201071602.ContentText: Watch what you say to her, she's not in the most stable mental state... I've taken care of her for a long time, but still haven't been able to get her back to her old self.

201071603.ContentText: Try talking with her, {NICKNAME}. And try to be as kind as possible... you don't want to scare her.

201331904.ContentText: Fools... You will know the taste of despair!

ContentText: She really caught up with us...
Even had time to set up an ambush...
I have one thing to say:
Sampo never lets friends who've helped him come to harm.
I say what I mean... and I mean what I say.
Alright princess. Let's dispense with the pleasantries!
You dare attack someone on our turf...?
Well? How about a few rounds with me?
Let me go — I gotta... I have to get to her!
Elio didn't put it in the script.
Cleaning up other people's mess isn't in my job description...
Long time no see, Astral Express crew.
I came at a good time. You're all here...
No need for the mysterious introduction...
Apologies for interrupting your little get-together.
But I'm sure once you've heard my request...
I'd like you to make a...
Well? Not what you were expecting?
With you two risking your lives for me...

280eea86bd6f362b.ContentText: Brrr. It really is one big snowball.
280eea86bd6f362b.Speaker: March 7th

2d24767894a01b58.ContentText: Well the Trailblaze Path grants us faint power. It allows us to better adapt to harsh environments.
2d24767894a01b58.Speaker: Dan Heng

d7e19695f6d57405.ContentText: *sigh* Snow as far as the eye can see. Which direction should we take?
d7e19695f6d57405.Speaker: March 7th

aee1d070514038d9.ContentText: Based on the coordinates, the target should be up ahead.
aee1d070514038d9.Speaker: Dan Heng

2b0508aea9162f96.ContentText: Then what are we waiting for? Let's go.
2b0508aea9162f96.Speaker: March 7th

91071246a3eeedc2.ContentText: ...Do you want to mention the time we smashed a hole through Taikiyan Stadium, or shall I?
91071246a3eeedc2.Speaker: Dan Heng

d8d46aa7a128077f.ContentText: *sigh* Please stop bringing that up. Let's just say that landings and crowds don't mix.
d8d46aa7a128077f.Speaker: March 7th

ea4f043d282f198b.ContentText: Unless you enjoy trailblazing through two weeks of community service.
ea4f043d282f198b.Speaker: Dan Heng

9b4936b7756275f9.ContentText: Me neither, if only we had a snowmobile... We never get to bring anything cool from the Express.
9b4936b7756275f9.Speaker: March 7th

3d737655da718814.ContentText: Do you remember what you did to our last snowmobile?
3d737655da718814.Speaker: Dan Heng

eb79304ed2b184e5.ContentText: Remember, we should stay vigilant. We know very little about this world.
eb79304ed2b184e5.Speaker: Dan Heng

9fd91ac922c78eb3.ContentText: Calm down. Between the three of us, nothing will stand in our way.
9fd91ac922c78eb3.Speaker: March 7th

d7455cc6fe5e0c85.ContentText: I mean c'mon, {NICKNAME}, you've got a Stellaron in your body, I have my special {RUBY_B#Mysterious Ice Crystal}Six-Phased Ice{RUBY_E#} powers, and Dan Heng... Uhh, he's got that mysterious past thing going for him...
d7455cc6fe5e0c85.Speaker: March 7th

0ce65b5289a96c07.ContentText: So, if people start creating trouble for us, they're gonna regret it!
0ce65b5289a96c07.Speaker: March 7th

1e28674179cdcbed.ContentText: Well, let's not get ahead of ourselves, hehe...
1e28674179cdcbed.Speaker: March 7th

b2aa4d4a5b14805c.ContentText: Let's go. Braving the unknown... that's the real spirit of trailblazing!
b2aa4d4a5b14805c.Speaker: March 7th

5c4d917b4fed58b0.ContentText: ...Hey, get outta there or you'll shiver to death.
5c4d917b4fed58b0.Speaker: March 7th

09d68073ba1cce5d.ContentText: If someone's got their head stuck in the sand, or the snow in this case...
09d68073ba1cce5d.Speaker: Dan Heng

0d0ca25459deb2b6.ContentText: My fine fellow, was that really necessary? Is crawling around in the snow a crime these days? I mean, c'mon, surely it doesn't warrant a spearing?
0d0ca25459deb2b6.Speaker: Sampo

b682303ba4b91b25.ContentText: ...But then again how can I blame you? I mean, I caught you off guard. It had to happen — you could even say I deserved it, huh? Besides, I've made a gallant group of new friends as a result, hehe...
b682303ba4b91b25.Speaker: Sampo

0be37642af5dfb54.ContentText: ...Is Captain Gepard around? H—He's an old buddy of mine...
0be37642af5dfb54.Speaker: Sampo

b5590429fa3863cb.ContentText: Wait, you're not Silvermane Guards? Well, why didn't you say so? Turns out we're on the same side after all!
b5590429fa3863cb.Speaker: Sampo

5c11123375f83702.ContentText: Pleasure to meet you, the name's Sampo Koski.
5c11123375f83702.Speaker: Sampo

c976809e506f5001.ContentText: Excellent, I'll remember the name. I never thought I'd run into friends from the same line of work out here in this frozen wasteland. *sigh* Business is bad these days, but fear not, Sampo Koski isn't interested in hoarding. There's more than enough treasure to go around, so let's get rich together! Hahaha.
c976809e506f5001.Speaker: Sampo

7064a6a7cc5cdc00.ContentText: Say, why don't we join forces? I have reliable intel the main strength of the Silvermane Guards is being deployed to the front line. This is a golden opportunity...
7064a6a7cc5cdc00.Speaker: Sampo

fe3ca2921b44c23a.ContentText: ...Come now, friends. I can understand the mistrust, but there's no need for the charade.
fe3ca2921b44c23a.Speaker: Sampo

5717d4889f288903.ContentText: Then again, I know the rules, vigilance is the name of the game in our profession. It's my fault for letting my enthusiasm and sincerity get the better of me...
5717d4889f288903.Speaker: Sampo

ecc3a6a32af13c6c.ContentText: Anyway, a meeting like this has to have been written in the stars. Ask me anything you like — I won't skimp on the details. Still, make it snappy, you're never more than ten feet from a Silvermane Guard...
ecc3a6a32af13c6c.Speaker: Sampo

5841c09a49aa873d.ContentText: Settlement? What a literary turn of phrase. Why, there's only one place in this world where the living still reside — our beloved Belobog! The further away you get, the dicier things become.
5841c09a49aa873d.Speaker: Sampo

992f12b26172310e.ContentText: The City of Preservation, the Towering Citadel, humanity's last bastion against the Eternal Freeze... It may sound a bit over the top, but those names are grounded in truth. The only place humans can eke out an existence is behind those impregnable walls.
992f12b26172310e.Speaker: Sampo

1aec74aa1e125c17.ContentText: Me? You guys scared me to death... There I was looking for relics to sell, when all of a sudden you came stomping over. I thought the Silvermane Guards were paying me a visit.
1aec74aa1e125c17.Speaker: Sampo

9a5906c40bf43cb0.ContentText: Seriously though, try treading a little lighter next time, hmm? If you run into the Guards, they won't hide in a snowdrift... and you'll be in a cell before you know it.
9a5906c40bf43cb0.Speaker: Sampo

1f7c60bbcb778331.ContentText: You...You really don't know? The Silvermane Guards are Belobog's soldiers, enforcers, and police. Let's just say they're not the most flexible of people... and they like paying visits to folks in our line of work.
1f7c60bbcb778331.Speaker: Sampo

896b724fb872c0b2.ContentText: Seems like you guys really are new to the business. *sigh* To be young and naive again... How about this. As a senior in the field, which I'm sure you don't mind me saying, I'll give you some free guidance.
896b724fb872c0b2.Speaker: Sampo

0b5ee447754096fb.ContentText: There are ways of doing things in this profession, and you better get familiar with them. Moving in the shadows, finding the goods, pricing your stock, hiding from the Guards... there's an art to all of it.
0b5ee447754096fb.Speaker: Sampo

dce0ff61620b7817.ContentText: No need, why don't you just take us to the city? We don't really know the way.
dce0ff61620b7817.Speaker: March 7th

86b543f2b0b349ab.ContentText: The city? Already? I haven't even started trading yet. Showing you the way is easy enough, missy, but it would cost—
86b543f2b0b349ab.Speaker: Sampo

dc15d1f9bb56f162.ContentText: ...B—But it would be my pleasure! "Kindness" is Sampo Koski's middle name. Follow me, friends, and keep quiet. We don't want to be spotted by the Guards.
dc15d1f9bb56f162.Speaker: Sampo

c1f3551de32fd825.ContentText: ...And the prime suspect? The one with the blue hair?
c1f3551de32fd825.Speaker: Gepard

100d4aae42e48a75.ContentText: Apologies, Captain! W—We lost him during the pursuit. We can't find his footprints...

187dc73698556fb6.ContentText: *sigh* No matter, we have his accomplices. He'll be close by, plotting his next move.
187dc73698556fb6.Speaker: Gepard

f041ab354e0bd64d.ContentText: Yeah, we'd never team up with someone like him!
f041ab354e0bd64d.Speaker: March 7th

db989f465b029b67.ContentText: I'm not trying to talk our way out of this, but... we're not friends with that scoundrel. Did you see how fast he ditched us?
db989f465b029b67.Speaker: March 7th

2dc8fd4d62f0575e.ContentText: We rescued him from the snow out of the kindness of our hearts. We had no idea he might be using us to get past you! Are you really dumb enough to fall for his...
2dc8fd4d62f0575e.Speaker: March 7th

718fa92d1c67f11f.ContentText: I'm a captain, not an adjudication panel. As a Belobog citizen, you have the right to defend yourself, but that can only take place under the scrutiny of the Architects, not now.
718fa92d1c67f11f.Speaker: Gepard

3a867cc5bc99bb86.ContentText: Silence! What kind of nonsense are you—

88c1f53f64a1b519.ContentText: As you were. We must not be tempted into careless judgment. Look at their attire. Indeed, it is not in the Belobog style.
88c1f53f64a1b519.Speaker: Gepard

3259315f1055f800.ContentText: Exactly! A—And we even have photos!
3259315f1055f800.Speaker: March 7th

b3a72756deb2064a.ContentText: As you were. We must not be tempted into careless judgment. Look at their relics. We've never excavated anything like them before, and I haven't seen anything similar in our museums.
b3a72756deb2064a.Speaker: Gepard

acfdee788d75f66a.ContentText: Ah! {NICKNAME}, you're a genius! Great idea!
acfdee788d75f66a.Speaker: March 7th

ec4b772f526c3c87.ContentText: You've probably never seen what your planet looks like, right? I took this one. Behold, Jarilo-VI...
ec4b772f526c3c87.Speaker: March 7th

51b890d804d320a8.ContentText: ...You mean to say that this... white ball... That's here? That's our home? How can that...

4db8abf32b572dc0.ContentText: It is said that a long time ago, {RUBY_B#Interstellar Travelers}strange visitors from beyond the sky{RUBY_E#} would visit us here... but that after the Eternal Freeze, the blizzards made passage impossible... and Belobog would cease to witness such arrivals.
4db8abf32b572dc0.Speaker: Gepard

fa5e19da78e6f927.ContentText: This decision is beyond us. If what they say is true, then only the supreme guardian may decide their fate.
fa5e19da78e6f927.Speaker: Gepard

4c8f77e180d6681e.ContentText: Our job is to present them before her. Nothing more.
4c8f77e180d6681e.Speaker: Gepard

0ba125c9690d0b0d.ContentText: Outsiders, follow me. Belobog lies beyond this blizzard.
0ba125c9690d0b0d.Speaker: Gepard

a0230bd24a53c07c.ContentText: Welcome to Belobog — the City of Preservation.
a0230bd24a53c07c.Speaker: Gepard

4e9a14a245003527.ContentText: This place still hasn't been corroded, yet Fragmentum monsters have already made it here.
4e9a14a245003527.Speaker: Dan Heng

be1e903290368e35.ContentText: I fear the Stellaron may be exerting a significant influence on this world.
be1e903290368e35.Speaker: Dan Heng

58daf052d63652a9.ContentText: These buildings have been buried in the snowfall.
58daf052d63652a9.Speaker: Dan Heng

1a364b518da3a33d.ContentText: Huh!? So these are rooftops? How long would snow have to fall to get this thick?
1a364b518da3a33d.Speaker: March 7th

bcf4a420e5b4901b.ContentText: This is Voidranger armor. It's ancient.
bcf4a420e5b4901b.Speaker: Dan Heng

aeb8315a6eea586c.ContentText: Voidranger? Was this planet invaded by the Antimatter Legion?
aeb8315a6eea586c.Speaker: March 7th

c0312d495f3dde3a.ContentText: *gasp* Did you see that? I think something's moving...
c0312d495f3dde3a.Speaker: March 7th

6dba2441c96d612f.ContentText: Mm... It's just an ordinary snowdrift. Are you sure you're not seeing things?
6dba2441c96d612f.Speaker: Dan Heng

190c5f3fe321a503.ContentText: Of course not, my eyesight's perfect! Come on, let's take a closer look.
190c5f3fe321a503.Speaker: March 7th

f7cca11632eee404.ContentText: So why were you hiding from the Silvermane Guards?
f7cca11632eee404.Speaker: March 7th

3687f001ea198785.ContentText: Uhh, I was just storing a few relics away from prying eyes, nothing serious. If it weren't for the uncompromising nature of our civil service, there'd be no need for secrecy.
3687f001ea198785.Speaker: Sampo

dd3fb60b65d8e134.ContentText: So whereabouts are you guys from, anyway? I don't mean to pry or anything, I just care about my friends! No pressure...
dd3fb60b65d8e134.Speaker: Sampo

377ac413946c1aff.ContentText: ...Rule number seven: Never leave a footprint. I have my own special technique called "invisible snow-walking." Helps me throw off pursuers in no...time...
377ac413946c1aff.Speaker: Sampo

89ab621a9c5a4316.ContentText: Uh, you remember the Silvermane Guards I mentioned? That's them...
89ab621a9c5a4316.Speaker: Sampo

f9ef902368a68979.ContentText: Help me, old friends! I don't wanna be caught!
f9ef902368a68979.Speaker: Sampo

0b7e5e9c9581165b.ContentText: It's the suspect and his accomplices! Arrest them!

7d25db0df29f8395.ContentText: Hey! Where do you think you're—
7d25db0df29f8395.Speaker: March 7th

c0ca290c38af20cb.ContentText: I, Gepard Landau, captain of the Silvermane Guards, order you to relinquish your futile resistance.
c0ca290c38af20cb.Speaker: Gepard

ebb1bf23a0a6af53.ContentText: Grr, that Sampo cheated us all. Wait till I get my hands on him...
ebb1bf23a0a6af53.Speaker: March 7th

6a2a8d2be434654a.ContentText: Ugh, so I'm a criminal, huh? Forget Sampo, wait until I get my hands on YOU!
6a2a8d2be434654a.Speaker: March 7th

20f458d16d850b95.ContentText: {NICKNAME}, March, this Gepard... he's no pushover.
20f458d16d850b95.Speaker: Dan Heng

cc452763e60f32f8.ContentText: ...Hey, it feels like it got a bit warmer!
cc452763e60f32f8.Speaker: March 7th

7431b89d9302bc44.ContentText: ...That's because you're in Belobog, the last bastion of humanity.
7431b89d9302bc44.Speaker: Gepard

c460148e599e3ef2.ContentText: Seven hundred years ago, {RUBY_B#Antimatter Legion}monsters{RUBY_E#} from beyond the sky set the world ablaze. The land was turned to scorched earth, with raging infernos and billowing towers of smoke stretching beyond the horizon.
c460148e599e3ef2.Speaker: Gepard

e59fd2b809d0ffc9.ContentText: In the midst of the conflict, the Eternal Freeze descended without warning. Suddenly, sweeping winds brought blizzards which buried the invading Legion. Belobog was all that remained.
e59fd2b809d0ffc9.Speaker: Gepard

37d038bf11bec908.ContentText: The steadfast Architects built this city. Under the protection of Qlipoth {RUBY_B#Aeon}the Preservation{RUBY_E#}, Belobog remains forever warm in the face of unrelenting cold.
37d038bf11bec908.Speaker: Gepard

e99913aba783debe.ContentText: (A marked change in tone. It sounds like he's quoting from a historical record.)
e99913aba783debe.Speaker: Dan Heng

8a9ae13a24224e85.ContentText: (Uh-huh, so why is he telling us all this?)
8a9ae13a24224e85.Speaker: March 7th

271d629821c1267f.ContentText: This is Qlipoth Fort, the heart of Belobog and headquarters of the Architects.
271d629821c1267f.Speaker: Gepard

67d4d4b0395b7778.ContentText: {RUBY_B#Aeon}Qlipoth{RUBY_E#} is the symbol of Preservation. Under Qlipoth's impulsion, the Architects constructed Belobog, thus protecting the spark of civilization from disaster and the Eternal Freeze.
67d4d4b0395b7778.Speaker: Gepard

e9922ea7f5fb94f9.ContentText: To show our reverence, we named this fortress after the Aeon themself. The Architects, under the protection of Qlipoth, have continued to lead this city forward, repelling all manner of disasters.
e9922ea7f5fb94f9.Speaker: Gepard

cbb8707e48abfce2.ContentText: The saviors of humanity. Long before the arrival of the Eternal Freeze, the Architects braved the doubts and derision of the people, never wavering from their construction of its defenses. History has proven that their decision was the correct one.
cbb8707e48abfce2.Speaker: Gepard

7657e2773e08552b.ContentText: The Architects named this fortress after Qlipoth, Aeon of Preservation. Under their direction, humanity has withstood external enemy attacks and held off the Eternal Freeze. Even today, we resist the Fragmentum's corrosion.
7657e2773e08552b.Speaker: Gepard

cce2548ff32decb4.ContentText: This fortress is also the residence of the supreme guardian.
cce2548ff32decb4.Speaker: Gepard

262a8e86776e9305.ContentText: The leader of Belobog, elected and appointed by the Architects. The supreme guardians have watched over this city for generations, sheltering the people from harm.
262a8e86776e9305.Speaker: Gepard

303a50e365ac08be.ContentText: The current guardian is Madam Cocolia Rand. Every major strategic decision is issued by her.
303a50e365ac08be.Speaker: Gepard

411657a648e13460.ContentText: Whoa... she sounds like a big deal.
411657a648e13460.Speaker: March 7th

85e572d9e6da1b47.ContentText: I will now bring you to see Madam Cocolia. Please have your words at the ready. Her time is precious, so she prefers concise communication.
85e572d9e6da1b47.Speaker: Gepard

ceee539097c9199a.ContentText: Uhh... We're gonna see her right now? Can I at least find a place to freshen up first?
ceee539097c9199a.Speaker: March 7th

a780d581e53883b3.ContentText: Let's not waste time. No one will notice.
a780d581e53883b3.Speaker: Dan Heng

2293a38a25e310aa.ContentText: You've got some snow in your hair, but no one will notice.
2293a38a25e310aa.Speaker: Dan Heng

29e19736db9bba67.ContentText: Rest easy, the Madam Guardian doesn't care about formalities. Not to mention, you've only just arrived, it would be unexpected if you were familiar with Belobog customs.
29e19736db9bba67.Speaker: Gepard

7c11f53de389765e.ContentText: I've dispatched a messenger to send word, Madam Cocolia will be aware of your arrival. Come with me.
7c11f53de389765e.Speaker: Gepard

799cee6907fc010a.ContentText: ...But that's a meaningless sacrifice, how can you—
799cee6907fc010a.Speaker: Bronya

5f6bcd0a69182da5.ContentText: Ahem... You may leave, Bronya. Visitors have arrived.

d9b4034615018b01.ContentText: Madam Guardian, I have brought three {RUBY_B#Interstellar Travelers}outsiders{RUBY_E#} to see you.
d9b4034615018b01.Speaker: Gepard

04faaf023a574982.ContentText: The messenger informed me. Well done, Gepard. You may leave.

5e42a0f8be97764b.ContentText: Welcome, visitors from beyond the Eternal Freeze. Or perhaps I should say: from beyond the sky... no?

a47d13342de9ed18.ContentText: I am Cocolia Rand, Belobog's supreme guardian. I would be grateful if you could tell me why you have come.

263a6d2bea8a0a99.ContentText: Do you wish me to doubt it? Or perhaps you're not confident in that identity yourself? Haha... No, I do not doubt it. I can see that you are not from this world.

b5f63f231e3dc536.ContentText: The Architects remember the history well, else we should forget it. I know that in the distant past, before the Eternal Freeze descended or the Legion invaded, this world was once prosperous beyond measure...

0f082119a250469f.ContentText: An Aeon connected our planet to other worlds, and we discovered the endless possibilities of the boundless universe. We also came to know of Qlipoth, the Amber Lord. Under their attentive gaze, we built the city walls.

6852a355acd5583c.ContentText: ...So, do not be surprised. For seven hundred years, the Architects have received no further communication from the stars... but I knew of your existence. Tell me why you have come.

7c8705898fac36e3.ContentText: ...Do you think anyone's gonna know what you're talking about?
7c8705898fac36e3.Speaker: March 7th

53ed41911bbb2c2d.ContentText: We came here for something known as a Stellaron.
53ed41911bbb2c2d.Speaker: Dan Heng

e5092799fa1eb79c.ContentText: Objects that fell from the blue on separate worlds. Their appearance spelled disaster. Many of the planets we've visited have suffered their effects.
e5092799fa1eb79c.Speaker: Dan Heng

e07c25606398fc7f.ContentText: You mentioned invasion by the Antimatter Legion. Soon after their arrival, this planet suffered the Eternal Freeze. At the same time, the phenomenon known as Fragmentum space corrosion began to occur. Correct?
e07c25606398fc7f.Speaker: Dan Heng

bd7557a1a77593cc.ContentText: Which is why the Antimatter Legion and Stellarons often show up together! Worlds seeded with Stellarons give birth to Fragmentums. As for the Eternal Freeze... it must have been a product of the Stellaron — unique to the environment of your world.
bd7557a1a77593cc.Speaker: March 7th

2c597198c912079d.ContentText: Stellarons bring about different disasters on different worlds. But every world seeded with a Stellaron will give birth to Fragmentums.
2c597198c912079d.Speaker: March 7th

43c2a5ab117ae5f7.ContentText: You can see us as... kindhearted interstellar public servants, lending a helping hand to any world affected by a Stellaron!
43c2a5ab117ae5f7.Speaker: March 7th

35772cee298060f5.ContentText: Your analysis of our current circumstances is clear. We have indeed suffered the disasters you speak of, some of which prove vexatious to us even today... but why should you care?

b383f2f66cb2ea64.ContentText: Even if this Stellaron you speak of did bring about disaster, I fail to see its connection to you. I don't believe that anyone would go to such lengths to help a world unrelated to them... unless they had something to gain.

32acc3676b872496.ContentText: You're right. Our reason for coming here is not purely selfless. If we don't seal the Stellaron, we cannot leave this planet.
32acc3676b872496.Speaker: Dan Heng

f02e11ba47fbda91.ContentText: If we can get rid of it, your world will be safer too!
f02e11ba47fbda91.Speaker: March 7th

e1adc0fd5fd5bdef.ContentText: You... know how to seal the "Stellaron"?

d0348d0e6f81d869.ContentText: Very well, I believe you. If our present situation is truly the result of this so-called Stellaron, then your arrival is the hope that Belobog has waited seven hundred years for. I am willing to assist you in any way possible to help you locate the Stellaron.

77227317eb6ef728.ContentText: It's getting late, and you must be tired. I will arrange for you to stay in our most comfortable hotel. Rest there, and get a good night's sleep. Tomorrow, at noon, I will dispatch someone to escort you here, and we can discuss this urgent matter in greater detail.

d15db1201a028263.ContentText: It should be me thanking you, visitors from beyond the sky.

23c4ff27221f651a.ContentText: But of course. You are Belobog's honored guests, and have the highest privileges afforded to you.

d72adb52074082ea.ContentText: I too need some time. I will go over our records for anything that may be connected to Stellarons... Please excuse me for not escorting you further.

999f5f61db7a76dc.ContentText: Do not worry, I have a way.

80a2294f90ef1700.ContentText: It seems that the supreme guardian holds you in high regard. I have received orders that your movements are no longer to be restricted.
80a2294f90ef1700.Speaker: Gepard

5a1d234e34f71812.ContentText: She's the big shot! Definitely got that "queen of the castle" vibe going on. Aww, so cool.
5a1d234e34f71812.Speaker: March 7th

dc119545f1c6a15b.ContentText: Y'know, I didn't think things were gonna go that smoothly.
dc119545f1c6a15b.Speaker: March 7th

39fab714213fce53.ContentText: Haha. I'm afraid I still have duties to attend to. I must return to my post. I hope you enjoy your stay in Belobog.
39fab714213fce53.Speaker: Gepard

5822f91c4af9128b.ContentText: Wait! Can you recommend some sights? It's not that late, we wanna take a look around.
5822f91c4af9128b.Speaker: March 7th

b873851c64cd844a.ContentText: Well, I'd say that Golden Theater and the History Museum are both worth a look. However, you'd need a pass to get into the museum.
b873851c64cd844a.Speaker: Gepard

3e8aa325cea4f54d.ContentText: I recommend you visit Everwinter Monument first — it's Belobog's most symbolic landmark.
3e8aa325cea4f54d.Speaker: Gepard

cfa6892ead0880bc.ContentText: And if you enjoy music, you could head to Neverwinter Workshop. You can sometimes catch an outdoor performance there. The artist is... *sigh* You'll see.
cfa6892ead0880bc.Speaker: Gepard

765c06f2a2836f1f.ContentText: Oh, and if you're staying at Goethe Hotel, please avoid the alley that runs next to it — the one with Silvermane Guards stationed there. It started to be affected by corrosion recently, so it's been sealed off.
765c06f2a2836f1f.Speaker: Gepard

451c81cedd1ff511.ContentText: So the corrosion is inside the city... that's a grave situation.
451c81cedd1ff511.Speaker: Dan Heng

1d4a24fc1e70edb6.ContentText: Yes, we're mounting a resistance as we speak. I must leave now, I hope all goes well for you.
1d4a24fc1e70edb6.Speaker: Gepard

ab476b34fd3b8114.ContentText: Neverwinter Workshop... Hey! Didn't Gepard say there'd be a show here?
ab476b34fd3b8114.Speaker: March 7th

98b115bfa69f0077.ContentText: He said "you can sometimes catch an outdoor performance..." "Sometimes" being the operative word.
98b115bfa69f0077.Speaker: Dan Heng

0582793d2bcebadf.ContentText: Darn, I wanted to see one...
0582793d2bcebadf.Speaker: March 7th

afd79746aaa11576.ContentText: Oh — I've been wondering — you see that heater over there? Why do they keep it outdoors? This city is so weird...
afd79746aaa11576.Speaker: March 7th

1cb5c54f740a31d9.ContentText: Normally you'd want a heater INSIDE a building, right?
1cb5c54f740a31d9.Speaker: March 7th

9af86b57b76a1458.ContentText: ...If so, I'm not sure "mighty" is the right word for these Architects.
9af86b57b76a1458.Speaker: March 7th

cc87295ead6e4213.ContentText: Maybe, but the ones outside just seem like a waste of energy.
cc87295ead6e4213.Speaker: March 7th

479af766ee1a820a.ContentText: *gasp* Maybe this is how the Architects repel the Eternal Freeze!
479af766ee1a820a.Speaker: March 7th

1263c7b63c99ae4c.ContentText: Tiny heaters are no use against a Stellaron disaster.
1263c7b63c99ae4c.Speaker: Dan Heng

f33bd2bc144f98ac.ContentText: Hah, you guys sure have a lot to say about that broken heater.
f33bd2bc144f98ac.Speaker: Serval

5d9000a18886e643.ContentText: Hi there. The name's Serval, I'm the owner of this workshop.
5d9000a18886e643.Speaker: Serval

081aceab0786487a.ContentText: Yep, touch it and find out — ice cold. I was just about to fix it up.
081aceab0786487a.Speaker: Serval

25f58cd4b4d79371.ContentText: I forgot to introduce myself. The name's Serval, I'm the owner of this workshop.
25f58cd4b4d79371.Speaker: Serval

a43832dcf83775f0.ContentText: If you got any broken equipment lying around you can always come find me, though I can't guarantee I'll be interested in fixing it.
a43832dcf83775f0.Speaker: Serval

5a964548fc85a155.ContentText: Oh, we're okay, I was just curious about the heater...
5a964548fc85a155.Speaker: March 7th

24cba0c30a559557.ContentText: Curious? About the heater? It's just a standard Geomarrow radiator — you can find them anywhere in the Administrative District.
24cba0c30a559557.Speaker: Serval

c1aa7c6f980677d5.ContentText: Huh? What's wrong with that? Everyone around here knows the way I work...
c1aa7c6f980677d5.Speaker: Serval

3fb64277db374e44.ContentText: Ah! I've figured it out! I heard a loudmouthed guard say that a group of outsiders had met with Cocolia... You must be them?
3fb64277db374e44.Speaker: Serval

fbbedabdade09abe.ContentText: What an honor! Where are my manners — we can talk about heaters all day if you like. Let's have a chat~
fbbedabdade09abe.Speaker: Serval

8c279b9578cec22c.ContentText: Wow, what a beautiful lobby! It's gonna be soft mattresses and cushiony pillows tonight!
8c279b9578cec22c.Speaker: March 7th

fb0bb58c9a6b36fd.ContentText: Wanna have a pillow fight later? Huh? Huh? I bet they're stuffed with goose feathers, haha!
fb0bb58c9a6b36fd.Speaker: March 7th

39fb6125c54871d5.ContentText: Stop! I know what you're gonna say: "March, you said too much back there — March, you shouldn't reveal our goal to people we don't trust..." Meanwhile you guys were beating around the bush and speaking in riddles.
39fb6125c54871d5.Speaker: March 7th

b807272e08794844.ContentText: But check it out — seems like we landed with a pretty sweet deal, right? We get the royal treatment, rooms in a beauuuutiful hotel, and the full support of the locals! As far as trailblazing goes, this is smooth as heck!
b807272e08794844.Speaker: March 7th

d04c518c7a4fa769.ContentText: ...That's... not what I was going to say.
d04c518c7a4fa769.Speaker: Dan Heng

6046110310e77235.ContentText: Earlier in Qlipoth Fort... were you paying attention to the {RUBY_B#Cocolia}Supreme Guardian{RUBY_E#}?
6046110310e77235.Speaker: Dan Heng

0835831ecf14caf2.ContentText: Uhh, yeah, of course — this isn't my first expedition y'know. My powers of perception are sharper than the sharpest blade~
0835831ecf14caf2.Speaker: March 7th

297541487f478bc9.ContentText: Nope, she seemed normal to me. She was kinda harsh at first, but she turned out to be a nice, reasonable lady.
297541487f478bc9.Speaker: March 7th

7ba5a74f87355508.ContentText: Something up with her? She seemed normal to me. She was kinda harsh at first, but she turned out to be a nice, reasonable lady.
7ba5a74f87355508.Speaker: March 7th

3aee75376f9b714f.ContentText: Nope, she seemed normal to me too. She was kinda harsh at first, but she turned out to be a nice, reasonable lady.
3aee75376f9b714f.Speaker: March 7th

b931133fb2fb4666.ContentText: Although... it felt like she was looking through me. As in, I know she was speaking to us, but it seemed like her gaze was fixed on something far away...
b931133fb2fb4666.Speaker: March 7th

de51d70b541848a4.ContentText: Hmm, I had a similar feeling. Almost as if we weren't the only people in the room.
de51d70b541848a4.Speaker: Dan Heng

da70d169632e077d.ContentText: *gasp* Do you have to put it like that? That's scary...
da70d169632e077d.Speaker: March 7th

6b8cb772419192ac.ContentText: Well, there's no way he'd get past Dan Heng's sharp eyes.
6b8cb772419192ac.Speaker: March 7th

bd236f2f9f25da96.ContentText: Hmm, maybe. She's an important person after all — maybe there were armed bodyguards lying in ambush.
bd236f2f9f25da96.Speaker: March 7th

5f1c24f16665741b.ContentText: Perhaps I'm too sensitive... She did promise to help us. I just hope she keeps her word...
5f1c24f16665741b.Speaker: Dan Heng

dd28b2f9a9979ed2.ContentText: Let's get some rest, we need to save our energy for the discussions tomorrow.
dd28b2f9a9979ed2.Speaker: Dan Heng

fc48f3acda44104a.ContentText: Huh? It's you... you were there at the Fort...
fc48f3acda44104a.Speaker: March 7th

ee70008381abad27.ContentText: I am Bronya Rand, acting commander of the Silvermane Guards. In the name of the {RUBY_B#Qlipoth}Amber Lord{RUBY_E#} in the highest, and under order of Supreme Guardian Cocolia Rand, I hereby arrest the suspected infiltrators under the charge of plotting to incite rebellion.
ee70008381abad27.Speaker: Bronya

40a15e8a899b1c1e.ContentText: As agent of the supreme guardian, I herewith temporarily strip you of your freedom of action and speech. When you are tried by the adjudication panel, you will be given the opportunity to defend yourselves against the accusations.
40a15e8a899b1c1e.Speaker: Bronya

9adc6c92b82e55c1.ContentText: Resistance will prove futile. You must come with me.
9adc6c92b82e55c1.Speaker: Bronya

137bf7bf227f0cbc.ContentText: Looks like we've been downgraded to accomplices... again. Seems like it's every third planet this happens.
137bf7bf227f0cbc.Speaker: March 7th

e42b233808880076.ContentText: That's because you always act without thinking — you never have a plan.
e42b233808880076.Speaker: Dan Heng

ba31758317f9fb1f.ContentText: Hey, I'm improving! I'm coming up with a plan right now... aaaand... got one!
ba31758317f9fb1f.Speaker: March 7th

39d6052e89b5a5df.ContentText: The one that's been sealed off... Hmm, it's possible.
39d6052e89b5a5df.Speaker: Dan Heng

55d100dfc5cb7234.ContentText: {NICKNAME}, March, be ready to make an escape.
55d100dfc5cb7234.Speaker: Dan Heng

738f51f405804a31.ContentText: Huh? Really? I just wanted to say something...
738f51f405804a31.Speaker: March 7th

ed4203ea9b7af80e.ContentText: Shh! It's an old Astral Express escape signal. Do you play cards?
ed4203ea9b7af80e.Speaker: March 7th

71f88ee4cd41d319.ContentText: Hey, what are you whispering? Let's get going!

826011b6441b814d.ContentText: W—Wait a minute! This isn't what we agreed! She said we were gonna be escorted to discuss an urgent matter!
826011b6441b814d.Speaker: March 7th

41ca929c341be1c0.ContentText: ...Escaping into a Fragmentum. I don't know if they're overconfident or just eager for death. It would seem that mother's judgment was correct...
41ca929c341be1c0.Speaker: Bronya

b1e3c7ae20648b14.ContentText: Should we report them as missing or deceased?
b1e3c7ae20648b14.Speaker: Pela

30dcfe27e09a65c2.ContentText: The supreme guardian's order was to arrest them. We cannot abandon our pursuit just because they fled into a sealed off area. I must ascertain their fate with my own eyes.
30dcfe27e09a65c2.Speaker: Bronya

be29929792b0412c.ContentText: Eradicate all threats to Belobog's security... that is what I must do.
be29929792b0412c.Speaker: Bronya

abaa4340aed20378.ContentText: *yawn* ...So tired. I just wanna put my head on a pillow and drift off...
abaa4340aed20378.Speaker: March 7th

2d679d386b7220f9.ContentText: Seems like the first day of our trailblazing expeditions is always pretty eventful, huh Dan Heng.
2d679d386b7220f9.Speaker: March 7th

fb02712356e736a9.ContentText: Heh, that's because you've got too much energy.
fb02712356e736a9.Speaker: Dan Heng

a557572cd5b93268.ContentText: Is there anything left to do? We're meeting the guardian tomorrow. There won't be any time for sightseeing.
a557572cd5b93268.Speaker: Dan Heng

0f8ddf0ebe2288e2.ContentText: It was a long day today. All I need is a hot shower and a good night's sleep.
0f8ddf0ebe2288e2.Speaker: March 7th

10b7c32068a478b4.ContentText: Well don't talk about it then!
10b7c32068a478b4.Speaker: March 7th

0fe1a5124a1e452f.ContentText: Let's get to bed early and save our energy. I sense the next few days could be tiring.
0fe1a5124a1e452f.Speaker: Dan Heng

740fbf73db2294be.ContentText: Well, I'm off to my room then. Express lights off!
740fbf73db2294be.Speaker: March 7th

8abe431a8a9af146.ContentText: There's a group of Silvermane Guards at the entrance... and I don't think they're here to say hi.
8abe431a8a9af146.Speaker: Dan Heng

bfe763ce5900025e.ContentText: If this is our escort, it's less friendly than I was expecting.
bfe763ce5900025e.Speaker: March 7th

c47797e00665a300.ContentText: Huh, you must've had some miserable jobs.
c47797e00665a300.Speaker: March 7th

7dd025a496b65a53.ContentText: I guess we'll have to find out...
7dd025a496b65a53.Speaker: March 7th

abfe01443acdb25d.ContentText: Let's go and meet them. We won't know until we're down there.
abfe01443acdb25d.Speaker: Dan Heng

43d421b3d6171861.ContentText: We saw strange creatures outside the city... They must have come from a tear in corroded space. A Fragmentum, correct?
43d421b3d6171861.Speaker: Dan Heng

755ba4af3d84ba66.ContentText: How do you... That's right. Out there in the blizzard, there are still many threats... including the monsters you saw.
755ba4af3d84ba66.Speaker: Gepard

9604c7bade054ee0.ContentText: Monsters of that type rarely venture outside the Fragmentum... meaning the corrosion affecting your planet is already very serious.
9604c7bade054ee0.Speaker: Dan Heng

969b62d8edb77b7d.ContentText: The Silvermane Guards are continuously engaged with the enemy, but I'm afraid the situation is bleak... After your meeting with the supreme guardian, I would like to consult you on this matter. *sigh* We're lacking in intel.
969b62d8edb77b7d.Speaker: Gepard

dac8352aeabc10ab.ContentText: If you know about corrosion and the Fragmentum, then you must have heard of Stellarons, right?
dac8352aeabc10ab.Speaker: March 7th

27b748e1cc1b06ac.ContentText: No. Does that have to do with the monsters? Perhaps the Madam Guardian will be familiar.
27b748e1cc1b06ac.Speaker: Gepard

400bf63cc719167a.ContentText: This queue isn't moving, how long are we gonna be here...

0d1dccb34f6d3e61.ContentText: Say, the officer that you were speaking to... was that Gepard Landau?

b2e2beab20da04be.ContentText: Argh, I knew it was him — I wasn't brave enough to go over. I should've tried to stop him.

088de0a1a2081747.ContentText: Captain Gepard is wise and decisive, and of noble birth... I'm sure he'd help me.

ae52d2997374dd9c.ContentText: What do I make of him? Why, he's a captain of the Silvermane Guards — not to mention of noble birth! I mean, he's a Landau!

1d36ec909511522d.ContentText: If I could just find a way to tell him about my situation, I'm sure he'd help me.

ebdd4e899f3936aa.ContentText: *sigh* I'm getting ahead of myself, I already missed my chance... back to the queue I guess.

d58d96fda56e2c90.ContentText: Hey, you got a problem? If you wanna petition then start queuing. Don't even think about pushing in.

da5d51cba0079d9f.ContentText: What am I gonna do? Only the Madam Guardian can help me...

ebfa8e5ab3b35d86.ContentText: We are allies... allies of the guardians through generations.

3f8e224b7d30b5e4.ContentText: To help you... achieve your wish.

5169fcb42f0ead47.ContentText: The heater you saw is just a standard Geomarrow radiator. They may not look like much, but they're a real lifeline to the people.
5169fcb42f0ead47.Speaker: Serval

a82a8ecce4620ae0.ContentText: The blizzards here are brutal. If we didn't have a reliable way of keeping warm, Belobog would long since have become a dead city — both above and below the surface.
a82a8ecce4620ae0.Speaker: Serval

55f9e8c5dc73d461.ContentText: It's an ore — a special energy resource. Whether it's keeping the city warm or keeping our counters ticking, everything runs on Geomarrow.
55f9e8c5dc73d461.Speaker: Serval

34b96a9c2c3fccaa.ContentText: Geomarrow grows beneath the surface of the planet, and specialist Underworld mining teams are there to extract it. Transport lines shuttle it up to the surface. In the Overworld, we use the same lines to ship surface goods and aid down to the Underworld.
34b96a9c2c3fccaa.Speaker: Serval

b9a69c93eb953fb3.ContentText: You didn't know? Belobog is structured like two big connected discs. The Overworld is responsible for administration and trade, while the Underworld is responsible for energy supply and resource extraction.
b9a69c93eb953fb3.Speaker: Serval

f72eeeac007b739c.ContentText: However, due to an order that was given many years ago, nobody has moved between the Overworld and the Underworld in a long time.
f72eeeac007b739c.Speaker: Serval

661308a32217e82d.ContentText: ...Ah! I shouldn't be talking about this. Pretend I never said anything.
661308a32217e82d.Speaker: Serval

44d28a7971e3e096.ContentText: Isn't it just like cooking food over an open flame? If the house is a pot, then the heater is the stove it rests on.
44d28a7971e3e096.Speaker: Serval

28d067420651fa72.ContentText: When she puts it like that, it actually starts to make sense...
28d067420651fa72.Speaker: March 7th

f2a1ec7269f5b87f.ContentText: No sweat. This is your first time in Belobog — I just want you to feel some of the warmth the city has to offer.
f2a1ec7269f5b87f.Speaker: Serval

42a2504787b830af.ContentText: Hey, seeing as there's nothing on your plate just now, wanna help me fix up this machine? Just a bit of manual labor — you might find it interesting.
42a2504787b830af.Speaker: Serval

bd7eee4fc834dcc6.ContentText: Great! Then let me give you a demonstration first.
bd7eee4fc834dcc6.Speaker: Serval

2dc31c5894812229.ContentText: Nice! You guys are pretty handy — you picked that up in no time. Wanna be my assistants? Average pay, but I'm a good boss.
2dc31c5894812229.Speaker: Serval

ae29d939c602f8bb.ContentText: Hah — do you just say yes to everything?
ae29d939c602f8bb.Speaker: March 7th

d818026213531de8.ContentText: Hahaha, I was only kidding — just a joke.
d818026213531de8.Speaker: Serval

91dcd026a3ff5f9b.ContentText: Well, I'd better carry on here, why not have a better look around? My workshop will always be open to you... and your wallets, of course.
91dcd026a3ff5f9b.Speaker: Serval

d1f2665912338657.ContentText: Move back! This is your final warning!

6654d41e45942246.ContentText: But... B—But my proof of property is inside. I don't have any—

515ef873001566f0.ContentText: The Fragmentum has already corroded this block! You can make a property retrieval request to the Architects, but only Silvermane Guards are permitted to enter here!

9c408b72be728488.ContentText: I can't believe Fragmentum corrosion has spread into the city... No wonder there are so many soldiers stationed there.
9c408b72be728488.Speaker: March 7th

4a10256bb684bb49.ContentText: It sure is... but at least we're here. Once we seal the Stellaron, they can get back to the good life.
4a10256bb684bb49.Speaker: March 7th

8147e1ad5e36221d.ContentText: No. As long as the Stellaron is active, the corrosion will continue to spread.
8147e1ad5e36221d.Speaker: Dan Heng

23dcc3a52ced341a.ContentText: The soldiers can only periodically clear the Fragmentum of monsters. But the monsters will continue to emerge and multiply.
23dcc3a52ced341a.Speaker: Dan Heng

2fd0598209cf1ede.ContentText: Please try to understand, sir. Backwater Pass has become very dangerous. We're just here for your safety.

d699022711e067a9.ContentText: If I can't get my proof of property, it doesn't matter how safe I am! Out of my way — let me pass...

d9cbf762ea3875e6.ContentText: Ah, that's the alley that Gepard mentioned — the one contaminated by the Fragmentum, right?
d9cbf762ea3875e6.Speaker: March 7th

5b89595aa6d8a0cf.ContentText: I can't believe how close it is to the city center...
5b89595aa6d8a0cf.Speaker: March 7th

d175759e24d05163.ContentText: If they hadn't identified it, I bet all the shops and hotels in the vicinity would have had to close down by now.
d175759e24d05163.Speaker: Dan Heng

b54194410f64397a.ContentText: Stand back! This area is off limits — only Silvermane Guards are permitted to enter here!

34608d93b734bf80.ContentText: We're optimistic — this area has only recently been corroded, so monsters are few and far between. Please, have faith in the Guards.

0ab6c6379064d743.ContentText: If it weren't for most of our forces being deployed to the front line, situations like this wouldn't amount to anything! We can't even go on the offensive.

edb91b58478576d3.ContentText: It used to be a transport hub... but it's been closed down.

6c31e9608b132cca.ContentText: Well, this is our duty as Silvermane Guards. We are responsible for the safety of the citizenry.

0f46b2493dc9fe7d.ContentText: Duty is duty — we trust in the higher-ups! But I worry about our compatriots below ground. They must be—

f2490769f4ea9dcd.ContentText: That's enough, the guardian has strictly forbidden discussion of Underworld affairs...

ee06f41f8d973d66.ContentText: Right! I'm such a hothead. I'll zip it!

8364ed72d34e293c.ContentText: Please keep a safe distance, this is a live situation. Plus, we need to look busy.

80ede83090b26368.ContentText: Let me pass! I'm not afraid to die! I've lost everything... everything...

fedb0725c6b8e6c2.ContentText: Wow, look at the carved ice! It feels perfect for this city, somehow.
fedb0725c6b8e6c2.Speaker: March 7th

138db3c7e71bac6e.ContentText: Whatever it's made of, it can't be ice.
138db3c7e71bac6e.Speaker: Dan Heng

594d252df57b7de5.ContentText: I guess you're right, it's actually pretty warm in the city... Hey, what's with all the children over there? Should we go and take a look?
594d252df57b7de5.Speaker: March 7th

c453c61591fdc8d7.ContentText: Alright children, no running around, okay? Let's gather over here...
c453c61591fdc8d7.Speaker: Pela

43c0582f7fdfa970.ContentText: So, let me introduce myself. I'm the Intelligence Officer for the Silvermane Guards, and a temporary guide for the "A Journey Through Belobog's History" program. My name is Pelageya Sergeyevna.
43c0582f7fdfa970.Speaker: Pela

c57db2273c7fc6f1.ContentText: But you can call me Pela.
c57db2273c7fc6f1.Speaker: Pela

a7a2f3fd8f2e7bfa.ContentText: ...And perhaps the grownups among us could refrain from acting like children?
a7a2f3fd8f2e7bfa.Speaker: Pela

fd1825f4102f19c3.ContentText: ...And perhaps the grownups among us could remain silent? This is a children's program...
fd1825f4102f19c3.Speaker: Pela

92c3f80e9bf7cc2c.ContentText: Okay guys, take a look over here: This is Everwinter Monument. It was erected to commemorate the mighty Architects.
92c3f80e9bf7cc2c.Speaker: Pela

01a81205bd9440fd.ContentText: The Architects are followers of the Aeon Qlipoth. It was they that foresaw crisis, built up our walls, and established Belobog — preserving the spark of human civilization. Even today, they are still tending to the city.
01a81205bd9440fd.Speaker: Pela

e06853dc0d617fe6.ContentText: Everwinter Monument is made up of two parts: a gear that symbolizes knowledge and industrial strength, and huge ice crystals that symbolize the Eternal Freeze. These two symbols are bound together — the gear restricting the ice. It represents the unyielding spirit of the Architects in the face of nature's barbarity.
e06853dc0d617fe6.Speaker: Pela

68cf57f25c5fff7c.ContentText: The monument is made up of two parts: a gear that symbolizes knowledge and industrial strength, and huge ice crystals that symbolize the Eternal Freeze. These two symbols are bound together — the gear restricting the ice. It represents the unyielding spirit of the Architects in the face of nature's barbarity.
68cf57f25c5fff7c.Speaker: Pela

d32385d7d0974c13.ContentText: You mean, what are they made of? It's Geomarrow that's undergone a change in color. The color of Geomarrow is related to the environmental temperature during its refinement.
d32385d7d0974c13.Speaker: Pela

4e3753e011438c0a.ContentText: The Architects are followers of the Aeon Qlipoth. It was they that foresaw the crisis, built up our walls, and established Belobog — preserving the spark of human civilization.
4e3753e011438c0a.Speaker: Pela

6f76d209c175e0c1.ContentText: Or to put it another way, the Architects are Belobog's founders and saviors. Even today, they are still tending to the city.
6f76d209c175e0c1.Speaker: Pela

1664f8133d636cc0.ContentText: That's a question for the Scientific Research Division, though they may not be able to give you a definitive answer.
1664f8133d636cc0.Speaker: Pela

c30a65fa8af33827.ContentText: The Eternal Freeze is no ordinary natural disaster — meteorological records from hundreds of years ago cannot explain the cause. To put it simply, it's a problem that has plagued Belobog scientists for centuries.
c30a65fa8af33827.Speaker: Pela

153bc40192e2a71e.ContentText: And what about you guys? Take your time, we're not in a rush.
153bc40192e2a71e.Speaker: Pela

40d697db64fa036c.ContentText: Hah! See, they weren't brave enough to follow us! Freedom!
40d697db64fa036c.Speaker: March 7th

ac54b1d283b34e3d.ContentText: Serves them right! Better luck next time, slowpokes!
ac54b1d283b34e3d.Speaker: March 7th

524f93ca554d893a.ContentText: Oh please, it's the result that counts~ Gotta take risks sometimes if you wanna succeed~
524f93ca554d893a.Speaker: March 7th

ab2ac5c0d9315003.ContentText: Hehe, it was a team effort~
ab2ac5c0d9315003.Speaker: March 7th

50ef87b8aa9dc5c8.ContentText: Well, you can get good at getting lucky~
50ef87b8aa9dc5c8.Speaker: March 7th

8da0b11f536268e5.ContentText: We caught them by surprise, nothing more. They'll be in pursuit soon enough.
8da0b11f536268e5.Speaker: Dan Heng

42f2f379cda0881e.ContentText: Let's follow the path. We need to guarantee our own safety before making any further plans.
42f2f379cda0881e.Speaker: Dan Heng

cdd113d90ebfd430.ContentText: Wait! There are Silvermane Guards here. Careful not to alert them!
cdd113d90ebfd430.Speaker: March 7th

7e6ea8f99699c6eb.ContentText: They must have entered from another direction to cut us off.
7e6ea8f99699c6eb.Speaker: Dan Heng

d06937009e5a44a2.ContentText: We should avoid an open conflict. Let's find another path.
d06937009e5a44a2.Speaker: Dan Heng

4e6481bf20ddf397.ContentText: Doesn't seem like there's any way to open this gate... Ooh, check this mechanism out. Look familiar?
4e6481bf20ddf397.Speaker: March 7th

2ada5508cd1b28c5.ContentText: Yes, we saw one in Serval's workshop.
2ada5508cd1b28c5.Speaker: Dan Heng

d1921b1248da8274.ContentText: We need to solve it before we run out of time. The Guards are right on our heels.
d1921b1248da8274.Speaker: Dan Heng

cca71fc7643dc88e.ContentText: We did it! It's open! Quick, let's go, I think I heard footsteps!
cca71fc7643dc88e.Speaker: March 7th

8bb9cdaf4c761ebd.ContentText: I don't see a switch for the gate.
8bb9cdaf4c761ebd.Speaker: March 7th

2f34291a7a52973f.ContentText: There's a monster in the area. We'll need to deal with it first.
2f34291a7a52973f.Speaker: Dan Heng

2d0dac8eb44cb5fd.ContentText: Even though it has suffered Fragmentum corrosion, this is still part of Belobog. It was our home. The Guards know this place like the back of their hand.
2d0dac8eb44cb5fd.Speaker: Bronya

d3088e8685e6f0fa.ContentText: Enough cat and mouse — drop your weapons and come with me.
d3088e8685e6f0fa.Speaker: Bronya

8a8fe19da1f42083.ContentText: Ugh, you're such a nuisance! Just what crime are we supposed to have committed again? It better be worth you following us all the way out here!
8a8fe19da1f42083.Speaker: March 7th

287dc07d06e78ec3.ContentText: My orders are to arrest you. It is for the adjudication panel to present you with the nature and penalty of your alleged crimes.
287dc07d06e78ec3.Speaker: Bronya

8164c7218240c056.ContentText: You saw us yesterday, do you remember? Madam Cocolia received us as honored guests.
8164c7218240c056.Speaker: Dan Heng

f1a8f52a4e8d05b9.ContentText: How can such a drastic change have occurred in the course of one night?
f1a8f52a4e8d05b9.Speaker: Dan Heng

f0e34cb033383bf1.ContentText: She summoned me last night to tell me that you had deceived her. Your identities and purpose here are counterfeit. You seek to overthrow the rule of the Architects.
f0e34cb033383bf1.Speaker: Bronya

6dfbfea6cc1612ce.ContentText: Publicly insulting the supreme guardian only elevates the seriousness of your crimes. Throw down your arms and surrender!
6dfbfea6cc1612ce.Speaker: Bronya

6c859b328f09bf38.ContentText: We're wasting our words, March. At least one thing is clear: We mustn't be caught.
6c859b328f09bf38.Speaker: Dan Heng

de233d8e6b711909.ContentText: Well, if there's no escape, then maybe it's time we gave them a taste of Astral Express medicine!
de233d8e6b711909.Speaker: March 7th

e79a9efb97d79b72.ContentText: This girl's pretty strong... Hey Dan Heng, maybe now's a good time to show off your secret strength!?
e79a9efb97d79b72.Speaker: March 7th

20e7a8a15ad47ce1.ContentText: Intruders, give it up! You will be guaranteed a fair trial.
20e7a8a15ad47ce1.Speaker: Bronya

7e28a9e207abcf85.ContentText: Ooh! Sorry, I didn't mean to ruin the intensity of the moment~
7e28a9e207abcf85.Speaker: Sampo

febe21b1a2ae4889.ContentText: So what happened back there? Why did the supreme guardian send people to arrest us?
febe21b1a2ae4889.Speaker: March 7th

52f46dd0ce431ab1.ContentText: Imagine launching a surprise attack when your enemy is fast asleep. The cheek!
52f46dd0ce431ab1.Speaker: March 7th

f0c19572c5b11927.ContentText: That woman had a troubling aura... our instincts were correct.
f0c19572c5b11927.Speaker: Dan Heng

b499ce0693fb8e55.ContentText: Ahhhh... Well, now that we're done with that whole situation in the Underworld, we can finally look for the Stellaron.
b499ce0693fb8e55.Speaker: March 7th

82d3efff9dc7e772.ContentText: *sigh* But thinking about it, I feel a bit bad about Clara... We promised her that our talks with Svarog would go peacefully...
82d3efff9dc7e772.Speaker: March 7th

25d167387e15fe15.ContentText: {NICKNAME}, you tried your best to persuade him. It's my fault for not preparing better for such a situation in advance.
25d167387e15fe15.Speaker: Dan Heng

0d2bd41ce608f6ee.ContentText: You tried your best, don't blame yourself. I should've considered such a situation in advance. And it was Svarog who attacked first, we didn't have any other choice.
0d2bd41ce608f6ee.Speaker: Dan Heng

924f3614a58c4af7.ContentText: That certainly isn't our area of strength.
924f3614a58c4af7.Speaker: Dan Heng

082d61f75d78e5bb.ContentText: I didn't mean for you guys to start beating yourselves up over it!
082d61f75d78e5bb.Speaker: March 7th

f644143055e87188.ContentText: Look on the bright side — things turned out alright, didn't they? Now everyone knows that the real problem here is the Stellaron, and they're willing to help us out.
f644143055e87188.Speaker: March 7th

a413ae294dfaa849.ContentText: All in all, the mission is going super smoothly!
a413ae294dfaa849.Speaker: March 7th

0c01e80b3b86f8cc.ContentText: But we still have a lot left to figure out. For instance...
0c01e80b3b86f8cc.Speaker: Dan Heng

7ae602025d236c9d.ContentText: Exactly. We don't even have the Stellaron's coordinates and location.
7ae602025d236c9d.Speaker: Dan Heng

1d7ae3fa2bda7e9a.ContentText: Cocolia's sudden change in attitude is also very curious.
1d7ae3fa2bda7e9a.Speaker: Dan Heng

cb1395f323bd9be3.ContentText: Exactly. There must be a reason for this sudden change in her attitude.
cb1395f323bd9be3.Speaker: Dan Heng

70d857eaf52a10a8.ContentText: And, we still don't have the coordinates and location of the Stellaron.
70d857eaf52a10a8.Speaker: Dan Heng

38e255f7279f3bc7.ContentText: What's important is that we still don't have the exact location and coordinates of the Stellaron. Nor have we figured out the reason behind Cocolia's sudden change in attitude.
38e255f7279f3bc7.Speaker: Dan Heng

e3373400a671293e.ContentText: We still haven't put all of the pieces together...
e3373400a671293e.Speaker: Dan Heng

33cf802081ae62e6.ContentText: Oh, I remember you mentioned something about strange dreams before...
33cf802081ae62e6.Speaker: March 7th

8fa2e80fdcf29960.ContentText: ...All three dreams were the same, with Cocolia and that other voice...
8fa2e80fdcf29960.Speaker: Dan Heng

b58ce2183e4e8dcf.ContentText: It would be weird to call it a coincidence.
b58ce2183e4e8dcf.Speaker: March 7th

a11ef5d6e425ce33.ContentText: I'm wondering if these dreams aren't just random, if there is some meaning behind them... Maybe you're having them because...
a11ef5d6e425ce33.Speaker: Dan Heng

1c31c3df24d05b2a.ContentText: That's my hunch, but I have no proof.
1c31c3df24d05b2a.Speaker: Dan Heng

550f3e4a31e123fd.ContentText: Well then that's as good as nothing for now... So, what should we do when we get back above ground? After all this talk, we're still back at square one...
550f3e4a31e123fd.Speaker: March 7th

4d8b61e61aa876ad.ContentText: We solve a puzzle one piece at a time. Let's get some rest. We'll talk to Wildfire tomorrow and get to the bottom of this.
4d8b61e61aa876ad.Speaker: Dan Heng

dea747eef90c021c.ContentText: Also, there's still one more key character we haven't talked to yet. Her connection to Cocolia may be the key to cracking this mystery.
dea747eef90c021c.Speaker: Dan Heng

4b06d481ff475f4c.ContentText: Over there, see that? That used to be the worst street in Rivet Town... and it's also where I grew up.
4b06d481ff475f4c.Speaker: Seele

0a188269e77e0263.ContentText: My friends and I used to wander those streets thinking about where to find our next meal. That is, until Chief Oleg got me out and took me to the orphanage.
0a188269e77e0263.Speaker: Seele

5c7fd070ef9ae51a.ContentText: There I learned to read and write from Natasha. At the age of <unbreak>10</unbreak>, I started to patrol the mines with Oleg, occasionally getting into fights with the local thugs...
5c7fd070ef9ae51a.Speaker: Seele

7dbf8e9a9fcda611.ContentText: Nice? You being sarcastic with me?
7dbf8e9a9fcda611.Speaker: Seele

2104ce479456abf8.ContentText: Oh! No, sorry. Life in the Underworld is difficult, I shouldn't be speaking about it so lightly.
2104ce479456abf8.Speaker: Bronya

fc0234a2e32d8890.ContentText: *sigh* You're always so serious... It really gets on people's nerves sometimes, you know?
fc0234a2e32d8890.Speaker: Seele

a2c2283f50f6c979.ContentText: Right... Uh, what I meant was... I kind of envy you, Seele.
a2c2283f50f6c979.Speaker: Bronya

84e86a15a3a73162.ContentText: For as long as I can remember, my days have been an endless cycle of studying, etiquette lessons, and training.
84e86a15a3a73162.Speaker: Bronya

2f87dc0e990389ab.ContentText: Every day all I hear is "Remember who you are, Bronya," "This is against the Architects' Admonishments, Bronya," "Ladies shouldn't use such foul language, Bronya"...
2f87dc0e990389ab.Speaker: Bronya

86124e274e292134.ContentText: ...Some may envy this kind of life, but I have felt... trapped. When every choice and every goal has already been made for you... You probably can't imagine how that feels.
86124e274e292134.Speaker: Bronya

d154228b694cb177.ContentText: ...No, I can't... But more importantly, what kind of "foul language" were you using?
d154228b694cb177.Speaker: Seele

e96a4a7ac0a73d3e.ContentText: In the name of the Architects, I shall stick this spear into your nostril!
e96a4a7ac0a73d3e.Speaker: Bronya

4c30c093a9c95d6e.ContentText: Hahaha, that's it? That's nothing. Looks like I'll have to teach you some Underworld slang before you go back.
4c30c093a9c95d6e.Speaker: Seele

3f156c7141d54fc7.ContentText: No, no, that won't be necessary.
3f156c7141d54fc7.Speaker: Bronya

6e31fe37f6fbe0f5.ContentText: It'll be better than poking people's nostrils at least...
6e31fe37f6fbe0f5.Speaker: Seele

ec3ec4403a2e6a64.ContentText: I never thought that I'd be here having a heart-to-heart with the future guardian. As a kid, I didn't meet many people who lived in the Overworld. I only heard stories from the grown-ups and figured you were all just a bunch of cold snobs.
ec3ec4403a2e6a64.Speaker: Seele

af55ec2caacd1a55.ContentText: I've heard from some Silvermane veterans that before the orders were made to seal off the Underworld from the Overworld, there was no difference between the two places. Everybody ate the same food, chatted about the same topics, celebrated the same festivals...
af55ec2caacd1a55.Speaker: Bronya

2d61b234edfdf0c4.ContentText: Even though times are different now, things like the joys and sorrows of life, the ties between people... These precious things must certainly still connect us all.
2d61b234edfdf0c4.Speaker: Bronya

02e9801d744a71bb.ContentText: If there is a way to bridge the gap between the two worlds, we can definitely go back to the time when you and I were not divided. When we could stand side by side against the Eternal Freeze and the Fragmentum.
02e9801d744a71bb.Speaker: Bronya

fb4882a7a8e411e7.ContentText: I'm not like you. I don't have that many grand plans for the future. But... if that's the future you want, I'm willing to build this bridge with you.
fb4882a7a8e411e7.Speaker: Seele

7d900e25b4997372.ContentText: Thank you, Seele. Your trust is very important to me.
7d900e25b4997372.Speaker: Bronya

520914c05e376e80.ContentText: Speaking of which, what are you going to do next? What Svarog revealed must've made quite an impact, huh...
520914c05e376e80.Speaker: Seele

9ecfcc4f64cc3449.ContentText: ...Yes. I thought I was prepared for anything, but...
9ecfcc4f64cc3449.Speaker: Bronya

f10032566cb9fd88.ContentText: As long as I am the guardian's successor, those truths will come out sooner or later. But why does my mother hide it from me, and why does she want me to hunt down the outsiders who know about the nature of the Stellaron... It just... it doesn't make sense.
f10032566cb9fd88.Speaker: Bronya

b049003e552019cf.ContentText: I've thought it over. There's only one thing I can do — go ask her directly.
b049003e552019cf.Speaker: Bronya

ab1aeeb6e249e281.ContentText: You... Hold on, you're not really going, are you? Alone? You can't, this plan is...
ab1aeeb6e249e281.Speaker: Seele

2e8b9e46987feee6.ContentText: I've already thought it through, Seele. I am Madam Cocolia's daughter. That will never change.
2e8b9e46987feee6.Speaker: Bronya

4fcb5c7048b2affd.ContentText: Be it my duties as her heir, or a Silvermane Guard, I must face my problems head-on. Even if...
4fcb5c7048b2affd.Speaker: Bronya

e0e7427927163b2c.ContentText: This is for you, Seele. Please help me pass it on to the outsiders. If... If I'm unable to see you again... They'll know what to do.
e0e7427927163b2c.Speaker: Bronya

0b61a284ee8825d3.ContentText: ...Okay, I understand. You've made up your mind, and there's nothing I can say that will change it. But remember this — if you run into trouble, I will come to save you, no matter what.
0b61a284ee8825d3.Speaker: Seele

63c683032b81ac30.ContentText: Then I'll be waiting for you.
63c683032b81ac30.Speaker: Bronya

e8e9dcfaeb04f2b1.ContentText: So... did you come to this spot when you were a child?
e8e9dcfaeb04f2b1.Speaker: Bronya

a10d749f7a50d83c.ContentText: Of course. I just didn't appreciate how nice it was at the time.
a10d749f7a50d83c.Speaker: Seele

b22681d9e26eff8b.ContentText: Took you long enough sleepy head. We've been waiting all day!
b22681d9e26eff8b.Speaker: March 7th

58de8fe35e2ed3c2.ContentText: I've noticed that our sleep routines don't match up. You either keep getting up in the middle of the night or snoozing away until the day is almost out. Unacceptable. You gotta work on your teamwork!
58de8fe35e2ed3c2.Speaker: March 7th

145fb63dd9a3141f.ContentText: {NICKNAME}, did you have a dream again last night?
145fb63dd9a3141f.Speaker: Dan Heng

b350adeb8cf16ae5.ContentText: ...So that's why you slept for so long.
b350adeb8cf16ae5.Speaker: March 7th

054af3f294b16e14.ContentText: ...Huh, that's weird. I bet the conductor won, right?
054af3f294b16e14.Speaker: March 7th

5f8601fac344a7df.ContentText: Oh, that happens to me all the time. It feels like I had a dream, but I can't remember anything about it.
5f8601fac344a7df.Speaker: March 7th

2c4ae3bc6a746f16.ContentText: Well then, let's go find Wildfire to discuss our next move and see if they have any new discoveries.
2c4ae3bc6a746f16.Speaker: Dan Heng

09db200442170276.ContentText: Let's go! I can't wait to finally get back above ground!
09db200442170276.Speaker: March 7th

ea068601dca94706.ContentText: It's the bane of Svarog! The big hero of the Underworld — {NICKNAME}!
ea068601dca94706.Speaker: Sampo

cfd3ae162d6cf4c1.ContentText: And the other big heroes, Dan Heng and March 7th!
cfd3ae162d6cf4c1.Speaker: Sampo

9837d79848f0c744.ContentText: She has a bunch of other things to attend to, so I hope you don't mind talking to this old man instead. I speak on behalf of Natasha.

1a2c119005bff0d5.ContentText: By the way, sorry for keeping that whole thing about her being the actual leader of Wildfire a secret. Hahaha...

9961c3a9f372c566.ContentText: I'm glad you don't mind. Natasha is always cautious, but she has no ill intent, as you surely have noticed.

1b1f25a1b012f04f.ContentText: Hahaha, my apologies. Natasha is always cautious, but she has no ill intent, as you must have noticed.

5bd657b9c7acd408.ContentText: Oh, well. I might just be second in command, but I still have a lot of responsibility. I couldn't give Natasha up right when we first met, could I? I had no clue that you bunch would become big heroes of the Underworld.

09a5f1b2bfbf0ac9.ContentText: She told me to make sure you return to the Overworld safely. I gave it some thought, and I think the safest way is to ask this fella for help.

76c1d41fa95a80c0.ContentText: I brought you down. I can take you back up! Free of charge, satisfaction guaranteed.
76c1d41fa95a80c0.Speaker: Sampo

f4fbf4154ee00158.ContentText: ...There's no need to knock us out this time, right?
f4fbf4154ee00158.Speaker: March 7th

338061e43c8e6013.ContentText: Of course not! This time we'll go back through the Furnace Core.
338061e43c8e6013.Speaker: Sampo

ae942fec7d3aa00a.ContentText: Well, for my sparkling companionship of course! ...I jest, I jest! The path has been blocked for over ten years, and very few know how to get through. That's where I come in.
ae942fec7d3aa00a.Speaker: Sampo

34aa4df5e7105e0d.ContentText: That would be... problematic, and dangerous. Trust me, we should go through the Furnace Core.
34aa4df5e7105e0d.Speaker: Sampo

c92c33fec857137c.ContentText: Please, don't be like that. We have so much history together, can't you have a little faith?
c92c33fec857137c.Speaker: Sampo

eeb1106cebb94536.ContentText: Enough chatter. Just be a good guide!
eeb1106cebb94536.Speaker: Seele

47c2f2636fcbc69f.ContentText: She already went back. As you know, she has some things to settle with the Supreme Guardian.
47c2f2636fcbc69f.Speaker: Seele

268ab21c44e42f13.ContentText: What? She just ditched us and went back? How could you let her...
268ab21c44e42f13.Speaker: March 7th

e91ad63afeaa6c4f.ContentText: It's not like that! She... just has many responsibilities to bear. I don't completely understand, I trust that she's trying to solve the problem.
e91ad63afeaa6c4f.Speaker: Seele

675d7443420a4166.ContentText: Exactly, she has a lot of responsibilities. I don't completely understand, but I trust that she's trying to solve the problem.
675d7443420a4166.Speaker: Seele

d7a1a24c0e5686c9.ContentText: Enough about Sampo! We need him for this trip, and we can still get rid of him after we reach the surface.
d7a1a24c0e5686c9.Speaker: Seele

6c7bb1c2baeed8df.ContentText: Miss Seele, I'm still here, you know...
6c7bb1c2baeed8df.Speaker: Sampo

29d2085316445008.ContentText: Oh right, Bronya told me to give you this.
29d2085316445008.Speaker: Seele

a19e802485906f0a.ContentText: She left us a letter. Hmm... could this be one of those "open-in-case-of-emergency" letters? I've never gotten one of those before. Should we wait until we run into something dangerous?
a19e802485906f0a.Speaker: March 7th

4aa77195d0de6759.ContentText: Stop overthinking and just open it.
4aa77195d0de6759.Speaker: Dan Heng

28f1dc4e2f3f069a.ContentText: Brother and sister Landau...? I know the brother must refer to Gepard, but who could the sister be...
28f1dc4e2f3f069a.Speaker: March 7th

d68a8e47272223e3.ContentText: Oh, Serval! So she's Gepard's older sister!
d68a8e47272223e3.Speaker: March 7th

1778e05f3eeb80cc.ContentText: Blonde, tall, good-looking... *sigh* Those Landau genes sure are something else.
1778e05f3eeb80cc.Speaker: March 7th

2cccb36c238d1c42.ContentText: She gave it some good thought, but whatever's going on in that supreme guardian's head... Even Bronya might have trouble understanding.
2cccb36c238d1c42.Speaker: Dan Heng

8614a562a7cd480b.ContentText: Sampo, do you know the Landau siblings?
8614a562a7cd480b.Speaker: Dan Heng

16d0cfcc39c13376.ContentText: Landau... Uhh yeah, we're old friends. I've mostly dealt with the younger brother in the past, but the sister... *shudder* She's much scarier. Today's supposed to be a day of celebration, so let's not talk about it right now.
16d0cfcc39c13376.Speaker: Sampo

a41d343bebd6bd70.ContentText: We can set out at any time. Just come find me when you're ready~
a41d343bebd6bd70.Speaker: Sampo

25da8e33a876daf1.ContentText: Well my friends, are you ready to head out?
25da8e33a876daf1.Speaker: Sampo

a2f3402a4154b1ce.ContentText: Wonderful! Remember to bring enough food and drink to refuel on the way. We have a lot of steps to climb!
a2f3402a4154b1ce.Speaker: Sampo

24b0a221fdf4dcd7.ContentText: Ask away, my friend. I have all the answers you seek.
24b0a221fdf4dcd7.Speaker: Sampo

f320d41b07eee02c.ContentText: What else is there to say? You know him as well as I do. He's an upstanding guy, as well as young, handsome, and charming in his lack of charm.
f320d41b07eee02c.Speaker: Sampo

6204ee12298b54fd.ContentText: But to be honest, I'm not very close to him. After all, he's an officer and I'm... the opposite.
6204ee12298b54fd.Speaker: Sampo

07ffd009fb258ffa.ContentText: Oh, she's quite extraordinary. The renowned rebellious Landau girl. She once had a bright future, but after getting on her leader's bad side, she lost her job. She ended up opening a workshop and playing underground music.
07ffd009fb258ffa.Speaker: Sampo

5d7502007c262dc3.ContentText: I heard that her old man was furious, and that only a few younger siblings are still in contact with her.
5d7502007c262dc3.Speaker: Sampo

0339c3f84d92a288.ContentText: I used to go to her sometimes when I had any mechanical problems above ground. But for... various reasons, I don't visit her workshop much anymore.
0339c3f84d92a288.Speaker: Sampo

b1095df145a4d949.ContentText: It's a passage connecting the Underworld and the Overworld, a big, stone, spiral stairway. Y'know, I don't understand the Architects' obsession with making these steps when there is such advanced technology available. Wouldn't an elevator have been better?
b1095df145a4d949.Speaker: Sampo

efab9d656b207795.ContentText: ...It's easier for you youngsters. For this old guy, the steps of the Furnace Core are a nightmare on the knees!
efab9d656b207795.Speaker: Sampo

6a52636dab6fd804.ContentText: You haven't heard enough about me, huh? Alright, my name is Sampo Koski. I'm a businessman who stands up for justice in his free time. And no, I don't have it in for you.
6a52636dab6fd804.Speaker: Sampo

3fd9315631baa6fb.ContentText: What's the matter? Got too attached to the underground? Go ahead, I'll be waiting here.
3fd9315631baa6fb.Speaker: Sampo

6025aad8b6cdc94e.ContentText: Bronya! I thought... I thought I'd lost you.

e30cf8e21deff271.ContentText: Where were you? A—Are you hurt? I'll fetch the butler right away—

e459f0e93d9fcb97.ContentText: No, there's no need! I don't want to see Sebas right now. Sorry, mother...
e459f0e93d9fcb97.Speaker: Bronya

b63122e24a7eabec.ContentText: I'm fine, really. I just got into a few skirmishes down in the Underworld, but nothing I couldn't handle.
b63122e24a7eabec.Speaker: Bronya

1aa76caef19f4543.ContentText: In that case, report everything you saw, Commander Bronya.

21af3cd96937f6bd.ContentText: After the failed pursuit at Backwater Pass, the wanted outsiders and I were somehow taken to the Underworld.
21af3cd96937f6bd.Speaker: Bronya

c7aa1ed13ad231ba.ContentText: Because of the difficult situation we were in, we formed a temporary alliance to help the residents of the Underworld resolve a few... issues of survival.
c7aa1ed13ad231ba.Speaker: Bronya

208550c7beb5f883.ContentText: We also defeated an ancient robot known as "Svarog," and learned some truths... about the Stellaron.
208550c7beb5f883.Speaker: Bronya

c64a12bf90226e48.ContentText: Madam Cocolia, it is my firm belief that the visitors from beyond the sky are not the villains we had imagined before.
c64a12bf90226e48.Speaker: Bronya

7418acb88832f109.ContentText: I witnessed them take up arms in the name of justice, and risk their lives for the sake of others. I can also ascertain that they did come for the Stellaron, but only to relieve the disaster it has brought upon Belobog.
7418acb88832f109.Speaker: Bronya

e31190ce3696eee7.ContentText: Mother... you've always known the truth about the Stellaron, haven't you? The responsibility of bearing that truth will fall upon me one day. Such is the burden of being guardian — to carry these secrets for eternity.
e31190ce3696eee7.Speaker: Bronya

3541eed53e84aade.ContentText: So... I ask you to forgive my defiance, but I believe that the order to dispatch the outsiders was a mistake. To solve the problems brought on by the Stellaron, the Architects waited hundreds of years, and those outsiders may be the... the—
3541eed53e84aade.Speaker: Bronya

7fb4fc8eab71d64f.ContentText: Arrogant, ignorant... Oh you disappoint me, Bronya.

fdf79a96eed1ab66.ContentText: You merely glimpsed the tip of the iceberg and now you think you know everything. You spend a short time with that Underworld scum, and suddenly you have the audacity to question my orders?

f32ab0ab7c3b02d3.ContentText: My entire life, everything you ever kept from me... I remember it clearly now. This time... this time I'm standing my ground, Madam Guardian! And please, stop dismissing me with vague excuses.
f32ab0ab7c3b02d3.Speaker: Bronya

71a37eb3bfc8b8ca.ContentText: Tell me what you have seen. What exactly it is you are hiding... Why do you send the Silvermane Guards to die in the Fragmentum? Why have you abandoned the people of the Underworld? And why... why did you have that sudden change of mind?
71a37eb3bfc8b8ca.Speaker: Bronya

b8d646cb16f8f9be.ContentText: I knew this moment would come sooner or later... I just didn't expect it would be so soon.

0e8168c198270c47.ContentText: You want to know why I gave those orders... is that right? Do you believe you are ready to learn the truth?

232a74b08b30472d.ContentText: It is time you heard it... the voice of this dying world.

56a3efd68c42b6ca.ContentText: (I should go meet up with March and Dan Heng.)
56a3efd68c42b6ca.Speaker: playerboy

fa649a612bec3a9a.ContentText: You're back! I've heard from Wildfire that you helped resolve that whole situation with Svarog. Amazing!

57cfb8695d35289d.ContentText: It must have been exhausting. Please, have some food and get a good night's rest.

54e3b9e5f89c2c82.ContentText: Ah, young {F#lady}{M#lad}. I wanted to see you off, but you know how things are around here in the underground. Solve one problem and three more take its place.

b61195c1f6405f43.ContentText: Hm, something you wanted to ask?

53c0025e45f7c931.ContentText: Natasha trusts me. In her eyes, an ex-military officer was more suited to be the leader of the organization than a doctor.

ce9ca866867482b0.ContentText: But the most important thing a leader needs is a strong heart. An ability to unite everyone toward a common cause. In that respect, no one in the underground comes close to her.

4f30164c9892a217.ContentText: I was actually once an officer of the Silvermane Guards. After being discharged due to an injury, I followed my old lady here to the Underworld, where I planned to retire.

cd72b454dbf2770e.ContentText: But as things would have it, I ended up busier than ever.

8c85623cc42acd3d.ContentText: There is nothing to regret! Life in the Underworld is hard, but people here are kind and everyone is close like one big family.

21074845a571826c.ContentText: Do I miss it? If you're talking about the time with my comrades-in-arms, of course. But other than that, I don't really prefer it over life in the Underworld.

8b5b762b19a8cf03.ContentText: Wildfire has already made it through its darkest days. With Natasha's leadership, we have the confidence to lead the Underworlders to a brighter future.

3280443495c5083a.ContentText: And much of that is thanks to all of you.

deeed21be325c789.ContentText: Fortunately, Svarog turned out to have some useful information for you. After all your hard work, I'd feel quite guilty if you left empty-handed. Hahaha!

31203822eb1544c8.ContentText: While you still have a long journey ahead, I have no doubt our paths will cross again one day. Till we meet again, friends of Wildfire!

3bbb561a1dd4c43b.ContentText: You ready yet? If you want to keep wasting time, I'll just go on ahead by myself.
3bbb561a1dd4c43b.Speaker: Seele

b661e4225e23c5f2.ContentText: What, still something you want to talk about? Alright, let's make it quick.
b661e4225e23c5f2.Speaker: Seele

e827c22954576cd5.ContentText: Not much. We just chatted a bit.
e827c22954576cd5.Speaker: Seele

4b48e67cc6a68a57.ContentText: I promised her that I would help her rebuild the connection between the Overworld and the Underworld, that's all.
4b48e67cc6a68a57.Speaker: Seele

59d6a4443de0fe78.ContentText: I made a promise to Bronya that if something were to happen to her, I'd rescue her myself.
59d6a4443de0fe78.Speaker: Seele

db93fe3bfa811bf9.ContentText: Hmm... I didn't really give it much thought. But traveling with you bunch does always lead to unexpected surprises.
db93fe3bfa811bf9.Speaker: Seele

6b4fd0332e34d596.ContentText: Hearty combat and exciting adventures... Not bad, I certainly don't hate it.
6b4fd0332e34d596.Speaker: Seele

191f322c2646ad7f.ContentText: Of course... Heh, you didn't see the look on Joshua's face. He could barely hold back his tears.
191f322c2646ad7f.Speaker: Seele

bee42423f7b373b4.ContentText: Chief Oleg... He didn't say much, but I know he's not the kind to wear his heart on his sleeve.
bee42423f7b373b4.Speaker: Seele

182c5e1a7bf41a05.ContentText: It was my choice to go up, and Natasha supported my decision. Besides, you could use another person who can fight, right?
182c5e1a7bf41a05.Speaker: Seele

bdba40124d3183e2.ContentText: Alright, then let's cut the chat and move out!
bdba40124d3183e2.Speaker: Seele

cce82841f4e3c082.ContentText: Ah, we're finally back! ...I forgot what fresh air tasted like... Nom, nom, nom.
cce82841f4e3c082.Speaker: March 7th

2759464a23a4a4a5.ContentText: Wait! I haven't finished yet... Alright, let's go.
2759464a23a4a4a5.Speaker: March 7th

7cba8c512e4984d4.ContentText: ...Freedom... Cold... Mainly cold actually. Let's go.
7cba8c512e4984d4.Speaker: March 7th

7de3b862d8ca3c36.ContentText: Where's our next stop? We should find somewhere to put our feet up, as long as it's not Goethe Hotel again...
7de3b862d8ca3c36.Speaker: March 7th

53932414a4023426.ContentText: Classic unreliable Sampo — he probably guessed we'd ask where his hiding place was. No sooner are we back in the Administrative District than he sneaks off.
53932414a4023426.Speaker: Seele

ee27e66ba5168199.ContentText: No way! The boss will recognize us, plus Silvermane Guards are stationed nearby. We'd be offering ourselves up on a silver platter!
ee27e66ba5168199.Speaker: March 7th

6c6a8c73e8766418.ContentText: The bro or the sis? If you're talking about Gepard, we should be careful... He's a top Silvermane Guard — he'd probably get a medal for every one of us he brought in.
6c6a8c73e8766418.Speaker: March 7th

9a944a7adb991cd3.ContentText: Where's your sense of loyalty!? Uh, that would be nice though...
9a944a7adb991cd3.Speaker: March 7th

190d18831f26d2ca.ContentText: Dan Heng, what do you think?
190d18831f26d2ca.Speaker: March 7th

e0063860df33448f.ContentText: I think it'd be best to pay a visit to Serval Landau.
e0063860df33448f.Speaker: Dan Heng

a6af2c6d6de15184.ContentText: So you think we should avoid Gepard for the time being, right?
a6af2c6d6de15184.Speaker: March 7th

5e48d669229319a6.ContentText: He's an elite officer of the Silvermane Guards. It wouldn't be easy to get to him. Besides... if he hasn't been persuaded by Bronya's letter, we'd be walking right into the lion's den.
5e48d669229319a6.Speaker: Dan Heng

2c0866652d91f115.ContentText: Hmm, makes sense... Guess we better head over to Serval's workshop then?
2c0866652d91f115.Speaker: March 7th

df13244f34e04515.ContentText: Mm. But... we must keep a low profile — we're still wanted fugitives.
df13244f34e04515.Speaker: Dan Heng

d550860c60a25f0f.ContentText: Nothing, it's just a little... new.
d550860c60a25f0f.Speaker: Seele
