4f043802f69ec004.ContentText: The last time I was on the surface, I was still a child. I have no memory of any of this.
4f043802f69ec004.Speaker: Seele

d45d71fab64f5f95.ContentText: The Overworld and the Underworld... We've... We've been cut off for so long.
d45d71fab64f5f95.Speaker: Seele

248b05eb7ce98efb.ContentText: There are so many Silvermane Guards on patrol. Is it usually like this?
248b05eb7ce98efb.Speaker: Seele

59b9ea57752fa584.ContentText: No, I don't remember the security being this tight last time... It might have something to do with us.
59b9ea57752fa584.Speaker: Dan Heng

2f40b83ffb7a747b.ContentText: The supreme guardian has probably learned of our arrival already. Bronya...
2f40b83ffb7a747b.Speaker: Dan Heng

ad4d46483eac9e32.ContentText: ...Well, now we have to help him keep his mouth shut.
ad4d46483eac9e32.Speaker: Dan Heng

b3852868139d34b0.ContentText: Tsk, don't stand in our way!
b3852868139d34b0.Speaker: Seele

311e204ee7e7b75b.ContentText: Intruders! I must inform the security captain...

38a8825fd3207b31.ContentText: He's gonna raise the alarm, stop him!
38a8825fd3207b31.Speaker: Seele

8962e232429c8492.ContentText: Who is it? Shop's closed today, you'll have to come back tomorrow!
8962e232429c8492.Speaker: Serval

8df30643f0020b64.ContentText: Ha, not interested — I need time, not money!
8df30643f0020b64.Speaker: Serval

6db3ac8eef808848.ContentText: Serval! We came past here before and helped you fix a few things, remember?
6db3ac8eef808848.Speaker: March 7th

3a5f72532684b306.ContentText: Ah, I remember! The three outsiders! Wait — why are you still strolling around the city? Do you know the Silvermane Guards are looking all over for you?
3a5f72532684b306.Speaker: Serval

aaa3a05bf2d0f969.ContentText: Quick, act natural and get inside. Don't get spotted!
aaa3a05bf2d0f969.Speaker: Serval

519186656ebe1828.ContentText: Alright, you'll be safe here. My workshop has pretty good soundproofing, and barely anyone comes in.
519186656ebe1828.Speaker: Serval

abccc46d9d51a363.ContentText: Just what crime did you commit exactly? They recalled a bunch of Guards from the front line to track you down — it's unprecedented. Now they're patrolling the whole city and everyone's in a panic.
abccc46d9d51a363.Speaker: Serval

be3adabc922e1a30.ContentText: Bronya said we could trust you completely.
be3adabc922e1a30.Speaker: Dan Heng

fe341274a56e861a.ContentText: You mean to say that you don't trust me completely?
fe341274a56e861a.Speaker: Serval

8f3c265ef70c2ed4.ContentText: Good! That's smart of you. But you needn't worry, Cocolia and I aren't even on speaking terms. It was her that ejected me from the Architects — I refuse to stand with her.
8f3c265ef70c2ed4.Speaker: Serval

39dae057ec674ea5.ContentText: I don't believe you guys would do anything bad, and the Architects are gonna need conclusive and publicly available evidence for me to think otherwise. Besides, I know the Architects, and if they did have any evidence, they would've released it by now.
39dae057ec674ea5.Speaker: Serval

df69c24fbda66a82.ContentText: I know Cocolia's style — get everyone into a frenzy first.
df69c24fbda66a82.Speaker: Serval

38b1b44641e6974b.ContentText: ...Most people in a frenzy don't stop to ponder the details.
38b1b44641e6974b.Speaker: Serval

7eec2681b1390e18.ContentText: Hehe, you could say that... We were like sisters once — inseparable. Of course, that was all before she became the supreme guardian...
7eec2681b1390e18.Speaker: Serval

00a980796dd92b99.ContentText: Me? None. What Cocolia and the Architects get up to has nothing to do with me. My time is too precious for pondering.
00a980796dd92b99.Speaker: Serval

90655270a18ce636.ContentText: Dislike? We were like sisters once — inseparable. Of course, that was all before she became the supreme guardian...
90655270a18ce636.Speaker: Serval

e9773467259f679f.ContentText: These days I just spend my time fixing things in this workshop and playing music. It's a pretty carefree existence.
e9773467259f679f.Speaker: Serval

42c1b6a33024793c.ContentText: *sigh* If I'm not careful I'll start boring you all with sob stories from the past. Let's get back to you guys. If long-lost Bronya told you to come here, you must have something important to tell me?
42c1b6a33024793c.Speaker: Serval

b1a5d09a51c0edcd.ContentText: You can trust me. I know our paths have only crossed once before, but my intuition tells me you guys are good people. And I've got good intuition by the way, haha.
b1a5d09a51c0edcd.Speaker: Serval

ab3e187f1b44c5a6.ContentText: Ooh! I'm the best storyteller — let me! Let me!
ab3e187f1b44c5a6.Speaker: March 7th

d3aa4473858d97f3.ContentText: ...Perhaps I should do it, or we'll still be here tomorrow.
d3aa4473858d97f3.Speaker: Dan Heng

2e03e095b053b509.ContentText: So that's what's been happening — no wonder we hadn't heard from Bronya recently. *sigh* After all these years in isolation and without a single word from below, this is what's become of the Underworld...
2e03e095b053b509.Speaker: Serval

8035469cb8433248.ContentText: I believe you, there's no way you could have invented all those twists and turns. What's more, we have Miss Seele here as living proof. As for the Stellaron... heh, I know why Bronya got you to find me.
8035469cb8433248.Speaker: Serval

3f7d1484a0a79a8f.ContentText: ...When I was still one of the Architects working in the Scientific Research Division, I was researching the Stellaron.
3f7d1484a0a79a8f.Speaker: Serval

bdbfb28ce4076fa6.ContentText: I never thought I'd hear that word again after being expelled by the Architects... Come on, I'll tell you everything.
bdbfb28ce4076fa6.Speaker: Serval

3e8a0072f6549b15.ContentText: Only a very few people in Belobog know of the existence of the Stellaron. Those that do would never associate it with the Fragmentum or Eternal Freeze.
3e8a0072f6549b15.Speaker: Serval

b930c67b36a3fb84.ContentText: But according to the data recorded in that robot, Svarog... the Architects dug out the truth long ago. The research results were purposely hidden away to ensure that the outside world would never know of them.
b930c67b36a3fb84.Speaker: Serval

8eb79463bceeca7b.ContentText: Just my luck... Out of all the research topics I could've chosen, I insisted on the Stellaron. It's clear now that anyone who wanted to get closer to the truth would have been expelled or "abandoned."
8eb79463bceeca7b.Speaker: Serval

0cc4226c0020f432.ContentText: Maybe I should be thanking Cocolia. All she did was push me out... She could've decided to take a more permanent measure.
0cc4226c0020f432.Speaker: Serval

a2d510d81325b6b1.ContentText: I figured out that the Stellaron and the Fragmentum were linked, so I was already close to the truth. It's a shame that the Architects ejected me before I could discover that the source of the Fragmentum was the Stellaron itself.
a2d510d81325b6b1.Speaker: Serval

1db1b6e053a27030.ContentText: Before I lost my position, I was applying for permission to survey the Stellaron directly. It was my research topic, but I'd never even set eyes on it. My research was all based on historical data and lab simulations.
1db1b6e053a27030.Speaker: Serval

b199ee9f8a8fa3ea.ContentText: Not long after I submitted my preliminary report and application, I received my punishment. It was obvious that somebody didn't want my research to continue.
b199ee9f8a8fa3ea.Speaker: Serval

332120974701edf3.ContentText: Cocolia... It's been so many years since we last spoke. We were great friends once — there was nothing we wouldn't share.
332120974701edf3.Speaker: Serval

740e72af5ec997dc.ContentText: She became a completely different person when she took on the supreme guardianship. The convictions she once held, her enthusiasm... it was like they were drawn out of her by some mysterious force.
740e72af5ec997dc.Speaker: Serval

df8c8ca67d82e36d.ContentText: She gave the order to expel me herself and refused to see me...I never understood that behavior, and I gave up trying to use logic to work it out a long time ago.
df8c8ca67d82e36d.Speaker: Serval

75385ec1094b95fe.ContentText: Sometimes I even wonder whether she really did become a different person... is that possible? Perhaps there's a single guardian's consciousness that gets handed down from generation to generation... and the real Cocolia has already vanished.
75385ec1094b95fe.Speaker: Serval

ce4a80b78d5e8387.ContentText: Is she being compelled by previous generations of guardians to make such baffling decisions? Who knows... but this might make for good songwriting material.
ce4a80b78d5e8387.Speaker: Serval

250b12d042b1e120.ContentText: Gepard? Not a chance... He's a decent guy, but also famously uncompromising.
250b12d042b1e120.Speaker: Serval

cf736cc937decea1.ContentText: For my brother, orders are more important than anything. Even if you stuck Bronya's letter to his forehead, he wouldn't be swayed.
cf736cc937decea1.Speaker: Serval

10b77e5bec4d3c22.ContentText: You need to choose your words carefully if you want to persuade him of something. It might be best if I talk to him... though I'd need a strategy first.
10b77e5bec4d3c22.Speaker: Serval

bebcf054e48cbe6b.ContentText: Yes. I never observed it directly, but I used lab simulations and outbound surveys to establish a rough location.
bebcf054e48cbe6b.Speaker: Serval

245060d50866b6b7.ContentText: According to the survey results, the Stellaron is likely to the north of Belobog... somewhere in the vast Snow Plains.
245060d50866b6b7.Speaker: Serval

1497968b9d5541dc.ContentText: We must locate it as soon as possible — ideally before Cocolia takes action. Can you tell us the way?
1497968b9d5541dc.Speaker: Dan Heng

a292fedd4bc68bae.ContentText: Not a problem, I was thinking the same thing! But I'm afraid telling you might not be enough.
a292fedd4bc68bae.Speaker: Serval

d0bccce43ee95f51.ContentText: The area to the north of Belobog has been more or less swallowed up by the Fragmentum. If you want to get to the northern Snow Plains, you'll need to get past the Silvermane Guard Restricted Zone on the front lines first.
d0bccce43ee95f51.Speaker: Serval

4eff72ec824941d0.ContentText: Even if you get past the restricted zone in one piece... you'll have a whole heap of Fragmentum to deal with.
4eff72ec824941d0.Speaker: Serval

607bc0b3897ce3a3.ContentText: Yes. That's where the main force of the Silvermane Guards is stationed. They've consolidated their position there in order to resist the encroaching Fragmentum.
607bc0b3897ce3a3.Speaker: Serval

b2e30eba9199c75a.ContentText: Correct. And it's different from the underground towns you described. The Fragmentum there has quite literally torn everything to pieces — there's no sign of life, despite the monsters.
b2e30eba9199c75a.Speaker: Serval

5d9abcb1a9dcc5ec.ContentText: It sounds like... The three of us and Seele might not be enough. Why don't we go back underground and get Wildfire to come with us?
5d9abcb1a9dcc5ec.Speaker: March 7th

8015b082bc0e8d6d.ContentText: I fear we may not have the time.
8015b082bc0e8d6d.Speaker: Dan Heng

0ce72cc2bffdd95d.ContentText: Hey, enough pessimism! Back in my "official capacity" days, I spent a lot of time in the north — I got to know the soldiers and officers on the front line very well.
0ce72cc2bffdd95d.Speaker: Serval

9e0312cb9e61648c.ContentText: This calls for brainwaves, not "brawnwaves." How about I take you over myself?
9e0312cb9e61648c.Speaker: Serval

c918d6a8c89610bd.ContentText: Really? Great! Phew, it's less scary if someone you know is leading the way!
c918d6a8c89610bd.Speaker: March 7th

70cad090cf4e6c2f.ContentText: Haha, I wanna see the Stellaron too, y'know — it was my research topic for over a decade. You don't get that many decades in life.
70cad090cf4e6c2f.Speaker: Serval

eba76e990fcb1846.ContentText: That's settled then! There's no time to lose — we should head out as soon as you're ready.
eba76e990fcb1846.Speaker: Serval

a5055309fd5174c0.ContentText: D—Darn it! I forgot my brother said he'd be around today...
a5055309fd5174c0.Speaker: Serval

fe172d008163e8c1.ContentText: Find somewhere to hide — quick — I'll handle him!
fe172d008163e8c1.Speaker: Serval

a3dc1ef852d0af1e.ContentText: G—Gepard, it's you! I didn't think you'd have the time to visit with things so tense on the front line, hehe...
a3dc1ef852d0af1e.Speaker: Serval

9e36614bbeb59236.ContentText: Things are manageable, the latest wave of monster attacks has slowed. I'm back in the city to take care of a few matters, but I'll be back on the front line later... I thought I told you?
9e36614bbeb59236.Speaker: Gepard

0e7a8f548b01d799.ContentText: ...Sis, you look a bit pale. Did something happen?
0e7a8f548b01d799.Speaker: Gepard

f76fb2e91c4e077c.ContentText: N—No, why would anything have happened?
f76fb2e91c4e077c.Speaker: Serval

8cbd355cce61ba18.ContentText: You don't normally use my full name.
8cbd355cce61ba18.Speaker: Gepard

62edcce03b07520d.ContentText: *sigh* You said you hate it when I call you "bro" in public! Well I agree. It'd sound better if I started using your full name. Right, broseph?
62edcce03b07520d.Speaker: Serval

4682c3215f0f434b.ContentText: ...You can call me whatever you like. Look Serval, I'm here on official business today. There's something wrong with the Barrier Generator Device and the engineers in our unit don't know how to fix it. I need you to take a look.
4682c3215f0f434b.Speaker: Gepard

dcd7aed6d131940a.ContentText: Those guys can't think outside the box. Of course they can't wrap their heads around my design. *sigh* I thought it was something big. Leave it here. I'll take a look.
dcd7aed6d131940a.Speaker: Serval

61c3e0ce90855413.ContentText: Why are you being so polite? Oh, and why's the city under curfew all of a sudden? Has something happened?
61c3e0ce90855413.Speaker: Serval

47abef33098ffaa5.ContentText: I... I've been instructed to keep it quiet.
47abef33098ffaa5.Speaker: Gepard

303522c79a812658.ContentText: Lil' Geppie... So grown up now... Looking down on his civilian sister...
303522c79a812658.Speaker: Serval

9d0d353a1434dad4.ContentText: Don't say that... *sigh* Forget it. If I don't tell you, Pela will...
9d0d353a1434dad4.Speaker: Gepard

aacdd3867be05ee7.ContentText: Last night, Lady Bronya suddenly appeared. She entered Qlipoth Fort without saying anything to anyone.
aacdd3867be05ee7.Speaker: Gepard

fcfe318d83ce1ade.ContentText: The Supreme Guardian is worried that the three intruders may have followed Bronya out of the Fragmentum and back into the Administrative District. She issued a curfew for the entire city, and ordered us to pursue and capture any suspicious individuals.
fcfe318d83ce1ade.Speaker: Gepard

b1f27cbf572143d9.ContentText: Ah! So that's how it is, no wonder I haven't heard from Bronya... Is she alright?
b1f27cbf572143d9.Speaker: Serval

8e065577d56bde48.ContentText: I'm not sure. She hasn't left Qlipoth Fort. The supreme guardian just said she'd returned. Nothing more.
8e065577d56bde48.Speaker: Gepard

193ffc34b52a1f25.ContentText: Well, I was sure worried about her... After she disappeared, Pela's workload doubled — she said she barely had time to go out.
193ffc34b52a1f25.Speaker: Serval

3bd4ef70cd7c6109.ContentText: She really does tell you everything... Oh, by the way, I left my Goethe Hotel limited-edition flask behind last time I was here. Let me have a look for it. I think I left it over...
3bd4ef70cd7c6109.Speaker: Gepard

cb90c16801301ba6.ContentText: What is it? You seem pretty off today, Serval...
cb90c16801301ba6.Speaker: Gepard

1816d0230aa967cb.ContentText: It's, um... right! You remember how you neglected all those flowers to death? I piled them all over there during a bit of spring cleaning, and now they smell terrible! So... don't go over there!
1816d0230aa967cb.Speaker: Serval

4d4e235fbdd0468f.ContentText: ...Seems like a strange reason not to take a look... plus, am I supposed to believe you were spring cleaning? You must be up to more forbidden research...
4d4e235fbdd0468f.Speaker: Gepard

becede2c86693b02.ContentText: Am not — how dare you! What do you take your sister for?
becede2c86693b02.Speaker: Serval

c701d55653cca784.ContentText: *sigh* Never mind. This is your space, and I shouldn't intrude. I've got business to take care of. Bye for now.
c701d55653cca784.Speaker: Gepard

e00e9c56369bfc19.ContentText: Hey! Wait a sec — uh... Those intruders, I wanted to ask. What crime have they committed?
e00e9c56369bfc19.Speaker: Serval

4c5b0f4e137d4715.ContentText: They're plotting to overthrow the Architects and bring harm to the city.
4c5b0f4e137d4715.Speaker: Gepard

5e51425e79fbde98.ContentText: Huh... reminds me of the accusations against me. Cocolia's methods haven't changed.
5e51425e79fbde98.Speaker: Serval

1a9531471d49a032.ContentText: Don't say that, Serval. I know that you're still nursing a grievance against the supreme guardian, but this isn't a joking matter.
1a9531471d49a032.Speaker: Gepard

c8dc5043ee62381f.ContentText: ...You're telling me off again. Fine, whatever bro. You better be going, come listen to Pela and my next rehearsal.
c8dc5043ee62381f.Speaker: Serval

9c88a33eda17767b.ContentText: I will... if I have the time.
9c88a33eda17767b.Speaker: Gepard

6fca6e4d6a4fb6b6.ContentText: The coast is clear. You can come out now.
6fca6e4d6a4fb6b6.Speaker: Serval

1f75a277d3bd5339.ContentText: Phew...I nearly suffocated! What kind of plot device was that...
1f75a277d3bd5339.Speaker: March 7th

910aec771a83be4d.ContentText: I almost lost my cool when he went for his flask...
910aec771a83be4d.Speaker: Serval

2638c3f86187aab6.ContentText: ...This is bad. Bronya's in danger. We have to go save her.
2638c3f86187aab6.Speaker: Seele

2226d27ff8e749bc.ContentText: Attempting to storm Qlipoth Fort by ourselves? Forget it, Seele. I don't care how skilled you are. I'm not sending you on a suicide mission.
2226d27ff8e749bc.Speaker: Serval

9d24ce69acca4026.ContentText: Rest assured, Cocolia may have changed over the years... but she'd never hurt Bronya. I'm certain of that.
9d24ce69acca4026.Speaker: Serval

967cf2012dd3f019.ContentText: ...You sound like Bronya herself. I don't get it — you guys are against Cocolia, and yet in some ways, you seem to trust her completely.
967cf2012dd3f019.Speaker: Seele

1ee23061696a6b0f.ContentText: I was gauging his reactions just now, did you see? Unless we have irrefutable evidence, he won't question Cocolia's orders. If you go after him now, our plan's as good as over.
1ee23061696a6b0f.Speaker: Serval

5f9a6279810602c8.ContentText: Didn't you hear him? He said he needs to take care of a few matters in the city first. If we're fast enough, we can stay out of his way.
5f9a6279810602c8.Speaker: Serval

0d68fc7279168589.ContentText: Come on, let's go to the restricted zone. If we can get ahead of the curve and find the Stellaron, Cocolia will be out of options.
0d68fc7279168589.Speaker: Serval

ec293e48c8e3c4b2.ContentText: You care about her, huh. You must have become close friends.
ec293e48c8e3c4b2.Speaker: Serval

ce8525ce01e15bcb.ContentText: Close is... a bit much. But I made her a promise...
ce8525ce01e15bcb.Speaker: Seele

6e1cb04085b19afb.ContentText: Relax, she's the strongest girl I've ever seen.
6e1cb04085b19afb.Speaker: Serval

9a524880143a0cb8.ContentText: They've jacked up security alright... how the heck are we gonna sneak in? Serval, we need one of those brainwaves.
9a524880143a0cb8.Speaker: March 7th

9895e257ff66cc04.ContentText: Leave it to me. Stick close guys, and don't get spotted.
9895e257ff66cc04.Speaker: Serval

fc864ef9287a1182.ContentText: This is a military base. Trespassers aren't allowed in.

56f76d01573af5a5.ContentText: Wait, isn't that... Ah! Serval! Long time no see!

1def1c4fbf176b95.ContentText: Well, if it isn't Franz, long time no see! You're still watching the entrance?
1def1c4fbf176b95.Speaker: Serval

ac58b30861dfd5d4.ContentText: Well you see, I... Bah, you haven't changed Serval. Still nailing us to the wall...

0693c11090730e9f.ContentText: So... what brings you over here at this hour? And who are the guys behind you?

fbecdeab71e3350e.ContentText: My brother said the restricted zone energy lines were malfunctioning — told me it was urgent. He doesn't trust those contracted maintenance workers... so he got me in for free.
fbecdeab71e3350e.Speaker: Serval

7daa40a32e836017.ContentText: These guys are my assistants. We need to overhaul all the installations here.
7daa40a32e836017.Speaker: Serval

ad81df1a0c608d36.ContentText: Uh... I didn't hear anything about the energy lines malfunctioning...

12863c740fc4be73.ContentText: Oh please, this is a Technology Division issue. Why would they tell you guys? Come on, let us in already. If the heating system goes down in the middle of the night, are you gonna be responsible for all the frozen corpses?
12863c740fc4be73.Speaker: Serval

1dc60d22d8acd299.ContentText: N—No, that's uh, not something I could handle...

9c08b32b1c0cb518.ContentText: Seeing as you're Captain Gepard's sister, it should be fine...

ca3271320f2f6dd3.ContentText: Okay, here are some temporary passes... Oh, and remember to give them back to me when you leave.

90ff0a7c5352746a.ContentText: Thanks, Franz. I'll put in a good word for you with my brother and get him to promote you!
90ff0a7c5352746a.Speaker: Serval

48ab3f3a52bd23ca.ContentText: No, no, Captain Gepard hates all that under-the-table stuff. I'd have a better chance if you don't mention me at all...

54dbc45d756b51a6.ContentText: I haven't seen one of those for a long time. Hmm... The restricted zone virtually never allows outsiders in.

dd3a0930ffb24538.ContentText: Sorry, I'm on duty, no time to chat.

9fe89718eafb1d3f.ContentText: If there's an issue, report to the security captain.

d80c798e3eb6af07.ContentText: Aren't you the maintenance people? What are you doing over here?

2ecd0ba6f40a0ca0.ContentText: You can't just go wherever you please in the restricted zone! Get to work!

2b8667c4d6901d8e.ContentText: I heard that there's an arrest warrant out in the city for some major criminals — they even recalled some of the Guards.

b1d3b5ce40956fb1.ContentText: It never ends. Things are bad enough on the front line without things going south behind us...

2cb05bd681122930.ContentText: At least Captain Gepard's here, they say he captured the fugitives once already.

f821dbc34562d255.ContentText: ...Mechanical Fever released a new song. Did you hear it?

30870b3ed78e34d4.ContentText: Sure did, Pela was on lead vocals this time, scared me half to death. It's a completely different style.

c65bfdbc4f2f2b72.ContentText: Even Mechanical Fever is changing... *sigh* Rock 'n' roll's dead, there's no audience anymore.

d9fc992622689d4b.ContentText: Don't be so pessimistic. They're just keeping things fresh. I thought Pela was pretty good.

cd8fb6a9bac068a3.ContentText: Hmm-hmm... Did you hear Mallick is being reassigned? It seems like both the front line and the city are shorthanded right now.

e8e3496392853b8a.ContentText: Seriously? No way. I thought Mallick had only just been promoted?

0b1708c1cfa4e98c.ContentText: Mysterious. It feels like something big's about to go down.

6ef9676cfc5af98d.ContentText: As long as it's away from the front line, I'd happily be reassigned... It's only been a year since I enlisted — I'm not ready to lose my life.

79fb22b8f1415e5d.ContentText: Ahh, you make it sound terrible. Good luck "preserving" anything with those idlers in the reserve units. Our purpose as Silvermane Guards is to protect the citizens of Belobog.

e00bbe6e02c6b171.ContentText: I'm aware that there are those among you who see the reserve units as a vacation. Well let me set one thing straight: You are gravely mistaken!

5d2470649ba4884e.ContentText: This is the restricted zone. The Fragmentum before you conceals monsters that watch your every move. Behind us, we have a band of conspirators that have infiltrated the city...

dee1d25c5844b357.ContentText: The situation is critical... The lazy and undisciplined among you will lose your lives to the forces surrounding us!

ad520455623eb6ac.ContentText: As such, starting from today, we will be adding <unbreak>200</unbreak> bench presses and <unbreak>30</unbreak> extra minutes of one-arm planks to our daily drill! Is that clear?

adaf9c9456215407.ContentText: Do you see that mechanical gear bridge? When you cross over to the other side, you arrive at hell on earth.
adaf9c9456215407.Speaker: Serval

549d7a9dd20e667e.ContentText: An endless Fragmentum, a few exhausted Silvermane Guards... and the stench of death in the air.
549d7a9dd20e667e.Speaker: Serval

aed888a600a19f21.ContentText: Hm... It's a place too cold to bear, covered in snow and ice. The guys doing the scientific research don't have time to worry about the surroundings.
aed888a600a19f21.Speaker: Serval

04702ead0b74b1a0.ContentText: The restricted zone front line is on the other side of the gear bridge. It's an endless Fragmentum with a few exhausted Silvermane Guards... and the stench of death in the air.
04702ead0b74b1a0.Speaker: Serval

9e220c31ad4f8eeb.ContentText: They do. The Architects believe that hell can exist on any world — a plight that will inevitably come to be without intervention.
9e220c31ad4f8eeb.Speaker: Serval

f01c9a38b5100ca2.ContentText: In the future, a terrible catastrophe will arrive. If, under Qlipoth the Preservation's guidance, we fail to construct a barrier, that catastrophe will sweep away the stars, plunging all worlds into hell.
f01c9a38b5100ca2.Speaker: Serval

7d682ea86724350c.ContentText: That's the belief of the Architects... but for us, hell is an endless Fragmentum, a few exhausted Silvermane Guards... and the stench of death in the air.
7d682ea86724350c.Speaker: Serval

ec4c489f88c0a9dd.ContentText: If we want to progress further north, we will need to cross that hell. Are you ready?
ec4c489f88c0a9dd.Speaker: Serval

af31746f07710dd6.ContentText: Exactly, we've got nowhere left to retreat.
af31746f07710dd6.Speaker: March 7th

ff5ec85fce0acff4.ContentText: Look how far we've come! Don't chicken out on us now.
ff5ec85fce0acff4.Speaker: March 7th

92482a975a5c97da.ContentText: Haha, let's go then. First, we need to think of a way to get to the other side.
92482a975a5c97da.Speaker: Serval

3fe0dc90523fb423.ContentText: I helped set the underlying mechanisms for this type of gear bridge. It's controlled via different terminals in combination. Let's go find them.
3fe0dc90523fb423.Speaker: Serval

03b57cb1d1298737.ContentText: Nope... this terminal is offline, we can't control it from here.
03b57cb1d1298737.Speaker: Serval

1ea01e66a20b4024.ContentText: Look for another — every platform linked to the gear bridge should have a similar terminal.
1ea01e66a20b4024.Speaker: Serval

7e6f81a52d4d14e3.ContentText: ...Darn, can't activate it. It seems like someone's severed the energy supply to the terminals.
7e6f81a52d4d14e3.Speaker: Serval

bf5dd3bd451671cc.ContentText: I... huh. Y'know, the more I think about it, the more it seems deliberate.
bf5dd3bd451671cc.Speaker: Serval

2e41edb466b2e59d.ContentText: I was just thinking that, we can't rule it out.
2e41edb466b2e59d.Speaker: Serval

45ab21c6af1bc3f7.ContentText: I think the Guards must have done this intentionally.
45ab21c6af1bc3f7.Speaker: Serval

705933de28fc9b10.ContentText: With the front line on high alert, they must have rotated the bridge to make it impassable. Then they cut off the energy supply to the terminals to avoid accidental repositioning... or to prevent deserters from escaping.
705933de28fc9b10.Speaker: Serval

f2168dd5e59cb891.ContentText: That way, even if the front line were to collapse... the Fragmentum monsters wouldn't be able to make it to the other side.
f2168dd5e59cb891.Speaker: Serval

32d036331eb27767.ContentText: Bronya was right... The Silvermane Guards really are risking their lives to protect Belobog.
32d036331eb27767.Speaker: Seele

5c059f69d297f612.ContentText: Just my conjecture, but I doubt it's far from the truth. My brother mentioned that they've had to use extreme measures to repel the Fragmentum monsters.
5c059f69d297f612.Speaker: Serval

ddfa11618f677f5b.ContentText: Let's press on. We can't activate either of these terminals, so let's look for the energy supply installation itself.
ddfa11618f677f5b.Speaker: Serval

4feafd7740502e79.ContentText: That's it! The thing shaped like a giant iron ball.
4feafd7740502e79.Speaker: Serval

128978c279ef3720.ContentText: And it's behind a gate. What are the odds...
128978c279ef3720.Speaker: March 7th

ce2da37f83b010f8.ContentText: Its formal name is the "mechanism energy hub." It's connected to all the energy lines — I would've thought it covers the entire restricted zone.
ce2da37f83b010f8.Speaker: Serval

15c1829d47d73ffe.ContentText: Mm... no wonder it's so heavily guarded.
15c1829d47d73ffe.Speaker: Dan Heng

8500943a26a0335e.ContentText: One unit for everything? That's a disaster waiting to happen — we learned the hard way.
8500943a26a0335e.Speaker: Seele

8d7631676c15bfff.ContentText: As long as we can gain access permissions to the hub, we can operate the gear bridge terminals.
8d7631676c15bfff.Speaker: Serval

dfa6cf6e7403e816.ContentText: That's why I told them we were here for urgent maintenance! The front line equipment needs servicing just as much as the rest.
dfa6cf6e7403e816.Speaker: Serval

a06174acc8d71d5a.ContentText: So that's why you went for maintenance, way to go Serval! I thought you just came up with it on the spot.
a06174acc8d71d5a.Speaker: March 7th

8c835d55c1c32c85.ContentText: Come on, let's see if that guard over there will let us past.
8c835d55c1c32c85.Speaker: Serval

5c59825f33602daf.ContentText: Are you the emergency engineers? I saw you guys hanging around. Did you find the problem?

dcb0b146885ceeab.ContentText: Not yet, everything looks normal so far. I think the problem is stemming from the energy hub.
dcb0b146885ceeab.Speaker: Serval

32113f4d93009662.ContentText: If you let us in we can do a routine service inspection... I've worked on various iterations of this type of installation...
32113f4d93009662.Speaker: Serval

f1cf3479befb1ae8.ContentText: Haha, no, no, no, no... No can do! No one gets near the energy hub without the security captain's encryption key.

4dfa26a5c0ba39a3.ContentText: Uh, not even the supreme guardian?
4dfa26a5c0ba39a3.Speaker: March 7th

477a4e7040291f29.ContentText: The supreme guardian...? Hey, no games, y'hear? No dice without the encryption key!

f0ce2dbade93dbe1.ContentText: You need the encryption key, right? Which captain should I bother then?
f0ce2dbade93dbe1.Speaker: Serval

29a0904692d98752.ContentText: ...Captain Dunn's resting up ahead. Go and find him. If he grants you permission, I won't stand in your way.

42fed3c1e6821260.ContentText: Dunn... Dunn? Ha, why didn't you say so! No problem. We'll be back in a bit.
42fed3c1e6821260.Speaker: Serval

f296299dadb80c3d.ContentText: I heard Gepard sent mechanics for an emergency repair?

e89086d6cadbe356.ContentText: Yes, I confirmed it with Franz.

98910b957f52473a.ContentText: I've been keeping watch here all day, why didn't I hear about any equipment in need of emergency servicing?

58d4b4df972828b9.ContentText: I heard from Franz that it's Captain Gepard's sister...

34ad6fc77001c1b0.ContentText: ...You gotta be kidding me, I haven't showered in two days... do I smell?

5c7ec1649a267f55.ContentText: Hey, Dunn! It's been a while. I didn't know you made security captain.
5c7ec1649a267f55.Speaker: Serval

b9d0c9bf2f850831.ContentText: S—Serval, it's been a long time... you're still so... Ahem. You look good.

2ab8e35da3f2d872.ContentText: Allow me to introduce my assistants to you. They help me take care of business at the workshop.
2ab8e35da3f2d872.Speaker: Serval

b012555563a3d6bb.ContentText: Everyone, this is Captain Dunn, an old friend of mine. He used to be an ace on the keys in the band.
b012555563a3d6bb.Speaker: Serval

901164cf8303e1ae.ContentText: Oh? You play rock 'n' roll too? Cool!
901164cf8303e1ae.Speaker: March 7th

b540ddad821fe117.ContentText: Hmm? *cough* Zackery, how many days has it been since you showered?

e59a68aedf34e9eb.ContentText: Uh... I showered right before my shift—

3794f6b5e6f567a2.ContentText: ...I—I haven't showered in two days, sir!

5585b95a12b3ec95.ContentText: Unacceptable, especially in front of visitors! Apologies for the embarrassment, all.

9e29078e5c136288.ContentText: It's not a big deal, Dunn. Y'know, if you get a chance, would you wanna get on stage with us again?
9e29078e5c136288.Speaker: Serval

4bf8a18754259949.ContentText: My keyboard guy is pretty good, but I still miss our military days playing in the band...
4bf8a18754259949.Speaker: Serval

c4119d6fc0bb1853.ContentText: That was a long time ago, Serval — I haven't touched a keyboard in ages. Besides, I'm stationed here all year round, I'm afraid I don't get many chances to return to the city.

428a6b780448ce4a.ContentText: Though I don't stand on ceremony... How may I assist you? If everything's in order, you'd better head back to the city. It's not safe here.

dbb4737e87d953e6.ContentText: I've checked the lines, there don't seem to be any major problems. All that's left is the energy hub.
dbb4737e87d953e6.Speaker: Serval

5d71d57644797ecf.ContentText: The guard over there said that I needed an "encryption key" to open the gate. Can you help me out?
5d71d57644797ecf.Speaker: Serval

3c7dd8deb98697d0.ContentText: Could you be any less discreet!?
3c7dd8deb98697d0.Speaker: March 7th

b3f87d927b170467.ContentText: Sorry, Serval... but can you tell me what Captain Gepard told you?

fcf431a8380c14fd.ContentText: Huh? Oh, uh... Let me think... "Hey sis, the energy supply lines in the restricted zone have malfunctioned. Those useless engineers can't find the problem." Something like that...
fcf431a8380c14fd.Speaker: Serval

0628db998304c05e.ContentText: And may I ask... when did he contact you?

5a0b7537e899f08b.ContentText: Uh... this morning? Yeah, that's right. He's on urban patrol duty today, right? That's why he popped round and asked the favor.
5a0b7537e899f08b.Speaker: Serval

0ab90fab306a6100.ContentText: Captain Gepard just returned to the front line. I could... reconfirm with him?

00c383416459c4c2.ContentText: ...Hah? Hold up, he's back? That can't be, he was still in the city a little while ago...
00c383416459c4c2.Speaker: Serval

4fad6d2d5e45e8cb.ContentText: *sigh* You haven't changed Serval... You're still a lousy liar.

f6657b36da05bc02.ContentText: These people you've brought, they're... they're not workshop assistants, right?

55cf56d9e82746e2.ContentText: Serval, it's not that I don't want to help you... but you should remember that I'm a Belobog Silvermane Guard!

006ec8d2dd839f2b.ContentText: How about this. You can leave and I won't tell anyone about this incident... But the outsiders must remain.

ad2fe7509adc5f14.ContentText: I brought you guys here, and I'm standing with you till the end!
ad2fe7509adc5f14.Speaker: Serval

076af558c96f98df.ContentText: Dunn, this concerns the fate of Belobog — no — the fate of our whole world. Please don't stand in our way...
076af558c96f98df.Speaker: Serval

56f93aeb92a936b4.ContentText: Serval! We used to rehearse together every day. You must understand?

b04174e216e9dd05.ContentText: My rock 'n' roll soul is to uphold the dignity of a soldier!

0364e6fac92a9896.ContentText: Serval, these are dangerous individuals, the supreme guardian has sent out a warrant for their arrest! Don't let them fool you!

b1c013624841f376.ContentText: I know what I'm doing, Dunn! Step aside.
b1c013624841f376.Speaker: Serval

1e9e416b11ab0fd9.ContentText: I'm sorry Dunn... Time for a little nap.
1e9e416b11ab0fd9.Speaker: Serval

386670650bc1502e.ContentText: Stubborn fool... strong, though. Wildfire lacks people like him.
386670650bc1502e.Speaker: Seele

9ce0e773550af258.ContentText: Got it, the encryption key! Quick, before we attract attention, let's—
9ce0e773550af258.Speaker: Serval

ce6fa57a4b0f2013.ContentText: That's the enemy attack alarm... Every Silvermane Guard in the reserve zone just became our enemy.
ce6fa57a4b0f2013.Speaker: Serval

2b90446a66051bd2.ContentText: You're not dead yet. How can you give up that easily!?
2b90446a66051bd2.Speaker: March 7th

498373828bbb600a.ContentText: We've made it up till now... I could lose an arm and a leg for all I care — I have to lay eyes on the Stellaron.
498373828bbb600a.Speaker: Serval

bf0beb4b3cc6b896.ContentText: Quick, back to the energy supply hub. Anyone that tries to stop us is gonna find out a thing or two.
bf0beb4b3cc6b896.Speaker: Serval

11765b2a5bc366e2.ContentText: Ugh, who designed this operating system! It's so unintuitive!
11765b2a5bc366e2.Speaker: Serval

bc15cd23511fbf2b.ContentText: Emergency Fire Evacuation System... Not that...
bc15cd23511fbf2b.Speaker: Serval

12a03f3c064556b4.ContentText: Rock 'n' Roll Dance Floor Atmosphere Mode... Who the heck added that!? And they used one of my songs!
12a03f3c064556b4.Speaker: Serval

6be879328a85fd05.ContentText: Gear Bridge Control Terminal — ha, still found it!
6be879328a85fd05.Speaker: Serval

75f83b8f78c372be.ContentText: That's it, I've reset the energy system! Let's go and operate the gear bridge terminal.
75f83b8f78c372be.Speaker: Serval

e4d2e47442440650.ContentText: Careful! There's a big guy up ahead.
e4d2e47442440650.Speaker: Seele

b9efa349a61a2644.ContentText: There's no other way... We'll have to fight.
b9efa349a61a2644.Speaker: Serval

66903e6bfee423d1.ContentText: Hmph, if we can beat Svarog, we can beat this one. Let's go!
66903e6bfee423d1.Speaker: Seele

8f7771322c66a73b.ContentText: Energy restored... system online... certification enabled... come on, come on!
8f7771322c66a73b.Speaker: Serval

2b5dbd641ce869c9.ContentText: Phew! We did it! We've gained access to the gear bridge. Let's move.
2b5dbd641ce869c9.Speaker: Serval

7d8e236b24d63308.ContentText: Perfect! Okay, we need to get to the front line.
7d8e236b24d63308.Speaker: Serval

b140a2382ad8e622.ContentText: ...We could have a problem. Your brother may be there.
b140a2382ad8e622.Speaker: Dan Heng

3cd6f1530d3c4f4f.ContentText: He probably is... Hopefully, we don't bump into him, but if we do, we'll just have to try and talk to him...
3cd6f1530d3c4f4f.Speaker: Serval

5f4614312318686b.ContentText: Are you sure you can convince him?
5f4614312318686b.Speaker: Dan Heng

bb198f5b509c2466.ContentText: I've probably got a <unbreak>30%</unbreak> chance, or less.
bb198f5b509c2466.Speaker: Serval

abe078063df7b7db.ContentText: ...Meaning it could end in a fight.
abe078063df7b7db.Speaker: Dan Heng

9283b8fc348ecac0.ContentText: Haven't you noticed yet? Most of our "convincing" ends in a fight.
9283b8fc348ecac0.Speaker: March 7th

29ec060e81282e92.ContentText: We need to be sure, Serval. If we can't reach a common understanding with your brother... will you stand with us?
29ec060e81282e92.Speaker: Dan Heng

dc594d8500cee57d.ContentText: ...Of course. My word is my bond. I said that I'd stand with you to the end, and I won't go back on that promise.
dc594d8500cee57d.Speaker: Serval

b0a61fb3304e62b1.ContentText: When the sentry reported to me, I thought there must have been a misunderstanding. The enemy alarm had to be unrelated to your entry into the restricted zone — perhaps the intruders had taken you hostage. And yet...
b0a61fb3304e62b1.Speaker: Gepard

ed5d9b819aab8f6d.ContentText: Step away from the intruders, Serval. Walk over slowly and stand behind me. You're different from them.
ed5d9b819aab8f6d.Speaker: Gepard

7577ce0fa3212831.ContentText: I'm sorry... we have an understanding. I stand with them.
7577ce0fa3212831.Speaker: Serval

ef2a8006391bd60e.ContentText: Give me a few minutes, just a few. I'll explain every—
ef2a8006391bd60e.Speaker: Serval

bf6afd7aa7b84fea.ContentText: Have you forgotten where we are? We Landaus ought to know this place better than anywhere... The outer reaches of the front line against the Fragmentum, Belobog's most strategic protective fortress.
bf6afd7aa7b84fea.Speaker: Gepard

dd447ba455077aa1.ContentText: Every Silvermane Guard here, every person here, is ready to sacrifice themselves, ready to spill their blood for Belobog at a moment's notice...
dd447ba455077aa1.Speaker: Gepard

32dc21ab5fda8d20.ContentText: Yet here you are leading fugitives into the restricted zone, attacking my Silvermane comrades-in-arms, hijacking the energy hub... Are you really worthy of the Landau name?
32dc21ab5fda8d20.Speaker: Gepard

42bf13f7029ae16c.ContentText: Why do you think I've come here? We've found a way to dispel the Eternal Freeze, to seal the Fragmentum. It might be the only lifeline this world has left!
42bf13f7029ae16c.Speaker: Serval

dc1b8f92aa872f87.ContentText: If that were true, why wouldn't you report to Madam Cocolia? Why would you sneak into the restricted zone and create chaos!?
dc1b8f92aa872f87.Speaker: Gepard

ae3d2dee21542c3d.ContentText: You don't understand. The one preventing us from getting close to the truth... is Cocolia herself.
ae3d2dee21542c3d.Speaker: Serval

83096d9c267441fe.ContentText: ...You have all seen the supreme guardian in person. Do you think you can act as you please because she didn't recognize your version of events!?
83096d9c267441fe.Speaker: Gepard

54380fe5f2ee673a.ContentText: Listen to me, Gepard! The origin and spread of the Fragmentum is linked to the Stellaron. The meteorite in the Architects' records, it's—
54380fe5f2ee673a.Speaker: Serval

78f9ab3f3836cc45.ContentText: I know about the Stellaron. It's exactly what the fugitives behind you are seeking. But the Madam Guardian has already revealed the truth to me! These people have ulterior motives, Serval. They want to steal this treasure from the Architects.
78f9ab3f3836cc45.Speaker: Gepard

1fb17148b3f625f4.ContentText: The Madam Guardian has warned me before that you were indulging in fantasy, that you'd been exposed to forbidden knowledge, and that you would bring destruction down upon Belobog... I believe you, Serval, I believe you think you're acting with loyalty to the people! It's just...
1fb17148b3f625f4.Speaker: Gepard

b0640db868ef37ae.ContentText: Guards, formation! Arrest these people. We could be inundated with Fragmentum monsters at any moment, we have no time to waste on them!
b0640db868ef37ae.Speaker: Gepard

ad1341dc76d22e03.ContentText: The forbidden is only forbidden to conceal the truth within.
ad1341dc76d22e03.Speaker: Serval

52d803d4483ea3c8.ContentText: Cocolia's afraid that we'll seize on this knowledge — that the truth will spread far and wide: To save the world, we must risk it all.
52d803d4483ea3c8.Speaker: Serval

00a69dcd404f2689.ContentText: I've said my piece, whether you believe it or not is up to you. Regardless, you should know by now your sister's never been one to back down. If there's something or someone you can't abide, you should stand up and resist... and if there's something you uphold, you should uphold it to the very end!
00a69dcd404f2689.Speaker: Serval

32216fb0258f62b7.ContentText: Save your explanation for the judge. You are charged with sabotaging the Silvermane Guard Restricted Zone. In my capacity as captain, I hereby order that these fugitives be arrested!
32216fb0258f62b7.Speaker: Gepard

5cd081c79f71edd0.ContentText: This isn't like our childhood games, Serval. You won't get any leniency from me.
5cd081c79f71edd0.Speaker: Gepard

6f9f81e2eeb32467.ContentText: The Barrier hasn't been fixed yet. Don't try and be a hero, Gepard!
6f9f81e2eeb32467.Speaker: Serval

ca5614c9086eea0a.ContentText: ...Ugh, didn't I tell you? All our negotiations end in combat!
ca5614c9086eea0a.Speaker: March 7th

de8ddbbf5c120b51.ContentText: Come to your senses, Serval! Did you forget your Oath of Preservation?
de8ddbbf5c120b51.Speaker: Gepard

c1cfdfe9f6a0e05e.ContentText: So much for your memory. Did you forget the Architects expelled me ages ago?
c1cfdfe9f6a0e05e.Speaker: Serval

c0b41d95aec2735a.ContentText: Bringing you to Belobog... was a grave error.
c0b41d95aec2735a.Speaker: Gepard

6e4ccf8ea6a58fa3.ContentText: An error only I can rectify!
6e4ccf8ea6a58fa3.Speaker: Gepard

48b6804251948bda.ContentText: This guy... knows how to put up a fight. I've never come up against anyone this relentless!
48b6804251948bda.Speaker: Seele

506c32d27244a80d.ContentText: Phew... he just won't go down...
506c32d27244a80d.Speaker: March 7th

1f71edf22818f501.ContentText: He's as stubborn as I am. It could be an argument or a fight — he'll do both to the death... That's why he bugs the heck out of me!
1f71edf22818f501.Speaker: Serval

c66013fba4068100.ContentText: That's enough, Gepard. Take a look around you! You're the last man standing!
c66013fba4068100.Speaker: Serval

1ab83b9ddd26855d.ContentText: ...Even if I am, I won't yield...
1ab83b9ddd26855d.Speaker: Gepard

b06f6417eb5b2bf5.ContentText: We don't want you to yield through force of arms. That wouldn't be a victory for us.
b06f6417eb5b2bf5.Speaker: Dan Heng

e4ee18db538b5d7c.ContentText: Yeah, our goal is the same as yours, Serval's, and Bronya's — we just want to preserve this world! There's no reason to turn against each other!
e4ee18db538b5d7c.Speaker: March 7th

7fb8a1c034573853.ContentText: Gepard... brother. Surely now you can see the need for pragmatism?
7fb8a1c034573853.Speaker: Serval

fe316fc877e4ee4a.ContentText: Even if you don't believe my outsider friends, you should believe me... Ugh, maybe I've wasted your trust... in which case, believe Bronya.
fe316fc877e4ee4a.Speaker: Serval

84488dd1e1bc5f4d.ContentText: There's nothing more to say, Gepard. The decision is yours.
84488dd1e1bc5f4d.Speaker: Serval

b00145acb758d13a.ContentText: As a captain of the Silvermane Guards, I am duty-bound to carry out the orders of the Supreme Guardian.
b00145acb758d13a.Speaker: Gepard

0a0663b4e5be963d.ContentText: But... Lady Bronya is the commanding officer for the front lines. According to military protocol, if the front line directives of the commanding officer clash with those of the Architects behind the lines, a soldier must remain at their post and await further directives.
0a0663b4e5be963d.Speaker: Gepard

ccb117c4ba266b17.ContentText: For the Silvermane Guards, the guardian's orders are paramount and absolute. But there is something of equal importance in the oath we take...
ccb117c4ba266b17.Speaker: Gepard

4af3b5ccfd86400e.ContentText: If we lose the people, we lose the reason for our existence. Our fight with the Fragmentum monsters is for the sake of preservation, but our fight with you... I fail to see the purpose.
4af3b5ccfd86400e.Speaker: Gepard

d14103d6678b9231.ContentText: If you are truly able to prevent our endlessly unfolding misfortunes, then the people of Belobog are indebted to you.
d14103d6678b9231.Speaker: Gepard

4c1da9dea8084bb0.ContentText: But if you are using lies to mask your true intentions, using my sister and Bronya for your own ends... I swear by Qlipoth that I will carry out your punishment without an ounce of mercy.
4c1da9dea8084bb0.Speaker: Gepard

f64f323b4977a823.ContentText: They're not lying, I promise you.
f64f323b4977a823.Speaker: Seele

bd2387621154a5fb.ContentText: You must be Seele? You are a skilled fighter... your combat style is nothing like that of the Guards.
bd2387621154a5fb.Speaker: Gepard

33d684535e5c290c.ContentText: Regardless of what you believe, these guys have been a great help to the Underworld. Many people would vouch for them.
33d684535e5c290c.Speaker: Seele

a27a65adb32f735c.ContentText: If you want to advance further northward, you must traverse an area entirely corroded by the Fragmentum. It's the only way to get to the Snow Plains on the other side.
a27a65adb32f735c.Speaker: Gepard

0df87fa4d1e8beed.ContentText: The Guards can give you some time before the next wave of attacks is upon us.
0df87fa4d1e8beed.Speaker: Gepard

53738e8c278c685c.ContentText: Hmph, I don't want people to see me that way... I'm doing this for you. Otherwise, I wouldn't be using my brother's name.
53738e8c278c685c.Speaker: Serval

ac3b56471bca146b.ContentText: Is Gepard on front line duty a lot?
ac3b56471bca146b.Speaker: March 7th

2e648ec94b0c1250.ContentText: Yes, but what made you ask that all of a sudden?
2e648ec94b0c1250.Speaker: Serval

fe35e44e238a9222.ContentText: It's so dangerous, don't you worry about him?
fe35e44e238a9222.Speaker: March 7th

bcf1d2bb6f1c24a1.ContentText: I never would've guessed that Gepard and you were brother and sister.
bcf1d2bb6f1c24a1.Speaker: March 7th

a094585e5eda69b5.ContentText: I can't say I blame you — we're nothing alike in personality or interests.
a094585e5eda69b5.Speaker: Serval

d0d6cfac3569f79a.ContentText: In our family we have a strong military tradition going back generations — many a Landau has died in their prime. There's not a lot of "brother and sister time." Everyone just does their best to get on with their life.
d0d6cfac3569f79a.Speaker: Serval

fa6592b4f73b2f5d.ContentText: Serval, this Dunn, do you know him?
fa6592b4f73b2f5d.Speaker: March 7th

da8a876cdd5755c4.ContentText: You bet I do. We go way back. He's easy to talk to. Watch me persuade him.
da8a876cdd5755c4.Speaker: Serval

ba23d25cc8617b37.ContentText: If I'd known he had the encryption key from the start, I could've snuck in and taken it off him myself.
ba23d25cc8617b37.Speaker: Seele

6cdb4d4434d8907f.ContentText: Shoulda, coulda, woulda, Seele! Activating the gear bridge alone would've been enough to expose us.
6cdb4d4434d8907f.Speaker: Serval

ad83b66222d2f11b.ContentText: It's open! Oh, thank you, thank you, thank you, Dunn!
ad83b66222d2f11b.Speaker: March 7th

3f2926e3821e9627.ContentText: Um, Serval... won't more Silvermane Guards be waiting for us on the other side of the gear bridge?
3f2926e3821e9627.Speaker: March 7th

3be3dd4162e94fd5.ContentText: Well, either we reason with them or charge straight through the blockade... Let's play it by ear!
3be3dd4162e94fd5.Speaker: Serval

4f4246c0c7c2aa13.ContentText: Before our next expedition, I need Himeko to teach me some negotiation skills. Beating people up all the time is cramping my elegance!
4f4246c0c7c2aa13.Speaker: March 7th

6d75338ddf3270ac.ContentText: I haven't fought with Gepard since he enlisted. He could never beat me when we were little, but now...
6d75338ddf3270ac.Speaker: Serval

bc19f19eb59ad91f.ContentText: You see? Brothers and sisters need to have a scrap once in a while to get back on good terms.
bc19f19eb59ad91f.Speaker: Serval

63080fa8318857b6.ContentText: Agh, enough apologizing. My ears can't take any more.
63080fa8318857b6.Speaker: Serval

e9831b1735787972.ContentText: Honestly, this would have happened sooner or later. You just gave me an excuse to bring everything forward.
e9831b1735787972.Speaker: Serval

6edc8d0ef52977bb.ContentText: What's wrong with a bit of violent coexistence between siblings? Seems pretty normal to me.
6edc8d0ef52977bb.Speaker: Serval

9954bf266edcf6c4.ContentText: Hehe, I'm pulling your leg. Since I left the military, my brother and I have always steered clear of certain sensitive topics... Thinking about it, perhaps he's just been looking out for my feelings, shielding me all along.
9954bf266edcf6c4.Speaker: Serval

1b48f91e2bac2055.ContentText: Knowing my temper, my brother almost certainly went to great lengths on many occasions for me. I should be thanking him.
1b48f91e2bac2055.Speaker: Serval

9a7eab38195ef4e6.ContentText: Let's do this. I may never have come face to face with it, but this Stellaron cost me a nice, stable job. It's time to get even.
9a7eab38195ef4e6.Speaker: Serval

1c3c0d2fd5ff1fcf.ContentText: Actually, I have another selfish motive... I want to prove to Cocolia that I was right. Once we've taken care of the Stellaron... maybe she'll go back to how she was.
1c3c0d2fd5ff1fcf.Speaker: Serval

5cf33f47ed990388.ContentText: ...Sorry, hardly the time for me to be obsessing over all this.
5cf33f47ed990388.Speaker: Serval

0ac2d940e5ab3a49.ContentText: As I mentioned, if we want to progress further north, we're gonna have to cross that "hell." Still, look at it this way: just another arena to showcase our skills, right?
0ac2d940e5ab3a49.Speaker: Serval

61b94b599b2bf0fa.ContentText: Now, if you're ready to get on stage, let's push for that standing ovation!
61b94b599b2bf0fa.Speaker: Serval

a2ba9e4a7ff89ddd.ContentText: I gotta admit, I had a lot of... misunderstandings... about the Silvermane Guards. They're fighting for survival here every day, just like Wildfire.
a2ba9e4a7ff89ddd.Speaker: Seele

817ae020cfc5dcc6.ContentText: The difference is we're making a stand for freedom... while they're just carrying out orders.
817ae020cfc5dcc6.Speaker: Seele

069e42188f4930af.ContentText: Put ourselves in their shoes... Easier said than done. Everyone has their struggles, but how can we understand them if we can't even see each other?
069e42188f4930af.Speaker: Seele

755ffe2e3d7da7ed.ContentText: Of course I do, I've understood them for a while now. But as far as I can tell, she doesn't need other people's understanding. She needs to understand her own heart.
755ffe2e3d7da7ed.Speaker: Seele

09e1e4371ec45c5c.ContentText: ...It's the same with Gepard. I could tell it took a lot for him to lay down his arms.
09e1e4371ec45c5c.Speaker: Seele

c8f4921f06fcb273.ContentText: I think I can already hear the storm on the other side of the city walls... Not a reassuring sound.
c8f4921f06fcb273.Speaker: Seele

476d60274a8a686a.ContentText: I hope Serval's right... That supreme lunatic better not have harmed Bronya.
476d60274a8a686a.Speaker: Seele

dc6183ffb638c96b.ContentText: {RUBY_B#Stellaron Hunter}Elio{RUBY_E#} always tells the exact future. So what's with the explosion just now? Was that also part of his script?
dc6183ffb638c96b.Speaker: Kafka

a32563555fb1398b.ContentText: Uh-huh — "<unbreak>23</unbreak>:<unbreak>44</unbreak>:<unbreak>59</unbreak> system time: The pulses from the explosion cause a massive breakdown from the master control system."
a32563555fb1398b.Speaker: Silver Wolf

49dd715edb710dc2.ContentText: No, the Antimatter Legion did it. They completely invaded the space station two system hours ago.
49dd715edb710dc2.Speaker: Silver Wolf

88cd300eecba2b45.ContentText: *whistle* Alright, so do we need to fight the Legion?
88cd300eecba2b45.Speaker: Kafka

67b82f8888c258d9.ContentText: I dunno. Elio didn't say anything about it, so it doesn't matter.
67b82f8888c258d9.Speaker: Silver Wolf

df57a227a1dfc2d6.ContentText: Got it. So from now on, I'll be in charge of this operation.
df57a227a1dfc2d6.Speaker: Kafka

e5fad590cc223b58.ContentText: Copy. Can you let me have some fun this time? Our last few operations turned out to be pretty dull.
e5fad590cc223b58.Speaker: Silver Wolf

8d27042099f199bf.ContentText: ...Sorry, I'm afraid there's not much I can do for you — our task this time is just to "place" the target properly.
8d27042099f199bf.Speaker: Kafka

ca787638aea8c1b8.ContentText: But if you wanna go look for some fun yourself, I won't stop you. I mean, after all...
ca787638aea8c1b8.Speaker: Kafka

4f9bd0306e2c0839.ContentText: So the owner of this space station is Herta, No. <unbreak>83</unbreak> of the Genius Society, right? Is her security system easy to crack?
4f9bd0306e2c0839.Speaker: Kafka

fada017fbf593c76.ContentText: Not really. But the Legion's invasion paralyzed the master control system for a few minutes, which was a big help.
fada017fbf593c76.Speaker: Silver Wolf

cf3e824a5c3baeea.ContentText: I guess this space station is about to meet its doom now that it's become a target of the Aeon of {RUBY_B#Nanook}Destruction{RUBY_E#}.
cf3e824a5c3baeea.Speaker: Kafka

18b37fa96ca8670d.ContentText: ...No, it isn't. There's a sequel to this mission... You didn't read the script?
18b37fa96ca8670d.Speaker: Silver Wolf

149286e434e180e0.ContentText: ...You know me, I hate being told what to do. Elio knows this too, so he normally just tells me what's off-limits.
149286e434e180e0.Speaker: Kafka

6396e6c350fae99c.ContentText: *sigh* Yeah, yeah. Where did you send it, Silver Wolf?
6396e6c350fae99c.Speaker: Kafka

95128fa4cb3ce249.ContentText: Some random coordinates, not important. You care about where that Voidranger ended up?
95128fa4cb3ce249.Speaker: Silver Wolf

260e94ab3c14b5b3.ContentText: Of course not~ I'm just amazed at this fancy technique of yours, as usual.
260e94ab3c14b5b3.Speaker: Kafka

73d2d17b1b0a2172.ContentText: Just a little trick of tampering with the data of reality, I wouldn't call it fancy.
73d2d17b1b0a2172.Speaker: Silver Wolf

a12162b37cbf42aa.ContentText: What were you looking at so intently just now? Let me see.
a12162b37cbf42aa.Speaker: Kafka

f92c4372dabb1fbb.ContentText: Herta's toys, a catalog featuring the space station's collection of rare items. They've got a lot of interesting gadgets.
f92c4372dabb1fbb.Speaker: Silver Wolf

23a4758a546e9ec4.ContentText: There's this gun, it can rate any creature within its crosshair as a score from 0 to <unbreak>100</unbreak>.
23a4758a546e9ec4.Speaker: Silver Wolf

a598af82113dc855.ContentText: Aren't you curious about how much you would score? I kinda wanna know mine.
a598af82113dc855.Speaker: Silver Wolf

5fa3cad364cf0eac.ContentText: Fine, I guess we can swing by and play with it if it's not too far. What's our destination?
5fa3cad364cf0eac.Speaker: Kafka

86fc71ddc6ecbace.ContentText: Go down the corridor behind the door on the left. There's a room where some kind of rare item is stored.
86fc71ddc6ecbace.Speaker: Silver Wolf

ce87e4ca866b837d.ContentText: So that's where the {RUBY_B#Cancer of All Worlds}Stellaron{RUBY_E#} is?
ce87e4ca866b837d.Speaker: Kafka

08b9d3d5838ce5d7.ContentText: That's where we can find out where the Stellaron is.
08b9d3d5838ce5d7.Speaker: Silver Wolf

7482c6c25805be7a.ContentText: Is the receptacle ready for use?
7482c6c25805be7a.Speaker: Kafka

af5ff4075d703c77.ContentText: Of course. You just need to make the decision.
af5ff4075d703c77.Speaker: Silver Wolf

c9f7f8b8d9065c43.ContentText: Elio said this decision will bring about lots of changes...
c9f7f8b8d9065c43.Speaker: Kafka

2a3c920f9dece86e.ContentText: He also said it must be you who makes it.
2a3c920f9dece86e.Speaker: Silver Wolf

5bcb601693f13111.ContentText: You can still change your mind before we find the Stellaron.
5bcb601693f13111.Speaker: Silver Wolf

da0e061ed7511390.ContentText: The central area of the space station is up ahead. There will be lots of Legion Voidrangers there.
da0e061ed7511390.Speaker: Silver Wolf

e82453e5dba18d63.ContentText: Just a reminder — this is a stealth mission, Kafka.
e82453e5dba18d63.Speaker: Silver Wolf

0f7636e29e34e04e.ContentText: No one will know we were here if they are all dead.
0f7636e29e34e04e.Speaker: Kafka

ac1e3a8f2bb6c444.ContentText: Someone, or something, is up ahead.
ac1e3a8f2bb6c444.Speaker: Kafka

97f6bff515075e1d.ContentText: Looks like we're the ones getting ambushed.
97f6bff515075e1d.Speaker: Silver Wolf

2e127486e885edd5.ContentText: But they're the ones getting besieged.
2e127486e885edd5.Speaker: Kafka

a003589c996e8e93.ContentText: Not a single soul here. Impressive evacuation work. Did Herta organize it herself?
a003589c996e8e93.Speaker: Kafka

2912a5fdf36aea4c.ContentText: According to the access history, she hasn't logged in here for over six months. The evacuation was directed by the acting lead researcher — a girl named Asta.
2912a5fdf36aea4c.Speaker: Silver Wolf

1b1726a4da1ace8a.ContentText: Doesn't ring a bell. Oh, right, Elio said we wouldn't run into Herta. It seems she really isn't here.
1b1726a4da1ace8a.Speaker: Kafka

f87463c32174c8ef.ContentText: Elio's script doesn't include any info about the location of the Stellaron, which means in the future he foresees...
f87463c32174c8ef.Speaker: Silver Wolf

35af2ab7253741fc.ContentText: ...We would find the Stellaron in a non-physical way?
35af2ab7253741fc.Speaker: Kafka

76b701cb64d49d06.ContentText: This space station is packed with extraordinary objects, I wouldn't be surprised if there's one that can make it happen.
76b701cb64d49d06.Speaker: Silver Wolf

8fea38bf53ca7aa7.ContentText: Hiding something extraordinary with something extraordinary... this is pretty Herta. I assume you know what to do? I mean, you've read that catalog for quite a while.
8fea38bf53ca7aa7.Speaker: Kafka

3014e63c525af980.ContentText: I've got all the clues we need. The only piece missing is a simple trick.
3014e63c525af980.Speaker: Silver Wolf

8926c032d66d6d81.ContentText: Help me investigate the terminal in this room, our item might be inside.
8926c032d66d6d81.Speaker: Silver Wolf

e344cad8063aaf40.ContentText: I can see the whole space station on the surveillance screen... but not the Stellaron.
e344cad8063aaf40.Speaker: Kafka

d95454239d079ce7.ContentText: Even if you could, it'd be a trap. Herta doesn't display her collections.
d95454239d079ce7.Speaker: Silver Wolf

2b9f285a36f95f0b.ContentText: Huh? I can't see the memory storage for this terminal...
2b9f285a36f95f0b.Speaker: Kafka

7f19461b6e74633c.ContentText: This is the monitoring room, they must have deleted the records and made a run for it. Classic.
7f19461b6e74633c.Speaker: Silver Wolf

edfd60129010d7cd.ContentText: *sigh* Make your way over here then, there's no point in trying to search like this.
edfd60129010d7cd.Speaker: Silver Wolf

d2573663b2b93342.ContentText: So, got a master plan? I'm all ears.
d2573663b2b93342.Speaker: Kafka

67e64209263966ca.ContentText: It's a matter of hacking the surveillance system directly.
67e64209263966ca.Speaker: Silver Wolf

478beeb1c722e13e.ContentText: Aha, I see. Herta's collections aren't in the system, so anything unaffected should be our target.
478beeb1c722e13e.Speaker: Kafka

e96d7400e2abb0d3.ContentText: Simple, crude, but effective. Look, found it.
e96d7400e2abb0d3.Speaker: Silver Wolf

bb43b5f9ef88f818.ContentText: Item number <unbreak>211</unbreak>, "Blind Spot": A simple light-deflecting field. It allows an object in its field to pass unnoticed, but if a different item ceases to be obvious, the object gets revealed.
bb43b5f9ef88f818.Speaker: Silver Wolf

f3f7a2c0fda45160.ContentText: So Herta hides her collection with something as simple as this?
f3f7a2c0fda45160.Speaker: Kafka

3d010ff1ac291599.ContentText: The simplest method is the hardest to spot, isn't that our motto?
3d010ff1ac291599.Speaker: Silver Wolf

b5ad73c8027a11c9.ContentText: The data suggests it's just an ordinary hologram. But it has an added layer...
b5ad73c8027a11c9.Speaker: Silver Wolf

80867e904582132a.ContentText: Let's take a look. Don't worry, this place won't be our grave.
80867e904582132a.Speaker: Kafka

5084e3764086e1df.ContentText: Your fake ID info is ready, just go to the console like you own it.
5084e3764086e1df.Speaker: Silver Wolf

984855d7c1932b68.ContentText: Interesting, she's a member of the Genius Society alright.
984855d7c1932b68.Speaker: Kafka

cce1d80e75ae1375.ContentText: The Stellaron is up ahead, let's hurry.
cce1d80e75ae1375.Speaker: Silver Wolf

465e7a050b7b1612.ContentText: It has its own security system... I guess even for Herta, a Stellaron is no ordinary rarity.
465e7a050b7b1612.Speaker: Silver Wolf

c852ebfcc84a9f5b.ContentText: Of course, even the genius Herta can't compete with me when it comes to hacking.
c852ebfcc84a9f5b.Speaker: Silver Wolf

7daf41c57674ea46.ContentText: Good, then I'll also count on you with the preparation of the receptacle.
7daf41c57674ea46.Speaker: Kafka

d142d5b63ff241a4.ContentText: A space station, but that's not important.
d142d5b63ff241a4.Speaker: Kafka

679f382ebbaf8ae9.ContentText: Maybe you're not as important as you think.
679f382ebbaf8ae9.Speaker: Silver Wolf

62c4a010a5933151.ContentText: <color=#dbc291ff>Listen</color>: You are in a daze right now. You don't know who you are, why you're here, or what you're going to do next. You think I look familiar, but you're not sure if you should trust me—
62c4a010a5933151.Speaker: Kafka

e1074618e8f313d0.ContentText: ...None of that matters. All you need to know is that I'm leaving, and you will be left all alone on this space station. From now on, you needn't think about your past or doubt yourself.
e1074618e8f313d0.Speaker: Kafka

6edf820337db660a.ContentText: <color=#dbc291ff>Listen</color>: In the near future, you will encounter all kinds of perils and hardships, but you will also have many wonderful experiences. You'll meet companions who treat you like family, and embark on surreal adventures with them...
6edf820337db660a.Speaker: Kafka

f3cbb3faf72f2613.ContentText: "At the end of your journey, all that perplexes you and troubles you will resolve."
f3cbb3faf72f2613.Speaker: Kafka

8977861582f7d97c.ContentText: This is your future that Elio has foreseen. Do you like it?
8977861582f7d97c.Speaker: Kafka

35e3f224b97a811e.ContentText: <color=#dbc291ff>Listen</color>: Remember what you're feeling in this moment. As long as you know in your heart where you're heading, you are guaranteed to see the ending of your story.
35e3f224b97a811e.Speaker: Kafka

370d263663fb46c0.ContentText: This is also a lovely answer.
370d263663fb46c0.Speaker: Kafka

901f002ce80dbac1.ContentText: <color=#dbc291ff>Listen</color>: Elio can foresee the future, but he can't make decisions for you.
901f002ce80dbac1.Speaker: Kafka

261f91c21079cac2.ContentText: Use that will of yours to reach the end of your story. That's the you I like.
261f91c21079cac2.Speaker: Kafka

7f6783b894b9f68b.ContentText: The next stop, to pave the way for the future that is written.
7f6783b894b9f68b.Speaker: Kafka

20bf679023989c7b.ContentText: It's like weaving brocade — you and I can only add one gold thread each time, but eventually, we will make a gorgeous pattern.
20bf679023989c7b.Speaker: Kafka

f75b0a25ef634486.ContentText: How long do you think you need? According to the script, the {RUBY_B#Trailblazers}Astral Express crew{RUBY_E#} is arriving soon. We should avoid being seen by them.
f75b0a25ef634486.Speaker: Silver Wolf

9ecbf59866cac632.ContentText: I know, Silver Wolf. Just give me another minute.
9ecbf59866cac632.Speaker: Kafka

d091d39f5cfe6d15.ContentText: I must leave now. <color=#dbc291ff>Listen</color>: someone will come and find you very soon, just go with them. You won't remember a thing except me.
d091d39f5cfe6d15.Speaker: Kafka

4b3899a79d4dcd84.ContentText: When you have a chance to make a choice, make one that you know you won't regret...
4b3899a79d4dcd84.Speaker: Kafka

08ab144ab0d0e142.ContentText: Weren't their coordinates sent out from the space station...?
08ab144ab0d0e142.Speaker: Dan Heng

b58f650670a97896.ContentText: Who cares? They're here and alive. Do they look like a mannequin to you?
b58f650670a97896.Speaker: March 7th

61f3064135110d0b.ContentText: ...Weak heartbeat and pulse... March, you better do CPR.
61f3064135110d0b.Speaker: Dan Heng

635ec6ff68bb507f.ContentText: Huh!? Hehe... I—I've never done it before! Dan Heng, you do it!
635ec6ff68bb507f.Speaker: March 7th

77febf98c47fd0a1.ContentText: Are you all right? Can you hear me? Do you remember your name?
77febf98c47fd0a1.Speaker: March 7th

1dc3b19095ec97fe.ContentText: Aw, this isn't good... Can you try harder? I'm sure you can at least remember your name...
1dc3b19095ec97fe.Speaker: March 7th

a09403285ce03a73.ContentText: {NICKNAME}? Nice to meet you. My name's Dan Heng, and this is March 7th.
a09403285ce03a73.Speaker: Dan Heng

99eac4aa4f12979c.ContentText: This space station was just attacked by the Antimatter Legion. We came to help with the rescue at the request of Lead Researcher Asta.
99eac4aa4f12979c.Speaker: Dan Heng

76d5d38719ff8587.ContentText: Goons owned by the Destruction. You're lucky that the most dangerous {RUBY_B#Emanator of Destruction}Lord Ravager{RUBY_E#} among them isn't around, just some nasty minions.
76d5d38719ff8587.Speaker: March 7th

1c99c57eeb6a99dc.ContentText: We'll take those invaders out soon, don't worry.
1c99c57eeb6a99dc.Speaker: March 7th

8817df760a23e56d.ContentText: Uh-huh, a petite cutie with pink hair. Madam Herta appointed her to be the acting lead researcher.
8817df760a23e56d.Speaker: March 7th

5a25416f1730a5ea.ContentText: ...That girl really needs to step up. I can't believe her own employee doesn't even know her name...
5a25416f1730a5ea.Speaker: March 7th

08cedea170af0c2d.ContentText: Back to the master control zone. Asta and the other researchers have gathered there.
08cedea170af0c2d.Speaker: Dan Heng

dbac7366d3a2eff3.ContentText: Plus that's where we parked the Astral Express! Don't you worry, we'll protect you from the monsters and clear up this mess.
dbac7366d3a2eff3.Speaker: March 7th

555f355d699db8b8.ContentText: Dan Heng and I are members of the Astral Express crew~
555f355d699db8b8.Speaker: March 7th

9e7ab0bbfc77bebe.ContentText: Well the Express has some dealings with Madam Herta, so we come to visit the space station from time to time.
9e7ab0bbfc77bebe.Speaker: Dan Heng

da828f552920ff39.ContentText: We just so happened to arrive during this... invasion. Of course, as a — ahem — crew of heroes, we're happy to lend a hand.
da828f552920ff39.Speaker: March 7th

46d07795f2619197.ContentText: Yeah, you've never seen it? The Express comes here every once in a while.
46d07795f2619197.Speaker: March 7th

f425d2b27da5d147.ContentText: It's a unique train that can travel between the stars with the power of the Trailblaze Aeon.
f425d2b27da5d147.Speaker: Dan Heng

c513159e35c1668e.ContentText: I'll show you once we're back to the master control zone~
c513159e35c1668e.Speaker: March 7th

4ae664cb32f92ee0.ContentText: You and March go back together.
4ae664cb32f92ee0.Speaker: Dan Heng

f8b5bec42b0af861.ContentText: Arlan from the Security Department lost contact in the vicinity. I need to find him first.
f8b5bec42b0af861.Speaker: Dan Heng

4b6063a79fc6b8b1.ContentText: Oh, all right. You stay safe.
4b6063a79fc6b8b1.Speaker: March 7th

82fbd7747377be83.ContentText: The Legion are rampaging through the space station like a pack of wolves — this trip won't be a walk in the park. It's better if you have something to protect yourself.
82fbd7747377be83.Speaker: March 7th

2a20a57def93f7ba.ContentText: Just a suggestion though — you're safe as long as you stick with me~!
2a20a57def93f7ba.Speaker: March 7th

8425c3861df9bcbd.ContentText: This place is full of fancy little gadgets — Herta's collection. I really don't get why she'd go out of her way to collect them and then leave them here to gather dust...
8425c3861df9bcbd.Speaker: March 7th

664b055c70a871a6.ContentText: Ah, it's the Antimatter Legion! So these crazy jerks made it all the way here... Watch this!
664b055c70a871a6.Speaker: March 7th

c24fe0ff7be88586.ContentText: You're stronger than you look... Seem to be quite the fighter.
c24fe0ff7be88586.Speaker: March 7th

440d42f73888b16f.ContentText: So we'll take that elevator on the central platform to go down to the master control zone. Do you know the way?
440d42f73888b16f.Speaker: March 7th

d981f511c421eaa8.ContentText: Um, I notice that you're not wearing the space station staff uniform. Do you really work here?
d981f511c421eaa8.Speaker: March 7th

115350de98005712.ContentText: ...Memory loss, huh. You must've been injured.
115350de98005712.Speaker: March 7th

9347c2d654cfe05b.ContentText: ...Never mind. I won't ask if you don't wanna talk about it.
9347c2d654cfe05b.Speaker: March 7th

15e374f04565dde4.ContentText: Let's go, I'll take you to the safe zone~
15e374f04565dde4.Speaker: March 7th

75d57143b500d0ee.ContentText: Nah, I think the elevator's broken. I pressed all the buttons but nothing happened.
75d57143b500d0ee.Speaker: March 7th

faf8d33b748424f7.ContentText: —But it wasn't me! The Antimatter Legion must've broken it!
faf8d33b748424f7.Speaker: March 7th

41d10eca872b8d85.ContentText: Too bad Dan Heng's not here. He's like a walking encyclopedia... He knows a ton of complicated stuff — maybe even elevator repair...
41d10eca872b8d85.Speaker: March 7th

e888d4d402eae734.ContentText: Whoa! Why are you here!? ...And how did you get here before us?
e888d4d402eae734.Speaker: March 7th

e498424fd4d40b2b.ContentText: I took another route to the upper level, and I saw you guys from up there.
e498424fd4d40b2b.Speaker: Dan Heng

53e03290a09cb5c9.ContentText: Arlan is in the control room. He's been injured, but not fatally.
53e03290a09cb5c9.Speaker: Dan Heng

91fe62bb4dc54fab.ContentText: You found him! Will he know what to do about this elevator?
91fe62bb4dc54fab.Speaker: March 7th

a6109897a88a7f08.ContentText: I suppose as the head of the Security Department, he should know.
a6109897a88a7f08.Speaker: Dan Heng

e75ef0c25868f762.ContentText: Then let's go talk to him!
e75ef0c25868f762.Speaker: March 7th

0538aeec05b88f79.ContentText: Yep, we're from the Astral Express~
0538aeec05b88f79.Speaker: March 7th

ebc7058959788d27.ContentText: Oh... Did Madam Herta send you to help?
ebc7058959788d27.Speaker: Arlan

6559667f90f09b4f.ContentText: It's just a coincidence. We came to deliver the rare relic Herta trusted us to find... We didn't expect to arrive during an invasion.
6559667f90f09b4f.Speaker: Dan Heng

837b54f4491871f8.ContentText: Why is the Antimatter Legion targeting you guys? It seems they just ignored the surface of the planet and came straight to the space station.
837b54f4491871f8.Speaker: March 7th

3df863906167fc1e.ContentText: I... have no idea. The Legion came at a very suspicious time — almost right after the security system suddenly failed.
3df863906167fc1e.Speaker: Arlan

fd0a1178499e9f0d.ContentText: Lady... Lead Researcher Asta immediately began to organize the evacuation. I was supposed to cover everyone as they evacuated, but... I didn't expect to end up failing in this task.
fd0a1178499e9f0d.Speaker: Arlan

e39c0487d4507066.ContentText: Don't be too hard on yourself. Your leg and dominant hand were injured. It was a wise decision to hide here and avoid a head-on encounter with the Legion.
e39c0487d4507066.Speaker: Dan Heng

42c3e2dc317e20ff.ContentText: Yeah! Most of the staff have been evacuated safely, so right now our highest priority is to return to the master control zone and plan a counterattack! So... do you know how to use the elevator? I couldn't start it...
42c3e2dc317e20ff.Speaker: March 7th

918bf7812ae5547c.ContentText: After the evacuation was complete, the elevators were all shut down to keep the Legion away from the master control zone.
918bf7812ae5547c.Speaker: Arlan

fbe025669f1ca113.ContentText: Since Lady Asta sent you to look for me, I assume she must've given you the encryption key for accessing the elevator system?
fbe025669f1ca113.Speaker: Arlan

94f480e3396c4916.ContentText: Oh, right, she did give me some sort of card...
94f480e3396c4916.Speaker: March 7th

b634ff0ce9a050ad.ContentText: But where did I put it...
b634ff0ce9a050ad.Speaker: March 7th

4c0ec15765b890d9.ContentText: ...Now that we found the key, we should get going. We can use that console over there to unlock the elevator.
4c0ec15765b890d9.Speaker: Arlan

ca51675fa9187358.ContentText: Hold on. I only activated the elevator on the highest floor. We'll have to go there to use it.
ca51675fa9187358.Speaker: Arlan

58eb22c495008802.ContentText: Because I mustn't give the Legion any chance to reach the master control zone by the elevator. I must ensure the safety of the station's staff.
58eb22c495008802.Speaker: Arlan

b23314bb1940b4cb.ContentText: So I'll have to trouble you to take a bit of a detour... Apologies.
b23314bb1940b4cb.Speaker: Arlan

08bd86d3ce664c54.ContentText: Sorry... This space station was entrusted to Lady Asta by Madam Herta. I must do this for the safety of the master control zone and the staff there.
08bd86d3ce664c54.Speaker: Arlan

b35c40ccc3c16c25.ContentText: So I'll have to trouble you to take a bit of a detour... Sincerest apologies.
b35c40ccc3c16c25.Speaker: Arlan

0923b8f73a2816b4.ContentText: Huh? You're not coming with us?
0923b8f73a2816b4.Speaker: March 7th

09e6b2e578e703b6.ContentText: My leg is injured... I'd only slow you down. I'll stay here and shut down the elevator once you've made it to the master control zone.
09e6b2e578e703b6.Speaker: Arlan

32a07466f069f4f2.ContentText: You won't slow us down. And you should be able to shut down the elevators from the master control zone, right?
32a07466f069f4f2.Speaker: Dan Heng

c5b06c9d91d5dcc9.ContentText: Agreed. {NICKNAME} and I made it here safely, and now we've also got Dan Heng. We're more than enough to protect you~
c5b06c9d91d5dcc9.Speaker: March 7th

07f9d4e58fa626e2.ContentText: Let us worry about the Antimatter Legion. You just follow us and keep yourself alive~
07f9d4e58fa626e2.Speaker: March 7th

f86d86f688932b98.ContentText: The Sorting and Analysis Room has been sealed off. We can't go this way.
f86d86f688932b98.Speaker: Arlan

c8b162d3036eb771.ContentText: Do you know why the Antimatter Legion would invade the station, Arlan?
c8b162d3036eb771.Speaker: Dan Heng

7a2ae0ee45334919.ContentText: They must've come for Madam Herta's collection... But as to why, I still...
7a2ae0ee45334919.Speaker: Arlan

b5177859e7537b94.ContentText: The repulsion bridge has been shut down?
b5177859e7537b94.Speaker: Dan Heng

269744fd7bb5e453.ContentText: Yes. To stall the enemy, more or less.
269744fd7bb5e453.Speaker: Arlan

a41639178055a178.ContentText: Is that it? We've reached the elevator already? That wasn't too many monsters~
a41639178055a178.Speaker: March 7th

25d3930f3cf5bef9.ContentText: Oof, probably shouldn't have said that... Might bring bad luck.
25d3930f3cf5bef9.Speaker: March 7th

46f408db46ce99f0.ContentText: I heard there's something called a Stellaron in Madam Herta's collection.
46f408db46ce99f0.Speaker: Dan Heng

a5101305bf439a4a.ContentText: ...That's not the kind of information someone in my position would have access to.
a5101305bf439a4a.Speaker: Arlan

67ebc938ff410b9c.ContentText: Hey, these shiny things... Are these Light Cones? I thought only the Interastral Peace Corporation had rare stuff like this.
67ebc938ff410b9c.Speaker: March 7th

a4c8787ca1820ed8.ContentText: No, Light Cones are Garden of Recollection technology. They allow you to carry memories around — very potent enhancement items. I heard the IPC paid a lot for the usage rights, but I've no idea how Herta managed to get hold of one.
a4c8787ca1820ed8.Speaker: Dan Heng

cd3d652f55993af3.ContentText: They were acquired legitimately, that's all I can say. Take them, they're very useful in combat.
cd3d652f55993af3.Speaker: Arlan

ab52860c12c07a58.ContentText: March, Dan Heng, you've been through a lot.
ab52860c12c07a58.Speaker: Himeko

000059bbb362688e.ContentText: Whew, Himeko~ What took you so long! That last wave of Antimatter Legion came at us like a swarm of locusts, have you ever tried shooting locusts with a bow?
000059bbb362688e.Speaker: March 7th

15dc93f1872520df.ContentText: I wouldn't have made a difference. My orbital cannon can deal with a whole bunch of enemies at once, but I couldn't just blow up the space station with it — Herta would NOT like that...
15dc93f1872520df.Speaker: Himeko

c031b1fb05f77b76.ContentText: Are you alright, Arlan? Asta's been worried about you.
c031b1fb05f77b76.Speaker: Himeko

04cf973c5c0628b1.ContentText: I'm fine, a quick patching up will do. Thanks for asking. I'll report the situation to Lead Researcher Asta immediately. Bye.
04cf973c5c0628b1.Speaker: Arlan

69a73fe250d1e3e5.ContentText: Hey, nice to meet you. I'm Himeko, navigator of the Astral Express.
69a73fe250d1e3e5.Speaker: Himeko

864da7c51d67bab1.ContentText: In other words, she's in charge of where the Express goes.
864da7c51d67bab1.Speaker: March 7th

bba185e95891e714.ContentText: March hasn't been any trouble for you along the way, has she?
bba185e95891e714.Speaker: Himeko
