7d9def57dee51fec.ContentText: {NICKNAME}, think carefully about how you wanna reply to that.
7d9def57dee51fec.Speaker: March 7th

bde91b91f118c083.ContentText: ...That's just my charm! And I didn't cause any trouble. You just have to get used to me... Look, Dan Heng agrees, right?
bde91b91f118c083.Speaker: March 7th

aeaebdf3a35b3162.ContentText: I have the right to remain silent.
aeaebdf3a35b3162.Speaker: Dan Heng

74b96bbc7770b7c2.ContentText: Well, that's the joy of youth! We should take every step forward full of energy! {M#He's}{F#She's} a discerning one, isn't {M#he}{F#she}, Dan Heng?
74b96bbc7770b7c2.Speaker: March 7th

0920dbfbd21dc785.ContentText: I have the right to remain silent.
0920dbfbd21dc785.Speaker: Dan Heng

bf1307a39b9abebd.ContentText: ...Oh, looks like we have two Dan Hengs on our team now.
bf1307a39b9abebd.Speaker: March 7th

afd8a2054ddd2134.ContentText: Please leave me out of this.
afd8a2054ddd2134.Speaker: Dan Heng

687d13d0a64f788b.ContentText: Haha, look at you all, you've already gotten really close.
687d13d0a64f788b.Speaker: Himeko

0f3521da220f4cc2.ContentText: Come on, Asta has been worried about all of you.
0f3521da220f4cc2.Speaker: Himeko

599cca9fe27a865c.ContentText: Projectile radar tracking, normal. Telemetry signal frequency unusually high! Maintain at normal levels!
599cca9fe27a865c.Speaker: Asta

18af7887cab2dc73.ContentText: Our measurements predict that the Legion is about to unleash over ten waves of continuous attacks. Everyone, brace yourselves!
18af7887cab2dc73.Speaker: Asta

972846900e40926a.ContentText: Whew, I'm glad you're all back safe. Arlan just told me about the situation at the storage zone — and about his injury... thank you, for all your help.
972846900e40926a.Speaker: Asta

b501c4b9bb8fbd21.ContentText: In times of disaster, I realize more and more that the space station's researchers are its most valuable assets... Alas, we were ill-prepared for such emergencies... we should have built up our security and combat departments.
b501c4b9bb8fbd21.Speaker: Asta

0a996ac0c662cfa0.ContentText: On the other hand, the entire crew of the Astral Express seems to be extraordinarily skilled.
0a996ac0c662cfa0.Speaker: Asta

0a13b00d7c705aff.ContentText: What is the current situation on the space station?
0a13b00d7c705aff.Speaker: Dan Heng

b3d8d8a8110f7207.ContentText: The situation is under control for now. The damage to our security system was minor. The intruder only managed to alter a small amount of data, so it was easy to fix.
b3d8d8a8110f7207.Speaker: Asta

5ac6b6b18cfc847e.ContentText: The real problem lies with the researchers... They trust Madam Herta wholeheartedly and never thought that the space station would be breached by the Legion. A broken spirit is far worse than a broken body.
5ac6b6b18cfc847e.Speaker: Asta

79349044f9a33cc1.ContentText: Let's go speak with the researchers. Right now, the space station can't afford any more unexpected turns, especially from within. Have you tried contacting Herta?
79349044f9a33cc1.Speaker: Himeko

50b6f4549ebf0ec5.ContentText: I sent multiple letters, all met with silence. You know her, Himeko, the space station is but a mere warehouse for followers and rare items. She doesn't really care about it.
50b6f4549ebf0ec5.Speaker: Asta

2022b64e7590c8c0.ContentText: I knew it... No matter. I'll also send a letter to Herta and tell her that we've brought the rare item she seeks. At least that might get her attention.
2022b64e7590c8c0.Speaker: Himeko

f76eba5e1a7e6874.ContentText: That would be of great help.
f76eba5e1a7e6874.Speaker: Asta

882156cdcf777a2e.ContentText: I'll leave the reassurance of the researchers in your hands.
882156cdcf777a2e.Speaker: Asta

09deb8c58c17a537.ContentText: If you have any other questions, you are welcome to come to Himeko and me.
09deb8c58c17a537.Speaker: Asta

48665a43a44668cc.ContentText: Hello, you must be... {NICKNAME}, right? How can I help you?
48665a43a44668cc.Speaker: Asta

b64b24d4c29a4dd1.ContentText: This is Herta Space Station. As you might tell from its name, it belongs to the distinguished Madam Herta herself.
b64b24d4c29a4dd1.Speaker: Asta

987166ab154ab5da.ContentText: Herta Space Station was originally built as a warehouse for rare items and relics, but Madam Herta also allowed her followers to oversee tasks and conduct research. It then gradually turned into a scientific research base.
987166ab154ab5da.Speaker: Asta

460a18a40d2dd223.ContentText: The storage zone you passed through contains all our inventory, and is the main research center.
460a18a40d2dd223.Speaker: Asta

83916abc2212530c.ContentText: The master control zone where we are now is the control center of the whole space station.
83916abc2212530c.Speaker: Asta

f27584b343aec7dd.ContentText: It is said that the space station also contains Madam Herta's private chamber where her most precious, rare, and dangerous collections are sealed... And for someone like her, it's not out of the realm of possibility.
f27584b343aec7dd.Speaker: Asta

d135c689937c06c6.ContentText: Even from me, the lead researcher, there are many things she keeps secret.
d135c689937c06c6.Speaker: Asta

5659288152ff5aaf.ContentText: I'm lead researcher of Herta Space Station. But honestly... I'm more like Madam Herta's "housekeeper" of this place.
5659288152ff5aaf.Speaker: Asta

cf058c57a950561f.ContentText: Madam Herta is a genius, but managing disparate staff, tactfully representing the space station before the Intelligentsia Guild... these are all things beyond her abilities. But as it turns out they are my forte.
cf058c57a950561f.Speaker: Asta

75f3aa61253dd4b6.ContentText: Hehe, scholars are a lot easier to deal with than those vociferous old geezers back at home.
75f3aa61253dd4b6.Speaker: Asta

e637d869f18a1a19.ContentText: No matter how much they drone on about "Astronomy is just about looking at things, it doesn't bring any real value," they all fall silent in front of Madam Herta.
e637d869f18a1a19.Speaker: Asta

647a7e7234e9fc98.ContentText: No matter the problem, you just needed to say that it was Madam Herta's wishes and all would be fine. After all, Herta herself is a symbol of wisdom.
647a7e7234e9fc98.Speaker: Asta

1e400c36c59785cb.ContentText: Hey, thanks to her, I can count the stars to sleep. Otherwise, I would've had to take over the family fortune. Just thinking about it terrifies me.
1e400c36c59785cb.Speaker: Asta

c4f81a4041575902.ContentText: Arlan went to dress his wounds at the rest area. He knows himself well... but if he insists on pushing his limits, I'll give him a good earful.
c4f81a4041575902.Speaker: Asta

1f69384870183d25.ContentText: I'm very upset he didn't obey my orders and insisted on searching the storage zone even though everyone had already evacuated.
1f69384870183d25.Speaker: Asta

74ca7e4f7abd1d54.ContentText: I know he didn't want to leave any researchers behind... The Security Department is more than just a job to him.
74ca7e4f7abd1d54.Speaker: Asta

828b1c9be268a167.ContentText: But Arlan doesn't care about getting hurt, he only cares about protecting others. It's the only way he feels... fulfilled.
828b1c9be268a167.Speaker: Asta

d4bb7aa2ea565d5e.ContentText: And it's not that I don't understand where he's coming from. I just want him to look out for himself, too!
d4bb7aa2ea565d5e.Speaker: Asta

65c39e8d3bf420c8.ContentText: Herta... she's a member of the Genius Society. One of the proud favorites of the Aeon of Erudition. Ever since the birth of {RUBY_B#Aeon of Erudition}Nous{RUBY_E#}, there have only been <unbreak>84</unbreak> people admitted into the Genius Society.
65c39e8d3bf420c8.Speaker: Asta

139238863404a389.ContentText: That is why Madam Herta is extremely... headstrong... She only pursues what interests her and as soon as that interest is lost, she abandons it and moves on. The space station was one such abandoned interest...
139238863404a389.Speaker: Asta

a34e0a7d67b85e26.ContentText: Anyway, I lent out one of her manuscripts as a resource reference not long ago. It should still be in the master control zone. You can take a look if you wish.
a34e0a7d67b85e26.Speaker: Asta

250b6c752458890f.ContentText: Huh, chatting with you seems to have lightened my mood. It seems like talking can really raise one's spirits.
250b6c752458890f.Speaker: Asta

6730dd6f340f4702.ContentText: What's the matter, {NICKNAME}? You seem to have something on your mind.
6730dd6f340f4702.Speaker: Himeko

06d5e42f485c75c3.ContentText: Basically speaking, it's a train that travels through space. But more specifically, the Astral Express was a creation of the Aeon, Akivili the Trailblazer.
06d5e42f485c75c3.Speaker: Himeko

9c81b649d425282c.ContentText: As for what the Trailblaze, the Aeons, and Akivili are all about, let's talk about it when things have calmed down a little. I don't wanna overwhelm you now, do I?
9c81b649d425282c.Speaker: Himeko

0b65d040f5c19cfd.ContentText: Light Cones were created by the Garden of Recollection. These followers of the Aeon of {RUBY_B#Fuli}Remembrance{RUBY_E#} refined memory fragments to create Light Cones, which preserve memories.
0b65d040f5c19cfd.Speaker: Himeko

4c5422590d8af9ce.ContentText: But you've already realized it, haven't you? Since Light Cones can preserve memories, they can also preserve experiences and abilities. That's why Light Cones are extremely precious rare items under level-2 restriction by the {RUBY_B#Galactic Monopoly}Interastral Peace Corporation{RUBY_E#}.
4c5422590d8af9ce.Speaker: Himeko

ce118450ca2b24d7.ContentText: As far as I know, only the IPC possesses Light Cone technology authorized by the Garden of Recollection. I couldn't say what deal Herta made with the Garden, but knowing her, it was likely off the books...
ce118450ca2b24d7.Speaker: Himeko

4d7e166ab80d0570.ContentText: You should cherish every Light Cone. They are all precious memories of their original owners.
4d7e166ab80d0570.Speaker: Himeko

cf3b706274ad22f1.ContentText: Who exactly you are escapes me, but you seem familiar to me.
cf3b706274ad22f1.Speaker: Himeko

392a81f661a86072.ContentText: I have a couple of hunches, but I can't prove any at this point. So, they'll be my little secrets for now.
392a81f661a86072.Speaker: Himeko

be83f3ee21595ebb.ContentText: Are you concerned about your past? You seem like someone who prefers to look forward rather than back... Or maybe I'm just describing myself.
be83f3ee21595ebb.Speaker: Himeko

39da53995ccc126b.ContentText: Come to me anytime if you have more questions.
39da53995ccc126b.Speaker: Himeko

7e824932f200d68e.ContentText: ...If only I'd caught the Antimatter Legion sooner...
7e824932f200d68e.Speaker: Arlan

003fab2aaea10197.ContentText: I'm fine, this pain is nothing, really. I'm used to it. In fact, I should be proud of it. It's a reminder of being able to protect everyone.
003fab2aaea10197.Speaker: Arlan

d216dd23bb7fe1ec.ContentText: Ahem, but don't tell Lead Researcher Asta what I just said.
d216dd23bb7fe1ec.Speaker: Arlan

3d94f71ada392cbd.ContentText: There were a few researchers who didn't make it...
3d94f71ada392cbd.Speaker: Arlan

e38fd912abd367ba.ContentText: The rest are fine, mostly minor injuries. But I'm worried about their mental states.
e38fd912abd367ba.Speaker: Arlan

3c6b0b092fb72e83.ContentText: Most of them came to the space station because they admired Madam Herta. But now they can't reach her or even their own families. I just hope they can all survive this crisis.
3c6b0b092fb72e83.Speaker: Arlan

e22fcd010123a448.ContentText: My first impression was that she was the daughter of a rich family — owners of a big company.
e22fcd010123a448.Speaker: Arlan

8ffe66f9f9342709.ContentText: She was kind to me though. When she went to the space station, I followed her.
8ffe66f9f9342709.Speaker: Arlan

fef74b0fa79824e7.ContentText: I don't know much about science, but I'm glad to be able to protect people in pursuit of their research.
fef74b0fa79824e7.Speaker: Arlan

5127a916af85e0de.ContentText: Thank you, I appreciate it. I wouldn't be able to hold Peppy properly if these wounds kept bleeding.
5127a916af85e0de.Speaker: Arlan

aec9b71ee0fdf581.ContentText: Oh, Peppy's a fluffy little puppy, like a white snowball. He's family.
aec9b71ee0fdf581.Speaker: Arlan

55b7dd285ceb8180.ContentText: Luckily, he'd already hidden in his little sleeping pod when the disaster struck.
55b7dd285ceb8180.Speaker: Arlan

0f106aeced3c38d3.ContentText: Y'know, I'll introduce you when you have the time. You're gonna love him.
0f106aeced3c38d3.Speaker: Arlan

13a056fe9aa15fcd.ContentText: I hope all this chaos will end soon.
13a056fe9aa15fcd.Speaker: Arlan

c9691da839f39de6.ContentText: I need to leave, I need to run from this forsaken...

39ad4bb1063fe349.ContentText: No, it's impossible. I can run from yesterday, I can run from today, but tomorrow will always be one step ahead of me...

8bddb1b80e2dac88.ContentText: Look, the obstacle detection terminal has recorded <unbreak>142,856</unbreak> attacks... the next count will be <unbreak>142,857</unbreak>!

9dc6ff7f15be20bb.ContentText: I know in my heart that when I see that hopelessly beautiful cyclic number... it will mean the poetic end of my life's cycle.

186d8d87560d2272.ContentText: Everyone keeps saying that. "Things will get better, things won't always be this bad."

4a336b8e4c40c955.ContentText: Negative... positive... A negative of a negative is a positive.

c83f31968f719fc4.ContentText: Why not do the right thing and let me hear the truth!?

ad548fe1be8fe6d7.ContentText: Life is but a path to death, but not today... How insightful. Yes, of course! The closer you approach death, the more you appreciate life.

2b972dea01efbbce.ContentText: I will pull myself together. Thank you, that was kind of you.

bbe24da935ca5af8.ContentText: How insightful, yes of course. The closer you approach death, the more you appreciate life.

3d9fa7a0f26a7879.ContentText: I will pull myself together. Thank you, that was kind of you.

cd5b7998261e3216.ContentText: Life is but a path to death, but not today... Thank you, kind stranger.

0b9aa120ae04ed15.ContentText: Push the stick down, Alfred... Sorry, sorry, I got the wrong person.

d9d4c319b7d14632.ContentText: Thanks, kid. We're doing some pre-checks for the satellite remote sensing. I'll hold down the button to monitor the signal, and you push the control stick according to my instructions.

5bc83511749f1c7b.ContentText: But first let's talk about the controls. "Up" is the spectrometer, "Down" is the filter, "Left" is the reference level, and "Right" is the attenuator.

4d45e74a6ff38448.ContentText: Our pre-checks have three steps. Turning on the spectrometer, then the attenuator, and finally outputting the signal to the filter.

fb14814368040709.ContentText: It's quite a bit to remember... You got everything?

8ad0533a9bb7c1a6.ContentText: Don't worry, I'll go over it again.

0c8db5325857ec8f.ContentText: The controls are "Up" for the spectrometer, "Down" for the filter, "Left" for the reference level, and "Right" for the attenuator.

3d2cf76d2a4fc1ec.ContentText: The pre-checks have three steps. Turning on the spectrometer, then the attenuator, and finally outputting the signal to the filter.

a8ab116449090cbd.ContentText: Are you ready? Three, two, one...

05c254f3f996e94b.ContentText: Wrong order, kid. Let me demonstrate.

ac7a62fd7556bc82.ContentText: Push the control stick up to activate the spectrometer, then right for the attenuator, and finally down for the filter.

06eb8105a417a0a5.ContentText: Wrong order, kid. Let me demonstrate.

5c4cc70caebc80d4.ContentText: Push the control stick up to activate the spectrometer, then right for the attenuator, and finally down for the filter.

5d75f31e593d3836.ContentText: That was very helpful of you, kid. Alfred was the researcher in charge of this — he was in the storage zone earlier... He didn't make it back.

cdba212725897d99.ContentText: Abraham was close to him. I don't know how to tell him about it...

4bfcc72f68e96018.ContentText: The top priority is to preserve the space station and concentrate on the work at hand.

f00d7859d1f399fe.ContentText: Looks like that's all the researchers who need help. Let's go check in with Asta.
f00d7859d1f399fe.Speaker: playerboy

817438ef27df7d3a.ContentText: All injured researchers, please stay where you are. Medical staff will be arriving immediately... Here's an emergency notice.

847ddc8e8db1a461.ContentText: Would {M#Mr.}{F#Ms.} {NICKNAME}, Ms. March 7th, and Mr. Dan Heng please proceed immediately to the master control station. Lead Researcher Asta is waiting for you.

e497d2c0447fe6e4.ContentText: Why did those monsters have to breach the ionizing grid on my watch...

61fc20a653e9e95b.ContentText: It can't be my fault, I'd never make a mistake like this... I'm going out there to check the data again!

e007aeae971a6012.ContentText: Injured? I don't care, see anyone else that cares? Who are you anyway, get out of my way.

01486cd8474ed4e9.ContentText: Dangerous? Of course it's dangerous, I just came back from the front line, I know that better than you.

a83652e1c33bf3a8.ContentText: Hero? Don't overthink it. I'm not doing this for others, I'm doing it for myself.

12c1a0c737a2ba6f.ContentText: The space station shield's first line of defense is the anti-gravity ionizing grid. I'm the researcher in charge of it. Do you expect me to just sit here after something like this?

91043ecf7b028e86.ContentText: I agree. But when the investigation's over, the blame will fall entirely on my shoulders.

b243fcf92b354f9d.ContentText: That may be the case, but it's better than just hiding here doing nothing.

435fe3020998dbcc.ContentText: Hmph... it's easy for you to say! This didn't happen on your watch, you wouldn't understand!

e70a1eecf60ac1b6.ContentText: Besides, that bunch of troublemakers is still out there... I know you mean well, but I've made up my mind.

39e578763dd9f23b.ContentText: We researchers have all taken refuge here, but has anyone given any thought to the non-human life on this space station?

645daa8db78d7144.ContentText: They may be part of the rare item collection, but are they not also living things? Don't their rights deserve to be protected!?

e651e485745c9ad5.ContentText: Yes. Non. Human. Life. Living creatures that aren't human...

6587969f620f6f66.ContentText: ...Some of which have been collected as rare items and housed in the space station. Most of the researchers disregard their basic rights.

e744f8971eaf9a4f.ContentText: Even now, with death staring them in the face, they still refuse to open their minds.

27fc2aaf36497e08.ContentText: And I, Lukacs, outstanding researcher of the Herta Department of Galactic Geopolitics, must awaken those pretending to sleep!

d5cbc4a82e5bb4c9.ContentText: At the space station, we've always collected rare items — countless articles from across the galaxy. But not everyone knows that among these articles are also living things.

2cc236c0e3dc6b7a.ContentText: And I, Lukacs, outstanding researcher of the Herta Department of Galactic Geopolitics, must emphasize in this time of crisis that their lives and rights should also be respected!

823768b764dd0943.ContentText: Exactly! And I, Lukacs, outstanding researcher of the Herta Department of Galactic Geopolitics, shall continue fighting and speaking up for the rights of all non-human life in these terrible times!

1fe5d553b4947331.ContentText: If you are interested in joining the cause, please stand by my side and repeat after me!

9ac27b5bf5112cb0.ContentText: Protect rare item rights! Save non-human life!

1b55e942072f4c17.ContentText: All together! Protect rare item rights...!

9998874a4a8f210e.ContentText: You did well, friend! Follow my rhythm, and say it loud, with conviction!

fea6172a0461b23a.ContentText: Protect rare item rights! Save non-human life!

58ab353232c7773d.ContentText: Perfect, my friend. Now let us work together and invite more supporters to join us!

5781492088457903.ContentText: Open your benighted eyes and look at the delicate life around you!

97d4d00ed36e0872.ContentText: That's right... that's right. "The resentful spirit's senseless obsession turns into a tangible hand, and the shadow of the old disaster will conceal the heavens!"

c99aae15c9a1af55.ContentText: That's exactly what was written on the Mystic Scroll of Aeons. It refers to the followers of Nanook the Destruction using antimatter to create a galactic weapon of war.

47a6741e0cd285c4.ContentText: I didn't think I'd be fortunate enough to witness... hehehehe...

ca8dc22773f4aecf.ContentText: Oh, have you also come to witness the power and miracle of the Aeons? Then go over there, there's a good spot right there.

48d0602fb75483e6.ContentText: Beware of any interferences from your mortal body when observing... you must seize every detail. When an Aeon appears, even the tiniest trace must not be missed. Hehehe...

5ca7700e2e1de1c1.ContentText: You see that, Sheila? History always repeats itself.

e6315b1da6ad0980.ContentText: History? Gunn, this is the first time I have witnessed the space station in such disarray.

026c6205ff8aa81e.ContentText: Oh Sheila, when we face another dire crisis like this, if you're able to rescue your home planet... Will you come back and save us?

8f70c904f159ace7.ContentText: Home planet? My home planet? ...I do not understand what you are saying.

b03b03fef79b3927.ContentText: Never mind. If Sheila could hear this, she'd understand.

bd647f2de91f5877.ContentText: Emily, calm down and think about what <color=#dbc291ff>she</color> would do in such a disaster. Ten cups of coffee? A pill? Or maybe hide in a room full of Mystic Scrolls of Aeons?

f628df0c6750a963.ContentText: Oh <color=#dbc291ff>sis</color>, where are you? I'm so scared...

05f674aefb32080e.ContentText: Lesley! Sir, I need to go. I need to go find Lesley.

5e3844be7cb98fbd.ContentText: Stupid boy, is your head not screwed on right? You're leaving over my dead body.

043326b64e53caba.ContentText: I'll knock some sense into you yet... Hey, where do you think you're go— Argh...

dd7f112d74f07aac.ContentText: *crying* What should we do!? They said there are monsters in the storage zone. And the gift I prepared for <color=#dbc291ff>Master Capote</color> is still in the analysis room of the Department of Implement Arts...

1c0aa88c27de26a3.ContentText: You know, there's loads of monsters attacking the space station this time, and some of them aren't even on the station's records—

47d33f12e927c843.ContentText: *crying* You're so annoying, stop saying that! *crying*

5991faa43cc2a78c.ContentText: Hey, how old are you? Don't be a baby!

c876149b5e5f1c5d.ContentText: Please stop crying. *gasp* How about I pretend to be a monster for you, huh?

7f38fd90aaf66ed0.ContentText: Darn it! I can't believe I actually bought that Asta girl's nonsense about how the station is on a hiring spree!

00f6578867968c51.ContentText: No one's even watching the blockade, and now my old butt is blocked here too.

d2cc89817473b8ae.ContentText: Darn the kids these days. They only know how to rattle my old bones...

3ee5650fd136cce5.ContentText: The supply zone's defense shield won't hold much longer. You all need to hurry...
3ee5650fd136cce5.Speaker: Asta

e4734707a27435c2.ContentText: I'll be here, you've got to fend them off...
e4734707a27435c2.Speaker: Asta

373df6a959607c6d.ContentText: Are you thinking of going back? Let me remind you, that's the Doomsday Beast, the Legion's planet destroyer.
373df6a959607c6d.Speaker: Dan Heng

fb62b32d10bf6446.ContentText: The space station is Herta's creation. As long as a {RUBY_B#Emanator of Destruction}Lord Ravager{RUBY_E#} doesn't intervene, there should be no problems.
fb62b32d10bf6446.Speaker: Himeko

ae1578c306b0fa53.ContentText: B—But we can't just run away like this, right...
ae1578c306b0fa53.Speaker: March 7th

094b58a2666d3cea.ContentText: The Doomsday Beast can rip off the defense shield like tearing paper — and Herta's not here. The station's defenses are too weak to stand against the Antimatter Legion.
094b58a2666d3cea.Speaker: Dan Heng

8ad28a9a22df86f3.ContentText: Either way, the Legion has the blessing of the Aeon, {RUBY_B#The Destruction}Nanook{RUBY_E#}. They came prepared and everyone here is not.
8ad28a9a22df86f3.Speaker: Dan Heng

f76c18f731b3c3af.ContentText: That's why we have to leave and take {NICKNAME} with us.
f76c18f731b3c3af.Speaker: Himeko

3b4743a8ec5abe60.ContentText: {M#He's}{F#She's} the one who can help us turn the tides... Of course, I may be wrong.
3b4743a8ec5abe60.Speaker: Himeko

cce9c8c3e5292efe.ContentText: ...As you say so. Alright, what should we do next?
cce9c8c3e5292efe.Speaker: Dan Heng

d0ea8115970be535.ContentText: This is the supply zone where the maintenance crew works. There's a path here that leads to the nearest railway platform. Let's head over there and meet up with Welt.
d0ea8115970be535.Speaker: Himeko

43c14add9279acbc.ContentText: Mr. Yang? Mr. Yang's here too? Didn't he stay on the Express?
43c14add9279acbc.Speaker: March 7th

25fbeaba693c1c87.ContentText: The Astral Express tracks our coordinates in real time... And with such a huge change in the space station's movements, there's no way Mr. Yang wouldn't have noticed.
25fbeaba693c1c87.Speaker: Dan Heng

4dcd230c2fbc11d2.ContentText: Hmm, I can almost guarantee that your Mr. Yang is already on his way.
4dcd230c2fbc11d2.Speaker: Himeko

cfc09503ec89e71b.ContentText: Right now, we might be able to handle things if it's just the Doomsday Beast. But, if the Destruction's Emanator were to appear...
cfc09503ec89e71b.Speaker: Himeko

5ebab780833d8dd0.ContentText: Let's hurry up and get out of here. I'll explain later.
5ebab780833d8dd0.Speaker: Himeko

e07811783fddab51.ContentText: Head to the nearest platform. Getting to the Express is our top priority.
e07811783fddab51.Speaker: Himeko

b2a564d4b416214d.ContentText: The exit's over there... how do we get to it?
b2a564d4b416214d.Speaker: March 7th

d728058f6b10f910.ContentText: {NICKNAME}, use the control device to switch the repulsion bridge.
d728058f6b10f910.Speaker: Dan Heng

f02cb6ecc8faa25e.ContentText: Could it be the Express? It looks like it'll get to the platform before us.
f02cb6ecc8faa25e.Speaker: March 7th

f4bceafe76604300.ContentText: It has to be nearby! Let me go take a peek with my sharp eyes.
f4bceafe76604300.Speaker: March 7th

83683ba84282f11b.ContentText: You're awake. I had March and Dan Heng stay by the Express to keep an eye on things.
83683ba84282f11b.Speaker: Himeko

029dedc23035c5a4.ContentText: It's almost time. She should be arriving any moment now.
029dedc23035c5a4.Speaker: Himeko

36511edb68f81d2e.ContentText: I've only been gone, what? A few months? And the space station is already in this state?
36511edb68f81d2e.Speaker: Herta

af0a59d166b86e46.ContentText: This is the true master of the space station — Genius Society number <unbreak>83</unbreak>, Herta.
af0a59d166b86e46.Speaker: Himeko

647aece25c1af0d1.ContentText: At least give me a proper introduction! Genius Society number <unbreak>83</unbreak>... Of all my outstanding achievements, that's what you want to mention?
647aece25c1af0d1.Speaker: Herta

e2bd92ea9f7ad350.ContentText: Yeah, up to speed yet? That place you all turned upside down? That's my property.
e2bd92ea9f7ad350.Speaker: Herta

f439e0b1a6ae7523.ContentText: What you're seeing here is one of my puppets. I'm using her to talk to you.
f439e0b1a6ae7523.Speaker: Herta

46a12eb8aecb58da.ContentText: Alright, laugh it up. That old Zandar came up with the name. You think I like it?
46a12eb8aecb58da.Speaker: Herta

a0a54cc0dd2f6add.ContentText: So this little twerp has the Stellaron now? Huh.
a0a54cc0dd2f6add.Speaker: Herta

31c132c9bb92f60c.ContentText: Hmm, I'll have to take a good look.
31c132c9bb92f60c.Speaker: Herta

0488f08eec7ffdaf.ContentText: Hmm, truly amazing! I built a whole space station just to contain this unactivated Stellaron and keep The Blue from disaster...
0488f08eec7ffdaf.Speaker: Herta

7f658e972cfca9c6.ContentText: Yet someone was able to achieve that with this little twerp's body. How did they do it?
7f658e972cfca9c6.Speaker: Herta

0b4e2d76de745daf.ContentText: Moreover, the Stellaron is still very stable in {NICKNAME}'s body.
0b4e2d76de745daf.Speaker: Himeko

38c373081a830640.ContentText: You're right. This little one's body truly is strange...
38c373081a830640.Speaker: Herta

91d54cfe9e957a41.ContentText: Hah! Compared to me, you are. How old are you even?
91d54cfe9e957a41.Speaker: Herta

ae1882c81c6dcae4.ContentText: Don't judge a book by its cover, Herta. Case in point, that puppet body of yours is actually much smaller than {NICKNAME}.
ae1882c81c6dcae4.Speaker: Himeko

379a3ef67002409e.ContentText: That's... beside the point. Hey is this one the same kind as that March 7th? If that were true...
379a3ef67002409e.Speaker: Herta

d1f0f274ba5e1987.ContentText: Alright, {NICKNAME}. I got it. But I'm still gonna call you little twerp. The space in my brain is too valuable to store peoples' names.
d1f0f274ba5e1987.Speaker: Herta

1f4e87da3304b3a9.ContentText: Oh! Well, thanks for remembering my name then.
1f4e87da3304b3a9.Speaker: Himeko

8b2dd2e7397f98fc.ContentText: That's different. We have business with each other. Umm, what was your name again?
8b2dd2e7397f98fc.Speaker: Herta

f6abecde5838e38d.ContentText: Forget it, let's focus on the one who can store a Stellaron in their body...
f6abecde5838e38d.Speaker: Herta

7095ced4ee63258a.ContentText: You can leave. I'm discussing science with what's her face... Himeko? Science exists in objectivity, there's nothing to be secretive about.
7095ced4ee63258a.Speaker: Herta

f58200ccadb6e593.ContentText: But as far as you're concerned, I think it would be better for you to listen in. After all, I have a lot of plans ahead involving you. Speaking of which, Himeko...
f58200ccadb6e593.Speaker: Herta

8c87e095df0b7eb4.ContentText: Can I bring {M#him}{F#her} in for some research?
8c87e095df0b7eb4.Speaker: Herta

6256ee6dbfb12a22.ContentText: That's not up to me to decide. You can ask {NICKNAME} yourself...
6256ee6dbfb12a22.Speaker: Himeko

45b09cbd7452d559.ContentText: This little twerp really has a temper. Don't worry, I won't hurt a hair on your head. With my skills, even surgery would be painless!
45b09cbd7452d559.Speaker: Herta

acfe1c32d25bb0a5.ContentText: Aren't you worried about that bomb inside of you? Let me help you while I'm still interested. Once I'm not, I won't do any studies even if you beg me.
acfe1c32d25bb0a5.Speaker: Herta

025f6239dd0090d4.ContentText: Study you of course. Your body contains a Stellaron, which, in some sense, is no different than storing a bomb. Who knows what might happen? Maybe it'll blow you to bits someday.
025f6239dd0090d4.Speaker: Herta

abd4f02127daf94b.ContentText: You should be grateful that this genius is willing to help you out. I still have some interest now, but once that's gone, I'm not studying you even if you beg me.
abd4f02127daf94b.Speaker: Herta

528cfe2aa39acc82.ContentText: This little twerp's pretty financially motivated. I like it.
528cfe2aa39acc82.Speaker: Herta

23deabebe06a39a3.ContentText: Alright, give the poor child a break, Herta.
23deabebe06a39a3.Speaker: Himeko

73ccbc5453cd8d99.ContentText: I'm very interested now, so there's almost nothing I won't accommodate. A Stellaron in your body, how interesting is that! Be grateful that I'm offering to help you out. This is a service even the IPC can't buy.
73ccbc5453cd8d99.Speaker: Herta

f5895e670c959495.ContentText: You understand now, {NICKNAME}? Herta wants you to stay in her space station.
f5895e670c959495.Speaker: Himeko

f20f625c972d7018.ContentText: Well, I'm going to have to modify your wording here: This little twerp can only stay temporarily until the research is done. Or maybe I'll lose interest halfway through and they can just beat it.
f20f625c972d7018.Speaker: Herta

79b25bf18d38a6f7.ContentText: {NICKNAME}... You also have another option — the Astral Express. If you want, you can leave with us.
79b25bf18d38a6f7.Speaker: Himeko

37d9ca7ec339296e.ContentText: The Express has its fair share of experiences with Stellarons. The thing you're worried about, and the answers we're looking for are one and the same. Besides...
37d9ca7ec339296e.Speaker: Himeko

a593f8643a539f1d.ContentText: We can come back any time to let Herta conduct her research. She's absolutely fascinated now.
a593f8643a539f1d.Speaker: Himeko

03888e4b87814836.ContentText: Hm, works for me, keeps this subject fresh, too. And that way I won't need to keep worrying about this little twerp all the time. Perfect!
03888e4b87814836.Speaker: Herta

24c90c7537b54fcd.ContentText: My advice would be to get on. You're not doing me that big of a favor by staying anyway.
24c90c7537b54fcd.Speaker: Herta

b5e4f27e1618db3c.ContentText: You should meet the others of the Genius Society. Some of them will trick you into thanking them after they milk you dry. At least I have my honesty going for me.
b5e4f27e1618db3c.Speaker: Herta

30e2ee67c9fbd1a6.ContentText: Yes, give it some good thought.
30e2ee67c9fbd1a6.Speaker: Herta

b2a0505f869bfc8f.ContentText: Just remember to come back often. Make an appointment in advance with Asta or Arlan so I can make time to study you.
b2a0505f869bfc8f.Speaker: Herta

3b7f326e2d3e4f48.ContentText: There's no need to rush into this, Herta. Asta's in the master control zone. Let's let {NICKNAME} have a talk with Asta first and decide for {M#himself}{F#herself}.
3b7f326e2d3e4f48.Speaker: Himeko

69eeb7df801d3f43.ContentText: {NICKNAME}, I'll be waiting for you on the platform. It's no hurry if you still have things to do or someone to see.
69eeb7df801d3f43.Speaker: Himeko

4828da5c090ab11a.ContentText: Come find me when you've made your decision.
4828da5c090ab11a.Speaker: Himeko

f35882779e379448.ContentText: Still haven't made up your mind? Fine. Since I'm interested in you, I'll answer any questions you have.
f35882779e379448.Speaker: Herta

a1271c7096481709.ContentText: Me? Hmm, well, Talking about oneself is as pointless as it gets.
a1271c7096481709.Speaker: Herta

7fe75e46e6155632.ContentText: On paper, yes. But I don't really care about this place. I built it, put some stuff in, left some people here, and let them just manage themselves.
7fe75e46e6155632.Speaker: Herta

01dad03ea2e32c7b.ContentText: Asta's the lead researcher of the space station, so for all intents and purposes, she's the master. I reject the concept of ownership because I don't want the responsibilities that come with it.
01dad03ea2e32c7b.Speaker: Herta

2c5402561c985d84.ContentText: It doesn't matter. Who cares if others don't like me? I know I don't care. As long as I have my own value, I can do whatever I want.
2c5402561c985d84.Speaker: Herta

b1ad3c4ddc48fd15.ContentText: While you may have good character, do you have any value? Don't take that the wrong way, I'm genuinely asking you. You might have some value, I just don't know about it.
b1ad3c4ddc48fd15.Speaker: Herta

116860a14bb4f197.ContentText: Not much different from what you're seeing now. I modeled it after how I looked, back when I was a kid. It might not be identical, but I'd say maybe <unbreak>70</unbreak>, <unbreak>80</unbreak> percent there?
116860a14bb4f197.Speaker: Herta

9f1574281c9d9f5b.ContentText: Oh, I was so precocious — all I cared about back then was solving the solitary wave problem, ignoring my precious childhood...
9f1574281c9d9f5b.Speaker: Herta

1d2102305fce1612.ContentText: Stellarons, huh? Ask away, I'm listening.
1d2102305fce1612.Speaker: Herta

a3a46039ca011375.ContentText: According to my research, it's a type of lifeform with a special property that tethers it to a certain Path or Aeon's power.
a3a46039ca011375.Speaker: Herta

21b126420d339ce4.ContentText: Wherever it's located, it responds to that world's desires to advance its civilization. But, this comes at the cost of some form of disaster. The mechanism behind it is likely related to Nanook the Destruction.
21b126420d339ce4.Speaker: Herta

4fdaf4490056706f.ContentText: Oh, that weird bunch. I'm satisfied with just one Stellaron, but they've scoured the universe, obtained several, and still aren't satisfied. I don't know what their true intentions are.
4fdaf4490056706f.Speaker: Herta

ce1d925143b64486.ContentText: {RUBY_B#Genius Society #76}Screwllum{RUBY_E#} went up against the Stellaron Hunters before. I heard there was a member whose hacking skills were on par with Screwllum.
ce1d925143b64486.Speaker: Herta

3e61c05a10028ae9.ContentText: Being on the same level as Screwllum — who's probably the best in the universe — is nothing short of spectacular. It's beyond my abilities, computers are not my forte.
3e61c05a10028ae9.Speaker: Herta

e54fa6638befa9a8.ContentText: Ha... That I don't know. Which is why I'm gearing up to solve this mystery.
e54fa6638befa9a8.Speaker: Herta

3f8ae46bba8334e3.ContentText: The Express? Shouldn't you be asking Himeko instead?
3f8ae46bba8334e3.Speaker: Herta

91f23272c2a0179a.ContentText: You mean how it looks? Like a train. Well...
91f23272c2a0179a.Speaker: Herta

22fa465d143dc054.ContentText: I was very interested in the Express for a while, and wrote a lot of papers, but forgot where I left them. Now I can't remember anything about it.
22fa465d143dc054.Speaker: Herta

7327e24ddad7fc02.ContentText: We've been business partners for a long time.
7327e24ddad7fc02.Speaker: Herta

cc6fd4445f1828cb.ContentText: Every once in a while, I'll need them to get me things from other planets, and they often come to me to help them solve problems.
cc6fd4445f1828cb.Speaker: Herta

12aa467fce6a9f98.ContentText: Uh, what decision? You're gonna have to be more specific.
12aa467fce6a9f98.Speaker: Herta

9467a0778b0abd19.ContentText: Of course, I'll still be here waiting for you, eh... and the space station will be waiting for you. Returning... it's not impossible.
9467a0778b0abd19.Speaker: Herta

2423726ebebe77b6.ContentText: If you wanna be a researcher here, you can just ask Asta. If she's fine with it, I have no complaints.
2423726ebebe77b6.Speaker: Herta

7d35546542d0f91f.ContentText: No, hold on — you have a Stellaron within you. I think it's better if you left and came back occasionally. It might be dangerous if you stay for too long...
7d35546542d0f91f.Speaker: Herta

d67fd6a14d560abc.ContentText: Well, from an objective standpoint, that's the most rational place for you to be.
d67fd6a14d560abc.Speaker: Herta

4563f0986ef27f4d.ContentText: First of all, you have somewhere to live. And you'd be under their protection. Also, it'll be a long trip, so you'll have more opportunities to find a way to save yourself from the Stellaron. Lastly, if the Stellaron really explodes, you won't harm too many people around you.
4563f0986ef27f4d.Speaker: Herta

c1c20093cd854689.ContentText: Oh, how should I know! It's up to you, you have so many options to choose from. Maybe jump out a hatch, or hop into the Fragmentum and see if any monsters start worshiping you?
c1c20093cd854689.Speaker: Herta

9feb01aba1e09e34.ContentText: It's a pity that we haven't had the chance to talk much, and now the Express is about to leave. Do you have any questions?
9feb01aba1e09e34.Speaker: Asta

f9333ba226214485.ContentText: Madam Herta gave me a piece of code, which she apparently wrote on the way here. I just tried it out and the defense shield's regenerating three times faster than before.
f9333ba226214485.Speaker: Asta

4c56adbad8620016.ContentText: Thanks to her, the Antimatter Legion outside is not much of a threat anymore. The space station's repairs and reconstruction can also begin smoothly, but internally...
4c56adbad8620016.Speaker: Asta

fa260fb3d073d7ff.ContentText: When the Stellaron was extracted, even for that brief moment, it corroded the space station and formed a new space — what we now call the Fragmentum.
fa260fb3d073d7ff.Speaker: Asta

3add81cbe80e28f8.ContentText: The part that was corroded is irreversible, so the space station will always be in a state of quasi-Fragmentum.
3add81cbe80e28f8.Speaker: Asta

bc9adbc3a4ae4679.ContentText: All existing Fragmentums are connected, so there will be monsters that will enter the space station through its Fragmentum.
bc9adbc3a4ae4679.Speaker: Asta

3c3d8ddd92bdec2a.ContentText: Ahh, I'd like to know the answer to that as well.
3c3d8ddd92bdec2a.Speaker: Asta

c12abfd552135f33.ContentText: All existing Fragmentums are connected, so monsters will be able to enter the space station through the Fragmentum here. But it shouldn't allow anything to exit your body, so...
c12abfd552135f33.Speaker: Asta

2f60ec70637587a1.ContentText: I talked with Arlan and there's no easy solution to this problem at the moment. We can only increase the security and patrol frequency to protect the ongoing research.
2f60ec70637587a1.Speaker: Asta

930ea03e7298a6f3.ContentText: I like you, but... you have a Stellaron in your body.
930ea03e7298a6f3.Speaker: Asta

11876e46b6265cea.ContentText: If you were just wandering around, or if you agreed to be sealed away in an experiment pod, that would be fine.
11876e46b6265cea.Speaker: Asta

91e4bc2cc816b639.ContentText: But if you're going to work in the space station long-term, the Stellaron may have some serious effects on the station's Fragmentum. As the lead researcher, that's a risk I cannot take.
91e4bc2cc816b639.Speaker: Asta

0cc1623508936fb8.ContentText: I can sense your enthusiasm for the space station, but I'm afraid I have to turn you away.
0cc1623508936fb8.Speaker: Asta

d009d6669e3628ec.ContentText: If you wanted to come back and help, of course, I wouldn't refuse you. Dan Heng helped inventory our rare items, March 7th said that she would help out as much as she can and connected over <unbreak>50</unbreak> wires in the electrical room. Everyone from the Express is so obliging...
d009d6669e3628ec.Speaker: Asta

6fe008524bd811e1.ContentText: And I think you're pretty good at "meddling" too, {NICKNAME}.
6fe008524bd811e1.Speaker: Asta

84f892776e489a20.ContentText: After all this is over, I'm putting my vacation time in with Madam Herta. I've got it all planned. I'll hop on an airship and give The Blue a good look.
84f892776e489a20.Speaker: Asta

2e38005eb8f53c87.ContentText: Be that as it may, taking it in while on vacation and observing it during work are not the same thing.
2e38005eb8f53c87.Speaker: Asta

d525de6834e24efe.ContentText: I guess so? I haven't taken leave once since I joined the space station...
d525de6834e24efe.Speaker: Asta

3f7a0c4da9199c6d.ContentText: And if I have an actual, full vacation, I can take my time to collect observational data and finish writing my paper.
3f7a0c4da9199c6d.Speaker: Asta

d3fbf2568a6050dc.ContentText: Of course, there's already a lot of published research on The Blue, but I want to study it myself. It might sound a lot like work, but it's really just a hobby — there are no deadlines or quotas to meet, and I don't get paid.
d3fbf2568a6050dc.Speaker: Asta

717d48eb11ae8579.ContentText: Hey, {NICKNAME}! I heard the news. You're coming with us on the Express, right?
717d48eb11ae8579.Speaker: March 7th

546d6d644a122432.ContentText: Oh come on, you know that's what you want deep down inside. I can see it on your face.
546d6d644a122432.Speaker: March 7th

d660df5c06dffa7b.ContentText: Do I even need to say it? I think we're becoming fast friends... isn't that enough?
d660df5c06dffa7b.Speaker: March 7th

c7de919502346248.ContentText: But you look like you've got something on your mind... come on, out with it!
c7de919502346248.Speaker: March 7th

0568fd852df89fa6.ContentText: Y'know, when you were passed out, all I thought was I had to look after you. And then you picked up the bat! Just incredible!
0568fd852df89fa6.Speaker: March 7th

87265f7cea98ca8f.ContentText: In the blink of an eye, you knocked that big fella into Mr. Yang's black hole and saved me... I still haven't thanked you properly yet...
87265f7cea98ca8f.Speaker: March 7th

b7c5a1b7bc909fec.ContentText: Nah, we're not splitting up here...
b7c5a1b7bc909fec.Speaker: March 7th

2343bbaedb49eabd.ContentText: I'd like to know too, because I was already on the Express when I woke up.
2343bbaedb49eabd.Speaker: March 7th

805aff3e8bd7c74b.ContentText: I was just drifting out there in space and got picked up by the Express. Amazing, right?
805aff3e8bd7c74b.Speaker: March 7th

27130d4807979a82.ContentText: Crazy stuff like that? Not too often. It sure freaked me out.
27130d4807979a82.Speaker: March 7th

81842b5036587ea5.ContentText: But every encounter I've had since coming aboard the Express has been strange to say the least.
81842b5036587ea5.Speaker: March 7th

d6e5715740fd5ed4.ContentText: For example, going to the desert to catch something called a "sandfish," correcting a gravitational field to flip an upside-down castle, or almost getting my head cracked open by a galena ball falling from the sky while trying to avoid a sleeping reindeer on the road—
d6e5715740fd5ed4.Speaker: March 7th

31207f5f6f90979f.ContentText: Huh... looking back now, it all seems quite dangerous... But I had the crew there with me, so the problems didn't seem all that bad.
31207f5f6f90979f.Speaker: March 7th

d80e9d68eb7e1636.ContentText: Of course you should! Why wouldn't you?
d80e9d68eb7e1636.Speaker: March 7th

4852cb71b7ca5b99.ContentText: There's only four of us now, plus Pom-Pom. Each of us can have our own carriage to sleep in! You wouldn't have the heart to leave your carriage unmanned, would you?
4852cb71b7ca5b99.Speaker: March 7th

0913c7219bb1dbf4.ContentText: Join us, {NICKNAME}. Then it wouldn't be a problem anymore.
0913c7219bb1dbf4.Speaker: March 7th

f4bf2f80ee4cf6d3.ContentText: Then come aboard and take a look for yourself.
f4bf2f80ee4cf6d3.Speaker: March 7th

259f693ae9cedbbf.ContentText: Oh, it's you, {NICKNAME}... Do you have something on your mind?
259f693ae9cedbbf.Speaker: Dan Heng

57752a47521a4759.ContentText: Is that so? Well, I am the train's guard. I suppose it's just instinct.
57752a47521a4759.Speaker: Dan Heng

399a6c1da4c8fc42.ContentText: It's about being observant at all times and carefully making the best choice for the situation. You can do it too.
399a6c1da4c8fc42.Speaker: Dan Heng

2c51e5297ac952cb.ContentText: I think you're not bad yourself, {NICKNAME}.
2c51e5297ac952cb.Speaker: Dan Heng

e606d02cdb4b9694.ContentText: If you're referring to what I think about you joining the Astral Express... You're overthinking it.
e606d02cdb4b9694.Speaker: Dan Heng

940c8a25d38b9365.ContentText: My position is simple: It doesn't matter to me. I suggest you ignore my opinions and make your own choice.
940c8a25d38b9365.Speaker: Dan Heng

495ecc804dc9b29e.ContentText: Being on the Express isn't exactly the same as "traveling" or "adventuring..." The Astral Express symbolizes "trailblazing" you understand?
495ecc804dc9b29e.Speaker: Dan Heng

f72d6e7945da43a7.ContentText: Trailblazing implies the unknown, be it unknown risks or unknown rewards.
f72d6e7945da43a7.Speaker: Dan Heng

66b1ea0991109cb5.ContentText: In my opinion, the unknown is no more terrifying than the known... In fact, the unknown signifies something we can control and change.
66b1ea0991109cb5.Speaker: Dan Heng

e4bdb011d4417324.ContentText: Don't use hesitation as an excuse. If you hesitate for too long, your original way of thinking will eventually cease to exist.
e4bdb011d4417324.Speaker: Dan Heng

f4986843566d2469.ContentText: So, have you thought things through?
f4986843566d2469.Speaker: Himeko

78395847f7d8a92d.ContentText: There's no need to be so formal. You helped us defeat that big fella, anyway. Plus, If we keep speaking pleasantries, we'll waste a whole day.
78395847f7d8a92d.Speaker: Himeko

46dfba4102008daa.ContentText: You've done me a huge favor by defending the space station from the Antimatter Legion. And know that while Herta may not admit it, she owes me one. And she will not refuse me if I ask for a favor in return...
46dfba4102008daa.Speaker: Himeko

cbccec38c15600b3.ContentText: And it's probably not too much to ask for a rare item from the space station, right?
cbccec38c15600b3.Speaker: Himeko

ba50de71ba22cbe0.ContentText: How about we continue talking on the Express? I'll make you a cup of coffee, my special blend.
ba50de71ba22cbe0.Speaker: Himeko

6820386ab2349561.ContentText: Haha, I was ready ages ago. *sigh* I've been here so many times before, it should've been just an ordinary trip for me.
6820386ab2349561.Speaker: Himeko

0de52a6283a15bbe.ContentText: But everything's not so ordinary anymore, is it?
0de52a6283a15bbe.Speaker: Himeko

63904c5904cf6e47.ContentText: Walking the same path over and over will never be the same, there will always be something new. That's the meaning of trailblazing.
63904c5904cf6e47.Speaker: Himeko

aa8d2e0f11233fb4.ContentText: As always, to follow in the footsteps of Akivili.
aa8d2e0f11233fb4.Speaker: Himeko

03d568059563e605.ContentText: Sometimes, we stop on other worlds and we'll continue to do so. There are countless "next stops" in the galaxy.
03d568059563e605.Speaker: Himeko

6fb650465e47a743.ContentText: I love the vast reaches of space, and the Express does too. I want to seek out new worlds, and the Express wants to return to its former path.
6fb650465e47a743.Speaker: Himeko

74463c580bacce7d.ContentText: While that might be the biggest reason, it's not the only one.
74463c580bacce7d.Speaker: Himeko

05622260ea1059ac.ContentText: Well, the fact that you have a Stellaron in your body is not something most people can boast about.
05622260ea1059ac.Speaker: Himeko

36f1f067e0165657.ContentText: I think you need a chance. A chance to discover just how different you really are from everyone else. Everybody keeps telling you about how special you are, and how you have a Stellaron inside you...
36f1f067e0165657.Speaker: Himeko

b5348e7023762b4e.ContentText: But that's already plain as day to you. And no matter who tells you — be it me, or Herta, or anybody — it's not the same thing as feeling it yourself.
b5348e7023762b4e.Speaker: Himeko

381bdc798a985471.ContentText: You have to experience enough to know if you've gained or lost anything because of the Stellaron, and to know who you really are... Learn to control the Stellaron and then you can control your destiny.
381bdc798a985471.Speaker: Himeko

b65e8281cdf836f0.ContentText: The Stellaron might still be an enigma, but the fact of the matter is — it's a part of you. And you have to embrace this before you can move forward into the future.
b65e8281cdf836f0.Speaker: Himeko

09553e50d63c349c.ContentText: Hm? Go ahead, speak your mind.
09553e50d63c349c.Speaker: Himeko

a1ad25e5cceee4fc.ContentText: *sigh* ...Come on, those toys of yours aren't that dangerous.
a1ad25e5cceee4fc.Speaker: Natasha

2cdc2ce7f9ea7152.ContentText: Uh, then why hasn't {F#she}{M#he} woken up yet?
2cdc2ce7f9ea7152.Speaker: Sampo

8196033808590213.ContentText: Because {F#she's}{M#he's} sound asleep — didn't you hear {F#her}{M#him} sleep talking? ...Poor child, sounded like a bad nightmare.
8196033808590213.Speaker: Natasha

a8549ffd3204c641.ContentText: Tell me the truth Sampo — what are you gonna do about the Overworld girl?
a8549ffd3204c641.Speaker: Natasha

871bec3e9bd04b1c.ContentText: What am I gonna do about her? Why, wait for the opportunity and send her back together with the rest of them of course, I... Hey come on, what's with the—
871bec3e9bd04b1c.Speaker: Sampo

4f42c606adf25240.ContentText: You're a bad liar, Sampo Koski.
4f42c606adf25240.Speaker: Natasha

e156fa46ca6384c7.ContentText: Wha— ...I didn't mean to bring her along! The smoke was too dense, I was in a daze! Before I knew it, I'd somehow dragged her down here too.
e156fa46ca6384c7.Speaker: Sampo

fbe833edfb821da7.ContentText: What are you up to, Sampo? Why do you insist on getting caught up in Overworld affairs that have nothing to do with you? If it's a whole lot more attention from Wildfire you want, you're going about it the right way.
fbe833edfb821da7.Speaker: Natasha

8babd8504935723e.ContentText: Hey now! Sampo Koski's primary concern is taking care of his friends. These guys scratched my back. How could I live with myself if I didn't scratch theirs?
8babd8504935723e.Speaker: Sampo

e5e6e65877c8abe1.ContentText: And another thing! Where does Wildfire get off... assuming that these fine folks won't come in useful to them, huh? I mean, you never know.
e5e6e65877c8abe1.Speaker: Sampo

4e1991f503718c9e.ContentText: Which is why you've set them loose in the underground?
4e1991f503718c9e.Speaker: Natasha

38178c5f7fb6e260.ContentText: Come on, accidents happen! I'll have them rounded up in no time.
38178c5f7fb6e260.Speaker: Sampo

98c74f9a89336d65.ContentText: *sigh* That girl... get her back as soon as possible, then don't let her out of your sight. The underground has been sealed off for over ten years now — the children won't even remember what overgrounders look like. If a girl in a Silvermane Guard uniform suddenly shows up...
98c74f9a89336d65.Speaker: Natasha

eac195a190f37094.ContentText: ...what would Wildfire do with her? What would they do with you?
eac195a190f37094.Speaker: Natasha

d1c969e42191beab.ContentText: Alright, I get it! I'm setting off right now. I'll have to trouble you to look after them while I'm gone, ma'am.
d1c969e42191beab.Speaker: Sampo

b5932d5344d6372c.ContentText: ...They will suffer, sacrifice, and die because of my order.

8b5df34ed1b19ab2.ContentText: It is not death which greets them... They will be swept into the infancy of a new world.

1fe75b38b90d84c3.ContentText: What about the Underworlders? They will lose the protection of the Architects. They will see me... as a tyrant.

bd23d155c7e54195.ContentText: You have witnessed... the world we have promised.

37ca975e0834a204.ContentText: A temporary misunderstanding... for an eternity of prosperity.

fd319409028cae57.ContentText: How are you feeling? Any aches or pains?
fd319409028cae57.Speaker: Natasha

7c9e2622f06e8ef0.ContentText: Good. You were out for a while, I was beginning to worry. You were saying some strange things.
7c9e2622f06e8ef0.Speaker: Natasha

fe5b801aad0eac71.ContentText: ...I hope you're joking, hehe... That's either an interesting metaphor, or you hit your head.
fe5b801aad0eac71.Speaker: Natasha

e080c1f0ffbd617a.ContentText: I bet, you were mumbling something about "Stellarons" and "wishes"... I couldn't make sense of it.
e080c1f0ffbd617a.Speaker: Natasha

35f5f3e780bdff43.ContentText: Well, now that you're awake, you should probably try moving your limbs. I'm Natasha — a doctor in the underground. You've already spent a day in my clinic.
35f5f3e780bdff43.Speaker: Natasha

cba1c6020c86b1ac.ContentText: Nice to meet you too... Hehe, you're very polite.
cba1c6020c86b1ac.Speaker: Natasha

3a85dff92e23267d.ContentText: Yes... it's a place that's been sealed off and neglected by the overgrounders for more than a decade. The underground has none of the splendor of the surface — the people here dig tunnels and mine ore to make a living.
3a85dff92e23267d.Speaker: Natasha

194621cf7df06566.ContentText: Mm-hmm, I'm afraid the conditions underground are terrible. People get sick easily here, and I'm the only doctor.
194621cf7df06566.Speaker: Natasha

9b0383c73a90904f.ContentText: Sampo's gone to clear up a mess of his own making, so I'm looking after you in the meantime. Based on your current state, I don't think there's any cause for alarm — you seem perfectly healthy.
9b0383c73a90904f.Speaker: Natasha

19bfe37278e66c3f.ContentText: So if you don't mind, I'll go and take a look at the other patients?
19bfe37278e66c3f.Speaker: Natasha

6bf0817980d49556.ContentText: Sampo just told me that you lost consciousness. He didn't say why. Still, I'll wager it had something to do with him — he's always tinkering with his devices.
6bf0817980d49556.Speaker: Natasha

dc34af824d20dab9.ContentText: Anyway, the opinion of the clinic is that none of you have come to harm.
dc34af824d20dab9.Speaker: Natasha

5711558a8d9d9438.ContentText: Sampo told me. Don't worry, the Silvermane Guards won't follow you below ground. We've been cut off from the surface for many years. Even when things were at their worst down here, they never showed.
5711558a8d9d9438.Speaker: Natasha

68fa6351952d9beb.ContentText: ...Of course, I don't know the whole story behind why the Architects ordered the lockdown. Who knows, thanks to you, they might finally be about to lift it... something that Wildfire's wanted to achieve for a long time now.
68fa6351952d9beb.Speaker: Natasha

baf4f1589cee19a2.ContentText: Oh, please, you needn't worry. You've just been asleep for a while, I barely had to lift a finger.
baf4f1589cee19a2.Speaker: Natasha

15660f60cbaefdc5.ContentText: I... might've exaggerated your condition for Sampo's ears... but that guy owes me. He better bring me back some medicine.
15660f60cbaefdc5.Speaker: Natasha

bc1dd56a476e5774.ContentText: They've been up for a while already. The young guy with the dark hair left first — he went with Sampo.
bc1dd56a476e5774.Speaker: Natasha

7887f3b43dff6107.ContentText: Your rowdier friend took off soon after waking up. I imagine she'll be taking a stroll nearby.
7887f3b43dff6107.Speaker: Natasha

1f75d1bdb9ec737e.ContentText: As for the girl in the Silvermane Guard uniform, I told Sampo to watch her... but it seems that he left his post and she made a run for it.
1f75d1bdb9ec737e.Speaker: Natasha

b07df5a80b8a36e8.ContentText: Good question... he's a man of mystery. He claims to be a simple cross-border businessman — not that there's much to interest an Overworlder down here. Either way, he's got a surprising number of connections.
b07df5a80b8a36e8.Speaker: Natasha

06290f9e8cb83b29.ContentText: I've managed to secure more than a few urgent medical supplies through him, and he's been a big help to Wildfire... In any case, I don't think his intentions are sinister.
06290f9e8cb83b29.Speaker: Natasha

95e4e195c06bf5c6.ContentText: Sure, but don't push yourself. If you start feeling unwell, come straight back and tell me.
95e4e195c06bf5c6.Speaker: Natasha

1b08438d7fef49af.ContentText: ...And if you run into any trouble, you can try asking for Wildfire.
1b08438d7fef49af.Speaker: Natasha

e978758689e94d24.ContentText: It's a grassroots organization. Think of it as the Silvermane Guards of the underground, but less stone-hearted.
e978758689e94d24.Speaker: Natasha

6b6caf7e46b876b5.ContentText: No need to thank me. It's a doctor's duty to heal.
6b6caf7e46b876b5.Speaker: Natasha

e84f5174df68a352.ContentText: Y'know, the underground has been cut off from the surface for years. For you outsiders to descend on us out of nowhere is pretty incredible.
e84f5174df68a352.Speaker: Natasha

f93ce5e932ea1f50.ContentText: The Underworld? What do you want to know?
f93ce5e932ea1f50.Speaker: Natasha

7afa3fe0ef8a3cd1.ContentText: Because we need Geomarrow. After Belobog's construction, the demand for energy kept increasing. The Eternal Freeze prevented us from expanding outwards, so our only choice was to go down.
7afa3fe0ef8a3cd1.Speaker: Natasha

1ef6643de44bdbf1.ContentText: The people answered the call of the Architects and descended, excavating ore veins and establishing mines. Before we were sealed off, it was an honor to work underground.
1ef6643de44bdbf1.Speaker: Natasha

9d390a4627abbe70.ContentText: It was a choice... the pursuit of arduous labor for the survival of our entire civilization.
9d390a4627abbe70.Speaker: Natasha

1dcc782c39c9ddd7.ContentText: ...It's never been good. Conditions are tough both above and below the surface. The Overworld is faced with the Eternal Freeze and Fragmentum corrosion, and the Underworld has to contend with hard labor, suffocating heat, and serious shortages.
1dcc782c39c9ddd7.Speaker: Natasha

9c0f16347d29b2ce.ContentText: It's been over a decade since the Silvermane Guards withdrew from the Underworld, and the situation here has only gotten worse. The only contact we have is the exchange of Geomarrow for goods.
9c0f16347d29b2ce.Speaker: Natasha

5b20c41c656055fd.ContentText: And what's more... the Fragmentum corrosion has begun to reach us down here, too...
5b20c41c656055fd.Speaker: Natasha

ec3caa2543c3e12c.ContentText: Ask away, but I'm afraid I don't know a lot about him myself.
ec3caa2543c3e12c.Speaker: Natasha

5690d80ab7fb2ec3.ContentText: A meticulously choreographed "chance meeting..." Sampo is pretty good at orchestrating unexpected encounters, and he always leaves a lasting impression.
5690d80ab7fb2ec3.Speaker: Natasha

011ba61436fa90fa.ContentText: According to him, that's the gift of a businessman.
011ba61436fa90fa.Speaker: Natasha

aa2533fb8179da49.ContentText: Hehe, I hear that question a lot — seems like he owes everyone something. That's why he never discloses his whereabouts.
aa2533fb8179da49.Speaker: Natasha

fc559a028967a388.ContentText: When people need him, he appears, and when people really need him, he disappears. Sampo's first and second laws of motion.
fc559a028967a388.Speaker: Natasha

b7019568b0c1d1b2.ContentText: ...I'm a doctor, not an informant! Very well, what's the question?
b7019568b0c1d1b2.Speaker: Natasha

38f507606d8fa7fb.ContentText: Wildfire is a volunteer grassroots organization. Like I said, you can think of it as the Silvermane Guards of the underground.
38f507606d8fa7fb.Speaker: Natasha

636e3977e744d904.ContentText: They've taken on the duties of the Guards: maintain safety and order in the Underworld and compete with Fragmentum corrosion for living space.
636e3977e744d904.Speaker: Natasha

e8c7736fa6f57895.ContentText: Wherever there is hardship and a cry for help, there is Wildfire.
e8c7736fa6f57895.Speaker: Natasha

e9ba87815148780f.ContentText: Okay, take care, and make sure you look after yourself.
e9ba87815148780f.Speaker: Natasha

da10a5663ee7d01d.ContentText: (I gotta find March 7th and Dan Heng... but where should I start?)
da10a5663ee7d01d.Speaker: playerboy

2febdd983435cbe6.ContentText: A club just for fighting... who knew undergrounders had such brutal hobbies.
2febdd983435cbe6.Speaker: March 7th

b1a93f8ff0d5f6cf.ContentText: They let YOU take part!? When did this place last have an inspection!
b1a93f8ff0d5f6cf.Speaker: March 7th

76cc51d19abd825e.ContentText: Hook's gonna go fight. See ya later!
76cc51d19abd825e.Speaker: Hook

512b9bc1e4688cfd.ContentText: Who's in charge here? How can they just let kids attack each other...?
512b9bc1e4688cfd.Speaker: March 7th

249bf3ca92cfc667.ContentText: The Moles are in charge, that's who! ...But only of the kids. Wildfire is in charge of grown-up business.
249bf3ca92cfc667.Speaker: Hook

ca60e5c2643c8cbc.ContentText: Umm, The Moles control everything underground!
ca60e5c2643c8cbc.Speaker: Hook

3944ffb985d9014d.ContentText: Umm, it's... The Moles for grown-ups...
3944ffb985d9014d.Speaker: Hook

b32de1b01c01904a.ContentText: Ooh! They need one more player there! I—I gotta go! If you ever wanna fight, come find me!
b32de1b01c01904a.Speaker: Hook

66d7a955b2a1ceb4.ContentText: Come back, come back, they won't be hiding that far away!
66d7a955b2a1ceb4.Speaker: March 7th

34b513a7d873da53.ContentText: There are so many people here — Hook's too short. I can't see anything...
34b513a7d873da53.Speaker: Hook

068b55a0e5512198.ContentText: Wha—! When did you... D—Did you hear what Hook was saying?
068b55a0e5512198.Speaker: Hook

8848af98a1f13f19.ContentText: Good. Hook didn't say anything, and you didn't hear it.
8848af98a1f13f19.Speaker: Hook

faa793ae533865f7.ContentText: Hehe, good. Wait a second... You did too hear everything Hook was saying!
faa793ae533865f7.Speaker: Hook

758431b693b511ee.ContentText: Hmph, grown-up fights are less fun than ours. So what if I can't see!
758431b693b511ee.Speaker: Hook

a712ffbd89b95a91.ContentText: You have to use your fists, palms, and even your fingers in combat! If you don't know how, you're done for! You need to train until your body is an extension of the mind... and the mind is an extension of your will.
a712ffbd89b95a91.Speaker: Hook

ae42df5194f6688b.ContentText: Fists, palms, and fingers... *gasp* Rock, paper, scissors! Phew! No wonder I was confused!
ae42df5194f6688b.Speaker: March 7th

ccfb748703d7f8aa.ContentText: Did you hear!? There's a new fighter at the club! He knocked the last champ's teeth out!

6eb70f276e7b7911.ContentText: Really? At least he still has his mouthguard...

fe55128df9b0142d.ContentText: ...Dark sense of humor you got there.

80c51056baf968c0.ContentText: I heard a new fighter showed up at the club — young guy, dark hair. They say he's invincible! Where did he come from?

3a62b1adbcafbd4f.ContentText: I heard someone say he's an elite Silvermane Guard.

2d6a7e3e08893427.ContentText: Don't be ridiculous. The Silvermane Guards have been gone for ages. Why would one suddenly appear out of the blue?

89cea23453919c82.ContentText: ...Brothers and sisters! Are you ready for today's most spectacular, spine-tingling, earth-shattering contest!?

e43fc03c825280a5.ContentText: On one side — recommended by Tall, Blue, and Handsome — the unsmiling pulverizing power of the new kid on the block: Cold Dragon Young!

39a106438cf760d4.ContentText: And his opponent is... none other than the unfeeling, incendiary, explosive might of Team Robomatic! All praise to Boss Svarog!

93dc144bbb8a999f.ContentText: Given that no other fighter was willing to take on the strength of Team Robomatic, Cold Dragon Young will face off against these opponents alone! On learning his fate, the brave young fighter had one thing to say: "Whatever!"

3aca325537781836.ContentText: And so, let the semifinals of the <unbreak>1758</unbreak>th Fighting King Challenge... begin!

d30c593f5113777d.ContentText: Oh-ho? Brothers and sisters, an unexpected turn of events... Two members of the audience have charged into the octagon! It looks like they want to team up with Cold Dragon Young!

230d3bb37b644d70.ContentText: Yeah! The first thing {NICKNAME} and I did was go look for you! And now that we've found you, we're trying to make sure you don't get your butt kicked! You're welcome~
230d3bb37b644d70.Speaker: March 7th

2951066647244018.ContentText: Brothers and sisters, you can feel their passion! The magnetic pull of this electric sport is undeniable! But let me reiterate: these competitions are for professionals only! Whatever you do kids, don't try this at home!

577ac46d3a46f8d3.ContentText: And Cold Dragon Young is signaling that the contest will go ahead! He's just itching to get into it! And so are we! It's the iron fists of Cold Dragon Young — and friends — versus the iron skin of Team Robomatic!

5dbc4311308007c2.ContentText: I can take them on my own, you know.
5dbc4311308007c2.Speaker: Dan Heng

05f77d7bf49e6b76.ContentText: ...*sigh* We need to work on your emotional intelligence.
05f77d7bf49e6b76.Speaker: March 7th

d5f392757dd4aeca.ContentText: Oh! What a beautiful performance! Cold Dragon Young and his last-minute admirers emerge victoriouuuus!

72d5ab84be0787d9.ContentText: Admirers... How come we don't get cool nicknames!
72d5ab84be0787d9.Speaker: March 7th

f118518d01676a58.ContentText: *sigh* Forget it. I think our taste in nicknames is different.
f118518d01676a58.Speaker: March 7th

827957ce130f5d9d.ContentText: So... what does Wildfire do all day?
827957ce130f5d9d.Speaker: March 7th

46a79c56da694f98.ContentText: Everything. They keep the peace, uphold justice, fight for resources, distribute goods...
46a79c56da694f98.Speaker: Sampo

d54157bbc6516542.ContentText: The sliver of trust they have for me has to do with the last one...
d54157bbc6516542.Speaker: Sampo

81adbbcafcd3ff94.ContentText: Ah, this is Geomarrow, an exothermic ore. The underground and the surface are sealed off from one another, right? Well only the Geomarrow transport line is still running. The underground sends ore to the surface, and the surface sends goods to the underground. At least in theory.
81adbbcafcd3ff94.Speaker: Sampo

2fb375c3f513fc65.ContentText: Most undergrounders are miners, and this is what they mine for a living. Y'know, if we didn't have Geomarrow to burn, this world would have frozen to death long ago.
2fb375c3f513fc65.Speaker: Sampo

863de7dcaa3993f6.ContentText: Hmm, let's keep moving. The person I was looking for isn't here...
863de7dcaa3993f6.Speaker: Sampo

dbe8c9d32b67395f.ContentText: Huh...? Old Oleg isn't here either. Where is everyone? Hehe, hm...
dbe8c9d32b67395f.Speaker: Sampo

99e28be05b783bf7.ContentText: Gah, so you're leading us on another wild goose chase?
99e28be05b783bf7.Speaker: March 7th

715ebbedb70292d8.ContentText: I wouldn't dare! Trust me, we're getting close!
715ebbedb70292d8.Speaker: Sampo

c4909df7d5591310.ContentText: *sigh* Huh? What's that huge structure in the distance...
c4909df7d5591310.Speaker: March 7th

f31c15e573a2b059.ContentText: Oh, that's the Furnace Core, and it's also the pillar that connects the Underworld and the Overworld. People used to travel up and down that thing, but then...
f31c15e573a2b059.Speaker: Sampo

1e0147fcedb3008a.ContentText: It's a long story. In any case, practically nothing moves up or down anymore.
1e0147fcedb3008a.Speaker: Sampo

a2ed79f4ad06c093.ContentText: Oh! C'mon, my dear fellow, I thought we weren't going to discuss this? I beg you, the fewer rumors there are about me, the better!
a2ed79f4ad06c093.Speaker: Sampo

31efa9f0a6711f4f.ContentText: Seele's usually always out on patrol here at this time...
31efa9f0a6711f4f.Speaker: Sampo

b03247f8e9d0f466.ContentText: What's Wildfire up to...? Hmm... are they avoiding me?
b03247f8e9d0f466.Speaker: Sampo

32317b7b3bc3f75b.ContentText: It looks like she's in trouble...
32317b7b3bc3f75b.Speaker: March 7th

20767601b61d39c9.ContentText: M—My friends, don't just stand there! This drama really doesn't need any more bystanders!
20767601b61d39c9.Speaker: Sampo

a4226790ecaca679.ContentText: Oh? Y'know, it might be interesting to see you get in trouble.
a4226790ecaca679.Speaker: March 7th

2c92515bc1b7610d.ContentText: We should avoid attracting too much attention... but we can't just leave her.
2c92515bc1b7610d.Speaker: Dan Heng

849029cfc59b773b.ContentText: Exactly! My boy Cold Dragon Young — uh... young master Dan Heng speaks with reason.
849029cfc59b773b.Speaker: Sampo

22650d99300c88f8.ContentText: Eh, I was kidding, and get your own opinion!
22650d99300c88f8.Speaker: March 7th

e1ad9b81187237ff.ContentText: I agree with Dan Heng, we can't just leave her to the bullies.
e1ad9b81187237ff.Speaker: March 7th

ff36b7d805ea78f2.ContentText: Well said! The young lady is wise and righteous!
ff36b7d805ea78f2.Speaker: Sampo

30fc95defc1e1fd5.ContentText: Miss Seele! Phew, it's a good thing you showed up when you did. My heartfelt thanks~
30fc95defc1e1fd5.Speaker: Sampo

af085be73f4ef644.ContentText: These vagrants have got some nerve looking for trouble in Wildfire terri—
af085be73f4ef644.Speaker: Sampo

8806495d3159802f.ContentText: Shut it Sampo, this has "you" written all over it. Wildfire has countless issues on its plate right now. We don't need a side order of Koski.
8806495d3159802f.Speaker: Seele

02e2e76571d62c46.ContentText: I hear a Silvermane Guard is paying the Underworld a visit... is that you?
02e2e76571d62c46.Speaker: Seele

637eafab6cb739f3.ContentText: You kidnapped me and brought me to the underground. What is the meaning of this?
637eafab6cb739f3.Speaker: Bronya

d86ab54df822ad35.ContentText: Hmph, listen to her. "What is the meaning of this?" ...She still thinks she's an Overworld princess.
d86ab54df822ad35.Speaker: Seele

56767b563b5383a4.ContentText: Do you know what's become of us down here while you live the easy life? Did you even consider the fate of the Underworlders?
56767b563b5383a4.Speaker: Seele

a46c01c3847ee3dc.ContentText: The Silvermane Guards aren't "living the easy life." We are constantly engaged with the enemy — defending Belobog from the scourge of attacking monsters... and protecting all those above and below the surface.
a46c01c3847ee3dc.Speaker: Bronya

d740c93c4da0af1b.ContentText: Hah, do you even hear yourself? You? Protect the underground? Redeploying every Guard to the surface, sealing off the only passageway... Protecting the so-called Architects, more like it.
d740c93c4da0af1b.Speaker: Seele

0fea1bbaa3382f6d.ContentText: The Madam Guardian has her reasons...
0fea1bbaa3382f6d.Speaker: Bronya

e7f845b0a0f47351.ContentText: Enough talk, you're coming with me. Chief Oleg wants to see you, and he's got more than a few questions.
e7f845b0a0f47351.Speaker: Seele

941dba326e6d3d57.ContentText: Perfect, Miss Seele! We were just on our way to pay Chief Oleg a visit ourselves. Room for a few more?
941dba326e6d3d57.Speaker: Sampo

78ff599af2906813.ContentText: ...What good is your name by itself!
78ff599af2906813.Speaker: Seele

0eab2bb57e591b7c.ContentText: A friend of his? Then most of the underground is your enemy.
0eab2bb57e591b7c.Speaker: Seele

7a2945ac9d12660d.ContentText: You know the chief? Then why don't I know you...
7a2945ac9d12660d.Speaker: Seele

1260583ab1cd124e.ContentText: Well it's like this: The chief's in the market for specific talent — an urgent request. So, I'm taking them to see him...
1260583ab1cd124e.Speaker: Sampo

e0bac76f6e1fa485.ContentText: We're looking for a Stellaron — it's the source of all the disasters here. If we find it, we can—
e0bac76f6e1fa485.Speaker: March 7th

a2ab77f9e5a7b178.ContentText: Ahaha — ahem! I would recommend you not recite your story to everyone you meet. Miss Seele won't understand it anyway, so let's save it for the chief, huh?
a2ab77f9e5a7b178.Speaker: Sampo

bb1797c4b4dbc31e.ContentText: You're right, I don't understand it, and I don't plan on passing the message on either. Wildfire's encountered trouble at the Great Mine — the chief's busy. If you really want to find him, come look for me at the mine entrance.
bb1797c4b4dbc31e.Speaker: Seele

8007fe7238264725.ContentText: Hey, you came. That was fast.
8007fe7238264725.Speaker: Seele

2596e06a09656302.ContentText: Didn't I tell you? *sigh* Long story short —
2596e06a09656302.Speaker: Seele

7eded2608da58fcb.ContentText: The underground used to have many mines. However, in recent years, some sort of corrosion called the "Fragmentum" started to spread. It's ruined a lot of mines.
7eded2608da58fcb.Speaker: Seele

c519449bfcf80698.ContentText: The one we're heading into is relatively unaffected. A bunch of vagrants made it their home after their old turf was consumed by the Fragmentum. Actually, most of them are pretty honest folks...
c519449bfcf80698.Speaker: Seele

46d69e93b9982419.ContentText: But with such a large group, it's inevitable that troublemakers will find their way in. They've been stealing from the miners and picking fights. And that's not the worst of it.
46d69e93b9982419.Speaker: Seele

d692708aed4bdeb6.ContentText: Things are much more serious this time... For two days now, huge clashes have been breaking out between the miners and the vagrants. It isn't pretty.
d692708aed4bdeb6.Speaker: Seele

2fa45281715e601f.ContentText: Mines are our lifelines in the Underworld. We have to keep providing Geomarrow to the Overworld in exchange for supplies.
2fa45281715e601f.Speaker: Seele

88eed4bd7be371bc.ContentText: In order to quell the situation, Chief Oleg brought Wildfire into the mine and left me in charge of security for the towns. But the situation in the mine is critical — I have to back him up.
88eed4bd7be371bc.Speaker: Seele

808c906d7243ab86.ContentText: Oh, as for you... the Chief will decide your fate when we see him.
808c906d7243ab86.Speaker: Seele

e6bb53ca4151b660.ContentText: Good, I've been wanting to come face to face with the leader of the Underworld.
e6bb53ca4151b660.Speaker: Bronya

f0d0be763e8ff1e9.ContentText: Hmph, you're about to come face to face with reality.
f0d0be763e8ff1e9.Speaker: Seele

8e6b57466996d26e.ContentText: Huh? Isn't that the doctor lady?
8e6b57466996d26e.Speaker: March 7th

97bea47fba7d10a8.ContentText: What's Natasha doing here...? Things must be worse than I thought.
97bea47fba7d10a8.Speaker: Seele

f1f9e287e9109be3.ContentText: Nat! I didn't think you'd be here. Where's Oleg?
f1f9e287e9109be3.Speaker: Seele

e422b5baf45115b5.ContentText: Hey Seele, and... Sampo's guests. So, it looks like you've already met.
e422b5baf45115b5.Speaker: Natasha

610557b18d014252.ContentText: I haven't seen Oleg. The miners said they saw him take a group further in.
610557b18d014252.Speaker: Natasha

e2f8c9a949cf179b.ContentText: Miners and their family members. They want an explanation from the instigators.
e2f8c9a949cf179b.Speaker: Natasha

2933fbe4b922d5e8.ContentText: This area up ahead is a vagrant dwelling, but they've sealed off the entrance. I guess they're afraid that angry miners might try to take revenge.
2933fbe4b922d5e8.Speaker: Natasha

7edf15db3a50da29.ContentText: *sigh* I heard that many were injured in the clashes, so I hurried over here to see if I could help.
7edf15db3a50da29.Speaker: Natasha

0e9ae7d26e0494c6.ContentText: I heard that the miners had been having violent clashes with local thugs, with significant numbers of wounded. I hurried over to see if I could help.
0e9ae7d26e0494c6.Speaker: Natasha

93be49ca2d87e8af.ContentText: You see these people? They're all miners and their family members. They want an explanation from the instigators.
93be49ca2d87e8af.Speaker: Natasha

c0f68c04fc9ae10c.ContentText: This area up ahead is a vagrant dwelling, but they've sealed off the entrance. I guess they're afraid that angry miners might try to take revenge.
c0f68c04fc9ae10c.Speaker: Natasha

2fdaa5fc1e3755dd.ContentText: Oh? You look fine to me. Sorry, I need to prioritize the wounded. There have been violent clashes between the miners and local thugs in the last few days — many people are injured.
2fdaa5fc1e3755dd.Speaker: Natasha

e1b0698e42c63aeb.ContentText: You see these people? They're all miners and their family members. They want an explanation from the instigators.
e1b0698e42c63aeb.Speaker: Natasha

33aaf7954a86b8a2.ContentText: This area up ahead is a vagrant dwelling, but they've sealed off the entrance. I guess they're afraid that angry miners might try to take revenge.
33aaf7954a86b8a2.Speaker: Natasha

4461308ef12d7e9a.ContentText: How could the situation here become such a mess?
4461308ef12d7e9a.Speaker: Seele

8e1c159d79479cc5.ContentText: I heard that First Mining Team found a Geomarrow vein with incredible deposits... The initial estimate put it at the largest discovery in the last thirty years.
8e1c159d79479cc5.Speaker: Natasha

f7c70cb9d64e9c6a.ContentText: Are you serious? That's big news. How come I never heard about it?
f7c70cb9d64e9c6a.Speaker: Seele

34d3dba6f506f674.ContentText: Well, they weren't in a hurry to make it known. Most of the mines have been contaminated by the Fragmentum — many people are out of work. They were afraid of being overwhelmed if they let the word out.
34d3dba6f506f674.Speaker: Natasha

9275e9af267f0b3f.ContentText: But the vagrants here have keen eyes — they couldn't keep it hidden from them. Some local gangs wanted to profit from the situation, so they blackmailed the mining team for hush money... and that was the final straw.
9275e9af267f0b3f.Speaker: Natasha

e4a687b62e6d3456.ContentText: *sigh* ...I can understand your thinking. It's just that the underground is in difficult straits...
e4a687b62e6d3456.Speaker: Natasha

54eab5befab979b9.ContentText: As it happens, that's exactly the law we have down here. But the vagrants have their own custom: See it, share it.
54eab5befab979b9.Speaker: Natasha

cfc75bc73b363338.ContentText: And that's how the clash started. Now both sides are dealing with heavy losses.
cfc75bc73b363338.Speaker: Natasha
