561499d0a53b6a73.ContentText: So, are you guys here to help resolve the conflict?
561499d0a53b6a73.Speaker: Natasha

794e3eb192c0e673.ContentText: They're here because they need a favor from Chief Oleg. I'm escorting them.
794e3eb192c0e673.Speaker: Seele

ba3b90c9aa88905c.ContentText: And seeing as you need that helping hand, it wouldn't be too much to ask you to lend one here first, right?
ba3b90c9aa88905c.Speaker: Seele

bffa254d5f9b1b11.ContentText: Of course we wanna help... we care about other people too y'know.
bffa254d5f9b1b11.Speaker: March 7th

25b9aac0c941dbed.ContentText: Oh... that's quite nice of you.
25b9aac0c941dbed.Speaker: Seele

bb657cdb550a8e7e.ContentText: Hmph, of course it is. Nobody gives without expecting something in return.
bb657cdb550a8e7e.Speaker: Seele

14779ed1d91d7c07.ContentText: Suit yourself. I'm not forcing you.
14779ed1d91d7c07.Speaker: Seele

d48d67d8e8c9206a.ContentText: Haha, I believe we're dealing with kind-hearted people here, Seele.
d48d67d8e8c9206a.Speaker: Natasha

5936c82dad56007a.ContentText: As you've all seen, the situation down here is... strained. If you can, we really would appreciate you helping the people.
5936c82dad56007a.Speaker: Natasha

15a08ae3839dc721.ContentText: The giant ore vein — the one they discovered... That must be where the clashes are centered?
15a08ae3839dc721.Speaker: Seele

56e49c76380c34a2.ContentText: Come on, let's get to higher ground and take a look.
56e49c76380c34a2.Speaker: Seele

fc25852be0b1481d.ContentText: Falling asleep in a place like this... impressive!
fc25852be0b1481d.Speaker: March 7th

8d416b34bf14d44c.ContentText: Hey, wakey-wakey! You'll get mushrooms growing on your head~
8d416b34bf14d44c.Speaker: March 7th

837e78b590fbd923.ContentText: Hm...? Wha...? Mushroom bread...? I can't see it on the menu... Miss Seele?

85aa329eec66930f.ContentText: Have you got a death wish or something? How can you sleep here? Get back to safety and take shelter!
85aa329eec66930f.Speaker: Seele

d5e5c6bc9918bcda.ContentText: Take shelter... *gasp* I remember now! These guys came out of nowhere and got into a fight with the mining team...

f3bf84e6466854d1.ContentText: At the time I was exhausted — I'd hardly run a few feet when one of them caught me. If it weren't for Wildfire, they'd have stolen the clothes off my back!

72022aee89c83750.ContentText: Further in, I guess. Those thugs took control of the vein ages ago — and they're fully armed. We poor, defenseless, good folks were no match for them.

475318d70fe5ac37.ContentText: It's only thanks to Wildfire that the Great Mine hasn't fallen into their hands completely.

c595b6df5345812e.ContentText: You don't know these guys — no moral compass — they'd rob you blind in a flash! It's only thanks to Wildfire that the Great Mine hasn't fallen under their control completely.

e431f4839d968eb5.ContentText: Uh... speaking of which... where is Wildfire? Did they head further in? Is there a fight happening?

03ecd0a72fc66826.ContentText: ...It seems like Chief Oleg must be up ahead. Hurry up and get back to safety — look for Nat. And try not to get into another scrap along the way.
03ecd0a72fc66826.Speaker: Seele

623dba8be0c76524.ContentText: Okay! Thank you for, um... getting me on my feet! If I get back soon enough, I'll have time for a nap...

5b8bccc3273964cb.ContentText: ...Cowards and bullies. I don't remember you guys acting this tough around Svarog's minions. Did your parents never teach you what a backbone was?

243b8c0ea5a840c9.ContentText: Pff! We ain't stupid! Why would we risk our lives against the robots? And get off the high road — you can't just find a huge chunk of Geomarrow and hog it all to yourselves!

b2163edbdc5efc54.ContentText: This mine is our territory — the mining team is laboring here day in and day out. You guys don't even pretend like you're here to lend a hand!

5cb4f8d4d1ba1c25.ContentText: You're lazy. All you want is to profit off of our sweat and tears. And you don't even try hiding it! ...Disgraceful.

b3f75e05d95bfb66.ContentText: Where does disgrace come into it when we can't even fill our stomachs, huh!? I know your game — you're just waiting for us to starve to death, so there's more food for your mining team.

b33f6aed86dfb3b6.ContentText: ...It's a waste of time trying to reason with you. While you've been kicking up this fuss, the whole vein's been seized by robots. Now we're all in the same boat.

35b4bffd95fc264f.ContentText: Hehe, right, right... we can't rely on the vein anymore... But don't forget which side brought loaded guns to the party.

0c514ce40af2351f.ContentText: Whoa, easy, wh—what are you trying to pull off? I—I'm warning you, Wildfire are in the area...

b2cd71f42ed9fd44.ContentText: Haha, empty threat! Wildfire are stuck dealing with Svarog's minions — how are they gonna help you now? Unless you're planning on taking a bullet, hand over the supplies and equipment!

a4a3cda07f0793ad.ContentText: They're getting ready to attack! Those miners are unarmed.
a4a3cda07f0793ad.Speaker: Bronya

97d7df0b96a038a7.ContentText: You stay calm if you want. I'm taking action! I know those people!
97d7df0b96a038a7.Speaker: Seele

3d9cd103680cfffc.ContentText: No need to play the hero, I'm going with you!
3d9cd103680cfffc.Speaker: Seele

35bfb3a95d6b1f1c.ContentText: I'm going too. We can't let these thugs get away with whatever they like!
35bfb3a95d6b1f1c.Speaker: Bronya

a1c63efe968bdb98.ContentText: Seele! Thank goodness you came. We were nearly...

2304ccf11cf08c8a.ContentText: Nothing but a few knuckleheads. I'm just glad you're okay. Antonia, have you seen Chief Oleg?
2304ccf11cf08c8a.Speaker: Seele

238398f6532bf919.ContentText: Oleg? He took a group into the inner section. Said it was to clear off the invading robots.

4e68cb0dcd3c4a4a.ContentText: They've been gone for a while now. Hmph, if Wildfire was around, those thugs wouldn't have dared.

a7f0fee8dc444c93.ContentText: Seems like the core of this problem is Svarog's robots...
a7f0fee8dc444c93.Speaker: Seele

766240e1e6401ed8.ContentText: Your run-of-the-mill robots don't have a will of their own. Their aim is merely Svarog's aim.
766240e1e6401ed8.Speaker: Seele

f81f9ad9a2e03c59.ContentText: The boss... He appeared suddenly after the Guards were redeployed, and became a major player in the Underworld.
f81f9ad9a2e03c59.Speaker: Seele

6a7d7eef5425af37.ContentText: Svarog claims to be a guardian of humanity — all the ownerless robots obey his commands. They've occupied the furnace core hub, and they're not letting anyone get close.
6a7d7eef5425af37.Speaker: Seele

e8c01cf79785842e.ContentText: Nobody knows why Svarog did any of this... He usually doesn't leave the Furnace Core and interfere unless some kind of disorder breaks out in the Underworld.
e8c01cf79785842e.Speaker: Seele

f83761914884eb33.ContentText: ...A "guardian of humanity" that can... command robots? I've never heard of anything like...
f83761914884eb33.Speaker: Bronya

16e9eafe8aa857d1.ContentText: Hmph, looks like your mighty Architects weren't as all-knowing as you thought.
16e9eafe8aa857d1.Speaker: Seele

522c25495bbac1cd.ContentText: Can you two say anything without quarreling? This isn't the time! It sounds like there's danger waiting for us in the inner section, can we still get through?
522c25495bbac1cd.Speaker: March 7th

952c9106ce083a50.ContentText: Right, there's unfinished business here — the chief is still down there. It's only a bunch of scrap metal. What are we afraid of?
952c9106ce083a50.Speaker: Seele

a6a8decdd53bdc23.ContentText: Easy for you to say. This isn't over — the chief and the others are still down there. It's only a bunch of scrap metal. What are we afraid of?
a6a8decdd53bdc23.Speaker: Seele

f9102cd4dd58bfda.ContentText: Yeah, you still need to talk with the chief. It's only a bunch of scrap metal. What are we afraid of?
f9102cd4dd58bfda.Speaker: Seele

cc15073ff1e350ca.ContentText: Ohh~ Is Seele starting to appreciate our strength? Hmm?
cc15073ff1e350ca.Speaker: March 7th

53144add0bbcd1dd.ContentText: I'll be honest, you guys are hardworking. If everyone from Wildfire were as impressive as you on the battlefield, we wouldn't be so hard-pressed by Svarog.
53144add0bbcd1dd.Speaker: Seele

e43030e5ea205d0c.ContentText: Antonia, can you take the mining team back through the entrance to meet up with Natasha?
e43030e5ea205d0c.Speaker: Seele

cfeffd0589ae9453.ContentText: Sure thing, but be careful! There are a lot of robots up ahead!

f3a77d7f9b1fd279.ContentText: Seeing it up close... this vein's even more spectacular.
f3a77d7f9b1fd279.Speaker: Bronya

0f096e5e3a21309f.ContentText: I doubt the underground will ever see it fully excavated...
0f096e5e3a21309f.Speaker: Seele

618fb976e0ed019c.ContentText: This vein... So this is what everyone is fighting over...
618fb976e0ed019c.Speaker: Clara

2407675ecc06cdb3.ContentText: Mr. Svarog, it's such a massive vein. I've never seen so much Geomarrow before...
2407675ecc06cdb3.Speaker: Clara

90b9d4ee156659fd.ContentText: Calculating... Based on the average rate of excavation, this vein is enough to supply Belobog with <unbreak>231</unbreak> days of energy, with a margin of error of 7 days.

36b4b6e5e70094fa.ContentText: I sense that your reason for summoning me is not the ore in question. State your true intention, Clara.

9f1a35670cb15aaa.ContentText: ...Right. I wanted Mr. Svarog to see that many miners and vagrants have gotten hurt because of the vein... Can you help them?
9f1a35670cb15aaa.Speaker: Clara

8c29e8dc680132c3.ContentText: I have already prevented the dispute and taken temporary control of the excavation zone. Evaluation result: In the event of no further variables, there will be no large-scale armed conflict within the next <unbreak>30</unbreak> days.

c05ab390bce56261.ContentText: I know why you did it, Mr. Svarog! It's just... I don't think it'll be enough.
c05ab390bce56261.Speaker: Clara

128b5997c4d398e0.ContentText: The mining team and Wildfire... they don't understand your actions... If only we could do more for them...
128b5997c4d398e0.Speaker: Clara

d2d21b17d7b1c270.ContentText: My mission is the protection of the Underworld. The trust of the minority sample is redundant to my calculations.

548f750f9451dff1.ContentText: Human behavior will always deviate from rational calculation, Clara...

d1a827062d2fb6ce.ContentText: As evidenced by their presence here.

b5f78c67b60eaf36.ContentText: Svarog! We haven't settled our final score.
b5f78c67b60eaf36.Speaker: Seele

536588fde9cfe1d7.ContentText: Seele, subordinate to Wildfire... Your resistance is futile. The result of my calculation is unequivocal: Remaining in the Underworld is the optimal strategy for survival.

d7380a916642b6cd.ContentText: *sigh* This again... Calculation results, survival strategies... I haven't got time for your thesis. Withdraw your forces, or I'll lose my temper!
d7380a916642b6cd.Speaker: Seele

6e502ab2bab19ac4.ContentText: Observe, Clara. Even under abject conditions, humans are unable to avoid division and conflict.

f04464aa7780c455.ContentText: Human failure to accept the calculation result is a significant threat to the survival strategy of the Underworld. Calculation complete, result unequivocal: Armed suppression of Wildfire and their allies is the optimal course of action.

5f08c6b68b032676.ContentText: And more fashionably dressed, too... Hey, is he about to leave? What about the girl in red?
5f08c6b68b032676.Speaker: March 7th

7ce244e03852510d.ContentText: Ah! What about the girl in red? That robot is gonna take her away!
7ce244e03852510d.Speaker: March 7th

623548c028696513.ContentText: We must leave, Clara. External variables have triggered a calculation reset. The Furnace Core hub requires protection.

661fa5888e5228be.ContentText: ...Please, Mills, don't hit them too hard.
661fa5888e5228be.Speaker: Clara

6853f09a44a6423c.ContentText: *sigh* I was getting bored of those minions — time for a real fight. Come at me!
6853f09a44a6423c.Speaker: Seele

11642ae91999067c.ContentText: Whew... not bad. How many of these big guys is Svarog hiding?
11642ae91999067c.Speaker: March 7th

c3954cc2b2e32d8c.ContentText: A lot... which is why Wildfire has never been able to take him down. Svarog's forces are too strong. We don't have enough firepower.
c3954cc2b2e32d8c.Speaker: Seele

327966b9d47fa25d.ContentText: Clara? Don't worry about her. That girl is best pals with Svarog — she's always following behind him. He wouldn't harm her.
327966b9d47fa25d.Speaker: Seele

d87548b1a61b905a.ContentText: Like I told you. That guy barely leaves his nest — it's rare to see him away from the Furnace Core. Even when he does appear, he doesn't stick around for long. He leaves everything to his subordinates.
d87548b1a61b905a.Speaker: Seele

860dfaaa9dfeaca3.ContentText: It might also have been because Clara was here — the little girl in red. She's best pals with Svarog — always following behind him.
860dfaaa9dfeaca3.Speaker: Seele

7491ace396cb0ad0.ContentText: I guess I'm just used to seeing them together now, even if I don't understand it. *sigh* Let's look for the chief.
7491ace396cb0ad0.Speaker: Seele

e64faae8bacec387.ContentText: Nice work, Seele. We were attacked on both sides by robots — who knows where they came from. We thought we were in it for the long haul, hahaha!

f64f06db536b2851.ContentText: Chief! Is everyone okay? Is anyone injured?
f64f06db536b2851.Speaker: Seele

8d3d88f236bbd5fe.ContentText: We're fine — we're used to it at this point. We sent those pesky robots and ragtag troops packing. The mine should be quiet for a while.

f791b6d7aaf3236d.ContentText: And who are your friends here...

c82538d4604854ae.ContentText: Ahh, them! They're outsiders that Sampo brought down from who-knows-where. They need a favor from Wildfire, so I brought them with me. It'll be faster if they explain.
c82538d4604854ae.Speaker: Seele

8c139ce08c39d7dc.ContentText: Hahaha! That's quite the tone to take on our first meeting. I won't forget you in a hurry.

4b264ac874722df3.ContentText: Hah, it's been a while since I heard that anyone was pleased to meet anyone, haha. I won't forget you in a hurry. Wildfire welcomes you.

c99f18d0b7ffe3ea.ContentText: So, you went to all this trouble to find Wildfire. What help is it you need?

49e29acc1ce87fb7.ContentText: Ha! I didn't know you'd put on a show for the Overworld too. Impressive.
49e29acc1ce87fb7.Speaker: Seele

49fc66b6c9f03d39.ContentText: Ho-ho, well this is new. Wildfire can barely take care of the Underworld, and now outsiders are looking for assistance from us.

c4d90cbf0a6cf6b8.ContentText: This "Stellaron" you speak of — I've never heard of it. But if it's a secret that even we locals don't know about, then one name does come to mind...

88fd26d2ca9a86e6.ContentText: Really? Sampo? You might as well try the supreme guardian.
88fd26d2ca9a86e6.Speaker: March 7th

56d8c823f9383562.ContentText: The current supreme guardian is a liar who uses sweet words to deceive the Underworld. She's never cared about our survival—

0084deecca697ca2.ContentText: Stop right there... I... won't allow you to insult the madam guardian.
0084deecca697ca2.Speaker: Bronya

01783a1cee948dab.ContentText: Miss Overworld, my words may be painful to you, but every one of them is true. Go out into the towns and hear for yourself — see how the people here suffer.

5802ac35a3ba2534.ContentText: I haven't gotten close to voicing the extent of the Underworld's grievances, young lady. But I will respect your request. I will leave it at that, for now.

b14ae62c27facb85.ContentText: Let's get back to the main topic. The name that came to my mind, was Svarog.

0aba88ca873ab1cf.ContentText: Huh...!? Isn't Svarog Wildfire's sworn enemy?
0aba88ca873ab1cf.Speaker: March 7th

98bc2290c65f2c90.ContentText: Why would a mere robot in the Underworld have knowledge of important secrets?
98bc2290c65f2c90.Speaker: Dan Heng

046e5844da3b8716.ContentText: Sworn enemy? Not how I see it. The young master here is closer. Svarog is a cold and unfeeling machine. He recognizes only the dead reasoning of his calculations.

b23dba3dd24d5eff.ContentText: Svarog is not against Wildfire... or perhaps I should say: Wildfire isn't even of concern to him. That ancient robot witnessed the war...

f2f52c55e9e7aff8.ContentText: If you're looking to pick up a thread... he may well be your best source.

4b71bae29ed49588.ContentText: Don't judge a book by its cover. I myself have put a few centuries behind me. Would you be able to tell?
4b71bae29ed49588.Speaker: March 7th

6e0e10794c7e5577.ContentText: I'm familiar with over twenty {RUBY_B#Abominations of Abundance}long-life species{RUBY_E#} — none of them look like you.
6e0e10794c7e5577.Speaker: Dan Heng

f94154db96e6cc49.ContentText: Hey! Would it kill you to play along?
f94154db96e6cc49.Speaker: March 7th

d80196b1e6b40b72.ContentText: Yeah, I remember hearing this world was invaded by the Legion hundreds of years ago.
d80196b1e6b40b72.Speaker: March 7th

74b2864da687cd79.ContentText: Robots don't forget. If Svarog hasn't heard of your Stellaron, then I'm afraid perhaps no one has.

e8eaae818cfb016e.ContentText: In which case, we need to think of a way to convince Svarog to communicate with us.
e8eaae818cfb016e.Speaker: Dan Heng

5d5b08a9a66509bb.ContentText: Or get him to hand over his memory bank. We could go through it ourselves.
5d5b08a9a66509bb.Speaker: March 7th

f45538679497732a.ContentText: We've tried repeatedly to negotiate with Svarog, but he rejects every effort. He believes that Wildfire is a threat. Still, if it were you guys...

c51b0eb9d1cc06d3.ContentText: ...We have time. Let's get into the detail tomorrow. It's late, and you must've been through a lot. Go back to the town and rest. I'll make arrangements.

87d33ac1201888c4.ContentText: Again? I'm starting to get nervous of "arranged rest" on this planet...
87d33ac1201888c4.Speaker: March 7th

4393dcc21559bcca.ContentText: As for our Silvermane girl here... do you have time? I'd like to talk with you in private.

c9af38294f7da031.ContentText: ...So you promise that if I win hide-and-seek, you'll tell big sister March all the ins and outs.
c9af38294f7da031.Speaker: March 7th

f1d3633ab158f14f.ContentText: Yep! All the ins and outs, hehe! ...What does that mean?
f1d3633ab158f14f.Speaker: Hook

4361ea1fe5784e0e.ContentText: It just means you'll tell me all the details. No hiding anything, and no telling fibs.
4361ea1fe5784e0e.Speaker: March 7th

328a9552c8f2d508.ContentText: Hmph, Hook isn't an overgrounder y'know! Hook never tells fibs!
328a9552c8f2d508.Speaker: Hook

c51f4c17a2187917.ContentText: Well, that's settled then~ Okay, let's play... Huh?
c51f4c17a2187917.Speaker: March 7th

96f67e10aef7596c.ContentText: You... When did you get here?
96f67e10aef7596c.Speaker: March 7th

02749807cdb0a43d.ContentText: Uh... th—this isn't just hide-and-seek, okay? Let me explain...
02749807cdb0a43d.Speaker: March 7th

a86f79ff9f4adf3a.ContentText: Uh... th—this isn't just hide-and-seek, okay? Let me explain...
a86f79ff9f4adf3a.Speaker: March 7th

a70f6dedf49b1bc8.ContentText: It's like this: After I woke up, that doctor said Sampo had taken Dan Heng with him. I went around in circles trying to find the blue-haired scoundrel, and bumped into these kids. They say they know where he is!
a70f6dedf49b1bc8.Speaker: March 7th

54de07e6ecab9e89.ContentText: But they said I had to join "The Moles" or something if I wanted to find out... and to do that, I had to prove my strength by winning a game of hide-and-seek... do you get it?
54de07e6ecab9e89.Speaker: March 7th

2e79ef5408b13d47.ContentText: Huh. {NICKNAME}, when did you start being so nice?
2e79ef5408b13d47.Speaker: March 7th

ff0eb1cbfc0deda5.ContentText: {NICKNAME}, you just got here and now you're gonna leave? Play hide-and-seek with me!
ff0eb1cbfc0deda5.Speaker: March 7th

7aded1b77176acd3.ContentText: ...Ugh, so what if I am! {NICKNAME}, why don't you help me, huh!?
7aded1b77176acd3.Speaker: March 7th

e05a2f4bc1050bc9.ContentText: Hey, are you done with your secret talk!? The Moles' time is precious!
e05a2f4bc1050bc9.Speaker: Hook

7e3f9221646a9011.ContentText: Okay, okay, we're done. Pitch-Dark Hook the Great, this is my friend, {NICKNAME}. {F#She}{M#He} also wants to join The Moles. Can {F#she}{M#he} play too?
7e3f9221646a9011.Speaker: March 7th

bf1a712210d24af2.ContentText: Ummmm... sure. I guess so. Then... you guys are seeking!
bf1a712210d24af2.Speaker: Hook

5862a44778087dab.ContentText: ...Boss! They don't seem very smart. Why don't we do a practice one first?

4473e319d083493b.ContentText: Hmm... you're right Julian. Okay, let's do a practice one. I'll hide, you two have to find me!
4473e319d083493b.Speaker: Hook

10515bb861f7511f.ContentText: So you kids think you're better than us, huh? Just you wait and see!
10515bb861f7511f.Speaker: March 7th

6eec15314a36c844.ContentText: S—So what, it's just a practice! Wait until we're playing for real — you'll see!
6eec15314a36c844.Speaker: Hook

f0e04f290705f1d5.ContentText: Alright, now we're playing for real! You gotta count to fifty before you open your eyes — no cheating!
f0e04f290705f1d5.Speaker: Hook

01ca2975f8cf5978.ContentText: Hehe~ Ready or not, here I come, naughty children...
01ca2975f8cf5978.Speaker: March 7th

d2441184bcb4e44e.ContentText: The Moles haven't lost a game for ages! You're doomed!
d2441184bcb4e44e.Speaker: Hook

5401737c79550f57.ContentText: You got it yet? We're the underground's greatest hiders and seekers!
5401737c79550f57.Speaker: Hook

d3958b17e745cf9d.ContentText: {NICKNAME}, it's simple. When you see one of them, you just have to catch them!
d3958b17e745cf9d.Speaker: March 7th

a19e9d8941eb114d.ContentText: Hmph, doesn't count unless you can answer this question.

ca2fa5a9251feabe.ContentText: Wha—! But we caught you! What's with the Q&A?
ca2fa5a9251feabe.Speaker: March 7th

1b877f7fd813a04a.ContentText: ...*sigh* I thought I had you there.

1fdac79fa64dfd47.ContentText: Don't run! I got you, Hook!
1fdac79fa64dfd47.Speaker: March 7th

ef972f0dfffbce65.ContentText: N—Not fair! I'm the boss of The Moles — how can I lose to a bunch of villains!
ef972f0dfffbce65.Speaker: Hook

4191751507bbd194.ContentText: Do your worst! I'm not afraid.
4191751507bbd194.Speaker: Hook

901b475b0f45c7d5.ContentText: What are they feeding you kids down here...
901b475b0f45c7d5.Speaker: March 7th

e3aedb4bd8c31f3b.ContentText: My instincts are telling me something's not right with this guy, but...
e3aedb4bd8c31f3b.Speaker: March 7th

cb9cf0782ffbbd79.ContentText: Nonsense! Ahem! How many eight-year-olds do you see walking around that look like this, huh?

5b58c26f63af7716.ContentText: That's because I'm tall... and old! I'm a grown man! Ask anyone!

092824685bc14eff.ContentText: Well here's the truth: I'm a grown man!

7f95277dc944e1c9.ContentText: Alright, the jig is up, your voice gave it away...
7f95277dc944e1c9.Speaker: March 7th

0db526a1f2470a1c.ContentText: ...Argh! But I'm Julian of a Thousand Faces! *sigh* Why did you have to talk to me! My reputation is ruined... What will the boss think!

d1c58d84d132ab08.ContentText: No need for the melodrama. That was still a magical performance...
d1c58d84d132ab08.Speaker: March 7th

a994c185ede2bb3e.ContentText: That guy's been staring at us this whole time... Hide-and-seek might have to wait — let's see what he wants.
a994c185ede2bb3e.Speaker: March 7th

7c99409913e37ead.ContentText: I... *sigh* I'm sorry boss! I failed...

ee6d02fc5579630b.ContentText: Darn! How did you see through Julian's disguise? What villainy is this?
ee6d02fc5579630b.Speaker: Hook

910e5b6cb998c74f.ContentText: Hehehe... "Those with keen eyes see the dust between the stars!" I came up with that, by the way.
910e5b6cb998c74f.Speaker: March 7th

0f50f974fcf89c66.ContentText: Yeah, yeah, you're in the footnote somewhere~
0f50f974fcf89c66.Speaker: March 7th

3090b79ead2b5d7d.ContentText: About time I got some credit for it!
3090b79ead2b5d7d.Speaker: March 7th

2ec1f18689b3cdc4.ContentText: So, Pitch-Dark Hook the Great, you can tell us now, right?
2ec1f18689b3cdc4.Speaker: March 7th

95251105d1393742.ContentText: Ummmm... Yes. The boss of The Moles is true to her word!
95251105d1393742.Speaker: Hook

b2ffcf2f7e8a8259.ContentText: Hook saw the blue-haired guy take your dark-haired friend to the Fight Club.
b2ffcf2f7e8a8259.Speaker: Hook

0449bf6f10004ebb.ContentText: No kidding, they didn't exactly get off on the right foot.
0449bf6f10004ebb.Speaker: March 7th

f26071a8086fda88.ContentText: Uh, Pitch-Dark Hook the Great, where is the Fight Club? Can you show us the way?
f26071a8086fda88.Speaker: March 7th

9bcc831d364f0b5f.ContentText: Hmm~ But it's an obvious building, grown-ups are just useless~
9bcc831d364f0b5f.Speaker: Hook

4621a126b52165f6.ContentText: Come with Hook, I'll take you over.
4621a126b52165f6.Speaker: Hook

63fb1f506270908d.ContentText: That's Pitch-Dark Hook the Great, to you! Who said you could shorten my title!?
63fb1f506270908d.Speaker: Hook

2729f7eb2c356662.ContentText: H—Hey! It's you! I was just thinking to myself: "Am I getting robbed? Who are these people following me?" So, y'know, you start to walk a little faster, and... Anyhoo if I'd just turned around, I could've thrown open my arms and said a big "hi" to my old friends.
2729f7eb2c356662.Speaker: Sampo

250e39c5e1c66f9a.ContentText: Save it. You saw us in there and got scared, so you pulled a runner.
250e39c5e1c66f9a.Speaker: March 7th

b4768c5ade4b41cc.ContentText: Me? Scared? Hahaha, my friends, what do I have to fear? *gasp* Surely I haven't done anything to offend you?
b4768c5ade4b41cc.Speaker: Sampo

235aa651ffe7b59d.ContentText: Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa rewind. If I hadn't made a break for it, Gepard would've caught all of us. And do you think he would've given you a chance to explain yourselves? Hmm? He would've checked you straight into the graybar hotel!
235aa651ffe7b59d.Speaker: Sampo

c5ef8849ce9ec79a.ContentText: Meanwhile, there I was, looking out for you from the shadows! Do you know how difficult it was to make an entrance? They were watching you the whole time!
c5ef8849ce9ec79a.Speaker: Sampo

73883a42c681e4e3.ContentText: Set him up? Yeah, with a job! You guys are new here, and let me tell you — you're gonna need some cash.
73883a42c681e4e3.Speaker: Sampo

6571ec7bc2316b10.ContentText: And, Sampo Koski stops at nothing to help his friends. Saving you was just the beginning — I have to consider your finances too! With me you get the full service, folks. That's friendship.
6571ec7bc2316b10.Speaker: Sampo

e72f46737ed18891.ContentText: ...My fine fellow, please don't do that again. You scared the daylights outta me.
e72f46737ed18891.Speaker: Sampo

d2a6ebbed9a98ce3.ContentText: Wait a minute, we're not done here! You dragged us to the underground — so what's the big idea?
d2a6ebbed9a98ce3.Speaker: March 7th

b5a0786c88cd3fee.ContentText: I had no choice but to take you guys down here. It was too dangerous for us on the surface — we're wanted criminals!? Sure, the Underworld has its drawbacks, but at least the Guards would never follow us. We're safe here...
b5a0786c88cd3fee.Speaker: Sampo

f9d9a74321313558.ContentText: Be that as it may, did you really have to poison us?
f9d9a74321313558.Speaker: Dan Heng

3ac3da64485093f7.ContentText: Maybe you've forgotten, but we were in a tight spot my friend — there was no time to think. I had to use whatever I could.
3ac3da64485093f7.Speaker: Sampo

7b97013addd152d9.ContentText: Hmm.. So it wasn't to cover anything up? A secret that you didn't want anyone, including us, to find out?
7b97013addd152d9.Speaker: Dan Heng

0eb8d33214683676.ContentText: I'm not certain yet... but there's more to our "friend" here than meets the eye.
0eb8d33214683676.Speaker: Dan Heng

d7a1b610d5ffc375.ContentText: You win! I'll help you to the best of my ability — free of charge I might add! But please, don't go spreading rumors about me?
d7a1b610d5ffc375.Speaker: Sampo

148aa68fc14dc501.ContentText: *sigh* Alright! To prove my sincerity, I'll introduce you to Wildfire. If you're looking for something down here, they're the ones to ask!
148aa68fc14dc501.Speaker: Sampo

bb78cc993d3b5100.ContentText: Because you are looking for something! Why are you asking? Dan Heng told me you guys were searching for a... what's the word... "Stellaron" — sounded pretty powerful. If anyone has a clue on its whereabouts, it'll be Wildfire.
bb78cc993d3b5100.Speaker: Sampo

6463b5289595dbdf.ContentText: You said I'd uncover a clue if I became the Fight Club champion.
6463b5289595dbdf.Speaker: Dan Heng

64b83a8087e7f467.ContentText: Uhh... Uh, y—yeah! I mean, If you'd fought in the final round and won, you'd have incredible street cred right now! Wildfire wouldn't think twice about talking with you. I don't see the problem.
64b83a8087e7f467.Speaker: Sampo

b6e898878fd5b05e.ContentText: Well, there's no such thing as a free lunch, of course. Wildfire has no reason to help you yet, so we'll just have to give them one! With your talents, we have nothing to worry about.
b6e898878fd5b05e.Speaker: Sampo

7961466f7af12f4d.ContentText: I'm telling you, no matter where you go, there's only one rule to getting things done: find the demand. Y'know, like supply and demand? Anyway, The underground has been sealed off for more than a decade — but do you think people here are just resigned to their fate?
7961466f7af12f4d.Speaker: Sampo

0a7d2c785954babc.ContentText: Well if you want my opinion, they're a bunch of artless, stubborn fools. But who cares what I think, huh?
0a7d2c785954babc.Speaker: Sampo

74d15a5dcd8c0853.ContentText: They're a band of do-gooders who sprung up to maintain order in the underground. After the Silvermane Guards withdrew, Wildfire set up shop.
74d15a5dcd8c0853.Speaker: Sampo

f34a28661119be4a.ContentText: Still, don't underestimate them! "We walk in the presence of giants" — have you heard that saying before? Well, Wildfire has giants in its midst. You'll see.
f34a28661119be4a.Speaker: Sampo

c864f64e97096d19.ContentText: Have a little faith! It's like I said: "Sampo never lets friends who've helped him come to harm." Hehe...
c864f64e97096d19.Speaker: Sampo

9eba6723af685a1a.ContentText: That person up ahead... is he asleep?
9eba6723af685a1a.Speaker: March 7th

c66264b704022ac8.ContentText: Let's head up and take a look, he might need help.
c66264b704022ac8.Speaker: Seele

84b71e8d42139395.ContentText: I recognize that woman — that's Elaine from First Mining Team! Quick, let's get up there and see if she's wounded.
84b71e8d42139395.Speaker: Seele

ff5de4958262f404.ContentText: Elaine! Are you okay? Are you hurt?
ff5de4958262f404.Speaker: Seele

f1a5a10d14e18567.ContentText: Seele! Thank goodness. I—I'm fine, just a couple of sprains.

48663325ca34e200.ContentText: You've got good timing — those vagrants were asking me about the robots, but I don't know anything...

a1780d1c4e475601.ContentText: Oh! Don't you know? The inner section of the Great Mine has been seized by a band of robots! Neither the mining team nor the vagrants can get anywhere near.

5ca328f9ed1eb2ef.ContentText: New challengers enter! About time, human-only conflicts are so boring.
5ca328f9ed1eb2ef.Speaker: March 7th

e7c0c26fe279034c.ContentText: Does anyone know where the robots come from?
e7c0c26fe279034c.Speaker: Dan Heng

80378ef29e134f4a.ContentText: At first, we thought that a collective fault had occurred in the excavation machines, but then we found out that those machines didn't even belong to the mining team.

01bec0ea5a859953.ContentText: They came out of nowhere and pushed the vagrants and us back. Then they blocked off the only tunnels into the inner section.

976a9304e64e4bbc.ContentText: Hehe, there's no way anyone in the mining team is behind this... Operating a single unit is tiring enough, but a whole group? Hehe, Impossible.

d4e4b27e08adc2fb.ContentText: Then there's only one possibility... Boss Svarog.
d4e4b27e08adc2fb.Speaker: Seele

a6d27057caafa663.ContentText: You remember the robots we defeated in the boxing gym?
a6d27057caafa663.Speaker: Dan Heng

9443ab731e04e380.ContentText: Oh! Boss Svarog's robots! What's his deal?
9443ab731e04e380.Speaker: March 7th

52f140864bdfecb2.ContentText: Let's just say he's not to be trifled with. Let's go and find some other people. Elaine, can you make it back to safety?
52f140864bdfecb2.Speaker: Seele

064eacfc07eac04d.ContentText: No problem. Seele, and the rest of you — be careful...

37271336a2a5a5c7.ContentText: Is this elevator b—broken? Why isn't it r—responding?

3fbaa2d9668464f8.ContentText: Why are you worried about this piece of junk? Do you really wanna go down there and be a live target for the robots?

8de7a54f57f90360.ContentText: But, i—if we evacuate, then haven't we lost out?

ff0330c14eea13ff.ContentText: You idiot — we'll just steal off the miners! Look, I saw with my own eyes — they managed to bag some Geomarrow. This is a perfect opportunity.

63ded4fa9f6168b0.ContentText: Shameless. Still after the miners, are you? Time to teach you a lesson.
63ded4fa9f6168b0.Speaker: Seele

3d83195a68b186e7.ContentText: Hey, what's that commotion? It sounds like there's a big argument happening...
3d83195a68b186e7.Speaker: March 7th

e3480b523a1e4d3c.ContentText: Let's get closer and take a look.
e3480b523a1e4d3c.Speaker: March 7th

b4b3a8ad0c30cbdf.ContentText: Whoa! Stop! Ah! Stop, stop, stop! There's a big evil hunk of metal right there!
b4b3a8ad0c30cbdf.Speaker: March 7th

263bba70825af499.ContentText: That model... it's one of Svarog's lapdogs alright.
263bba70825af499.Speaker: Seele

a47e6078c5bad718.ContentText: Don't be afraid, I've dealt with those robots before. Let's go!
a47e6078c5bad718.Speaker: Seele

32af4ac446c7b950.ContentText: Oh, hi {NICKNAME}, wanna listen to my thoughts on the underground?
32af4ac446c7b950.Speaker: March 7th

8648a9673f5d0e62.ContentText: No worries, just thought you might be interested.
8648a9673f5d0e62.Speaker: March 7th

97363ddb92de8a60.ContentText: Ha, my observational skills are second to none.
97363ddb92de8a60.Speaker: March 7th

3735e5703c9ba2a8.ContentText: Well, the Underworld is surrounded by cliffs, and there's no obvious structure. It seems like a spread out collection of mines and small towns — just like the outskirts of Belobog.
3735e5703c9ba2a8.Speaker: March 7th

9047ff66c0ae83e9.ContentText: There's that huge pillar called the Furnace Core that's always in view — maybe it's some kind of energy hub?
9047ff66c0ae83e9.Speaker: March 7th

2003d15df4623d86.ContentText: From what I've seen, the residents are nearly all miners. It seems like the people here have less than those in the Overworld.
2003d15df4623d86.Speaker: March 7th

a1c13355b102696f.ContentText: Still, the miners watch fights in their spare time. It's less pretentious than that theater they have on the surface.
a1c13355b102696f.Speaker: March 7th

7397654ebddf95e4.ContentText: They're always in a hurry. The pace of life here is so fast! Things are pretty busy in the Overworld too, but everything feels more relaxed up there.
7397654ebddf95e4.Speaker: March 7th

f58a9f467aad0c75.ContentText: I'm not so good at analyzing people, but seeing as you asked...
f58a9f467aad0c75.Speaker: March 7th

6f07413d107a0f12.ContentText: That guy!? He's lazy, lying, cunning, and evil! I don't like him — can't stand the sight of him.
6f07413d107a0f12.Speaker: March 7th

f0fbb334cd49985b.ContentText: I bet you think he's pretty entertaining. Watch out, or he'll fool you!
f0fbb334cd49985b.Speaker: March 7th

835ad5b166deb410.ContentText: Ah, you mean that naughty kid we played hide-and-seek with?
835ad5b166deb410.Speaker: March 7th

05182fa9237ed191.ContentText: Dr. Natasha said that she's a handful, but that she also takes care of the homeless kids. Maybe she's more mature than she seems?
05182fa9237ed191.Speaker: March 7th

a077d33aa9f7d8ff.ContentText: ...Still, I can't believe how arrogant she is. I was pretty mad with her for a while.
a077d33aa9f7d8ff.Speaker: March 7th

f2a87141b1e60116.ContentText: The Silvermane girl? She's pretty. I like looking at her.
f2a87141b1e60116.Speaker: March 7th

62ec9f4a7e324779.ContentText: When I first met her I thought she was kinda scary, but now it seems like there's something on her mind. I'm too nervous to ask her.
62ec9f4a7e324779.Speaker: March 7th

e12f4552c19229f8.ContentText: At least she's not trying to arrest us anymore.
e12f4552c19229f8.Speaker: March 7th

efb25319c63f07ab.ContentText: She says what she thinks — I like her. And did you hear what she said about the Silvermane Guards? Haha, sounded like she'd been waiting a long time to say it. I think I'd get along with her.
efb25319c63f07ab.Speaker: March 7th

4512e120d0e2af62.ContentText: If we can get her to help us, we'll bag a Stellaron in no time!
4512e120d0e2af62.Speaker: March 7th

9f84ff28ffa54585.ContentText: If you hear any juicy gossi— uh... information, come find me!
9f84ff28ffa54585.Speaker: March 7th

2468d1f1a247cef9.ContentText: Bored? Your big brother Sampo's always up for a chat.
2468d1f1a247cef9.Speaker: Sampo

b424a3e8d5fb8896.ContentText: What kind of question is that!? I'm your old pal — Sampo Koski — we've been through thick and thin together!
b424a3e8d5fb8896.Speaker: Sampo

61f405e1ce0d607f.ContentText: Well, that just means there's something wrong with your question! Questions are like transactions — if your request isn't clear, you might end up buying the wrong thing.
61f405e1ce0d607f.Speaker: Sampo

07b8f7d99f7a26b4.ContentText: What do you mean!? We battled wind and snow — fought shoulder to shoulder against the great Gepard Landau! I risked life and limb in the Fragmentum to save you from the evil clutches of the fearsome Bronya Rand!
07b8f7d99f7a26b4.Speaker: Sampo

610131d023bacd05.ContentText: How's that for thick and thin?
610131d023bacd05.Speaker: Sampo

068f13c7f4f836e2.ContentText: Yeah! Haha... Wait, do you mean it?
068f13c7f4f836e2.Speaker: Sampo

b12e85c0ea548f2b.ContentText: Wildfire are one of my major clients, though the work is mostly odds and ends... Still! It's always a pleasure. Haha, who am I to complain if the money's right, huh?
b12e85c0ea548f2b.Speaker: Sampo

177ca83c4879b2e0.ContentText: Seele works for them — Oleg's most trusted lieutenant. *sigh* To her I'm probably just, uh, Wildfire's lapdog.
177ca83c4879b2e0.Speaker: Sampo

c54c0235408b7c61.ContentText: Haha! But a very contented lapdog, I should add! Hehe...
c54c0235408b7c61.Speaker: Sampo

02bfc22ec8aa861d.ContentText: As a non-member, not a clue. They'd never tell me their ultimate aims. Shame, really, it's not like I'm a blabbermouth...
02bfc22ec8aa861d.Speaker: Sampo

a595edd52f00e1fe.ContentText: ...I will arrest you under the supreme guardian's decree. Nothing has changed.
a595edd52f00e1fe.Speaker: Bronya

ef1a7f690a420a6b.ContentText: ...I saw you the day before the Goethe Hotel. Gepard took you to see mo— ...the supreme guardian. He told me you were visitors from beyond the sky.
ef1a7f690a420a6b.Speaker: Bronya

5e616fa9d6090109.ContentText: Just like the interstellar travelers of ancient legend — people of all kinds that carried the will of the Aeons.
5e616fa9d6090109.Speaker: Bronya

b092d5b0ddf87e48.ContentText: Gepard said that you wanted to help us reverse the damage that the Eternal Freeze and Fragmentum continue to wreak on our planet... but that night, mother summoned me, and ordered me to take a detachment to arrest you.
b092d5b0ddf87e48.Speaker: Bronya

6fdaa398c65ce68f.ContentText: What happened? The supreme guardian didn't tell me the details and Gepard had to rush back to the front line... I don't understand...
6fdaa398c65ce68f.Speaker: Bronya

bf152377e2a4167b.ContentText: The Silvermane Guards withdrew to the surface long ago... I must avoid that identity here.
bf152377e2a4167b.Speaker: Bronya

3d21b18025d64032.ContentText: Until we're back in the Overworld, I propose a temporary truce and cooperation. Your true intentions are of interest to me...
3d21b18025d64032.Speaker: Bronya

d3329fec38db02b1.ContentText: If it helps you to trust me, I'm willing to answer your questions to the best of my ability.
d3329fec38db02b1.Speaker: Bronya

4e0f45f47957bc30.ContentText: Let me repeat — all I received were the supreme guardian's instructions. It is for the adjudication panel to pass judgment on the accused.
4e0f45f47957bc30.Speaker: Bronya

bf99b5731cc17ad4.ContentText: ...All the supreme guardian told me was that your identities were counterfeit, and that your intention was to overthrow the rule of the Architects.
bf99b5731cc17ad4.Speaker: Bronya

6a386f6c121c9aa5.ContentText: Truthfully, I've never heard of this Stellaron.
6a386f6c121c9aa5.Speaker: Bronya

0fc75163e35bb682.ContentText: But if all this catastrophe could be brought to an end simply by sealing it, then I hope its existence proves to be real.
0fc75163e35bb682.Speaker: Bronya

690f435a679be34b.ContentText: Fragmentum monster activity on the surface intensified, and hostilities on the front line were critical. To resist the invasion, the Architects had no choice but to redeploy the Guards to the front line.
690f435a679be34b.Speaker: Bronya

af49b595d6ee5a18.ContentText: ...If we couldn't hold our defensive line, then we wouldn't be able to maintain our supply of aid to the underground, which would have collapsed without us. That was the supreme guardian's explanation.
af49b595d6ee5a18.Speaker: Bronya

31070f8d938e7799.ContentText: In truth... I've always felt like something important is being hidden. Whether it's the Architects, mother, or Silvermane Guards, there's always an... unnatural element to their actions.
31070f8d938e7799.Speaker: Bronya

c0c2e184c7423236.ContentText: Since encountering you, the unexpected seems to have arrived in waves. I never thought I'd enter the Underworld that has been sealed away for so long...
c0c2e184c7423236.Speaker: Bronya

19d4c37b4b54b39f.ContentText: I have a feeling that with you, I can pick up the lost threads... and dispel my uncertainties.
19d4c37b4b54b39f.Speaker: Bronya

731f45b755d9c53c.ContentText: Mm, we should be going to see Wildfire. Let's move.
731f45b755d9c53c.Speaker: Bronya

89a9d4eb7245aa1b.ContentText: How are you finding your first Trailblazing expedition?
89a9d4eb7245aa1b.Speaker: Dan Heng

8ad3c0fd1cc7a835.ContentText: All journeys contain their share of the unexpected. It won't be the last time.
8ad3c0fd1cc7a835.Speaker: Dan Heng

08df87055ff87ea4.ContentText: ...Sounds like you've taken it in your stride.
08df87055ff87ea4.Speaker: Dan Heng

3a6f550c55fe7b2f.ContentText: I'm about to summarize the intel we've gathered so far. Did you want to listen?
3a6f550c55fe7b2f.Speaker: Dan Heng

b54bf314967b2746.ContentText: No problem, come find me any time.
b54bf314967b2746.Speaker: Dan Heng

2590211d62c76ca9.ContentText: First we have the Underworld — a huge underground space. Miners have built towns here and are excavating Geomarrow.
2590211d62c76ca9.Speaker: Dan Heng

cfe50726e1996868.ContentText: We learned from Natasha that the Underworld shoulders the energy needs of their entire civilization. Laboring in the Underworld used to be a great honor, and there was regular movement between realms.
cfe50726e1996868.Speaker: Dan Heng

2a20452f102cf2a3.ContentText: Sampo mentioned the Furnace Core, which people would use to travel in both directions. Yet now, each realm is sealed off from the other. Only the automatic transport line for Geomarrow and goods is still in operation.
2a20452f102cf2a3.Speaker: Dan Heng

7c8793361849d65a.ContentText: The reason for sealing the Furnace Core still needs to be investigated. In addition, it appears that Sampo has secret connections that grant him passage between here and the surface. That may come in useful to us.
7c8793361849d65a.Speaker: Dan Heng

2c866f60fa86172a.ContentText: Up to now, apart from Bronya, whom Sampo brought here, I still haven't seen a single Silvermane Guard.
2c866f60fa86172a.Speaker: Dan Heng

b173a158b9db8a33.ContentText: At the Fight Club I heard people say that the Guards withdrew from the underground many years ago, and that it was the supreme guardian who gave the order.
b173a158b9db8a33.Speaker: Dan Heng

eefbf370cec1be1c.ContentText: At the time, the supreme guardian was none other than Cocolia Rand.
eefbf370cec1be1c.Speaker: Dan Heng

5de00d67f05e32ad.ContentText: No problem, come find me any time.
5de00d67f05e32ad.Speaker: Dan Heng

f38bdf827c26e53e.ContentText: Next we have our goal — the Stellaron.
f38bdf827c26e53e.Speaker: Dan Heng

49370178fd54f7c7.ContentText: After we revealed our intentions, the supreme guardian suspended communications and sent soldiers to arrest us. Her reaction was strange, to say the least.
49370178fd54f7c7.Speaker: Dan Heng

9ff79391b2a85560.ContentText: It's too early to say, but it was a radical move. It means that we must have broached a highly sensitive subject... a secret that she's sparing no effort to protect.
9ff79391b2a85560.Speaker: Dan Heng

4dc6ed8aaaba1ee1.ContentText: If I remember our discussion correctly, I think there are two main possibilities: the Architects, and the Stellaron. I'm inclined to think it's the latter, but we lack evidence.
4dc6ed8aaaba1ee1.Speaker: Dan Heng

8f09ff1d5f26d962.ContentText: There's an old saying that goes: "Good fortune lies within bad, bad fortune lurks within good." Even when compared with the Overworld, the Underworld has a long history. There should be valuable intel here. Not to mention, without the supreme guardian's interference, we have a better chance than ever of locating the Stellaron.
8f09ff1d5f26d962.Speaker: Dan Heng

39a97116548331ab.ContentText: No problem, come find me any time.
39a97116548331ab.Speaker: Dan Heng

a8f16157204bdc49.ContentText: Lastly, we have the main strength of the Underworld — Wildfire.
a8f16157204bdc49.Speaker: Dan Heng

fb21c75e2839a588.ContentText: After the Silvermane Guards withdrew, and in order to keep the peace, the residents of the Underworld spontaneously organized their own militia — thereby taking over the Guards' duties.
fb21c75e2839a588.Speaker: Dan Heng

ba6a9546109fc1cf.ContentText: Ally? It's a little premature to be talking about that.
ba6a9546109fc1cf.Speaker: Dan Heng

38ad334e53ff96e6.ContentText: But Wildfire will be familiar with all manner of forces below ground. If we want to find Stellaron clues in the underground, I'm certain they can help.
38ad334e53ff96e6.Speaker: Dan Heng

b9778134664cc255.ContentText: I don't know them. Trust isn't part of the picture yet. But speaking of trust, I suggest you don't place too much of yours in Sampo Koski.
b9778134664cc255.Speaker: Dan Heng

3783473ca97d98c4.ContentText: He hasn't revealed his true intentions, but he has managed to corral us into a difficult situation — almost without us realizing. That's a dangerous person indeed.
3783473ca97d98c4.Speaker: Dan Heng

0d0b15252fca19bb.ContentText: Mm, that's all we need to summarize for now. If there's anything else you're not clear on, come and find me.
0d0b15252fca19bb.Speaker: Dan Heng

6b3830ea8e70d9a0.ContentText: Hey, where are you going!? Don't think you can just run off — come back here and finish talking things through with Natasha.
6b3830ea8e70d9a0.Speaker: Seele

ed558569a2175781.ContentText: Hey! There are still wounded here that need our help!
ed558569a2175781.Speaker: March 7th

463cc5327b649f34.ContentText: Got all your intel? Come on, let's head over to that Great Mine, or whatever they call it.
463cc5327b649f34.Speaker: March 7th

c080296267687257.ContentText: I told Antonia from the beginning: We never should have let those vagrants mine with us. I wouldn't be in this mess if it weren't for those thugs.

f427d285512978a4.ContentText: Enough already. Nobody has it easy — this is a time to help each other out.

74f2206b6376a41b.ContentText: I remember one of your uncles had to flee Rivet Town, which makes him a vagrant too, right? Would you drive him away?

3fecbb7c554a52f0.ContentText: ...He's family. The other vagrants aren't my problem.

2e0fb6de39574cac.ContentText: Have any of you seen my husband? He's a good-looking guy — tall and thin...

63d9d3b58dab8516.TitleText: Wildfire Member Caring for the Injured
63d9d3b58dab8516.ContentText: You again? Quit joking around! No need to add to the confusion.

9863e4c3ad8e9a43.ContentText: *sigh* You think I'm joking? I saw you taking down the names of the miners — that's why I came over.

d41e01be59f7cb79.TitleText: Wildfire Member Caring for the Injured
d41e01be59f7cb79.ContentText: Oh... You can put the name down here.

bf997b4c61926065.ContentText: Peak... he's done for. He was asleep in there.

10c4aa8b3ff41ed2.ContentText: Easy, Dr. Natasha told you to rest. What if your wound opens up again? Besides, Elaine will get him out, she's a reliable girl.

65275d4432cfc942.ContentText: Elaine was in there too!? Quick, we have to—

93e20894a743f235.ContentText: Calm down and stop worrying. Wildfire's already gone in.

418c29a09df3e5c1.ContentText: What kind of days are we living through...

e87a4faa19e171c0.ContentText: Svarog? I don't know much. The underground is in turmoil, everyone's focused on their own issues. Who has time to get involved in someone else's affairs?

951fbd9167713d27.ContentText: I heard the vagrants say Svarog was protecting their base near the Furnace Core. Tsk, and there I was thinking he was one of the good guys.

e7511b986f60ac1e.ContentText: Huh? What are you trying to say — that it's my fault?

a662c98057974f0d.ContentText: Forget it, I'm just tired, that's all.

3ae4af8938de047c.ContentText: Even if those vagrants have no home to return to, they still have their dignity. They won't accept charity forever.

a538dd6ead155113.ContentText: They needed honest work to get them through this hardship. So, I let them join the mining team. Can anyone really say I did wrong?

204cab76edc1910a.ContentText: The problem started with them leaving home and being dependent on charity... If you want something to blame, blame life in the Underworld.

f567795f73b140d9.ContentText: *sigh* When it boils down to it, they only chose to form a clique because the other miners never truly accepted them... I should've seen it.

73aa1f67b7112358.ContentText: They're a reliable group. Trust me, if we didn't have them, this area would be packed with monsters already. Just like Rivet Town.

e1780f6bbaf1618c.ContentText: I'm about to take the mining team over to Dr. Natasha. Take care of yourselves.

fd667cf84303ea91.ContentText: Ah, young {F#lady}{M#man}. This isn't the best place for a chat. Let's keep things brief.

5ac6e0d45d94b93c.ContentText: Svarog? He's an artificially intelligent being from the Old World. He was here when the underground was first constructed. That's about all I know.

b501eedc8c27f2e7.ContentText: Now he guards the Furnace Core hub. Many vagrants have established bases in the vicinity, seeking Svarog's protection.

07324ce39415aede.ContentText: You got the gist from Natasha, right? The miners and vagrants came to blows over the vein, then Svarog's subordinates pushed everyone back.

64d45aebc58dc381.ContentText: Well, perhaps their methods were lacking in finesse, but that's essentially what they did.

0bc280f5417b4f80.ContentText: You saw for yourself — after he pushed everyone back, he disappeared. It was clear: He didn't have any interest in the vein itself.

50b6de776f56d74b.ContentText: If you want my take, he prevented another Underworld conflict, even if the execution was rough around the edges.

f76eec80eb16aa82.ContentText: His behavior says something about his thinking: "As long as everyone's been driven out, the conflict is over."

882180f0a00fafec.ContentText: Well, I heard that she's a Silvermane Guard that was sent to arrest you. I expected you to be less friendly around each other... Are you worried about her?

f39f9ae7bec8fabd.ContentText: Oh, working together? Understood. Rest easy, I won't make things difficult for her.

999a7cdf906335ba.ContentText: Hahahaha, you needn't worry! That Silvermane girl wouldn't be afraid of an old veteran anyway.

f275aed61446fc83.ContentText: Really? I'm surprised. Still, you can rest easy, I won't make things difficult for her.

35b6e1118112b030.ContentText: We haven't seen a Silvermane Guard down here for a long time now. I just wanna ask her a few questions, nothing more.

bada3b094095f6b1.ContentText: It's getting late. You should go back to the town and get some rest.

01adc2fe74e9ba74.ContentText: Wildfire, the vagrants, Svarog... The changes in here are greater than I ever imagined. *sigh* What exactly did the Underworld go through after the Silvermane Guards left?
01adc2fe74e9ba74.Speaker: Bronya

5af5fcf4f92a60c5.ContentText: ...Sorry, did you have something you wanted to say to me?
5af5fcf4f92a60c5.Speaker: Bronya

b1806f0dae4ff856.ContentText: I think I know what it will concern. Even if Oleg wasn't looking for me, I would've looked for him.
b1806f0dae4ff856.Speaker: Bronya

5f4fd106a661cf3f.ContentText: I'm certain that the residents of the underground will have a lot they need to vent about. And as a Silvermane Guard, I have a lot that I need to ascertain. Nothing more.
5f4fd106a661cf3f.Speaker: Bronya

9ca1431ebb18f738.ContentText: According to Oleg, he's a robot that took part in the War of Defense over seven hundred years ago. He possesses a near-human intelligence, and rules over all the machinery in the underground...
9ca1431ebb18f738.Speaker: Bronya

21c49d167a9c3db9.ContentText: During {RUBY_B#War Against the Antimatter Legion}the war{RUBY_E#}, the Architects created astonishing mechanical soldiers, but the fight was so terrible that most were damaged or destroyed. The technology was lost.
21c49d167a9c3db9.Speaker: Bronya

a1674f3068abe46a.ContentText: ...If what Oleg says is true, then Svarog is an Architect creation leftover from the Old Era.
a1674f3068abe46a.Speaker: Bronya

22ee8128251e2e73.ContentText: We do? I hadn't realized. I've received rigorous military training — coordinating with soldiers under any circumstances is easy for me...
22ee8128251e2e73.Speaker: Bronya

722c2582a5dec413.ContentText: I admit, Seele is talented. We... do work well together. But that's all there is to it.
722c2582a5dec413.Speaker: Bronya

ed3ff38ae68b040a.ContentText: Hey... Thanks for your concern. You should head back to the town, and... I'll do the same when Oleg and I are finished.
ed3ff38ae68b040a.Speaker: Bronya

aeabfa242e569e43.ContentText: Oh, it's you... It looks like the conflict is over for now. Thank goodness, if the numbers of wounded had kept climbing, I don't know what we'd have done. If only he'd have been here...
aeabfa242e569e43.Speaker: Natasha

4457cc3eba1f50ac.ContentText: ...Now's not the time for those thoughts. I need to focus on treating the injured.
4457cc3eba1f50ac.Speaker: Natasha

b33be635dbbbc57d.ContentText: You've done enough. Treating the injured is doctor's work.
b33be635dbbbc57d.Speaker: Natasha

f42a384df385224e.ContentText: So if you're not hurt yourself, you should go back and get some rest. Relax, if I need your assistance, I won't hesitate to ask.
f42a384df385224e.Speaker: Natasha

75e79a45b0254d57.ContentText: ...Could you pretend like you didn't hear anything? Now's not the time.
75e79a45b0254d57.Speaker: Natasha

f5542c5f9e072df0.ContentText: The same to you and your friends. You've just arrived and already helped resolve such a sizable conflict. I don't know how to thank you.
f5542c5f9e072df0.Speaker: Natasha

771186575aa74b71.ContentText: You'd best get some rest back in town.
771186575aa74b71.Speaker: Natasha

64cd3c80edca38a4.ContentText: You guys have some moves. If you need my help with anything, just shout.
64cd3c80edca38a4.Speaker: Seele

e6c17678aa996235.ContentText: Hmph, it'll take more than that. But you're not as bad as I took you for. You walk the talk.
e6c17678aa996235.Speaker: Seele

58b35a8e5b83b6f3.ContentText: Huh, couldn't even give it a minute, could you?
58b35a8e5b83b6f3.Speaker: Seele

d72c28969f116cea.ContentText: I've been on my feet all day. I don't have the energy for more headaches right now. Let me catch my breath and I'll come find you tomorrow.
d72c28969f116cea.Speaker: Seele

051ec69d9204ac6d.ContentText: Oh, I wanted to ask you — that Bronya girl... Is she really a Silvermane Guard?
051ec69d9204ac6d.Speaker: Seele

99a0aca6734b60dc.ContentText: Oh? She heads up the force? Hm... Not bad.
99a0aca6734b60dc.Speaker: Seele

f3dcbaaea1e04c87.ContentText: No, no, she's got skill alright, I can tell she's got training.
f3dcbaaea1e04c87.Speaker: Seele

9aca98b81dcd5efe.ContentText: It's just... I thought that Silvermane Guards were all cold and unfeeling — they left the Underworld to perish. But she... doesn't give me that impression.
9aca98b81dcd5efe.Speaker: Seele

f505a6c04c6097a1.ContentText: Anyway, I've got stuff to report to the chief. See you around.
f505a6c04c6097a1.Speaker: Seele

e0838bbf1136cb4e.ContentText: Don't come any closer! The road's blocked — stay where you are!

f8957fd80416d82b.ContentText: ...Whoa, easy! Why are you hiding in there? Don't you know what happened in the mine?

636ad9c87858f471.ContentText: What's that got to do with us? Do you think we're the same as those thugs?

4f1ff1f0b93c6fb4.ContentText: Is anyone with you injured? We have a doctor. She can care for your wounded!

e1ad7fd0bbb8d6f0.ContentText: Yeah right, and you can guarantee that no one there with you is out for blood? I don't believe it. Stay where you are!

32565c6314a2bd32.ContentText: No good, all the components here are rusted. Let's keep looking.
32565c6314a2bd32.Speaker: Seele

dec300724b25c484.ContentText: The wheels are completely broken, but the connecting component should be pretty much okay. Let's remove it.
dec300724b25c484.Speaker: Seele

4219fcc5bda22d8e.ContentText: Ugh, where's the pin? Is there anything those vagrants won't steal?
4219fcc5bda22d8e.Speaker: Seele

c3d75ebd7a425897.ContentText: At least the chassis and the wheelset are relatively intact. Here, give me a hand removing the wheels.
c3d75ebd7a425897.Speaker: Seele

5e43ee3d5668604b.ContentText: Hmph, quick work. Y'know, I didn't think you guys had worked a day in your lives, but you know how to get your hands dirty.
5e43ee3d5668604b.Speaker: Seele

4a299ac797cc2558.ContentText: The cart is about to depart!
4a299ac797cc2558.Speaker: March 7th

04fbfc46d2283382.ContentText: The robots will have seized the road ahead by now. We should go carefully.
04fbfc46d2283382.Speaker: Seele

734a2f99892f782a.ContentText: Is this the right way? It looks like there's a roadblock up ahead.
734a2f99892f782a.Speaker: Bronya

b6f7eeab1b0d64af.ContentText: ...I'll be the judge of that. Come on, let's take a closer look.
b6f7eeab1b0d64af.Speaker: Seele

5f6d1a4f00e917a5.ContentText: Great, let's head back and fix the cart.
5f6d1a4f00e917a5.Speaker: Seele

ae0c3695a71af7c2.ContentText: Are you gonna do it yourself?
ae0c3695a71af7c2.Speaker: March 7th

b4ce60560b8df7d4.ContentText: Why wouldn't I? You've gotta be self-reliant down here. Watch, you might learn something.
b4ce60560b8df7d4.Speaker: Seele

3a4f9fbb0ad0463e.ContentText: Robots aligned against humans? I've never heard of such a thing. Machines should obey humans unconditionally...
3a4f9fbb0ad0463e.Speaker: Bronya

e9022ef25ee4af31.ContentText: That's not the only thing you won't have heard of down here, princess.
e9022ef25ee4af31.Speaker: Seele

34c1abebeba926d5.ContentText: Aha, and who do we have here? Do you know whose territory this is!?

a91aeafa86c64a8d.ContentText: Shut it, this isn't your territory. I'm in a hurry — I'll take you all in one go!
a91aeafa86c64a8d.Speaker: Seele

bf77b399c44e4e2c.ContentText: Oh, you must be Oleg's guests? Welcome to the Goethe Grand Hotel.

29cbe17f38859bc3.ContentText: Yep, you've probably seen that stylish Goethe Hotel above ground, right?

55bd3fc70fed0b9f.ContentText: Uhh, not the most pleasant memories of that place...
55bd3fc70fed0b9f.Speaker: March 7th

d456af88b784fdfa.ContentText: That's the above-ground branch of the Grand Hotel. A few hundred years ago, one ancestor of the Goethe family was ambitious, and sought to build something big from nothin'.

f2316db264d648f1.ContentText: He eventually realized his dream and opened a hotel branch in the most expensive area on the surface.

707413baa8362b70.ContentText: Hahaha, it's fine. You aren't the first guest to have that reaction.

f10781a0ba544ad7.ContentText: A few hundred years ago, one ancestor of the Goethe family was ambitious, and sought to build something big from nothin'. Eventually, he actually did it.

6f4a1fa8fdb41fce.ContentText: Have you seen that stylish Goethe Hotel? Strictly speaking, it's a branch of this Grand Hotel.

6cef8bd95826cf99.ContentText: ...People with big dreams have big determination.
6cef8bd95826cf99.Speaker: March 7th

8de65d4d48052d55.ContentText: Oleg wants me to take good care of y'all. Here's the key, you'll be stayin' in our most spacious guest room.

913d39148f287dea.ContentText: What do you think, {NICKNAME}? Should we go ahead and call it a day, or walk around a bit more first?
913d39148f287dea.Speaker: March 7th

5b732e1250f312de.ContentText: Time to rest again. I hope there aren't any surprises this time.
5b732e1250f312de.Speaker: March 7th

0942d00b490556e7.ContentText: That Oleg... he seems sincere. What do you guys think?
0942d00b490556e7.Speaker: March 7th

7c2c4b9b971d25f5.ContentText: Don't you have something cool to say, like "Appearances can be deceiving"?
7c2c4b9b971d25f5.Speaker: March 7th

391e67be5396c920.ContentText: *sigh* Happy now? {NICKNAME} is even starting to sound like you.
391e67be5396c920.Speaker: March 7th

0f528202d0542436.ContentText: It has nothing to do with me.
0f528202d0542436.Speaker: Dan Heng

383f0913b710711a.ContentText: Would you look at {NICKNAME}, blurting out something so irresponsible.
383f0913b710711a.Speaker: March 7th

7f96b00b9ca06999.ContentText: But if you ask for my opinion, it's better to be safe than sorry.
7f96b00b9ca06999.Speaker: Dan Heng

bdd791c5590bbc28.ContentText: Fine, we'll keep our guards up. Our last hotel experience was eventful, to say the least.
bdd791c5590bbc28.Speaker: March 7th

aa7be22316b0baca.ContentText: One of us should keep watch tonight.
aa7be22316b0baca.Speaker: Dan Heng

2862dfaacd7282ef.ContentText: K—Keep watch? Are we space cowboys now? I guess this is the cosmic wild west.
2862dfaacd7282ef.Speaker: March 7th

c7e53bdcc105181d.ContentText: N—No I don't! *pretend yawn* Besides, I've never pulled an all-nighter before! Do you know how bad it is for your skin?
c7e53bdcc105181d.Speaker: March 7th

2c03141ad32304d3.ContentText: Sure. I don't have much need for sleep.
2c03141ad32304d3.Speaker: Dan Heng

9d9f40b5e7685641.ContentText: You seem pretty exhausted, don't overexert yourself. I'll do it.
9d9f40b5e7685641.Speaker: Dan Heng

590121e59f68a44c.ContentText: Bronya, did you finish talking to Oleg? Hope he didn't make things difficult for you.
590121e59f68a44c.Speaker: March 7th

4f2c64265045f81e.ContentText: Not really, though it wasn't the friendliest conversation. We didn't see eye to eye on everything.
4f2c64265045f81e.Speaker: Bronya

fcfb061f48568927.ContentText: I've come to know a great deal in a short time — I doubt I'll be able to fall asleep tonight.
fcfb061f48568927.Speaker: Bronya

dbe0626fa3d41550.ContentText: I doubt I'll be able to sleep either... not that I don't trust you! It's just... you're a Silvermane Guard officer in the underground. There might be people looking to harm you.
dbe0626fa3d41550.Speaker: March 7th

a2bff81719c3507c.ContentText: I wouldn't be surprised if there are... the Silvermane Guards have a lot to make amends for down here.
a2bff81719c3507c.Speaker: Bronya

0e3e120e387c9b0d.ContentText: If someone had made a stand in the outset... and explained the consequences to Madam Cocolia... Forget it. It's meaningless to talk about it now.
0e3e120e387c9b0d.Speaker: Bronya

8827f404cea6dd0a.ContentText: You don't need to worry about me. Oleg guaranteed that I wouldn't be harmed. He seemed like a man of his word. Go and rest.
8827f404cea6dd0a.Speaker: Bronya

e08ff0434e5ff3d8.ContentText: (That voice again... such a strange dream.)
e08ff0434e5ff3d8.Speaker: playerboy

41264b5c035a4f11.ContentText: (May as well go for a walk if I can't sleep.)
41264b5c035a4f11.Speaker: playerboy

db8567f597f66f58.ContentText: ...It's you. Don't sneak up behind me next time. Lucky for you I wasn't armed.
db8567f597f66f58.Speaker: Bronya

5d42c1ed54968cd9.ContentText: No sleep for you either, huh?
5d42c1ed54968cd9.Speaker: Bronya

cfa0a60305dbffb7.ContentText: I understand. The more that weighs on your mind, the more your fears become dreamscapes.
cfa0a60305dbffb7.Speaker: Bronya

4de3440b493bd4ae.ContentText: I know what you mean. I don't like the feeling that I'm not in control. And now...
4de3440b493bd4ae.Speaker: Bronya

7c0d12123c5ea851.ContentText: ...You need someone to look after you.
7c0d12123c5ea851.Speaker: Bronya

fa4fb81a7fbe8ad0.ContentText: Actually, seeing as there's no one around... can I ask you some things?
fa4fb81a7fbe8ad0.Speaker: Bronya

0bcc05e186f22ca3.ContentText: This {RUBY_B#Source of the Disaster}Stellaron{RUBY_E#} you speak of... if you were to find it, how sure are you that you could stop the Eternal Freeze?
0bcc05e186f22ca3.Speaker: Bronya

5e3353e88f0f105a.ContentText: Your confidence actually makes me even more worried... This isn't like helping a child make a snowball.
5e3353e88f0f105a.Speaker: Bronya

b83771f0bd73225d.ContentText: I see... Well, thank you for being sincere. In itself, it's a comfort to me.
b83771f0bd73225d.Speaker: Bronya

495357f99bd6ad8c.ContentText: Is he your leader? I feel he possesses a great stillness of mind in everything he does.
495357f99bd6ad8c.Speaker: Bronya

1c1b15beccc3b52f.ContentText: You know, it was difficult for me to believe you. Some of the words you use are too alien for those that have lived their entire life in Belobog.
1c1b15beccc3b52f.Speaker: Bronya

96f7b3c70d406146.ContentText: As far as I was concerned, Madam Cocolia's order to arrest you sounded reasonable... but why didn't she issue it straight away?
96f7b3c70d406146.Speaker: Bronya

48751397aa3f8926.ContentText: She must have realized something about you... Something I haven't yet been able to perceive for myself, and it bothers me...
48751397aa3f8926.Speaker: Bronya

ca32758f66dfb40f.ContentText: What must have transpired to cause her such a drastic change? ...Still, orders are orders. It's not for soldiers to question their superiors.
ca32758f66dfb40f.Speaker: Bronya

0aeaa7a77e7b4bc8.ContentText: I don't need you to absolve me. The truth is, I didn't have every confidence that I was doing the right thing, but the sense of duty to carry out an order is bound to prevail with me.
0aeaa7a77e7b4bc8.Speaker: Bronya

b8b941a0768bce89.ContentText: I don't need you to remind me, and I didn't have every confidence that I was doing the right thing. But the sense of duty to carry out an order is bound to prevail with me.
b8b941a0768bce89.Speaker: Bronya

97798376c6590db2.ContentText: In the past, Overworld soldiers on the front line would lose their lives in droves, and yet the Fragmentum's advance would remain unaffected.
97798376c6590db2.Speaker: Bronya

196cf56e8326e3fb.ContentText: Madam Cocolia decided on a last-ditch offensive. She thought that if the surface fell, the underground would immediately collapse without source of supply. However, in the reverse scenario, humanity would hold out longer.
196cf56e8326e3fb.Speaker: Bronya

43e62785fcdc1504.ContentText: Nevertheless, that was her reason for deploying all the Silvermane Guards to the front line. The transport line for supplies and Geomarrow remained open, but the passage between the surface and the underground ceased. I approved of that decision...
43e62785fcdc1504.Speaker: Bronya

c93f617dbc8cb495.ContentText: I never thought that the Underworld would sink into such ruin without the Silvermane Guards... Perhaps mother was wrong...
c93f617dbc8cb495.Speaker: Bronya

a73d23d96f587e0e.ContentText: But how can I change her mind? I've tried, but she won't listen. I don't know how to get through to her...
a73d23d96f587e0e.Speaker: Bronya

28fa85d12bf8a917.ContentText: Help me change the mind of the Madam Guardian? Not easy. Nobody knows that better than I do.
28fa85d12bf8a917.Speaker: Bronya

19f18769bd444854.ContentText: ...What was I thinking!? No... I shouldn't... That was a diabolical thought!
19f18769bd444854.Speaker: Bronya

c3671551081eb0cb.ContentText: The more I think about it, the more disoriented I get, which in turn makes me think about it even more... I just want a better life for the people of Belobog...
c3671551081eb0cb.Speaker: Bronya

6a1f235a83de8402.ContentText: ...Maybe you're right, or not. Right now I just... need more time to think.
6a1f235a83de8402.Speaker: Bronya

8b5ee18434114519.ContentText: Walk with me. Let's forget our problems for a while.
8b5ee18434114519.Speaker: Bronya

f4dfc9958686d3c6.ContentText: ...I know. I'll go to Rivet Town and bring them back for you.
f4dfc9958686d3c6.Speaker: Seele

38fb7fe8e8565e66.ContentText: It's too dangerous to go alone. Get Oleg to send someone with you.
38fb7fe8e8565e66.Speaker: Natasha

6523f79e52d31929.ContentText: The rest of Wildfire has barely gotten any sleep the last few days. They should rest. They'd only be holding their eyelids open and slowing me down.
6523f79e52d31929.Speaker: Seele

0f78dda7d1a514e8.ContentText: Besides, didn't you say some of the miners were gravely injured? Lives are on the line...
0f78dda7d1a514e8.Speaker: Seele

c93dab6c6251569b.ContentText: Aren't you supposed to be sleeping? What are you doing out here?
c93dab6c6251569b.Speaker: Seele

8aba077dbb1bb382.ContentText: We're just having a walk. Neither of us could sleep. You can rescind your baseless accusations.
8aba077dbb1bb382.Speaker: Bronya

a93fadf1b4a2a3c9.ContentText: Easy, Seele, maybe they can help.
a93fadf1b4a2a3c9.Speaker: Natasha

0d5961bfc420e13b.ContentText: Hey, come on now, Seele's got a sharp tongue but a soft heart. She didn't mean anything.
0d5961bfc420e13b.Speaker: Natasha

87ffefc8046fe2f2.ContentText: Haha, oh yeah? Well look at you swaggering in like the protagonist in your own story.
87ffefc8046fe2f2.Speaker: Natasha

b9c5cdcefaa389d5.ContentText: Here's the situation: The clinic is packed full of people injured in the mines incident. Since you helped us resolve things, Seele and I have been busy caring for them.
b9c5cdcefaa389d5.Speaker: Natasha

37d193d73dd46044.ContentText: As you know, the underground is lacking resources to begin with. Add on the sudden nature of the incident, and it's no surprise that the clinic is almost out of medical supplies. We need to acquire more... somehow.
37d193d73dd46044.Speaker: Natasha

48735d8650042b24.ContentText: *sigh* The situation in other towns is even worse than ours.
48735d8650042b24.Speaker: Seele

2d88bbd17f227237.ContentText: You don't know him at all yet, do you? You can't rely on people like Sampo when it's important.
2d88bbd17f227237.Speaker: Seele

abcb59d9c282472e.ContentText: As the Fragmentum spreads underground, more monsters go roaming around causing trouble for all the towns. That means more vagrants in the mines.
abcb59d9c282472e.Speaker: Seele

396d7dc4113ce1d8.ContentText: The towns' resources have been swallowed up by the Fragmentum. To get anything now, people have to risk their lives!
396d7dc4113ce1d8.Speaker: Seele

1ce6f2226cf2a757.ContentText: ...Easy now, Seele. Anger isn't good for one's health.
1ce6f2226cf2a757.Speaker: Natasha

9b29902ab0527c4e.ContentText: Seele and I actually aren't from here. We both come from an industrial town to the north. A few years ago, the Fragmentum began to seep into the town center.
9b29902ab0527c4e.Speaker: Natasha

2b74afe9e42d1b78.ContentText: I used to manage an orphanage and clinic there, but after the Fragmentum corroded the area, I had no choice but to move here to Boulder Town. After all, I have to survive myself if I want to save more people.
2b74afe9e42d1b78.Speaker: Natasha

e401f9743f5be04b.ContentText: Go to a corroded town to collect some useful resources? I'm in.
e401f9743f5be04b.Speaker: Bronya

2a3c6bafaeae5718.ContentText: You want to come as well? But you look quite tired.
2a3c6bafaeae5718.Speaker: Bronya

bb2ad7bbcddcff59.ContentText: Hold up! I never said you could join us!
bb2ad7bbcddcff59.Speaker: Seele

abf9c5a76b4e7499.ContentText: People's lives are at stake. Why wouldn't you want another person to help? Besides, I have some experience with the Fragmentums. I'm sure I will be of use.
abf9c5a76b4e7499.Speaker: Bronya

4e4ca9b30473e2f6.ContentText: *sigh* Well... just don't slow me down!
4e4ca9b30473e2f6.Speaker: Seele

ad3209e1a0cd38f9.ContentText: —Seele's lack of outright rejection means she approves of you, hehe. With you all accompanying her, my mind will be more at ease.
ad3209e1a0cd38f9.Speaker: Natasha

3ceddbd8d480f296.ContentText: Come. Let me give you a list of materials we need.
3ceddbd8d480f296.Speaker: Natasha

eabd3dd1cc92ca7f.ContentText: The place you are going to is called Rivet Town. Follow the path through the mountains to the north for a bit and you'll arrive there.
eabd3dd1cc92ca7f.Speaker: Natasha

90822fc99dff90b4.ContentText: Let me think... I'm almost out of metal plates and bandages used for immobilizing broken bones. There's a market in the center of Rivet Town. Residents left behind piles of materials there when they evacuated. Please look for some there...
90822fc99dff90b4.Speaker: Natasha

e9ca69c022403705.ContentText: Oh! Also, rubbing alcohol. I kept a bunch at the orphanage, since the kids often got into tussles. I didn't bring it with me when I left... I hope it's still intact.
e9ca69c022403705.Speaker: Natasha

8f584bb7f37da0e2.ContentText: ...Lastly, painkillers. There should be a bunch stored in the old lab. Hopefully they haven't been destroyed by monsters...
8f584bb7f37da0e2.Speaker: Natasha

39f7bdb0e8d9f92b.ContentText: These should be enough to get by for a bit longer. Be careful. Don't push yourselves too hard.
39f7bdb0e8d9f92b.Speaker: Natasha

a3f78ba985a1885f.ContentText: Metal plates and bandages, rubbing alcohol, and painkillers... Got it, piece of cake.
a3f78ba985a1885f.Speaker: Seele

49bc7da1570e4e94.ContentText: Let's go, if we leave now we can still make it back before sundown. When it comes to helping injured people groaning in pain, the sooner the better.
49bc7da1570e4e94.Speaker: Seele

bc0f21cd973c4e3c.ContentText: Thank you, {NICKNAME}. If we hadn't run into you two, Seele would've had to venture into the Fragmentum on her own.
bc0f21cd973c4e3c.Speaker: Natasha

8b88fa1ec72ff01d.ContentText: I know it's not her first rodeo, but the thought of her taking on those horrid monsters... I can't help but worry.
8b88fa1ec72ff01d.Speaker: Natasha

1ca4e027a5937c4c.ContentText: Well, she grew up before my eyes after all. I don't want anything bad to happen to her.
1ca4e027a5937c4c.Speaker: Natasha

dbb68e0f8dca1f63.ContentText: I know, but she grew up before my eyes after all. I don't want anything bad to happen to her.
dbb68e0f8dca1f63.Speaker: Natasha

2e1ddc1695e7021a.ContentText: Seele has been like this since she was little — impulsive and eager to be the best. For people who don't know her, they might find her... difficult...
2e1ddc1695e7021a.Speaker: Natasha

4f5d9a404619c311.ContentText: But you can trust her, even with your life. Stick around a bit longer and you'll see what I mean.
4f5d9a404619c311.Speaker: Natasha

f160a88ea7a0fc47.ContentText: (This is a little far, I should follow Bronya.)
f160a88ea7a0fc47.Speaker: playerboy

09a1878c77712798.ContentText: I can't remember the last time I went for a walk like this. I never thought I'd take one through such a strange place, with someone I'd only just gotten to know.
09a1878c77712798.Speaker: Bronya

742c9571ebd7811f.ContentText: It's so quiet here I'm not used to it... *sigh* The quieter things are around you, the louder they are in your head.
742c9571ebd7811f.Speaker: Bronya

1b1ab37b67c4ffb6.ContentText: I'm surprised the vagrants in the Great Mine go after the mining teams, they must be desperate.
1b1ab37b67c4ffb6.Speaker: Bronya

3c5b31a517f9074d.ContentText: Still, whatever their situation, a crime is a crime. *sigh* How is the law supposed to find a balance between justice and compassion in the face of such complexity...
3c5b31a517f9074d.Speaker: Bronya

cd7717adf65c92bc.ContentText: I'm sorry, I said I'd forget such problems for a while... And, as expected, here they are keeping me company.
cd7717adf65c92bc.Speaker: Bronya

3a8c6b8cf48177d4.ContentText: Wildfire... I don't know anything about them. In all my time above ground, I never heard of this organization.
3a8c6b8cf48177d4.Speaker: Bronya

e52b2585e9dc97a5.ContentText: But their leader seems like a reasonable individual. Oleg and I have our differences in understanding, but we respect each other's opinion.
e52b2585e9dc97a5.Speaker: Bronya

3bb5979e9f022f36.ContentText: If we hadn't happened to be passing by... were you really planning to go into the Fragmentum alone?
3bb5979e9f022f36.Speaker: Bronya

f7c2379a4f4e4b65.ContentText: Of course. What's all the fuss about? I've done that loads of times.
f7c2379a4f4e4b65.Speaker: Seele

94c779952314b09f.ContentText: So reckless... According to the rules of the Silvermane Guards, any expedition into the Fragmentum must have a squad of at least four members, as well as a communications officer.
94c779952314b09f.Speaker: Bronya

9d501992208bb442.ContentText: Exactly, a rule of the Silvermane Guards. Don't apply your rules to us.
9d501992208bb442.Speaker: Seele

f6980b88a4cbe00b.ContentText: We're here. This is Rivet Town... *sigh* Everything looks familiar...
f6980b88a4cbe00b.Speaker: Seele

ae3dae06740d3040.ContentText: Let's go, and watch your step. I haven't been here in a long time. There are probably some monsters around.
ae3dae06740d3040.Speaker: Seele

998d42c93d5698e8.ContentText: We can't see anything here... Let's find higher ground to get a better view.
998d42c93d5698e8.Speaker: Seele

074f87fcf81fa441.ContentText: Way over there, see that house on the hill? That's Natasha's old orphanage.
074f87fcf81fa441.Speaker: Seele

9980c7f8f43e047d.ContentText: After Oleg found me, he sent me there. I spent over half my childhood in that place.
9980c7f8f43e047d.Speaker: Seele

2a9cae01d2a18fac.ContentText: Natasha said that the house was donated by some rich businessman. Whatever his business may have been, he must have been a good person.
2a9cae01d2a18fac.Speaker: Seele

94f0dbe746d8dd43.ContentText: Oh, I miss those carefree days as a kid...
94f0dbe746d8dd43.Speaker: Seele

5cf615c84f3636cd.ContentText: No, it's just... this place seems familiar somehow. Never mind.
5cf615c84f3636cd.Speaker: Bronya

db990e22b6896cf0.ContentText: Look down there. See the mess that remains of those old stalls? That's Rivet Town's market. The supplies Natasha wants are probably there.
db990e22b6896cf0.Speaker: Seele

5c2c7c08c8a78c57.ContentText: Let's keep moving. Watch out for monsters.
5c2c7c08c8a78c57.Speaker: Seele

f90b57b556586ed5.ContentText: These aren't like vagrants. They won't—
f90b57b556586ed5.Speaker: Seele

b6a79957fce156db.ContentText: Don't treat me like a new recruit. I'm all too familiar with the monsters of the Fragmentum. Let's get ready to fight!
b6a79957fce156db.Speaker: Bronya

77171dbd99894544.ContentText: Heh, the most famous restaurant in town. Natasha would bring the kids who behaved well here for a special meal.
77171dbd99894544.Speaker: Seele
