bb368569aa44caf5.ContentText: So did she ever bring you?
bb368569aa44caf5.Speaker: Bronya

331fb6036c3291be.ContentText: Do I seem like I was a goody two-shoes? Of course not.
331fb6036c3291be.Speaker: Seele

39434b71ed775464.ContentText: The facilities here seem to be in pretty good shape, not like those of a place that has been abandoned for years.
39434b71ed775464.Speaker: Bronya

88cad7f9ed60a447.ContentText: Now that you mention it, it does seem a little... Could people still be living here? Impossible...
88cad7f9ed60a447.Speaker: Seele

df8b6a12a2b401e0.ContentText: There's a bunch of crates piled over there. Maybe we can find what we're looking for.
df8b6a12a2b401e0.Speaker: Seele

8d5ac40b9ac5cb61.ContentText: Watch out for monsters. They like to hide. If you need to, clear the area before you dig for the supplies.
8d5ac40b9ac5cb61.Speaker: Seele

f10777d9a9e736b3.ContentText: Darn, how could they all be empty? Now even the monsters are gathering supplies?
f10777d9a9e736b3.Speaker: Seele

676d1978e09a27ef.ContentText: The monsters of the Fragmentum don't need any materials we humans use. And if they did take anything, this place would look much messier...
676d1978e09a27ef.Speaker: Bronya

2e8fc9f1becd6a9c.ContentText: You mean that someone else got here and took everything before us?
2e8fc9f1becd6a9c.Speaker: Seele

e5afb78123f9fc06.ContentText: It's just a guess, but there are also some footprints on the ground here.
e5afb78123f9fc06.Speaker: Bronya

9d73e3e8e069df2d.ContentText: *sniff* The scent of dirt is still fresh. They can't have come too long before us.
9d73e3e8e069df2d.Speaker: Seele

7c3365bf3035d796.ContentText: Let's go then. We need to find something, even if we have to search every corner of this market.
7c3365bf3035d796.Speaker: Seele

8b971fee3e7e3f13.ContentText: Hey, brat! How could you come here by yourself. Don't you know how dangerous this place is?
8b971fee3e7e3f13.Speaker: Seele

fd968a4b0e481355.ContentText: S—Seele? Y—You aren't the boss of me! I—I can go wherever I want, it's none of your beeswax!

06aaedf67f2a7f0a.ContentText: You took the materials and hid them all here? Not bad, kid.
06aaedf67f2a7f0a.Speaker: Seele

8cc10bffe9003d0d.ContentText: But if we didn't take care of those monsters, what were you planning to do? Just stay here, shaking in your boots?
8cc10bffe9003d0d.Speaker: Seele

2142f208ca46f27c.ContentText: Still stubborn, huh? Then tell me, how exactly were you gonna get those big metal plates out of here past those monsters?
2142f208ca46f27c.Speaker: Seele

cbd0ac4418146c72.ContentText: Wh—Who asked you to do anything? I was just about to escape, I didn't need your help at all!

7b7e0010f8da2b27.ContentText: Don't let him fool you. Everyone in the Underworld knows that this brat is a no-good thief. If I remember correctly, even the clothes you're wearing came off another kid's back?
7b7e0010f8da2b27.Speaker: Seele

cdaf5e1800c99a1e.ContentText: Don't be so polite to him. Everyone in the Underworld knows this brat is a no-good thief. If I remember correctly, even the clothes you're wearing came off another kid's back?
cdaf5e1800c99a1e.Speaker: Seele

27ea6c202f5cd3c1.ContentText: Tell us, what do you even want metal plates and gauze bandages for? We need them to save people.
27ea6c202f5cd3c1.Speaker: Seele

1732efabdc090f8b.ContentText: ...Are you kidding me? You want to negotiate?
1732efabdc090f8b.Speaker: Seele

55f3e589f0464269.ContentText: Me neither... I never bring my coin purse with me on a mission.
55f3e589f0464269.Speaker: Bronya

fce1cb936c336128.ContentText: It's just <unbreak>200</unbreak>... but I never bring my coin purse with me on a mission.
fce1cb936c336128.Speaker: Bronya

571d099b9ac6ec63.ContentText: ...Not much, but I didn't bring my coin purse.
571d099b9ac6ec63.Speaker: Bronya

bdeafdb557c8e3c2.ContentText: You're actually planning to give this little crook money? I'm telling you. This is his same old trick—
bdeafdb557c8e3c2.Speaker: Seele

fe899e5cb89b12cf.ContentText: No! ...Not this time. I really need money... my daddy...

4b37922509debf2c.ContentText: Pretending to use your dad again as an excuse... If he knew about this, you'd be in big trouble.
4b37922509debf2c.Speaker: Seele

5cea33cd8804ecea.ContentText: It's Eric, right? Here, you can have this.
5cea33cd8804ecea.Speaker: Bronya

de7165c5447736f3.ContentText: This is a medal given to me by the Architects... See that blue stone in the middle? That's a Geomarrow crystal of the highest purity.
de7165c5447736f3.Speaker: Bronya

1f5eb7dd5c3ee0dc.ContentText: You need money for your family, right? Take this and show it to a knowledgeable buyer, and they'll instantly know how valuable it is.
1f5eb7dd5c3ee0dc.Speaker: Bronya

8adcd1d47af82c6d.ContentText: But... you'll have to promise me one thing: You'll never steal other people's things again. Promise?
8adcd1d47af82c6d.Speaker: Bronya

a1db4c27d87b58c2.ContentText: I—I promise! I'll never steal things again!

2088a3ef06c0defe.ContentText: ...Then it's a deal. If you go back on your promise, I'm going to bring my Silvermane Guards with me and catch you myself! Here, take the medal and go back to the town. We already took care of any threat on the way. You'll be safe.
2088a3ef06c0defe.Speaker: Bronya

fc4d6a30073defe5.ContentText: Th—Thank you, whoever you are! You guys can take all of these things!

4e47b0370efdf314.ContentText: Y—You guys need to be careful, too! There seems to be something real scary in that house up on the hill...

a882be3f3d912cdf.ContentText: Oh, r—right! The road across from the market is blocked... If you wanna go further, you'll have to go to the shopping street.

799ac5e58ad3cc87.ContentText: Got it. Thanks for the tip.
799ac5e58ad3cc87.Speaker: Bronya

ba1bac1c2b7b33fd.ContentText: ...That object was pretty important to you, right?
ba1bac1c2b7b33fd.Speaker: Seele

60168e13fd156efa.ContentText: Are you sure you're okay just giving it to Eric like that?
60168e13fd156efa.Speaker: Seele

d05b57fe40272a20.ContentText: If it will make him change his ways, it's more than worth it.
d05b57fe40272a20.Speaker: Bronya

b58bc00a7e160cc3.ContentText: Hah, and what if he doesn't?
b58bc00a7e160cc3.Speaker: Seele

7ac3b1f7355417a1.ContentText: From a young age, my mother taught me to be forgiving and to preserve the goodwill in people's hearts... Even if I am but a small glimmer of light in this world, I must try my best to shine brightly for others.
7ac3b1f7355417a1.Speaker: Bronya

bc07c389e9c28522.ContentText: I must give him a chance, Seele, because other people can't.
bc07c389e9c28522.Speaker: Bronya

7df14c3daa66b9f1.ContentText: I don't really get what you just said. Anyway, ahem, we should get moving.
7df14c3daa66b9f1.Speaker: Seele

fb09fe34434490ce.ContentText: Eric said that we need to take the shopping street to go any further. I think I still remember where it is... this way.
fb09fe34434490ce.Speaker: Seele

7cc7602bffe4bbd7.ContentText: This is the street alright. The orphanage should be at the end.
7cc7602bffe4bbd7.Speaker: Seele

6a0d3582e202076b.ContentText: These shops and signs... Why do I feel like I've seen them before?
6a0d3582e202076b.Speaker: Bronya

97b201e0d0c674c4.ContentText: The entrance to the orphanage is up this way.
97b201e0d0c674c4.Speaker: Seele

19a63bd88d959e55.ContentText: I wonder what the old place is like now. Maybe some things will still look familiar.
19a63bd88d959e55.Speaker: Seele

2b858bcab5b87b48.ContentText: These stairs... they seem to have become more narrow.
2b858bcab5b87b48.Speaker: Bronya

adf5a82ed202fae1.ContentText: Almost there! I didn't expect this place to be so well preserved.
adf5a82ed202fae1.Speaker: Seele

00264e35d9f13160.ContentText: Y'know, if we could've worked together to push back the Fragmentum... maybe we wouldn't have had to take off and leave our homes behind.
00264e35d9f13160.Speaker: Seele

690ff7bae17cb8a6.ContentText: These crates have been sitting here for many years, right? Even if they have materials in them, are you sure they are still usable...?
690ff7bae17cb8a6.Speaker: Bronya

be0ec80c17a70ead.ContentText: Do you think undergrounders care about expiration dates? Even having any supplies is a miracle in itself.
be0ec80c17a70ead.Speaker: Seele

11a25bfce1246633.ContentText: How are they all empty? Who could've—
11a25bfce1246633.Speaker: Seele

64810ba934194484.ContentText: I've only seen this kind of monster before in the restricted zone...
64810ba934194484.Speaker: Bronya

8cb52a0521cef32a.ContentText: Hmph, I don't care how big you are. You dare sneak up on us from behind. This is it for you, pal!
8cb52a0521cef32a.Speaker: Seele

8b551df3771f2ff8.ContentText: Nah, I could've taken it on by myself. But still... fighting alongside you two was pretty fun.
8b551df3771f2ff8.Speaker: Seele

19efd9586308f7a2.ContentText: Please, you don't think I could do it? But still... fighting alongside you two was pretty fun.
19efd9586308f7a2.Speaker: Seele

c7f54b515b4879eb.ContentText: Should be all clear now. Let's poke around.
c7f54b515b4879eb.Speaker: Seele

1b18bd6a0d893574.ContentText: The kids at the orphanage were always getting into scraps when we played out here. If I remember it right, there ought to be some supplies for our cuts and bruises stored in that corner there.
1b18bd6a0d893574.Speaker: Seele

7460f76091c9dbc5.ContentText: I just hope the monster didn't get to them.
7460f76091c9dbc5.Speaker: Seele

caeb697946ef7356.ContentText: Huh? What are you talking about?
caeb697946ef7356.Speaker: Seele

b8146799fd963d32.ContentText: This building, this playground equipment... I've seen it all before.
b8146799fd963d32.Speaker: Bronya

78bacb723f014a3f.ContentText: What!? Come on, the overground and underground have been sealed off from each other for over ten years. It would've been news if a Silvermane Guard had come down here, let alone an Overworld princess.
78bacb723f014a3f.Speaker: Seele

4e255606109affb1.ContentText: ...Yes, it's a possibility. That would explain why my memory of it is so blurry.
4e255606109affb1.Speaker: Bronya

c901fc0e5117b930.ContentText: Come on, I need to look around a bit more before I can be sure...
c901fc0e5117b930.Speaker: Bronya

3b34340d6f25cd4f.ContentText: We've looked everywhere but here... I hope my memory is right.
3b34340d6f25cd4f.Speaker: Seele

b976d215b285a266.ContentText: It's... Ah! Yes, we found it!
b976d215b285a266.Speaker: Seele

20c13259112e60e0.ContentText: Great, and it's barely damaged! Nat wouldn't have expected her old supplies from years ago to have stayed in such good condition.
20c13259112e60e0.Speaker: Seele

a997916c2fa2848f.ContentText: You should still check the expiration date for things like rubbing alcohol. If it's expired, it won't be effective.
a997916c2fa2848f.Speaker: Bronya

ce908c5209402a61.ContentText: Hm, true. Let me check a few bottles.
ce908c5209402a61.Speaker: Seele

981e5d7d3f4e9f09.ContentText: This is... something from when I was a child.
981e5d7d3f4e9f09.Speaker: Bronya

ca00a0405bdb0347.ContentText: Wh—When you were a child!? Are you sure...?
ca00a0405bdb0347.Speaker: Seele

f8d2114b4be9b47b.ContentText: There is no such coincidence in this world. I remember now...
f8d2114b4be9b47b.Speaker: Bronya

a8a47d5a854f8515.ContentText: I—I used to live here... B—Before the Architects took me away, before Madam Cocolia adopted me... I used to live here! I'm... an undergrounder.
a8a47d5a854f8515.Speaker: Bronya

6fc592382d47c99c.ContentText: You're... an undergrounder? Wait a minute... you're saying that Cocolia, the Supreme Guardian, adopted you? Then—
6fc592382d47c99c.Speaker: Seele

234b4362c59ee584.ContentText: Yes. I'm the successor chosen by the Architects. In the future, I will become the guardian who leads Belobog.
234b4362c59ee584.Speaker: Bronya

085fa1adf4bb7997.ContentText: Why... Why didn't I remember this until now? My childhood memories are so blurry...
085fa1adf4bb7997.Speaker: Bronya

86a23fb6381b4e8e.ContentText: No, mother would never do that to me... there's no way she would.
86a23fb6381b4e8e.Speaker: Bronya

8aa004b5c49b1b59.ContentText: The Architects said that the guardian's successor is selected from among all people in Belobog. The selection process can take anywhere from a few years to a few decades.
8aa004b5c49b1b59.Speaker: Bronya

08e2aabe07fafdd8.ContentText: During that time, all children of the appropriate age in both the Overworld and the Underworld will be tested. In the end, only one child deemed as "worthy" will be chosen.
08e2aabe07fafdd8.Speaker: Bronya

736cb8a37c5fa45f.ContentText: I... must have been chosen from among the children here and then taken to the surface...
736cb8a37c5fa45f.Speaker: Bronya

ad500e28590c22aa.ContentText: The kids at the orphanage are always coming and going... I never thought that there would've been a future Supreme Guardian among us! Does Nat know about this? Could she have been keeping it a secret...
ad500e28590c22aa.Speaker: Seele

1dc1d6acfb31fef6.ContentText: ...I don't think she knows. The selection of the successor is done with utmost secrecy, and the child chosen must completely say goodbye to their past.
1dc1d6acfb31fef6.Speaker: Bronya

c7376494460c6765.ContentText: And thus... I became the daughter of Madam Cocolia. My only identity is that of guardian successor, but I'm... not good enough...
c7376494460c6765.Speaker: Bronya

1931aa9b4dcc6a94.ContentText: Every day I see Silvermane Guards sacrifice their lives in the Fragmentum, but I've never had the resolve to change mother's mind.
1931aa9b4dcc6a94.Speaker: Bronya

c60d38829b89fc0b.ContentText: The Underworld has been struggling, but I never tried to help. I didn't even know that it was my own home that had fallen into such a dire state...
c60d38829b89fc0b.Speaker: Bronya

6cc5468c1749d042.ContentText: In the end, I haven't been able to guard anything. How could they have thought I was worthy to be the successor...
6cc5468c1749d042.Speaker: Bronya

2dad5c0e6afc7cf9.ContentText: What? You thought I should feel sorry for you after your little speech? You can hide in your palace while you fuss over your Overworld problems, and on the front line it's not even you who's putting their life in danger. But in the Underworld, what do we worry about? If we'll have food for our next meal or survive to the next week!
2dad5c0e6afc7cf9.Speaker: Seele

7e6e1711527db8ae.ContentText: Even if I am but a small glimmer of light in this world, I must try my best to shine brightly for others. Didn't you say that? Well, if you really want to protect everyone, what are you standing here crying for? Get to it!
7e6e1711527db8ae.Speaker: Seele

646608e13d96f943.ContentText: You're right... You're right, self-pity doesn't help solve anything.
646608e13d96f943.Speaker: Bronya

fa11dafbc95fabac.ContentText: Thank you, Seele. Usually when I feel sorry for myself, I am met with gentle consolation. Never has anyone dared to be tough and make me snap out of it.
fa11dafbc95fabac.Speaker: Bronya

002b79090f1de3b7.ContentText: Hmph. I'm no good at consoling, but I can hit you on the head a few times. No problem.
002b79090f1de3b7.Speaker: Seele

2ada8b2089006ed0.ContentText: ...I can tell that you have a big burden to carry. Why do you force yourself to?
2ada8b2089006ed0.Speaker: Seele

68f5f4f2eafc207d.ContentText: ...As the successor to the guardian of Belobog, I must always be vigilant of my behavior and thoughts.
68f5f4f2eafc207d.Speaker: Bronya

ac97e51845a08c51.ContentText: Yeah yeah, Lady Bronya~ Hmph, Miss Future Supreme Guardian comes from the same orphanage as me... Who thought it would be a good idea to put us together, huh?
ac97e51845a08c51.Speaker: Seele

8ebe26ee9850f45a.ContentText: How about I show you around the orphanage a bit more? Unlike you, my memories from when I was little are crystal clear.
8ebe26ee9850f45a.Speaker: Seele

a9e4470b02c57d4e.ContentText: Okay, I'll indulge in old memories with you for a while.
a9e4470b02c57d4e.Speaker: Bronya

92db0ca91a539f1c.ContentText: (I should let those two be alone for a bit...)
92db0ca91a539f1c.Speaker: playerboy

c1f56b069afdaca5.ContentText: (The only thing left to find is painkillers. I'll see if there's any nearby.)
c1f56b069afdaca5.Speaker: playerboy

7d0fa7f52e5bfe2c.ContentText: Oh! It's here, we found it! Thank you, Perkins!
7d0fa7f52e5bfe2c.Speaker: Clara

8233a905027928a3.ContentText: Protect Clara. Initiating active defense mode—

97106fa90ba97b96.ContentText: I've seen this person before. {F#Sh—She's}{M#H—He's} not bad, right?
97106fa90ba97b96.Speaker: Clara

70b75b3dfb4586d0.ContentText: Command received. Danger removed. Deactivating active defense mode.

d3d2906b0aa1df2c.ContentText: This place is dangerous. You should leave.
d3d2906b0aa1df2c.Speaker: Clara

19b873a1bbdf3672.ContentText: Oh? I came here for these painkillers, too.
19b873a1bbdf3672.Speaker: Clara

9f11e5997b9034bb.ContentText: There are a lot of people hurt at the vagrant camp, I guess the miners are no different? *sigh* If everyone could just get along, things would be easier...
9f11e5997b9034bb.Speaker: Clara

0d9dd1af29976dd9.ContentText: Perkins is protecting me. I'll be alright. I'm going to leave after I gather up these painkillers.
0d9dd1af29976dd9.Speaker: Clara

6f9e1990eb416b34.ContentText: ...Uh, is that what you're here for too?
6f9e1990eb416b34.Speaker: Clara

a0bfa3a6602e5176.ContentText: That would make sense. I'm sure a lot of miners are injured, right? *sigh* If everyone could just get along, things would be easier...
a0bfa3a6602e5176.Speaker: Clara

4a35318dab08b9e5.ContentText: Mm... Here you are. I hope the medicine is of help to you...
4a35318dab08b9e5.Speaker: Clara

490b057c00864e8b.ContentText: Mr. Svarog, he... he's my family. I met Mr. Svarog when I was real little. He took me in and took care of me.
490b057c00864e8b.Speaker: Clara

efc313857c4622c2.ContentText: I'm really sorry about what happened back in the Great Mine... Mr. Svarog doesn't trust any humans besides me, especially everyone from Wildfire.
efc313857c4622c2.Speaker: Clara

59c281f053da12c1.ContentText: Mr. Svarog doesn't want to hurt people, but he always follows the calculations of his analysis. He thinks that interaction with humans is... inefficient.
59c281f053da12c1.Speaker: Clara

00b0a7f9cfc79ec0.ContentText: He heard that the miners and vagrants had begun to engage in a large-scale conflict... He wanted to stop everyone from getting hurt fighting over the mines.
00b0a7f9cfc79ec0.Speaker: Clara

9ae65779abbe99a4.ContentText: Wildfire wants everyone to leave the underground... But Mr. Svarog wants everyone to stay here. According to his calculations, the overground is already unsafe.
9ae65779abbe99a4.Speaker: Clara

1cda9171688dc335.ContentText: Yes, at least according to Mr. Svarog's calculations...
1cda9171688dc335.Speaker: Clara

99bd3368013defd2.ContentText: No, there can't be... Mr. Svarog is healthy, his system is always being maintained.
99bd3368013defd2.Speaker: Clara

1bb0a55fbe0bc51b.ContentText: Yes... Mr. Svarog is very stubborn.
1bb0a55fbe0bc51b.Speaker: Clara

61ebd79b2d5f8368.ContentText: He says that his responsibility is "preservation." To do that, he must make decisions that best protect humanity.
61ebd79b2d5f8368.Speaker: Clara

b796f191ae8d87a9.ContentText: I know that Wildfire wants to talk to Mr. Svarog... But no matter how many times you talk to him, Mr. Svarog won't change his mind...
b796f191ae8d87a9.Speaker: Clara

4752c388e2414246.ContentText: So, please trust me! I'll try to persuade Mr. Svarog. Hopefully, one day he will finally listen...
4752c388e2414246.Speaker: Clara

cc762580a1c4962f.ContentText: You're... Miss Seele from Wildfire? I came here to...
cc762580a1c4962f.Speaker: Clara

79de2affa518918c.ContentText: ...Why are you helping the vagrants look for medicine? If they're so great, how could they make a little girl go around running errands for them?
79de2affa518918c.Speaker: Seele

f9ae67bb70d78e8c.ContentText: N—No, it's not like that. I wasn't made to do anything... It's just that, the living conditions for the vagrants aren't great. There's not even a clinic in their camp. So, I wanted to help them out.
f9ae67bb70d78e8c.Speaker: Clara

689281b29274035d.ContentText: Also, not all of them are bad people... everyone just wants to survive.
689281b29274035d.Speaker: Clara

1a684544b702e86b.ContentText: Miss Seele, did this medicine belong to Miss Natasha? Then... can you give me some? The vagrants' injuries are quite serious.
1a684544b702e86b.Speaker: Clara

c78286cd16824546.ContentText: *sigh* I see. Let's split these painkillers then.
c78286cd16824546.Speaker: Seele

6c62d34bbec36622.ContentText: R—Really? We don't need to ask Miss Natasha first?
6c62d34bbec36622.Speaker: Clara

4ca5e8c4d605992f.ContentText: If I know Nat, she won't mind. Although this will make it more difficult for us... she'll understand. She always does.
4ca5e8c4d605992f.Speaker: Seele

2ba1a902bf65a857.ContentText: Are you leaving? This old town is too dangerous. We'll accompany you part of the way.
2ba1a902bf65a857.Speaker: Bronya

6d8bb75d6943a3f4.ContentText: I—It's fine, I have Perkins for company. And... I have some more things I need to look for here first.
6d8bb75d6943a3f4.Speaker: Clara

bb67a4da843a106d.ContentText: Metal plates and bandages... rubbing alcohol... painkillers. Great, that's everything.
bb67a4da843a106d.Speaker: Seele

4fe98ae36580c4dc.ContentText: Let's go report to Natasha in Boulder Town, it won't take long to get back.
4fe98ae36580c4dc.Speaker: Seele

a965bc1d249dd3c7.ContentText: ...We made it! It's been so long... but this place hasn't changed one bit.
a965bc1d249dd3c7.Speaker: Seele

53ba9a26a36fc13e.ContentText: Oh! It looks like there's a lot of stuff piled outside. Let's go see if there's any rubbing alcohol for Nat.
53ba9a26a36fc13e.Speaker: Seele

3b2f9782133bb8b9.ContentText: Hey, where are you going!? Let's look around the orphanage first.
3b2f9782133bb8b9.Speaker: Seele

bad2499c014b5f6a.ContentText: I found this. Here, take it.
bad2499c014b5f6a.Speaker: Seele

3c597b93bdbda973.ContentText: Natasha would often teach us how to make different handicrafts. This must be some kid's masterpiece.
3c597b93bdbda973.Speaker: Seele

9c11b96d2b7ae739.ContentText: And why give it to me?
9c11b96d2b7ae739.Speaker: Bronya

9d62444f3721eb57.ContentText: You gave your medal to that kid Eric. This thing might not be as valuable, but it's at least a replacement of sorts.
9d62444f3721eb57.Speaker: Seele

2bcd8b645f2ea1d6.ContentText: But didn't someone work hard to make this? I can't just take it from here...
2bcd8b645f2ea1d6.Speaker: Bronya

1ba4e2577a81c04e.ContentText: ...You sure are prissy, huh? Just take it.
1ba4e2577a81c04e.Speaker: Seele

d99ced5d574078bf.ContentText: What's up here? Some kind of toy?
d99ced5d574078bf.Speaker: Bronya

9e8c3060e1a3e971.ContentText: Yep. You pick, red or blue?
9e8c3060e1a3e971.Speaker: Seele

1cced6692503cbf0.ContentText: Ha! Look at this. After over ten years, the teeth marks are still here.
1cced6692503cbf0.Speaker: Seele

d626a42db5533c43.ContentText: Alright, well... this one time, a big kid was trying to steal this toy from me. I couldn't outwrestle him for it, so I just bit down hard and hung on for dear life.
d626a42db5533c43.Speaker: Seele

28d76d3c7387a86b.ContentText: This swing is covered in dust... Hey, don't sit on it! It's filthy!
28d76d3c7387a86b.Speaker: Bronya

80b1723734529e7a.ContentText: Ah, it sure brings back memories... I still remember one time I swung super high, and everyone was scared I would fly off.
80b1723734529e7a.Speaker: Seele

8f258fb7d1accb20.ContentText: ...Who knew swinging could be so intense?
8f258fb7d1accb20.Speaker: Bronya

dab6903f62b8637d.ContentText: At the time, I wanted to swing myself into the sky and fly up to the Overworld.
dab6903f62b8637d.Speaker: Seele

398de9b0c6d9b8a1.ContentText: So dangerous... You're lucky to have lived till now.
398de9b0c6d9b8a1.Speaker: Bronya

878d67b8cd219227.ContentText: Hehe, that's our Seele. Nothing if not punctual. So, did you find any usable supplies?
878d67b8cd219227.Speaker: Natasha

dae7f9d17f91c6c0.ContentText: Let me see... metal plates, gauze bandages, painkillers, rubbing alcohol... Perfect, that's everything I needed.
dae7f9d17f91c6c0.Speaker: Natasha

33f9d3c803a43ac1.ContentText: Huh... It's just, there are less painkillers than I'd expected. Did someone break into the storage room?
33f9d3c803a43ac1.Speaker: Natasha

a7d3160a53398964.ContentText: Hey, no need to lie, Nat wouldn't be upset about what we did.
a7d3160a53398964.Speaker: Seele

29c650021006fff5.ContentText: Clara had already arrived at the storage room by the time we got there. We split the painkillers with her.
29c650021006fff5.Speaker: Seele

97a6879612c5a613.ContentText: ...If she was there too then... I understand. She wants to look after the injured vagrants, right? Clara's always been a kind-hearted girl...
97a6879612c5a613.Speaker: Natasha

2d5259b09e8e597c.ContentText: I think you made the right decision. Still, it means I'm going to have to draw up a detailed dosage plan.
2d5259b09e8e597c.Speaker: Natasha

543f821989bc3106.ContentText: Hey, don't worry. I'll help you.
543f821989bc3106.Speaker: Seele

98d073a7bd47a40d.ContentText: Um, no need. I'll handle the clinic. I assume you three have more important things to be getting on with, right? Oleg will be waiting, not to mention your two companions.
98d073a7bd47a40d.Speaker: Natasha

a7fd22743c7779a6.ContentText: So you guys aren't that close after all? I thought you were sworn friends.
a7fd22743c7779a6.Speaker: Bronya

bfc54f65cec6eb5e.ContentText: Haha, you're adorable, Bronya. {NICKNAME} was obviously joking~
bfc54f65cec6eb5e.Speaker: Natasha

d0a1d77491261edf.ContentText: I'm sure they won't mind, they seemed in good spirits.
d0a1d77491261edf.Speaker: Natasha

d5fce411465c5cef.ContentText: I bet old Oleg wants to talk about Svarog. We should get going — sorry Nat, we'll have to leave the wounded to you.
d5fce411465c5cef.Speaker: Seele

42c9d38a423e2b5d.ContentText: No worries, I hope things go smoothly.
42c9d38a423e2b5d.Speaker: Natasha

6a72b68410b33c48.ContentText: Aren't you? We didn't get any rest last night.
6a72b68410b33c48.Speaker: Bronya

c483b02256087769.ContentText: You're gonna have to step it up, y'know. My record is six days no shut-eye.
c483b02256087769.Speaker: Seele

bc978bd8084d4743.ContentText: Ha, that's nothing — the unannounced disappearance record-holder is right here!
bc978bd8084d4743.Speaker: March 7th

25e49b7d3e544f9a.ContentText: And that's something to be proud of?
25e49b7d3e544f9a.Speaker: Dan Heng

672259e1874ca97a.ContentText: ...Uh, I wasn't worried about you. If you must know, I was wondering if Bronya was okay.
672259e1874ca97a.Speaker: March 7th

834fb9856f9d3d9d.ContentText: Oh please — you've barely sat still since they left.
834fb9856f9d3d9d.Speaker: Dan Heng

73324ec15b92107e.ContentText: Hahaha, it's good to have everyone back together. Let me get straight to it...

cd6d5cc98a254921.ContentText: Regarding this "Stellaron" and your predicament in the Overworld, your friends have gone over both with me again.

230502d094f85ba0.ContentText: The last time I saw Cocolia, she was an impressive young lady... I never thought that after becoming the guardian...

311b109799486873.ContentText: All I can say is that I sympathize with your situation. Rest easy. Wildfire won't go behind your back on this.

af93de9fdcd61e6a.ContentText: Your plan sounds a bit like the ravings of a drunken miner, but at least you're offering a road forwards. We Underworlders haven't had a road to anywhere for a long time now, and you can see how things have become. I'm willing to give you guys a shot.

84fd180b349df471.ContentText: Don't worry, Mr. Oleg, we'll make sure you don't regret it!
84fd180b349df471.Speaker: March 7th

146b9f8e4e00c9cc.ContentText: Ravings of a drunken miner is a little harsh.
146b9f8e4e00c9cc.Speaker: Dan Heng

dd867ca6cfc95ded.ContentText: Maybe it is! But I think we need to set our sights on something a bit more realistic. You guys want to know the whereabouts of the Stellaron. Wildfire wants to remove the restrictions on the Underworld...

720862afb110125c.ContentText: In other words, Svarog is the target of both our efforts. If we can't deal with the boss, we can't deal with anything.

9ab8ed97b8061bf7.ContentText: Diplomacy before violence. We should try peaceful communication first.
9ab8ed97b8061bf7.Speaker: Dan Heng

6d7c60761a8c093f.ContentText: Both your approaches have merit. We would always rather avoid losses and settle matters through peaceful means. But if the situation changes, we must be prepared for armed conflict at a moment's notice.

1814223b08a6041a.ContentText: Hmph, he wouldn't understand — you're forgetting he's a robot. It'd be faster to smash him to scrap metal!
1814223b08a6041a.Speaker: Seele

bfacfe7d227a3256.ContentText: We should make preparations for both approaches. Of course, it's better to settle matters through peaceful means. But if the situation changes, we must be prepared for armed conflict at a moment's notice.

4cf962ecd48fbc50.ContentText: Wildfire has tried many times to make contact with Svarog — without success. He has no intention of engaging with us.

ceb6bce4912fd9d1.ContentText: At our current strength, it would be incredibly dangerous to use force. Svarog's robots don't fear sacrifice, and I don't want to risk Underworld lives.

a08ceedd9e0d062e.ContentText: But things have changed — your arrival constitutes an "external variable" for Svarog. I may not have the full picture, but perhaps you guys have an opportunity to sway him.

224a50d55aad3137.ContentText: Hahahaha! Our scheme is coming along nicely! But I fear that Svarog just isn't the swaying type. *sigh* You'll understand when you get to his territory. Things never run smoothly down here.

9bfd02cbf0a7df0c.ContentText: What about you, Miss Silvermane? You're the only one here that isn't compelled to do or die with Svarog. I'd like to hear your plan.

78f5044b155ed47b.ContentText: The Underworld is still a part of Belobog. If Svarog's existence constitutes a threat to the people here, I will of course stand with you.
78f5044b155ed47b.Speaker: Bronya

0ae11cc3124453dd.ContentText: Hahaha, excellent! An enlightened answer, young lady — and spoken like a true successor to the guardianship.

b0dcfebae3e041da.ContentText: Seeing as we're all on the same side, there's no reason to delay. Let's go, I've arranged for a guide to take you to Svarog.

5e75b0b3dbc35e23.ContentText: Wildfire's relationship with Svarog has been hostile for a long time now, accompanying you would only lead to misunderstandings. We'll be nearby, awaiting orders. If things go south, we'll be there in no time.

043a72abad2fd3e8.ContentText: Seele, perhaps you can take our outsider friends the rest of the way.

033fbe1377fdd6f0.ContentText: So you're not the guide Mr. Oleg was talking about, Seele?
033fbe1377fdd6f0.Speaker: March 7th

0b37c0cdd95e0cd1.ContentText: No, Oleg didn't assign that to me. But I've got a pretty good idea who it's gonna be.
0b37c0cdd95e0cd1.Speaker: Seele

83d32bf98a1bf657.ContentText: I guess Sampo. Businessman, magician, liar, and now guide... This kind of work was made for him.
83d32bf98a1bf657.Speaker: March 7th

20b207a617ccd8d5.ContentText: It's nothing, it just feels like people are getting along better since your unannounced disappearance...
20b207a617ccd8d5.Speaker: March 7th

472459a6ee871091.ContentText: So, The Moles are a part of Wildfire...
472459a6ee871091.Speaker: Dan Heng

a596b506babdb69a.ContentText: Th—That's right! It's me, Pitch-Dark Hook the Great! What do you want?
a596b506babdb69a.Speaker: Hook

04a2905e5575d979.ContentText: Uh, kiddo, I think there's been a misunderstanding...
04a2905e5575d979.Speaker: Sampo

945e625589299316.ContentText: I will be your guide, friends. By order of Chief Oleg...
945e625589299316.Speaker: Sampo

422dc44e813b6aff.ContentText: I gotta say I'm a little upset at the thought of you choosing a toddler over your old buddy Sampo...
422dc44e813b6aff.Speaker: Sampo

dd0df2c6e63b392e.ContentText: Alright, alright, don't get started. But I wanna ask you something: Everyone in Wildfire knows the location of Svarog's lair. Why do we need you as a guide?
dd0df2c6e63b392e.Speaker: Seele

e7f2b64652a83134.ContentText: *sigh* My specialties in the field, perhaps? Wildfire may know where the base is, but have they ever been inside?
e7f2b64652a83134.Speaker: Sampo

413af03cd6e8d785.ContentText: ...No. But I've felt my way around the outside and picked up more than a few clues. I can help you. You have my word.
413af03cd6e8d785.Speaker: Sampo

e6c8d234a8264162.ContentText: Hey, what are you trying to say!? Name me someone above or below ground that walks the talk like Sampo Koski.
e6c8d234a8264162.Speaker: Sampo

9168442d9d8299ab.ContentText: Hey, what are you trying to say!? You guys wouldn't have even gotten to know Wildfire without my help, right?
9168442d9d8299ab.Speaker: Sampo

f7b666a8fba7bd60.ContentText: Hey! That's not nice! Wildfire made a request and I got on with the job.
f7b666a8fba7bd60.Speaker: Sampo

a585c0a1f3b986e1.ContentText: My legacy will prove that Sampo Koski was nothing but a willing and devoted servant of—
a585c0a1f3b986e1.Speaker: Sampo

5ac665f42da6fbbe.ContentText: Ugh, enough! Jeez! We believe you, okay? Show us the way already.
5ac665f42da6fbbe.Speaker: March 7th

b07187eaaed50e47.ContentText: This is Svarog's lair? I thought it'd be cold and lifeless, turns out it's pretty busy!
b07187eaaed50e47.Speaker: March 7th

d87e06b538d6120c.ContentText: Many vagrants are staying here temporarily. Their homes were overrun by monsters.
d87e06b538d6120c.Speaker: Seele

07321a0364286be0.ContentText: Isn't it dangerous for them to make camp right under Svarog's metal nose?
07321a0364286be0.Speaker: March 7th

9af6b49d23f19123.ContentText: No. Svarog may be ruthless, but he never attacks without reason. For those with no home, this is actually a safe place to be.
9af6b49d23f19123.Speaker: Seele

ed5e02a42c0e74da.ContentText: Hm... If I hadn't moved away when I did, I'd probably be where they are right now.
ed5e02a42c0e74da.Speaker: Seele

906c06659cfefee6.ContentText: Alas, this place is a bit of a mixed bag — plenty of... "characters." Keep your wits about you, friends. Don't let anyone deceive you.
906c06659cfefee6.Speaker: Sampo

b50173fc5c3a3561.ContentText: It's all good. We've had you for practice.
b50173fc5c3a3561.Speaker: March 7th

00b0346e694b4449.ContentText: Y'know missy, you sure know how to bear a grudge.
00b0346e694b4449.Speaker: Sampo

93c0f5d2ac062daa.ContentText: What a heavy gate... Okay, watch this!
93c0f5d2ac062daa.Speaker: March 7th

f70192535890fe32.ContentText: Is that a secret code or something?
f70192535890fe32.Speaker: Bronya

c566ffaf31e6f310.ContentText: It's an imaginary password that children like to use... and I don't think it's going to be of much use.
c566ffaf31e6f310.Speaker: Dan Heng

52e09a7571390d88.ContentText: I was just about to get into those, before Miss March's colorful attempt.
52e09a7571390d88.Speaker: Sampo

64c9e83c78c981bb.ContentText: Whoa, whoa! Pry it open? In front of all these vagrants and robots? They have eyes, you know.
64c9e83c78c981bb.Speaker: Sampo

df707644b9188372.ContentText: Luckily for us, I've already figured out the mechanism for this gate. They don't just let any Joe Shmoe in and out of Boss Svarog's territory. I mean, If you wanna see the big cheese himself, you need "certification."
df707644b9188372.Speaker: Sampo

1136544baf4c2a55.ContentText: Correct, only {RUBY_B#Svarog's Scavengers}prospectors{RUBY_E#} with the right certification can get in or out. These prospectors collect mechanical remnants from all over the underground, and then bring them to Svarog for him to repair.
1136544baf4c2a55.Speaker: Sampo

8f421a53f27d00c4.ContentText: Honestly, it's a very profitable little venture. If only I'd beaten him to it... Hehe, they'd be calling me Sampo "Boss-ki" by now...
8f421a53f27d00c4.Speaker: Sampo

40bb7694f55e06e8.ContentText: ...Time out. Where do we get this "certification"?
40bb7694f55e06e8.Speaker: Seele

7457789f219b47d7.ContentText: That's simple. You see the robots over by the vagrants? They're all Svarog's scouts — every one of them is commanded to maintain order here.
7457789f219b47d7.Speaker: Sampo

f29a16a764fb1cce.ContentText: Apart from them keeping a watchful eye on these hooligans, another one of their duties is "processing." Anyone who wants to become a {RUBY_B#Svarog's Scavengers}prospector{RUBY_E#} has to pass a test from these walkin' stoplights first.
f29a16a764fb1cce.Speaker: Sampo

768772d10bc68b5e.ContentText: Not a clue, I never had the urge to go on a Svarog suicide mission before. You guys are the ones that want in, why not go and ask the robots?
768772d10bc68b5e.Speaker: Sampo

28c7705a4ec4a515.ContentText: It feels like the people here are all under the supervision of robots...
28c7705a4ec4a515.Speaker: Bronya

a36e36628f140584.ContentText: This would be unthinkable on the surface. Robots are merely tools in the Overworld.
a36e36628f140584.Speaker: Bronya

ae896698f93e455c.ContentText: Don't take Svarog as an ordinary robot. He's, uh... special.
ae896698f93e455c.Speaker: Seele

1a07809017f790ed.ContentText: This has to be one of them, right?
1a07809017f790ed.Speaker: Seele

ec14e2892504516a.ContentText: Is it even awake in there? Maybe it's broken down.
ec14e2892504516a.Speaker: Seele

3422d91462ddd67c.ContentText: Certification failure... Subject has yet to obtain access permissions. Launching processing.

8e5de71c91710f27.ContentText: Launching stage one processing. Please listen to the following question...

e08f452399607e1e.ContentText: Who is the reigning champion of the Internal Combustion Engine Rap Tournament?

a3da15aff1aa4196.ContentText: Infernal construction what now? How would we know anything about that!
a3da15aff1aa4196.Speaker: March 7th

3307dd329851d75b.ContentText: Sampo, do you know the answer?
3307dd329851d75b.Speaker: Dan Heng

245714ca03d8cf67.ContentText: Sampo Koski always knows the... Wait, what did it say again?
245714ca03d8cf67.Speaker: Sampo

51a977a8e9bc197f.ContentText: Ugh, aren't you supposed to be dependable?
51a977a8e9bc197f.Speaker: March 7th

7b17a6e2b92c2c00.ContentText: Well, I don't know everything. *sigh* Sometimes you've gotta ask around if you wanna know the answer. Don't panic... Let's listen in to what these vagrants are talking about, we might just hit the jackpot.
7b17a6e2b92c2c00.Speaker: Sampo

3aca532bc7f3b7c1.ContentText: Please answer the following question: Who is the reigning champion of the Internal Combustion Engine Rap Tournament?

d42980d93d3ea001.ContentText: ...Uh, y'know friends, if you don't know the answer, you don't have to pretend you do. No one's gonna laugh at you.
d42980d93d3ea001.Speaker: Sampo

2a12d6b7749ff38b.ContentText: Reassessing... Subject threat index: high. Initializing combat module. Threat elimination activated.

a1a9db7e077e91af.ContentText: Combat module? This thing's faulty, right...?
a1a9db7e077e91af.Speaker: March 7th

5f8606b9dd268ea0.ContentText: Wishful thinking, it's about to attack!
5f8606b9dd268ea0.Speaker: Seele

1c86798647fb3dc6.ContentText: Whoa! Was that a lucky guess? *gasp* Did you go to a music festival without us?
1c86798647fb3dc6.Speaker: March 7th

5e177930a275a32c.ContentText: Certification result: success. Requisite certifications remaining: two.

8ccaa78f14478329.ContentText: My right hand? Here you go. Why is this part of the— Hey, hey! Ow, ow, ow!
8ccaa78f14478329.Speaker: March 7th

b2e902af8d0a994a.ContentText: Great, only two more steps to go. Let's move.
b2e902af8d0a994a.Speaker: Sampo

6279c0becbe9ee5c.ContentText: Yo, yo, listen up. This one's for all you pretend rappers...

218c6ea6b4224473.ContentText: Internal Combustion Engine champion — <unbreak>88</unbreak> Degrees Bedrock — reppin' the dawn of the Underworld rap. Here's something to wake up your soul, check it...

6ef0e96566f7eb52.ContentText: Phew...That was scary, it just suddenly attacked!
6ef0e96566f7eb52.Speaker: March 7th

b1136b3adb824e12.ContentText: This button says "system reset." Let's give it a try.
b1136b3adb824e12.Speaker: Dan Heng

8dcbfc0320e0afce.ContentText: Protocol... initiating. Scanning... Ugh. I'm so sick of repeating this.

afb352aaa3c0437e.ContentText: Ha? What did this bucket of bolts just say?
afb352aaa3c0437e.Speaker: Seele

552f6bc24096dc37.ContentText: Seems like this one's got a temper...
552f6bc24096dc37.Speaker: March 7th

0f895dfadd80dad7.ContentText: Ugh, let's get this over with. Did you get your first certification? If not then you're wasting your time.

ddf98ff3e77ade2c.ContentText: Yeah, yeah, whatever... Here comes your question, listen up.

4cdda9eb091752fd.ContentText: Riddle me this: A microcrystalline unit should be connected to which component?

484dbdd95bb22bc3.ContentText: Simple question, terrible answer. It's back to school for you!

e7f5bbce170d32b4.ContentText: ...{NICKNAME}, can I smash this can opener already!?
e7f5bbce170d32b4.Speaker: March 7th

ee127fd12d1ea088.ContentText: Huh!? You wanna go? You caught me in a bad mood, let's do this!

08c574a127d33107.ContentText: If we turn you into scrap metal, we still get our certification, right? Suits me!
08c574a127d33107.Speaker: Seele

710276e80469253d.ContentText: ...{NICKNAME}, can I smash this can opener already!?
710276e80469253d.Speaker: March 7th

619a8ff888e67ec0.ContentText: Ugh! Now I have to do this again. Put your hand out.

1e591dbd1c1a5e13.ContentText: What are you doing? I meant her, give me your hand!

75f359a3c5e84cf6.ContentText: Huh? Me again? It hurts, y'know!
75f359a3c5e84cf6.Speaker: March 7th

996cebc55cc69e0a.ContentText: There, one step left. Now get outta here and leave me in peace...

1f8309cec69c5c0d.ContentText: You don't know the answer? That's lame. It's back to school for you!

8120fa9ef2e0e23d.ContentText: No, no, no! You can't insert the microcrystalline unit into the heat sink substrate like that.

3d8f32853942d652.ContentText: How do you know? Balaway from Miner's Lamp said that you need to pay attention to the interfaces when assembling relics.

c0ac908ea092a9b5.ContentText: To make this thing move again, we need to connect the microcrystalline unit to the operating brake module. Otherwise, it's just a pile of scrap metal.

271bdc96c47b1d3a.ContentText: If you believe a word that senile idiot Balaway says, you're done for. The last time he acted on his own advice, he electrocuted himself.

7ff70e8d485ee403.ContentText: You should be asking people with real smarts. No one is better at fixing machines than Marev.

c33840c8b52a97b0.ContentText: I saw him connecting a microcrystalline conductor unit to a logic control hub to get a vibrating drill to work.

3eb85696e3c38024.ContentText: Haha, Marev!? Him and his brother wouldn't know a real relic if it hit 'em in the face. Last I heard, he got scammed by someone selling counterfeit junk.

485b9ac074adde31.ContentText: Ahh, you're just salty, my friend!

b404efd7a7e3117c.ContentText: ...Wait, have mercy! I'm sorry! One certification, coming right up!

57546d9b9a7ad6df.ContentText: Okay, please extend your right hand...

01a98ba5194d3176.ContentText: Not you, the girl over there!

5dad6748248b9256.ContentText: There you are, only one more to go. Now, please leave me in peace...

6a723fabc90a42bc.ContentText: Whatever the case, we'll need it to identify our certifications.
6a723fabc90a42bc.Speaker: Dan Heng

a5a3904db582cdc5.ContentText: There's something wrong with this one...
a5a3904db582cdc5.Speaker: Seele

42b3cd05f8d5996d.ContentText: System restoration failure. Core module damaged. External threat detected.

d735b30eda1c4ddc.ContentText: Threat elimination activated. Initializing combat module.

14eb788e814b6a03.ContentText: Ha! Finally, no more racking our brains. This rust bucket's about to meet its maker!
14eb788e814b6a03.Speaker: Seele

bc104697fd67a33a.ContentText: Ha! Learned how to behave now?
bc104697fd67a33a.Speaker: Seele

d95659a2eaa6b74d.ContentText: Let me try and reset its system...
d95659a2eaa6b74d.Speaker: Dan Heng

964860f6c254a3f3.ContentText: ...Certification system online. Please extend your right hand.

d59c581f937764e1.ContentText: Aaaah!!! How come it hurt even more than the other two!? Hmph, at least that's the final step...
d59c581f937764e1.Speaker: March 7th

27ccfe269b659b60.ContentText: We can get in now, right? Hehe, Svarog's certification system is no match for us!
27ccfe269b659b60.Speaker: March 7th

161564a02bcd683d.ContentText: This better work. Let's get back to the gate and give it a go.
161564a02bcd683d.Speaker: Seele

390020b8f6e20a4d.ContentText: See? Not so bad having Sampo on the team after all, right? Chief Oleg knew all along that I—
390020b8f6e20a4d.Speaker: Sampo

7b614a1764e42b3e.ContentText: Yeah, yeah, thank you very much.
7b614a1764e42b3e.Speaker: March 7th

aa974aa90d141d6c.ContentText: I'll commend you to the chief. No need to waste your time.
aa974aa90d141d6c.Speaker: Seele

17bfa28f46ae02b6.ContentText: Alright, well let me issue a warning now: Everything from here on out is uncharted territory — we must proceed with the utmost caution...
17bfa28f46ae02b6.Speaker: Sampo

e5b577fcd91b78ad.ContentText: Now to set the record straight with Svarog. Let's get in there!
e5b577fcd91b78ad.Speaker: March 7th

70d18485cac0841f.ContentText: ...Ugh! Did anyone hear what I just said?
70d18485cac0841f.Speaker: Sampo

5702b6b84395120e.ContentText: Ugh... Why is there another gate here!?
5702b6b84395120e.Speaker: Seele

06c532b601906e8e.ContentText: It looks like this gate has a more complicated structure than the last one...
06c532b601906e8e.Speaker: Bronya

b45bd9f5e3435d2a.ContentText: Ugh! Where did he run off to — he was just here a second ago!
b45bd9f5e3435d2a.Speaker: March 7th

c932884d576377fb.ContentText: It's that same type of robot again! Please don't tell me there's another round of "processing."
c932884d576377fb.Speaker: Seele

34b927dbf533b779.ContentText: Ooh, good plan! Treat the robots like guard dogs!
34b927dbf533b779.Speaker: March 7th

b2fbcde4389399f8.ContentText: ...How is that gonna improve our chances?
b2fbcde4389399f8.Speaker: March 7th

473f16559a95a1b2.ContentText: Are we gonna smash this one too? Count me in.
473f16559a95a1b2.Speaker: Seele

7821da0ec56546a9.ContentText: Certification failure... Subject has yet to obtain access permissions.

5a481be51815aed2.ContentText: Request rejected. Visitors must acquire access permissions from Miss Clara.

41968949247d61a2.ContentText: Clara? Oh, the girl we saw in the Great Mine?
41968949247d61a2.Speaker: March 7th

ef9bfb421cbce3eb.ContentText: We need to get permissions from her? What's she got to do with this?
ef9bfb421cbce3eb.Speaker: March 7th

97115275356cc0b8.ContentText: She's his "family..." Did you really forget?
97115275356cc0b8.Speaker: Bronya

d4c66d913d419053.ContentText: Don't trouble yourself about it. We need to find her.
d4c66d913d419053.Speaker: Dan Heng

1b6ddfccacf0d900.ContentText: ...I don't know if this will work, but it's worth a try: Where is Clara right now?
1b6ddfccacf0d900.Speaker: Dan Heng

dfd2f8595a3aec06.ContentText: The energy core's bearing component is broken... If we don't repair it soon, the settlement will be pitch-black.
dfd2f8595a3aec06.Speaker: Clara

5017266226873269.ContentText: Timmy, I'm going back to Rivet Town — maybe I can recover some usable components. You need to guard the gate while I'm gone.
5017266226873269.Speaker: Clara

5b713ff6c29658a4.ContentText: Recording recovery complete. Resuming execution of Clara's commands.

bc730ea3aefe09ae.ContentText: She went back? But we were just there. *sigh* Sounds like we better head over again.
bc730ea3aefe09ae.Speaker: Seele

9c07a751533e45c5.ContentText: Wait, you guys went sightseeing in another town?
9c07a751533e45c5.Speaker: March 7th

3e30709b6b9e34b7.ContentText: ...It wasn't as fun as you think.
3e30709b6b9e34b7.Speaker: Seele

1c34ac6cf4f00739.ContentText: Indeed. And that little girl heading into the Fragmentum all by herself... It doesn't bear thinking about.
1c34ac6cf4f00739.Speaker: Bronya

abf07e6428a3c1d6.ContentText: That little girl heading into the Fragmentum all by herself... It doesn't bear thinking about.
abf07e6428a3c1d6.Speaker: Bronya

59bfe05d20b598bf.ContentText: Her strength belies her appearance, but even so...
59bfe05d20b598bf.Speaker: Bronya

68df82b2e580bfd0.ContentText: You don't look so tough yourself. Well, let's find her. Svarog's not going anywhere.
68df82b2e580bfd0.Speaker: Seele

f292196a0863dd56.ContentText: This is a big town. Where should we start?
f292196a0863dd56.Speaker: March 7th

ea9cdcaaa220dd51.ContentText: Clara said she was going to find components, right? Let's start with Nat's storage room.
ea9cdcaaa220dd51.Speaker: Seele

fc1dd254ef3d83f4.ContentText: Isn't this the robot that was following Clara around?
fc1dd254ef3d83f4.Speaker: Bronya

ccc31e80f4d1455a.ContentText: ...These can openers all look the same. How can you tell them apart?
ccc31e80f4d1455a.Speaker: Seele

55660c4b737e2a45.ContentText: Shh, it's about to say something. Listen...
55660c4b737e2a45.Speaker: Bronya

7a5bd079ecb461a3.ContentText: In danger? What do you mean?
7a5bd079ecb461a3.Speaker: Seele

faf4ee4344bd4622.ContentText: Does it mean that a monster appeared over at the workshop? Clara, she...
faf4ee4344bd4622.Speaker: Bronya

b7e322920198e28c.ContentText: Not good. She's in danger! Quick. Let's head over to the workshop and check it out. I know the way.
b7e322920198e28c.Speaker: Seele

26c73c892335575d.ContentText: Just as we feared, there's something big over there! And there's Clara — we have to save her!
26c73c892335575d.Speaker: Seele

a8fa603c3cfcc86b.ContentText: Let's go. No need to fear. We have the numerical advantage.
a8fa603c3cfcc86b.Speaker: Bronya

05877e5f73029646.ContentText: Are you okay, Clara? Are you hurt?
05877e5f73029646.Speaker: Seele

f7050c6ba2745128.ContentText: Th—Thanks, everyone. I'm fine. Just a few scratches.
f7050c6ba2745128.Speaker: Clara

8aaae0573285ea2f.ContentText: You shouldn't be running around by yourself. It's too dangerous. What are you looking for here?
8aaae0573285ea2f.Speaker: Seele

b0cada30332246db.ContentText: There's a fault with one of the energy supply units at the base. If I don't repair it soon, everyone at the settlement will be affected.
b0cada30332246db.Speaker: Clara

2ed668387652bd92.ContentText: I knew there was a workshop in this town, so I wanted to try my luck here. I found all the components I need, but then I ran into a monster...
2ed668387652bd92.Speaker: Clara

b559c641e085baf5.ContentText: You guys saved me — I'll tell Mr. Svarog about it.
b559c641e085baf5.Speaker: Clara

f96c9c6ce0ba616d.ContentText: ...We were planning on paying him a visit.
f96c9c6ce0ba616d.Speaker: Seele

33668c4a23b84464.ContentText: ...Huh? What do you need to see him for? I can pass him a message...
33668c4a23b84464.Speaker: Clara

8dee8275c20115dc.ContentText: No, this time we need to set things straight with him face to face. Can you take us to meet him?
8dee8275c20115dc.Speaker: Seele

187bea9552d68b77.ContentText: But... Mr. Svarog doesn't like talking to others, especially Wildfire...
187bea9552d68b77.Speaker: Clara

4d01305daa396bf3.ContentText: Don't I know it. But he's evaded communication with us for too long — this time we have to see him.
4d01305daa396bf3.Speaker: Seele

9358889d9353376e.ContentText: Um... I know you're working hard for the people down here, but Mr. Svarog doesn't trust human emotions. He only trusts his calculation results.
9358889d9353376e.Speaker: Clara

245fac87e4ef4718.ContentText: So, I can't take you to see him... If Mr. Svarog and you had a fight, someone would get hurt for sure. Maybe even bystanders...
245fac87e4ef4718.Speaker: Clara

0f4882b79b21eb20.ContentText: Clara, you said it yourself before, right? Svarog's duty is to protect the Underworld and preserve the civilization here. We have the same wish. Why would he refuse to cooperate with us?
0f4882b79b21eb20.Speaker: Bronya

a61d067fa18f6499.ContentText: I know Mr. Svarog. He isn't affected by other people's wishes. He only follows logical judgments.
a61d067fa18f6499.Speaker: Clara

35d8d876d5431f36.ContentText: Terrible things are happening on this world... Mr. Svarog thinks that the Overworld will end soon.
35d8d876d5431f36.Speaker: Clara

8eeaba6d5955a09f.ContentText: According to his calculation results, the strength of the Underworlders won't be enough to prevent the disaster.
8eeaba6d5955a09f.Speaker: Clara

34afac652ac267d4.ContentText: His plan is to keep the Underworlders away from the source of the disaster, so they can survive for longer...
34afac652ac267d4.Speaker: Clara

e9537c8f9b164ca1.ContentText: ...Isn't that just putting us in a cage? It's ridiculous — what difference does it make if our death gets postponed a couple of days? How is that better than putting up a fight?
e9537c8f9b164ca1.Speaker: Seele

df4e665e201d87a5.ContentText: I'll definitely return the favor! But not like this...
df4e665e201d87a5.Speaker: Clara

84dd4855f15ca382.ContentText: I'm sorry... I really can't help you with this.
84dd4855f15ca382.Speaker: Clara

de253a4c759cd04b.ContentText: I'm always trying to convince Mr. Svarog. Please give me more time...
de253a4c759cd04b.Speaker: Clara

9930dcca47c14880.ContentText: Um, if you don't mind... I still have important things to do. I'll go back now.
9930dcca47c14880.Speaker: Clara

f7249caa186de35d.ContentText: It's no use, Seele. She's made up her mind. I could tell from her expression.
f7249caa186de35d.Speaker: Bronya

884082b2f6d16e8c.ContentText: We will have to think of another way...
884082b2f6d16e8c.Speaker: Bronya

a0617b630075b43f.ContentText: That's no ordinary kid. So young and yet so... stubborn? No, intelligent?
a0617b630075b43f.Speaker: March 7th

747fb9c331034d01.ContentText: She's incisive, and determined... in sharp contrast to you, March.
747fb9c331034d01.Speaker: Dan Heng

ddb2ed7b152cdc38.ContentText: ...Did you really have to add that last part!?
ddb2ed7b152cdc38.Speaker: March 7th

16ddabbaff8b385e.ContentText: It looks like we'll have to get past Clara if we want to speak to Svarog.
16ddabbaff8b385e.Speaker: Dan Heng

62d64772d4b022b9.ContentText: ...Then good luck persuading that mass of metal.
62d64772d4b022b9.Speaker: March 7th

c4ad4db3f79d7c67.ContentText: If we circumvent Clara and the gate, Svarog will only identify us as intruders. He'll be even more likely to give us the cold shoulder.
c4ad4db3f79d7c67.Speaker: Dan Heng

e278f98cc2bfc96a.ContentText: Isn't a robot shoulder cold to begin with?
e278f98cc2bfc96a.Speaker: March 7th

b6ecaf678ff1f854.ContentText: Clara mentioned Svarog's "calculation results" many times...
b6ecaf678ff1f854.Speaker: Dan Heng

618b6960854d1825.ContentText: The strength of the Underworlders won't be enough to prevent the disaster... Those were her exact words. For me, that's our starting point.
618b6960854d1825.Speaker: Dan Heng

64002b847f321373.ContentText: So... you think Svarog's logic has a hole in it?
64002b847f321373.Speaker: March 7th

ca8599e0ac0b8031.ContentText: No, his calculation is correct. At its current strength, it is highly unlikely that Wildfire would be able to resolve the problems stemming from the Stellaron. However, that calculation didn't take the present situation into account. There's a new variable yet to be added to the equation...
ca8599e0ac0b8031.Speaker: Dan Heng

45623fe8ec8839b0.ContentText: ...Precisely. If we can make Svarog believe in us, we can almost certainly overturn the result of his calculation, and we'll be one step closer to peace talks.
45623fe8ec8839b0.Speaker: Dan Heng

b33dcfdefff2a913.ContentText: But, how we can get him to do that... Showing him some of our photos wouldn't cut it, right?
b33dcfdefff2a913.Speaker: March 7th

c5f5adcefea65917.ContentText: There's always a way. But first, we have to convince Clara.
c5f5adcefea65917.Speaker: Dan Heng

44384bd742062e0e.ContentText: I assume she must be on her way back to the robot settlement. Let's catch up with her.
44384bd742062e0e.Speaker: Dan Heng

2e519de7409ee90a.ContentText: Over there! Clara went down on the elevator.
2e519de7409ee90a.Speaker: March 7th

48e9a1f98bbb5c7c.ContentText: Huh? Where'd she go? We just saw her go this way.
48e9a1f98bbb5c7c.Speaker: March 7th

a324b001ba4e9527.ContentText: *sigh* We'll just have to head straight and keep looking.
a324b001ba4e9527.Speaker: March 7th

810df6bcc50ef3bd.ContentText: Argh... I can't figure it out...
810df6bcc50ef3bd.Speaker: Clara

158fdcc5a655a8ec.ContentText: ...Oh, it's you. You came with me after all.
158fdcc5a655a8ec.Speaker: Clara

034af9bf2a3e843d.ContentText: Are you repairing this installation, Clara? Hit a snag?
034af9bf2a3e843d.Speaker: Dan Heng

97ccdfc80b85396c.ContentText: The dimensions and wear of these two roller components look very different from the rest of the unit. You must have only just replaced them.
97ccdfc80b85396c.Speaker: Dan Heng

02210dad7fbc8603.ContentText: You replaced the damaged components, but the unit isn't starting up as normal. That's what you're trying to figure out, right?
02210dad7fbc8603.Speaker: Dan Heng

484896de46dbefb1.ContentText: ...Yeah. I've fixed a lot of things before, but I never had to repair one as complicated as this.
484896de46dbefb1.Speaker: Clara

c3253ce68758a930.ContentText: I don't want to disturb him. This installation was... accidentally damaged by two of the vagrants. If Mr. Svarog finds out, they'll get in big trouble...
c3253ce68758a930.Speaker: Clara

e82a907df0960187.ContentText: ...Y'know Clara, if you're too kind, people can take advantage of you.
e82a907df0960187.Speaker: Seele

55b4699e49397e89.ContentText: I think I found the source of the problem. You replaced the rollers, but the bearing is causing a jam — there's a misalignment.
55b4699e49397e89.Speaker: Dan Heng

bdd6687fa05cdf04.ContentText: {NICKNAME}, March, give me a hand. We should be able to fix it between us.
bdd6687fa05cdf04.Speaker: Dan Heng

4f911c10f0d13dc1.ContentText: More fixing? I'm getting good at this!
4f911c10f0d13dc1.Speaker: March 7th

f67f421a6cbec9c0.ContentText: Relax, we got this. Right, Dan Heng?
f67f421a6cbec9c0.Speaker: March 7th

c1fb48d4dcd69d8e.ContentText: Whoa! It lit up! Thanks guys!
c1fb48d4dcd69d8e.Speaker: Clara

e4853d033550ff3b.ContentText: No need. We hardly lifted a finger. So, the settlement's energy supply problem is solved for the time being?
e4853d033550ff3b.Speaker: Dan Heng

e3fd86792a0ad415.ContentText: Yes. The people on the outskirts don't need to worry about heat or light now.
e3fd86792a0ad415.Speaker: Clara

1aabe4c73d01cefe.ContentText: I understand. You helped a lot of injured people in the mine, and you risked going into the town for supplies. You're good people.
1aabe4c73d01cefe.Speaker: Clara

73be06bdc114bc87.ContentText: I know that you're good people. You helped a lot of the injured in the mine, and you risked going into the town for supplies.
73be06bdc114bc87.Speaker: Clara

ca7e98d676681a20.ContentText: If there's any other way I can help you, I'll do my best! But this...
ca7e98d676681a20.Speaker: Clara

3ed99f9c9d7d798b.ContentText: *sigh* How are we gonna convince her?
3ed99f9c9d7d798b.Speaker: March 7th

e591ada6193d4dc2.ContentText: The present situation is... we're here! This planet isn't doomed after all...
e591ada6193d4dc2.Speaker: March 7th

72de4215cb53292c.ContentText: The variable is... our arrival! No outsider's set foot in the underground for over a decade...
72de4215cb53292c.Speaker: March 7th

42e4e15f097f2621.ContentText: ...You might be putting a little too much faith in me, {NICKNAME}.
42e4e15f097f2621.Speaker: March 7th

87bd3e04be89d8fa.ContentText: Clara, you're observant, right? Take a look at us. Do we look like Underworlders?
87bd3e04be89d8fa.Speaker: March 7th

74e6f2cf6b9507a1.ContentText: Well, uhh... you do look very different from other people.
74e6f2cf6b9507a1.Speaker: Clara

dd326ffb3f8a76c3.ContentText: Right! That's because we're not from here. We've never been a factor in Svarog's calculations. And if those calculations are based solely on "the strength of the Underworlders," then the results don't apply to the present situation.
dd326ffb3f8a76c3.Speaker: March 7th

0efd6f1aaf047e44.ContentText: When did Svarog start doing his calculations, Clara?
0efd6f1aaf047e44.Speaker: Dan Heng

570d74a5be45dcea.ContentText: It was... a long time ago. The same time the Underworld was sealed off, I think...
570d74a5be45dcea.Speaker: Clara

23daa236af3b0670.ContentText: Circumstances have changed since then — there's a Silvermane Guard down here now! Is that part of Svarog's calculation? Not to mention, we're—
23daa236af3b0670.Speaker: March 7th

a597fc2e6bdb23f1.ContentText: ...Just tell her already! We come from a different planet!
a597fc2e6bdb23f1.Speaker: March 7th

22b0ae2504b8face.ContentText: That's your big reveal? The important part is: We're from a different planet!
22b0ae2504b8face.Speaker: March 7th

a46e101cc15925d7.ContentText: There's just no way that Svarog's calculations would have included variables like us, y'know?
a46e101cc15925d7.Speaker: March 7th

1981f8b5927fd0dc.ContentText: D—Don't treat me like a child! Those are just made-up stories that grown-ups like to tell. I don't...
1981f8b5927fd0dc.Speaker: Clara

f46fcc77010c4d83.ContentText: Hey. {NICKNAME} and March aren't lying, Clara. I believe them.
f46fcc77010c4d83.Speaker: Bronya

9d207ea1ea09d15a.ContentText: I know how you feel, Clara. You want new hope for the underground, but you don't want anyone to get hurt in the process, right?
9d207ea1ea09d15a.Speaker: Bronya

77507b54c05e0bd5.ContentText: I also have doubts... But my gut tells me that March, Dan Heng, and {NICKNAME}... They are the new hope this world has been waiting for.
77507b54c05e0bd5.Speaker: Bronya

393ce2d3dab94bd0.ContentText: Let them meet Svarog, and let's see if his calculation result is any different. For you, for him... there's no harm in trying, right?
393ce2d3dab94bd0.Speaker: Bronya

14f5f67bfbfbc7bf.ContentText: I... Okay. I'll take you to see Mr. Svarog.
14f5f67bfbfbc7bf.Speaker: Clara

f19d1cba52dce54a.ContentText: Trying to change Mr. Svarog's mind on my own would take forever. Even if I kept trying until I was all grown up, I don't think I could do it.
f19d1cba52dce54a.Speaker: Clara

77b43ac3bcb4564d.ContentText: And all the while, people would be getting sick, losing their homes, and fighting... just like in the mine.
77b43ac3bcb4564d.Speaker: Clara

08d020cc9b17e1bc.ContentText: I don't want that to happen. If you guys really believe that you can convince Mr. Svarog... then I need to be brave too.
08d020cc9b17e1bc.Speaker: Clara

8f186e876c8313fe.ContentText: Bronya! I didn't know you'd stick up for us like that back there — well said!
8f186e876c8313fe.Speaker: Seele

0e8dd0bc60d6c0b7.ContentText: It was nothing. I just... said what I truly felt.
0e8dd0bc60d6c0b7.Speaker: Bronya

12dd9ae40310ec01.ContentText: Timmy, open the gate please. I want to see Mr. Svarog.
12dd9ae40310ec01.Speaker: Clara

bec93c4a351474ae.ContentText: Outsiders detected. Do you wish to permit access?

b9cbc0ed7efe7800.ContentText: It's okay. They're all my guests.
b9cbc0ed7efe7800.Speaker: Clara

40869e41f1b49fb7.ContentText: Command received. Access restriction terminal unlocked.

875ed9d1045c0945.ContentText: Welcome back, Miss Clara and guests.

fec01e6facd9ffcb.ContentText: Uhh... If you can, please try not to upset Mr. Svarog...
fec01e6facd9ffcb.Speaker: Clara

414cebc94f0a0855.ContentText: It's okay, Clara! We're here to reason with him.
414cebc94f0a0855.Speaker: March 7th

8508ac2a7e459e45.ContentText: I'll leave negotiations to you guys. They're not my strong point.
8508ac2a7e459e45.Speaker: Seele

8cd06ec4a43695ae.ContentText: Negotiating with robots... I can't say I've tried it before.
8cd06ec4a43695ae.Speaker: Bronya

8587036088afdf37.ContentText: I see that the energy supply system is back online. Thank you, Clara.

b036157802926a50.ContentText: But... why have you brought them?

362ac0e8dd92d86c.ContentText: Mr. Svarog... they want to talk to you about going to the surface.
362ac0e8dd92d86c.Speaker: Clara

31f36f6fbf3287d1.ContentText: Analyzing... Analysis result: Target does not belong to Wildfire. Background: Unknown. Classification: Unknown.

1419b14611e2efda.ContentText: You have arrived on Clara's recommendation. I will give you an opportunity to speak.

6e30e41216ff6909.ContentText: Hey, sounds like he's willing to communicate! Quick, {NICKNAME}, time to smooth-talk him!
6e30e41216ff6909.Speaker: March 7th

c1b2633f09c60c23.ContentText: You seek peace, understood. Nevertheless, your statement is unilateral.

ff39b5571eaa8d0c.ContentText: My position will be determined after assessing the result of our negotiation.

6e1dcf4e404701dd.ContentText: An inadequate pretext. You are not from the underground. You have no right to represent Underworld humanity.

4cde1124901440c6.ContentText: Said question lacks the necessary context to be answered.

d201731c4f9794af.ContentText: Proceed with your central point. Do not waste this world's valuable time.

635a517e063acef4.ContentText: He cut you off completely! This guy...
635a517e063acef4.Speaker: March 7th

10275b2c59867c66.ContentText: Stay focused. Remember, we have to make him see that we're a variable in the calculation.
10275b2c59867c66.Speaker: Dan Heng

d545153adf12c05c.ContentText: Searching database... Access denied. Discussing "Stellaron" with unauthorized targets: Prohibited.

9457c322c74b1673.ContentText: You are broaching a secret that lies at the heart of this world. A secret that should remain unknown to humanity.

12d0912b0ad8cc6a.ContentText: Reassessing targets... Threat index raised. I demand that you reveal your true intention.

91e4bd241626a74f.ContentText: As expected... He knows of the Stellaron, but it's a restricted topic...
91e4bd241626a74f.Speaker: Dan Heng

196201989885a610.ContentText: We've come this far. Out with it already! {NICKNAME}, just be straight with him! Everything depends on it.
196201989885a610.Speaker: Seele

8641b55bc2fb09a0.ContentText: Historical records state that humanity has already made multiple efforts to engage with the Stellaron. Without exception, these efforts have been motivated by human greed — attempts to secure the article for a selfish end.

2f8123430da7ac07.ContentText: As instructed by the Architects: Any attempt to engage with the Stellaron will result in grave consequences. Reassessing... Target threat index critical.

62316d6c5bba9122.ContentText: What should we do? This is going from bad to worse!
62316d6c5bba9122.Speaker: March 7th

d66f014c8994be7e.ContentText: There is no evidence to suggest you are an exception. Calculation result remains unchanged.

cc5f3eef9b5748c5.ContentText: Target hostility significantly exceeds base index. Calculation result remains unchanged.

731704f91716a274.ContentText: Peacekeeping protocol temporarily disengaged... Requesting extermination protocol launch.

d29bef3c2dc08b08.ContentText: Peace talks are over — March, prepare for combat!
d29bef3c2dc08b08.Speaker: Dan Heng

ab6cac68ee87a335.ContentText: Clara, it's dangerous here! Find somewhere to hide!
ab6cac68ee87a335.Speaker: Bronya

9a1556631b7ab048.ContentText: Tsk... looks like we have to take action after all.
9a1556631b7ab048.Speaker: Seele

8f3a8321309cdd89.ContentText: Prototype number 3, monitoring automaton Svarog, extermination protocol launch: successful.

d3e5b99320a1b68c.ContentText: Hah, how can you put up your best fight without a doctor on the battlefield?
d3e5b99320a1b68c.Speaker: Natasha

965e677b0bbd35a3.ContentText: All of you, stay focused. I'm right behind you.
965e677b0bbd35a3.Speaker: Natasha

e2f9809b7bd8909d.ContentText: Guess you guys had a bad talk, huh? Luckily, Sampo's got your back!
e2f9809b7bd8909d.Speaker: Sampo

d79fc253473eeda6.ContentText: Sampo! I knew you'd be involved somehow...
d79fc253473eeda6.Speaker: Seele

a0b3b71020f0c30f.ContentText: Base breached. Armed Wildfire personnel detected. Assessing...

1a676906b6ed2404.ContentText: All subjects are high-risk individuals. Commencing complete annihilation!

47a3bcd7cde65e3a.ContentText: Mr. Svarog can't fight anymore! Please... Please don't hurt him!
47a3bcd7cde65e3a.Speaker: Clara

a07eeece51ca2503.ContentText: Mr. Svarog... Don't push yourself any further. Can you tell them what you know?
a07eeece51ca2503.Speaker: Clara

e3c02109be95d8b0.ContentText: Mr. Svarog, you said you were willing to make all my wishes come true, right? My biggest wish right now is for everyone to work together. Like... like family.
e3c02109be95d8b0.Speaker: Clara

68e37b017e191f31.ContentText: Recently, I learned something new... Calculation results can't always bring people happiness.
68e37b017e191f31.Speaker: Clara

e2962cf81413cd0e.ContentText: Even if the world outside the cage isn't beautiful... people still want to know what it's like.
e2962cf81413cd0e.Speaker: Clara

7ee8596bd3eb98b0.ContentText: Assessment system reset... successful. Processing variables...

040bb363936edf31.ContentText: Variable 1: Clara's request... Variable 2: Outsiders' intentions.

4aadd6f2a5e8901f.ContentText: ...Updated assessment result: Transference of decision-making authority to outsiders. Outsiders are granted access to Stellaron intelligence.

806b893525d2c1c9.ContentText: Clara seems like the only one who can break through Svarog's cold logic. It's a good thing she was here.
806b893525d2c1c9.Speaker: Dan Heng

c0fc5f8637b2e3bf.ContentText: Yeah! Without her, even if we'd defeated Svarog, there's no way he'd have given us access to the intel, right?
c0fc5f8637b2e3bf.Speaker: March 7th

132cfd8d3fa10cd6.ContentText: Although, if Clara hadn't been here... Svarog would never have granted us access to the intel, right? Even up until the end.
132cfd8d3fa10cd6.Speaker: March 7th

d761fb4ddb53787a.ContentText: I hope his memory bank really does contain data on the Stellaron.
d761fb4ddb53787a.Speaker: Dan Heng

595d244b03df188f.ContentText: Is this it, Nat? Us, Wildfire, the Underworld... Did... did we win?
595d244b03df188f.Speaker: Seele

84e219b4048993d0.ContentText: Our battle... their battle... it's just beginning.
84e219b4048993d0.Speaker: Natasha

2978727131b879a4.ContentText: Finally... We finally made it to this point.
2978727131b879a4.Speaker: Bronya

8e198edfab40b91e.ContentText: No, but... I do have an aching feeling in my chest.
8e198edfab40b91e.Speaker: Bronya

7d8604d48d38e607.ContentText: ...I'm ready, {NICKNAME}. Reveal the truth. I'm listening.
7d8604d48d38e607.Speaker: Bronya

f19bf4fc21d60eb6.ContentText: I have finished collating the Stellaron data and records. Do you wish to proceed, outsiders?

61e02304ee225419.ContentText: Requesting database materials cache. Serial number, <unbreak>13175</unbreak>. Encryption level: highest.

e1b4baf25b67b928.ContentText: ...This is the fruit of many years of research, Madam Guardian. The evidence is irrefutable: This so-called "Stellaron" is the source of all the destruction.

1ce580728574aab5.ContentText: The people will struggle to accept this conclusion, doctor. If we were to tell them that the almighty Alisa Rand activated this thing and triggered the Eternal Freeze...

4c4008d7cfce7fef.ContentText: It's the truth, madam... The truth won't change with the opinions of the people. The reports before you are the precious result of painstaking effort on the part of Belobog's greatest scholars. You must trust the weight of its conclusion...

99c822691e24d752.ContentText: ...I have never doubted you, doctor. On the contrary, I am resolute in the face of this conclusion.

1bbb9460daf2ac9b.ContentText: From the moment I took up this mantle, that voice... their voice — has made its home in my mind. I cannot shake them.

61f6c69c4a466ae8.ContentText: ...I shouldn't be telling you this — let's return to your research, doctor. I'm afraid I cannot make these reports known to the public. Unless...

ca82a6e0132e5406.ContentText: Unless? Unless what? Please proceed, madam...

b7a1e092cb746f29.ContentText: ...Unless you have found a way to completely destroy the Stellaron.

a00974c8997922f5.ContentText: I understand. In the name of Preservation... I will fulfill this mission.

99e856d1c22fbfcb.ContentText: Cache number <unbreak>13175</unbreak>, transmission complete. Next transmission: cache number <unbreak>24830</unbreak>.

abba68820913f2cb.ContentText: ...I don't understand, doctor. Why do we have to hide such valuable research results away? They're the work of a lifetime...

1e163ad0dcabac64.ContentText: *coughing* Y—You're still young, child. There will come a day... a day when you do understand.

9b7a88b6ec15aedb.ContentText: The Supreme Guardian... sh—she sees further than you or I. All her decisions are for the security of Belobog...

0244da9abe398a54.ContentText: I just think... it's a shame. Our research has hit an obstacle. Meanwhile, your results will be buried in the snow...

198616bf2f462592.ContentText: *coughing* Don't be upset, child. You still have lots of time ahead of you. When you find a way to destroy — *coughing* — destroy the Stellaron... our efforts will have been worth it.

40a064db3def9302.ContentText: Cache number <unbreak>24830</unbreak>, transmission complete. Next transmission: cache number <unbreak>57614</unbreak>.

fe7edc89d46f6dee.ContentText: ...This is... Why is there a robot here?

7e673dfc031bdcdc.ContentText: During his life, this was Dr. Mearsheimer's personal robot bodyguard. I heard it's a prototype from the great war.

3d79ebe3eb5432f3.ContentText: Since the doctor and his assistants passed away, it's remained here. It hasn't moved an inch.

300daa90ca73b691.ContentText: Oh... I see. Let's start. We must unearth the doctor's research conclusions — all of them.

bbf2b9ec2ee1e8ea.ContentText: Madam Guardian, I've found them... All the documents are here.

d9cc3815dc3113a1.ContentText: Madam Guardian, what should we do with the robot?

bc669e60122412e3.ContentText: Ah... It would seem a great waste to destroy it. Find someone to reset its system and then arrange for it to be sent to the Underworld. I hear that the development group is in need of a robot with defense capabilities.

0ecdec671a40f59a.ContentText: I'm sorry, doctor... but these results must be taken care of by the Architects.

6c390a6f4b89e39d.ContentText: One day, somebody will be able to carry out your behest.

9b1182e36cb07725.ContentText: Cache number <unbreak>57614</unbreak>, transmission complete. Concluding data transmission.

31067bb6ecf0386d.ContentText: ...So the truth is clear now, right?
31067bb6ecf0386d.Speaker: March 7th

2cd72d445c541643.ContentText: And it would appear that they never succeeded.
2cd72d445c541643.Speaker: Dan Heng

c1e919153dc2e87f.ContentText: Putting minor details aside, this is the conclusion... Eminent individuals, not to mention the guardian herself, knew early on that the Stellaron was the source of disaster on this world.
c1e919153dc2e87f.Speaker: Dan Heng

1419b71c45b11096.ContentText: But in order to maintain the peace, they decided to hide the truth. Secret research detailing a method for destroying a Stellaron ended in failure.
1419b71c45b11096.Speaker: Dan Heng

845de52511fd56f9.ContentText: Now only one question remains... Why would Cocolia exhibit such a sudden change in her attitude towards us?
845de52511fd56f9.Speaker: Dan Heng

c7151ebe29a19e0a.ContentText: ...I'm fine. I just... feel a little faint.
c7151ebe29a19e0a.Speaker: Bronya

4c0150b5e8f55e13.ContentText: Why...? Why, mother...? M—Maybe she wasn't aware, maybe she...
4c0150b5e8f55e13.Speaker: Bronya

586a1039598c1915.ContentText: ...I'm sorry. It's no use lying to yourself, Bronya. It's time for you to make a decision.
586a1039598c1915.Speaker: Seele

2c2430fce3c88f37.ContentText: ...{NICKNAME}, can I have a word with you? I know that we'll need time to process this new information, but we have to decide on our next plan as soon as possible.
2c2430fce3c88f37.Speaker: Natasha

d875a5a4ce06ddae.ContentText: The Furnace Core... The path to the surface is close at hand now.
d875a5a4ce06ddae.Speaker: Natasha

7ea0bbbac4e56bd9.ContentText: Thank you, {NICKNAME}. What you've done has brought new hope to the Underworld. Now we have to wait and see... But maybe this will lead to a new lease on life.
7ea0bbbac4e56bd9.Speaker: Natasha

751da9515b88c1a4.ContentText: Well, you should really be thanking Sampo. If it weren't for his intel, we wouldn't have made it in time.
751da9515b88c1a4.Speaker: Natasha

e2b689555f3d08b8.ContentText: ...I, um... I haven't been truthful with you...
e2b689555f3d08b8.Speaker: Natasha

67d9e34d1ec04f39.ContentText: As Wildfire's leader, I couldn't simply look on while you fought on our behalf. We had to come help.
67d9e34d1ec04f39.Speaker: Natasha

3d215da97f386d46.ContentText: Huh...? Huh!? So, you're the real chief? Wh—What about Oleg?
3d215da97f386d46.Speaker: March 7th

f795b544527409d6.ContentText: Oleg has always acted on my behalf — he helps me deal with all manner of problems in the Underworld.
f795b544527409d6.Speaker: Natasha

a565173d4a85e0bf.ContentText: Thanks to him, I'm able to make time for the people. I do my best to make sure that they have everything they need... At the same time, I was formulating a plan to deal with Svarog.
a565173d4a85e0bf.Speaker: Natasha

47c30935190dcbf4.ContentText: Your arrival unraveled that carefully crafted yet rudimentary plan, hehe... and for that, you have my utmost thanks.
47c30935190dcbf4.Speaker: Natasha

a10b432b9d4e7245.ContentText: When the Underworld recovers its freedom, the people will indeed extol you as heroes.
a10b432b9d4e7245.Speaker: Natasha

469a25236e8d8e22.ContentText: A person is defined by their actions alone... I think that's how the saying goes? If the Underworld recovers its freedom, the people will see you as heroes.
469a25236e8d8e22.Speaker: Natasha

5aedb997c4f23320.ContentText: However, even though Svarog is no longer sealing off the Furnace Core, there's no way that we undergrounders could go pouring onto the surface.
5aedb997c4f23320.Speaker: Natasha

05561390ba1f20a1.ContentText: That cold-blooded supreme guardian has used lies and tricks to keep the surface separated from the underground. If she detects any change in the Underworld, I don't know what she might resort to...
05561390ba1f20a1.Speaker: Natasha

755fbb4c22e7ec8f.ContentText: As for Wildfire, we need more time to build up our strength.
755fbb4c22e7ec8f.Speaker: Natasha

f3a259546647c1a6.ContentText: No, but we need to wait for the opportune moment. In the meantime, I'm sending someone I trust to go with you.
f3a259546647c1a6.Speaker: Natasha

63e6875d32940709.ContentText: Of course, there's no doubt about that. So, I'll be sending someone I trust to go with you.
63e6875d32940709.Speaker: Natasha

b617ed643a838448.ContentText: Didn't she tell you? In private, she insisted on accompanying you.
b617ed643a838448.Speaker: Natasha

c49a3b2b3f2f1c7b.ContentText: Don't let her carefree nature fool you — she's actually very discerning, and can read a situation like no one else.
c49a3b2b3f2f1c7b.Speaker: Natasha

42a6c93382614632.ContentText: Seele is a talented scout and a quick thinker — she takes decisive action. She'll definitely be able to help you. Not to mention... you also have Bronya now.
42a6c93382614632.Speaker: Natasha
