746ca73a7894ed15.ContentText: It seems like the intel we got from Svarog caused her a significant shock... but with Seele by her side, I know she'll recover.
746ca73a7894ed15.Speaker: Natasha

ef136d42b8e44d84.ContentText: You're right, but with Seele by her side, I know she'll recover.
ef136d42b8e44d84.Speaker: Natasha

c7c4a1e9a465cdd7.ContentText: {NICKNAME}, when's the last time you got some rest? I heard that you've been on your feet looking for Svarog since Rivet Town.
c7c4a1e9a465cdd7.Speaker: Natasha

526a69962b60b68e.ContentText: Health is everything — you won't be much use if you neglect yours. Let Wildfire take care of the Furnace Core for now. You head back and recuperate.
526a69962b60b68e.Speaker: Natasha

154c69173fe6bc82.ContentText: If you're lucky... perhaps tomorrow you can return to the Overworld.
154c69173fe6bc82.Speaker: Natasha

256007d1fd658fab.ContentText: Did you hear? Those idiots got into a fight in the mine, haha! It only got settled after Boss Svarog showed up.

7bea79eab28b2734.ContentText: I've said it before — only Boss Svarog can protect us down here. Everyone should follow his lead.

d532b3e136cbcd85.ContentText: Well, what do you think? Cat got your tongue?

4fd45249811a0488.ContentText: ...Do you ever talk about anything else? I'm so tired of hearing about Svarog.

285625f9e90c8916.ContentText: B—But it's true. What else is there to say? Take a look at all these good-for-nothings... They'd starve to death without him.

8d50d9e81bc57699.ContentText: Did you see those extra boxes of medical supplies at the depot? Who brought those over?

4b28a4855852c25e.ContentText: Clara, I assume? I can't think of anyone else that'd do something that generous.

1d0cabdf4f793136.ContentText: Who's Clara? Is she one of us?

a8cab28d89cad701.ContentText: Not even close! She's Svarog's trusted family.

4fb8d89705b86300.ContentText: Well, you'll understand when you've been here a while longer.

1938127550180ad6.ContentText: My design has been superceded by newer models. My components are no longer valuable.

6cb743764e990a70.ContentText: Hey! What are you talking about? I'm not interested in selling your components.

4a8b09266b1e080b.ContentText: Take a good rest while you still can, {NICKNAME}. Your adventures on the surface won't be easy-going.
4a8b09266b1e080b.Speaker: Natasha

c51ecd26794c80d4.ContentText: Don't be surprised. My job is just to help everyone make the right calls.
c51ecd26794c80d4.Speaker: Natasha

6fbd871f6ea7a0a5.ContentText: You remember Rivet Town? When the Fragmentum corrosion first appeared, we were defenseless. We didn't have a clue how to protect our homes.
6fbd871f6ea7a0a5.Speaker: Natasha

c647f93823cd3836.ContentText: After we fled to Boulder Town, I made up my mind: A tragedy like that could never be allowed to happen again. That's why I gathered Oleg and the others together, and created the first sparks of Wildfire.
c647f93823cd3836.Speaker: Natasha

1f59db2ea7dfb99f.ContentText: Afterwards, Wildfire began to grow. To be honest, I never thought a day like this would come.
1f59db2ea7dfb99f.Speaker: Natasha

b4cecd4933796018.ContentText: What do you mean? That's me too, y'know. The "me" that my patients see, at least.
b4cecd4933796018.Speaker: Natasha

368c2740f0197d99.ContentText: Our identities are like masks. When we switch between them, we change the way the world perceives us.
368c2740f0197d99.Speaker: Natasha

e2f88b50269c18d3.ContentText: Well, we don't want to act in haste before the situation has stabilized. We need to wait for the right time.
e2f88b50269c18d3.Speaker: Natasha

5494b7eb3ae16a41.ContentText: Ten years of being sealed away has sapped the Underworld's vitality. Now that the Furnace Core is no longer blocked off, we need to prioritize the people and replenish our resources.
5494b7eb3ae16a41.Speaker: Natasha

fb82ddf4b6cef640.ContentText: Wildfire has never been in this for its own gain. Everything we do is for the citizens of the Underworld. That passage is a means to an end, not the end itself.
fb82ddf4b6cef640.Speaker: Natasha

a8284bdc045ec1a7.ContentText: We'll leave them be... Svarog may have blocked off the Furnace Core, but he's provided shelter to the vagrants from the beginning. An admirable deed.
a8284bdc045ec1a7.Speaker: Natasha

fa59a9e30c4e309e.ContentText: There are many homeless people in the Underworld. If they had safety and security, they wouldn't have to struggle to survive
fa59a9e30c4e309e.Speaker: Natasha

b96b57caf484d38d.ContentText: Wildfire can provide that while Svarog is recovering.
b96b57caf484d38d.Speaker: Natasha

4ded3dd3d5cb88fc.ContentText: Things have settled for now, you should rest while you can.
4ded3dd3d5cb88fc.Speaker: Natasha

4d2b3cc793775c0d.ContentText: At daybreak, the guardian shall be a glittering star, illuminating the people's path.
4d2b3cc793775c0d.Speaker: Bronya

2f51be9de6283176.ContentText: At nightfall, the guardian shall be a flickering flame, comforting the people's soul.
2f51be9de6283176.Speaker: Bronya

84fca0946755d6df.ContentText: So many years... Have I been following lies this whole time?
84fca0946755d6df.Speaker: Bronya

26a4323263587232.ContentText: Hey... maybe you should find someone to talk to...
26a4323263587232.Speaker: Seele

a897a42a2026487b.ContentText: Don't let it get you down — you can share your feelings with others y'know? Do you think keeping it all to yourself is doing you any good?
a897a42a2026487b.Speaker: Seele

3791c6a6b6d9ee30.ContentText: You let that status of yours go to your head, huh? Afraid to show weakness? That's why you're keeping so much bottled up inside, right?
3791c6a6b6d9ee30.Speaker: Seele

bcb5209e765d34b1.ContentText: This isn't the Overworld. We don't do envy and etiquette down here. Whatever's on your mind, you can say it.
bcb5209e765d34b1.Speaker: Seele

bc7242aa1a3cdd6a.ContentText: ...I just want to be clear in myself, first. These fragments of history, the teachings I studied... It's all muddled together in my mind... I just... I don't know what I should believe.
bc7242aa1a3cdd6a.Speaker: Bronya

0357442d88d6e59f.ContentText: ...No, you just have to be clear on what you should do.
0357442d88d6e59f.Speaker: Seele

aa45623704c46436.ContentText: You've spent long enough living in lies, Bronya. This is your chance to break out of the cage.
aa45623704c46436.Speaker: Seele

741566a45a3c1ccc.ContentText: How's it going, partner? Is that feeling in your chest the thrill of victory or just the joy of making it out alive?
741566a45a3c1ccc.Speaker: Sampo

3327148c4272bfe3.ContentText: I know, your heart is bursting with gratitude... but there's no need to thank me. We have what I'd like to call a "fiscal friendship." If the money's right, not a problem in sight!
3327148c4272bfe3.Speaker: Sampo

858e62934a8fa29a.ContentText: Ha, I knew that you'd get yourselves into trouble eventually, so I got Oleg to send relief in advance. Pretty sensible, right?
858e62934a8fa29a.Speaker: Sampo

a6ce20bcfac26391.ContentText: My assignment was simply to take you to Svarog's lair. I got the payment and delivered the goods — I wasn't obligated to tell you about my dinner plans!
a6ce20bcfac26391.Speaker: Sampo

2510c6c53e224610.ContentText: But I threw in something extra regardless. I only did that because we're friends, or I would've charged extra.
2510c6c53e224610.Speaker: Sampo

fa62b4adc4416ef7.ContentText: My pleasure! Friends should look out for each other. Good for business.
fa62b4adc4416ef7.Speaker: Sampo

753f52b604be1aee.ContentText: Here's a slice of life experience for you: Resourceful businessmen never get into risky trading without a plan b... and a plan b for their plan b. Plan c, we call that.
753f52b604be1aee.Speaker: Sampo

9740905a51f09e75.ContentText: ...The chief? Of course I knew. Wildfire are mostly made up of torch and pitchfork types. How could they function without her?
9740905a51f09e75.Speaker: Sampo

154d5662952327e4.ContentText: Not that I'm criticizing old Oleg! He's good at the heavy lifting. It's just that Wildfire needs a meticulous thinker lurking in the sha— Ahem! ...Working in the background, hehe.
154d5662952327e4.Speaker: Sampo

94b04ac791794c4c.ContentText: Hey now, you've got me all wrong! I just enjoy watching people fight, that's all. Fierce words, fists flying... what's not to like?
94b04ac791794c4c.Speaker: Sampo

039464beb315c01d.ContentText: Easy there, don't get mushy on me now. We professional types don't have time for "thank yous." It's business! Feelings don't come into it.
039464beb315c01d.Speaker: Sampo

a62946b681ccd21a.ContentText: Hahaha~ you see? Gotcha! Hah, seriously though — Sampo will always be happy to assist you.
a62946b681ccd21a.Speaker: Sampo

64538eefd0b3f817.ContentText: Mr. Svarog, are you okay? Let me repair your language module first...
64538eefd0b3f817.Speaker: Clara

fe336736df00db67.ContentText: Assessing... Language module operating as normal. Thank you, Clara.

7f3f30a4a1976404.ContentText: Did your memory module get damaged? Maybe I can fix that too.
7f3f30a4a1976404.Speaker: Clara

ea9984bdc2e5ad12.ContentText: Architect machine era records: intact. War of Defense combat data: intact. Geomarrow Development Group era records: intact...

6c8df6b57fb5365b.ContentText: Record of Clara's crafting of miniature magnetic drill rigs: intact. Record of Clara's explanation of human "sleeping in" behavior: intact...

04986a9c61480395.ContentText: S—So, your memory module is okay?
04986a9c61480395.Speaker: Clara

ef29a8cf704b33e4.ContentText: I have made a backup of all records pertaining to you, Clara. Do not worry.

711ce2c72d18aa75.ContentText: There are multiple backups. I can recover them at any time.

eb197cf9ada549a0.ContentText: Mr. Svarog, can I delete some of them...?
eb197cf9ada549a0.Speaker: Clara

9b9614dea6cddb86.ContentText: I cannot grant this request. Records pertaining to you constitute important data, Clara. They must remain intact.

3b46c8ea743efe7e.ContentText: Mr. Svarog, I still want to help you check a few other modules... Turn around a little.
3b46c8ea743efe7e.Speaker: Clara

39490beda298d033.ContentText: Why? Why is every elevator in the Underworld busted!?
39490beda298d033.Speaker: March 7th

cda42ae5d2954ce7.ContentText: When I first woke up after being rescued from the ice, I could see clusters of stars in front of me. I reached out for them automatically, but they turned out to be the carriage ceiling lights.
cda42ae5d2954ce7.Speaker: March 7th

2464bcfe87e8a980.ContentText: The whole crew was watching me — it was pretty embarrassing...
2464bcfe87e8a980.Speaker: March 7th

7d7696f50bfb1d81.ContentText: Oh, I forgot to tell you.
7d7696f50bfb1d81.Speaker: March 7th

5c3618cb5bc716ca.ContentText: Before all this, I was stuck in a huge block of ice drifting through space.
5c3618cb5bc716ca.Speaker: March 7th

ddbd4ac3183960d3.ContentText: Uh-huh! Like I was some kind of weird alien! I don't really blame them for being curious though — they had no idea where I came from.
ddbd4ac3183960d3.Speaker: March 7th

73691cdda402133c.ContentText: You might not believe it, but before all this, I was stuck in a huge block of ice drifting through space.
73691cdda402133c.Speaker: March 7th

e24d36d4c59e87cd.ContentText: Himeko and Mr. Yang and... who was it again? Anyway, they figured out a way to melt the ice and saved me.
e24d36d4c59e87cd.Speaker: March 7th

c10cb8ab156a8036.ContentText: Who knows? I don't remember anything before that.
c10cb8ab156a8036.Speaker: March 7th

8c4696b74a950e1d.ContentText: Who I am, where I'm from, my name... it's like everything was erased from my mind. "March 7th" was the day they found me, so it stuck.
8c4696b74a950e1d.Speaker: March 7th

1d627cc028f89a4c.ContentText: Ever since then, I've been hanging out on this train and following it to whatever destination it decides to stop at. I'm hoping that one day, I can find my past...
1d627cc028f89a4c.Speaker: March 7th

dc742aa8112f3d63.ContentText: Ugh, what am I talking about this for? Way to get everyone down, huh.
dc742aa8112f3d63.Speaker: March 7th

2edb78af194c201a.ContentText: It's fine. I was the one who brought it up.
2edb78af194c201a.Speaker: March 7th

e66881a18a7d5b95.ContentText: Cheer up, {NICKNAME}! It's not every day someone gets to ride on the Astral Express...
e66881a18a7d5b95.Speaker: March 7th

23f3e834ba1ac160.ContentText: The Express has reached a safe distance from the space station. We'll be jumping in about ten minutes.

cd33561c04c763c7.ContentText: Return to your seats please, both of you. Things could get bumpy!

a3afcac992fdec77.ContentText: Uh... thanks, Pom-Pom. But did you really have to come and remind me? I'm not a newbie, you know~
a3afcac992fdec77.Speaker: March 7th

778834258399513e.ContentText: Well, it wouldn't be necessary, but Miss March 7th likes to challenge herself... and falls over every time.

1e8c68d1d37a986e.ContentText: That's just called never giving up! Hehe~
1e8c68d1d37a986e.Speaker: March 7th

408da67620ad1bf5.ContentText: Conductor, can I get a juice, please? Thank youuuu~
408da67620ad1bf5.Speaker: March 7th

e1dc620af7d09ead.ContentText: Ugh... We're jumping in five minutes! You can have something to drink when it's over!

2c324c8267923978.ContentText: Oh, don't worry about me. I just wanna see if I can stay on my feet this time~
2c324c8267923978.Speaker: March 7th

adefa67a243256f9.ContentText: Thanks. I feel like I'm starting to get the hang of it.
adefa67a243256f9.Speaker: March 7th

3dab787157e61096.ContentText: The key is using your core, waist, and leg muscles. It's not your stance that matters, but your ability to ride the inertia...
3dab787157e61096.Speaker: March 7th

eb7ada6a4ff7e87f.ContentText: It's fine, I'm sturdier than I look~ Besides, the ice will protect me.
eb7ada6a4ff7e87f.Speaker: March 7th

913fcc622164aeb4.ContentText: When I'm in danger, I instinctively create ice to protect myself.
913fcc622164aeb4.Speaker: March 7th

ea880658a5a55505.ContentText: ...Though sometimes falling on the ice actually hurts more than falling on the ground.
ea880658a5a55505.Speaker: March 7th

9015e85076e2bee2.ContentText: Don't be silly — this is fun!
9015e85076e2bee2.Speaker: March 7th

3ab55a496c3f172b.ContentText: I like keeping busy, otherwise I start obsessing over... pointless things.
3ab55a496c3f172b.Speaker: March 7th

a1037cc4ca643ae0.ContentText: Well, don't mind me. Find a place to sit down and buckle up.
a1037cc4ca643ae0.Speaker: March 7th

e95e86dfa2fd35fd.ContentText: Our next stop is a small planet called Jarilo-VI.
e95e86dfa2fd35fd.Speaker: Himeko

8f5968d7749770fa.ContentText: It's been thousands of years since the last time the Express paid a visit. The data bank shows it was a lush and beautiful place.
8f5968d7749770fa.Speaker: Himeko

e4ce9acdf5980ec3.ContentText: But after all this time, it's possible that dramatic changes have occurred.
e4ce9acdf5980ec3.Speaker: Himeko

8f21be7179c35524.ContentText: Jumps are like this: They may feel novel the first few times, but you'll slowly get used to them after a few more.
8f21be7179c35524.Speaker: Welt

0fec0c578c10809b.ContentText: As for the mechanism... Well, if you're interested, I'll explain it to you in detail when we have more time.
0fec0c578c10809b.Speaker: Welt

8df89a5fcf42ab52.ContentText: For now, just sit and wait. Remember to close your eyes — it helps with the dizziness.
8df89a5fcf42ab52.Speaker: Welt

2b76cd0965489e70.ContentText: After all those millennia... is this what Jarilo-VI has become?
2b76cd0965489e70.Speaker: Himeko

4ed2d6bdc2760461.ContentText: Huh? So that snowy planet is our destination this time?
4ed2d6bdc2760461.Speaker: March 7th

ad34270121e8bbf1.ContentText: Yes... Looks like this trailblazing expedition won't be easy.
ad34270121e8bbf1.Speaker: Himeko

72f84813d6342a1c.ContentText: Spatial readout anomaly! Star rail stability is down to <unbreak>12%</unbreak>!

356ff5fbc14df633.ContentText: Schedule alteration: Seven-day stopover time extended indefinitely!

2a4cd8f7bac692ce.ContentText: The complex locality of this world has been... affected somehow. The star rail has been blocked off by something.
2a4cd8f7bac692ce.Speaker: Himeko

ac0a3aef7766bdd7.ContentText: Take an ordinary train as an example: It's like the tracks up ahead have suddenly snapped, and the way forward leads straight into a collapsing abyss...
ac0a3aef7766bdd7.Speaker: Himeko

c6f4dca4484876c4.ContentText: The only sensible thing to do would be to brake hard, right?
c6f4dca4484876c4.Speaker: Himeko

b082c40401f8832a.ContentText: Indefinitely. Until the anomaly is removed!

48e9169c0517a055.ContentText: Take an ordinary train as an example: It's like the tracks up ahead have suddenly snapped, and the way forward leads straight into a collapsing abyss...
48e9169c0517a055.Speaker: Himeko

bad9fab1b6004113.ContentText: The only sensible thing to do would be to brake hard, right?
bad9fab1b6004113.Speaker: Himeko

30e011ea13e8dd79.ContentText: If we try to force our way ahead, there could be a hefty price to pay!

bb767e79285ba74f.ContentText: This again... Don't tell me, it's gotta be...
bb767e79285ba74f.Speaker: March 7th

abd258897c924329.ContentText: The results of the preliminary analysis are here — the anomaly stems from a Stellaron, as always.
abd258897c924329.Speaker: Welt

c84bf02e89584664.ContentText: Yes, {NICKNAME} — just like the one that's been placed into your body.
c84bf02e89584664.Speaker: Welt

35edc8b9f6ac810a.ContentText: Don't worry. It's not the first time our route has been obstructed by a Stellaron.
35edc8b9f6ac810a.Speaker: Himeko

bc03e6c360823f0d.ContentText: Stellarons are clouded in mystery — even Herta isn't able to fully understand them... but at least we know how to neutralize their influences.
bc03e6c360823f0d.Speaker: Himeko

5085cccc41c8f47c.ContentText: Stellarons are clouded in mystery — even Herta isn't able to fully understand them...
5085cccc41c8f47c.Speaker: Himeko

aac0dad4705c2d27.ContentText: But there's no need to worry — this isn't the first time our route has been obstructed by a Stellaron. Even if we don't know much about them, at least we know how to neutralize their influences.
aac0dad4705c2d27.Speaker: Himeko

c0b18c786fc951af.ContentText: The only thing we can say for sure is that their arrival causes massive changes to civilizations and ecosystems. They also generate distortions in space such as Fragmentums.
c0b18c786fc951af.Speaker: Welt

3b8e2a80b045fdc6.ContentText: There must be an inextricable connection between the Stellaron we're dealing with here, and Jarilo-VI becoming a frozen planet.
3b8e2a80b045fdc6.Speaker: Welt

fcf238db784b9c1e.ContentText: Our current theory is that Stellarons are seeds of disaster planted by a certain Aeon throughout the universe. We can't continue to trailblaze without removing the source of the disaster.
fcf238db784b9c1e.Speaker: Himeko

5ccde8aa6078bedd.ContentText: It's empowering, looking out at a world from a window like this...
5ccde8aa6078bedd.Speaker: Welt

ede9ceb33edc4a0c.ContentText: ...but when you set foot on the planet itself, you realize how small and helpless you really are — just like them.
ede9ceb33edc4a0c.Speaker: Welt

a9fd4a8a3807c1c9.ContentText: Right! You finally get what we're all about. Pretty cool, huh?
a9fd4a8a3807c1c9.Speaker: March 7th

2fd50c0414075565.ContentText: {NICKNAME}, I'd like to entrust this trailblazing expedition to March, Dan Heng, and you.
2fd50c0414075565.Speaker: Himeko

fe1b6ced22cc61c0.ContentText: The objective is clear: Find the Stellaron responsible for the disaster and the spatial distortions, and bring it back to the Express. We'll deal with the rest.
fe1b6ced22cc61c0.Speaker: Himeko

94b69e38b4f8f844.ContentText: Awesome! We get to work as a team again, {NICKNAME}!
94b69e38b4f8f844.Speaker: March 7th

4675ca6f538b118b.ContentText: Someone has to stay on the train, or Pom-Pom will get lonely.
4675ca6f538b118b.Speaker: Himeko

ed2dd878cf4ae5c2.ContentText: Not to mention, {RUBY_B#The Destruction}Nanook{RUBY_E#} threw us a glance just now. If we're targeted by the Antimatter Legion, then things could go south fast.
ed2dd878cf4ae5c2.Speaker: Himeko

4932b41bda8af9a2.ContentText: Because you three made a great team back in the space station. My guess is that if you spend even longer together, we'll see something even more impressive.
4932b41bda8af9a2.Speaker: Himeko

94fb0a9e2e330cf6.ContentText: So it's still not our turn...
94fb0a9e2e330cf6.Speaker: Welt

f7382614d2ca7beb.ContentText: I know you really want to go, but we should give the youngsters a chance to get out there on their own. It'll be a good opportunity for them to bond.
f7382614d2ca7beb.Speaker: Himeko

1aa772e2e5d45190.ContentText: {NICKNAME}, March, if you two are ready, why not go and find Dan Heng?
1aa772e2e5d45190.Speaker: Himeko

a3a3d224094bddc5.ContentText: He's probably already started collating the ecological data and survey results for Jarilo-VI. It's always good to know more about the destination before you start a journey.
a3a3d224094bddc5.Speaker: Himeko

af22b7f25748bff8.ContentText: Each stop brings its own grand and exciting adventure!

3ee65768edb2c574.ContentText: Pom-Pom can't leave the train right now...

2cdfa8f687d32a1c.ContentText: Pom-Pom's so dejected all of a sudden...
2cdfa8f687d32a1c.Speaker: playerboy

88bd8c6087d500f2.ContentText: A planet covered in snow and ice... Will I find my answer here...?
88bd8c6087d500f2.Speaker: March 7th

ba836a677e08a7d5.ContentText: WHOA! Don't sneak up on me like that!
ba836a677e08a7d5.Speaker: March 7th

388f306fc1397e44.ContentText: Why are you still here? Go find Dan Heng! Exciting adventures are waiting for us.
388f306fc1397e44.Speaker: March 7th

eaa5ec94af60b25f.ContentText: Ever since the Destruction sowed Stellarons across the universe, many worlds have changed.
eaa5ec94af60b25f.Speaker: Welt

801bdeaf3afc0bd8.ContentText: Nanook the Destruction, Yaoshi the Abundance, Terminus the Finality... I've seen and learned a lot in my time, but I still struggle to understand some of the Aeons' actions.
801bdeaf3afc0bd8.Speaker: Welt

fa2e443cbe717556.ContentText: Thanks to a brilliant performance, you guys saved the space station from a moment of crisis. Now the Express is relying on you to get it moving again.
fa2e443cbe717556.Speaker: Himeko

a7fda635b6834c3f.ContentText: Remember, there are four things we do when we arrive at a new world: explore, understand, establish, and connect.
a7fda635b6834c3f.Speaker: Himeko

e54f184dcb3a7438.ContentText: And I'm sure you'll get along really well with March and Dan Heng.
e54f184dcb3a7438.Speaker: Himeko

8ea8c85514aa88e9.ContentText: Are you doing okay after your first jump?
8ea8c85514aa88e9.Speaker: Dan Heng

1e649a4c485e4286.ContentText: Dizziness or retching are normal reactions. You'll feel better once you get used to it.
1e649a4c485e4286.Speaker: Dan Heng

a021fc4404fe6e6f.ContentText: So you have high compatibility with the Express. That's good.
a021fc4404fe6e6f.Speaker: Dan Heng

71f82e3d11db9ae4.ContentText: I enjoy being alone, especially when I have important work to do.
71f82e3d11db9ae4.Speaker: Dan Heng

f3eb6834cea91175.ContentText: I went through the Express's database, and it seems the environment on Jarilo-VI has undergone drastic changes in the past few centuries. It was not a frozen planet to begin with...
f3eb6834cea91175.Speaker: Dan Heng

6d680a2b64761412.ContentText: He said so? Hmm... considering the spatial obstacles that the star rail has encountered, it's highly possible.
6d680a2b64761412.Speaker: Dan Heng

ef5c7c2321459d5b.ContentText: I've conducted a preliminary survey and found that there's one area with a relatively normal temperature on the surface of the planet. By "normal," I mean a temperature that just about allows for human survival.
ef5c7c2321459d5b.Speaker: Dan Heng

81bb9e9fbadab910.ContentText: If I had to choose a site for initial investigation on this trailblazing expedition, that would be it.
81bb9e9fbadab910.Speaker: Dan Heng

0378f897777ad691.ContentText: ...As I expected. Before you came, whenever March wanted to go anywhere, Himeko would make Mr. Yang and me go with her.
0378f897777ad691.Speaker: Dan Heng

9ed89c28fdf3ddff.ContentText: And even after you arrived, I didn't suppose I'd be the one to be liberated of that duty.
9ed89c28fdf3ddff.Speaker: Dan Heng

f1093a3005e20616.ContentText: If I know Himeko, she's not gonna let you stay behind.
f1093a3005e20616.Speaker: Dan Heng

614d6838d22e4c79.ContentText: You're new, I'm sure she wants to get you started with some firsthand trailblazing.
614d6838d22e4c79.Speaker: Dan Heng

df900e41158e2ef8.ContentText: Don't worry. With March around, you are guaranteed an eventful expedition.
df900e41158e2ef8.Speaker: Dan Heng

ee131c081a3b0cab.ContentText: I assume the trailblazing objective this time is to find the Stellaron on Jarilo-VI and dispel the effect it's exerting on the star rail... right?
ee131c081a3b0cab.Speaker: Dan Heng

3dc4706d223aad8a.ContentText: I see. {NICKNAME}, you should find March. I'll join you two once I'm ready.
3dc4706d223aad8a.Speaker: Dan Heng

1da48ebaf057c557.ContentText: Did you talk to Dan Heng? How'd it go?
1da48ebaf057c557.Speaker: March 7th

9be72cc333b79a4e.ContentText: Really? I find that hard to believe...
9be72cc333b79a4e.Speaker: March 7th

5ec82c44483bed42.ContentText: *sigh* That's our Dan Heng — always trying to look cool with his poker face. Don't mind him~
5ec82c44483bed42.Speaker: March 7th

d15b352e75e4ebcb.ContentText: Relax, {NICKNAME}! Dan Heng and I are experienced trailblazers! We got your back!
d15b352e75e4ebcb.Speaker: March 7th

b93a4a4c76fe8465.ContentText: When I first saw this planet, I thought: A world covered in ice... could it have something to do with my past? Now I can't stop thinking about it.
b93a4a4c76fe8465.Speaker: March 7th

0fc4bc652c241bf6.ContentText: Still, the ice that trapped me was Six-Phased Ice — a very rare substance. I don't think you can find it on your average planet...
0fc4bc652c241bf6.Speaker: March 7th

656f9e5bad51c15f.ContentText: To be honest, I think I'd be kind of annoyed if I found out this was my homeworld. It looks freezing... Pretty girls aren't frost-resistant!
656f9e5bad51c15f.Speaker: March 7th

9de5c81753a14a85.ContentText: ...What? Is there something on my face?
9de5c81753a14a85.Speaker: Dan Heng

fae5907638ed1ad8.ContentText: Nah~ I was just imagining all the fun we're gonna have here... hee-hee!
fae5907638ed1ad8.Speaker: March 7th

449d8e20cf60a434.ContentText: ...I feel sorry for this world. First the Stellaron, and now you...
449d8e20cf60a434.Speaker: Dan Heng

7ca2ea6df58d3859.ContentText: Alright! Here comes, the Jarilo-VI Trailblaze Team!
7ca2ea6df58d3859.Speaker: March 7th

ae256bba9b1f5bb3.ContentText: As soon as the restricted zone gate is open, the monsters on the other side will turn out in full force. The Guards will do their best to stall them and buy you some time.
ae256bba9b1f5bb3.Speaker: Gepard

ebadbdd2b0058f9c.ContentText: Once you've broken through the front line... there's nothing more we can do for you. You'll have to find out for yourselves what lies within the northern Fragmentum.
ebadbdd2b0058f9c.Speaker: Gepard

5a91d7c9d1a2042d.ContentText: So... have you made up your minds?
5a91d7c9d1a2042d.Speaker: Gepard

f03da9e45d6ab6be.ContentText: Understood. Keep your weapons close. This will be a fierce fight.
f03da9e45d6ab6be.Speaker: Gepard

958a6cafd6a423ab.ContentText: Are you dealing with attacks like this every day?
958a6cafd6a423ab.Speaker: Serval

4e4a22617dc503fa.ContentText: Hmph, well I'm gonna make sure I don't owe the Guards any favors when this is done!
4e4a22617dc503fa.Speaker: Seele

a84f4069ac2ac8fd.ContentText: The more the merrier, these guys are nothing! Hold the line!
a84f4069ac2ac8fd.Speaker: Seele

455d18bf100a6185.ContentText: ...I told you, Gepard, the Barrier hasn't been fixed yet! Don't try and be a hero!
455d18bf100a6185.Speaker: Serval

a5a32bb9018fadc9.ContentText: This is... only the first wave. They'll have reassembled soon... I have to...
a5a32bb9018fadc9.Speaker: Gepard

396b26728a8e542c.ContentText: Hey, Mr. Silvermane, listen to your sister! I can tell just by looking at you that you haven't fully recovered.
396b26728a8e542c.Speaker: Seele

464fecd0ba5cf4ff.ContentText: Outsiders, Seele, the second wave hasn't started yet. Make the most of this opportunity and make a break for it!
464fecd0ba5cf4ff.Speaker: Serval

4a3caa8fc1c49efc.ContentText: Huh? Serval, aren't you gonna look for the Stellaron with us?
4a3caa8fc1c49efc.Speaker: March 7th

87075ee8d1f745f8.ContentText: My brother can't hold them back by himself. He wasted a lot of energy on us. He's my responsibility now. Besides...
87075ee8d1f745f8.Speaker: Serval

08c4b8e08e976379.ContentText: If I'm not here to help... I don't know what might happen in the next wave.
08c4b8e08e976379.Speaker: Serval

88676afa7ca7092a.ContentText: I want to go with you, I do! I always wanted to catch a glimpse of the Stellaron with my own eyes, and now it's so close...
88676afa7ca7092a.Speaker: Serval

0d549cf23bfc7c33.ContentText: But I can't abandon my brother and the other Guards — I'm a Landau! It's up to you now, I believe in you. You've given me new hope!
0d549cf23bfc7c33.Speaker: Serval

7b8ac98d4d5ea4a1.ContentText: Get hold of the Stellaron before Cocolia realizes what's happening!
7b8ac98d4d5ea4a1.Speaker: Serval

67bd85e772538647.ContentText: The Guards have opened up a way through for us, we can't let them down.
67bd85e772538647.Speaker: Dan Heng

d1226f945831b720.ContentText: Hey March! Don't forget to take a picture of the Stellaron for me.
d1226f945831b720.Speaker: Serval

b5bac486e07de98d.ContentText: Say no more! We're good at this. Don't worry!
b5bac486e07de98d.Speaker: March 7th

2132ef9504b8a950.ContentText: Fragmentum activity is intensifying... Something's happening on Jarilo-VI.
2132ef9504b8a950.Speaker: Welt

f683dd7d8ad61e37.ContentText: Shouldn't we go down there, Himeko?
f683dd7d8ad61e37.Speaker: Welt

452d0d3371286dd5.ContentText: Have faith in them. Besides, this is {M#his}{F#her} first Trailblazing expedition. How will {M#he}{F#she} be able to look back fondly without a few twists and turns?
452d0d3371286dd5.Speaker: Himeko

be87c8f2c22c27ae.ContentText: Are you bored, Welt? I understand... But we have lots of opportunities ahead of us. Let's leave the memories of this expedition for them~
be87c8f2c22c27ae.Speaker: Himeko

74c67b85ce35f32e.ContentText: So you think they'll be safe, right?
74c67b85ce35f32e.Speaker: Welt

40452aea7ecc52b7.ContentText: ...Yes, we haven't seen any Aeon or Emanator-level imaginary reactions. Relax.
40452aea7ecc52b7.Speaker: Himeko

b9f7dce114c7008c.ContentText: This is a young person's adventure, we shouldn't interfere. At most, we could offer a little "off-site assistance."
b9f7dce114c7008c.Speaker: Himeko

e93d9281c3f425ce.ContentText: Is this... the Fragmentum Gepard was talking about?
e93d9281c3f425ce.Speaker: Seele

be7e180027a6e3e0.ContentText: Compared to this, the corrosion we saw in Backwater Pass pales into insignificance.
be7e180027a6e3e0.Speaker: Dan Heng

6c4d71f91fb8ad61.ContentText: Serval said that the Stellaron was very likely hidden in the Snow Plains north of Belobog. If we want to get there, I'm afraid we'll have to find the exit to this Fragmentum maze first.
6c4d71f91fb8ad61.Speaker: Dan Heng

f6a9169ef847469e.ContentText: Guys... does this place feel weird to you? It feels like... like there are loads of eyes staring at us.
f6a9169ef847469e.Speaker: March 7th

d640fdd1cdbe0f87.ContentText: Oh yeah, {NICKNAME}. It feels like... like there are loads of eyes staring at us.
d640fdd1cdbe0f87.Speaker: March 7th

6c24e08b2b164ef1.ContentText: ...This place makes my flesh crawl... like there are insects under my skin.
6c24e08b2b164ef1.Speaker: Seele

cffa25c72eda18b3.ContentText: We have no guide and no way of detecting the Stellaron. We'll just have to advance gradually... and cautiously.
cffa25c72eda18b3.Speaker: Dan Heng

0d8277df43c04c9c.ContentText: Don't be disheartened. The stronger the Fragmentum contamination, the closer we are to the source.
0d8277df43c04c9c.Speaker: Dan Heng

f7d24ab0a2c80c40.ContentText: Look, up ahead on the ground... What is that?
f7d24ab0a2c80c40.Speaker: March 7th

7c6691d6655cc12d.ContentText: Be careful, think twice before you interact with anything in the Fragmentum.
7c6691d6655cc12d.Speaker: Dan Heng

5b6d6416d7c28abb.ContentText: Yeah! So she's... she's been here already?
5b6d6416d7c28abb.Speaker: Seele

d613f21f18118c72.ContentText: Right, she must be! This can't be a coincidence.
d613f21f18118c72.Speaker: Seele

e6e4b63c4f469042.ContentText: That's Bronya! H—Huh? Is that Cocolia too!?
e6e4b63c4f469042.Speaker: March 7th

08f575a5ad3a917f.ContentText: It must be... a kind of echo? Some type of residual energy replicated by the Fragmentum...
08f575a5ad3a917f.Speaker: Dan Heng

402ca832d386bc0b.ContentText: Which means they were definitely here, right?
402ca832d386bc0b.Speaker: March 7th

aeb89448818df529.ContentText: And it looks like they went that way.
aeb89448818df529.Speaker: March 7th

3d5e426276ba2f1c.ContentText: Ha, just in time! We had no idea which direction to take. Let's go!
3d5e426276ba2f1c.Speaker: Seele

787375e67930e67d.ContentText: Objects that have been exposed to Fragmentum corrosion might not be stable. I wouldn't touch that device if I were you.
787375e67930e67d.Speaker: Dan Heng

513e61d7dda8a9dd.ContentText: ...You still haven't told me what this place is, mother.
513e61d7dda8a9dd.Speaker: Bronya

35b2ad35d13413a0.ContentText: Seven hundred years ago, this was Belobog's northern border and the site of an ancient battle. Here is where Alisa Rand led the first Silvermane Guards in resistance against the Legion.

def21b1d1be0b607.ContentText: Now... it is nothing more than an abandoned corridor, filled with the sounds of Old World echoes.

85dff92697cdc87e.ContentText: Don't let its fragmented appearance fool you, Bronya. On the day the promise is fulfilled... these ruins will become the breeding ground of a new world.

f73a43cfaf4497da.ContentText: ...Mother, do you truly believe the Stellaron's promise? It summoned the blizzard beyond our walls and opened the door of the Fragmentum. It destroyed our civilization, it...
f73a43cfaf4497da.Speaker: Bronya

f034270c0c0515ed.ContentText: ...And yet, the crime of our ancestors was their inability to embrace that destruction sooner...

84b60d14ed4bca5c.ContentText: From the moment those intruders descended from beyond the sky, this world was handed a death sentence. But the Stellaron... has reserved for us a thread of hope.

43c8bafcd5842073.ContentText: There is a price to pay for new life. Wiping away every decaying vestige of the Old World, renouncing the meaningless and lingering struggle... This is the price the Stellaron demands.

c24189051911d66a.ContentText: When the promise is fulfilled, Bronya... no longer will we have to squander our lives guarding this wasteland. You and I will witness the new world rise from the ruins.

ac425c599856a3ad.ContentText: This is a complex mechanism. How did they get past?
ac425c599856a3ad.Speaker: Seele

3e74663fb541afc6.ContentText: *sigh* I knew this wouldn't be simple...
3e74663fb541afc6.Speaker: March 7th

13fc34283b8e30b5.ContentText: Wait! Wasn't there some big energy hub-looking thing back in that empty area? Let's go back and take a look, maybe it's linked to this gate.
13fc34283b8e30b5.Speaker: March 7th

098f5bef579471ac.ContentText: I can't say I like the idea of interacting with our surroundings — especially this deep into the Fragmentum. However...
098f5bef579471ac.Speaker: Dan Heng

73e389d4cbcbbf43.ContentText: ...There's no other way. Desperate times call for desperate measures.
73e389d4cbcbbf43.Speaker: Dan Heng

12d24816910c329b.ContentText: Ha, even Dan Heng the sensible has his adventurous days!
12d24816910c329b.Speaker: March 7th

2389c48ae45ff6d1.ContentText: ...But, the gate didn't move an inch...
2389c48ae45ff6d1.Speaker: March 7th

1e6e57de4acb217a.ContentText: Hmm. It's clear that whoever designed these mechanisms didn't want outsiders to get through too easily. Let's keep looking for the energy hub.
1e6e57de4acb217a.Speaker: Dan Heng

a1cc6a9327bfd950.ContentText: Look over there! I think I can see the next unit.
a1cc6a9327bfd950.Speaker: March 7th

64ad5a143c441174.ContentText: Are those monsters guarding the energy hub?
64ad5a143c441174.Speaker: March 7th

3c491607f81c6c71.ContentText: It seems like it... Strange. Fragmentum monsters would usually destroy man-made objects.
3c491607f81c6c71.Speaker: Dan Heng

bdf5940ac084b7c5.ContentText: Did you hear that? This mechanism must be on now!
bdf5940ac084b7c5.Speaker: March 7th

6384760291c3d3a2.ContentText: Come on, let's find the next one!
6384760291c3d3a2.Speaker: March 7th

41ee2e74241f563e.ContentText: I've never seen such a desolate place... At least in Rivet Town, you could tell that people used to live there.
41ee2e74241f563e.Speaker: Seele

3b1f29f64d9a6e57.ContentText: Rivet Town is only at the outstretched fingertips of the corrosion... Now, we're deep in the Fragmentum's heart.
3b1f29f64d9a6e57.Speaker: Dan Heng

9c293c7c52b28fe1.ContentText: Where is the next mechanism... Oh, behind that gate.
9c293c7c52b28fe1.Speaker: Seele

ba8bbc103b7c4ef0.ContentText: There's no switch. We need to find a way around.
ba8bbc103b7c4ef0.Speaker: Dan Heng

b961c7fe90fa434e.ContentText: {NICKNAME}, I want to ask you a question.
b961c7fe90fa434e.Speaker: Dan Heng

d7fe05a2db4b50d5.ContentText: Yes, I think this could well be the best time.
d7fe05a2db4b50d5.Speaker: Dan Heng

5609cbab1e7c2744.ContentText: Do you still remember those dreams you mentioned to us?
5609cbab1e7c2744.Speaker: Dan Heng

18602bb1962fc3d8.ContentText: I know you're wide awake right now, but I need you to try. See if you can recall the "voice" you heard.
18602bb1962fc3d8.Speaker: Dan Heng

40fafb1f476ea811.ContentText: You must...eradicate... Once... and for all...

2d3f57a08966c4f6.ContentText: This is merely speculation... but perhaps the voice you heard is the Stellaron somehow conveying information to Cocolia...
2d3f57a08966c4f6.Speaker: Dan Heng

82ea39970a946a5f.ContentText: ...and the one in your body... is resonating with the Stellaron on this world.
82ea39970a946a5f.Speaker: Dan Heng

ffa0da3482734e38.ContentText: Huh!? You mean that Stellarons can communicate? I've never heard that before...
ffa0da3482734e38.Speaker: March 7th

28af2b8edc013094.ContentText: Well, there's never been a human that could accommodate a Stellaron in their body.
28af2b8edc013094.Speaker: Dan Heng

9799506aa54d68c7.ContentText: ...Then, aren't we walking straight into a trap?
9799506aa54d68c7.Speaker: Seele

d6b4e587d4412d65.ContentText: ...Yes. And Bronya may well be the bait.
d6b4e587d4412d65.Speaker: Dan Heng

84c4342c41f694b9.ContentText: Dan Heng's speculations are usually right on the money. But even if we've guessed right, we can't go home now.
84c4342c41f694b9.Speaker: March 7th

de963220b1a13a34.ContentText: Hmph... there's no way back anyway. At least Cocolia won't catch us off guard now. So what if it's an ambush!? We're not about to lose now!
de963220b1a13a34.Speaker: Seele

37de6c1735e1e085.ContentText: I have to save Bronya, beat Cocolia, and crush this Stellaron thing to dust!
37de6c1735e1e085.Speaker: Seele

c24f681c6dbc263f.ContentText: Done! It took some effort, but we finally cracked these mechanisms...
c24f681c6dbc263f.Speaker: March 7th

9d719c9759bb6c91.ContentText: We're one step closer to Bronya. Let's move!
9d719c9759bb6c91.Speaker: Seele

d58ab97629bec20b.ContentText: Yes. The Fragmentum here seems to have made a special connection with Cocolia. It's repeatedly generating forms in her image.
d58ab97629bec20b.Speaker: Dan Heng

151401f95c942fd1.ContentText: I don't understand... Even if the truth is as you say, every generation of guardian has resisted the call of the Stellaron...
151401f95c942fd1.Speaker: Bronya

e6ea33f269715c2e.ContentText: Can all of them have been wrong, mother?
e6ea33f269715c2e.Speaker: Bronya

429ed6eb2b022fb9.ContentText: Do you still not see, Bronya? There is no right or wrong here. Some of them acted out of human pride, others out of human shortsightedness.

bd7b7cf36b7ee938.ContentText: Our ancestors... including Alisa Rand... spent their whole lives trying to prolong this civilization. Then, after all fell still, their memories were scattered by the blizzard.

4f7b38585a4a27e2.ContentText: They spent lifetimes writing songs of praise that lauded the bravery of humanity, but couldn't spare the time to gaze up into the stars.

fa1aaa514fa6802b.ContentText: To those entities of greater magnificence in the heavens above, a thousand years is but a passing moment, the attainments of insignificant beings nothing more than a footnote.

50a51c6a04cc17b4.ContentText: I shall not follow the guardians' misguided steps down that blind alley of narcissism. If persistence is futile, then one must choose a new beginning.

68a795ea26118737.ContentText: But, Qlipoth the Preservation... Are they not one of the magnificent entities you speak of? Is it not their strength... that has sheltered Belobog this entire time?
68a795ea26118737.Speaker: Bronya

a9ed5660890cbe05.ContentText: The Preservation... Has the Preservation ever looked humanity in the eye? Nothing more than an arrogant delusion of the Architects.

fd10c8793b4d7996.ContentText: You will hear the real voice of magnificence, Bronya... Then, you will understand my choice.

3259844d22f97aed.ContentText: Whoa, check this place out! Tables and sentry posts — there must have been Silvermane Guards stationed here once.
3259844d22f97aed.Speaker: March 7th

8d305bf3f9001240.ContentText: If there were, they left a long time ago. There might be valuable information here... shame we don't have time to look for it.
8d305bf3f9001240.Speaker: Dan Heng

e1848c0a626561fb.ContentText: Looks like another completely new monster.
e1848c0a626561fb.Speaker: March 7th

e64235ea7d128641.ContentText: Considering where we are, it would be surprising if we didn't run into strange enemies here.
e64235ea7d128641.Speaker: Dan Heng

1bb4429f9d1b4f10.ContentText: I don't care how strange it is, it's blocking our way... Let's get it!
1bb4429f9d1b4f10.Speaker: Seele

5f911a12a5978bb2.ContentText: This enemy is completely different! If I didn't know it was a product of the Fragmentum, I'd think we were fighting a human!
5f911a12a5978bb2.Speaker: March 7th

4416a58bd7c5fb29.ContentText: Unlike those random low-level Fragmentum creations, this one seems to have a mind of its own. It seems to be able to use complex tactics.
4416a58bd7c5fb29.Speaker: Dan Heng

9156f8199bcb3295.ContentText: Look, Bronya and Cocolia's echoes... they must have come through here.
9156f8199bcb3295.Speaker: March 7th

0bfdbe21dc1a9304.ContentText: ...That means we must be really close, right?
0bfdbe21dc1a9304.Speaker: March 7th

924a0c2b461e320f.ContentText: Hey, stay with it! This is the final push!
924a0c2b461e320f.Speaker: March 7th

ee6b8b955697f6e8.ContentText: I sense that we're very near to the northern Snow Plains.
ee6b8b955697f6e8.Speaker: Dan Heng

aae02a72335f517f.ContentText: This is where the first guardian led the Silvermane Guards into battle. She made huge sacrifices for the sake of temporary respite.

eb979c8a4af9a278.ContentText: But the otherworldly Legion did not tire. She soon realized that flesh and blood could not contend with so ruthless an enemy.

6d54f6820799bff9.ContentText: When all was nearly lost, she chose to set her sights on the Stellaron... and made the first wish.

ecf7a89bf5a965aa.ContentText: As for what came later... you know as well as I.

8392379ef6f34024.ContentText: So... the Eternal Freeze was a disaster brought about by a human wish...?
8392379ef6f34024.Speaker: Bronya

71e4da93b4fed8b3.ContentText: Ironic, no? All the Stellaron did was answer humanity's call, and yet we kept its existence a closely guarded secret for centuries.

bdbd7eee32ddf953.ContentText: Even going so far as to attempt to use "it" to control the Stellaron... Woeful... laughable.

3c364cf6766baf4a.ContentText: Something created using otherworldly technology... An inhibitor that the IPC from the Old World and the Architects attempted to use to house the Stellaron.

c24d6affe043204d.ContentText: ...I know you have many questions, my daughter. Be patient... soon you will have all the answers.

f1063088233a77f7.ContentText: It's that "shadow" of hers again... but Bronya's isn't with her this time.
f1063088233a77f7.Speaker: Seele

592933a027083aee.ContentText: It's only a Fragmentum illusion. {NICKNAME}, let's get a closer look.
592933a027083aee.Speaker: March 7th

80d0d83c55ca4c89.ContentText: It feels like this echo is different from the others before.
80d0d83c55ca4c89.Speaker: March 7th

d3023e435db9c9c8.ContentText: Huh!? Did... Did she just speak!?
d3023e435db9c9c8.Speaker: March 7th

6be2ce9063b723ee.ContentText: Not good — March, out the way!
6be2ce9063b723ee.Speaker: Seele

2d3d7c4b8c4d5403.ContentText: A—Are you sure this isn't the real her?
2d3d7c4b8c4d5403.Speaker: March 7th

a8305959e744389b.ContentText: It may look like her, but the Fragmentum can only create forgeries. Bring her down!
a8305959e744389b.Speaker: Dan Heng

d99cfc75dad1999d.ContentText: Those stairs... it's the only way forward.
d99cfc75dad1999d.Speaker: Seele

263ce7622a766352.ContentText: Wherever they lead, it must be the end of the journey.
263ce7622a766352.Speaker: Dan Heng

1dd9821c7e048046.ContentText: I don't wanna get to the end so soon... I want my journey to go on forever.
1dd9821c7e048046.Speaker: March 7th

6ab8e27eb93525cc.ContentText: This means that Bronya is up ahead... and so is the fate of the Overworld and the Underworld... It's all in our hands.
6ab8e27eb93525cc.Speaker: Seele

29ca9066a16bc8e3.ContentText: Strange, I thought I'd feel nervous or afraid... but I don't. The only feeling I have... is that none of this seems real.
29ca9066a16bc8e3.Speaker: Seele

a2fce4143d87d42f.ContentText: Not always, sometimes it's a happier conclusion.
a2fce4143d87d42f.Speaker: March 7th

3872962ec922c168.ContentText: To be honest, you never really get used to them! We always used to rely on Himeko and Mr. Yang.
3872962ec922c168.Speaker: March 7th

8e1db0254a50c5a9.ContentText: Hey, way to boost morale over there!
8e1db0254a50c5a9.Speaker: March 7th

a95a456b91c636b5.ContentText: The Express has traveled world after world. We are merely passing travellers — witnesses to part of a grander story.
a95a456b91c636b5.Speaker: Dan Heng

27660b73d4f70d24.ContentText: We invariably avoid getting drawn into turbulence that can decide the fate of a world... but there are always times when we have no choice but to act.
27660b73d4f70d24.Speaker: Dan Heng

975b31c5529ebe5a.ContentText: Or to put it another way, {NICKNAME}... this is one heck of a first Trailblazing expedition! You hit the jackpot!
975b31c5529ebe5a.Speaker: March 7th

7c31de6da988ab9a.ContentText: I was about to bore you all with my gloomy reflections... but on second thought — not today. Adventuring with you guys by my side has made me feel like no obstacle is too big.
7c31de6da988ab9a.Speaker: Seele

f23763f359cf031b.ContentText: Right on! But you can say whatever you like — a good adventure shouldn't be full of rules and regulations!
f23763f359cf031b.Speaker: March 7th

716d160d4781d7a4.ContentText: Helping those in need, befriending those worth counting on, and saving the world a few times along the way...
716d160d4781d7a4.Speaker: March 7th

590d7a52005ff0e8.ContentText: We're deep inside the Fragmentum... There could be hidden dangers lying in wait.
590d7a52005ff0e8.Speaker: March 7th

c397c83774c503af.ContentText: Let's look for other clues first.
c397c83774c503af.Speaker: March 7th

ee59e2835aa0c660.ContentText: Hey, it's too dangerous to operate the mechanism with them here... We better clean this place up first!
ee59e2835aa0c660.Speaker: Seele

7c42c77fa57e9642.ContentText: If we want to get to the other side, we'll need to rotate the gear bridge again and go around.
7c42c77fa57e9642.Speaker: Dan Heng

58f5d97acafd09af.ContentText: If we avoid the enemy, we might be ambushed further in.
58f5d97acafd09af.Speaker: Dan Heng

d3d277830b79b5c6.ContentText: It'll be too late for regrets then... Let's defeat this one here.
d3d277830b79b5c6.Speaker: Dan Heng

36b558fb7661c2e0.ContentText: It's f—freezing here — the blizzard's so fierce! The power from the Trailblaze Path isn't enough to stop the cold...
36b558fb7661c2e0.Speaker: March 7th

7a7f77ff7e596406.ContentText: It means that we're getting closer to the Stellaron... and the heart of the Eternal Freeze.
7a7f77ff7e596406.Speaker: Dan Heng

91b18c11c692c928.ContentText: ...very different from the uniform style of the buildings we saw in the city.
91b18c11c692c928.Speaker: Dan Heng

c1e428b9138fc178.ContentText: Does it... look like the palm of a huge hand to you?
c1e428b9138fc178.Speaker: March 7th

eac3a6084aa5aa69.ContentText: ...It's like an insect trapped in amber...
eac3a6084aa5aa69.Speaker: Dan Heng

8a49a4ec3fe052be.ContentText: I bet the Antimatter Legion forces never thought they'd be swallowed up by the Eternal Freeze when they invaded this world.
8a49a4ec3fe052be.Speaker: March 7th

f49dd2d1b417a02d.ContentText: Even in the ice... could these guys still be alive...?
f49dd2d1b417a02d.Speaker: March 7th

85b9b8da927b2b9c.ContentText: No, no! We've got enough on our plate.
85b9b8da927b2b9c.Speaker: March 7th

483166c27d94f7b3.ContentText: I... I don't remember... It's a blank canvas...
483166c27d94f7b3.Speaker: March 7th

c34434cabe3f84aa.ContentText: I'm impressed you can still think up jokes right now...
c34434cabe3f84aa.Speaker: March 7th

9e84c47f4d966d63.ContentText: The Commercial District has fallen. We've transfered the residents to the Outer Municipal District for the time being. The Garrison lost <unbreak>26</unbreak> fighters... but I...
9e84c47f4d966d63.Speaker: Gepard

122bd0b005e61111.ContentText: I... I'm not sure that they're dead... I saw their broken figures lingering in the Fragmentum...
122bd0b005e61111.Speaker: Gepard

65c064a0cf651c77.ContentText: What happened back there defied all reason... it was madness. Madam Guardian, if this continues...
65c064a0cf651c77.Speaker: Gepard

da5760974b72b8aa.ContentText: ...I know well the consequences, Gepard. You may leave.

cecc00e51dad1a68.ContentText: ...Why do you hesitate, Cocolia? Isn't this what you've always been hoping for? Get out of this cage and take a look at the city. What is there to lose!?
cecc00e51dad1a68.Speaker: Serval

39564eca92122d2f.ContentText: The efforts of our predecessors... their unfinished research... we can finally see them come to fruition! Give me some soldiers and I'll locate the Stellaron and find out how to save our world—
39564eca92122d2f.Speaker: Serval

d8f75485a0c2f578.ContentText: ...You need to come to your senses, Serval.

b432ecd2d28ed946.ContentText: Come... to my senses? What are you—
b432ecd2d28ed946.Speaker: Serval

870fb4563ae0a758.ContentText: Guards! Miss Serval is tired, take her to rest.

9beee0452e17a876.ContentText: Sequester her lab and detain the researchers — their work is illegal.

0d9fccf0507be876.ContentText: ...Why Cocolia... Why have you grown so cold...
0d9fccf0507be876.Speaker: Serval

975eb43380b21414.ContentText: Serval Landau... you were my most cherished friend.

5a10ea78344a0156.ContentText: ...But there is no place for her in the promised new world.

63446a347273e933.ContentText: Madam Cocolia, the monsters are surging this way! ...It's too dangerous here!

eaf250244a2f79c2.ContentText: Only I... Only I can understand. They have eyes that do not see, ears that do not hear...

443a421ace6fa58b.ContentText: Feast on their willful ignorance... absolve them of their stupidity and fear...

0db378196846b91d.ContentText: The Fragmentum corrosion has already spread to the Underworld. How will those below ground fend for themselves if we withdraw every guard?
0db378196846b91d.Speaker: Bronya

fbdfe4989db0f5c0.ContentText: The automatons will ensure their safety. The most important defensive position is here on the surface. If our lines crumble, the underground will vanish in an instant. Our defenses here must be maintained at all costs.

c7a5621f6faded2f.ContentText: These are the choices we make, Bronya... As a leader, you must harbor the courage and foresight to choose.

42820027b02a9946.ContentText: You, me, and every Silvermane Guard in the city, all of us must carry out a higher mission. There will come a day when you must make your own choice. Do you understand?

b2c62e307c76dea9.ContentText: It is too early Bronya... still too early. You will understand when the time is right.

07bde2ae551ef97d.ContentText: Do not resist, Bronya... Accept the common will!

6bf4e7bac3570005.ContentText: No... I... I don't want this...
6bf4e7bac3570005.Speaker: Bronya

adb8c4a626b9347a.ContentText: Look upon their promised future, Bronya! A world without poverty, without cold, without suffering... A world where people no longer have to pray like prisoners for survival... A world that we can guard for all eternity.

032df69ca7b9d243.ContentText: Seven hundred years ago, we tried and fought unceasingly, believing that the radiance of human nature could shepherd us towards rejuvenation. And to what end? A crushing defeat!

49d628d8176a61f0.ContentText: Why, when faced with irrefutable strength, is our first thought always to resist, to cover our ears, instead of hearing the call?

cb9382cfd40a7f71.ContentText: It is the conceit and cowardice entrenched in the depths of human nature — so difficult to efface. Cast them aside, break free of the chains that bind you! The Stellaron will lead humanity to evolve, and they will...

16e31a102c02b892.ContentText: Your brainwashing ends here, you witch!
16e31a102c02b892.Speaker: Seele

48ac34c66ce8564e.ContentText: ...You came. I thought the blizzards had entombed you...

98d78c07e8d241db.ContentText: You wish! We're not going down before you do!
98d78c07e8d241db.Speaker: Seele

1b733e21d9683f64.ContentText: Bronya! I don't know what happened between you and them. Even if you explained it to me, I probably wouldn't understand all the crazy details. But there are two things I do know...
1b733e21d9683f64.Speaker: Seele

9d6678199635b5f5.ContentText: One: These guys have come through hell to get here — to seal this Stellaron thing.
9d6678199635b5f5.Speaker: Seele

7b653a754903326e.ContentText: And two: Do you remember what I said? If anything happened to you, I'd save you.
7b653a754903326e.Speaker: Seele

00889c6d08868677.ContentText: Do you understand? Even if the damage is done — even if you've completely forgotten our promise, then... then I'm just gonna have to knock you out and bring you back myself!
00889c6d08868677.Speaker: Seele

ca6996be29888157.ContentText: ...Finished? I think I've given you long enough, to... bid farewell.

e5543872fa6a3a44.ContentText: It's time I told you my other reason for bringing you here, Bronya.

6748726ab73963d5.ContentText: I want to witness your choice.

d939568068220493.ContentText: I have told you all the truths there are to tell: The deal with the Stellaron, the wish I made to it... There are no more secrets between us.

544d2488a8ce448a.ContentText: Many years ago, the voice of the Stellaron sounded in my ears for the first time. I was no different from the previous generations of guardians... I withdrew, refused to hear. I was as you are now — bitterly defending the Architects' so-called "Preservation..."

da63429212a4028d.ContentText: My conviction was once steadfast, unparalleled... until a sudden change arrived and threw everything into chaos. Another choice appeared before me — a subversion of the old order... and the welcoming of a new world.

6ee5289af3eab7fc.ContentText: And compared to the illusory, evermore distant Preservation, this was so tangible...

c92036a3227df0a7.ContentText: I have agonized — long agonized over how to convey all this to you. Inevitably, the promised tomorrow will transpire... but if you were not there beside me, to watch over that new world...

1b5194aa2a6d5f9e.ContentText: ...Then I would descend into torment, Bronya — enduring torment!

758ca2b259009941.ContentText: Perhaps I should be thanking you, outsiders. The pressure you have imposed... has at long last compelled me to confront my final... weakness.

1c7ac8bbd4ee2540.ContentText: Bronya, throughout your life, I have never forced you to submit to my will. You have always, will always have a choice... as then, so now.

33ec6bedef491ab3.ContentText: Madam Cocolia... I am grateful to you for raising me, and for allowing me the privilege of choice.
33ec6bedef491ab3.Speaker: Bronya

aeff39f62ff3a7aa.ContentText: But... I am sorry, mother. On this, our final occasion, I cannot stand with you.
aeff39f62ff3a7aa.Speaker: Bronya

40074de081915064.ContentText: You say that conceit and cowardice lie in the depths of human nature — perhaps you're right... desperation sheds light on the darkest recesses of the heart.
40074de081915064.Speaker: Bronya

c1fa87d83e5ec6f5.ContentText: ...But what about those simply struggling for survival, fighting for something better? I've witnessed their light on the front lines, in the Underworld... in places you have overlooked.
c1fa87d83e5ec6f5.Speaker: Bronya

3b7729ced42bc992.ContentText: Our ancestors built this city — striving in the bitter snow to prolong our civilization. Even if this world is doomed to fall apart, we should allow humanity to pave the way to its final outcome...
3b7729ced42bc992.Speaker: Bronya

bd6b9bc690fb52db.ContentText: ...Not hand over our fate to this seed of ruin!
bd6b9bc690fb52db.Speaker: Bronya

03a5ce02004d5d28.ContentText: We are guardians, mother! Chosen from among the masses! Our duty is to preserve the world built by humanity! We are not gods! We are not arbiters!
03a5ce02004d5d28.Speaker: Bronya

5cb7e7f884603e69.ContentText: You seek to crush human nature underfoot while masquerading as an... as an arbiter and a god! I cannot let you!
5cb7e7f884603e69.Speaker: Bronya

159781e384ec3f6b.ContentText: So... this is your choice. I understand, Bronya.

68baf3fc372cfaf4.ContentText: Pity... Such a pity that you will never see that resplendent world... Unable to free yourself from the shackles of your mind... You know what? You were supposed to be... the mother of the new world.

fe845616f7b90b6b.ContentText: The ground... it's shaking! What's happening!?
fe845616f7b90b6b.Speaker: March 7th

c2032df2bb6da145.ContentText: The fate of this city... of Belobog... is sealed. Its future will unfold in our hands.

188da00b709338d6.ContentText: And you... will become the foundation of the new world!

51a7c82fa9f9c6f4.ContentText: Th—This robot's a thousand times bigger than Svarog!
51a7c82fa9f9c6f4.Speaker: March 7th

c65d020468a50fbf.ContentText: ...The future of Belobog rests in my hands!

03ae741c7d5c37b8.ContentText: Behold, the end is upon you!

ec73b9efb813f806.ContentText: How can we bring a giant like this down?
ec73b9efb813f806.Speaker: Bronya

4dc884c80394f6e0.ContentText: Listen to the power surge... sing...

f707f2af4e419947.ContentText: The Stellaron's promise is the only hope for this world...

a15cd0b8cd1386be.ContentText: Just as it dispelled the Antimatter Legion <unbreak>700</unbreak> years ago, so too will it wipe you from the face of this world!

fb97dec0fba6c061.ContentText: ...You lost your final chance to leave this place.

31006e1e42c85318.ContentText: The will of Preservation has made its choice...
31006e1e42c85318.Speaker: Bronya

978e2bece1c7b12b.ContentText: Hmph. The future of Belobog is no longer just the guardian's to decide.
978e2bece1c7b12b.Speaker: Seele

16dfe1fe8bf51c1b.ContentText: You know nothing of the plight of this world... nothing of the wait for its final end!

9b8b7c03b72eac9f.ContentText: On the contrary, we know it well.
9b8b7c03b72eac9f.Speaker: Bronya

eceeb9f3ec6b58e2.ContentText: Even in the face of the blizzard and the Fragmentum... the people of this city never gave up hope, never stopped yearning for tomorrow.
eceeb9f3ec6b58e2.Speaker: Seele

42799a0d331c2b36.ContentText: Even if we are doomed to destruction, we will go bravely, walking hand in hand into the darkness...
42799a0d331c2b36.Speaker: Bronya

af49d637db71dbbf.ContentText: No! That end won't come to pass while we're around!
af49d637db71dbbf.Speaker: March 7th

ccb6dc1130d188b8.ContentText: In the name of every citizen of Belobog, I command you to rise... Engine of Creation!
ccb6dc1130d188b8.Speaker: playerboy

9615941879a7f0a4.ContentText: No... No! Obey my commands! Obey me!

7b2af263a8c637b7.ContentText: The power of the Stellaron is with me...

f96d906bec260cae.ContentText: You are but cinders of the Old World soon to become ashes!

507ee41dff798922.ContentText: If Cocolia threatens us by taking Bronya hostage...
507ee41dff798922.Speaker: March 7th

df11be4358244c28.ContentText: We have to save her. The Underworld... no, the entire planet relies on her.
df11be4358244c28.Speaker: Seele

2c31537c44f0932a.ContentText: Hello? Can you hear me? This signal is terrible...
2c31537c44f0932a.Speaker: Himeko

017a743ee36004d6.ContentText: Himeko! You finally spared a thought for us!
017a743ee36004d6.Speaker: March 7th

5d8af1833ac8aead.ContentText: What are you talking about — Welt and I have been up on the star rail missing you this whole time! You've got quite the Trailblazing expedition on your hands.
5d8af1833ac8aead.Speaker: Himeko

eea6d78c192c3a1c.ContentText: So how does this big guy work...? Or more importantly — how do you stop him from working? Over to you guys, I guess!
eea6d78c192c3a1c.Speaker: Himeko

86c7e9e1b18aaca7.ContentText: But I was fighting Cocolia. Why am I here...?
86c7e9e1b18aaca7.Speaker: playerboy

6bfb848f9468ed26.ContentText: ...The last time I came here, I drew Nanook's gaze. Could it be...
6bfb848f9468ed26.Speaker: playerboy

cdd49505401f1b71.ContentText: This spear... isn't that Cocolia's weapon?
cdd49505401f1b71.Speaker: playerboy

4be169b7e80ba2eb.ContentText: Thank you again... If it weren't for you and Doctor Natasha, Hook and I probably would've been in big trouble.

9ddbf7beefcc20a2.ContentText: *sigh* Well, a few days ago, I found a Geomarrow vein using a vein detector, and I sold this info to Antonia, a supervisor of the mining team.

5c97e62c3b5db321.ContentText: Then those vagrants heard about it and accused me of being a traitor... They believe that since I'm also a vagrant who came from another mine and ended up in here for a living, I should naturally be on their side.

b22f8c334630c5a0.ContentText: The mining team could not agree with that, of course. *sigh* I'm too old for this...

46553fde3a22e004.ContentText: Yes indeed, it is quite a valuable piece of information.

cbae79d5f9d37f95.ContentText: You think so? But I don't believe I owe anything to the vagrants. In fact, when they had no roof over their heads, I begged the mining team to offer them shelter...

99e89bcf039fd8b2.ContentText: *sigh* I was so naive... How can I expect those rascals to know anything about gratitude...

989730fb5c98f0c3.ContentText: Daddy, are we short on money? Why did you do that?
989730fb5c98f0c3.Speaker: Hook

0d59bfffbbc216c8.ContentText: My poor child... Daddy is old now. Who knows how long I can stay by your side? I have to start preparing for your future.

bb2859f8b3d29989.ContentText: People say I'm selfish, think I'm a traitor, but it doesn't matter to me. All you need to know is, when I'm gone, you will have the money to take care of yourself and survive on your own...

4ae42befe7865426.ContentText: Forget about it. Since I've got the money from the mining team, I have nothing to complain about now.

cca18de7a4267f0f.ContentText: It's just a shame that I lost my vein detector... It was indeed a treasure.

fd40d022761e546c.ContentText: I guess so. It's an ancient relic that can detect Geomarrow veins. It's very rare — I haven't seen a second one in my life.

68beea1994d79f3d.ContentText: I often carried it around looking for a new claim, I suppose some villains must have taken notice.

c5d62da945657bcb.ContentText: It's an ancient relic that I found in a mine. People say it's a device that mining teams used for detecting Geomarrow veins long ago.

6c8e3bb2c1254f02.ContentText: I often carried it around looking for a fresh claim, perhaps some villains up to no good took notice. It's a rare device you know, no wonder somebody stole it...

c6ff59baefe63325.ContentText: ...Anyway, I guess I don't need the detector anymore. The less trouble the better, I shouldn't care who stole my device... *sigh* Whoever it was, I hope they get good use out of it...

b6f3680726a4fd94.ContentText: {M#Hook seems to be giving me a look like: "I wanna talk to you outside the clinic, now!"}{F#Hook seems to be giving me a look that says: "Hook wants to talk to you outside the clinic, now!"}
b6f3680726a4fd94.Speaker: playerboy

e8c9bd787c68781f.ContentText: (So that's why people call eyes the "windows to the soul.")
e8c9bd787c68781f.Speaker: playerboy

1bdc0dc6c06daefb.ContentText: ...If I had done that, I would've completely destroyed my credibility.

e19a64ff5e6a1167.ContentText: My friend, are you serious? This device is quite rare. Are you really willing to sell it to me at such a low price?
e19a64ff5e6a1167.Speaker: Sampo

385af71813bd6e00.ContentText: I mean, I love a sweet deal as much as anyone, but I still have common sense — there has to be a catch, right?
385af71813bd6e00.Speaker: Sampo

8d58bcacc1b7439d.ContentText: No, no, why are you making this so complicated? Do you want it or not? Just tell me!

5b7d74c9740cb389.ContentText: You two, stop right there! Pitch-Dark Hook the Great has arrived!
5b7d74c9740cb389.Speaker: Hook

916cd10e97cfe201.ContentText: Just doing a little business. What's all the fuss?
916cd10e97cfe201.Speaker: Sampo

702c52e4e79bdb4a.ContentText: Tsk boy, I knew it was too good to be true!
702c52e4e79bdb4a.Speaker: Sampo

f1b384dca40e2553.ContentText: Tsk boy, I knew it was too good to be true!
f1b384dca40e2553.Speaker: Sampo

f64370ee51734c4d.ContentText: I gotta make this clear: I have nothing to do with this fella! You have to trust me— Miss Hook, please don't point that thing at me, it's scary!
f64370ee51734c4d.Speaker: Sampo

1f9e8ec74a9ccdee.ContentText: Hey! How can you sell me out like that! We had a deal...

adaedad07bfc30c8.ContentText: You! You stole daddy's treasure! Diggertron will not spare you...!
adaedad07bfc30c8.Speaker: Hook

a4c1f0bf0a2021f7.ContentText: This... this is all that old Fersman's fault! Just because he has this device I'm holding, he can make a fortune... It's not fair!

d502f2c4a13f44b6.ContentText: Umm, well... It seems you guys have some issues to sort out. So... maybe I should leave.
d502f2c4a13f44b6.Speaker: Sampo

cf7002d68400f910.ContentText: What kind of a reason are you looking for? With the Underworld in such a sad state, how are we supposed to survive if we don't resort to robbing and stealing?

512d5cce40a11691.ContentText: The heck if I care! With the Underworld in such a sad state, how are we supposed to survive if we don't resort to robbing and stealing?

bb1c6e622d9c5412.ContentText: Hmph, anyway, I got the device now! Come take it... if you have the guts!

875f56f72fd6d7bc.ContentText: Wait a second! Let's all just calm down! Is there something wrong with the source of this stuff? I mean, I've got nothing to do with it...
875f56f72fd6d7bc.Speaker: Sampo

92c77729e61dc492.ContentText: Th—This... a teddy bear's cap, clothes, and a dresser! And a little home for him...
92c77729e61dc492.Speaker: Hook

7262dcb4098209e3.ContentText: Toy-making companies are increasingly scarce this year... I had to travel to different towns. I never expected Junjun might have been sold. What a shame...

14bbe921a2ed4ddb.ContentText: It's okay daddy, don't cry! Natasha will teach me how to make another doll!
14bbe921a2ed4ddb.Speaker: Hook

5af61b5d123f5828.ContentText: Oh, yeah! I got a gift for you, too! Open it and take a look!
5af61b5d123f5828.Speaker: Hook

cf54a76e4470f2ad.ContentText: Hehe, {NICKNAME} helped me to bid for it at the auction! I bought it with the money I got from selling Junjun!
cf54a76e4470f2ad.Speaker: Hook

43c4074aca05f306.ContentText: With this, you should be able to repair the vein detector, right daddy?
43c4074aca05f306.Speaker: Hook

b3512ecc214b66cc.ContentText: Thank you so much, Hook! Daddy really likes this birthday gift... but I might not be able to use it right now...

00f58a9992b51986.ContentText: I... bought your gift with the money I got from selling the vein detector.

6503c5747a38b41d.ContentText: ...Ah!? So my gift is also... useless...
6503c5747a38b41d.Speaker: Hook

30ca4c61e971444f.ContentText: Hook... do you still like the gift I got for you?

68d3170da68664e2.ContentText: ...O—Of course! Your gifts are the best in the world!
68d3170da68664e2.Speaker: Hook

71817e7a010b2808.ContentText: I feel the same way about your gift, Hook. Me and you are in the same boat.

d46a755420c55b7f.ContentText: Ah, honorary member of The Moles! Listen up!
d46a755420c55b7f.Speaker: Hook

1521e76c385fac78.ContentText: How rude! You should have called me Pitch-Dark... Ugh, never mind...
1521e76c385fac78.Speaker: Hook

96df4163f4ffc9f9.ContentText: Thank you for helping Hook find the detector, but now Hook needs to ask you another favor...
96df4163f4ffc9f9.Speaker: Hook

7905833a47b031e2.ContentText: Haha, I haven't even mentioned what this is about! But that's the spirit. You truly are an honorary member of The Moles!
7905833a47b031e2.Speaker: Hook

7a2f674bf23221b4.ContentText: Hook and daddy's birthday is approaching! Every year at this time, we exchange gifts and celebrate our birthday together.
7a2f674bf23221b4.Speaker: Hook

dd87639f64b03dbe.ContentText: Daddy's job has been more difficult since moving to Boulder Town. He gets home really late every day. I don't want to use his hard-earned money to buy a gift!
dd87639f64b03dbe.Speaker: Hook

217ecb599206f144.ContentText: ...Oh, I've broken a thing or two in the clinic, you see... I'm too embarrassed to ask for help from the old witch...
217ecb599206f144.Speaker: Hook

f70699421853723b.ContentText: Actually, I still have some valuable treasure of my own in Rivet Town. It's a shame I left it there. If I go bring it back and sell it for a decent price, I can buy a gift for daddy without begging anyone for money.
f70699421853723b.Speaker: Hook

71ad274a58a273f2.ContentText: I know that Rivet Town is super dangerous right now! That's why I'd like to enlist you as my bodyguard!
71ad274a58a273f2.Speaker: Hook

92ece57408d534c9.ContentText: That way, even if the old witch finds out later, I won't be the only one getting a scolding, hehe!
92ece57408d534c9.Speaker: Hook

e51d4b7b10c2fe08.ContentText: Wh—What nonsense! This is an order from the boss of The Moles. An order!
e51d4b7b10c2fe08.Speaker: Hook

a4661962f9291a4f.ContentText: And I'm still a kid! You wouldn't let me go inside the Fragmentum by myself, would you?
a4661962f9291a4f.Speaker: Hook

22a8b76b3c88ef66.ContentText: Then it's settled, let's meet in Rivet Town! I'll be waiting for you in a safe spot. You're not allowed to not come!
22a8b76b3c88ef66.Speaker: Hook

43e87594ecbbb07d.ContentText: I've got to get back to my treasure!
43e87594ecbbb07d.Speaker: Hook

d5045b9dcb1f3bac.ContentText: Let's agree to meet in Rivet Town! I'll be waiting for you in a safe spot. You're not allowed to not come!
d5045b9dcb1f3bac.Speaker: Hook

23a4f5333d0c8a2b.ContentText: Hmph, at least hear me out first before you refuse.
23a4f5333d0c8a2b.Speaker: Hook

327d91e6e79dac6c.ContentText: {NICKNAME}, what took you so long? Hook's been waiting here for ages!
327d91e6e79dac6c.Speaker: Hook

dd06f61f8f0df331.ContentText: ...Well, it wasn't actually that long. As long as you're here now, it's fine!
dd06f61f8f0df331.Speaker: Hook

56b9a8162508a10e.ContentText: ...Okay, whatever you say. As long as you're here now, it's fine!
56b9a8162508a10e.Speaker: Hook

d8770a0de1a8cc17.ContentText: I got some good news and some bad news. Which do you wanna hear first?
d8770a0de1a8cc17.Speaker: Hook

aa4e3c06ee87ac6c.ContentText: I told the rest of The Moles about the plan, and Julian asked me to get some treasure for him. If we don't help him, he'll tell the old witch where we've gone!
aa4e3c06ee87ac6c.Speaker: Hook

15cc55fe0d40f73d.ContentText: The good news is that he's willing to contribute to our adventure. Look, he gave me this gardening shovel!
15cc55fe0d40f73d.Speaker: Hook

bbc737f5dedb323a.ContentText: Julian is willing to contribute to our adventure. Look, he gave me this gardening shovel!
bbc737f5dedb323a.Speaker: Hook

14a269ec62bef903.ContentText: The bad news is that he asked us to help him get some treasure... Otherwise, he'll tell the old witch about our plan!
14a269ec62bef903.Speaker: Hook

ba672be4342b6ec8.ContentText: Well, Julian has been a huge help to me! Consider this returning the favor.
ba672be4342b6ec8.Speaker: Hook

6835c5dd2c3bf189.ContentText: Hehehehe her...? No, what? N—Nonsense, no! Nobody scares Pitch-Dark Hook the Great!
6835c5dd2c3bf189.Speaker: Hook

d72ea9f2da9fef67.ContentText: Well, the treasure won't grow legs and find us, will it! Come on, let's go!
d72ea9f2da9fef67.Speaker: Hook

295f07f9e28dab5e.ContentText: Julian's parents used to own a business in this area. When we were all forced to leave the town, there were lots of things they didn't have time to take with them.
295f07f9e28dab5e.Speaker: Hook

870116021405c001.ContentText: ...It shouldn't be too hard to locate his treasure! Let's start by looking over there!
870116021405c001.Speaker: Hook

2def3c0b8ff34c00.ContentText: Ah, we found Julian's treasure! No, not the key — these glass marbles. Look at all the different colors! I bet it wasn't easy collecting all these.
2def3c0b8ff34c00.Speaker: Hook

e747c9d020440353.ContentText: What? Hee-hee, you don't know? Have you never played marbles before!?
e747c9d020440353.Speaker: Hook

65c097d863d1b94a.ContentText: By the way, what does this key open? Maybe Julian knows...
65c097d863d1b94a.Speaker: Hook

ebd7b5e1cda92a4d.ContentText: No, these marbles are what he's after.
ebd7b5e1cda92a4d.Speaker: Hook

7cf39beaac0cb5bc.ContentText: But I'm also curious... What does this key open? Let's ask Julian when we get back.
7cf39beaac0cb5bc.Speaker: Hook

23a919aea187a41f.ContentText: What's that look on your face? Oh, I get it. You don't think this jar of glass marbles is worth anything, right?
23a919aea187a41f.Speaker: Hook

ca9737b81d7522b6.ContentText: Hmph, don't even try to pretend otherwise! The look on your face sold you out!
ca9737b81d7522b6.Speaker: Hook

3865f7bc2156c29a.ContentText: Let me tell you something, this jar of marbles means a lot to The Moles.
3865f7bc2156c29a.Speaker: Hook

e5fea9b51939dfe3.ContentText: Julian used it to help The Moles overcome a super-huge crisis, for which he was promoted to second-in-command!
e5fea9b51939dfe3.Speaker: Hook

26ecfbcd31033ccc.ContentText: Of course it wasn't that. But his accomplishments are nothing to be scoffed at!
26ecfbcd31033ccc.Speaker: Hook

95d115c4529fb09d.ContentText: It was a super-huge crisis that jeopardized The Moles' honor!
95d115c4529fb09d.Speaker: Hook

ad3a49d69b088ef7.ContentText: In the past, the kids in town were archrivals to us at the orphanage! Those kids used to bully us, relying on the pocket money that their parents gave 'em.
ad3a49d69b088ef7.Speaker: Hook

d7e85bee14e96610.ContentText: One time, they sent us a formal declaration of war — challenging The Moles to a marbles competition!
d7e85bee14e96610.Speaker: Hook

59a5b5e5d1898391.ContentText: We were all well aware that we didn't stand a chance! We at the orphanage only had some old glass marbles we scavenged from the side of the road, which were no match for those rich kids' marbles!
59a5b5e5d1898391.Speaker: Hook

c394c779be84c112.ContentText: Nonetheless, Julian bravely accepted the challenge... and triumphantly returned with a pile of colorful glass marbles he won! It was incredible!
c394c779be84c112.Speaker: Hook

458939717b544a5b.ContentText: Yep. So now you know why he wanted us to find this treasure.
458939717b544a5b.Speaker: Hook

f505597758028aff.ContentText: Alright, enough chit-chat! Next we need to find my treasure.
f505597758028aff.Speaker: Hook

2816e7dedb853aee.ContentText: You're being a rude adult again... Believe me, I'm not exaggerating when I say that crisis was super huge!
2816e7dedb853aee.Speaker: Hook

35bccb8f6f9cdbf8.ContentText: After that epic story, that's all you have to say? Ugh... I would've been better off telling a stone-grilled olm instead.
35bccb8f6f9cdbf8.Speaker: Hook

4735f77e5ff0b316.ContentText: Time to get to work! Hook's treasure is hidden below the orphanage, near the mine's entrance.
4735f77e5ff0b316.Speaker: Hook

f4128565adaff785.ContentText: This doesn't feel like the Rivet Town I remember... Do you think the orphanage is like this now too?
f4128565adaff785.Speaker: Hook

9aca4b6f296f5134.ContentText: This place is nothing like it was before I left! Boxes and mine carts are all over the street. What a mess! Did someone move my treasure too?
9aca4b6f296f5134.Speaker: Hook

443fd9567449b9ab.ContentText: I used to keep it in the mining team's junk pile. Behind the corner, there were heaps of Geomarrow and boxes. Hopefully, it hasn't been taken.
443fd9567449b9ab.Speaker: Hook

99a0675d7eed6162.ContentText: That's all I can recall. But don't worry, I'll look with you! Heh, I may even find it before you.
99a0675d7eed6162.Speaker: Hook

585d55caca80a6e1.ContentText: I'll look with you. We'll definitely find it if we work together.
585d55caca80a6e1.Speaker: Hook

4219af7cc94420c4.ContentText: What a shame, honorary member! In the end, we still had to rely on Pitch-Dark Hook the Great herself.
4219af7cc94420c4.Speaker: Hook

c40de97486134a55.ContentText: Quick, help! I can't reach it, it's too high!
c40de97486134a55.Speaker: Hook

92480b6d8fdfa372.ContentText: Look, it's in this box! This miniature drill rig was given to me by a guy from daddy's mining team as a birthday present!
92480b6d8fdfa372.Speaker: Hook

17a17d654f90a1bb.ContentText: I'm going to turn it on... Whoosh!
17a17d654f90a1bb.Speaker: Hook

c500fd86306649cf.ContentText: J—Just don't talk to me right now... I need to calm down!
c500fd86306649cf.Speaker: Hook

f59f3fc1025c6b2c.ContentText: I said don't talk to me right now! I need time to think...
f59f3fc1025c6b2c.Speaker: Hook

6852ab5150468fc2.ContentText: Honorary member... Um, I wonder, how much do you think Julian's glass marbles would sell for?
6852ab5150468fc2.Speaker: Hook

c2c4c9597f0926e5.ContentText: ...Uhh, what? Hehehe, did you think I was serious? I wasn't actually planning on selling these marbles — besides, they aren't even worth much.
c2c4c9597f0926e5.Speaker: Hook

14bf0f6086c92a14.ContentText: ...*sigh* I wasn't actually planning on selling these marbles... But Julian gets his treasure and I get nothing... What a lousy bargain!
14bf0f6086c92a14.Speaker: Hook

194f3b72342ebe76.ContentText: That might work... but it'll be pretty expensive to fix, right?
194f3b72342ebe76.Speaker: Hook

862d697afd97dad9.ContentText: Not possible. Daddy said that guy went missing one day, and he never saw him again. Maybe he went to someplace far away...
862d697afd97dad9.Speaker: Hook

04700f8340f7bd58.ContentText: I have no idea when he'll come back. So that definitely won't work!
04700f8340f7bd58.Speaker: Hook
