35fecd8a36fbeb13.ContentText: Not as much as Diggertron, but that guy who gave it to me was pretty skillful. He could always make fancy things.
35fecd8a36fbeb13.Speaker: Hook

974141c7732e6d17.ContentText: Wait a second! I hid another treasure at the orphanage! I don't want to sell it, but if I want to buy daddy a gift, I don't have any other choice...
974141c7732e6d17.Speaker: Hook

16add3e161104db0.ContentText: Honorary member, please! Please help me look for it! Just one more time!
16add3e161104db0.Speaker: Hook

aa8dfbd1d26edd60.ContentText: *sigh* Why are you so lazy? I'm so unlucky!
aa8dfbd1d26edd60.Speaker: Hook

6efa1d68b55c63df.ContentText: That's it!? Ugh, I guess I'll have to abandon my evil plan.
6efa1d68b55c63df.Speaker: Hook

7a916faf7060d33a.ContentText: I promise this is the last time! Let's go!
7a916faf7060d33a.Speaker: Hook

d36ca1a5f4449a03.ContentText: No! Don't leave! If we go back now, everything we've done so far will be for nothing! I promise this is the last time. Let's go!
d36ca1a5f4449a03.Speaker: Hook

691873c0800d4d6c.ContentText: Why are there so many monsters here!? We need to deal with them first!
691873c0800d4d6c.Speaker: Hook

d4968db79ec6983d.ContentText: Wait! Let me take a look at my notes. I marked the location where I stashed the treasure.
d4968db79ec6983d.Speaker: Hook

b6bbcf8df1754d26.ContentText: It's a reward from the old witch! You'll know what it is after I dig it up.
b6bbcf8df1754d26.Speaker: Hook

38793185ae15780f.ContentText: "Go down the stairs on the left, then walk ten paces forward. Turn right, walk another fifteen paces. Spin around ten times, then keep walking forward..."
38793185ae15780f.Speaker: Hook

aaa1ed9b5f2ecb4d.ContentText: ...Oh, no... I'm doomed! The second half of my notes are completely ruined!
aaa1ed9b5f2ecb4d.Speaker: Hook

3bbdd3a43d9256bc.ContentText: What kind of lame treasure map would it be if it only had one or two steps!?
3bbdd3a43d9256bc.Speaker: Hook

a6120189b1c9a453.ContentText: Without the second half of my notes, how will I ever find the treasure...
a6120189b1c9a453.Speaker: Hook

d1e66088ec619079.ContentText: (Let's use the Home-Use Object Finder to help Hook search.)
d1e66088ec619079.Speaker: playerboy

ecb973c52178ed00.ContentText: Wow! This little thing... it can talk?
ecb973c52178ed00.Speaker: Hook

95f8e1ac6c259067.ContentText: Aren't you sassy! But if you can help me find my treasure, I'll let it slide!
95f8e1ac6c259067.Speaker: Hook

e8293fb374134c5e.ContentText: What's this? Looks like something is written on it... "For Julian <unbreak>50</unbreak> years in the future"?
e8293fb374134c5e.Speaker: Hook

32d6fd58f9d52c25.ContentText: Whatever. Since we've already dug it up, let's open it!
32d6fd58f9d52c25.Speaker: Hook

88384360047a0c54.ContentText: I guess you're right... We should wait <unbreak>50</unbreak> years before opening it! Let's take it back to Julian along with the glass marbles.
88384360047a0c54.Speaker: Hook

b2f399a07b89b761.ContentText: Really? The old witch did say that some things will emit a poisonous gas after being buried for a long time...
b2f399a07b89b761.Speaker: Hook

05243fa78377ede0.ContentText: Okay forget it, let's not open it!
05243fa78377ede0.Speaker: Hook

ae63ad8ece249047.ContentText: Here it is — my teddy bear! The old witch gave it to me as a gift!
ae63ad8ece249047.Speaker: Hook

54289f869f91569c.ContentText: Whoa, Junjun... How did you get covered in dirt? And why do you have so many loose threads? If we don't get you cleaned up, no one will buy you.
54289f869f91569c.Speaker: Hook

16a04d6e8aab22b3.ContentText: Well, the old witch said that Junjun isn't just any old teddy bear! He'll be worth a lot of money once he's cleaned up!
16a04d6e8aab22b3.Speaker: Hook

91b31b76cb55afaa.ContentText: *sigh* There's no other way... I haven't learned to sew yet — I'll have to ask the old witch for help.
91b31b76cb55afaa.Speaker: Hook

1210695cdd4609f9.ContentText: Of course! The old witch said Junjun isn't just any old teddy bear!
1210695cdd4609f9.Speaker: Hook

90530f6520a5ec78.ContentText: *sigh* I haven't learned to sew yet — I'll have to ask the old witch for help.
90530f6520a5ec78.Speaker: Hook

1eedcaca0c8fb422.ContentText: If she finds out I went somewhere I shouldn't have gone... *whimper* Hook will get lectured all over again...
1eedcaca0c8fb422.Speaker: Hook

ccf33cc304cf366b.ContentText: But so what if the old witch yells at me, Hook still has to prepare the gift for daddy!
ccf33cc304cf366b.Speaker: Hook

2016aedbb70ff1f4.ContentText: We've found the treasure. Let's split! The monsters here give Hook goosebumps — too scary!
2016aedbb70ff1f4.Speaker: Hook

795ee8d23b509845.ContentText: I'm warning you — don't you dare tell the old witch about Hook's plan to sell the treasure!
795ee8d23b509845.Speaker: Hook

d3fea05756cde7fe.ContentText: {NICKNAME}, you go first and Hook will follow! As long as you attract enough attention, I'll be safe from the old witch!
d3fea05756cde7fe.Speaker: Hook

7db8bce3e88806bf.ContentText: Don't worry, your sacrifice isn't in vain! The Moles will remember your contribution!
7db8bce3e88806bf.Speaker: Hook

803d077867ff7be4.ContentText: Beep, beep, beep... Findie the Home-Use Object Finder at your service. Please say the target object you want to search for.

fda1555e77697e5b.ContentText: Wow, you can talk as well, little thing?

bb0a2efbfd3f2eb8.ContentText: N—Natasha! Junjun's in bad shape. Can you help me fix him...?
bb0a2efbfd3f2eb8.Speaker: Hook

74779398c993e74d.ContentText: I remember giving you Junjun. I haven't seen this fella in years. Where did you find him?
74779398c993e74d.Speaker: Natasha

402d88f3bcc27539.ContentText: The... the wind brought him back to me...
402d88f3bcc27539.Speaker: Hook

5cfd3efd7b1cc412.ContentText: ...{NICKNAME} helped me find him in the Rivet Town orphanage.
5cfd3efd7b1cc412.Speaker: Hook

27e6f0c6ce96cd47.ContentText: You had {NICKNAME} take you to the Fragmentum just for this teddy bear? Hook, how many times have I told you...?
27e6f0c6ce96cd47.Speaker: Natasha

41576d05674465f3.ContentText: Natasha, please! Please help me fix Junjun. I'll clean the clinic for you for a whole month!
41576d05674465f3.Speaker: Hook

b1fee5b0de78685e.ContentText: *sigh* You say that every time, and then...
b1fee5b0de78685e.Speaker: Natasha

5bff7dbbe3255c13.ContentText: G—Great, seeya soon! {NICKNAME}, I'll leave Junjun with you!
5bff7dbbe3255c13.Speaker: Hook

0fa0f3b90ff07d01.ContentText: ...What am I going to do with that girl.
0fa0f3b90ff07d01.Speaker: Natasha

b68f19c28bde0900.ContentText: You shouldn't indulge her, outsider. Uh-uh, I know it's difficult to tell Hook "no," but sometimes it just has to be done.
b68f19c28bde0900.Speaker: Natasha

fb837744b9b990cb.ContentText: Junjun... so she gave her bear a name, huh?
fb837744b9b990cb.Speaker: Natasha

32ee19bdea72696c.ContentText: Yeah, I've lost count of all the dolls I've made. Still, Hook clearly likes this one a lot.
32ee19bdea72696c.Speaker: Natasha

a23b854e35796402.ContentText: I've lost count of all the dolls I've made. To be honest, I wasn't expecting her to like this one so much.
a23b854e35796402.Speaker: Natasha

9e6c33b5092bb43d.ContentText: It was an award I used to give the kids in Rivet Town for "good behavior." Can you imagine what an orphanage is like with so many difficult children? I had to come up with a solution to get them to behave.
9e6c33b5092bb43d.Speaker: Natasha

446715acdac5ef3a.ContentText: Hook pretended to be well-behaved for a month in order to get Junjun. She ate on time, slept on time — even stopped fighting with the other kids...
446715acdac5ef3a.Speaker: Natasha

9d4247a35ea9b603.ContentText: Of course, as soon as she got her award, she went straight back to her old self.
9d4247a35ea9b603.Speaker: Natasha

e08379decb7569b0.ContentText: I'm afraid you have no idea how much she suffered that month.
e08379decb7569b0.Speaker: Natasha

65a6d3d68af8b031.ContentText: Hook has an uncanny ability to rally people to her cause — both adults and children. It's a skill alright, and forcing her to be well-behaved puts a lid on it.
65a6d3d68af8b031.Speaker: Natasha

df5985cd20f35e0e.ContentText: ...Well, this teddy bear has sure been through the wars. Don't worry, I'll help Hook repair Junjun, but I'll need to find some stuffing...
df5985cd20f35e0e.Speaker: Natasha

015bc3716e279495.ContentText: They must be... erebus? Strange, I didn't notice when I sewed them on...
015bc3716e279495.Speaker: Natasha

92452fc7afb1c821.ContentText: I'm no appraiser, but these two gems look to be high quality.
92452fc7afb1c821.Speaker: Natasha

911c43b605317d07.ContentText: I think I must have been — it's not every day you sew precious gems into a teddy bear. Honestly...
911c43b605317d07.Speaker: Natasha

0ba8df6828b13b8a.ContentText: ...Did the old witch yell at you?
0ba8df6828b13b8a.Speaker: Hook

91befd719286f98d.ContentText: *sigh* But you were only there to help Hook... I'm sorry, honorary member!
91befd719286f98d.Speaker: Hook

2640e37a73cdaefc.ContentText: What? Why did she only yell at Hook!?
2640e37a73cdaefc.Speaker: Hook

807bf182a260e7a7.ContentText: Never mind that. You didn't tell her what I was really up to, did you?
807bf182a260e7a7.Speaker: Hook

d2ad4f89aa50569e.ContentText: Great! Your loyalty as an honorary member of The Moles is acknowledged.
d2ad4f89aa50569e.Speaker: Hook

2ce85d91d8e39041.ContentText: ...I'm aware of that! I just... didn't want to upset her!
2ce85d91d8e39041.Speaker: Hook

d3d6839b54d11c40.ContentText: Anyway, why are you still standing here, silly? Do you have something to report to the boss of The Moles?
d3d6839b54d11c40.Speaker: Hook

1c30e11d858fcc0b.ContentText: G—Gems!? Does that mean he's worth a lot of money?
1c30e11d858fcc0b.Speaker: Hook

c2e8ef27014fa042.ContentText: Of course I'll sell him! If the gems are expensive, Hook can buy a better birthday gift for daddy!
c2e8ef27014fa042.Speaker: Hook

50358396b3657bac.ContentText: What are you talking about? Of course, I do! If the gems are expensive, Hook can buy a better birthday gift for daddy!
50358396b3657bac.Speaker: Hook

bf199d8dd501f07d.ContentText: I don't want to keep Junjun's eyes. If some kid gets a Junjun with no eyes, they'll be sad, right?
bf199d8dd501f07d.Speaker: Hook

65147f85a69c2b7a.ContentText: Anyhow, this is super useful intel! If you'd been with The Moles a bit longer, I'd be promoting you to third-in-command right now!
65147f85a69c2b7a.Speaker: Hook

ba89b17c279cc943.ContentText: I'll need your help again after Natasha fixes Junjun! Always be prepared to answer the call of Pitch-Dark Hook the Great!
ba89b17c279cc943.Speaker: Hook

a25e4fa4f555dced.ContentText: Let's talk later. Go and find Hook, she can't have gone too far...
a25e4fa4f555dced.Speaker: Natasha

36e035add69c915c.ContentText: *sigh* That girl... I'd barely gotten two sentences out.
36e035add69c915c.Speaker: Natasha

e7dcd5ceba84daa0.ContentText: There's no shortage of surprises in life.
e7dcd5ceba84daa0.Speaker: Natasha

380a21bf811e8f7e.ContentText: Well, our war torn bear here just became a priceless doll. Not bad, Junjun.
380a21bf811e8f7e.Speaker: Natasha

ad63f4e19287d57a.ContentText: (It looks like the patients have surrounded Natasha? Let's hear what they're saying...)
ad63f4e19287d57a.Speaker: playerboy

c5ccbc1eb5ca418f.ContentText: ...What are you saying, doctor? The wonder medicine is out of supply?

a99d5d050de45485.ContentText: Correct. That medicine is a wolf in sheep's clothing — Wildfire has cut off the supply chain.
a99d5d050de45485.Speaker: Natasha

5055230e89a3ae34.ContentText: Your ailments need rational, scientific treatment. Relying on pseudo-medicines will only worsen your condition...
5055230e89a3ae34.Speaker: Natasha

3f806e154bc6a284.ContentText: Hmph, rational and scientific, huh...? The way I see it, you're just jealous you lost your patients.

69234777d09869f4.ContentText: H—How dare you speak to Dr. Natasha like that! Where are your manners...

c4d9a80d0b774215.ContentText: ...Ma'am, please think for a moment. How can you still be siding with her? That wonder medicine was working fine for us, and now it's gone because she wants it to be? How can she—

aa903116b836e7ff.ContentText: I understand your anger, but as your doctor, I ask you to trust my judgment.
aa903116b836e7ff.Speaker: Natasha

fcc0cf1dc0251016.ContentText: I will find a way to access more medical resources and help you through your struggles. If I must, I'll get help from the surface...
fcc0cf1dc0251016.Speaker: Natasha

9313ca0615439b32.ContentText: The surface... Hmph, I almost forgot that you were an Overworld big shot.

15ffd55f1e57ae6b.ContentText: Have some respect for Dr. Natasha...

15073bfdd211717b.ContentText: Tsk, if it's respect she wants, she better find a replacement for the wonder medicine, fast! If not, I'll tell everyone about how she set up Dr. Vache.

ef0c0dc01dec6294.ContentText: Oh... {NICKNAME}, you're here. I apologize, that must have made for uncomfortable viewing.
ef0c0dc01dec6294.Speaker: Natasha

7194e13839d66f33.ContentText: Mm... I'm okay. If I were in his shoes, I may well have had the same reaction. Now I need to focus on treating the patients, and dispelling their doubts.
7194e13839d66f33.Speaker: Natasha

eca7af407a80fc2a.ContentText: Don't let your emotions get the better of you. If I were in his shoes, I might well have had the same reaction. Now I need to focus on treating the patients, and dispelling their doubts.
eca7af407a80fc2a.Speaker: Natasha

5119f37db968c62e.ContentText: ...Let's leave it for now. I'll feel a lot better once I've gotten rid of this mess that Vache left us.
5119f37db968c62e.Speaker: Natasha

d2d755757608f137.ContentText: ...Now's as good a time as any to tell you Vache's whole story.
d2d755757608f137.Speaker: Natasha

fd86678cefeb7c50.ContentText: If there's anything you want to know, don't hesitate to ask.
fd86678cefeb7c50.Speaker: Natasha

7f43c184ac8b99d1.ContentText: No... but I used to think we were so close that we may as well have been...
7f43c184ac8b99d1.Speaker: Natasha

616a035aff3c01da.ContentText: I actually grew up in the orphanage. It wasn't until I was adopted by an Overworld family that life changed for me.
616a035aff3c01da.Speaker: Natasha

0f02b553f71f1e23.ContentText: My adoptive mother always saw me as her own flesh and blood, and Vache loved me like a sister... that is, while we were still young.
0f02b553f71f1e23.Speaker: Natasha

4c8a076c0c039f0c.ContentText: My adoptive parents belonged to a prominent medical family — as kids, we were exposed to all kinds of medical texts. When we were older, both of us got straight into Belobog's medical school. We were on a path into the medical profession.
4c8a076c0c039f0c.Speaker: Natasha

bb6e21632da013dd.ContentText: He was gentle and introverted. But when it came to work he could be absurdly obsessive... like a completely different person.
bb6e21632da013dd.Speaker: Natasha

9a2e63397d6d52c6.ContentText: Whenever I made a mistake in an experiment, he'd bite my head off... and then a while later, he'd apologize and comfort me. He was conflicted in that way.
9a2e63397d6d52c6.Speaker: Natasha

1f51c5313cf0a6af.ContentText: I didn't know he had leftover reagents in Rivet Town. I was shocked when you told me.
1f51c5313cf0a6af.Speaker: Natasha

8e138146eb251ded.ContentText: If you fail to make a clean break with the past, the past creeps up on you...
8e138146eb251ded.Speaker: Natasha

2295674fcc6bd25c.ContentText: *sigh* That's a long story... Ever since he was little, Vache had always wanted to develop a medicine called "Blizzard Immunity."
2295674fcc6bd25c.Speaker: Natasha

e1a81537b4a42873.ContentText: He saw the human body's vulnerability to cold as a disease, and wanted to cure it so that humanity could survive the Eternal Freeze. If he succeeded, people would be able to leave Belobog and rebuild their homes in the Snow Plains.
e1a81537b4a42873.Speaker: Natasha

6020e33ff831de6a.ContentText: To be honest, I never understood how he'd achieve that "Blizzard Immunity." But I do admire that vision and perseverance... I always chose to believe him, ever since I was a kid.
6020e33ff831de6a.Speaker: Natasha

7dfa6169a5810921.ContentText: I do admire his vision and perseverance, even though "Blizzard Immunity" always seemed unachievable to me.
7dfa6169a5810921.Speaker: Natasha

d3920770b0541ba0.ContentText: I knew his research in the Overworld wasn't going well. I used to write to him and ask him to come down and stay with the kids in the orphanage for a while. I thought it might help take his mind off his research.
d3920770b0541ba0.Speaker: Natasha

7cd17557fb00be07.ContentText: But I was too young to know what long-term frustration could do to a person. It changed him in a terrible way...
7cd17557fb00be07.Speaker: Natasha

23bf536176edd07e.ContentText: During his stay in the Underworld, he met patients affected by Fragmentum corrosion with mild symptoms. Compared with non-patients, their bodies reacted differently to hot and cold. And that fascinated Vache.
23bf536176edd07e.Speaker: Natasha

19af910488b05ac5.ContentText: He began to simulate mild Fragmentum corrosion, thinking that it could lead to breakthroughs in developing Blizzard Immunity.
19af910488b05ac5.Speaker: Natasha

c067570e046fb474.ContentText: Those reagents of his aren't cure-alls for critical illness — that doesn't exist. Vache made the reagents to mitigate the suffering of his patients in the short term — a convenient way for him to observe changes in his test subjects.
c067570e046fb474.Speaker: Natasha

ee93c6b5ccf85f01.ContentText: But behind my back, he had been doling out the reagents to residents who were kept in the dark. When it finally struck me that something was wrong, his terrible research had already turned him into... into a madman.
ee93c6b5ccf85f01.Speaker: Natasha

9581ecbf48e5eb00.ContentText: Indeed... and it all happened under my nose. How ridiculous — my judgment was clouded by trust in a loved one...
9581ecbf48e5eb00.Speaker: Natasha

3ec15aa693928e67.ContentText: I trusted Vache with all my heart. Funny, isn't it? And pathetic.
3ec15aa693928e67.Speaker: Natasha

90f1b8ad9b804a5e.ContentText: When his experiments were exposed, I spent a long time with Oleg discussing how to handle the aftermath.
90f1b8ad9b804a5e.Speaker: Natasha

536a6695869bc94d.ContentText: This was shortly before the Underworld was sealed off — there were hardly any Silvermane Guards remaining. We spent ages trying to find a way to handle Vache.
536a6695869bc94d.Speaker: Natasha

e4864c9e64ff54bc.ContentText: In the end, Oleg suggested that we banish him and permanently deny him access to the Underworld.
e4864c9e64ff54bc.Speaker: Natasha

4eda7a83d936a253.ContentText: Had his victims found out the truth, Vache would've been torn to pieces by furious Underworlders. I was young and weak at the time — Oleg must have worried about how I'd react to such a scenario, or he wouldn't have suggested banishment.
4eda7a83d936a253.Speaker: Natasha

cd53488c1cc4584a.ContentText: *sigh* Looking back, it wasn't. He deserved much worse...
cd53488c1cc4584a.Speaker: Natasha

a26e1674a2b40719.ContentText: ...I hope so. The day I learned the truth was the day I no longer recognized my brother.
a26e1674a2b40719.Speaker: Natasha

20b0bc7ce613e998.ContentText: Oleg and I took Vache to the Overworld. He made his final request to us: to take him outside the city to the Snow Plains he'd always wanted to conquer.
20b0bc7ce613e998.Speaker: Natasha

af4a77e1d1fbff42.ContentText: His figure gradually disappeared into the snow curtain... I've been telling myself that Vache is dead ever since.
af4a77e1d1fbff42.Speaker: Natasha

93ad160ef99dcdcb.ContentText: Forgive me, {NICKNAME}, I'm not good at telling stories. Vache was a terrible brother and a worse doctor... That's all you need to know.
93ad160ef99dcdcb.Speaker: Natasha

5bb6dbf1087e9994.ContentText: Let's call it a day. Thank you for cleaning up the mess my brother left behind. Here — for your trouble.
5bb6dbf1087e9994.Speaker: Natasha

5849285234689859.ContentText: These are... records of his experiments.
5849285234689859.Speaker: Natasha

d696a1e77470b9b4.ContentText: It's Vache's handwriting. This must be the location of his final lab. {NICKNAME}, come have a look.
d696a1e77470b9b4.Speaker: Natasha

93b65c1f0b57790b.ContentText: His last experiment was nearly two years ago. What happened after that? His notes seem to suggest he was working to improve Blizzard Immunity.
93b65c1f0b57790b.Speaker: Natasha

3a6e6a2887174d42.ContentText: Brother... where are you? What happened...?
3a6e6a2887174d42.Speaker: Natasha

e6dace37bd99e794.ContentText: Sorry, I needed to take a moment.
e6dace37bd99e794.Speaker: Natasha

f8016c84282894a7.ContentText: After seeing the letters Mr. Oswell kept for me, I was hoping things might've ended differently. I shouldn't have asked you to come with me to such a dangerous place.
f8016c84282894a7.Speaker: Natasha

e4688a0b0c0f1a52.ContentText: ...He was my family, and someone I used to look up to.
e4688a0b0c0f1a52.Speaker: Natasha

665bfc02c8dcef9b.ContentText: I can't forgive him for what he's done. But nor can I say I don't miss him...
665bfc02c8dcef9b.Speaker: Natasha

e591ae1cb68fc424.ContentText: I... maybe I should feel glad. The medicine might not have been what he wanted it to be, but it came to something... Maybe he found some inner peace...
e591ae1cb68fc424.Speaker: Natasha

6785e814735eedb5.ContentText: ...You're right. There can be no forgiveness for the crimes he committed. He didn't deserve the title of "doctor."
6785e814735eedb5.Speaker: Natasha

91fe1a2bed126cc6.ContentText: ...They'll remember him as a murderer... as someone whose evil experiments brought great harm to the innocent. Vache doesn't deserve to be remembered as a "doctor." I know that very well.
91fe1a2bed126cc6.Speaker: Natasha

17217c23ac95c0af.ContentText: But maybe this Blizzard Immunity can now bring benefit to others... even if it was made by a monster.
17217c23ac95c0af.Speaker: Natasha

ac972e3e3830ade8.ContentText: Human beings really are conflicted life forms...
ac972e3e3830ade8.Speaker: Natasha

02424834b95eb229.ContentText: I'll take his records and data with me and continue what he started. One day, the world will see a perfect Blizzard Immunity.
02424834b95eb229.Speaker: Natasha

368d0ec30dc66ca2.ContentText: Before we leave, {NICKNAME}, I'd like to ask for another favor — the last one, I promise...
368d0ec30dc66ca2.Speaker: Natasha

e60cc3d2dc5a9b1f.ContentText: (If we don't keep up with this guy, we might get lost in the blizzard...)
e60cc3d2dc5a9b1f.Speaker: playerboy

bef7a1e20a98635b.ContentText: So impressive... I want to become as strong a Silvermane Guard as him!

005bb1d4a0c3e27d.ContentText: Who are those guys behind the captain? Look at their attire, so strange...

b4366e6186972094.ContentText: (The guards will notice if we stray too far off... We should stick close to Gepard.)
b4366e6186972094.Speaker: playerboy

f57488d5f05a6328.ContentText: Hey! Commander Bronya is waiting for you all down below. Hurry up and go see her. And no tricks!

aa7e0b0eef463d3f.ContentText: Are we... in a lot of trouble?
aa7e0b0eef463d3f.Speaker: March 7th

5fffd6bb64c129ef.ContentText: Suspects! Stop running around and go see Commander Bronya!

91c5fefe276bd91d.ContentText: Agh, gotta stick close to Hook...
91c5fefe276bd91d.Speaker: playerboy

6cf2d71ec380abb9.ContentText: That guy can't have gotten too far! Let's search nearby.
6cf2d71ec380abb9.Speaker: March 7th

f9b88aee0b8d6ceb.ContentText: It's completely blocked by the mine cart... What do we do? Can we blow it up?
f9b88aee0b8d6ceb.Speaker: March 7th

e24c330a64b68150.ContentText: Easy! It belongs to the mining team. We can't just destroy it. We should try and fix it.
e24c330a64b68150.Speaker: Seele

4cdbfd06bdce2874.ContentText: Easier said than done... Do you know how?
4cdbfd06bdce2874.Speaker: March 7th

b79d20f2ead3f637.ContentText: Yeah, of course, every Underworlder worth their salt knows how to fix a mine cart. Let me see...
b79d20f2ead3f637.Speaker: Seele

35dfbefb2e33cb2e.ContentText: ...Hmm. Even the pin connecting the body to the chassis is broken, not to mention the rear wheelset bearing. This looks like the work of Svarog's minions.
35dfbefb2e33cb2e.Speaker: Seele

a033ece0a26b18dd.ContentText: We need to find spare parts we can use nearby. Argh, we're wasting time...
a033ece0a26b18dd.Speaker: Seele

68142ba333764262.ContentText: Beep, beep, beep... Friends, do you need to find something? Findie can help.

a62436fd420ecec5.ContentText: ...How come you just jumped out on your own, little fella? Isn't your module thingy broken?
a62436fd420ecec5.Speaker: March 7th

c28649ab6238d885.ContentText: Beep, beep, beep... My brainwave scanner module is indeed broken. However, manual input for search is still operable.

693e0fb4ddf83234.ContentText: Come on. Input the name of the object you are looking for. Findie can help.

b033f95a304c447e.ContentText: Oh, well aren't you confident? Let me give it a try then.
b033f95a304c447e.Speaker: March 7th

09461b50b45f3207.ContentText: Where's the input interface? Ah, found it...
09461b50b45f3207.Speaker: March 7th

79859b0c1d554995.ContentText: Mine Cart Pin... Mine Cart Wheelset... Confirm... Just like that?
79859b0c1d554995.Speaker: March 7th

c3791dbd0c8b6bff.ContentText: Beep, beep, beep... Request is being processed...

15a9bbc414799416.ContentText: Beep, beep, beep... Match successful... Initiating search for lost item: Mine Cart Pin...

85ede9cce0c5da79.ContentText: Beep, beep, beep! Item found. Please commence search according to the Home-Use Object Finder Safety Manual.

314fd2e980cea40c.ContentText: Let me see... Yeah, we can make do with this part. This little machine isn't half bad.
314fd2e980cea40c.Speaker: Seele

04308fd52425bcf8.ContentText: Beep, beep, beep... What's that? Is that a hint of respect for Findie?

f42c61145da4aa04.ContentText: How convenient! So next time Dan Heng gets lost, we can just use Findie to find him, right?
f42c61145da4aa04.Speaker: March 7th

8a7dcdde8e2af333.ContentText: Beep, beep, beep... Biological life form search is currently not supported. If you have any questions, please call Interastral Peace Appliances.

2781460e7a2d8941.ContentText: ...Well, it was a good idea. Let's look for the next part.
2781460e7a2d8941.Speaker: Dan Heng

05909be6ced5802a.ContentText: Beep, beep, beep... Initiating search for lost item: Mine Cart Wheelset...

9698afd1207328e4.ContentText: Beep, beep, beep! Item found. Please commence search according to the Home-Use Object Finder Safety Manual.

47bfbd052721a2b2.ContentText: You were a big help, Findie!
47bfbd052721a2b2.Speaker: March 7th

188be9c8dd409f75.ContentText: Beep, beep, beep... It was nothing. Interastral Peace Appliances, your most trustworthy companion.

92088bbf730da212.ContentText: Beep, beep, beep... Current search complete. *yawn* Entering sleep mode. Please recharge the Home-Use Object Finder.

68ff7b2ed7546389.ContentText: ...We're pretty lucky, huh? Without Findie, it probably would've taken half the day to find these parts.
68ff7b2ed7546389.Speaker: March 7th

f3c880d16bea2323.ContentText: Well, not that long... But that little machine definitely made it a lot easier. Alright, let's go back and fix the mine cart.
f3c880d16bea2323.Speaker: Seele

ef385cbfbe849d29.ContentText: ...How much longer can you last with your current supplies?
ef385cbfbe849d29.Speaker: Seele

0ad7fbdd6df18fcf.ContentText: This is a military base. Temporary workers aren't allowed in.

93c4e9d6988ecee2.ContentText: *vicious laughter* Humanity... so weak and foolish. Always overestimating their abilities.

ee3707dec7516505.ContentText: Let me bestow upon you... despair!

fc14be2cedcc9492.ContentText: Hmph, fleeing at the first sign of danger... that's all they're good for.
fc14be2cedcc9492.Speaker: Seele

7a78af1dc7a8490f.ContentText: Huh? What's this... Did those guys leave it behind...?
7a78af1dc7a8490f.Speaker: March 7th

13fcfdb72fdd2b5b.ContentText: Beep, beep, beep... Searching for potential user...

5a372ff29f2f35a8.ContentText: Beep, beep, beep... Voiceprint detected. Looking up corresponding identity information... Oh my, it's an alien.

ab17f15899a01e6c.ContentText: Hey, it talks! And it knows that we aren't from this planet?
ab17f15899a01e6c.Speaker: March 7th

cd4638064b9a4f9e.ContentText: It doesn't seem to be technology from here. Look — it even has an Interastral Peace Corporation logo on it.
cd4638064b9a4f9e.Speaker: Dan Heng

7b14d9ff43aae0a7.ContentText: Perhaps it's an antiquity left behind by some past interstellar traveler.
7b14d9ff43aae0a7.Speaker: Dan Heng

b34949e9234216e9.ContentText: Beep, beep, beep... Your mom's an antiquity!

43051be056f5d086.ContentText: Beep, beep, beep... Whatever, whatever. So you aliens know about the Interastral Peace Corporation? That's great.

c4c27dd81395fc6f.ContentText: Beep, beep, beep... Self introduction: I am Richard, the Home-Use Object Finder. Model information: Version <unbreak>0.63</unbreak>, Professional model, Annual Deluxe package. Nickname: "Findie."

2df731e29e0b8f70.ContentText: A Home-Use Object Finder? Who knew the IPC made these kinds of products...
2df731e29e0b8f70.Speaker: March 7th

f560c012e58c1dcc.ContentText: Beep, beep, beep... My brainwave scanner module is damaged. Please send me to an Interastral Peace Appliances retail store near you for free repair within the warranty period of <unbreak>232</unbreak> years <unbreak>84</unbreak> days.

6444da0a0728919d.ContentText: Beep, beep, beep... Alien, please take me to an Interastral Peace Appliances retail store to conduct repairs—

afb48bda5aabacf1.ContentText: What!? This fella's already broken... What should we do, take it with us?
afb48bda5aabacf1.Speaker: March 7th

094f2a069e4a4919.ContentText: Beep, beep, beep... Yes, yes, yes. When you need to find something you can't see, just call upon Findie. That's me.

2ccd3dd0f38983ce.ContentText: Ugh, you need to log out once in a while.
2ccd3dd0f38983ce.Speaker: March 7th

20d9cbf71517a7fc.ContentText: Let's take it with us. It doesn't take up much room. And if it really is broken, there are trash cans everywhere.
20d9cbf71517a7fc.Speaker: Dan Heng

8791d00ee1aa2b98.ContentText: Beep, beep, beep... Not a trash can! Yes, yes, yes. When you need to find something you can't see, just call upon Findie. That's me.

82ed81ea7eed0a82.ContentText: Ugh, Look, it's just containers as far as the eye can see.
82ed81ea7eed0a82.Speaker: March 7th

dd5e9ff2adadeea5.ContentText: This area isn't for receiving guests, it's for unloading cargo! Who decided to send us this way?
dd5e9ff2adadeea5.Speaker: March 7th

32bfe5f9b852ced4.ContentText: Such a huge port and not a soul in sight. It gives me the creeps...
32bfe5f9b852ced4.Speaker: March 7th

8cfaf401e6e6079f.ContentText: Ah! Stop talking! If there is someone here, they're in my bad books already.
8cfaf401e6e6079f.Speaker: March 7th

33e9120b62d38636.ContentText: Mr. Yang, what should we do?
33e9120b62d38636.Speaker: March 7th

26b2967585fad519.ContentText: We should start with the person who opened the Jade Gate. If it turns out they're not friendly, then at least they've already made things easier for us. If it turns out they were just doing their job, then we can ask them what happened here.
26b2967585fad519.Speaker: Welt

a42d40142f1fcb99.ContentText: That's Mr. Yang — this is child's play for him. He's dealt with all kinds of dangers before.
a42d40142f1fcb99.Speaker: March 7th

226fe61c727fae18.ContentText: Are you forgetting we've got Mr. Yang with us? Oh, right, you haven't seen what he can do yet...
226fe61c727fae18.Speaker: March 7th

b66e686cb9ae8fb6.ContentText: Let's move. Keep your wits about you.
b66e686cb9ae8fb6.Speaker: Welt

71b803e53ffdc31d.ContentText: Miss Tingyun, the mara-struck have been repelled, b—but there could be other dangers nearby.

03fdd5ffc8e34d6e.ContentText: The situation is serious. Allow us to escort you back to the Sky-Faring Commission, immediately.

2ca3db94ded98389.ContentText: Calm down, I heard you. It'd be rude of me to depart without thanking our benefactors.
2ca3db94ded98389.Speaker: Tingyun

0b641d6b2ea6c2b2.ContentText: My name is Tingyun. I'm the Amicassador for the Luofu Sky-Faring Commission merchant guild. May I venture to know the illustrious names of my heroes?
0b641d6b2ea6c2b2.Speaker: Tingyun

61437227a54e0fa6.ContentText: Illustrious names? ...Uhh, sure. I'm March 7th, this is Mr. Yang — oh — Mr. Welt Yang, and this is—
61437227a54e0fa6.Speaker: March 7th

bcaaa5ea3163714f.ContentText: Don't mind {F#her}{M#him}. {F#She}{M#He} likes to get a little creative with {F#her}{M#his} introductions.
bcaaa5ea3163714f.Speaker: March 7th

13a0165a33e60fec.ContentText: Next time, why not remind me before I give up my name?
13a0165a33e60fec.Speaker: March 7th

c8966f700cd910e1.ContentText: Don't mind {F#her}{M#him}. {F#She}{M#He} likes to get a little creative with {F#her}{M#his} introductions.
c8966f700cd910e1.Speaker: March 7th

d57afc205dc69d39.ContentText: Next time, why not remind me before I give up my name?
d57afc205dc69d39.Speaker: March 7th

3d29fb7224da6995.ContentText: I see, well, thank you for coming to our aid. Although, there is one thing I don't understand: Starskiff Haven is under lockdown. Since none of you are Xianzhou residents, may I ask how you came to be here?
3d29fb7224da6995.Speaker: Tingyun

1b27bdcdd7a6330e.ContentText: If you can't offer an explanation, I'm afraid these Cloud Knights will have to escort you out.
1b27bdcdd7a6330e.Speaker: Tingyun

d0acb6580af2a2e9.ContentText: We called for port transfer and got no response, but then someone opened the Jade Gate for us. When we arrived there was no one to be found, so we started to make our own way through.
d0acb6580af2a2e9.Speaker: Welt

9ce51fc594465e17.ContentText: How can that be? My ship was the last one into port before the Jade Gate was shut. The Sky-Faring Commission has already locked down Starskiff Haven entirely...
9ce51fc594465e17.Speaker: Tingyun

779a9c6186dfc1a8.ContentText: We're telling the truth. You could verify it yourself by checking the access history of the Jade Gate.
779a9c6186dfc1a8.Speaker: Welt

31606a26178db75b.ContentText: W—We found it strange ourselves when the gate opened but no one came to greet us.
31606a26178db75b.Speaker: Welt

3751af45706c65cb.ContentText: Indeed I have. *sigh* ...You've arrived at a bad time — the Xianzhou has suffered an incident. Whether you're here for leisure, treatment, or trade, I'm afraid you won't be able to go through with it.
3751af45706c65cb.Speaker: Tingyun

de09bd4eec2c3902.ContentText: For your safety, you should hurry to Central Starskiff Haven and take refuge. I'll take you to Madam Yukong of the Sky-Faring Commission and let her decide how to proceed.
de09bd4eec2c3902.Speaker: Tingyun

35ef5637c4f12b75.ContentText: We caught wind of the incident you mention. That's why we're here Miss Tingyun — to help the Xianzhou seal the Stellaron.
35ef5637c4f12b75.Speaker: Welt

ff497b789c5efa19.ContentText: Hehe, your actions have already revealed your kind hearts to me! Sadly... I can't make you any promises. You're outsiders, and only Madam Yukong has the authority to consider your offer.
ff497b789c5efa19.Speaker: Tingyun

7d8c2180dfbedc98.ContentText: Don't worry! Madam Yukong is kind-hearted too. Come on now, I'll lead the way.
7d8c2180dfbedc98.Speaker: Tingyun

ed855fd9f3218187.ContentText: On behalf of the Sky-Faring Commission, allow me to welcome you to Starskiff Haven.
ed855fd9f3218187.Speaker: Tingyun

4445f1f2a874df20.ContentText: On the Xianzhou Luofu, anything relating to aviation, navigation, and trade falls within the scope of the Sky-Faring Commission, which is one of the six commissions of the Luofu. As the biggest port on the ship, Starskiff Haven is governed by the Sky-Faring Commission, too.
4445f1f2a874df20.Speaker: Tingyun

e1959e12f00e65d2.ContentText: You definitely sound like a... what was it again...? Oh, Amicassador! By which I mean — nice speech.
e1959e12f00e65d2.Speaker: March 7th

eeae4beb9da1cca1.ContentText: That's too kind of you. My job involves ferrying business delegates to and from Starskiff Haven, so I do this kind of introduction all the time.
eeae4beb9da1cca1.Speaker: Tingyun

2ff25d7e52103a22.ContentText: Anyway, we're safe now. Normally I'd be a good host and take you around. But these are difficult times. Let's head to the Palace of Astrum first and report your arrival to Madam Yukong.
2ff25d7e52103a22.Speaker: Tingyun

ddf7cf774a4fbc6b.ContentText: Right there, the tallest building in the city. It's also the headquarters of the Sky-Faring Commission. Let's hurry. We haven't got much time.
ddf7cf774a4fbc6b.Speaker: Tingyun

4d3ebfb81616b309.ContentText: *sigh* I don't mean to rush you, but if Madam Yukong holds me accountable for not getting you over soon enough, I wouldn't want to be around for the consequences...
4d3ebfb81616b309.Speaker: Tingyun

f52e808c0c27e027.ContentText: Sounds scary. I thought you said she was kind-hearted?
f52e808c0c27e027.Speaker: March 7th

9b4174bd216d3f7e.ContentText: We need to make a few preparations before paying a visit to any of the six commissions. Rest assured, Miss Tingyun, we won't go anywhere. If you could inform Madam Yukong of our arrival first, we'll meet you at the palace entrance later.
9b4174bd216d3f7e.Speaker: Welt

4d7d00c5b246d8dc.ContentText: Report the losses to General Jing Yuan and find someone from the Divination Commission. They can't just stand there watching while we deal with this mess...

0c8faead9a7f2ef3.ContentText: Greetings, guests from the Astral Express.

8b087cb5de0ce4ea.ContentText: Tingyun has informed me of the purpose of your visit. Receiving guests isn't normally one of my responsibilities...

a8e1fadf8b5c0fa1.ContentText: ...but since you know about the Stellaron and have stated that you want to help the Luofu, I thought I should at least meet you in person...

a7b90ecde0dbc487.ContentText: The Xianzhou Alliance knows what a Stellaron is and is more than capable of handling it ourselves. We have been around for over <unbreak>8000</unbreak> years and weathered countless dangers and crises. While the situation is serious, we have more than enough resources to spare. Outsider help is not needed on this occasion.

4ea6ecd75cc8d6fe.ContentText: You are guests from afar — there is no reason for this matter to concern you... Am I making myself clear?

21147ec436359583.ContentText: From what we've gathered, the influence of the Stellaron can still be contained.
21147ec436359583.Speaker: Welt

6455b0ffa3014930.ContentText: If we can locate it in time and contain it, it's possible that we can restore any space — and any individuals — affected by the corrosion.
6455b0ffa3014930.Speaker: Welt

e9790af762848fb1.ContentText: We have experience in preventing Stellaron disasters, and we've only come here to lend you that experience.
e9790af762848fb1.Speaker: Welt

44972a7a6e8b6145.ContentText: I've said this and I'll say it again: This is an internal affair of the Xianzhou Alliance and there is no need for the Astral Express to get involved. I decided to arrange a meeting with you as a gesture of respect, but my decision is final.

2f3c40859163c1c3.ContentText: Never mind, Mr. Yang. If the Xianzhou Alliance say they can handle it, then we're wasting our breath. Let's go.
2f3c40859163c1c3.Speaker: March 7th

d501027d62d03688.ContentText: ...Huh? And what's that supposed to mean?
d501027d62d03688.Speaker: March 7th

7c018cf39f43ccae.ContentText: It's only been a few days since the presence of a Stellaron was detected on the Luofu. Starskiff Haven has been under full lockdown — no one has been permitted to leave. How did you come to know of the incident, and what led you to conclude that it was linked to a Stellaron?

fdbeeeeb5be3f7b7.ContentText: I acquired the access history of Starskiff Haven. Not long ago, someone hacked into the system and opened the Jade Gate, before guiding you, the Astral Express, into our territory.

286e0102d5c682d0.ContentText: The hacker was skillful and even taunted us with her seal. Her name is Silver Wolf, a member of the Stellaron Hunters...

aa2b5afa9266a051.ContentText: What say you in your defense?

8c519cd0e517085a.ContentText: You are forbidden from leaving the Sky-Faring Commission until the aforementioned questions have been investigated.

ba277f1590fc5944.ContentText: Don't be too harsh, Yukong. If this gets out, the whole galaxy will think the Alliance has forgotten how to treat our guests.
ba277f1590fc5944.Speaker: Jing Yuan

8faf4cfe1748da3b.ContentText: It's very unlikely that the Express has joined forces with the Stellaron Hunters. They are mortal enemies, after all.
8faf4cfe1748da3b.Speaker: Jing Yuan

0a55db065797dbf2.ContentText: Apologies for interrupting your meeting. My name is Jing Yuan — I'm the general of the Cloud Knights here on the Luofu.
0a55db065797dbf2.Speaker: Jing Yuan

7771a0e1f1dea58c.ContentText: General, this is an internal affair for the Luofu...

2b95993007ca9cc9.ContentText: I fully agree with you, Helm Master Yukong, this is indeed an internal affair.
2b95993007ca9cc9.Speaker: Jing Yuan

7dc5ff370fb86608.ContentText: I am sorry, guests of the Astral Express. It is true that there is a Stellaron on the Luofu, but I'm afraid I cannot accept your kind offer to help resolve the issue. This is a Xianzhou matter, and it is our responsibility to handle it.
7dc5ff370fb86608.Speaker: Jing Yuan

3d0ecd1ef81e824f.ContentText: ...Of course, it would be inappropriate of me to let you return without something to show for it. While I cannot accept your help with regard to the Stellaron, I do have a favor to ask. Please, after you.
3d0ecd1ef81e824f.Speaker: Jing Yuan

ef625bd223fe090e.ContentText: Master Diviner, you heard our discussion. What do you make of it?
ef625bd223fe090e.Speaker: Jing Yuan

07ed8496288a086a.ContentText: What do I make of it? "The way of heaven is apparent, but the heart of humanity is often deceptive." Are you asking me to divine their true intentions?

711fbdc9e09e3417.ContentText: That won't be necessary. The crew has nothing to do with the incident, of that I am almost certain. It isn't their intentions that trouble me. All I want is for them to lure out the one we're after.
711fbdc9e09e3417.Speaker: Jing Yuan

42f6efc2ed7d146c.ContentText: Indeed, your counsel has always been of great help to me. You may use your discretion on the matters ahead of us.
42f6efc2ed7d146c.Speaker: Jing Yuan

ca6208a5fcc3fc5c.ContentText: Hmph, why don't you retire early and I use my discretion full-time?

ae7509ba0c365f3d.ContentText: It is still too soon, unfortunately. If something goes wrong, you'll need a general to take the blame. How could I simply walk away and put you at such risk?
ae7509ba0c365f3d.Speaker: Jing Yuan

249e16ae2b58e807.ContentText: If you'd brought me that Blade earlier, none of this would've been necessary.

cb8bf4b7a745fa7e.ContentText: Wait, what are you up to exactly? Jing Yuan, did you... let him escape on purpose!?

546febb1ddd09a3a.ContentText: Me? I had no idea he might escape! Unlike you, my gaze never travels beyond the horizon. I take full responsibility — the Cloud Knights failed in their duty.
546febb1ddd09a3a.Speaker: Jing Yuan

25c702bfd5d93321.ContentText: Hmph, I can understand. There's a lot to take care of on the Xianzhou — you were bound to miss something. Thank goodness I'm here...

7b5ea8c6e0ac45a0.ContentText: On that note, perhaps it's about time you finally nominate me as your successor when the Six Charioteers next convene...

ad4b1da861b46103.ContentText: Yes, yes, yes... I have to go now — I'll leave this in your overwhelmingly capable hands, Fu Xuan.
ad4b1da861b46103.Speaker: Jing Yuan

530fdfa03320d6c8.ContentText: *sigh* There are three things in the world that I can't seem to rid myself of: the troubles of the Xianzhou, the papers on my desk, and the weeds in my garden.
530fdfa03320d6c8.Speaker: Jing Yuan

e3951b9c2048b0e4.ContentText: General, Diviner Fu wants the general's position for herself. Everyone knows that.
e3951b9c2048b0e4.Speaker: Yanqing

00de79992b315989.ContentText: She is very capable, but her intellect is burdened by a quick temper. I'll retire when she's achieved a better balance.
00de79992b315989.Speaker: Jing Yuan

60f969822fb2b35b.ContentText: This Stellaron thing is easy. Blade escaped, now we gotta go get him. Just say the word and I'll solve this in a flash.
60f969822fb2b35b.Speaker: Yanqing

5022d9432b326179.ContentText: I can understand your impatience, and I know you want to prove yourself. Now is not the time. If you truly wish to become Sword Champion, you shouldn't be running around brandishing your sword at people, especially not a major criminal.
5022d9432b326179.Speaker: Jing Yuan

df04f78a72e32a12.ContentText: Tsk, you think I'd lose to Blade?
df04f78a72e32a12.Speaker: Yanqing

ce657f4b6e9243f8.ContentText: I'm saying you need to have patience, Yanqing. Governing Xianzhou is different from a sword fight. The only way to build momentum is to work slowly. Besides, we still don't know who's really moving the chess pieces...
ce657f4b6e9243f8.Speaker: Jing Yuan

8dae0d3356f7f2ff.ContentText: There is something we must take care of before making our next move. As long as it remains unresolved, we're at a stalemate. That something is the Stellaron.
8dae0d3356f7f2ff.Speaker: Jing Yuan

dfdeab3a5ee61b16.ContentText: How did it manage to bypass the Sky-Faring Commission's inspections and the Divination Commission's predictions? Where is it now?
dfdeab3a5ee61b16.Speaker: Jing Yuan

0045b5b423179ee9.ContentText: I say we bring those two Stellaron Hunters before Diviner Fu — she'll get an answer out of them in no time.
0045b5b423179ee9.Speaker: Yanqing

8cbb3921aca55f85.ContentText: I've asked our friends from the Express to take care of that for us. Worry not, you'll have your moment when the current stalemate is broken.
8cbb3921aca55f85.Speaker: Jing Yuan

3372ff2b2864b934.ContentText: You are my most trusted aide, and there are some things that I would only assign to you. Speaking of which, Yanqing...
3372ff2b2864b934.Speaker: Jing Yuan

32491b197de2c962.ContentText: I suppose it is my fault. I should have given him an opportunity already. "A sharp sword can't stay sheathed forever," haha...
32491b197de2c962.Speaker: Jing Yuan

f1060986c9760ee1.ContentText: My fear is that this might prove too big a setback, bigger than his exuberance...
f1060986c9760ee1.Speaker: Jing Yuan

40a88e046e10e026.ContentText: *yawn* Well, here we are. I feel sleepy already.
40a88e046e10e026.Speaker: March 7th

5e834c2e1b622b3d.ContentText: What? But we've done a whole day's work — what's the sun playing at? It felt like we spent the whole day in the Palace of Astrum.
5e834c2e1b622b3d.Speaker: March 7th

f3053236fca8e06c.ContentText: Hey, that's not fair! My eyes are peeled this time — I'll make a run for it the second things go wrong.
f3053236fca8e06c.Speaker: March 7th

449be9f45a3d2856.ContentText: Jokes aside, did you see Madam Yukong frown at us? I thought her guards were about to jump out of nowhere and throw us in jail.
449be9f45a3d2856.Speaker: March 7th

f26b4bed524eff3f.ContentText: *sigh* I'd rather deal with monsters than these big shots...
f26b4bed524eff3f.Speaker: March 7th

2fbcbe0567062738.ContentText: Ah! I—I mean... not that Madam Yukong doesn't have her merits, hehe...
2fbcbe0567062738.Speaker: March 7th

3cec9602b9656e30.ContentText: Don't worry, my lips are sealed~
3cec9602b9656e30.Speaker: Tingyun

ae7705815ccf2cd4.ContentText: But as her subordinate, I have to say that it's Madam Yukong's duty to keep her guard up. The Luofu is facing a crisis, and as head of the Sky-Faring Commission, she is responsible for the security of the Xianzhou's customs and borders.
ae7705815ccf2cd4.Speaker: Tingyun

5915bf7a522a4ca5.ContentText: She's actually a very reasonable old girl in private.
5915bf7a522a4ca5.Speaker: Tingyun

fea4a17223696882.ContentText: They say that many years ago, Madam Yukong was an ace pilot in the Cloud Knights. She was a "work hard, play harder" type, known for her hot temper and incredible skill.
fea4a17223696882.Speaker: Tingyun

57ec9368a7a9954b.ContentText: Eventually, she became the head of the entire commission, which required her to learn patience and adopt a meticulous approach to her work.
57ec9368a7a9954b.Speaker: Tingyun

9e2705a416fc0c18.ContentText: In any case, Madam Yukong instructed me to reserve the best rooms at the inn and have all your expenses covered. She wants to extend the full courtesy of the Xianzhou so that all of you enjoy your stay to the fullest~
9e2705a416fc0c18.Speaker: Tingyun

1fe45f9bd39c2999.ContentText: She specifically mentioned that if you wish to buy anything at the inn, be it food or otherwise, just let the innkeeper know. The commission will cover the cost.
1fe45f9bd39c2999.Speaker: Tingyun

b4e017fd26896db9.ContentText: Why don't you go back yourself?
b4e017fd26896db9.Speaker: March 7th

93a059d37656aca2.ContentText: That's the friendliest thing I've heard since we arrived!
93a059d37656aca2.Speaker: March 7th

41a5cbcc6e962eeb.ContentText: Ahem! S—Seeing as our hosts are so thoughtful, I guess we should help ourselves. Right, Mr. Yang?
41a5cbcc6e962eeb.Speaker: March 7th

14ee7ad6dcbd5c87.ContentText: We should focus on our objective first. Seeing as Helm Master Yukong was extremely reluctant to get us involved, am I right to speculate that the Sky-Faring Commission has some leads on the whereabouts of Kafka?
14ee7ad6dcbd5c87.Speaker: Welt

afa03193074fe436.ContentText: Exactly right. The suspect is extremely cunning. She encrypted her transmission and timed her communication — we couldn't pinpoint her exact location.
afa03193074fe436.Speaker: Tingyun

08b213898b62659f.ContentText: But as cunning as she is, the Divination Commission has managed to find something.
08b213898b62659f.Speaker: Tingyun

de55fdcacd15b9a9.ContentText: Here are the coordinates. It's up to you how to proceed.
de55fdcacd15b9a9.Speaker: Kafka

6e11cfc200c97446.ContentText: Our destinations may differ, but the orbits of the stars will eventually converge. See you later.
6e11cfc200c97446.Speaker: Kafka

61fc95c595e7773c.ContentText: Don't let her words distract you.
61fc95c595e7773c.Speaker: Tingyun

a89dc154a85f8292.ContentText: That's the sound of a device.
a89dc154a85f8292.Speaker: Tingyun

94c93de520d6ea74.ContentText: Ahhhh, which means... what exactly!? This is a starship! There are all kinds of devices making weird noises.
94c93de520d6ea74.Speaker: March 7th

2f211f5e12927ff5.ContentText: Miss March, to the untrained ear, these noises may sound the same. But for the craftsmen of the Artisanship Commission, every machine has a different pitch and melody.
2f211f5e12927ff5.Speaker: Tingyun

ad2de56655c50964.ContentText: The general sent for craftsmen, and they concluded that the sound came from the shipyard facilities in Stargazer Navalia.
ad2de56655c50964.Speaker: Tingyun

db57b36d48e7dcef.ContentText: Now, get some rest and prepare yourselves for the operation ahead. I look forward to seeing you in action~
db57b36d48e7dcef.Speaker: Tingyun

0f302dba4cf824bc.ContentText: You've been standing here for half an hour. It's rare to see you like this.
0f302dba4cf824bc.Speaker: Himeko

79845b9fc12f7253.ContentText: Are you worried about those two? Welt is with them. They should be fine.
79845b9fc12f7253.Speaker: Himeko

26cc374054c49ee1.ContentText: Himeko, did you keep a copy of the Stellaron Hunters' transmission?
26cc374054c49ee1.Speaker: Dan Heng

f33531b9c04cc82f.ContentText: Not to mention, <unbreak>45</unbreak> system hours ago... a Stellaron burst occurred on the Luofu.
f33531b9c04cc82f.Speaker: Kafka

c1a563b2ca46cba4.ContentText: An unexpected calamity... don't you think?
c1a563b2ca46cba4.Speaker: Kafka

263086c5cce1bc6d.ContentText: What exactly are you Stellaron Hunters trying to do...? The Xianzhou Alliance aren't us — they won't give you time to explain. Once you draw the attention of {RUBY_B#Lan}The Hunt{RUBY_E#}, you become their prey. The Alliance will hunt you to the end of the universe...
263086c5cce1bc6d.Speaker: Welt

193da7d1b4f12f01.ContentText: Stop speaking in riddles, Kafka. Say what you have to say.
193da7d1b4f12f01.Speaker: Himeko

43999daa8715f535.ContentText: ...It's simple. That Stellaron has nothing to do with us, but the Xianzhou is convinced that we're responsible.
43999daa8715f535.Speaker: Kafka

c8013d2678cc3e1c.ContentText: The Xianzhou is in danger! ...This man, he—
c8013d2678cc3e1c.Speaker: Dan Heng

6e8f31e93ca0b01f.ContentText: If he's on the ship, then Welt, March, and {NICKNAME}... everyone is in grave danger!
6e8f31e93ca0b01f.Speaker: Dan Heng

696b3bc27b8b5e67.ContentText: Is he... connected to that past you want to escape?
696b3bc27b8b5e67.Speaker: Himeko

a6573d639f2d5e10.ContentText: I... I can't leave them down there. It's just... I'm afraid my burden has finally caught up with me, and that everyone is about to be drawn in...
a6573d639f2d5e10.Speaker: Dan Heng

bb9b99c983791a5e.ContentText: Is there anyone who doesn't carry around a past burden? She may not remember it, but even a girl as carefree as March has hers.
bb9b99c983791a5e.Speaker: Himeko

0649576f093afa25.ContentText: We tread on a Path that is hidden from us. The things we see and the trails we blaze all become our baggage. They weigh us down, but they also give us strength to continue the journey.
0649576f093afa25.Speaker: Himeko

5baa9d7613dfda54.ContentText: Try not to dwell on it, Dan Heng.
5baa9d7613dfda54.Speaker: Himeko

e8f639e5c5f4100e.ContentText: The Express spends seven standard days at each stop. Its passengers are allowed to do as they deem fit during that time.
e8f639e5c5f4100e.Speaker: Himeko

6ab39bdd82943b17.ContentText: Pom-Pom and I are more than capable of looking after the Express.
6ab39bdd82943b17.Speaker: Himeko

ea202df770761bb0.ContentText: If there's something you've got to do, do it now. Better than regretting it further down the line.
ea202df770761bb0.Speaker: Himeko

6f4387ef2ff96231.ContentText: And... you'll come back and travel with us once this is all over, right?
6f4387ef2ff96231.Speaker: Himeko

18ca23d4b4abb144.ContentText: Stay where you are — I can handle this.
18ca23d4b4abb144.Speaker: Sushang

ee51f1bd3af8323b.ContentText: Emergencies should be dealt with by professionals...
ee51f1bd3af8323b.Speaker: Sushang

9bb171de1bcdda4f.ContentText: Good. I'm Sushang of the Cloud Knights — I was just transferred here from the Yaoqing!
9bb171de1bcdda4f.Speaker: Sushang

19f40fe65f2daf66.ContentText: I did tell you to let me handle it. I don't have eyes in the back of my head — what if I accidentally hit you?
19f40fe65f2daf66.Speaker: Sushang

e6d89d1f0c443748.ContentText: Forgive me miss, but you were too busy being hit yourself. It's a good thing I joined the fray.
e6d89d1f0c443748.Speaker: Luocha

3b33ce100f60707d.ContentText: Ha, I was protecting you more like — it's a Cloud Knight's job to protect others. This area is under martial law, I'm escorting all civilians to safety. Follow me.
3b33ce100f60707d.Speaker: Sushang

cc4fb418edc3fbac.ContentText: That was some impressive Cloud Knight spearmanship. Which unit are you from?
cc4fb418edc3fbac.Speaker: Sushang

1de66bd64b584396.ContentText: Huh, okay... You're a civilian then. Come with me!
1de66bd64b584396.Speaker: Sushang

94a737180454ba09.ContentText: Miss Sushang, what exactly has transpired here? In all my trade visits, I've never seen Starskiff Haven in such a state.
94a737180454ba09.Speaker: Luocha

cbb5cdcf436a1b7f.ContentText: I, uh... I can't comment on that. I was just ordered to rescue the civilians... Actually, I have no idea either. Anyway, you two just need to come with me.
cbb5cdcf436a1b7f.Speaker: Sushang

0c6d3fe75b046c78.ContentText: Hey, you're pretty quiet. What's your name? I've got forms to fill out — can't put your name down as blank.
0c6d3fe75b046c78.Speaker: Sushang

42143a7de512fa9b.ContentText: My name is Dan Heng. I'm a traveler. I'm on my way to meet up with my friends. I appreciate the help, but I can leave the port on my own.
42143a7de512fa9b.Speaker: Dan Heng

8e2a99df17a489f9.ContentText: No can do, mister — it's way too late. You won't find anyone at Starskiff Haven. If your friends made it out, then they'll already be in the safe zone. No need to worry, you'll see them when we get there.
8e2a99df17a489f9.Speaker: Sushang

736778ee5421f932.ContentText: Aren't you going to take my name too, miss?
736778ee5421f932.Speaker: Luocha

7050dbb56a54f1e2.ContentText: You already said it when we were busy fighting. Luo... something... Luocha! Is that right? I remember it.
7050dbb56a54f1e2.Speaker: Sushang

1af04dae5fb14a2b.ContentText: Let's go! Stay close, you two. Cloud Knight Sushang will guarantee your safety!
1af04dae5fb14a2b.Speaker: Sushang

717abfc714d6e1b4.ContentText: Ah, one more thing — I need you to write your names down later. I don't know too many characters, I might make a mistake...
717abfc714d6e1b4.Speaker: Sushang

a1b53d51ad721fcf.ContentText: Hold on, I... I'll be there soon.
a1b53d51ad721fcf.Speaker: Dan Heng

7d48322ceafed3c9.ContentText: What did I tell you, {NICKNAME}? He's definitely sleeping in.
7d48322ceafed3c9.Speaker: March 7th

eb14a9ec05f545e2.ContentText: We Trailblazers can go days without sleep, but when we do hit the hay, we have to make up for it. Anyway, no point wasting our time in the corridor.
eb14a9ec05f545e2.Speaker: March 7th

95b41be4fb519e2b.ContentText: The conductor wants us to attend a warp navigation meeting. Same old location apparently, and we can't be late~
95b41be4fb519e2b.Speaker: March 7th

87310e1df6a4c078.ContentText: Let's head over. Oh, by the way...
87310e1df6a4c078.Speaker: March 7th

732b1bbe96c84e9d.ContentText: You drew the short straw, {NICKNAME}. It's your turn to wash the coffee cups this week.
732b1bbe96c84e9d.Speaker: March 7th

13aee9bb54e78571.ContentText: Passengers! The warp navigation meeting has officially begun!

90c79bb1edc55c4e.ContentText: Firstly, Pom-Pom wants to congratulate you, the Nameless, for successfully resolving the problems at this stop. The Express is now able to continue along the star rail!

d370d0b4862b8640.ContentText: The three of us actually pulled it off, huh {NICKNAME}!
d370d0b4862b8640.Speaker: March 7th

1284fda9aa658757.ContentText: It's time for your conductor — ahem, that's me — to reveal the name of our next stop...

926821cb77bb2ea0.ContentText: I've seen your face before, Stellaron Hunter, even if it was only on a Corporation wanted poster. They were offering quite the bounty... dead or alive. Do you know the figure?
926821cb77bb2ea0.Speaker: Himeko

d88e5b606e2a2c14.ContentText: Doesn't concern me. Then again, a Corporation bounty is a compliment, not an insult, don't you think? The higher the figure, the bigger the compliment.
d88e5b606e2a2c14.Speaker: Kafka

16754014b76e2e4f.ContentText: You wanted criminals sure know how to look on the bright side of things...
16754014b76e2e4f.Speaker: March 7th

3ba78fb2c267d107.ContentText: ...I will say, Herta certainly paid you all a compliment: "A {RUBY_B#Elio}maniac{RUBY_E#} that claims he can see destiny, leading a bunch of {RUBY_B#Stellaron Hunters}wild lunatics{RUBY_E#} in pursuit of the most dangerous objects in the universe!" ...And Herta doesn't give out compliments very often.
3ba78fb2c267d107.Speaker: Himeko

8569e947bbe7bd8b.ContentText: In pursuit of the most dangerous objects in the universe, huh? ...In that sense, you Astral Expressers and I are cut from the same cloth.
8569e947bbe7bd8b.Speaker: Kafka

e2956dbc3e54e37e.ContentText: You're in the wrong place, Kafka. We're not about to accept your request, and we're not about to get into bed with a Stellaron Hunter. It was nice talking with you. Perhaps next time you'll be willing to pay us a visit in person and we can continue our little discussion.
e2956dbc3e54e37e.Speaker: Himeko

2c21f75137a791c2.ContentText: Have you guys heard of the Luofu?
2c21f75137a791c2.Speaker: Kafka

a82837a1542ef89c.ContentText: ...The Xianzhou Luofu? It belongs to the Hexafleet of the Xianzhou Alliance. We've heard of it.
a82837a1542ef89c.Speaker: Welt

49fcb57ae4f8dcd9.ContentText: Mm. But what you haven't heard is that it's currently very close to you — a couple of warp jumps away, in fact.
49fcb57ae4f8dcd9.Speaker: Kafka

c83f5b832858bf58.ContentText: Not to mention, <unbreak>45</unbreak> system hours ago... a Stellaron burst occurred on the Luofu.
c83f5b832858bf58.Speaker: Kafka

32c969689cbd65df.ContentText: An unexpected calamity... don't you think?
32c969689cbd65df.Speaker: Kafka

a39b3567bda93d7f.ContentText: What exactly are you Stellaron Hunters trying to do...? The Xianzhou Alliance aren't us — they won't give you time to explain. Once you draw the attention of {RUBY_B#Lan}The Hunt{RUBY_E#}, you become their prey. The Alliance will hunt you to the end of the universe...
a39b3567bda93d7f.Speaker: Welt

4ce99ba1b28c30ed.ContentText: Stop speaking in riddles, Kafka. Say what you have to say.
4ce99ba1b28c30ed.Speaker: Himeko

dd1e87721b8fc076.ContentText: ...It's simple. That Stellaron has nothing to do with us, but the Xianzhou is convinced that we're responsible.
dd1e87721b8fc076.Speaker: Kafka

faf8059bc8deeb0d.ContentText: My companion Blade has been taken away by the Cloud Knights. I want to bring him back, resolve this Stellaron crisis, and clear our names.
faf8059bc8deeb0d.Speaker: Kafka

94b7de1cface0366.ContentText: Nothing to do with you? Yeah right — sounds like a weird coincidence to me. You just happened to show up after the Stellaron burst...?
94b7de1cface0366.Speaker: March 7th

04fc0c25c71a48c9.ContentText: Also, we're not your friends. Why should we care if a Stellaron Hunter is innocent, hmm~?
04fc0c25c71a48c9.Speaker: March 7th

572c722ccf081208.ContentText: No! Why are we listening to her? The Alliance is strong — is a single Stellaron burst really too much for them to handle? We're the crew of the Astral Express, not some squad of Stellaron-sealing super specialists!
572c722ccf081208.Speaker: March 7th

8f79eba4aa25a07c.ContentText: You could, of course, not get involved. Knowing that the Stellaron hasn't yet affected this region of space, you could make the jump and arrive at the next world. But sooner or later, the star rail here will be more blocked off than it was before.
8f79eba4aa25a07c.Speaker: Kafka

0712e78e5b2720e6.ContentText: I can tell you what the future holds: If you don't go to the Luofu, the Stellaron will eventually contaminate the entire ship, and over half of the inhabitants will perish.
0712e78e5b2720e6.Speaker: Kafka

88d0498617c74bcf.ContentText: Oh you brave and fearless Trailblazers, you benevolent Nameless, can you really remain indifferent to that?
88d0498617c74bcf.Speaker: Kafka

e16b81aa93d2e55c.ContentText: ...This companion of yours, Blade, he'd perish too, right?
e16b81aa93d2e55c.Speaker: Himeko

7757159727736649.ContentText: Here are the coordinates. It's up to you how to proceed.
7757159727736649.Speaker: Kafka

5617576d7740a572.ContentText: Our destinations may differ, but the orbits of the stars will eventually converge. See you later.
5617576d7740a572.Speaker: Kafka

b167b034fd9b9d43.ContentText: Whoa, what are you doing here?
b167b034fd9b9d43.Speaker: March 7th

5bf27e3e7c9aff7a.ContentText: I just gave him the low-down. Hey, remember what I said, okay? We're gonna vote against it! I'm not gonna take orders from that woman.
5bf27e3e7c9aff7a.Speaker: March 7th

5c8a31ad9baebc5e.ContentText: Are you okay, Dan Heng? March brought you up to speed, I assume?
5c8a31ad9baebc5e.Speaker: Himeko

f1734f2c03d50014.ContentText: I'm fine, and yes, I'm up to speed.
f1734f2c03d50014.Speaker: Dan Heng

ba2c3fb5cd26d101.ContentText: Good. In that case, with regard to the matter at hand, let's vote to decide our next move.
ba2c3fb5cd26d101.Speaker: Himeko

611a65bf49145d00.ContentText: Our Stellaron Hunter claims that a Stellaron burst has occurred on the Xianzhou Luofu, and that we're in the vicinity. If we head for the Luofu, we may have the chance to save many innocent lives.
611a65bf49145d00.Speaker: Himeko

a60ec34176efe4cb.ContentText: ...However, it's also possible that our Stellaron Hunter is lying and using us for her own ends. Neither Welt nor I believe that she's telling us the truth, but we can't just ignore the intel she's given us...
a60ec34176efe4cb.Speaker: Himeko

4cc6d14af2afb802.ContentText: So, we're about to hold a democratic vote on whether to set a course for the Xianzhou. All those in favor, hold out your hand. All those against, keep your arms by your side.
4cc6d14af2afb802.Speaker: Himeko

1b0cab8f8b2aa187.ContentText: Four against one. Well, it looks like the Astral Express crew has a majority vote to head for the Xianzhou!
1b0cab8f8b2aa187.Speaker: Himeko

71cd3da8407dff20.ContentText: Three against two. Well, it looks like the Astral Express crew has a majority vote to head for the Xianzhou!
71cd3da8407dff20.Speaker: Himeko

c457dc1c44d6b84b.ContentText: *sigh* I calmed down and thought about it a bit. If it turns out that woman isn't lying, then a lot of innocent people are gonna get hurt... Now's the time for thinking about other people... hehe *sigh*
c457dc1c44d6b84b.Speaker: March 7th

687667342fc97368.ContentText: Alright, alright, I think we're all used to March's modus operandi by now.
687667342fc97368.Speaker: Welt

fe5c1977885bc1ea.ContentText: So, Dan Heng, you want to stay here?
fe5c1977885bc1ea.Speaker: Himeko

a165f1d222e67fb3.ContentText: In that case... Welt. Ready for a trailblazing expedition? I know you've been itching to get out there for a while now. But make sure you take good care of {NICKNAME} and March.
a165f1d222e67fb3.Speaker: Himeko

dd37ae3b71ae3928.ContentText: Whoa! So that's a Xianzhou ship? It looks even bigger than Jarilo-VI!
dd37ae3b71ae3928.Speaker: March 7th

4506eb1ccd5265c2.ContentText: For Xianzhou natives, these ships are their planets.
4506eb1ccd5265c2.Speaker: Dan Heng

62e1a9467aa3b0d9.ContentText: Terrestrial environments are cradles that allow civilizations to survive and then develop. Some of those civilizations progress further — constructing space-faring vessels which allow them to voyage into the unknown... The Xianzhou Alliance is one such civilization.
62e1a9467aa3b0d9.Speaker: Dan Heng

e1244f4ebe039358.ContentText: I've only glimpsed it a few times, but... it's as magnificent as I remember...
e1244f4ebe039358.Speaker: Dan Heng

47c2fc20e614ffef.ContentText: You okay there? What's with all the lonely nostalgia vibes?
47c2fc20e614ffef.Speaker: March 7th

c0d09d875c95b5dc.ContentText: This is the Astral Express, I repeat, this is the Astral Express. We have arrived in Xianzhou territory. Requesting landing permission from ground control... f—from the bridge, I mean.
c0d09d875c95b5dc.Speaker: Himeko

c1525ac34b67ca7c.ContentText: Welcome to... Luofu skyport... Starskiff Haven...

2ba688a8bf9f1713.ContentText: Please await transfer... Please await transfer... Please await transfer...

c6059a292974d406.ContentText: *sigh* Now you know how I feel when you copy me.
c6059a292974d406.Speaker: March 7th

2c4eb77e7b4f016d.ContentText: The signal is still repeating, but no one is guiding us in to dock.
2c4eb77e7b4f016d.Speaker: Himeko

9b8c6811afbfa2f5.ContentText: Maybe the Stellaron Hunters were telling the truth. It seems like something really did happen to the Xianzhou...
9b8c6811afbfa2f5.Speaker: March 7th

19992e19f2f22c64.ContentText: A vessel arrives at a deserted spaceport... Isn't that how, like, loads of horror movies start!?
19992e19f2f22c64.Speaker: March 7th

f6037b3db13a9476.ContentText: Let's not let our imaginations get the better of us.
f6037b3db13a9476.Speaker: Dan Heng

a6ba56b1004b570a.ContentText: Please await transfer... Please await transfer... Please await transfer...

0e753954cdffd5d6.ContentText: Yes, it's still on repeat... Ah! There we go.
0e753954cdffd5d6.Speaker: Himeko

c7f9d4dab07dabc1.ContentText: ...The Jade Gate is now opening. On behalf of the Xianzhou Luofu: Welcome, guests from afar. Please proceed to dock in accordance with the guidance...

bc449b4dc611acbf.ContentText: The signal broke off, seems that's all there is.
bc449b4dc611acbf.Speaker: Himeko

0038f75473417e8c.ContentText: We should get going. Himeko, stay vigilant back here on the Express.
0038f75473417e8c.Speaker: Welt

285c9b8e8f24d8bd.ContentText: Relax, I've got Dan Heng here with me.
285c9b8e8f24d8bd.Speaker: Himeko

bcde8197706b8dec.ContentText: Yes, but I won't be putting my feet up. There's a lot to take care of here on the train.
bcde8197706b8dec.Speaker: Himeko

15090a08458ca592.ContentText: Come onnnn, you were the most excited last time we got off the train!
15090a08458ca592.Speaker: March 7th

2732af7ce4a2da83.ContentText: Make sure you're properly prepared before you set off.
2732af7ce4a2da83.Speaker: Himeko

a74a333f62984176.ContentText: Before we set off, I need to clarify the aim of this journey with you...
a74a333f62984176.Speaker: Welt

fcf51535e3c5e6df.ContentText: The Stellaron Hunters have given us a lot to consider, and a lot to doubt... But the most important part of this expedition is—
fcf51535e3c5e6df.Speaker: Welt

ffb49a8561b9b8dc.ContentText: Always thinking with your stomach. What about all the scenic photo opportunities?
ffb49a8561b9b8dc.Speaker: March 7th

6b32b47c8073046d.ContentText: That Belobog expedition got in your head, huh...
6b32b47c8073046d.Speaker: March 7th

142861482c015dd9.ContentText: The Stellaron Hunters clearly have ulterior motives. However, knowing what they're all about and given the focus of Kafka's words, I have no doubt that the Xianzhou is dealing with a Stellaron.
142861482c015dd9.Speaker: Welt

f64da31e7eb012c2.ContentText: The Alliance and the Express haven't had any previous dealings, so our arrival might not receive the warmest welcome. But as Trailblazers, we're not in this for fame or gain — we just need to do everything in our power to assist the Xianzhou and eliminate the source of disaster.
f64da31e7eb012c2.Speaker: Welt

4f95951502f03e8b.ContentText: Always keep that in mind, and don't forget the way of the trailblaze: Explore, understand, establish, and connect.
4f95951502f03e8b.Speaker: Welt

50bfc126ad72a9e5.ContentText: I guess it doesn't matter if I tell you now... Our original destination was a place called Penacony. The records on the Express indicate that it's a prison planet used by the IPC to exile criminals — at least that's how it was in the days of Akivili.
50bfc126ad72a9e5.Speaker: Welt

0612038127b0c91e.ContentText: When the Cancer of All Worlds broke out, the IPC lost control of Penacony, and the planet sought refuge under Xipe the Harmony. Now it's a member of the "Family."
0612038127b0c91e.Speaker: Welt

b3e0a57a1fc15a27.ContentText: Penacony is holding an event, and the Family sent an invitation to the Express. Himeko intends to accept the invitation, so we were planning to travel there as guests, not Trailblazers.
b3e0a57a1fc15a27.Speaker: Welt

418db900f0aa07eb.ContentText: ...But alas, for now we're changing our bearings and heading for the Xianzhou.
418db900f0aa07eb.Speaker: Welt

52d6622c9f74d048.ContentText: Long-range communication technology is still improving. Perhaps the presence of the Stellaron is affecting signal transmission.
52d6622c9f74d048.Speaker: Welt

2b8465b4abbf76ec.ContentText: Doesn't seem like it, everything else is working fine — see?
2b8465b4abbf76ec.Speaker: March 7th

121e301487d9388f.ContentText: In that case, it looks like someone wants to make things difficult for us. Since Kafka's here, I wouldn't be surprised if this turns out to be that Stellaron Hunter hacker girl's handiwork.
121e301487d9388f.Speaker: Welt

983f31e5889a8343.ContentText: No, no, only an extra couple of hours~
983f31e5889a8343.Speaker: Tingyun

42c9ffef0799e57a.ContentText: Hee-hee, I like your sense of humor, benefactors. Of course I'm happy to see you! When things settle down, I might even get promoted for catching a Stellaron Hunter.
42c9ffef0799e57a.Speaker: Tingyun

60a4be18b4eb3071.ContentText: Stargazer Navalia is governed by the Artisanship Commission — it took me a while to sort out our paperwork. I got a sense of the situation on my way back.
60a4be18b4eb3071.Speaker: Tingyun

dee76420f84b12f0.ContentText: Just like at Cloudford, Stargazer Navalia's meridian pin has malfunctioned. The checkpoint there is abandoned and the garrison is scrambling to locate the Stellaron.
dee76420f84b12f0.Speaker: Tingyun

5f7ad2070a693257.ContentText: With monsters wreaking havoc and the Knights scattered, Stargazer Navalia has become a perfect place for the suspect to hide out.
5f7ad2070a693257.Speaker: Tingyun

97027fabca78c1bd.ContentText: So... we've got a bunch of monsters to deal with, an IPC most-wanted Stellaron Hunter to catch, and we have to do all that on our own without reinforcements... Fair enough, this isn't our first rodeo.
97027fabca78c1bd.Speaker: March 7th

d7efd1c3e2406b8e.ContentText: Haha, that's the trailblazing life for ya.
d7efd1c3e2406b8e.Speaker: March 7th

59ad33bb9ee09697.ContentText: I was just making small talk, never mind the details!
59ad33bb9ee09697.Speaker: March 7th

ddbd700f4dc9074e.ContentText: I wouldn't say you're entirely on your own, hehe... When you're ready, let's get going~
ddbd700f4dc9074e.Speaker: Tingyun

7a6573bbdb4aeb44.ContentText: Now, what's a hunt without a hound? Kafka is still at large, and the Sky-Faring Commission wants this problem to go away. I made a few calls and managed to procure this from the Artisanship Commission — perfect for hunting down suspects.
7a6573bbdb4aeb44.Speaker: Tingyun

5e3d1fcd4c45bdb1.ContentText: Uh, Ahem, I mean... what can he do exactly? Are we gonna set him loose on Kafka?
5e3d1fcd4c45bdb1.Speaker: March 7th

366e0c01adf437be.ContentText: Yes, and no. This is Diting, a bionic dog developed by the Artisanship Commission. He has all the five senses of the Foxian race and takes them to another level.
366e0c01adf437be.Speaker: Tingyun

8c192df82f224a47.ContentText: Be it tracks or scent, as long as he uncovers a trace, he'll follow it all the way to the end.
8c192df82f224a47.Speaker: Tingyun

e2d9c010e475a7e0.ContentText: All we need to do is look for any trace left by Kafka. It doesn't matter how good she is at hiding, Diting will find her.
e2d9c010e475a7e0.Speaker: Tingyun

90a91a09dc877161.ContentText: But before we get started, let's play with his settings a bit and get him ready~
90a91a09dc877161.Speaker: Tingyun

c82c31613940fb32.ContentText: *sigh* We need to follow these sparkly traces to find Miss Tingyun, right?
c82c31613940fb32.Speaker: March 7th

4a1fa358f60ed17b.ContentText: She's not in a hurry, that's for sure. Playing hide-and-seek with us while Kafka's still at large.
4a1fa358f60ed17b.Speaker: March 7th

6f689be02c5369aa.ContentText: To begin with, let's set him to scent detection mode~
6f689be02c5369aa.Speaker: Tingyun

f455cdd7eba8dcb3.ContentText: Tell Diting to follow the scent of my perfume and see what he can do!
f455cdd7eba8dcb3.Speaker: Tingyun

bc118f6ea6f93299.ContentText: The traces... where did they go? Is Diting malfunctioning?
bc118f6ea6f93299.Speaker: March 7th

3a543576ea591518.ContentText: Got it. He says the wind is too strong here at the port, so it's not easy to follow the scent.
3a543576ea591518.Speaker: March 7th

a4df435c5ebf6e9f.ContentText: That's just the psychic bond between cute girls and cute puppies!
a4df435c5ebf6e9f.Speaker: March 7th

9060ce1ccb390da6.ContentText: Using the environment to hide her traces... Our girl from the Sky-Faring Commission sure knows how to put up a challenge. Let's look around and see if we can find any other clues.
9060ce1ccb390da6.Speaker: Welt

4bcd6165daaced36.ContentText: Or... we could ask around? Look how busy this place is, someone must have seen Miss Tingyun. That's not cheating, right? We're just collecting intel.
4bcd6165daaced36.Speaker: March 7th

f542ef4d258755a5.ContentText: Excuse me, any chance you saw a Foxian lady pass by?
f542ef4d258755a5.Speaker: March 7th

b10345a899eb8960.ContentText: Well that's a heck of a question, miss! I'd say nearly one in every two people passing through Starskiff Haven is Foxian. We might have seen the lady you're looking for, but we wouldn't have batted an eyelid.

157ee790a6c28351.ContentText: He's not lying. Still, if you describe her a little, maybe it'll jog our memory.

5a42b38fe4982bc7.ContentText: Write that down, write that down!

04979199636a193e.ContentText: "Pretty?" That's too generic for a Foxian. Even if you don't count the ladies, there are plenty of gents that fit that description like a glove...

e7551989b39fafae.ContentText: As tedious as it is, I'm afraid you'll have to describe her in more detail. Please don't say "two ears, one tail."

6eebbf7ed7a166ad.ContentText: ...I can put my hand on my heart and say I remember this fine lady.

69127b81703fdab7.ContentText: Nonsense. I've been stood next to you this whole time and I don't remember anyone like her.

0007a587b604f21c.ContentText: Well, I may not have seen her in person, but her beauty feels like a long-lost acquaintance... How wonderful to be reunited with her after so long!

63d78467bee83c88.ContentText: Oh dear. I'm sorry, my friend here appears to have lost touch with reality.

4aa43554302c35d4.ContentText: Are you two professional time-wasters or something?
4aa43554302c35d4.Speaker: March 7th

c27f536fa11ebe33.ContentText: Please accept our apologies! Me and my partner do double act comedy in the Sleepless Earl — the teahouse round the corner. As you can probably guess, with all these curfews and lockdowns, we've hardly had an audience the past few days. We figured we'd find a spot on the street and do some rehearsal — just to stop us getting rusty.

51a9476f27d6fd5d.ContentText: Then you guys swung by asking for this Foxian lady, so we thought we'd give you a bit of improv — free of charge I might add.

3d922177e1c94b2a.ContentText: Stay calm, stay calm! I did see the girl you're looking for. She took a turn from here into Starwatcher Avenue. I'd suggest you head over that way — she might still be there.

f419c33b7b069e4b.ContentText: I find it hard to trust anything you've just said...
f419c33b7b069e4b.Speaker: March 7th

31de1ff0008f109c.ContentText: You found me~ Diting's quite handy when it comes to tracking, isn't he?
31de1ff0008f109c.Speaker: Tingyun

a0c239e7222b852d.ContentText: If you pick up traces of Kafka in Stargazer Navalia, just switch him on. Don't let her escape.
a0c239e7222b852d.Speaker: Tingyun

c57603043181842b.ContentText: Miss Tingyun must have left us these clues, right?
c57603043181842b.Speaker: March 7th

112b1c02dd863915.ContentText: Diting should be able to pick up her traces now.
112b1c02dd863915.Speaker: Welt

cc60fff4e122bfad.ContentText: More customers? You're a sight for sore eyes these days. So, what do you have in mind? I'd recommend our prawn crackers.

9b0761edeb4aa42a.ContentText: A Foxian lady. She ordered a songlotus cake and went on her way.

1ff493e5aaa01733.ContentText: So you know each other! She ordered a tuskpir wrap and went on her way.

0e78861ea36ce260.ContentText: Berrypheasant skewers, tuskpir wraps, steamed puffergoat milk... Oh, a Foxian lady just ordered a songlotus cake — they're great too.

17725aa44ca62ea4.ContentText: Hey {NICKNAME}, we're not on a food tour, remember?
17725aa44ca62ea4.Speaker: March 7th
