bc47e0179b7eabe1.ContentText: She was just here, give me a second... Oh, she was heading towards Stargazer Navalia — that's my guess.

c74f893b74b246fa.ContentText: Apologies, you've come at a bad time. Our shop is closing earlier than usual today...

2154a743a3180bfd.ContentText: A Foxian girl? Well, our bracelets and pendants are extremely popular among Foxian customers...

4c44ee71dc456e68.ContentText: ...and I'm sure this pretty young lady won't want to miss out on our Verdant Luna selection. Please, try anything you like...

6a79ce8782a358ea.ContentText: Hey, {NICKNAME}, remember what we're here for?
6a79ce8782a358ea.Speaker: March 7th

08373fafd13d8a81.ContentText: We were just wondering if you could help us find somebody...
08373fafd13d8a81.Speaker: March 7th

e4005b53778193d7.ContentText: *sigh* I knew it, nobody has time for jewelry in these trying times... A Foxian girl you say? Let me think...

6242f95bbae168ce.ContentText: I did just see Miss Tingyun walk by. She's a big patron of ours...

e52a4765220391f1.ContentText: Well that's Miss Tingyun! She's a big patron of our shop.

636ced6d65637470.ContentText: May I ask why you're looking for her? Surely she...

d472caf0ceafcdbb.ContentText: I should've guessed from your attire — you look like you're from another world.

4f1958f90efecf72.ContentText: Miss Tingyun sometimes takes intergalactic business delegates on tours around Starskiff Haven... In fact, I just saw her walk by, she was heading down the street.

9aaae559abf249a3.ContentText: Ah, new patrons I see! Looking for some refreshment at the teahouse?

d8323771c0d6ca8c.ContentText: Sadly there have been fewer and fewer bookings since the lockdown, so we decided just now to close the Sleepless Earl until further notice. We'll reopen once the Cloud Knights finish addressing their "security concerns."

47165168e2733f5d.ContentText: Unfortunately yes, the boss is never far away.

dcc223836e3bf1ae.ContentText: No, no, my apologies, different Foxian. If it's Miss Tingyun you're looking for, she was here a moment ago...

495b153929221264.ContentText: Any chance you've seen this lady?
495b153929221264.Speaker: March 7th

5e7f857b2adc1cb7.ContentText: Ah, so it's Miss Tingyun you're looking for...

892e9792a4bea7d0.ContentText: She ordered a cup of Immortal's Delight and went on her way. I saw her checking out the food stalls over there, that might be a good place to start.

cb4e4f30e5ef88f5.ContentText: *sigh* Here we are sweating over our training while she's busy sampling dim sum!
cb4e4f30e5ef88f5.Speaker: March 7th

275933dc6451fffe.ContentText: Curious timing for a visit to Jeweler's Pagoda... Hm, your faces... no sadness or misery. I take it you're not here to pawn anything?

819441e492e538a1.ContentText: Well, we're a pawn shop — we see plenty of customers. But let me see if I can recall the lady you're looking for...

d72be7eb9db84b20.ContentText: Well, we're a pawn shop — we see plenty of customers. But let me see if I can recall the lady you're looking for...

e541f5b2a20857f3.ContentText: I remember, she walked past my shopfront and headed over to the food stalls. I'd recommend asking over there.

63bac3bae5960dea.ContentText: Do come back when the Cloud Knights finish their business.

4c18a4a6790acb1c.ContentText: Customers! Take your time, I've got plenty of good stuff here. Lots of nice gift ideas.

0e90528e64249733.ContentText: Yeah! Oh, wait, um... maybe not. Hmm, let me uh... search my memory for a moment...

89a32096a4cf242a.ContentText: Yeah! Oh, wait, um... maybe not. Hmm, let me uh... search my memory for a moment...

aae39ec055032be1.ContentText: Ahem, if only business were better, perhaps my memory would start to improve... don't you think?

f5c781485fa4ba06.ContentText: You just want us to buy your things! This is extortion!
f5c781485fa4ba06.Speaker: March 7th

a653b2aea79e04c7.ContentText: Hey, I didn't force you to buy anything, did I? I was simply commenting on my memory. And now I remember that I didn't see your Foxian lady... I mean, surely you don't want me to make up an answer and point you in the wrong direction?

50a890b8266ff23e.ContentText: Then you'll have to pardon my bad memory.

d1b1a45b9ab9b101.ContentText: {NICKNAME}, doesn't look like we're gonna get anything from him. Let's go search somewhere else.
d1b1a45b9ab9b101.Speaker: March 7th

7f81bbbd71f77d96.ContentText: Who'd have thought that Stargazer Navalia might become so quiet. "Long were the nights, when the clangor of hammers rose to meet the stars." ...People used to write poems about the shipwrights here.
7f81bbbd71f77d96.Speaker: Tingyun

2d511db66a09557f.ContentText: The Luofu relies on the starskiffs produced here to transport people and goods. Now that work in the shipyard has stopped, our internal transport and outbound flights might also grind to a halt.
2d511db66a09557f.Speaker: Tingyun

7d51818b87cbcdaf.ContentText: *yawn* Of course, the silver lining is I don't have to go on as many trips anymore.
7d51818b87cbcdaf.Speaker: Tingyun

1ad6910b3c252be2.ContentText: You don't seem to worry too much about the Xianzhou, Miss Tingyun.
1ad6910b3c252be2.Speaker: March 7th

f82e1f93c84879c6.ContentText: I wouldn't say that — a good businesswoman doesn't wear her heart on her sleeve. Besides, the alliance has weathered plenty of challenges. We can handle this situation.
f82e1f93c84879c6.Speaker: Tingyun

68724d9c9494bf29.ContentText: Just to warn you, if we do run into Kafka, you'll have to do the fighting, benefactors. I'd love to help, but there's very little I can do except cheer you on from the side lines~
68724d9c9494bf29.Speaker: Tingyun

12c733a61366bae8.ContentText: Not a lot of people out there could've fought the mara-struck like you did. I'm only a civil servant — I can't imagine what Kafka would do to me if I were caught in the fray...
12c733a61366bae8.Speaker: Tingyun

cc8c016aa412fc9b.ContentText: We Foxians don't live as long as the Xianzhou locals, but I still want to enjoy the hundred-odd years I've got left. You'd do the same in my shoes, wouldn't you?
cc8c016aa412fc9b.Speaker: Tingyun

4a988f72e7452752.ContentText: *sigh* Playing the Madam Yukong card, are we? That's not very heroic now, is it.
4a988f72e7452752.Speaker: Tingyun

cdb5ed7c4e94fab5.ContentText: Besides, the Madam Helm Master simply asked me to assist you in navigating around Starskiff Haven. It's no different to any other diplomatic mission or delegate reception.
cdb5ed7c4e94fab5.Speaker: Tingyun

4bc1b38491c5d124.ContentText: I was never much of a fighter, and I'm not one for risking my life either. Getting Diting into your hands is already beyond the realm of my job description.
4bc1b38491c5d124.Speaker: Tingyun

7548af136ae7c205.ContentText: I'll definitely be putting in a few words next time we meet Yukong...
7548af136ae7c205.Speaker: March 7th

8bd1e20b1dd59984.ContentText: Understood. We won't put you out of your comfort zone, Miss Tingyun.
8bd1e20b1dd59984.Speaker: Welt

6158aff3a420687b.ContentText: When we run into Kafka, we'll do the fighting — and the capturing for that matter. Thank you for showing us the way.
6158aff3a420687b.Speaker: Welt

05c23c272e338bf3.ContentText: I think we've rounded up all our suspicious clues... but did Kafka leave them behind on accident or on purpose?
05c23c272e338bf3.Speaker: Welt

d52c9d2528678a86.ContentText: She sure did put a lot of work into this gag, and I think we're the punchline.
d52c9d2528678a86.Speaker: March 7th

f66c5b4ed89a4b9d.ContentText: Ugh. Making us run around like jerks. I bet she's loving this! I can almost hear her whispering: "Come and get me..."
f66c5b4ed89a4b9d.Speaker: March 7th

87884157b6fdd7cc.ContentText: Ugh, why don't you go and marry her, huh?
87884157b6fdd7cc.Speaker: March 7th

5279041337cc401c.ContentText: Don't forget, she's on the IPC's most-wanted list — a fugitive that nobody can seem to pin down... and now we've become her prey while she stalks us in the shadows.
5279041337cc401c.Speaker: Tingyun

14f0b1fb22e60c33.ContentText: Let's go, benefactors, time is of the essence. We must be close.
14f0b1fb22e60c33.Speaker: Tingyun

46af8e3f45fb35dc.ContentText: We should have enough clues here to get Diting on the move.
46af8e3f45fb35dc.Speaker: Welt

900380036390992a.ContentText: No time to lose! Let's give him the scent and let him lead the way.
900380036390992a.Speaker: Tingyun

5708f024e531673e.ContentText: Stay still, benefactors... My instinct tells me something's not right here.
5708f024e531673e.Speaker: Tingyun

24300d04447f5c12.ContentText: I can't see anything fishy... Did Kafka lay a trap for us? Let's get Diting to investigate.
24300d04447f5c12.Speaker: March 7th

c15d1e0a5968b4ad.ContentText: Stargazer Navalia may have come to a standstill, but the alarms are operational... How did she get through here?
c15d1e0a5968b4ad.Speaker: Tingyun

4570cb2df4b3d0e9.ContentText: I bet that hacker Kafka pals around with had a hand in it.
4570cb2df4b3d0e9.Speaker: March 7th

ec5eb13770a0efa8.ContentText: Hee-hee, thanks to little Diting, we didn't have to break and enter.
ec5eb13770a0efa8.Speaker: March 7th

824ca066109c65ef.ContentText: {NICKNAME}, can you watch what you're doing!?
824ca066109c65ef.Speaker: March 7th

1060cde97580f379.ContentText: The scent... where did it go?
1060cde97580f379.Speaker: Tingyun

0115795c41437882.ContentText: When the trace of the hunted disappears, the hunter better think twice...
0115795c41437882.Speaker: Kafka

5b86976470045ca5.ContentText: It might mean the tables have turned.
5b86976470045ca5.Speaker: Kafka

8ea373f1b8e0d5f8.ContentText: These Cloud Knights aren't mara-struck... What did you do to them?
8ea373f1b8e0d5f8.Speaker: Tingyun

51372c4829332130.ContentText: Just a little persuasion to get them to <color=#dbc291ff>listen to me</color>. But you know all about that already, don't you {NICKNAME}?
51372c4829332130.Speaker: Kafka

0b22eb73a93c759f.ContentText: What a hassle, this place is too far for the diviner. See you up ahead.
0b22eb73a93c759f.Speaker: Kafka

a097dd8e34d61c18.ContentText: So close and yet so far... you'll have to pick up the pace.
a097dd8e34d61c18.Speaker: Kafka

5dfb0dd284e692ae.ContentText: Ugh, there's no way through here, we need to think of a way to cut her off!
5dfb0dd284e692ae.Speaker: March 7th

1d3e2f56a4ca9da2.ContentText: Don't worry about locked doors, benefactors, we can use the conveyor belts.
1d3e2f56a4ca9da2.Speaker: Tingyun

22553785f1763999.ContentText: Of course, I didn't want to make things too difficult, so I spun you a broad web... Wasn't that nice?
22553785f1763999.Speaker: Kafka

cec19b9527f8d4d3.ContentText: Welcome, Astral Expressers. Looks like you caught me.
cec19b9527f8d4d3.Speaker: Kafka

a0eb9c4774902187.ContentText: Admit it, Kafka. You planned for us to come here.
a0eb9c4774902187.Speaker: Welt

dadc7d87ba410984.ContentText: I didn't plan anything. It was the future. We interfere on countless future possibilities and make the best future a reality.
dadc7d87ba410984.Speaker: Kafka

6035b77f79f1a915.ContentText: You speak too highly of us, Welt. The Stellaron Hunters are merely destiny's slaves.
6035b77f79f1a915.Speaker: Kafka

596b21c0d7816b8c.ContentText: Best future? Best for who? As if you'd consider anyone but yourself.
596b21c0d7816b8c.Speaker: March 7th

2e6fd97883be0232.ContentText: If I said "best for the universe," would you believe me? Hehe... Best for me, naturally.
2e6fd97883be0232.Speaker: Kafka

f7ac2e6029e37f20.ContentText: We're taking you to see the general of the Luofu. You can profess your innocence all you like, but the general will decide your fate.
f7ac2e6029e37f20.Speaker: Welt

b0634b70408bd87b.ContentText: Oh thanks, but no thanks. I can't stand moving at someone else's pace.
b0634b70408bd87b.Speaker: Kafka

a1e0fda93be04048.ContentText: We don't have much time. If I were you, I'd make a move before it's too late.
a1e0fda93be04048.Speaker: Kafka

3a078cae16f52e63.ContentText: Greetings, crew of the Astral Express. This is our first encounter... though given that I have encountered you in foresight, perhaps I should say the second. I am Fu Xuan, master diviner at the Divination Commission and one of the Six Charioteers.

7af5dec62ebe8b4c.ContentText: Far-flung friends ought to be received with fine wine, but alas, the heavens, earth, and body are not aligned for such an occasion. You'll allow for a postponement of the usual formalities, I trust? We should begin with the matter at hand.

c84f3bb7f91de05d.ContentText: ...What the actual heck is she saying?
c84f3bb7f91de05d.Speaker: March 7th

e9d9f8bd505aff1d.ContentText: Ahem! If the method of my speech is offensive to you, you need but say.

a21488591f106ca1.ContentText: We received an assignment from General Jing Yuan to arrest the Stellaron Hunter. Thank you, diviner, for coming to our aid, but we must escort the fugitive to the general.
a21488591f106ca1.Speaker: Welt

7c1fcad7d940896e.ContentText: Inessential. I hold a proclamation from the general here, if you care to see. Upon detaining the Stellaron Hunter, questioning and all further arrangements are to be undertaken by the Divination Commission.

6e4b1dafcab9ce5a.ContentText: Did the general just spare us a walk with Kafka? I knew he was a good guy~
6e4b1dafcab9ce5a.Speaker: March 7th

e35899ebd37eda22.ContentText: Understood. However, the general promised that all intel would be shared with us. We have a right to know anything that Kafka divulges.
e35899ebd37eda22.Speaker: Welt

2bf13ee712a4b490.ContentText: That guy... Can I go one day without him throwing me under the—

915e0be4cbbe5c6b.ContentText: We won't make things anymore complicated than they need to be. We just want to listen in on the questioning.
915e0be4cbbe5c6b.Speaker: Welt

adae98decf44d211.ContentText: Very well, urgency demands fluidity... The three of you shall accompany me to the Divination Commission.

1be3cfa8c29ceaa3.ContentText: Can't we do the questioning here? The Stellaron Hunters are slippery, what if she makes a break for it?
1be3cfa8c29ceaa3.Speaker: March 7th

179daa72bc400f92.ContentText: While I am here, she will not escape. Only the Divination Commission has the methods to make her talk and bring the truth to light.

99921c6a790f98db.ContentText: The time has arrived. We must depart. Please, proceed.

30d711cfc0e41837.ContentText: Before Diting can start tracking, you'll have to feed him some leads.
30d711cfc0e41837.Speaker: Tingyun

af19afd80443ed2e.ContentText: If Kafka is hiding in Stargazer Navalia, she'll have left behind traces. Let's spread out and look for them — leave no stone unturned.
af19afd80443ed2e.Speaker: Tingyun

be792dba0f9ea559.ContentText: Our priority now is to find anything that could lead us to Kafka.
be792dba0f9ea559.Speaker: Tingyun

a745e1a7c7632e5f.ContentText: ...A jade seal used by the shipwrights. It opens various passages.
a745e1a7c7632e5f.Speaker: Tingyun

4d0ad39f98cff494.ContentText: It looks like someone used it and then destroyed it — possibly Kafka.
4d0ad39f98cff494.Speaker: Tingyun

519affb1463588f6.ContentText: Shards of a Cloud Knight's weapon. Something really sharp caused this...
519affb1463588f6.Speaker: Tingyun

1c00751ce6a71bb4.ContentText: It must have been Kafka! She's got a scary sword.
1c00751ce6a71bb4.Speaker: March 7th

38b04f34e974c3f9.ContentText: I know, I know, let's go and have a look!
38b04f34e974c3f9.Speaker: March 7th

b6f2f53d2cd4a678.ContentText: Agh! Is that a grenade? What's that on the side... Huh? It's lipstick...
b6f2f53d2cd4a678.Speaker: March 7th

2b327d42a36fbdb6.ContentText: Look, Diting found a strange chest... and there's a hand print on it...!
2b327d42a36fbdb6.Speaker: March 7th

fb108d98910ff165.ContentText: Let me see... Slender fingers, but strong. This hand belongs to a killer.
fb108d98910ff165.Speaker: Tingyun

84445f3927823f1f.ContentText: Huh? There's a note here too. "Take your fancy? There's a reward inside~"
84445f3927823f1f.Speaker: March 7th

19b95153b31be598.ContentText: Ugh, why do I get the feeling we're not the ones doing the hunting?
19b95153b31be598.Speaker: March 7th

75762c67fa5754b1.ContentText: It seems like Kafka predicted our every move... Stay alert, all of you. We could be walking into a trap.
75762c67fa5754b1.Speaker: Welt

d37edf1843c96ecb.ContentText: Is this... anything to do with Kafka?
d37edf1843c96ecb.Speaker: March 7th

f9e66186e68d860b.ContentText: That's a shipwright's soldering gun, I think one of the workers here must have left it behind.
f9e66186e68d860b.Speaker: Tingyun

b18c0404b5ced640.ContentText: What's this? It looks like clay.
b18c0404b5ced640.Speaker: Tingyun

f052d2703ad40e30.ContentText: I think it might be shipbuilding material leftover from the assembly line, though I can't tell exactly what the substance is... I don't think it's connected to Kafka.
f052d2703ad40e30.Speaker: Welt

37c9ef7d609a8a67.ContentText: "Downy cloud and opalescent moon are set in twain by the seals multitudinous. Neither road nor skiff shall cross the gulf and carry me to thee."
37c9ef7d609a8a67.Speaker: March 7th

aab36b0daeb25975.ContentText: Thanks to the {RUBY_B#machine translator}synesthesia beacon{RUBY_E#} I can understand the characters, but I don't get what any of it means... Is this something Kafka left behind?
aab36b0daeb25975.Speaker: March 7th

843b0a2f71c141ea.ContentText: Seems like a love poem to me.
843b0a2f71c141ea.Speaker: Welt

28c03115f1e4e2e4.ContentText: L—Love poem? Quick, put it back!
28c03115f1e4e2e4.Speaker: March 7th

b143fe2d13c4a0e1.ContentText: This isn't a clue, it's just a brand of tea I like...Two cups a day keeps the tiredness at bay.
b143fe2d13c4a0e1.Speaker: Tingyun

89fa4d846888465e.ContentText: I could do with a cup once we're done here...
89fa4d846888465e.Speaker: March 7th

a6247efc014ee55b.ContentText: Ah, I know what this is! It's an advertisement for a Home-Use Object Finder.
a6247efc014ee55b.Speaker: March 7th

acb4121b665f79c7.ContentText: There are IPC advertisements everywhere. It's about time I got in touch with their trade commissioner.
acb4121b665f79c7.Speaker: Tingyun

9b76ab4b6fbc0319.ContentText: Another chest, another hand print. Has this woman got nothing better to do?
9b76ab4b6fbc0319.Speaker: March 7th

a09e6f90624d5a42.ContentText: "A little cheese for the rats in the maze~"
a09e6f90624d5a42.Speaker: Tingyun

7a36ed21bf894202.ContentText: Rats!? She's playing games with us — I hate her!
7a36ed21bf894202.Speaker: March 7th

3733998802c1cd71.ContentText: {NICKNAME}, keep your eye on March. We can't let her be impulsive.
3733998802c1cd71.Speaker: Welt

0b83088029f847f9.ContentText: The time has arrived. We must depart. Please, proceed.

cec1e89029e30e1f.ContentText: Mother... Did you wake up from that dream...?
cec1e89029e30e1f.Speaker: Bronya

a5ea4dc2c8363b7e.ContentText: Wow... that was a tough trailblazing expedition. Dan Heng, {NICKNAME} — we made it! But, uh, what are we gonna do with the Stellaron? It's usually Mr. Yang who handles it...
a5ea4dc2c8363b7e.Speaker: March 7th

9491cb00b57b4334.ContentText: I've informed Himeko and Mr. Yang already. They'll seal the Stellaron.
9491cb00b57b4334.Speaker: Dan Heng

4136441d34321cb9.ContentText: Nice! The crisis on this world is basically over, right?
4136441d34321cb9.Speaker: March 7th

b141a518b848eb79.ContentText: Now that the Stellaron is sealed, the Eternal Freeze will slowly recede. The Fragmentum won't aggressively expand anymore, but nor will it disappear. Jarilo-VI has a chance to return to life, but it will take time...
b141a518b848eb79.Speaker: Dan Heng

2f844b20fba8cdf8.ContentText: It will depend on the efforts of the people here.
2f844b20fba8cdf8.Speaker: Dan Heng

0c3b70d400063da9.ContentText: Thank you {NICKNAME}... I—I'm fine. Don't worry.
0c3b70d400063da9.Speaker: Bronya

7486da87fb4fd554.ContentText: This victory is only the beginning for Belobog.
7486da87fb4fd554.Speaker: Bronya

1dfc686f462a3dcb.ContentText: Hehe, start thinking, we're going to need all the humor we can get... At least the biggest hurdle is behind us.
1dfc686f462a3dcb.Speaker: Bronya

c4b47678c1ea1102.ContentText: There is still much to do... The people will have felt the effects of the Engine of Creation. There are so many questions to answer, so many truths to reveal...
c4b47678c1ea1102.Speaker: Bronya

3219e4e39c612a01.ContentText: I don't know whether I can get the people to accept all this...
3219e4e39c612a01.Speaker: Bronya

66e006d767369c3a.ContentText: Tell everyone about Mother's true motives... about a lie perpetrated for <unbreak>700</unbreak> years...
66e006d767369c3a.Speaker: Bronya

55670ae876e3166c.ContentText: ...Use a lie to conceal a lie. But if I do that, then...
55670ae876e3166c.Speaker: Bronya

91c3ae98f905c8c0.ContentText: I... I don't know how to explain it... but I don't think there's any other way.
91c3ae98f905c8c0.Speaker: Seele

ead5888f7d183cc1.ContentText: In the Underworld, we tell the kids "things will be better tomorrow." Everyone knows it's a lie, but it gets them to sleep with some hope.
ead5888f7d183cc1.Speaker: Seele

909a7a874e85031e.ContentText: Can you imagine the consequences if we told the people what happened here? They'd be devastated. If we can't trust the guardians, who — or what — can we trust...?
909a7a874e85031e.Speaker: Seele

02fc6b0957e616b0.ContentText: The visitors from beyond the sky told her the secret of the Stellaron. She knew that Alisa Rand, the first supreme guardian, had failed to destroy it...
02fc6b0957e616b0.Speaker: Bronya

881fc50117695d31.ContentText: ...and yet she decided to challenge its power — a power beyond human comprehension. Supreme Guardian Cocolia sacrificed herself to dispel the dark clouds enveloping this city.
881fc50117695d31.Speaker: Bronya

f20ed69504649ab2.ContentText: ...From here on out, that's the "truth" the world will hear. What do you think?
f20ed69504649ab2.Speaker: Bronya

3e691c8046959427.ContentText: It keeps the hope of preservation alive, at least.
3e691c8046959427.Speaker: Seele

eeccd908e40e7cff.ContentText: It's logical... and hard to disprove.
eeccd908e40e7cff.Speaker: Dan Heng

cdfbf7ec7c3eddeb.ContentText: Why do we have to lie? ...I'm abstaining — I like telling the truth. But... I get what you're trying to do.
cdfbf7ec7c3eddeb.Speaker: March 7th

ef58a837fca523ab.ContentText: I understand, but... I must protect those that believe in the Architects...
ef58a837fca523ab.Speaker: Bronya

44b9363f0748cb62.ContentText: Sorry... I'll be sure to make it up to you.
44b9363f0748cb62.Speaker: Bronya

9f2b5447360b6185.ContentText: For many people, mother was an outstanding guardian... The whole truth will live on in my mind — all the mistakes, madness, evil, and dreams therein... I will be the one to carry that burden.
9f2b5447360b6185.Speaker: Bronya

a01e2858e05df4ff.ContentText: Now I must take over the duties of the supreme guardian... and discard my naive fantasies.
a01e2858e05df4ff.Speaker: Bronya

f24ec65fe84c1d16.ContentText: I'm sorry, Seele. Please protect this secret with me... till the end of our lives.
f24ec65fe84c1d16.Speaker: Bronya

2d427e33dc06e714.ContentText: Say no more — I know what to do.
2d427e33dc06e714.Speaker: Seele

e0d59a70f7f845f8.ContentText: Well then, as promised, let's start rebuilding the bridge between the Overworld and the Underworld.
e0d59a70f7f845f8.Speaker: Bronya

4e7a0a2170fa8f24.ContentText: Natasha! Oleg! Hope you didn't have to wait too long.
4e7a0a2170fa8f24.Speaker: March 7th

051a81a3137e9a08.ContentText: You kids move fast! By the look on your faces, I assume you come bearing good news?

d06e44192dc9b8b5.ContentText: Mm-hmm, you bet! You might not believe this, but we summoned up all our strength, and then...
d06e44192dc9b8b5.Speaker: March 7th

a2a17cb770aaa1da.ContentText: ...Uh, maybe {NICKNAME} should do the talking. I'm no good at serious stuff — I'll probably say something I'll regret.
a2a17cb770aaa1da.Speaker: March 7th

6e58d72c2e78e186.ContentText: We were there at the fight — we witnessed everything.
6e58d72c2e78e186.Speaker: Dan Heng

cf4458078347ba9b.ContentText: "Sacrificed herself," huh... Sure. Yeah. That's the whole story...
cf4458078347ba9b.Speaker: March 7th

f0163923eb190d6f.ContentText: The supreme guardian sacrificed herself to seal the Stellaron. We were there at the fight — we witnessed everything.
f0163923eb190d6f.Speaker: Dan Heng

5e3e7a8419fb6150.ContentText: "Sacrificed herself," huh... Sure. Yeah. That's the whole story...
5e3e7a8419fb6150.Speaker: March 7th

dbbc1c0fce95650a.ContentText: Cocolia? In order to save Belobog, she... I see.
dbbc1c0fce95650a.Speaker: Natasha

c4634f8afbe4b64f.ContentText: So the massive tremors we felt earlier were a result of the battle, right?

60a84e078de92513.ContentText: ...Thank you. I can't even imagine what you've been through up there. I'm just glad everything turned out alright.
60a84e078de92513.Speaker: Natasha

722cd477d2b9718d.ContentText: Don't worry, she's alright! It took a big toll on Bronya, so Seele took her over to the Guards.
722cd477d2b9718d.Speaker: March 7th

fcfb9a397ec7b9c1.ContentText: Good... I'm so glad you're all okay.
fcfb9a397ec7b9c1.Speaker: Natasha

42a5ed933f448b66.ContentText: Now that Cocolia is no more, I guess our Silvermane girl is about to become the next supreme guardian?

c3703b795191b6d5.ContentText: She sees things through and doesn't go back on her word. The Underworld will thrive again under her watch.

06aeba80b40026fc.ContentText: Mm-hmm! Oh, we brought you a message from Bronya! Ahem, "The blockade will soon be lifted. The people of the Underworld will breathe freely."
06aeba80b40026fc.Speaker: March 7th

a2c08c315034801e.ContentText: "Breathe freely..." That's been our wish all along.
a2c08c315034801e.Speaker: Natasha

4fd14613afb8c507.ContentText: March, Dan Heng, and {NICKNAME}... can I ask for your help again? I want to get this news out to everyone. It'll lift their spirits and bring them hope.
4fd14613afb8c507.Speaker: Natasha

3f688fddddb66414.ContentText: Thank you. Choose whoever you like. Wildfire will take care of the rest.
3f688fddddb66414.Speaker: Natasha

e51df90ddba29413.ContentText: We've gotten to know a lot of Underworlders... {NICKNAME}, who do you think we should start with?
e51df90ddba29413.Speaker: March 7th

ed6e49d6d5f660e5.ContentText: Roger that — you can leave the rest to us. If everything goes smoothly... this should be Wildfire's final mission.
ed6e49d6d5f660e5.Speaker: Natasha

705e0e5faf41e214.ContentText: How did you know that was Perkins...
705e0e5faf41e214.Speaker: March 7th

1e63c858a781dee5.ContentText: Seems like Perkins picked up a stammer?
1e63c858a781dee5.Speaker: March 7th

f2d96dc2a4f1ed97.ContentText: Its language module must have malfunctioned... Can you take us to Clara?
f2d96dc2a4f1ed97.Speaker: Dan Heng

4e225d7ea473a386.ContentText: Outsiders... are f—friends of Clara... Follow me...

83f7f8d8cb5d1df1.ContentText: Are you trying to start another fight...
83f7f8d8cb5d1df1.Speaker: March 7th

68f83998918c0b5b.ContentText: There was a huge shaking just now coming up through the ground. Mr. Svarog said it... must have been...
68f83998918c0b5b.Speaker: Clara

d1eee37804d1aa12.ContentText: Recalculating... Conclusion: Engine of Creation. <unbreak>97.66%</unbreak> probability.

53e3556fc1a1335b.ContentText: The Engine of Creation was an immense construction machine created by the Architects. It was not built to fight.

023a9ee10ebd0070.ContentText: Well whatever, we won... Thanks to that giant robot, we were finally able to take care of the Stellaron... and Bronya made a promise — the Underworld and the Overworld will soon be reunited.
023a9ee10ebd0070.Speaker: March 7th

82ce0cc720db1fd7.ContentText: Which means that you, Svarog — uh... You won't have to worry about preserving the Underworld... for the time being.
82ce0cc720db1fd7.Speaker: March 7th

e703c7a0d4bc8212.ContentText: March, everyone... thank you so much! I wasn't sure you guys would be able to do it, but...
e703c7a0d4bc8212.Speaker: Clara

084485ca84f0f6e9.ContentText: But now... Mr. Svarog, what do you say?
084485ca84f0f6e9.Speaker: Clara

af326bd400de15a8.ContentText: You guys said you were travelers from other worlds, right? I want to be just like you... One day, I'm gonna go traveling to faraway places and make new friends.
af326bd400de15a8.Speaker: Clara

9a1d87ab30f33da8.ContentText: Calculation result... update. Mission number <unbreak>0001</unbreak> — Preserve the Underworld — complete.

af12e18796f9f48e.ContentText: March, Dan Heng, {NICKNAME}... it's wonderful you made it to the address.
af12e18796f9f48e.Speaker: Bronya

204f0082a3bdeb1d.ContentText: Sorry, I know the invitation was very last minute... but I needed to get the news out as soon as possible. The longer people waited, the more rumors started to swirl. The situation risked spinning out of control.
204f0082a3bdeb1d.Speaker: Bronya

b16ae68b8221774c.ContentText: Yes, I'm fine now. Don't worry.
b16ae68b8221774c.Speaker: Bronya

551522766e935d36.ContentText: My mother... she tried to force the voice of the Stellaron into my head... It was a terrible feeling. I don't know what would've happened if you hadn't shown up.
551522766e935d36.Speaker: Bronya

ae27046cf2a5de9f.ContentText: She was there. She just made sure no one could see her.
ae27046cf2a5de9f.Speaker: Bronya

439bf6877e3f8518.ContentText: Seele is still new to the vastness of the Overworld — she feels uncomfortable in a big crowd... I'll help her adjust to life here.
439bf6877e3f8518.Speaker: Bronya

4ebc1c1c3859ba0f.ContentText: That was some speech, Bronya! If I had to talk like that in front of a huge crowd, I'd be shaking head to toe!
4ebc1c1c3859ba0f.Speaker: March 7th

c559507f3adfa299.ContentText: It was all just a bunch of palatable lies. I hope you never have a similar experience, March.
c559507f3adfa299.Speaker: Bronya

a41992558aace182.ContentText: Mm... I'd prefer to be honest with the people... but I also want to preserve their hope.
a41992558aace182.Speaker: Bronya

8f744e344ff551c8.ContentText: ...Dan Heng, wanna... talk about Mr. Yang's findings?
8f744e344ff551c8.Speaker: March 7th

fd61844c0eed0e4b.ContentText: ...Which means the Fragmentum has already taken root by this point. Even though the Stellaron is sealed, we won't be able to reverse the damage immediately...
fd61844c0eed0e4b.Speaker: Bronya

53ebf664c412a5d4.ContentText: I know. Our ancestors wouldn't have risked using one if they'd had other ways of avoiding calamity.
53ebf664c412a5d4.Speaker: Bronya

fe563756524775c6.ContentText: You've gone out of your way to save this world. {NICKNAME}, you nearly lost your life. I have no right to ask for more.
fe563756524775c6.Speaker: Bronya

61ac94b12bbe29e7.ContentText: Besides, I agree with Mr. Yang. Ultimately, the fate of Belobog is in the hands of its own people...
61ac94b12bbe29e7.Speaker: Bronya

b39534e091a22a07.ContentText: In that case... as a leader, I must give you a promise of the same weight.
b39534e091a22a07.Speaker: Bronya

5a8312ea0d8f3c7e.ContentText: We will hold out with everything we have until the day you Trailblazers return. Even if it takes another <unbreak>700</unbreak> years, the children of Jarilo-VI will look up to the sky with hope in their hearts.
5a8312ea0d8f3c7e.Speaker: Bronya

b4be20f23c227521.ContentText: So long, my friends. May the Preservation bless your journey.
b4be20f23c227521.Speaker: Bronya

535f5c1de47fe3d7.ContentText: Aw, it was a close thing alright! Good thing it dawned on me: Hey, Sampo doesn't have to be a protagonist, right? The likes of us are better suited to... shadowy comic relief, huh?
535f5c1de47fe3d7.Speaker: Sampo

d2cbee37d261c470.ContentText: Turns out the Astral Express crew is more fun than I expected! You liked it? Really? Haha, told you so!
d2cbee37d261c470.Speaker: Sampo

5489482f8f01e1f1.ContentText: ...No no, I'm in no hurry to leave. What? Oh, Epsilon? Pff. What fun can you get out of a giant vanity fair like that? "True happiness always entails the manifestation of the dignity of mankind..." Now that's a quote I live by.
5489482f8f01e1f1.Speaker: Sampo

36ae8a05e1b096fa.ContentText: Well, bye for now. Send my regards to the guys and girls in the tavern. Oh, and don't forget to say that Sampo Koski will catch them for the next one. Time to make my curtain call.
36ae8a05e1b096fa.Speaker: Sampo

8c23bbfc62b134c3.ContentText: To you, my dear audience, I dedicate my performance... I wonder, did I bring a little more joy into your lives?
8c23bbfc62b134c3.Speaker: Sampo

21cf8e16ee79e72c.ContentText: ...You don't have to answer that — but if the answer is no, then you'll break my heart.
21cf8e16ee79e72c.Speaker: Sampo

f4478ee52ea2c5d0.ContentText: It seems to have stopped working...
f4478ee52ea2c5d0.Speaker: Clara

c9987ccdb4c03ab7.ContentText: Was it begging for mercy? I'm not sure what happened either.
c9987ccdb4c03ab7.Speaker: Clara

434b2ec44abae88c.ContentText: I guess we should return this little fella and the parts. I think I can... I'll repair it.
434b2ec44abae88c.Speaker: Clara

05c3dcac35d667a3.ContentText: And if I can't, I'll ask Mr. Svarog for help. He always knows what to do...
05c3dcac35d667a3.Speaker: Clara

d75b6246fcd01a90.ContentText: Please leave Pascal to me. It was my decision to keep him in the first place, so I must take full responsibility.
d75b6246fcd01a90.Speaker: Clara

5918bc3eb9703811.ContentText: I'm certain Pascal won't do anything to harm anyone, but if something goes wrong...
5918bc3eb9703811.Speaker: Clara

c307cdd2a66b7592.ContentText: Please let me handle this myself. Please, Mr. Svarog!
c307cdd2a66b7592.Speaker: Clara

44fc3fca633afedb.ContentText: I... can't shirk my responsibilities. I'll do it.
44fc3fca633afedb.Speaker: Clara

b6ed2be01423adf9.ContentText: That's right... This all started with me and can only end with me.
b6ed2be01423adf9.Speaker: Clara

352fd1e857839078.ContentText: I'm certain Pascal would never do anything to harm anyone.
352fd1e857839078.Speaker: Clara

76ed2ce4436d723f.ContentText: Clara, please tell me how you came to this conclusion.

f4785fd03fe93f7f.ContentText: Pascal possesses a quality that other small robots lack. It's kind of similar to the emotions we humans have.
f4785fd03fe93f7f.Speaker: Clara

46a8fdd747d76796.ContentText: I've only ever seen this quality in Mr. Svarog...
46a8fdd747d76796.Speaker: Clara

f3858bbe9596ac05.ContentText: I feel... a warmth from these emotions. I feel drawn to this quality, and try to respond back in my own way...
f3858bbe9596ac05.Speaker: Clara

9a3d51c8115605b4.ContentText: But I'm also aware that not all emotions in this world are positive... If there are too many negative emotions that go unchecked, then someone needs to step in and stop them.
9a3d51c8115605b4.Speaker: Clara

43b2dfaf5c306e2b.ContentText: The only things that can stop such negative emotions are rationality and responsibility. This is a valuable lesson I've learned from Mr. Svarog.
43b2dfaf5c306e2b.Speaker: Clara

99136db666d415e2.ContentText: Mr. Svarog, I want to help Pascal overcome those negative emotions. I want to take on this responsibility.
99136db666d415e2.Speaker: Clara

57d05c23b2675b61.ContentText: That way... I won't have to hide behind Mr. Svarog anymore.
57d05c23b2675b61.Speaker: Clara

e3052d250c809e3d.ContentText: ...I understand, Clara. I support your decision.

7787132dedc7536c.ContentText: I won't intervene unless the situation risks spinning out of control.

0c078172d124f440.ContentText: We can install a "lock" in Pascal's core.
0c078172d124f440.Speaker: Clara

65195b6955376841.ContentText: Clear the redundant data and locate the core sectors that are still intact. Then, we can install a new suite of operational programs.
65195b6955376841.Speaker: Clara

0ade4d6126a42e9e.ContentText: This suite of programs can regulate Pascal's behavior and prevent him from hurting people.
0ade4d6126a42e9e.Speaker: Clara

b8acef5a1eb4bfa7.ContentText: With this method, we might be able to retain as much of Pascal's emotional intelligence as possible while keeping him out of trouble...
b8acef5a1eb4bfa7.Speaker: Clara

5e71e151f02186fc.ContentText: If we can keep Pascal's emotional intelligence, I might be able to teach him to treat people with kindness. What do you think, Mr. Svarog?
5e71e151f02186fc.Speaker: Clara

c502653d111cc5e7.ContentText: This procedure is theoretically viable, but there are risks. It will not eliminate the muddled information. Additionally, the newly installed programs may be later contaminated by it.

1732c344190a81de.ContentText: In other words, because we cannot monitor the robot outside of the network, this approach can only guarantee Pascal's stability for a brief period of time.

74d4d14c4a829681.ContentText: The probability of the robot crashing again is around...

c9effb490edad18d.ContentText: And if that happens, I'll do it again. And if it happens again, I'll go through the exact same steps. I'll guide him and fix him. No matter how many times it happens, I'll be there to help Pascal...
c9effb490edad18d.Speaker: Clara

1bc2f755c6702280.ContentText: But he will forget about you, Clara. He will repeatedly forget you, as well as all the emotions and memories he has previously accumulated.

60b754d7f44baa4b.ContentText: His limited storage capacity will eventually become completely overwritten by infinite copies of muddled information in an everlasting cycle.

076f62e1700b7d82.ContentText: Clara, the challenge will be tougher than you can possibly imagine. Are you sure this is the path you want to take?

66d93e847e2d0862.ContentText: There, there Clara. There's no need to rush to a conclusion.

f2a4c3a25259f2ab.ContentText: The variable in Belobog's fate is still here. Perhaps {F#she}{M#he} can suggest the best solution.

b8ad3124d51af413.ContentText: Okay. I... I trust your judgment.
b8ad3124d51af413.Speaker: Clara

1180ec99388cce99.ContentText: Love at first sight, sold at first strike! The Wildfire used item auction is opening soon! If you're interested, head down to the vagrant camp and get involved!

a13cbe906c408936.ContentText: Outsider! I remember you. Perhaps you're hoping to find some treasures at the auction, too?

fa4ea086f0530a9f.ContentText: Don't just dash off! Let me tell you about it. I'm sure I can stoke your interest...

a013927ec1bfd1d4.ContentText: We're not sticklers at this auction — you'll find everything from exotic Belobog rarities to tattered roadside socks!

4ab24c77b71af1a5.ContentText: Oh after Wildfire got involved in the maintenance of the vagrant camp, they saw there was a big resource distribution problem. People would rather keep a stockpile of useless objects than exchange them for useful resources.

f0412e6f885a0d82.ContentText: So we intend to hold a public auction. It will allow folks to make the best use of the stuff they have by exchanging it for stuff they need.

498920660c9a3a4b.ContentText: It's mostly vagrants from the camp, but Boulder Town residents are welcome to join as well, of course!

0494c2e3debeb280.ContentText: The more attendees we have, the more items there will be for trade, and the better we can meet the auction's goal!

5da69cda62d12681.ContentText: Buyers and sellers must all register their personal information. To ensure the quality of items, the sellers must also register details for each item.

ccf4406aadd881ef.ContentText: Then there's the standard auction procedure. The auctioneer presents the items, and the bidders place their bids on the spot... Pretty straightforward, don't you think?

4b36de72f1385606.ContentText: Oh plenty! Gloves used by Chief Oleg, the domestic robot that Miss Fidora built...

bb7b0c7bbd849c69.ContentText: There are lots of prospectors hunting for ancient relics in the vagrant camp, so there should be a lot of unique items at this auction. For example, I heard that one of the goods up for auction is a barely used Geomarrow Probe...

6268f2853971bb28.ContentText: Ah, never heard of a treasure like that before, huh? More excited about the auction now?

1c2ec049ca1fb0db.ContentText: Oh, here — take this pamphlet. It has more information on all the rarities up for auction. Remember to stop by the vagrant camp! Be there or be square!

88712cb5bd9090d6.ContentText: I should tell Hook about the Geomarrow Probe... She might want to help Fersman get his treasure back.
88712cb5bd9090d6.Speaker: playerboy

9a3a4e520d502792.ContentText: Take a pamphlet, have a look, and don't lose it! Remember to stop by the vagrant camp for the auction. Be there or be square!

af29c4d0104a9180.ContentText: Ah, honorary member! I was just about to go see you!
af29c4d0104a9180.Speaker: Hook

586932b75af734e7.ContentText: Daddy's already planned his birthday party, but I haven't been able to sell Junjun... or buy a gift for him.
586932b75af734e7.Speaker: Hook

aa9990be62e4f0de.ContentText: What should I do? Honorary member — you think of something!
aa9990be62e4f0de.Speaker: Hook

6d123ea64e006fcd.ContentText: Ah! I was just about to ask you about the probe!
6d123ea64e006fcd.Speaker: Hook

fe2e24af2c63fb3c.ContentText: Huh? What's so urgent? Spit it out!
fe2e24af2c63fb3c.Speaker: Hook

68825294a09b48d3.ContentText: Ah! How did you know what I was thinking? Hook was about to ask you about the probe!
68825294a09b48d3.Speaker: Hook

e6fb209ce428feca.ContentText: Honorary member, you found some clues?
e6fb209ce428feca.Speaker: Hook

bc15ee856a18ad99.ContentText: The auction... So... that's where the probe is!?
bc15ee856a18ad99.Speaker: Hook

3a58948dad789018.ContentText: Hmph! Do you think Hook's stupid or something?
3a58948dad789018.Speaker: Hook

c8f24ff29960a5c2.ContentText: At the auction, I can sell Junjun AND buy a birthday gift for daddy... Yeah!
c8f24ff29960a5c2.Speaker: Hook

223a41e91da0d18b.ContentText: That's nothing — you're here too! I've got the honorary member here to help me with the bidding!
223a41e91da0d18b.Speaker: Hook

755eb401cfe34014.ContentText: Junjun is still with the old witch. Let's go get him and then register for the auction!
755eb401cfe34014.Speaker: Hook

23646dfac8233ce5.ContentText: Stupid, witchy old... Natasha! Hehe, h—have you finished fixing Junjun?
23646dfac8233ce5.Speaker: Hook

fe2a1d07fec755fb.ContentText: Oh, your teddy bear? Hehe... He's nearly done. Here, take a look at him.
fe2a1d07fec755fb.Speaker: Natasha

79eee0137d48d476.ContentText: Wow... He looks brand new! Natasha, you're incredible.
79eee0137d48d476.Speaker: Hook

3947068568d3fd00.ContentText: Glad to be of service. Now then... did you really bring {NICKNAME} over here with you just to pick up Junjun? Come on now, what are you guys up to this time?
3947068568d3fd00.Speaker: Natasha

650fb4248a11d358.ContentText: Ah... n—no! That's not what we're going to do!
650fb4248a11d358.Speaker: Hook

adfc8917382d2695.ContentText: ...The auction, the one at the vagrant camp?
adfc8917382d2695.Speaker: Natasha

2d323b3125dffb26.ContentText: The auction... right Hook? The one at the vagrant camp?
2d323b3125dffb26.Speaker: Natasha

aeef9d28e280260f.ContentText: ...You've been spending too much time with Hook.
aeef9d28e280260f.Speaker: Natasha

9d766939f22c4089.ContentText: So you made me go through all this effort to repair Junjun just so you could sell him...?
9d766939f22c4089.Speaker: Natasha

969e722b80160113.ContentText: I... uh... Psst, honorary member! Think of something!
969e722b80160113.Speaker: Hook

f107db52a4cb813a.ContentText: Hehe, you two make an adorable duo.
f107db52a4cb813a.Speaker: Natasha

49e30d4928af4803.ContentText: I was only joking, Hook. Junjun is yours, and it's entirely up to you what you do with him. But you must make one promise to me...
49e30d4928af4803.Speaker: Natasha

e42b79e5758389f1.ContentText: Don't go charging into the Fragmentum again. Mr. Fersman heard about what you did and came to me to find out what happened.
e42b79e5758389f1.Speaker: Natasha

626e1fedb8e36c70.ContentText: Your dad worries about you — stop giving him reasons to.
626e1fedb8e36c70.Speaker: Natasha

b85760659aa3e4aa.ContentText: Daddy... Aw... Okay, I swear I'll never make Natasha or daddy worry again.
b85760659aa3e4aa.Speaker: Hook

0bab8a4be60d1a17.ContentText: {NICKNAME}, I'm going to have to trouble you to keep an eye on this kid again. You seem to be doing a good job, so I'll leave it at that.
0bab8a4be60d1a17.Speaker: Natasha

61442bdc0e6160ce.ContentText: Off you go then, and good luck.
61442bdc0e6160ce.Speaker: Natasha

e9b0fe6c907c002d.ContentText: Thanks, Natasha! Honorary member, let's head to the auction!
e9b0fe6c907c002d.Speaker: Hook

6ad416f8fd5b596a.ContentText: Welcome! Are you here to take part in the auction?

7acce4756edf8b9c.ContentText: Yep! Hook wants to auction this teddy bear!
7acce4756edf8b9c.Speaker: Hook

98c6b4fff04e98ed.ContentText: Teddy bear? How about I take a look at it first, little missy...

2d489b08d1954d5c.ContentText: Hm... With all due respect, I don't think this item will generate much interest at the auction... I don't see any value in it.

8784a911002a3907.ContentText: Hm, let me take another look... The craftsmanship is excellent, and the fabric is soft... but I'm afraid that won't command a high price on its own.

2e72871a7c174b7e.ContentText: The eyes... wait a minute, that's natural erebus! Haha, what are precious gems doing on such an ugly teddy?

d507f27d9d72c547.ContentText: Hey, who are you calling ugly? Take that back!
d507f27d9d72c547.Speaker: Hook

88ad9522aaaa8421.ContentText: Well, well, well, who'd have thought it... Allow me to make a suggestion — you should only auction off the gems.

7f5cd0871c44b2be.ContentText: What are you talking about? You can't just take Junjun's eyes off!
7f5cd0871c44b2be.Speaker: Hook

de453b29b57d96a0.ContentText: ...Alright, alright, don't get upset, little missy! I'll respect the wish of the owner and keep Junjun here intact.

77f718ae575873eb.ContentText: Please sign this commodity contract here...

c9f1a6b55f18f1a2.ContentText: And if you and your friend would like to bid, please fill out this buyer registration form as well.

92fd96c9006e443c.ContentText: Of course we'd like to bid! I'll sign again! {NICKNAME}, ask about the probe!
92fd96c9006e443c.Speaker: Hook

573d3b25112d1a0c.ContentText: Probe? Are you talking about the Geomarrow Probe? As far as I know, there are a lot of people interested in acquiring that device. The estimated sale price is no less than <unbreak>600</unbreak> shield.

c621551c32c98edd.ContentText: Because it's a rare and useful treasure, the Geomarrow Probe will be up for bidding in the final round of the auction.

6c1d371404657cda.ContentText: But don't worry, the gems on your teddy bear are also very valuable. You'll have the chance to bid on the probe if someone's willing to pay a high price for him.

19b5e90cfc489923.ContentText: Oh? Then we'll be counting on you.

89f6f53db1b514d1.ContentText: I'll tell you a secret... <color=#dbc291ff>the more bidders there are, the more you can get for your bear here.</color> This place is teeming with potential buyers. It only takes a gentle nudge to get them to join in.

1adaf021ff44a6e2.ContentText: Hook doesn't get it. What are we supposed to do?
1adaf021ff44a6e2.Speaker: Hook

a8278491b15a824c.ContentText: Is "true love" really that useful? Hee-hee!
a8278491b15a824c.Speaker: Hook

170b9e88d2f6f61d.ContentText: Hmm, I won't be much help then. Hook never deceives anyone!
170b9e88d2f6f61d.Speaker: Hook

b9a08080a1ae081a.ContentText: Yay! Diggertron's all set and ready to go!
b9a08080a1ae081a.Speaker: Hook

6739327999912563.ContentText: Let's ask around. Junjun's super cute — I'm sure there'll be loads of people interested in buying him.
6739327999912563.Speaker: Hook

08c5ad8220d78bcf.ContentText: Don't try making conversation with me! I don't trust anyone here!

497cdf9a38716f88.ContentText: I'm warning you, there's only one winner at an auction — everyone here is one of my competitors!

f74c79933083a649.ContentText: Hmph, I'll take that as a compliment! You think I can't hear you, you little brat?

d60cbb698050e572.ContentText: Haha, you think you can fool me? The friendlier they are on the outside, the more devious they are on the inside!

dae03eaa51e0c911.ContentText: Seems like this guy's got a real bad temper...
dae03eaa51e0c911.Speaker: Hook

5b662d614001e3bb.ContentText: Temper? What temper? I'm perfectly calm, thank you!

85de5f78b9b562c4.ContentText: You're sellers, right? I just caught sight of a teddy bear on the bid list. Is that yours?

07d2997076848c55.ContentText: Hmph, you two with your poker faces... You've got a trick up your sleeves with that bear?

a95170a35bdc806e.ContentText: ...This guy thinks that the whole world is against him... What should we do, honorary member?
a95170a35bdc806e.Speaker: Hook

e9365bcc2c337ece.ContentText: ...Trying to dupe me into not bidding on it, huh? Fine, then I will bid for it! I won't let this opportunity slip!

6af3bdc3e8d3a9d7.ContentText: Don't want me to profit from your item, huh? Well in that case, I'm definitely gonna solve the mystery of your teddy bear, haha!

2e74d29b1b5fd477.ContentText: But I don't wanna sell Junjun to such a weirdo...
2e74d29b1b5fd477.Speaker: Hook

068979556f7a68e5.ContentText: ...Don't want me to profit from your item, huh? Well in that case, I'll just have to place a bid and solve the mystery of your teddy bear, hahaha!

495f744fec418d64.ContentText: What a weirdo... Anyway, at least we've tricked him into bidding for it!
495f744fec418d64.Speaker: Hook

3cd37db7ec4fe444.ContentText: Well, look at that. That's no ordinary teddy bear...

125b4ba0729c653b.ContentText: Oh! Uh... sorry, I was in a bit of a trance. I didn't know someone was about to strike up a conversation.

8d01d9a8b2eb66f2.ContentText: Huh, you don't look like you'll be bidding on much, so I'll tell you... That teddy bear's eyes are genuine erebus!

ae4197d2631e27c9.ContentText: ...Wait, how did you know that!? Unless you're... a fellow gemologist?

0071fdd96b0bf108.ContentText: Ahem, yes... I didn't think anyone else had noticed. *sigh* I guess getting my hands on those gems won't be so simple after all...

bfbacbc153720d4f.ContentText: But it's so absurd... I don't understand why precious gems would be sewn onto a teddy bear. Is this some new kind of scam?

cb52ae47a90f03f5.ContentText: ...So you don't think Junjun deserves those gems?
cb52ae47a90f03f5.Speaker: Hook

5f3d27f34704a37d.ContentText: It's okay, I didn't take it to heart.

f0590dfc25682eac.ContentText: Oh, haha, wh—why didn't you bring that up earlier? Your item has piqued my curiosity.

41efc5b982fc7696.ContentText: In any case, erebus of that purity is hard to come by in the Underworld. I have to get my hands on that bear, even if it means breaking the bank! Ha...

f670ba659bb9c69d.ContentText: Hmph, Junjun will break your bank for sure.
f670ba659bb9c69d.Speaker: Hook

a0dfdd09947a08f5.ContentText: (The gemologist will be bidding too. Hook's teddy bear may be the center of attention.)
a0dfdd09947a08f5.Speaker: playerboy

878ca06e7a1d52cc.ContentText: His design is super cute and he's really really soft! You can't help but give him a biiiig hug!
878ca06e7a1d52cc.Speaker: Hook

469e4e566253f5e3.ContentText: You'll have sweet dreams every night as long as Junjun's by your side! Intrigued...?
469e4e566253f5e3.Speaker: Hook

99059c5d6a70d89a.ContentText: According to the old witch, some people aren't good at talking in front of other people. Why not ask him to write his thoughts down?
99059c5d6a70d89a.Speaker: Hook

c5334d77bc88f46c.ContentText: (We could find the auctioneer now and wait for the bidding to begin...)
c5334d77bc88f46c.Speaker: playerboy

701dcbc0b29bc023.ContentText: (...Although there is still some time left. <color=#dbc291ff>We could also see if we missed any buyers...</color>)
701dcbc0b29bc023.Speaker: playerboy

5bcd2736be92412e.ContentText: Please wait a moment. The auction will begin shortly.

20bdac5b778324f5.ContentText: Outsider? I knew you'd show up. We met before, remember?

9eca7263bab5ae64.ContentText: That's right, so you do remember me!

83dfd0aee9d3f577.ContentText: ...You don't remember me? How saddening... Anyway, it doesn't matter. Let's get down to business.

febc6eb72a50a16e.ContentText: You've obviously come here for the Geomarrow Probe, right?

860fcae0d3ff38fe.ContentText: Hey, there are lots of people here who want the same thing as you.

df21ecd758122687.ContentText: Do you remember Balaway the Miner's Lamp? He told me everything.

35e27ef00d658420.ContentText: Hey, why so tense? I'm not here to elicit information from you. Forget it, pretend I didn't say anything...

e04ad8e9029271a1.ContentText: By the way, I'm looking for Gertie, manager of the Goethe Grand Hotel. Please tell me if you see her.

c2715abf554346ea.ContentText: Gertie's niece will be returning to Boulder Town in a few days. She asked me a while ago if there were any gifts suitable for children at the auction.

43f88cb711b590f3.ContentText: I've noticed there are a few more children's items at the auction today, but I haven't seen Gertie anywhere... She hasn't returned to Boulder Town yet, has she? It would be a shame if she couldn't make it to the auction...

bc4ec9dc55148c42.ContentText: (So Gertie's hunting for children's toys? Maybe we can persuade her to bid on Hook's teddy bear too.)
bc4ec9dc55148c42.Speaker: playerboy

8aa26feb5be30146.ContentText: I wanted to go and see whether there were any gifts, toys, or dolls that my niece might like. I didn't mind if they were a little more expensive than usual, I just wanted her to be happy.

0fc5d1e31b66552f.ContentText: So, I got up early this morning and went to take a look around — turns out all the items were ancient relics. There was something called a Geomarrow Probe. It all sounded a little extreme... I went around the whole venue and couldn't find what I was looking for, so I came back early.

ba455a871aa39991.ContentText: That's right, my teddy bear is one of them! Your niece will love him!
ba455a871aa39991.Speaker: Hook

3888008f5e037c10.ContentText: Huh? Y—Yeah, that's right! Hook spotted loads of cool stuff at the auction!
3888008f5e037c10.Speaker: Hook

0dd9ee77e422a4f7.ContentText: For example, there's this teddy bear called Junjun! Your niece will love him!
0dd9ee77e422a4f7.Speaker: Hook

de3603dc256058a4.ContentText: Oh really? I guess I must've missed the latest additions... In that case, I'll finish up here and head back to the vagrant camp. Thanks so much for letting me know!

3403df4b4a045972.ContentText: The teddy bear? I've seen it. The one with the erebus eyes, right? I was planning on bidding for it...

65c9bd5240380055.ContentText: ...Correct. I rushed over here from a neighboring town and forgot my darn wallet!

e3d5835a8368d6c4.ContentText: But I also have my own items to auction and a commodity contract. If I can sell my stuff at a good price, I might be able to afford the bear.

66bcd163ea8affcf.ContentText: The catch is I... lost the contract!

e4ff6f6c2dead4e6.ContentText: Not so fast! I... I know where the contract is.

55439d74fa371a49.ContentText: A robot stole my contract. Now it's lurking somewhere in the machine graveyard, and I'm too terrified to go after it.

a774037c0224e388.ContentText: *sigh* Just my luck... If I can't retrieve the contract, I won't be able to buy that bear...

89feac9b2ba7c15e.ContentText: Is this the "contact" that careless guy lost? Let's give it back to him!
89feac9b2ba7c15e.Speaker: Hook

3c861f4ce3940734.ContentText: *sigh* When am I gonna catch a break...?

95ce594367d4ad85.ContentText: Huh? But that robot stole it! How did you...?

37ce4e9423ba0567.ContentText: We defeated the evil robot and got your "contact" back!
37ce4e9423ba0567.Speaker: Hook

3b5c3b3b39121762.ContentText: Really? Thank you so much! ...Now, if I can just sell my items, I'll... have enough money to bid on the erebus teddy!

e5fbad342e6e6fab.ContentText: You two have done me a huge favor, I won't forget it!

3f9b30ded057d212.ContentText: Oh! Finally. Don't run off again! You're such a disobedient... How many times have I told you to stay close to me? You'll get lost!

c18fa2d68d275b5b.ContentText: This is my flesh and blood! How could I possibly... Come on, let grandma see that cute little face...

07c9d511fc7965a8.ContentText: Oh for the love of... You're not my grandson after all!

e7a0baa35d1fd601.ContentText: No! She mistook me for someone else.
e7a0baa35d1fd601.Speaker: Hook

60dbef08808c46e9.ContentText: Nonsense, how could I mistake my own flesh and blood? Come on, let grandma see that cute little face...

725522f770e02c6f.ContentText: ...My eyes might not be up to much, but I can assure you my brain's working just fine...

a2f3653242d64dcc.ContentText: My grandson is right here. Come on, let grandma me see that cute little face...

11d77f296472c19d.ContentText: Oh for the love of... You're not my grandson after all!

c04642bb861ccaab.ContentText: ...Then where has my darling grandson gotten to? Oh, dear me, this is dreadful... dreadful!

55265e5557e79d10.ContentText: So, why you hanging around here by yourself, tiny?

f036bce245650bcb.ContentText: Yeah, tiny. Where are your parents? You didn't go out on your own, did you?

793dd4e4ca92b9b5.ContentText: ...B—But you brought me over here. My grandma's just over there...

2a784c3dde06c5f7.ContentText: Hey! Did we give you permission to speak?

a554ea461e8371ee.ContentText: Alright, enough mister nice guy... Give us the money, now!

c6603c79acebcf4a.ContentText: You dare steal from a kid in front of Pitch-Dark Hook the Great!? Let's see how brave you are against Diggertron!
c6603c79acebcf4a.Speaker: Hook

a9cd7a6b4f300bb0.ContentText: Huh, looks like someone's trying to be a hero. Boss, they look rich. We should rob them, too!

f16eee05a11b3ba9.ContentText: Huh? Who the heck are you? Boss, these two must have more money than this brat. Let's rob them instead!

47e76e71695e1953.ContentText: You dare steal from a kid in front of Pitch-Dark Hook the Great!? Let's see how brave you are against Diggertron!
47e76e71695e1953.Speaker: Hook

0a0040d24da1479e.ContentText: Huh, looks like two new brats showed up. We'll just have to teach you a lesson as well! Boss, they look rich. Let's rob them too!

dd93408bf526cbbc.ContentText: You're safe! Go find your family!
dd93408bf526cbbc.Speaker: Hook

f7499aed0dc39024.ContentText: ...Th—That was really brave of you! I hope I can be half as strong as you someday.

addea6e4a9b94c2f.ContentText: Thanks so much guys! I gotta go!

4c775a8316c3404d.ContentText: Isn't this the kid we just saved?
4c775a8316c3404d.Speaker: Hook

d80704037ae5e36d.ContentText: Grandma, grandma! They're the ones who saved me.

15a6d0c290c07262.ContentText: Oh my goodness! I can't even begin to express my gratitude!

7018eecabf830885.ContentText: Thank you both so much. He's my only grandson — and I don't know what I would've done.

be4f1b0e8f6479e8.ContentText: Can we buy the teddy bear at the auction, grandma?

2b36dc59668f38b6.ContentText: Hey! What are you doing!? You're making Hook angry!
2b36dc59668f38b6.Speaker: Hook

16d0b4d43b426234.ContentText: Oh! I'm sure that teddy bear must've belonged to a nice person... Let's go and take a look.

f8326b9807b6b11f.ContentText: If grandma wins the auction, don't tell your parents I bought it! Let's pretend it was a gift from this kind {F#young lady}{M#young man}.

8448be4feaa1ba1f.ContentText: Aww, they're really sweet! Junjun will be super happy if they take him home...
8448be4feaa1ba1f.Speaker: Hook

25a0a22779805fcf.ContentText: *sigh* Anyway, we should get going. Come on, honorary member!
25a0a22779805fcf.Speaker: Hook

d61487b2b470433b.ContentText: *sigh* I came because I heard there was an auction, but there's nothing I want here.

941bc4db392d081b.ContentText: Why did the auction house set such a low opening bid? I'm bound to make a loss...

135176f526dfdca4.ContentText: Perhaps I should publicize it myself! Oh... I don't like talking to strangers though...

033c2d2d6d14b8d5.ContentText: ...I heard there was something called a Geomarrow Probe at this auction, but I didn't think it would be so pricey.

fd7c2e2ef2c7a25a.ContentText: Where did you hear that? What is a Geomarrow Probe exactly?

d1764f2676e111f2.ContentText: I'm not sure, but it was Balaway that told me. I'm not sure why he wants it.

56cfc11e3692103b.ContentText: So expensive... There must be a lot of people after it for the price to skyrocket like that.

57804c37212bb45d.ContentText: Oh, who cares about that probe thing. There's a teddy bear at the auction that looks pretty valuable...

44e673572f019c08.ContentText: What's so appealing about a toy? *sigh* We're clearly operating on different wavelengths.

dd8a892e7b326c37.ContentText: The next item has been provided by Hook, a gemstone collector from Boulder Town. It's a handmade teddy bear adorned with erebus.

f8752ae34c142524.ContentText: An innovative design! It combines incredibly valuable erebus gemstones with, uh... a good old-fashioned cuddly teddy bear! The opening bid is <unbreak>300</unbreak> shield.

055f4d43c4f7fd8b.ContentText: What's the problem with <unbreak>325</unbreak>? That's my offer!

307699ca92a89f78.ContentText: I'm putting my reputation as a gemologist on the line — I have to get my hands on that erebus... Add another <unbreak>100</unbreak> shield!

b7515559f42f9e41.ContentText: <unbreak>450</unbreak> going once, any buyers going higher?

5e3f7b63701d2a40.ContentText: <unbreak>450</unbreak> shield for the erebus teddy bear, going twice! Any other offers?

0ae4e94abdacf5a7.ContentText: <unbreak>450</unbreak> shield going three times... aaaand sold!

5d164751c59c649e.ContentText: <unbreak>500</unbreak> going once, any buyers going higher?

1c27f539add3078d.ContentText: <unbreak>500</unbreak> shield for the erebus teddy bear, going twice! Any other offers?

b0a9db428f19bcfc.ContentText: <unbreak>500</unbreak> shield going three times... aaaand sold!

1afe092803510993.ContentText: <unbreak>550</unbreak> going once, any buyers going higher?

9611d73043fd498a.ContentText: <unbreak>550</unbreak> shield for the erebus teddy bear, going twice! Any other offers?

6b2ca518c9ecf959.ContentText: <unbreak>550</unbreak> shield going three times... aaaand sold!

e96f4b210d4cdbd8.ContentText: <unbreak>600</unbreak> going once, any buyers going higher?

78090685f934f082.ContentText: <unbreak>600</unbreak> shield for the erebus teddy bear, going twice! Any other offers?

d150f87c7d751d4b.ContentText: <unbreak>600</unbreak> shield going three times... aaaand sold!

b233f3c24f48bcf9.ContentText: Phew! The gems belong to me.

a3e3402fbce034e6.ContentText: Hmm... I hope this money is enough to buy the probe...
a3e3402fbce034e6.Speaker: Hook

6657d43f911a4388.ContentText: That's true, but I want to help daddy get his treasure back...
6657d43f911a4388.Speaker: Hook

27db6a95329ab4d4.ContentText: The bidding for the Geomarrow Probe has been postponed due to unanticipated complications at the venue. Please be patient and don't leave the auction if you want to bid on it...

d27a248e27f5d4a5.ContentText: Don't worry, everyone — just a minor technical issue! We'll take a quick break now, and the auction will resume soon.

71568a156847c3db.ContentText: ...A break? {NICKNAME}, do you think there's something wrong with the Geomarrow Probe?
71568a156847c3db.Speaker: Hook

f2e7b00ed8f9b972.ContentText: Let's go ask that staff member!
f2e7b00ed8f9b972.Speaker: Hook

24ad8e15cf2d6055.ContentText: What happened to the Geomarrow Probe? Tell me right now! Straight away! Immediately!
24ad8e15cf2d6055.Speaker: Hook

d28a7a9c9ae75ad6.ContentText: Uh... There's nothing to worry about — it's just a technical issue.

a2b9541e125e36c4.ContentText: ...You don't sound very convincing! *gasp* ...Did someone steal it?
a2b9541e125e36c4.Speaker: Hook

8059dc9592f931bf.ContentText: ...Well, we can't say for sure that it was "stolen..." We've contacted the seller and sent some people in search. We should soon be able to...

87ceb269417c7dd7.ContentText: Yeah, why wasn't Wildfire keeping a lookout?
87ceb269417c7dd7.Speaker: Hook

0611507184dc52ce.ContentText: Yeah, why is Wildfire so incompetent? You should have put The Moles in charge!
0611507184dc52ce.Speaker: Hook

965c7030b8b6f1f8.ContentText: I gotta catch the thief and get the probe back! Any ideas, honorary member?
965c7030b8b6f1f8.Speaker: Hook

ec71dcd65c0c5dbd.ContentText: Are you suggesting that someone altered the registration form? That's simply not possible! We've been keeping a close eye on everything...

f172f6fa3096bc1d.ContentText: Fool! What the honorary member means is that the thief only came here to create trouble — they weren't interested in buying or selling! Right, {NICKNAME}?
f172f6fa3096bc1d.Speaker: Hook

a7d59c1fa90ac916.ContentText: When the going gets smart, the boss of The Moles gets smarter!
a7d59c1fa90ac916.Speaker: Hook

80f3c2df3d5312ec.ContentText: I don't have a salary to give! I'm a volunteer... *sigh*

eb47f0c4b18a5f83.ContentText: Wait a minute, let me see...

926cbece2da698ba.ContentText: ...Hmm, aside from you, there was someone else who registered as a buyer but never put in a bid!

b3ac7cf7ddd959b1.ContentText: ...And I think there was a miner who registered with him. Come on, let's go and interrogate them.

2e8923001e561330.ContentText: Hi, excuse me... may I ask where the miner who registered with you has gone?

e89c323fff8f3f8c.ContentText: ...Him? I think he went back into town.

6ee98049699491b7.ContentText: He came here saying he wanted to buy the Geomarrow Probe, but then he changed his mind for some reason and ran back to Boulder Town alone.

ed2c1e51acf466ae.ContentText: I don't know him all that well. Why don't you just head into town and look for him?

af1c90e630743297.ContentText: Do you really think he'll turn out to be a thief? I'm not so sure now...

2d5f2eee73d4078e.ContentText: Ahem, anyway. Outsiders, you should go and look for him in Boulder Town. I need to make sure the other buyers haven't left. If you don't find anything, the thief might still be among us...

fb69f01072896734.ContentText: Let's head back to Boulder Town and catch the thief!
fb69f01072896734.Speaker: Hook

54b22a06f6ca0d85.ContentText: Hey, you! Did you take the Geomarrow Probe? Hand it over, right now!
54b22a06f6ca0d85.Speaker: Hook

f2b60d502713d2c9.ContentText: ...Huh — what? Who are you? Where are the people I'm supposed to meet up with?

fa400bfec8077762.ContentText: Honorary member, we shouldn't waste any time talking to him. Let's just knock him out!
fa400bfec8077762.Speaker: Hook

8271df475ac78d66.ContentText: Hahahaha, what could a couple of brats do to me? Do you even know how much the probe is worth?

042f413f1767b84f.ContentText: You two better think twice. The boss put in a lot of effort to find this item. If you even...

a4df7df7bd63cfab.ContentText: Enough talk! How about a Diggertron knuckle sandwich!
a4df7df7bd63cfab.Speaker: Hook

34cd8379e95dd9ac.ContentText: Okay, enough! I give up, okay!? S—Stay calm! I'll give you the probe, just listen to me...

a3b19d710afa4e7d.ContentText: I overheard the auctioneer say that the Geomarrow Probe would fetch at least <unbreak>600</unbreak> shield... <unbreak>600</unbreak> shield! Have you ever seen that much money?

00c8e100bb882a0b.ContentText: Tsk. You? Yeah right. I don't believe you!

a780ef0a3747fe42.ContentText: ...Why would I lie to you at this point?

01f30d12660a9565.ContentText: How about this. The boss, along with a few buddies and I — we put together <unbreak>600</unbreak> shield and buy the probe from you, hmm?

53ed53196dca9894.ContentText: Come on missy, don't be so stubborn. We can talk it over...

ae2861219c5dd25f.ContentText: Oh... I see. You just wanna keep the probe to yourselves, right? *sigh* And here I was thinking I'd met some nice people. You're worse than I am...

555d367ef7a6d949.ContentText: ...Maybe it did in the beginning, but things have changed now.
555d367ef7a6d949.Speaker: Hook

66d66a6de7fabecf.ContentText: Let's go, honorary member! Back to the auction.
66d66a6de7fabecf.Speaker: Hook

587d7f2b1b302cf6.ContentText: Wait a minute! You're just gonna give it back? That's <unbreak>600</unbreak> shield! <unbreak>600</unbreak>! At least think about it!

e51908762b5a93e6.ContentText: There's nothing to think about, Mr. Thief! I want this detector, but I don't wanna be a louse like you!
e51908762b5a93e6.Speaker: Hook

5b0aca319e2a18b9.ContentText: We're gonna win it at the auction, fair and square! Let's go, {NICKNAME}!
5b0aca319e2a18b9.Speaker: Hook

4f616c92c1083e15.ContentText: ...You got the probe back? Amazing! Fantastic!

ca08329b01579e84.ContentText: The owner asked me to pass on <unbreak>150</unbreak> shield as a reward for retrieving it.

a18ea7027490426c.ContentText: And thanks to you, the auction house has regained its credibility. Please accept an extra <unbreak>50</unbreak> shield!

0d0cc0f993498d3d.ContentText: You've earned it. Besides, if you win the bid for the Geomarrow Probe, you'll have paid back the seller anyway, right?

b307a2f164e3c83a.ContentText: Well, I didn't say that, but you could certainly interpret it that way.

0be2d4e7e8c78f03.ContentText: Haha, you should check your reflections. Your eyes light up whenever money's involved.

b976ea4d072516bb.ContentText: Hook generously accepts the reward! We've got <unbreak>650</unbreak> shield for the auction!
b976ea4d072516bb.Speaker: Hook

341d785547741872.ContentText: Hook generously accepts the reward! We've got <unbreak>700</unbreak> shield for the auction!
341d785547741872.Speaker: Hook

ca2e66c15a78daf1.ContentText: Hook generously accepts the reward! We've got <unbreak>750</unbreak> shield for the auction!
ca2e66c15a78daf1.Speaker: Hook

48710cc99dd8bd70.ContentText: Hook generously accepts the reward! We've got <unbreak>800</unbreak> shield for the auction!
48710cc99dd8bd70.Speaker: Hook

4f240723559342b0.ContentText: Ahem, ladies and gentlemen, the technical issue has been resolved. The second half of the auction is about to commence — please gather in an orderly manner!

290496a6dd1b6c36.ContentText: ...The next item up for auction has been provided by a veteran prospector from the vagrant camp. It's an ancient relic — a Geomarrow Probe.

8216789d612ded9f.ContentText: The item itself was once a key component of another Old World relic, and its one-of-a-kind craftsmanship has long since ceased to exist. This meticulously preserved probe is a rare work of art! The opening bid is <unbreak>400</unbreak> shield.

d8f24488d1e1142a.ContentText: Order! Order! You're just throwing bids out at random!
d8f24488d1e1142a.Speaker: Hook

3497a99691fa69f3.ContentText: Argh, {NICKNAME}! Everyone's looking at us! What should we do?
3497a99691fa69f3.Speaker: Hook

c42df6c7237802ca.ContentText: Oh-ho? A new challenger enters! <unbreak>750</unbreak> shield!

d81c58badc36208f.ContentText: <unbreak>750</unbreak> shield going three times... aaaand sold! Congratulations to the winner!

565ef6c31f95f5a6.ContentText: The next item up for auction is...

3b75d4453681d662.ContentText: ...Hook still thinks the probe is the best gift.
3b75d4453681d662.Speaker: Hook

e615463e2bde2eab.ContentText: I did the right thing! H—Hook regrets nothing...
e615463e2bde2eab.Speaker: Hook

792f03450dd0f6b6.ContentText: Just now... I thought I saw the old witch. Was Hook imagining things?
792f03450dd0f6b6.Speaker: Hook

d240e53b91e3781f.ContentText: Ugh... what does it matter, Hook didn't get the gift. I'll have to go back and ask the old witch for ideas.
d240e53b91e3781f.Speaker: Hook

c6a324cbebe23b09.ContentText: <unbreak>750</unbreak>! Did you hear that, everyone? That's what a one-of-a-kind treasure costs! <unbreak>750</unbreak> shield going once!

e973314dda1d3c19.ContentText: Honorary member... Did I win the bid? Does Hook really get the probe?
e973314dda1d3c19.Speaker: Hook

c833732429ea7b02.ContentText: Woohoo!!! Hook actually won the bid!
c833732429ea7b02.Speaker: Hook

9cf5ecc0b4a30a8b.ContentText: {NICKNAME}, thank you so much... Hook would never have won the probe without your help!
9cf5ecc0b4a30a8b.Speaker: Hook

7805d73363503f54.ContentText: ...No explanation needed! Just accept Pitch-Dark Hook the Great's gratitude!
7805d73363503f54.Speaker: Hook

22a4912c58ab5f25.ContentText: Haha... It doesn't matter whether you're an honorary member or not. Just accept Pitch-Dark Hook the Great's gratitude!
22a4912c58ab5f25.Speaker: Hook

d7f6d386d2e97f5e.ContentText: Let's go see the old witch later! I'll ask her to wrap this probe up as a beautiful gift for daddy!
d7f6d386d2e97f5e.Speaker: Hook

86877554cb85d72d.ContentText: We've got some money left over — let's use it on the old witch. She helped Hook repair Junjun, so Hook's gonna treat her to some stone-grilled olm! As for you, {NICKNAME}... you've earned Hook's verbal praise!
86877554cb85d72d.Speaker: Hook

3a5b3739db0228a8.ContentText: Hmph, don't even think about it! We're not a simple organization! Still, I may consider making you my deputy...
3a5b3739db0228a8.Speaker: Hook

5e4d0fdfc1b986ef.ContentText: Anyway, enough about The Moles... Thanks for the help, {F#big sister}{M#big brother}!
5e4d0fdfc1b986ef.Speaker: Hook

4468e15142fb849d.ContentText: I'll say it once. Listen carefully!
4468e15142fb849d.Speaker: Hook

ddedc0613ba290c8.ContentText: Thanks for the help, {F#big sister}{M#big brother}.
ddedc0613ba290c8.Speaker: Hook

586407e425ca81d0.ContentText: Uhh... there's only this much left, sorry. You'll just have to accept Hook's heartfelt gratitude!
586407e425ca81d0.Speaker: Hook

f21773a37501b1d5.ContentText: Thanks for the help, {F#big sister}{M#big brother}.
f21773a37501b1d5.Speaker: Hook

abf793d4ef47cbae.ContentText: Hook know this is what grownups should be like, But Hook still want to thank you.
abf793d4ef47cbae.Speaker: Hook

c75c46b0a638ad37.ContentText: Thanks for the help, {F#big sister}{M#big brother}.
c75c46b0a638ad37.Speaker: Hook

1bc5edb24932dcc3.ContentText: Hook, what's wrong? Has someone been bullying you?
1bc5edb24932dcc3.Speaker: Natasha

bc47a3b2351b075a.ContentText: Mine and daddy's birthday party is starting soon, but I haven't bought daddy his gift yet...
bc47a3b2351b075a.Speaker: Hook

c650bbbbc8323efa.ContentText: So... the auction didn't go too well, huh?
c650bbbbc8323efa.Speaker: Natasha

6f5a49a312b18849.ContentText: It's true. It's ridiculous that a single probe can fetch <unbreak>750</unbreak> shield.
6f5a49a312b18849.Speaker: Natasha

c18aafaa1a9f5188.ContentText: You made a very high bid... The problem is that there are a lot of wealthy people lurking in the Underworld.
c18aafaa1a9f5188.Speaker: Natasha

69e055ab2cfe23a3.ContentText: Huh!? You were at the auction too, Natasha?
69e055ab2cfe23a3.Speaker: Hook

877d1fb09563c27c.ContentText: Hook, you're upset that you don't have a gift for your daddy, right? Well, what about this?
877d1fb09563c27c.Speaker: Natasha

655031997f989da9.ContentText: Ah! It's... the Geomarrow Probe from the auction! How did you get it?
655031997f989da9.Speaker: Hook

f2fb39a7b41d0d0d.ContentText: I wasn't planning on saying anything... but I saw a couple of very sad-looking faces in the crowd.
f2fb39a7b41d0d0d.Speaker: Natasha

f1d14d96099b0f13.ContentText: What do you think, Hook? Are you willing to buy the Geomarrow Probe from me?
f1d14d96099b0f13.Speaker: Natasha

d7af15af30dfc387.ContentText: ...Th—This is all the money we got for Junjun. Here, it's all yours!
d7af15af30dfc387.Speaker: Hook

3512bfd176672fc0.ContentText: Let's have a count. Hmm, doesn't seem to be enough...
3512bfd176672fc0.Speaker: Natasha

7e9cf3b8acccd5fe.ContentText: ...Hook could also help Natasha clean the clinic for... half a month?
7e9cf3b8acccd5fe.Speaker: Hook

d8d801c0db600ea1.ContentText: Th—Three months!? Witchy old... Natasha, let's negotiate...
d8d801c0db600ea1.Speaker: Hook

8a5682f815b53f07.ContentText: By the way, Hook, how are your birthday party plans coming along? Have you invited this {F#young lady}{M#young man}?
8a5682f815b53f07.Speaker: Natasha

3ef238b5f046f47c.ContentText: Oh! Not yet! {NICKNAME}, do you wanna come to my birthday party?
3ef238b5f046f47c.Speaker: Hook

bafe83972e10e3ea.ContentText: Of course not! All members of The Moles must obey Pitch-Dark Hook the Great's commands!
bafe83972e10e3ea.Speaker: Hook

e8f1219e2104236d.ContentText: I'll contact the other members of The Moles too. Come find me when you're ready — we'll go together!
e8f1219e2104236d.Speaker: Hook

d0918f6c59684e14.ContentText: Hook, you look very happy. Did something good happen?
d0918f6c59684e14.Speaker: Natasha

78e7056d6bc6cebf.ContentText: Mine and daddy's birthday party is starting soon! Can you help me wrap up this gift! I wanna surprise daddy!
78e7056d6bc6cebf.Speaker: Hook

7e97496551a84ae5.ContentText: *sigh* You rascal... You only come and find me in situations like this.
7e97496551a84ae5.Speaker: Natasha

cb17a37473b4f7d6.ContentText: Pleeease Natasha! I'll help you clean the clinic for... half a month if you help me!
cb17a37473b4f7d6.Speaker: Hook

f0892d7b02929ea3.ContentText: Deal. I can't believe you won such a valuable item. Junjun must have fetched a small fortune, huh?
f0892d7b02929ea3.Speaker: Natasha

42f07b820aaf825a.ContentText: Even with the erebus, you must've put in a lot of effort to get such a good price?
42f07b820aaf825a.Speaker: Natasha

9cf4998a3913945d.ContentText: Fersman will be very happy with his gift.
9cf4998a3913945d.Speaker: Natasha

ca15cd7f69816b88.ContentText: By the way, Hook, how are your birthday party plans coming along? Have you invited this {F#young lady}{M#young man}?
ca15cd7f69816b88.Speaker: Natasha

850435e6671659da.ContentText: Boss, the "big hero" you mentioned is here.

a7a9b9be0941cf97.ContentText: Argh, you heard that? Don't get too cocky, honorary member!
a7a9b9be0941cf97.Speaker: Hook

27164bd7f723b030.ContentText: Nothing! Hmph, Hook would never compliment an honorary member behind their back.
27164bd7f723b030.Speaker: Hook

ac39a5cfb6a6f6b1.ContentText: We were talking about the birthday party. You wanna hear about it too?
ac39a5cfb6a6f6b1.Speaker: Hook

1628b763a3a23432.ContentText: Aunt Gertie always makes a big Black Bean Cake for Hook's birthday!
1628b763a3a23432.Speaker: Hook

981c295b60700a7b.ContentText: Oh! Oh! And daddy always makes a huge Roasted Rock Crab for me. It makes my mouth water just thinking about it!
981c295b60700a7b.Speaker: Hook

0a0e1571115a6b99.ContentText: And don't forget about Diggertron! Daddy brings a year's worth of machine oil and Diggertron drinks it all up!
0a0e1571115a6b99.Speaker: Hook

8850bb7954ba4e18.ContentText: I'm the boss of The Moles! If I don't get enough to eat, how will I have the energy to punish villains?
8850bb7954ba4e18.Speaker: Hook

f2dbc95ec920a79f.ContentText: Well, I had to invite daddy first! Speaking of birthdays, daddy never used to celebrate them. He only started doing it when he adopted Hook.
f2dbc95ec920a79f.Speaker: Hook

99c9e768450e2636.ContentText: I also invited other members of The Moles, and... Oh yeah! Seele too! She couldn't come today, but she said she'd still send me a gift.
99c9e768450e2636.Speaker: Hook

dffde79a53005329.ContentText: I also invited the old witch, Swetta, aaaand... you, of course! The honorary member {NICKNAME}!
dffde79a53005329.Speaker: Hook

13654901044dea01.ContentText: I do hope you'll forgive the ramblings of an old man, but I would like to say a few words...

b5c33af8d2d5d55e.ContentText: I had no idea when my birthday was before I adopted Hook, and I most certainly did not celebrate it.
