6392dcf1cae81967.ContentText: I didn't realize how important birthday celebrations were until I met my daughter... That is why I chose to have my birthday on the same day as Hook, so that we could celebrate this special day together.

0957cee99c54dfbc.ContentText: That continued year after year... until I, too, began to look forward to the party.

54baf283feed9511.ContentText: Today is an extra special day. In addition to The Moles, Hook has invited a dear and brave new friend. {NICKNAME}, I hope you have a wonderful time at the party today!

98a0bb569a8d6ed4.ContentText: That's right, this honorary member helped Hook a lot!
98a0bb569a8d6ed4.Speaker: Hook

f224cad75419e34a.ContentText: Natasha told me that you helped Hook retrieve her teddy bear. It used to be that Hook could only fall asleep when she held that bear in her arms.

4216493de567d74b.ContentText: D—Daddy! Don't bring that up! Hook's grown up now — I can sleep without hugging Junjun...
4216493de567d74b.Speaker: Hook

73abfccf108c2d53.ContentText: Life has gotten increasingly difficult since we left the mining town. All those days away at work have meant that your dad hasn't always been around to look after you.

45823ec81d697498.ContentText: But fortunately, Junjun was always with you to keep you company when I wasn't around. I...

e8ce57476127aa82.ContentText: ...Daddy! I—I have to tell you something...
e8ce57476127aa82.Speaker: Hook

fd21ebbbb78c4f80.ContentText: Don't worry, daddy! I don't need a doll to keep me company anymore! Natasha, The Moles and the honorary member will keep me company from now on, so I won't be lonely.
fd21ebbbb78c4f80.Speaker: Hook

b47b1addcbcd64ee.ContentText: I truly am an incompetent father. I had no idea...

97579b3b93834b64.ContentText: Not true! I know you care about me the most, daddy! I just didn't tell you because I didn't want you to worry.
97579b3b93834b64.Speaker: Hook

644c8eed05319010.ContentText: Thank you, Hook... but the birthday gift I've chosen is...

194ad5335050c1f5.ContentText: Huh? What did you get for me, daddy?
194ad5335050c1f5.Speaker: Hook

560068f28de3d840.ContentText: Oh-ho? Did a little bird tell you? Alright, I won't pretend otherwise. Yes, old man Fersman sold it to me.

02a5d6d9db73a3a7.ContentText: Sadly, I wasn't able to get hold of the Geomarrow Probe... *sigh* What good is this detector on its own?

54d734e0e363129e.ContentText: Thief? I didn't send a thief.

13e8e2c8cb99b58d.ContentText: I did arrange for a young apprentice to attend the auction, but he lost out in the bidding.

a86ac8d1ace06afc.ContentText: I arranged for a young apprentice to attend the auction, but he lost out in the bidding.

12bef6b72117b793.ContentText: Hmph, clearly you don't understand the value of ancient relics.

8dd2c4bf61c3f78a.ContentText: Shame, it's becoming increasingly difficult to find a Geomarrow Probe... The more I think about it, the more I realize that this deal was a big mistake... *sigh*

62ed92a7e7b3a759.ContentText: Fersman wouldn't want to be the sucker, would he? But maybe I should ask him... It would be great to get rid of it as early as possible...

6fc9f41516fb9e82.ContentText: Hmph, I'll give you the benefit of the doubt... Let me find Fersman and ask if he intends to sell the probe.

c911e60b9b3bcb4b.ContentText: Do you think I don't know how rare that probe is? I need to find out who that buyer at the auction was...

d412e8ca886a1ab3.ContentText: The label must've been on this box! Wait a minute... What's that smell?
d412e8ca886a1ab3.Speaker: Hook

119b3ae29d504e9c.ContentText: *sniff* It smells like condiments! Mmm, this smells like salt-grilled olm...
119b3ae29d504e9c.Speaker: Hook

807f54d9beecc32d.ContentText: Not too many people smell like this...
807f54d9beecc32d.Speaker: Hook

5f3ed6b00eb8bb96.ContentText: There won't be any eating until we find the culprit!
5f3ed6b00eb8bb96.Speaker: Hook

0d0e38a906ca937f.ContentText: I think the thief took daddy's treasure... and I think that this damaged probe is from the detector!
0d0e38a906ca937f.Speaker: Hook

bc31289780a7c8fb.ContentText: Has daddy's treasure been sold already?
bc31289780a7c8fb.Speaker: Hook

3a3db69fc3d9f2b2.ContentText: Where could the thief have gone? Hmm... think, Hook, think...
3a3db69fc3d9f2b2.Speaker: Hook

9e3648acac5fe359.ContentText: Oh yeah! I saw Mr. Sampo on the way to the mine when I came here... Could he be involved in this?
9e3648acac5fe359.Speaker: Hook

31581aa3e2f6c6f6.ContentText: Follow Hook, Mr. Sampo should be that way!
31581aa3e2f6c6f6.Speaker: Hook

35572d2eea8aff20.ContentText: You! Hey, you, stop! You are now a conscript of The Moles!

de969b163537a187.ContentText: I'm not a sidekick! I'm second-in-command! Argh. You know what? No. This ain't the time.

8584791fb124b3fe.ContentText: Heehee, I, Julian of a Thousand Faces... Wait, it's not the time for this!

845a8d0e06a2b5dc.ContentText: We got trouble! The boss went to the Great Mine alone with her Diggertron!

436d3af5eedb0bf3.ContentText: And she refused to let anyone go with her. I feel like she's doing something dangerous... You have to go check on her for us!

c1e608fe3268c1ea.ContentText: Fersman is in the mines. It seems like the boss heard some bad news about him, then just ran in there.

424356e444591b39.ContentText: She even took her Diggertron. Is she preparing for a fight with the Vagrants...

bd1ffcec84d5d4b8.ContentText: There's lots of bad guys in the mines. Miss Natasha said kids ain't allowed to go in! Go check on her for us now!

4f1fb85173a11362.ContentText: He's Hook's daddy, and he's like a daddy to everyone in The Moles! He's like... a great person!

f9bf2a4a68fd6bab.ContentText: Diggertron is Diggertron! As long as the boss has it with her, you can expect a good fight...

a991d659a263a985.ContentText: There's lots of bad guys in the mines. Miss Natasha said kids ain't allowed to go in! Go check on her for us now!

efd8a705255c016d.ContentText: You kidding? It's me! The second-in-command of The Moles? Julian of a Thousand— You know what? No. It ain't the time for this.

aa84aa6b4cb63cff.ContentText: Someone's life is at risk! Forget the minor details!

eda03a168cfbc823.ContentText: Calm down, calm down! We're all here to work for a living. Why not sit down and talk it out?

81c049748c76d468.ContentText: Save it! We treated you as our leader, but look how you treated us?

ec4a975a00dbe72f.ContentText: You sold the intel about the vein to Antonia, but we discovered it first! Now, we lost the mine and we have to work for those guys!

6727356241589346.ContentText: Well, nothing to say for yourself, huh? So you admit that you sold the intel to the mining team?

e9b65ee75dad630a.ContentText: Go away, you brutes! Don't bully my daddy!
e9b65ee75dad630a.Speaker: Hook

3caf034ac7a51435.ContentText: Little Hook? No, no, you have it wrong. It's your daddy who bullied us first. Ask him if you don't believe me!

9a0ba625c37cbddd.ContentText: Yes, I told Antonia about the vein... but I was the first one to discover it. I have the right to do anything with it.

babac9530ad5eaa4.ContentText: Tsk, it's only because you have that detector. Let's see who's boss when we take it from you!

2fb778404f45702e.ContentText: Back off! I was thinking about the bigger picture when I did that, unlike you all who just look for trouble every day!

3b8517391d23161b.ContentText: Well, I think someone needs to teach you a lesson. Guys, get him!

044e62f9a8c9d67c.ContentText: You'll never lay a finger on daddy without passing through Hook!
044e62f9a8c9d67c.Speaker: Hook

5e897101d75d0f27.ContentText: Ah, it's you! Come and help Hook!
5e897101d75d0f27.Speaker: Hook

b991a541605540d2.ContentText: Tsk, another punching bag? Fine by me! I'll kick all your butts!

b174da380be59b37.ContentText: *coughing* ...Just a few scratches. How about you, Hook?

0af5dd110ddfb7c1.ContentText: Don't worry about me! I have Diggertron. No one can hurt me!
0af5dd110ddfb7c1.Speaker: Hook

74033c89a964cecc.ContentText: Good, that's good... And you, {F#young lady}{M#young man}, are you hurt? Thank you for your help...

4d29c9d2ef147f9b.ContentText: Ah, I remember... You are the outsiders Natasha mentioned before, right? I heard that you helped resolve some conflicts around the mines when you arrived. And again today, when you saved my life...

bf1bb5e89ffee1b9.ContentText: The conflicts between the vagrants and the mining team have lasted for quite a long time... Even if you have just temporarily mitigated our rather tense relationship, it is greatly appreciated.

b1e4031a89cd43c0.ContentText: Daddy, let's go to the old witch's clinic. You're seriously hurt!
b1e4031a89cd43c0.Speaker: Hook

4ed787dfd3b29c56.ContentText: B—But... the vein detector that rapscallion was after— somebody already stole it from me. I need to keep searching, otherwise I might never see it again...

9f04dbd09a4c5e74.ContentText: It's just a tool, I guess I should let it go. Let's head to the clinic.

f93ffeef067e8a55.ContentText: Quit acting tough, {F#young lady}{M#young man}. Your injuries must be treated right away.

095cee7bd1252eda.ContentText: Don't be afraid, {F#young lady}{M#young man}. Your injury isn't fatal.

39f85bf0e07b9b38.ContentText: What a noble young spirit you have! Thank you very much!

fca6e9d8cbc4733f.ContentText: Haha, whatever your motivation was... I appreciate your help.

363807d7a9d4354d.ContentText: I've taken care of your wounds. I'm running short on medical supplies these days though, so behave yourselves and stay away from trouble, you hear me?
363807d7a9d4354d.Speaker: Natasha

b020e9ce3ffcc44a.ContentText: Don't pretend you didn't hear that, Hook, I'm talking to you!
b020e9ce3ffcc44a.Speaker: Natasha

d4f389155a2e6a4b.ContentText: ...Hook wasn't the one that caused trouble. It was those bad guys! We were just defending ourselves, ask {NICKNAME}!
d4f389155a2e6a4b.Speaker: Hook

2e430315e861a32c.ContentText: Hey, whose side are you on!?
2e430315e861a32c.Speaker: Hook

784f8e016c1e5700.ContentText: I'm glad we're on the same page. We can't just let this kid do whatever she wants.
784f8e016c1e5700.Speaker: Natasha

73bf59efbeb8b65e.ContentText: That's enough for now. I'll say this one last time, Hook: If you cause any trouble again, I'll take Diggertron away. Do you understand?
73bf59efbeb8b65e.Speaker: Natasha

218efbe8b6cafa67.ContentText: The Boss of The Moles should stick to her word. I have patients to take care of, see you later.
218efbe8b6cafa67.Speaker: Natasha

d16167f7f030cb01.ContentText: ...Well, passing the buck is one way to handle this.
d16167f7f030cb01.Speaker: Natasha

60fcbd2e88e99df1.ContentText: ...Wait, Hook needs you to help with something!
60fcbd2e88e99df1.Speaker: Hook

de156f2521c774ce.ContentText: Yes! We can't just stand by and do nothing!
de156f2521c774ce.Speaker: Hook

5fd2d11cde679fd7.ContentText: ...I haven't said what we're gonna do! But that's the spirit. You truly are an honorary member of The Moles!
5fd2d11cde679fd7.Speaker: Hook

fcb1acc96c188255.ContentText: That detector is daddy's treasure, so I gotta get it back! You'll help me, won't you?
fcb1acc96c188255.Speaker: Hook

9101191fb085dee1.ContentText: Don't be a jerk. I'll just take your response as a yes.
9101191fb085dee1.Speaker: Hook

dd05cd6e6c519abc.ContentText: Alright then! I'll be waiting for you at the shelter in the mine, {F#big sister}{M#big brother}!
dd05cd6e6c519abc.Speaker: Hook

7abd72d1af4958c4.ContentText: Members of The Moles gotta help each other out! ...Please...
7abd72d1af4958c4.Speaker: Hook

1c609fc1fa8b1354.ContentText: What's wrong, young one? Is something else on your mind?

769badca291e4c1f.ContentText: It's an ancient relic that I found in a mine. People say it's a device that mining teams used for detecting Geomarrow veins long ago. It's very rare — I haven't seen a second one in my life.

1d89cbd3a50bcab6.ContentText: Yes. Hook and I were from a small industrial town up north, but that place became corroded by the Fragmentum, forcing us to leave, as vagrants.

8dcdf9dc71581019.ContentText: Hook's parents were close friends of mine, though I'm much older than them. When Natasha asked me if I could adopt Hook, I agreed without hesitation.

0c109fe4b4b7f298.ContentText: When the Fragmentum completely overtook the Orphanage, Natasha found adoptive families for every single child. She sure is one incredible lady...

3a3a5deba7daab53.ContentText: When you were out resolving that big conflict in the mine, some of the more cautious vagrants like myself hid in the shelter. I still had my detector at that point.

b8b32bf3eb68614a.ContentText: When the fighting was over, Wildfire asked everyone to leave the shelter to get a headcount of the wounded. After that, I went back to the shelter, only to find that my detector was gone.

2e3ca3bc9c756cd6.ContentText: When I'm gone, please help look after Hook.

8b510c2155584ab1.ContentText: Too slow, {NICKNAME}, Honorary Member of The Moles! You should have gotten here before Hook!
8b510c2155584ab1.Speaker: Hook

32361f05d48d7e1c.ContentText: Let me introduce you to Swetta. She is daddy's most trusted miner.
32361f05d48d7e1c.Speaker: Hook

08a68cf28ccc890f.ContentText: Not at all, Mr. Fersman trusts every vagrant, and every one of us trusts Mr. Fersman.

495ebf0aa46820c8.ContentText: But after what happened over at that Geomarrow vein... the atmosphere at the shelter became a bit tense.

f4adccedbfa74a33.ContentText: I'm here to find daddy's treasure, his vein detector! I heard that someone stole it, is that true?
f4adccedbfa74a33.Speaker: Hook

f72d59039c78a389.ContentText: Well... I would guess that's probably true.

d5ed9ad9ec45e2b2.ContentText: After the conflict in the mines, Wildfire gathered everyone at the shelter and took a headcount to check on the wounded. <color=#dbc291ff>Four people were not there.</color>

57e10cd1a913b8fb.ContentText: When we returned to the shelter, Mr. Fersman's detector was gone. We searched all around the shelter but found nothing... I guess <color=#dbc291ff>one of those four people was the thief</color>.

825a3ee922c8ea04.ContentText: Yes. The shelter was usually crowded, so thieves would've had a hard time stealing things when everyone was around.

07b378e0e2798995.ContentText: Indeed, now we can narrow down the scope of our search considerably.

e5b13b3c9545530e.ContentText: We vagrants have our dignity, too. I'm sure we will catch the thief, but...

676e9d3451e57e17.ContentText: Actually, we've already asked those four suspects about it... but they all claimed to not have stolen anything.

030458c5d88c3d25.ContentText: Of course, we could never expect thieves to confess and turn themselves in, right? In my opinion, <color=#dbc291ff>one of those four was lying</color>.

48159eef9d5dfc98.ContentText: All four suspects are at the shelter. If you're feeling confident, why not go give it a try? Maybe you can determine who the thief is.

f01de8dc12423179.ContentText: Ugh, adults are so dishonest! Hook's gonna question them one by one!
f01de8dc12423179.Speaker: Hook

a8933abda9cb5902.ContentText: We're all vagrants. None of us have the authority to arrest anyone just because we feel like it.

c9d2f8e759fe1a19.ContentText: Let's see whose words contradict with the facts, and that person would be the thief.

2d447277deb46ef8.ContentText: Well, well, well! What's this, playing detective, are we?

6e608ee455a213f8.ContentText: Spill it! Did you steal my daddy's detector?
6e608ee455a213f8.Speaker: Hook

ec8d005fc71a1dff.ContentText: You little brat! How dare you label me a thief! Someone needs to give you a good lesson on manners! I'm an honest and decent man, I'd never do such a shady thing!

fcfb4a49418bdba2.ContentText: Hmph, anyone can say that... If you really didn't steal anything, then just answer our questions!
fcfb4a49418bdba2.Speaker: Hook

3ebd9e66cf084616.ContentText: Oh, you have a temper, huh? Alright, I'll spare a couple minutes for your little detective game.

eb9a2c4e1cc78a85.ContentText: I'm a cook, what else would I be doing? Don't you notice the smoky cooking smell all over me?

9251f2579886e434.ContentText: It's just that I happened to be out shopping for ingredients at that time. Otherwise, who'd want anything to do with this kind of thing?

3bc7803ee3614cab.ContentText: That old Fersman was kind to me. When we were at Rivet Town, he put me in charge of the whole mining team's food supply.

91280e45ee04f462.ContentText: And it's because I trusted him that I came to this mine with him. I mean, I didn't expect he would take that money for himself...

4fe4fcb3399839e1.ContentText: Anyway, he found that Geomarrow vein by himself, so I won't blame him for not sharing. But y'know, what he did was not like the old Fersman I knew.

a215a2ba41867060.ContentText: Well... I don't want to be a snitch, but out of my respect for Fersman, I'll tell you a secret.

2fed9ea4906e559a.ContentText: The helper over there, I saw him sneak into Fersman's tent and come out holding a box. See? Isn't he the most suspicious one?

dd86509d885172e3.ContentText: Hehe, I don't care if you believe me or not. Told you all I know. Now leave me alone if you don't have any more questions, I'm busy.

1e74a2b5a01acfcc.ContentText: I told you. I'm sure that helper is the thief.

fe242e5aec0c1974.ContentText: Really? Then you better answer our questions honestly!
fe242e5aec0c1974.Speaker: Hook

a50414e6ee539686.ContentText: But a bit of a cheapskate.

576c6851704cbfc5.ContentText: Hey, would you mind talking more nicely?
576c6851704cbfc5.Speaker: Hook

adf6da6a25725756.ContentText: ...I don't feel like she is the thief.
adf6da6a25725756.Speaker: Hook

5bc63c631d842e3f.ContentText: ...Well, it's the hunch of Pitch Dark Hook the Great...
5bc63c631d842e3f.Speaker: Hook

2b8263d5384bb668.ContentText: What? How could you say that! You're gonna make me angry!

960cb1baacb0c92f.ContentText: You know what a businessman values the most? Reputation! If your slander ruins my reputation and harms my business... You'll pay for that!

9dddba8cdfce436a.ContentText: Uh... Well, then answer our questions! We'll decide if we believe you or not.
9dddba8cdfce436a.Speaker: Hook

10e94fc2ed2d7546.ContentText: I have the right to remain silent.

e6711dab7379f635.ContentText: I... withhold my opinion toward this question.

5d0e9c7e248d0baf.ContentText: I'll give you one more chance. Think carefully and give your answer to Diggertron this time!
5d0e9c7e248d0baf.Speaker: Hook

e5473199c8f7f81b.ContentText: You little brat. Grow a couple feet taller before you think about threatening me!

6353bfa20c2a22d2.ContentText: I've seen all sorts of things in my life. Why would I be afraid of you two little rascals?

f5feae0e1c4bbc51.ContentText: ...Here, how about we make a deal? I'll tell you what I know, in exchange for a small intel service fee — fair and honest!

02199000ae93f10a.ContentText: I like your style! Customers who don't fuss over the price are the best. So what do you wanna know? Ask away!

8705c1f86de7b113.ContentText: Well, looks like I can only continue exercising my right to remain silent. It's up to you.

1cb19412f9b0647c.ContentText: Smart decision. I love doing business with smart people!

882fae0a1869af0d.ContentText: Trying to threaten me with Wildfire, huh? Think I'm afraid of them!?

756bc2891977774e.ContentText: {NICKNAME}, let's tell Seele to take him away!
756bc2891977774e.Speaker: Hook

c91e002230330c1e.ContentText: Huh? No, please don't! I was only joking... Fine, I'll answer your questions! Please, just don't pull Wildfire into this.

76eca21b28439d27.ContentText: I went into town to restock. Nothing out of the ordinary, right? I restock on a regular basis, everyone knows that. I was wondering why there was nobody at the shelter.

ca473433dab3d1c0.ContentText: Fersman is an old customer of mine. He's pretty nice to me, though we are not so close. As to what he did about that Geomarrow vein, it was kinda unethical.

23590e2a5ec645c1.ContentText: We're all neighbors. We've known each other for a long time. But he sold out to the other side and left his own people out to dry... I really can't agree with that!

b9599fbf873255c2.ContentText: Look, the cook is definitely the thief, I'm sure about that! I value my reputation more than anything, so you can trust me.

12a191b60b72818b.ContentText: In my line of work, I've learned to read people. And something's definitely fishy with that cook. I could tell from the start. If you don't believe me, just ask anyone.

b3f9758d9a51277b.ContentText: What do I have to gain from lying to you? Wildfire coming for me in the night?

32060395dd835132.ContentText: Trust me, something's definitely fishy with that cook. I could tell from the start. If you don't believe me, just ask anyone.

63cbe19cd3b6f815.ContentText: That cook is a crook. He's definitely the one who stole Fersman's device.

234ad71a4158184d.ContentText: Wha— Oh if I'd known I would become a suspect, I wouldn't have gone out at that time... How foolish of me.

b466bd231fbba3bc.ContentText: O—Of course not! I didn't do anything wrong...

f2844e98b027f8e8.ContentText: We just need you to answer a few questions!
f2844e98b027f8e8.Speaker: Hook

0ea1cb2b4e4edd67.ContentText: Okay... ask away. It would be good to clear myself of suspicion.

60d22932563c995e.ContentText: Nothing special. I just went out to get some fresh air.

be74373a87b4ae01.ContentText: Oh dear, oh dear... I know that's a lame alibi! But I swear it's the truth.

65625d4403a23a00.ContentText: Mr. Fersman? He's a good person. Though... oh, er, uh, never mind.

aa56bac6317dc1cb.ContentText: Oh no, oh no... I must sound very suspicious. But I really didn't do anything. You have to believe me...

510ec8cfad3d9502.ContentText: Detector? No, I haven't seen anything, and I don't know anything...

e1c15d3f62369a6c.ContentText: Is that all the questions you have? Have I proven my innocence?

4d3f773680efe53d.ContentText: Oh dear... All this waiting around is enough to make me even more anxious...

f33a592e528a203a.ContentText: I didn't steal it. Really, it wasn't me...

ac491c5d40d43a9b.ContentText: Argh... Hook's head is spinning! Do you remember everything they said?
ac491c5d40d43a9b.Speaker: Hook

b2a0acd511c4561f.ContentText: Don't worry, I've written it down for you. Remember, among these four people, only the <color=#dbc291ff>real thief will lie</color>.

598ecade8db1d4b6.ContentText: *sigh* The cook said the helper did it, the tailor said it wasn't her, the merchant said it was the cook, and the helper said it wasn't him. So, do you know who the culprit is?

7acf49083de5dc4d.ContentText: Right, we have other methods besides deductive reasoning to find out who the true thief is. Let's just examine what they've said first to decide.

2b7ece772e870f24.ContentText: Hmm... I don't know why, but I'll trust your judgment!
2b7ece772e870f24.Speaker: Hook

10942cc25da55637.ContentText: Come on, let's go accuse the culprit!
10942cc25da55637.Speaker: Hook

2a55aa6584066552.ContentText: I think the <color=#dbc291ff>cook</color> and <color=#dbc291ff>merchant</color> are the most suspicious. My gut tells me that one of them is the culprit.
2a55aa6584066552.Speaker: Hook

ad73086eeb5638b5.ContentText: Don't worry. Even if you choose the wrong one, Pitch-Dark Hook the Great has other ways to uncover the true culprit.
ad73086eeb5638b5.Speaker: Hook

8ed6cacaa1052b2e.ContentText: Huh!? Where's the cook? Where did he go?
8ed6cacaa1052b2e.Speaker: Hook

7e15e0d256d80376.ContentText: Beats me! I saw him running out in quite a panic.

1c78eeb4efbfc5d8.ContentText: Argh! That guy has to be guilty! Where is he running off to...
1c78eeb4efbfc5d8.Speaker: Hook

8702fc9a64246c5f.ContentText: Hook figured it out, you're the one who stole daddy's detector!
8702fc9a64246c5f.Speaker: Hook

dacda88b2dd12f65.ContentText: She's pretty stubborn about denying it... Should we think it over again?
dacda88b2dd12f65.Speaker: Hook

805b8a82ff0e9842.ContentText: If she's lying, then that makes her the thief! But then, what the cook and merchant said would contradict each other...
805b8a82ff0e9842.Speaker: Hook

91491ef752901440.ContentText: What! Can I even count on you?
91491ef752901440.Speaker: Hook

ea5af8edd6a28841.ContentText: Forget it, let's keep looking for the culprit!
ea5af8edd6a28841.Speaker: Hook

de72a7a514065884.ContentText: You gotta be kidding me... You thought about it for that long, and came up with this conclusion?

22871ae1a45b237a.ContentText: Ah? You mean... we got it wrong?
22871ae1a45b237a.Speaker: Hook

64bef5ae7e09f78f.ContentText: I gave you the answer, and you still couldn't crack the case, detective!? Why don't you just go home!

e30193b6c169cca6.ContentText: I already told you, it was the cook! Even if you asked me a hundred times, my answer would still be the cook!

5345c1bf8db61209.ContentText: Huh!? Is it that hard for you to admit you were wrong? Have you ever heard of something called "logic"?

4061d90b51ac6e71.ContentText: Just you wait. I'll find evidence, and then you'll be begging me for mercy!
4061d90b51ac6e71.Speaker: Hook

bea47f13950c50f0.ContentText: Hey, you're not questioning yourself, are you? Let's look for evidence and let him beg me for mercy!
bea47f13950c50f0.Speaker: Hook

a6d733d8405552ba.ContentText: Pff, right, I'd beg you for mercy. Go ahead, you'll understand once you find the truth.

37224397742fd6f4.ContentText: I wouldn't lie to you, it was the cook. The cook did it, the cook!

3f37ecf9a72a7057.ContentText: Hmm... Let's go look around and see if there are any more clues.
3f37ecf9a72a7057.Speaker: Hook

4c158b24d66de703.ContentText: Wha— What? You have the wrong person, I didn't steal anything! Waaaah... I knew you'd suspect me. I shouldn't have returned to the shelter at that time. If only I hadn't returned to the shelter...

8f56bd6043399ab0.ContentText: I really didn't do it, I don't know anything!

147a175802bce131.ContentText: You... you just think I'm a pushover. That's why you're treating me like this! Wah...

8e2cc94e98b78f0e.ContentText: T—Tent? I've never even been close to Mr. Fersman's tent...

0fea2b465557ba17.ContentText: W— Well... you deduced wrong! What kind of reasoning are you even using!?

2ad5ccfb263b2604.ContentText: I beg you, I never even stole pocket money from my parents as a kid. Don't wrong an innocent person...

dc16c8a634db52d5.ContentText: Hmm... Maybe he really isn't the thief. Hook doesn't think he's lying...
dc16c8a634db52d5.Speaker: Hook

5a228eae780c2944.ContentText: Just think about it! Swetta said that only the real thief would lie to us.
5a228eae780c2944.Speaker: Hook

162b26f44ab575be.ContentText: If the thief really is the helper, then what he and the merchant said would both be wrong!
162b26f44ab575be.Speaker: Hook

6bd648eacbe38847.ContentText: Hmph! Adults are all so unreliable! Let's go look for more clues.
6bd648eacbe38847.Speaker: Hook

c296db038136e5e0.ContentText: Let's go look around where daddy kept the detector. Maybe we can find some clues there.
c296db038136e5e0.Speaker: Hook

706634fc7948af61.ContentText: This is the label from a supply box... I know where those boxes are!
706634fc7948af61.Speaker: Hook

4f25b6d2c914a7aa.ContentText: That way, let's go take a look!
4f25b6d2c914a7aa.Speaker: Hook

6cf6a8b86460990f.ContentText: Mr. Sampo's always at the clinic hanging around Miss Natasha. Hook thought he was really sick or something!
6cf6a8b86460990f.Speaker: Hook

eb3946c0a7c06e26.ContentText: If he's working with the thief... then he's also a bad guy!
eb3946c0a7c06e26.Speaker: Hook

af0ee6e226abf43a.ContentText: Hah, you sure talked tough for someone who can't fight! Come on, hand the detector over to Hook!
af0ee6e226abf43a.Speaker: Hook

98a23097dec71ec5.ContentText: No... No! Daddy's treasure... It's broken!
98a23097dec71ec5.Speaker: Hook

2e14d4bb2551c61f.ContentText: Hey, now this is Sampo's time to shine!
2e14d4bb2551c61f.Speaker: Sampo

a03cd0d0d669d29d.ContentText: Of course! I wouldn't want to miss out on seeing you and Miss Hook's acts of heroism, would I?
a03cd0d0d669d29d.Speaker: Sampo

3158b6d9b4cd5ecc.ContentText: Listen here, there's a fellow in Boulder Town they call Balaway the Miner's Lamp. He's an appraiser. Although he claims that he doesn't do appraisals anymore for ancient relics, he actually still does a bit behind the scenes for ones that are of especially high value.
3158b6d9b4cd5ecc.Speaker: Sampo

f06a64c19d0401e3.ContentText: I think this device of yours is probably worth a lot. It might be a good idea to try your luck with Balaway.
f06a64c19d0401e3.Speaker: Sampo

42d1b2c8a520e49a.ContentText: Here's a trick — first, pretend that you want to sell it for a low price, then wait for him to excitedly fix the device for you. After it's fixed, tell him you've changed your mind and you want to keep it for yourself.
42d1b2c8a520e49a.Speaker: Sampo

641170f25553a591.ContentText: This business tactic is what I call a "bait and switch." Pretty clever, huh?
641170f25553a591.Speaker: Sampo

ec368488a845bceb.ContentText: Balaway the Miner's Lamp... Got it! Thanks, Mr. Sampo.
ec368488a845bceb.Speaker: Hook

d8e0b45c421d15d4.ContentText: {NICKNAME}, let's go into town to find him!
d8e0b45c421d15d4.Speaker: Hook

92394e2deabd317a.ContentText: I'm already retired from appraising ancient relics. So unless this detector is some kind of precious treasure...

5f70d0b96038fbb9.ContentText: Look at this! The detector's probe broke off, can you fix it?
5f70d0b96038fbb9.Speaker: Hook

7d5a523ef78681ac.ContentText: Oh ho ho, this certainly is a rare relic! Let me take a closer look...

ef2ca2b093ecb656.ContentText: Yes, look extra close! You have to help Hook fix it!
ef2ca2b093ecb656.Speaker: Hook

aeea2045ed8c7e57.ContentText: This device... I've been in the business for a long time, but never have I seen an ancient relic like this one before.

2d2cbe4e30ec534e.ContentText: I think this is probably beyond repair. But still, it is a rare treasure. Even broken, I'd be willing to pay a high price for it. What do you say?

b0140c57980e7c71.ContentText: The detector's probe is gone, it's like searching for something without eyes or ears. Now it's nothing more than a pile of junk with no practical value.

2e56b25fdb6e5ef0.ContentText: I'm willing to offer a generous price for this thing. So, do you want to sell it or not?

0d0620da413be1ed.ContentText: Alright then, let's go find daddy...
0d0620da413be1ed.Speaker: Hook

9f5c8fe344bab83b.ContentText: The detector's probe is gone, it's like searching for something without eyes or ears. Who's going to want a pile of junk?

1a031deb8509b9f2.ContentText: I don't believe any other stores will buy it off you. Come on, I'll give you a nice deal.

dc0c05b5948743bf.ContentText: Where have you been, Hook? I was just about to go looking for you. Come on, let's go home, I'll cook some salt-baked rock crabs for you.

7d41139bb88ef122.ContentText: Vein detector? The one I lost?

2b7b8f974963af29.ContentText: {NICKNAME} and Hook helped daddy catch the thief that stole it!
2b7b8f974963af29.Speaker: Hook

80a542080197a682.ContentText: But... daddy's detector... is broken. It's all my fault... If only I could've found it sooner...
80a542080197a682.Speaker: Hook

2b468594b0ce736b.ContentText: So it was stolen... You're not hurt are you, Hook?

d9ed33fe85d7d34b.ContentText: I'm fine! Daddy, can you see if your detector still works?
d9ed33fe85d7d34b.Speaker: Hook

7e69f7ad630f2ef4.ContentText: Hmm... the Geomarrow Probe is damaged. I'm afraid this thing won't work anymore.

2027a639f52a4a18.ContentText: I'm sorry, daddy. I didn't help one bit...
2027a639f52a4a18.Speaker: Hook

d7b231a3e74fd545.ContentText: What are you apologizing for? Thank you so much for looking out for me, Hook.

e1c1f400d58d4afe.ContentText: Don't cry, Hook! Daddy's true treasure has been here all along. It was never lost or broken.

8ab2b41f6990a39f.ContentText: Huh, you know what it is too?
8ab2b41f6990a39f.Speaker: Hook

3ad415f759a03887.ContentText: The detector helped me find lots of Geomarrow veins, and it saved the mining team a lot of money. In that respect, it was a very good thing.

ab1395b2c2965015.ContentText: But at the end of the day, the detector is just a tool. A true treasure must have irreplaceable importance to someone.

25ba5bbb02e5b084.ContentText: Hahaha, that's okay. I'm saying some things that might seem strange, but you will understand some day.

ac92d3e2435d49db.ContentText: So, the treasure daddy is talking about...
ac92d3e2435d49db.Speaker: Hook

fb4129a389307f7b.ContentText: Is still happily running and jumping around.

fd93570f21c31999.ContentText: {NICKNAME}, you're not allowed to see Hook cry! Go away!
fd93570f21c31999.Speaker: Hook

4e03c9c57fc6a13a.ContentText: If there's something you've got to do, do it now. Better than regretting it further down the line.
4e03c9c57fc6a13a.Speaker: Himeko

c8db65f872a6faa1.ContentText: You want to disembark, Dan Heng? Changed your mind?

6ea057f04413c1fe.ContentText: Well then, Pom-Pom wishes you the best of luck.

c7b279e6c826af87.ContentText: Mm... Pom-Pom understands. Not everything needs to be put into words.

d8f485d5b84b0f6d.ContentText: Make sure you return before the Express departs...

ab01e7cec557cfea.ContentText: ...and bring Pom-Pom back some local specialties?

f45396b3a5802d07.ContentText: Little miss fox moves at quite the pace — I can't keep up with her. *sigh* I've spent too long on the bench... Let's catch our breath for a while — we can expect a packed schedule ahead.
f45396b3a5802d07.Speaker: Welt

4b1428cc5ad38aa0.ContentText: That might be a little harsh, but she does put her own interests first.
4b1428cc5ad38aa0.Speaker: Welt

f57c82c550007821.ContentText: She did the right thing by not trusting us initially — we were an unknown quantity to her. As for the rush... my guess is she's just eager to get us out of her hair and further up the chain.
f57c82c550007821.Speaker: Welt

d7a3049ba2b14d6a.ContentText: It'll be alright, we're not trying to stand in her way. We have nothing to hide from her.
d7a3049ba2b14d6a.Speaker: Welt

475fde9314174f1e.ContentText: We didn't have anything to hide in Belobog, either...
475fde9314174f1e.Speaker: March 7th

9a1788ab76eb415c.ContentText: I need to give you two a heads up first. Our meeting with Madam Yukong won't be without risk. We need to be prepared and take it seriously.
9a1788ab76eb415c.Speaker: Welt

a19aec9b42aa88c1.ContentText: She is a top Xianzhou leader... Mr. Yang, do you think this could be Belobog all over again...?
a19aec9b42aa88c1.Speaker: March 7th

0595a2a295a48ced.ContentText: No, the Xianzhou Alliance is better than that. But Madam Yukong will definitely have a string of difficult questions for us...
0595a2a295a48ced.Speaker: Welt

e7bc2478e8556156.ContentText: Why did we choose to come to the Xianzhou now? How did we know that the incident is related to a Stellaron? Who leaked their information to us...?
e7bc2478e8556156.Speaker: Welt

958b8671e067383f.ContentText: Careless answers mean distrust and potential hostility, which would make things much harder for us.
958b8671e067383f.Speaker: Welt

0519144e3d49dcdc.ContentText: Aw, crud. One of us is gonna blurt something out or get something wrong, I just know it...
0519144e3d49dcdc.Speaker: March 7th

805b6e719278340a.ContentText: Good idea! We can be his cheerleaders in the background.
805b6e719278340a.Speaker: March 7th

06718c7afc4df20d.ContentText: Ugh... But we haven't done anything wrong!
06718c7afc4df20d.Speaker: March 7th

96256cbb8ac1196c.ContentText: March is right. If we're too scripted, it'll sound like we're hiding something.
96256cbb8ac1196c.Speaker: Welt

9af37283dd94a77c.ContentText: What if she thinks we're with the Stellaron Hunters? Never mind the Alliance, even I don't trust them...
9af37283dd94a77c.Speaker: March 7th

fce63c16a889ed23.ContentText: {NICKNAME} is right. If we're too scripted, it'll sound like we're hiding something.
fce63c16a889ed23.Speaker: Welt

a79e68aa7b149f3a.ContentText: Don't worry. We'll find a way through. Let me do the talking.
a79e68aa7b149f3a.Speaker: Welt

5eb7f3a7066a988f.ContentText: Oh, you're here already? Sorry to keep you waiting. Madam Yukong is expecting you.
5eb7f3a7066a988f.Speaker: Tingyun

dcfa91af49ca6da6.ContentText: I've brought Madam Helm Master up to speed. It's over to you now~
dcfa91af49ca6da6.Speaker: Tingyun

bb516b273b7e5766.ContentText: The Astral Express! I must confess that the train's reputation precedes it, such that it is often close to my thoughts. How delightful to come face to face with its passengers!
bb516b273b7e5766.Speaker: Jing Yuan

ffd4c09a8602d484.ContentText: It's an honor to meet you, general. May I ask what the favor you spoke of is?
ffd4c09a8602d484.Speaker: Welt

dc912950ebb1187d.ContentText: Ah, a matter that requires capable people such as yourselves. We captured a member of the Stellaron Hunters a few days ago, who goes by the name of "Blade."
dc912950ebb1187d.Speaker: Jing Yuan

6dad0f59ca14a3ac.ContentText: During our investigation, the Divination Commission — the department in charge of intelligence processing — intercepted a transmission sent out by his accomplice, Kafka, who has managed to hide aboard the ship. As for where that transmission was destined...
6dad0f59ca14a3ac.Speaker: Jing Yuan

bf43c71727a8eb96.ContentText: I have some knowledge of your relationship with the Stellaron Hunters. The Divination Commission is convinced that you made an alliance with them... I say that's impossible. The crew of the Astral Express are honorable people whose valiant deeds are lauded across the universe. There must have been a misunderstanding.
bf43c71727a8eb96.Speaker: Jing Yuan

6d1329101fbac37f.ContentText: As such, I came to the conclusion that the communication must have been an attempt by the Stellaron Hunters to sow dissent between us.
6d1329101fbac37f.Speaker: Jing Yuan

adca9b2837551478.ContentText: We can handle the Stellaron, but it will take time and will require the bulk of the Cloud Knights on the ship. It is this Kafka that concerns me. The longer she stays on the ship, the bigger the threat she will pose.
adca9b2837551478.Speaker: Jing Yuan

2f87f51ff3f531f9.ContentText: Since the Stellaron Hunters lured you to our ship, we shall move with the current. You are hereby authorized to do as you deem fit on the Luofu, with the goal of bringing Kafka out of the shadows and under our control.
2f87f51ff3f531f9.Speaker: Jing Yuan

11ae36f646a599e2.ContentText: Doing so would clear the misunderstanding between us, reveal the true intentions of the Stellaron Hunters, and help us understand their connection to the Stellaron burst. What say you, my Astral guests?
11ae36f646a599e2.Speaker: Jing Yuan

bc4da8ef3c01f22b.ContentText: If you are able to capture this Stellaron Hunter, the Xianzhou will be indebted to you.
bc4da8ef3c01f22b.Speaker: Jing Yuan

12d81b07f12789b4.ContentText: I'm afraid my hands are tied on the matter — this is a diplomatic affair and I have rules to follow. But if you can bring me the Stellaron Hunter and discover her motive for placing a Stellaron on the ship, it would be of great help in resolving the incident.
12d81b07f12789b4.Speaker: Jing Yuan

6c2054fe75683005.ContentText: Of course you do. You can be strangers and simply walk away. But I feel you wish to help the Xianzhou.
6c2054fe75683005.Speaker: Jing Yuan

7630175b63a5a5be.ContentText: The Luofu never fails to reward that which is given.
7630175b63a5a5be.Speaker: Jing Yuan

cbdb3951e4d3b847.ContentText: Wonderful, it's a deal then. I shall notify Yukong that all intel is to be shared with you, and that our best personnel are to aid you in your search.
cbdb3951e4d3b847.Speaker: Jing Yuan

6fd75daed9955767.ContentText: If there's anything the Sky-Faring Commission or the Cloud Knights can do for you during your stay, don't hesitate to make it known.
6fd75daed9955767.Speaker: Jing Yuan

0a05b4cb52163f46.ContentText: I have heard of you, {NICKNAME}... The Alliance is very interested in the Astral Express.
0a05b4cb52163f46.Speaker: Jing Yuan

1fa9c9be12fb2801.ContentText: Blade is wanted by both the IPC and the Alliance. I'm afraid I cannot comment on his file.
1fa9c9be12fb2801.Speaker: Jing Yuan

c697efc78ee8b400.ContentText: There are five known members of the Stellaron Hunters. Elio is their leader, but always stays behind the scenes. Most of the operations are led by Kafka.
c697efc78ee8b400.Speaker: Jing Yuan

7ff07d8c1f396b53.ContentText: Had the Divination Commission not intercepted her encrypted transmission, she would have remained undetected for much longer.
7ff07d8c1f396b53.Speaker: Jing Yuan

8480699dcc9e924d.ContentText: Hmm, ordinary means may prove futile when it comes to this individual. But the Divination Commission has ways of...
8480699dcc9e924d.Speaker: Jing Yuan

159c4fa6ab021dbc.ContentText: ...Haha, don't misunderstand me. The Xianzhou does not engage in torture. Retrieving intel does not necessarily involve the use of violence.
159c4fa6ab021dbc.Speaker: Jing Yuan

bc51cd6aa07d0c1f.ContentText: In any case, you can deliver her directly to us. Once we learn something, I will share every piece of information with you.
bc51cd6aa07d0c1f.Speaker: Jing Yuan

633feb741c6a8ab6.ContentText: If things go as planned, I would love to find the time to sit with all of you and hear about your experiences among the stars. My responsibilities to the Xianzhou have meant that I haven't had the chance to travel in many years.
633feb741c6a8ab6.Speaker: Jing Yuan

f08c4fe3ce8014b0.ContentText: We had heard nothing of the Express for a long time. It is heartening to learn of its continued journey along that starward track.
f08c4fe3ce8014b0.Speaker: Jing Yuan

75afa9db8e035b31.ContentText: I have other matters to attend to. Goodbye for now.
75afa9db8e035b31.Speaker: Jing Yuan

f849cab9a11fc6cd.ContentText: Hmm, I think we only scratched the surface of this General Jing Yuan...
f849cab9a11fc6cd.Speaker: Welt

8965b0c27f83523c.ContentText: I don't know about "strange," but my gut tells me something is off.
8965b0c27f83523c.Speaker: Welt

93732ad9e77c5c81.ContentText: He says he doesn't want outsiders getting involved in the Xianzhou's internal affairs, which is understandable.
93732ad9e77c5c81.Speaker: Welt

7f55ae659145704b.ContentText: Yes! There's something about this point...
7f55ae659145704b.Speaker: Welt

260dbc6f0d054382.ContentText: He wants us to trust him. He took advantage of Yukong's frosty reception to play the good guy.
260dbc6f0d054382.Speaker: Welt

30170a0b108326ab.ContentText: Theoretically, yes. But something feels off.
30170a0b108326ab.Speaker: Welt

dfe9b61a49e96485.ContentText: Ah, that's it! A minor detail, but curious. He avoided talking about Blade!
dfe9b61a49e96485.Speaker: Welt

330d2832fc2a2016.ContentText: Since the Cloud Knights have already captured a Stellaron Hunter, why not use him to get to Kafka? Why rely on us?
330d2832fc2a2016.Speaker: Welt

e0dc8a2bf43bf7ff.ContentText: The Xianzhou is reluctant to involve outsiders in the Stellaron disaster, so why is it so keen on letting us capture a Stellaron Hunter?
e0dc8a2bf43bf7ff.Speaker: Welt

2193fc440bd648f8.ContentText: Yes. The only sensible conclusion I can draw is that Blade had already escaped when Jing Yuan spoke to us — provided they even captured him in the first place.
2193fc440bd648f8.Speaker: Welt

a351563bc8766679.ContentText: Therefore, given our connection to Kafka, we represent the only way of luring the Stellaron Hunters in.
a351563bc8766679.Speaker: Welt

22f40855b6860c2a.ContentText: That's why he asked for our help... He didn't want to let anyone else find out that Blade had already escaped!
22f40855b6860c2a.Speaker: Welt

a7e13a4d75db7f33.ContentText: Now that we've figured that out, perhaps we can get closer to the core of what's happening here.
a7e13a4d75db7f33.Speaker: Welt

161766e8873da7a1.ContentText: This Jing Yuan... how much does he know, and how much is he hiding from us?
161766e8873da7a1.Speaker: Welt

c265effc2ab10b0f.ContentText: We've got a Xianzhou general on our side! This time we have to... wait, does this seem familiar to you? Let's hope he doesn't offer us a hotel!
c265effc2ab10b0f.Speaker: March 7th

4a395ea722cbad2f.ContentText: Seeing as the general gave the order, the Sky-Faring Commission will lend you our full support. The Stellaron Hunter investigation is in your hands now. I'll issue you a pass so you can access the facilities around Starskiff Haven.

c2e5c27d791ca89f.ContentText: As for personnel... the skyports are currently all under maintenance, so we're thinly stretched. What I can do is send Tingyun as your guide — she'll take care of you during your stay.

d7fdc35257c259f9.ContentText: What do you make of this Jing Yuan?
d7fdc35257c259f9.Speaker: March 7th

3c19a1f2c0ad6c04.ContentText: I'm not asking about that! Although, you're not wrong...
3c19a1f2c0ad6c04.Speaker: March 7th

11a06fdb46f83afb.ContentText: He's much easier to talk to than that Yukong — their attitudes are so different! Maybe that's why she's only a helm master and he's a general...
11a06fdb46f83afb.Speaker: March 7th

8facfde38a2a64b2.ContentText: I feel the same. He's much easier to talk to than that Yukong — their attitudes are so different! Maybe that's why she's only a helm master and he's a general...
8facfde38a2a64b2.Speaker: March 7th

a16bd0ef8c88150d.ContentText: {F#You think everyone's suspicious... though they do say some girls have a sixth sense.}{M#Come on, you think everyone's suspicious...}
a16bd0ef8c88150d.Speaker: March 7th

5dc4df955c179915.ContentText: *sigh* Madam Yukong has asked me to look after you.
5dc4df955c179915.Speaker: Tingyun

d86ba59d9c66f984.ContentText: Seems like we were destined to be in each other's company...
d86ba59d9c66f984.Speaker: Tingyun

adf2738622b1c87b.ContentText: The Sky-Faring Commission has reserved rooms for you at the Petrichor Inn. When you finish your business here, how about some tea together?
adf2738622b1c87b.Speaker: Tingyun

2bff018e65e3f232.ContentText: Not at all, though I'd appreciate it if you mention to Madam Yukong that you got a warm reception from me when you next see her. *sigh* Better to be busy than idle, I suppose.
2bff018e65e3f232.Speaker: Tingyun

c20feffa78e8b4b1.ContentText: No, no, though I'd appreciate it if you mention to Madam Yukong that you got a warm reception from me when you next see her. *sigh* Better to be busy than idle, I suppose.
c20feffa78e8b4b1.Speaker: Tingyun

6baf0cef9210ba20.ContentText: Easy, I know this probably brings back bad memories.
6baf0cef9210ba20.Speaker: Welt

bbdc58e058aa6efe.ContentText: Let's take advantage of the rest. It won't be easy to track down Kafka the Stellaron Hunter.
bbdc58e058aa6efe.Speaker: Welt

12d76265fd625089.ContentText: Oh, let's let the Express know how we're doing~
12d76265fd625089.Speaker: March 7th

f8213a389355067e.ContentText: More importantly, let's see how Dan Heng's doing! Hee-hee, ask him what he's up to — then tell him we're having loads of fun!
f8213a389355067e.Speaker: March 7th

70cc6587d4811628.ContentText: How perceptive. Our wind, clouds, rain, and fog are all artificial. The Realm-Keeping Commission's weather pavilion manages the environmental conditions here.
70cc6587d4811628.Speaker: Tingyun

cb07a3900314a163.ContentText: If Kafka was holding an umbrella, that means she was in an area with artificial rainfall during the transmission.
cb07a3900314a163.Speaker: Tingyun

1d6ef1970b31841a.ContentText: Still, that doesn't help us much. The ship is huge, with changing conditions across various delves. I'm sure there were showers across many of them at the time.
1d6ef1970b31841a.Speaker: Tingyun

81e135d44a194e1e.ContentText: Impossible to say. It used to be that the Divination Commission could track the access history of all the delves...
81e135d44a194e1e.Speaker: Tingyun

2fafd7cd4229df27.ContentText: But with the arrival of the Stellaron, things have become messy. Some delves even had their entrance marked as the exit.
2fafd7cd4229df27.Speaker: Tingyun

830a69e5f49a13c0.ContentText: If I were one of the Stellaron Hunters, I'd be very happy to capitalize on all the chaos. It'd be harder to escape, but easier to blend in.
830a69e5f49a13c0.Speaker: Tingyun

3e42f047d02c6cdf.ContentText: Is that the Jade Gate? It's huge!
3e42f047d02c6cdf.Speaker: March 7th

e8980e514efec776.ContentText: Whoa... I felt like I suddenly lost weight when we passed through.
e8980e514efec776.Speaker: March 7th

c8de26d42b476031.ContentText: There was a gravitational shift. The same thing happens when we warp jump, only we feel heavier.
c8de26d42b476031.Speaker: Welt

0cfbcf3e3603efb5.ContentText: Y'know, you're talking my language. B—But I liked your explanation too, Mr. Yang, hehe...
0cfbcf3e3603efb5.Speaker: March 7th

74ba7eaf569245ce.ContentText: Ugh, can't you two humor me once in a while? I thought all that working out was finally paying off...
74ba7eaf569245ce.Speaker: March 7th

4290d8cac1420e0e.ContentText: The Xianzhou possesses extremely advanced technology. If I'm not mistaken, we've been in an artificial ecosphere since we arrived at the skyport.
4290d8cac1420e0e.Speaker: Welt

f677e0a7133270d7.ContentText: There's a huge star in the sky and you're only interested in the clouds?
f677e0a7133270d7.Speaker: March 7th

c4e812a01d2c742c.ContentText: Strange. I don't remember seeing a big planet near the Xianzhou when we were on the Express.
c4e812a01d2c742c.Speaker: March 7th

df39dc774ec5a504.ContentText: You're right. Something with a mass as huge as a Xianzhou ship should keep clear of any planets on its course... otherwise, it risks being caught up in the gravitational pull.
df39dc774ec5a504.Speaker: Welt

b6c050dec1fe48ec.ContentText: The sky here is an artificial boundary. I imagine it was created to shield residents from the pitch dark of outer space, and the negative emotions that it can generate... fascinating.
b6c050dec1fe48ec.Speaker: Welt

223e6ad5e0b793bd.ContentText: I heard that residents of the Xianzhou have extremely long life spans, which would require them to make great efforts to preserve their mental health... meaning...
223e6ad5e0b793bd.Speaker: Welt

33cc2c973ec8e8fd.ContentText: When you travel with Mr. Yang, he'll give you a thesis on everything he sees — if you have the patience to let him go on and on.
33cc2c973ec8e8fd.Speaker: March 7th

c8394ccdb251ceba.ContentText: Right, okay, let's get back to work.
c8394ccdb251ceba.Speaker: Welt

e225ea46fb46886f.ContentText: The silver lining is that based on what we can see, no civilians were caught up in the battle...
e225ea46fb46886f.Speaker: Welt

6068884f3ea65c86.ContentText: I'm guessing the Xianzhou must have evacuated the port immediately, leaving the soldiers to deal with the crisis. But as for these corroded monsters...
6068884f3ea65c86.Speaker: Welt

0f804a633dc1111f.ContentText: It must be the Stellaron — the corrosion has already started to spread... It doesn't look serious yet, but this is a bad sign.
0f804a633dc1111f.Speaker: Welt

b5453c5b0f2dd854.ContentText: The Stellaron-affected worlds we've come into contact with so far were all subjected to prolonged corrosion. In contrast, much like here, the space station had only just begun to be affected when we arrived. It's still the case that not much is known about early-stage corrosion...
b5453c5b0f2dd854.Speaker: Welt

cf12722ba9301cca.ContentText: Whoa, so we're like doctors diagnosing a patient right now!
cf12722ba9301cca.Speaker: March 7th

5b5d65da96a2c580.ContentText: {NICKNAME}, you, me, and Mr. Yang can make up our own team: The Stellaron Medics!
5b5d65da96a2c580.Speaker: March 7th

0572d84bd5c81402.ContentText: You're hurt, son. Try not to talk.
0572d84bd5c81402.Speaker: Welt

5ebaca425a0840cb.ContentText: March, use your six-phased ice to stop the bleeding. Go easy, we don't wanna add frostbite to his list of complaints.
5ebaca425a0840cb.Speaker: Welt

cbefc54313f3a01c.ContentText: {NICKNAME}, March, this area saw fierce fighting only recently.
cbefc54313f3a01c.Speaker: Welt

72d846b6b03f2d01.ContentText: Let's keep searching, there might be other survivors.
72d846b6b03f2d01.Speaker: Welt

3e1d0f83cf2d690f.ContentText: Hey, you there! We need your help~!
3e1d0f83cf2d690f.Speaker: Tingyun

7ed5419be6c900c8.ContentText: Thanks for saving beauty from the beast~
7ed5419be6c900c8.Speaker: Tingyun

d187a030719a5509.ContentText: Pleasure! But are you thanking us or giving yourself a compliment?
d187a030719a5509.Speaker: March 7th

5a324d2274ea4ca8.ContentText: A conflict with the Cloud Knights? Hm... Not likely, Mr. Yang wouldn't let that happen...
5a324d2274ea4ca8.Speaker: Dan Heng

b3446718f8fd2de9.ContentText: A Cloud Knight stricken with mara...
b3446718f8fd2de9.Speaker: Dan Heng

433e268f8f94f8b5.ContentText: How could the mutations get this bad... is the Stellaron exerting an effect?
433e268f8f94f8b5.Speaker: Dan Heng

68f87fc57b4733f2.ContentText: It's okay! Phew, this one's strong alright!
68f87fc57b4733f2.Speaker: Sushang

a6206b06f4a89f8f.ContentText: Could I really "stay where I am" with you two risking your lives to save me?
a6206b06f4a89f8f.Speaker: Luocha

5fe3f6540488f825.ContentText: Careful, we've never seen this kind of life form before...
5fe3f6540488f825.Speaker: Welt

02d3e9ee1e614f4c.ContentText: They're {RUBY_B#Long-Life Curse}mara-struck{RUBY_E#} — we've already lost them...

b3fc1c400823b4e4.ContentText: You work for the Sky-Faring Commission, so I assume you're aware of its destructive power.
b3fc1c400823b4e4.Speaker: Welt

c440322c631472c0.ContentText: Yes, I am. As an Amicassador, I've been to many planets, and seen my fair share of Stellaron corrosion... *sigh*
c440322c631472c0.Speaker: Tingyun

6536ce17917a57d6.ContentText: Y'know, you sound sweet enough, but you were talking about getting us escorted away by your Cloud Knights. If it weren't for Mr. Yang...
6536ce17917a57d6.Speaker: March 7th

1d520c22e726e6c1.ContentText: You misunderstand. If you were in my shoes right now, wouldn't you want to keep your guard up~?
1d520c22e726e6c1.Speaker: Tingyun

0eac5bfedc54c045.ContentText: True... But we came here to trailblaze, not jailblaze.
0eac5bfedc54c045.Speaker: March 7th

c316fe1ab893ad1e.ContentText: Those were not to be confused with monsters, benefactors. We call them {RUBY_B#Long-Life Curse}mara-struck{RUBY_E#}.
c316fe1ab893ad1e.Speaker: Tingyun

13ee189377bea7ee.ContentText: Get ready, and watch your backs.
13ee189377bea7ee.Speaker: Welt

2814975b5bcd7b91.ContentText: Virtually nothing has changed since I left...
2814975b5bcd7b91.Speaker: Dan Heng

f685c95465c932ee.ContentText: ...apart from darkness, this place is all that I remember of the Luofu.
f685c95465c932ee.Speaker: Dan Heng

f55bdd42bb4734cc.ContentText: The network is down, but some functions still work?
f55bdd42bb4734cc.Speaker: Dan Heng

70e5a013b0a43e27.ContentText: Don't worry, Miss. I have a favor to ask, that's all.
70e5a013b0a43e27.Speaker: Tingyun

6240afefa5d35e6b.ContentText: Favor...? Count me out. What if we do it wrong and you get your cloud cronies to throw us in jail.
6240afefa5d35e6b.Speaker: March 7th

16aa920b8211057c.ContentText: *sigh* I shouldn't have doubted you, please accept my apologies. Our road ahead is barricaded, do you see?
16aa920b8211057c.Speaker: Tingyun

8228ac02a0ca500d.ContentText: The soldiers stationed here must have moved these into a roadblock.
8228ac02a0ca500d.Speaker: Tingyun

fc128df936f4920a.ContentText: I'd like to see us try, haha... they're extremely heavy. Even with all of us, we wouldn't be able to move one.
fc128df936f4920a.Speaker: Tingyun

80febff0f6485213.ContentText: Not that I'm doubting your skill, but I'd feel terrible if you hurt yourself in the process.
80febff0f6485213.Speaker: Tingyun

b43b3df6ad93dc22.ContentText: What? Does he look like a crane to you?
b43b3df6ad93dc22.Speaker: March 7th

438b3ff76e29b4b7.ContentText: If I'm not mistaken, the containers in the Trove of Verdure can be moved around using a control panel.
438b3ff76e29b4b7.Speaker: Tingyun

c1cdddffb18989ae.ContentText: You've already put on quite the show — do you think you'll be able to find and operate the control panel? Should be simple, right?
c1cdddffb18989ae.Speaker: Tingyun

eff7ac06a4ac5d51.ContentText: I knew it. This will be a breeze for you.
eff7ac06a4ac5d51.Speaker: Tingyun

6e3a520ee80c3fd0.ContentText: Oh, I'm afraid I'm not built for hard labor...
6e3a520ee80c3fd0.Speaker: Tingyun

72f72c63f9256ea1.ContentText: She sure knows how to boss people around.
72f72c63f9256ea1.Speaker: March 7th

7fb69fd5ef3fe1a3.ContentText: We just need to pass through here, take the barge to Starskiff Haven, and we'll be safe.
7fb69fd5ef3fe1a3.Speaker: Tingyun

d21deddcf75cc55a.ContentText: Strange, the gate here is supposed to be open.
d21deddcf75cc55a.Speaker: Tingyun

2c220be525c0d75d.ContentText: Huh? Now's not the time to turn back or take a detour.
2c220be525c0d75d.Speaker: Tingyun

bd3df1ee0424628c.ContentText: Seems like someone wants to make things difficult for us. Let me see if I can pry it open...
bd3df1ee0424628c.Speaker: Tingyun

7e2d0b30889c0422.ContentText: Let {NICKNAME} do it. A bat's not as good as a crowbar, but it's definitely better than your fingers.
7e2d0b30889c0422.Speaker: March 7th

03ff804e4ac383a3.ContentText: What, you'd rather leave it to our fox lady here? She'll probably break a nail, and then we'll never hear the end of it...
03ff804e4ac383a3.Speaker: March 7th

b06aec5d8144795d.ContentText: Moving containers, picking locks... Seems like we're doing all the heavy-lifting just so Miss Tingyun can enjoy the scenery.
b06aec5d8144795d.Speaker: March 7th

9005afb335116a2f.ContentText: Hehe, am I really such a nuisance~?
9005afb335116a2f.Speaker: Tingyun

0ae24dbb758e1646.ContentText: *sigh* Finally. Look how many tail hairs I lost on the way. Tsk, my beautiful tail...
0ae24dbb758e1646.Speaker: Tingyun

d0d4cdc1f052a1ea.ContentText: We had a difficult start, but things got easier. Look, that's the barge I was talking about.
d0d4cdc1f052a1ea.Speaker: Tingyun

525bffb9acc4ebf3.ContentText: Don't fret. All Amicassadors know their way around a starskiff.
525bffb9acc4ebf3.Speaker: Tingyun

c7d4206fc9ad56b7.ContentText: I was perfectly calm until she volunteered to help...
c7d4206fc9ad56b7.Speaker: March 7th

934951d1c48c95dc.ContentText: Don't fret. All Amicassadors know their way around a starskiff.
934951d1c48c95dc.Speaker: Tingyun

f2833287438fe1d0.ContentText: I was perfectly calm until she volunteered to help...
f2833287438fe1d0.Speaker: March 7th

fec76bc8e345e16d.ContentText: Uh-uh. Just sit back, and relax. All Amicassadors know their way around a starskiff.
fec76bc8e345e16d.Speaker: Tingyun

74408c7f002fff51.ContentText: I was perfectly calm until she volunteered to help...
74408c7f002fff51.Speaker: March 7th

94733de36f0e93fe.ContentText: Please take your seats, everyone. We'll be off right away.
94733de36f0e93fe.Speaker: Tingyun

6722d87a61fd7c33.ContentText: Seele, can you tell everyone in the Underworld that the Stellaron has been sealed? Tell them the blockade will soon be over... and they'll breathe freely again soon.
6722d87a61fd7c33.Speaker: Bronya

db48382cd446e3e5.ContentText: Of course, leave it to me — Nat's probably getting anxious about the delay.
db48382cd446e3e5.Speaker: Seele

e235a682a2a8092a.ContentText: While you do that, I'll head back to the Administrative District. I need to tell Gepard... Serv— ah...
e235a682a2a8092a.Speaker: Bronya

1ff685f383ff5ba2.ContentText: What's wrong, Bronya? Do you feel sick?
1ff685f383ff5ba2.Speaker: March 7th

733dba6cf445b1e4.ContentText: I'm... fine. I need to... hurry...
733dba6cf445b1e4.Speaker: Bronya

90befaf61e935789.ContentText: She's exhausted! Quick, we need to think of something... {NICKNAME}, help me out here!
90befaf61e935789.Speaker: March 7th

9fa16a498d4e1b5a.ContentText: Right... I almost forgot, you're still wanted by the guards... I might be an Underworlder, but at least I don't stand out as much as you guys.
9fa16a498d4e1b5a.Speaker: Seele

f9a58851bbb22d5d.ContentText: That's settled then. I'll leave Nat to you. Remember to keep the secret — for Bron— No, for Belobog's sake.
f9a58851bbb22d5d.Speaker: Seele

8ac16e5a9a15b88c.ContentText: Are you alright? Are you hurt anywhere? Do you feel dizzy? Tired? Or...
8ac16e5a9a15b88c.Speaker: Seele

f530f464b1132875.ContentText: ...I don't know, Seele. I feel... cold... all over.
f530f464b1132875.Speaker: Bronya

110ebc64041b0ab7.ContentText: Isn't that normal? This place is freezing... *sneeze* Ugh...
110ebc64041b0ab7.Speaker: Seele

6ead965b46e02b12.ContentText: Let's get out of here before you catch a cold too.
6ead965b46e02b12.Speaker: Bronya

8f515a6c477adfae.ContentText: Don't worry, I'm a tough cookie. Here, hold on to me... let's go.
8f515a6c477adfae.Speaker: Seele

4bd19c98005e0390.ContentText: So, {NICKNAME}, wanna tell us what happened back there? Don't think you can just reappear on the battlefield with a cool weapon in your hands and skip the story.
4bd19c98005e0390.Speaker: March 7th

dd89884f2510a307.ContentText: Uh... you drew the Amber Lord's gaze? Right at that moment? That's too much of a coincidence...
dd89884f2510a307.Speaker: March 7th

84776658a0fdb57e.ContentText: Um... thank you? That's not answering my question though...
84776658a0fdb57e.Speaker: March 7th

157f8a42f29b78e8.ContentText: Be serious! I really wanna know...
157f8a42f29b78e8.Speaker: March 7th

9a2f01f01823893e.ContentText: {NICKNAME} probably doesn't know what happened either. This wouldn't be the first time... Something similar happened when we faced the Doomsday Beast on the space station. Remember that glance from Nanook?
9a2f01f01823893e.Speaker: Dan Heng

623df5399c30acad.ContentText: Originally, we thought it was because the Stellaron was linked to the Destruction, but now it seems to be more than that. We might need to speak with Mr. Yang to understand what's going on.
623df5399c30acad.Speaker: Dan Heng

f359db427a94381c.ContentText: Let's focus on the business at hand first. We shouldn't disrupt Himeko and Mr. Yang while they're dealing with the Stellaron. Let's talk once we're back on the Express.
f359db427a94381c.Speaker: Dan Heng

6b2aa43973c97d29.ContentText: Mm, you're right, we need to finish what we started... Let's hurry up and find Natasha.
6b2aa43973c97d29.Speaker: March 7th

fae67630a77d37c6.ContentText: Look! There's a big crowd around the clinic.
fae67630a77d37c6.Speaker: March 7th

8009d82867008baf.ContentText: Do you think they felt the effects of the battle just now...? Let's go ask around.
8009d82867008baf.Speaker: March 7th

ec16b66e68e3b38a.ContentText: ...Do you think the Great Mine was affected by our fighting on the surface?
ec16b66e68e3b38a.Speaker: March 7th

858aeb3e76b246a8.ContentText: Let's hope we didn't cause a collapse.
858aeb3e76b246a8.Speaker: Dan Heng

0d56349819160841.ContentText: Look, it's Antonia! The miners and vagrants are all in the same spot.
0d56349819160841.Speaker: March 7th

b4445aa195039440.ContentText: I sure hope they're not arguing again... Quick, let's head over!
b4445aa195039440.Speaker: March 7th

48743f7ca4ec6983.ContentText: ...Here, take it. I'm afraid we're short on goods and materials right now.

29879ee29f56172a.ContentText: Oh, well we actually have enough for the moment. You hang onto it...

60e9c888e2935fa7.ContentText: Hey! Are you guys causing trouble again?
60e9c888e2935fa7.Speaker: March 7th

de20119730b51cec.ContentText: It's you! Oh, no, no, you misunderstand...

499e2b8e4f6e67bd.ContentText: There was a huge quake at the mine just now — part of it collapsed. If the vagrants here hadn't stopped to help, I doubt we'd have gotten everyone out in one piece.

8a8b7da66736118e.ContentText: I was just discussing how to repay them. It's a shame the mining team is hard up right now.

0c48df9e23d63c97.ContentText: Oh? To do with us? I'm listening...

b31b268fea82ce9e.ContentText: Uh... can't we get Bronya to cover the bill?
b31b268fea82ce9e.Speaker: March 7th

eb94237de2db93e9.ContentText: Ugh, can we focus? {NICKNAME}, tell them the good news already!
eb94237de2db93e9.Speaker: March 7th

8bb571b811b81d30.ContentText: You mean to say that... we're about to be reunited with the Overworld?

5ae13ce9952e32ad.ContentText: Are you serious!? This has... gotta be a dream. Good things... don't happen to us!

4fc32a3c7804b294.ContentText: Today they do! And you're not dreaming. If you don't believe us, pinch yourself!
4fc32a3c7804b294.Speaker: March 7th

10d8cbafd13b63b1.ContentText: If things go back to the way they were <unbreak>10</unbreak> years ago... then the mining team can finally escape this poverty...

7ac7dd43be36a132.ContentText: ...and you won't have to rely on the charity of others. We'll finally be living with the dignity we deserve.

fcbb4f3b7b04777b.ContentText: Thank you, outsiders, from the bottom of my heart! The mining team'll remember you as heroes... as will the rest of the Underworld.

6ead3b512beed899.ContentText: Please tell Natasha that we're ready to get back to work... If the cable car station can start operating again, we'll dispatch a mining representative to negotiate with the Architects.

d4df3ec4cc40c3c0.ContentText: ...Mr. Yang put it nicely, but the reality is this: We sealed the Stellaron, but that's not gonna solve the problems on this planet...
d4df3ec4cc40c3c0.Speaker: March 7th

2df118bb505337c1.ContentText: There I was getting excited to tell everyone the good news...
2df118bb505337c1.Speaker: March 7th

21de677067912cee.ContentText: That's the cruelty of a Stellaron. Still, compared with some of the other planets we've visited, at least this one has hope.
21de677067912cee.Speaker: Dan Heng

d3b60ab321bffe1e.ContentText: So... should we tell everyone the deal?
d3b60ab321bffe1e.Speaker: March 7th

a701c968271480f7.ContentText: We should tell Bronya when the time's right. Let's not dampen the spirit just yet.
a701c968271480f7.Speaker: Dan Heng

5f602dec86e0b4a3.ContentText: Those kids better not have taken advantage of the chaos to go on an expedition.
5f602dec86e0b4a3.Speaker: Natasha

b1c77bf38efd985a.ContentText: Hook does always talk about wanting to go on a Rivet Town adventure... this could be bad.
b1c77bf38efd985a.Speaker: Natasha

d689c75690a45a05.ContentText: Ready or not, here I come!

623328a3e99df057.ContentText: Found you! You ran all the way out here just to play hide-and-seek? It's too dangerous!
623328a3e99df057.Speaker: March 7th

7d418d600c63b3b4.ContentText: M—Miss March!? D—Didn't you go back to the surface...?

e19fbabdd77fd0f0.ContentText: Since when did I become "Miss" March? And where's Hook and the others? Come on, call them over.
e19fbabdd77fd0f0.Speaker: March 7th

d77c9b683af6ed7f.ContentText: Aww... but we just started playing. Can't we finish this round first...?

635d14b5941fee71.ContentText: Hey, it wasn't like I wanted to play! The kids forced us to...
635d14b5941fee71.Speaker: March 7th

4582568be6cea37a.ContentText: Great idea! Shame we don't have any.
4582568be6cea37a.Speaker: March 7th

bd5c470b4a90b312.ContentText: Well, we better go and find them.
bd5c470b4a90b312.Speaker: Dan Heng

29ad396f42e51596.ContentText: ...A—Actually, I sorta wanna go play on the swings for a while... I'll leave the seeking to you guys!

3897eb8e1807274d.ContentText: Hmph, so he is a scaredy-cat. I knew he'd get someone else to talk to me...

30a35a9cf397f3ac.ContentText: You should be happy it's us and not Natasha! If she'd found you, you'd be in big trouble already.
30a35a9cf397f3ac.Speaker: March 7th

c9b3d196f66ab2bc.ContentText: Mm... I guess so. Anyway, I'm gonna go find Julian.

48c2c89d5fe22958.ContentText: Huh!? Wh—What the heck are you guys doing here? Ugh, wait till I get my hands on Julian, that traitor... Where's his integrity!?
48c2c89d5fe22958.Speaker: Hook

7e47b66a6501a766.ContentText: What about your integrity, huh? You brought the other kids out here to Rivet Town, didn't you?
7e47b66a6501a766.Speaker: March 7th

b34cd682d446cfdf.ContentText: I... I did not! The Moles hold a vote on all our expedition destinations!
b34cd682d446cfdf.Speaker: Hook

5da1f48c53192a76.ContentText: ...Fine, I will. But it better be exciting.
5da1f48c53192a76.Speaker: Hook

071782739df392e5.ContentText: Ah, you snitch! You'll regret it, I'm warning you...
071782739df392e5.Speaker: Hook

0005186221a1d24f.ContentText: Okay, okay, that's enough of that. Let's go and find Julian.
0005186221a1d24f.Speaker: March 7th

9055ac6e586c32a3.ContentText: Hide-and-seek update... Astral Express crew — 2, The Moles — 0!
9055ac6e586c32a3.Speaker: March 7th

5911c87aa5b39614.ContentText: Hmph, celebrate while you can! Hide-and-seek is best of five, y'know...
5911c87aa5b39614.Speaker: Hook

05ed5661f371278b.ContentText: Anyway, enough about hide-and-seek. You came all this way to tell The Moles something, so spit it out.
05ed5661f371278b.Speaker: Hook

fc14a3c0a9cd0b22.ContentText: Hehe... {NICKNAME}, do you wanna do the honors?
fc14a3c0a9cd0b22.Speaker: March 7th

3cc1187d8eed285d.ContentText: Huh? What's wrong? Why aren't you saying anything?
3cc1187d8eed285d.Speaker: March 7th

16a4d2d646c4ebc1.ContentText: ...H—Hey! Wipe your tears, Julian! You're second-in-command — no crying in front of grown-ups!
16a4d2d646c4ebc1.Speaker: Hook

bd92f8dfc2b277c0.ContentText: Hmph, you three listen up. Starting from today, you are The Moles' number one rivals!
bd92f8dfc2b277c0.Speaker: Hook

cddcfe866d50b38c.ContentText: Rivals...? Why the heck are we rivals now? What are you talking about?
cddcfe866d50b38c.Speaker: March 7th

761f3da62ceba85e.ContentText: ...Hook and Julian always wanted to defeat the villains on the surface and take back our homeland.

d3c14bae5e63bd01.ContentText: But it sounds like you grown-ups just stole their thunder, so...

4ed0f4ca147d86fa.ContentText: Hmph! You think we're gonna accept defeat just like that!? One day The Moles will be the heroes of the Underworld and the Overworld! Then everyone will sit... sit...
4ed0f4ca147d86fa.Speaker: Hook

a44626c0957e24c3.ContentText: Ah! Yeah — sit up and take notice! I—I would've figured it out myself. I didn't need you to remind me!
a44626c0957e24c3.Speaker: Hook

d26cea981ab5daae.ContentText: So that's why you were so silent! Hmph, if you wanna be as awesome as us, you better start training every day~
d26cea981ab5daae.Speaker: March 7th

39f1f8db2146d72c.ContentText: Training every day... listening to the old witch... Will that really make us as awesome as you guys? In that case... deal!
39f1f8db2146d72c.Speaker: Hook

a8d612d242e34bfd.ContentText: Julian, Alina, let's run back to the town! Training starts today!
a8d612d242e34bfd.Speaker: Hook

19941991fd4101aa.ContentText: Uh, Alina, I can... uh... give you a piggyback if you can't make it...

0bcb99fbbd61aa5d.ContentText: Oh, is everyone alright? Thanks for your help.
0bcb99fbbd61aa5d.Speaker: Natasha

9ce780049bc5358c.ContentText: Haha. Sometimes face-to-face communication is more meaningful, don't you think?
9ce780049bc5358c.Speaker: Natasha

a1776c16492a5cae.ContentText: Now we just have to wait for the official news. I hope Bronya doesn't keep us too long.
a1776c16492a5cae.Speaker: Natasha

8184acac19d08f27.ContentText: Huh... do you think Svarog and Clara felt the effects of our battle with the guardian?
8184acac19d08f27.Speaker: March 7th

cfa13a1d3c4d3051.ContentText: I think they'll be fine... Plus Svarog's devotion to Clara is even greater than his hostility to Wildfire. If you're worried, you could look for them over at the robot settlement.
cfa13a1d3c4d3051.Speaker: Natasha

0096b89f0dd8ae51.ContentText: Why is everyone in such a hurry? I hope nothing's happened at the hotel...
0096b89f0dd8ae51.Speaker: March 7th

c1ec6b1cf7f639e4.ContentText: We should take a look, maybe we can help.
c1ec6b1cf7f639e4.Speaker: Dan Heng

7ed95ea7513890d0.ContentText: I see Gertie! But who's that lying on the ground?
7ed95ea7513890d0.Speaker: March 7th

490347245dc90c45.ContentText: Oh my, this doesn't look good... Can you hear me? Are you okay?

524fc61f1a32cc2b.ContentText: H—He's still breathing! T—Try not to p—panic Aunt Gertie...

6debca32fdb714d2.ContentText: Is everything okay? Wait, isn't that... Peak? Don't tell me he fell asleep in the middle of the road again.
6debca32fdb714d2.Speaker: March 7th

ee92291c2f082822.ContentText: Oh, it's you three! Back in the Underworld so soon?

9c979b152747aa6b.ContentText: Word must have gotten out that I was renovating the hotel today. Being the kind-hearted young man that he is, Peak came straight over and offered to help.

8aae8d4e1fb7a2b8.ContentText: There we were hard at work, when all of a sudden the hotel started shaking... I got everyone outside as fast as I could, but I think Peak was hit by a ceiling tile...

27499ea3eb3d567c.ContentText: Look! Seems like he's coming around.
27499ea3eb3d567c.Speaker: March 7th

43dfa514b4c3b075.ContentText: I... don't think that's necessary. Look, he's awake.
43dfa514b4c3b075.Speaker: Dan Heng

0fd1e745df3ae939.ContentText: Peak, are you awake? Oh, thank goodness you're alright! Easy now, take your time...

84131e659ac64b9b.ContentText: Argh, my back... I was having such a great nap, how did I...

a8da3837cf5863b4.ContentText: A—Are you okay, bro? L—Let me take you to N—Natasha's clinic...

92c7b89b09f6a10d.ContentText: Hey, look where he was lying. What is that?
92c7b89b09f6a10d.Speaker: March 7th

4d5d1b360b007abf.ContentText: ...an old photo. I thought I lost this ages ago. How did it get...

0cb19a91a020e30a.ContentText: Aunt Gertie, isn't that you in the photo? And Old Goethe, too! You look so young!
0cb19a91a020e30a.Speaker: March 7th

51e91d6fa18483dc.ContentText: Don't I know it. My distant cousin had only just taken over the family business at the time. He wrote me a letter inviting me to head up and take a look. It's been nearly <unbreak>20</unbreak> years already...

bd673766c03dcf6d.ContentText: *sigh* I remember chatting in the hotel lobby and drinking tea. I wonder if we'll ever get another chance to do that...

2deb2b27548daf93.ContentText: ...Y'know, we've got some good news for you, haven't we, {NICKNAME}?
2deb2b27548daf93.Speaker: March 7th

6c923f23ffa9b67b.ContentText: ...Is that true? Bronya, she... I—I can't believe my ears!

ea9ecd2c42dbe032.ContentText: I... Hahaha! I don't know what to say! Turns out things aren't always lost forever. *sigh* It feels like better days are finally on the horizon!

1c64ab33390f8715.ContentText: Thank you all so much for coming to tell me the good news. I haven't felt like this in a long time... We'll get plenty of guests staying at the hotel again once the passageway is open!

970b713b795ee784.ContentText: But there's no way I'm letting them set eyes on the old place looking like this... Oh, and we're gonna need to expand the menu. Oh dear. Action stations!

021fac6dddf87652.ContentText: Action... stations? Already? Ooh, um — ow, oww...! My head...

1d57bf44e362868f.ContentText: Please let Dr. Natasha know not to worry — we're all okay... You three will have to come and stay again once the hotel is fully renovated!

4de3e0257fad12d0.ContentText: You made it... I thought you were about to miss out on a moment of history.
4de3e0257fad12d0.Speaker: Natasha

d43f3bd57ac0da68.ContentText: No way! After all our hard work, how could we miss out on the final celebration? Right, {NICKNAME}?
d43f3bd57ac0da68.Speaker: March 7th

bee9bda8e8f96c1b.ContentText: Haha, I don't know how much of a celebration we'll be having... but I know Hook and Clara will be pleased to sit with you.
bee9bda8e8f96c1b.Speaker: Natasha

eb0dab81c64795b2.ContentText: For Oleg and I, not to mention the other adults, reopening the passageway means rediscovering old ways of living — a return to "normality..." Survival is no longer the top of the agenda...
eb0dab81c64795b2.Speaker: Natasha

6d011d7983156bfb.ContentText: But for the children who were born into this era, who grew up in this isolation... this will be a new life altogether.
6d011d7983156bfb.Speaker: Natasha

977a4f90fcca9d04.ContentText: ...Once you've tasted freedom, it's difficult to accept a life of separation and isolation. Those of us whose childhoods were marred by tragedy... we must strive to do better for the next generation.
977a4f90fcca9d04.Speaker: Natasha

1cd38988bc7b3c95.ContentText: I'm sorry, here I am talking your ear off again. This is a day to remember. We should welcome it with smiles.
1cd38988bc7b3c95.Speaker: Natasha

9c093ba2aa2e1126.ContentText: If you have time, talk to the folks here — every one of them will tell you about their excitement. Then, when you're ready... let's "go home."
9c093ba2aa2e1126.Speaker: Natasha

7d24b83e966f221d.ContentText: Finally... Finally I can get back to supervising the cable cars! I thought I'd spend the rest of my life in those mines...

1fb99a366526341a.ContentText: Ah, it's you! The liberators of the Underworld! You're the first passengers we've had since being sealed off — it'll be my honor to get you to the surface in one piece!

4922c9bbabae3a43.ContentText: Oh, uh, I'm afraid you might have to make an exception, {F#miss}{M#mr}. My license has expired, but then I haven't had the chance to go up and renew it for <unbreak>10</unbreak> years now...

bf3bfe6858b8d790.ContentText: Relax, relax! In all my <unbreak>20</unbreak> years on the job, there were only ever, uh... Anyway, none of them were serious!

0f6a8a591f54ac6e.ContentText: Brothers, sisters, ladies, gentlemen, boys, and girls of all ages — gather round! The cable car passenger service is about to restart!

948dec50ded80077.ContentText: No problem, this car won't be leaving without you!

e9c464ea5aaca8ce.ContentText: Whoaaaa...! Look at the big blue ceiling!
e9c464ea5aaca8ce.Speaker: Hook

1dc69d9a66ce3c0f.ContentText: That's not a ceiling, Hook... that's the sky.
1dc69d9a66ce3c0f.Speaker: Natasha

19bdb9b97544dc6f.ContentText: So this is... the Overworld? The air here smells... different.
19bdb9b97544dc6f.Speaker: Clara

417c018194c28d44.ContentText: Hahaha, less rust and Geomarrow particles floating around. Take a deep breath, children — this is what freedom tastes like.

1703cf6a1b0f0e3b.ContentText: ...I never thought I'd live to see the Administrative District again. All those years... We've been through a lot, Natasha.

0c4d69ab767a5689.ContentText: It's funny... The moment I boarded the cable car, my mind was filled with everything I wanted to do on the surface...
0c4d69ab767a5689.Speaker: Natasha

5fdedbc42919973a.ContentText: But now... I just want to sit down, zone out, and watch the people coming and going... and let the day just pass me by...
5fdedbc42919973a.Speaker: Natasha

91aa5d725b5e0ff2.ContentText: Enjoy the peace and quiet, Natasha. We earned it.

30cedf13c11659b2.ContentText: It's been more than ten years. I can finally see my little girl again...

6294bd1ab74a0095.ContentText: She must have graduated by now. I hope she found a good job — government administration or legal consulting, perhaps...

dd3b8322f7996104.ContentText: Please, Amber Lord, anything but those terrible magazine publishers! She's always liked to read those pointless things...

7aaf71b7da514900.ContentText: Mommy, what do children in the Overworld dress like?

d87366a788e3e406.ContentText: Mommy doesn't know either, sweety — the Overworld is different from here. Their fashion is always changing, I don't know what's popular these days...

bfa3cf3a082cd0cb.ContentText: Then... will other children laugh at me when we go up?

48b794b055302a69.ContentText: Don't be silly, that won't happen — mommy's gonna buy you some pretty new clothes as soon as we're on the surface.
