0222722e53990a05.ContentText: The Guards... they m—moved so q-quickly... don't you think it's a little f-fishy?

b31e9e480749b7bf.ContentText: I... I think it's hard to believe, but I've met that young lady Bronya. We didn't talk much, but she felt trustworthy to me.

6cee510e45d6ce4a.ContentText: I don't really know what kind of person the new guardian is, but I heard the three outsiders are on good terms with her.

f3056f17afae3f4d.ContentText: Those three are really capable people. If they believe the Guards, then there's no reason for us not to.

f07010601c00dfb8.ContentText: Fidora's right. They saved lots of people at the mines... I think they can be trusted.

bb926ca59f0c70c3.ContentText: Ah, it's Gepard! Is he here to meet us?
bb926ca59f0c70c3.Speaker: March 7th

f76959d4525714b1.ContentText: He's still on duty. Huh, he must have recovered quickly.
f76959d4525714b1.Speaker: Dan Heng

ffd5dcb7382f66ba.ContentText: Welcome back to the Administrative District, Trailblazers.
ffd5dcb7382f66ba.Speaker: Gepard

0f26c896688b1c49.ContentText: Trailblazers... first time anyone's called us that on this planet!
0f26c896688b1c49.Speaker: March 7th

59dafabf66952bbd.ContentText: The Architects think it's only right that we should address you properly. "Outsiders" is hardly fitting anymore.
59dafabf66952bbd.Speaker: Gepard

ee5ce0c847dbe0ec.ContentText: ...Please allow me to apologize again for what happened in the restricted zone. You were only trying to help... I should've trusted Serval's judgment.
ee5ce0c847dbe0ec.Speaker: Gepard

9ac84cd77e5cd58e.ContentText: I'll keep that in mind, thanks.
9ac84cd77e5cd58e.Speaker: Gepard

21159ae0e86227b1.ContentText: You are excellent fighters. I'd love to have you provide training for the Guards, but I know you have places to be.
21159ae0e86227b1.Speaker: Gepard

9bf240e928dee130.ContentText: Lady Bronya's inaugural address will begin soon. She asked me to pass on her invitation to you.
9bf240e928dee130.Speaker: Gepard

61572e9d7078e588.ContentText: Huh? That's sooner than I expected. Is she well enough to...
61572e9d7078e588.Speaker: March 7th

0cf81e6c922b3b7b.ContentText: Not really... But Lady Bronya insisted on delivering the speech as soon as possible. She wants the people to understand what happened.
0cf81e6c922b3b7b.Speaker: Gepard

8b04ac74d55d6532.ContentText: The address will be held at Everwinter Monument. I hope the three of you can find time to attend.
8b04ac74d55d6532.Speaker: Gepard

1c032a0397d313b2.ContentText: Look! There's a crowd gathering over there. Is the address starting soon?
1c032a0397d313b2.Speaker: March 7th

7245ffdc92d3ce30.ContentText: Looks like it. Bronya hasn't arrived yet, though. Let's find somewhere to wait.
7245ffdc92d3ce30.Speaker: Dan Heng

f1c112061529d238.ContentText: Citizens of Belobog, I kindly ask for your attention! Lady Bronya Rand's inaugural address will begin shortly. Please remain orderly!

36dc3a8e7301bea8.ContentText: Today we gather here to celebrate our victory... but it was a sacrifice made by a mighty guardian that delivered us this opportunity. She dispelled an evil that cost us <unbreak>700</unbreak> years of suffering... and in the process, she paid the ultimate price.
36dc3a8e7301bea8.Speaker: Bronya

8fee5484f7149fe9.ContentText: The sacrifice of Cocolia Rand ushers in a new chapter. The blizzard beyond the walls will die away and the offensives of our Silvermane Guards will begin to contain the Fragmentum's advance.
8fee5484f7149fe9.Speaker: Bronya

1faa267c2ac85986.ContentText: In the far north, I witnessed with my own eyes the struggle between the late supreme guardian and the evil power that sought to destroy us. In her last moments, the supreme guardian told me her greatest regret...
1faa267c2ac85986.Speaker: Bronya

a1678873e768856f.ContentText: ...The order to seal off the Underworld from the Overworld. With the passage of time, she gradually came to realize the consequences of that decision... Although tortured with guilt, she could not undo the damage.
a1678873e768856f.Speaker: Bronya

d205caaeb95ea6cc.ContentText: In her final moments, she wanted us to mark the Stellaron's end by reuniting Belobog. Overworlders and Underworlders must embrace the dawn of a new age... together.
d205caaeb95ea6cc.Speaker: Bronya

40e9e4a5dafb1a9d.ContentText: People of the Underworld, I dare not ask for your forgiveness — I now know the reality of your decade of suffering...
40e9e4a5dafb1a9d.Speaker: Bronya

d496104179d5f8f5.ContentText: But I want us to work together. We know that without your perseverance and hard work, Belobog will not recover its former glory... and the seed of civilization will not be preserved.
d496104179d5f8f5.Speaker: Bronya

52a2d649bd088264.ContentText: ...And on that note, I'd like to extend my heartfelt gratitude to a few guests of the city.
52a2d649bd088264.Speaker: Bronya

d007242fcc7284db.ContentText: Most of you were not aware of their arrival... but it is thanks to them that our world now flourishes with hope.
d007242fcc7284db.Speaker: Bronya

4e12b2380fa2fb92.ContentText: They made me realize that while we remain focused on "preserving" the ground beneath our feet, we should not forget to look up into the sky.
4e12b2380fa2fb92.Speaker: Bronya

6f537061bfd77069.ContentText: I firmly believe that with the determination of everyone, our world, the world the Trailblazers call "Jarilo-VI," will no longer be alone among the stars.
6f537061bfd77069.Speaker: Bronya

1641566b3bc48f28.ContentText: But before we accomplish that goal, I humbly ask you to follow me into the future...
1641566b3bc48f28.Speaker: Bronya

80cca450b02b55ef.ContentText: I, Bronya Rand, the nineteenth guardian of Belobog, hereby take my oath...
80cca450b02b55ef.Speaker: Bronya

08410cb83b7d6306.ContentText: Lady Bronya! Lady Bronya! Long live Belobog!

c86fce12ce561b04.ContentText: Back in this office again... The last time I was here was... the last time I was here.
c86fce12ce561b04.Speaker: March 7th

4dc9080a8e06ba95.ContentText: No more unnerving gaze this time! Hehe...
4dc9080a8e06ba95.Speaker: March 7th

1f53697fadb91c0d.ContentText: Congrats, {NICKNAME}! That was one heck of a first trailblazing expedition!
1f53697fadb91c0d.Speaker: March 7th

c4b09fbbb1d0cdec.ContentText: My scoring criteria are different from yours.
c4b09fbbb1d0cdec.Speaker: Dan Heng

2a547add64b50e87.ContentText: Ugh! Anyway, we should be asking {NICKNAME}... Any thoughts you want to share?
2a547add64b50e87.Speaker: March 7th

f450eed658fd2d9e.ContentText: Wait, what? No way — we're about to leave and I've hardly got any decent photos.
f450eed658fd2d9e.Speaker: March 7th

4e8bfcde87906741.ContentText: Come on, let's go back to the Administrative District and hang out for a bit longer!
4e8bfcde87906741.Speaker: March 7th

f57a22e8037df340.ContentText: That's the spirit! Come on, we should take some more photos before we head back to the Express.
f57a22e8037df340.Speaker: March 7th

b238b0ac96b1d293.ContentText: Let's go! One more round in the Administrative District!
b238b0ac96b1d293.Speaker: March 7th

2d4c7eb4d75e128a.ContentText: Equally unforgettable, I'm sure. Anyway, don't worry about the future — live in the moment!
2d4c7eb4d75e128a.Speaker: March 7th

b3629cbe4133d08d.ContentText: Let's go for one more round in the Administrative District! I wanna take more photos!
b3629cbe4133d08d.Speaker: March 7th

47e482c7227a85fc.ContentText: Bronya said she's willing to wait <unbreak>700</unbreak> years for us...
47e482c7227a85fc.Speaker: March 7th

eb34008b15124b5f.ContentText: Hmm... Dan Heng, how long can humans live for?
eb34008b15124b5f.Speaker: March 7th

94115d80dfd8f88f.ContentText: ...Forever. But in that scenario, they can't be considered human anymore.
94115d80dfd8f88f.Speaker: Dan Heng

95891e9493e4a5f6.ContentText: Yikes! So serious! I was just curious.
95891e9493e4a5f6.Speaker: March 7th

ffa88e518943f57e.ContentText: *yawn* ... That's enough sightseeing and photo-taking to last me a while...
ffa88e518943f57e.Speaker: March 7th

58bab0480d56e307.ContentText: ...Time to head back to the Goethe Hotel for a good night's sleep!
58bab0480d56e307.Speaker: March 7th

799f5bcc81e33f20.ContentText: ...We can sleep when we're back on the Express.
799f5bcc81e33f20.Speaker: Dan Heng

af7b4260c2aa40a0.ContentText: Not so fast! Last time we were here, that evil Madam Guardian interrupted us before we'd gotten the most out of our luxury suites... Don't you think we should make up for it?
af7b4260c2aa40a0.Speaker: March 7th

59e39c59b7d72e21.ContentText: Come onnnn! Himeko and Mr. Yang are grown-ups — I'm sure they'll cope without us for one night.
59e39c59b7d72e21.Speaker: March 7th

b1726fc2b2706c5a.ContentText: We should be getting back to the Express. Time to find March and Dan Heng.
b1726fc2b2706c5a.Speaker: playerboy

407e5324bd117d33.ContentText: Morning, {NICKNAME}! How did you sleep? I'm full of energy myself!
407e5324bd117d33.Speaker: March 7th

fe7ea23fdec1f75c.ContentText: ...Copycatitis still has no cure I see.
fe7ea23fdec1f75c.Speaker: March 7th

69fcbc36fd7b42ed.ContentText: You poor thing! I'll go check the lunar calendar — today might be unlucky.
69fcbc36fd7b42ed.Speaker: March 7th

4c233e0d502c1756.ContentText: *sigh* But the beds here are so nice!
4c233e0d502c1756.Speaker: March 7th

2407b5c577102ca1.ContentText: Did you get Himeko's message? It's time to go. The conductor will nag us again if we put the Express behind schedule.
2407b5c577102ca1.Speaker: Dan Heng

f9f2a006483dee3f.ContentText: Yeah, yeah. Well, pack your souvenirs and stuff. Back home we go!
f9f2a006483dee3f.Speaker: March 7th

4db8ca1a276a1a3a.ContentText: ...Priorities? What do you mean? Are you saying rebuilding the Underworld isn't one of your "priorities"?
4db8ca1a276a1a3a.Speaker: Seele

c4d740cf81c689ed.ContentText: Of course not! I'm just saying we have limited assets, and we need new parameters.
c4d740cf81c689ed.Speaker: Bronya

a693fc10ab4de103.ContentText: Assets... parameters... You sure love your fancy words.
a693fc10ab4de103.Speaker: Seele

40dc68acf82222f1.ContentText: Ugh, forget it. Leave it to me. I'll go down myself...
40dc68acf82222f1.Speaker: Seele

595926d8630d3e5c.ContentText: ...Come on, Seele! I won't leave you to—
595926d8630d3e5c.Speaker: Bronya

3fb27c9b4da024d7.ContentText: There'll be plenty of difficulties waiting for them, right?
3fb27c9b4da024d7.Speaker: Seele

a6fdc2a5d4775e56.ContentText: Yes... their future is filled with even more uncertainty than ours.
a6fdc2a5d4775e56.Speaker: Bronya

344a2715868ce850.ContentText: But we will prevail here... Even if it means arguments like this go on forever...
344a2715868ce850.Speaker: Bronya

bdf51aa390fff9ce.ContentText: ...Hmph, they won't go on forever if I win them.
bdf51aa390fff9ce.Speaker: Seele

22d5830445fa2ff0.ContentText: Here we are, Everwinter Monument! Photo time!
22d5830445fa2ff0.Speaker: March 7th

a492dcfc029a4d71.ContentText: Oh, Pela and Hook are here too? Let's make sure we get them in the background!
a492dcfc029a4d71.Speaker: March 7th

71d922e3621252ac.ContentText: Oh, we haven't seen Serval since we got back! Let's head to the workshop.
71d922e3621252ac.Speaker: March 7th

431e65acf9033596.ContentText: Who's there? Didn't your parents tell you to knock before—
431e65acf9033596.Speaker: Serval

b36293b5c54f7bf9.ContentText: Ha, it's you three! Come on in! I was just talking to Clara about you.
b36293b5c54f7bf9.Speaker: Serval

38ac285b290285c8.ContentText: How have you been, {F#big sister}{M#big brother}? Miss Serval's workshop is amazing — there are all kinds of things... I like it here a lot!
38ac285b290285c8.Speaker: Clara

31a539be08af5e78.ContentText: "Miss Serval..." Clara is such a well-mannered kid! Meanwhile, the Architects' children are still calling me "auntie" and making me feel old...
31a539be08af5e78.Speaker: Serval

e0bd3cda83aec77d.ContentText: Hey, that's not your line! We're here to take a photo, remember?
e0bd3cda83aec77d.Speaker: March 7th

402847850d5c3c2b.ContentText: Photo? ...This feels like one of my fan meet-ups, haha. Anyway, for you guys, I'd do autographs for free.
402847850d5c3c2b.Speaker: Serval

ee0637df33ace3b6.ContentText: "Photo..." Oh! I remember. When I was little, Mr. Svarog took a photo for me...
ee0637df33ace3b6.Speaker: Clara

9588d58c17ffe3e2.ContentText: Over here, Clara! Wanna learn some cool poses?
9588d58c17ffe3e2.Speaker: Serval

96b2b99dc281d3b4.ContentText: Wow, that's pretty great! I wish the photographers at my shows had your skills!
96b2b99dc281d3b4.Speaker: Serval

471819d5b7bf651f.ContentText: Huh...? Am I really that short? I thought...
471819d5b7bf651f.Speaker: Clara

86b81ed25549027a.ContentText: Don't worry! If you eat like Dan Heng, you'll be as tall as him one day! *stifled laughter*
86b81ed25549027a.Speaker: March 7th

dc2d50c8d649a043.ContentText: Here, keep it... a little farewell gift from the Astral Express.
dc2d50c8d649a043.Speaker: March 7th

4fb5d7e7b62e0247.ContentText: ...There's gotta be a better shot than this one!
4fb5d7e7b62e0247.Speaker: Serval

dc8d0bf043590b98.ContentText: Um... I was trying really hard not to blink...
dc8d0bf043590b98.Speaker: Clara

81f212c0a7b61508.ContentText: *sigh* We shouldn't have trusted an amateur...
81f212c0a7b61508.Speaker: March 7th

2fc1acb99fc84bc9.ContentText: Never mind, at least it's memorable... A little farewell gift from the Astral Express.
2fc1acb99fc84bc9.Speaker: March 7th

87abd9db83b8d728.ContentText: *sigh* I understand. Well, this photo will always be close to my heart. I'll make a copy for you too, Clara.
87abd9db83b8d728.Speaker: Serval

373b8f651cfa8efd.ContentText: Th—Thanks Miss Serval! {F#Big sister}{M#Big brother} {NICKNAME}, March, Dan Heng... Thanks for taking care of me. Safe travels.
373b8f651cfa8efd.Speaker: Clara

3d0aa7be4fc66802.ContentText: If you have time... please come back and visit me and Mr. Svarog.
3d0aa7be4fc66802.Speaker: Clara

3c0a1e300a88036a.ContentText: Besides, don't you want to chit-chat with the locals now that Belobog is full of life again? I know I do!
3c0a1e300a88036a.Speaker: March 7th

660aa04711511a3d.ContentText: Here we are at last... *sigh* It's sad to say goodbye.
660aa04711511a3d.Speaker: March 7th

c9cca7bd487cf3fe.ContentText: Nothing lasts forever. You'll stop feeling sad the moment you set foot on the Express.
c9cca7bd487cf3fe.Speaker: Dan Heng

fa8c864ff297cf6c.ContentText: Hey, I'm not that heartless y'know...
fa8c864ff297cf6c.Speaker: March 7th

d69ac487aeca0f72.ContentText: Whoaaaa! So much ice! But it's warm here... aren't you Overworlders worried it'll melt?
d69ac487aeca0f72.Speaker: Hook

5595023a31ebb435.ContentText: Not at all. It may look like ice, but it's actually a monument carved out of Geomarrow crystal.
5595023a31ebb435.Speaker: Pela

5bf4367f6e7b0dbb.ContentText: Ah, Geomarrow! It's a shame daddy isn't here — He'd find a buyer for it and sell it for big bucks!
5bf4367f6e7b0dbb.Speaker: Hook

d277a430ca9be0d2.ContentText: Uh... How do I explain... This particular piece of Geomarrow is definitely not for sale...
d277a430ca9be0d2.Speaker: Pela

d74a962aa9edc16b.ContentText: A "photo?" What's that? Hook wants to see it!
d74a962aa9edc16b.Speaker: Hook

546b16288769b61b.ContentText: I must remind you that taking photos of others without gaining their permission violates Belobog public security ordinance number...
546b16288769b61b.Speaker: Pela

9aa64863f6bd7468.ContentText: ...Wait, that's a nice picture! And... it's crystal clear.
9aa64863f6bd7468.Speaker: Pela

29452431b1ae3f22.ContentText: Wow! Photos are awesome! ...Can Hook have it?
29452431b1ae3f22.Speaker: Hook

21ab8ef29b78244e.ContentText: Hee-hee, you like it? It's yours. A farewell gift from us.
21ab8ef29b78244e.Speaker: March 7th

322d050ba3aa0166.ContentText: U—Uh, excuse me... are you Captain Oleg?

27bb4bde6e62d271.ContentText: ...Huh? I didn't think anyone would still remember my name after all this time.

a27133146ff646c9.ContentText: Of course we remember! Every young guard knows about your courageous exploits!

a5fdf1e6b1c2b4f0.ContentText: Oh? Which ones might they be? The time I finished off that rampaging prowler with just three bullets? Or when I defended the outpost from monsters for six days straight without food or water?

f4a1991b77e41008.ContentText: I haven't heard of either of them actually... But I'd love to hear all about them!

367f29a5e5cb0baa.ContentText: Hahaha, sure! In which case, I'll cut my walk short and tell you all the grisly details...

6b81c6e2174cd3d7.ContentText: Wow! Did you see that, Clara? A super suuuper big steel monster just ran past!
6b81c6e2174cd3d7.Speaker: Hook

980057c1b8a4b086.ContentText: I don't think that's a monster... Mr. Svarog's database has information about it. It's called... hmm, I can't remember.
980057c1b8a4b086.Speaker: Clara

eaee58fc052eb470.ContentText: Don't worry about the name! The important thing is I saw what it can do — it has a huuuuge appetite and swallows people whole!
eaee58fc052eb470.Speaker: Hook

6cabb2f3c1ced1f1.ContentText: And it just so happens to be The Moles' next target, hehe... We'll defeat the iron monster and save the people in its tummy!
6cabb2f3c1ced1f1.Speaker: Hook

b94015eb68d7719d.ContentText: Um... I don't think that's how it works...
b94015eb68d7719d.Speaker: Clara

6387d12c619d000f.ContentText: Sasha! My Sasha, is that you?

f85e1c02f45772bc.ContentText: Dad! — by the Amber Lord, I thought I was never going to see you again!

e1ca6f34a4fcd526.ContentText: Praise the Preservation, my child. Praise their leniency... And who's this little one?

62b249e8688ec053.ContentText: Here, Barry... say hello to grandpa!

520e9d3d71491a89.ContentText: My grandson... Is this my grandson? *sob*

e12b17f0ac1c764a.ContentText: Sorry Dad, I wanted to introduce you to my husband too, but he can't get away from the publisher today.

a4400344793897c8.ContentText: That's okay, my child, we've got all the time in the... did you say "publisher"?

6e4bcc8bdf3da523.ContentText: I don't know if you've ever had that feeling, {NICKNAME}... When you stop and look back on the things you've done, and wonder at all the obstacles you've overcome, the strength you've displayed...
6e4bcc8bdf3da523.Speaker: Natasha

53027a56f9d19ff1.ContentText: And then you start to doubt yourself, and wonder if you've lost that drive... If everything were to happen again, would you still stand strong?
53027a56f9d19ff1.Speaker: Natasha

d145205f3d318270.ContentText: You do? Good... I mean, it's good to know someone in this world feels the same way as me.
d145205f3d318270.Speaker: Natasha

51d88e454f4fa1d7.ContentText: And that's not surprising — you're different from others. You seem to radiate a confidence most people don't have.
51d88e454f4fa1d7.Speaker: Natasha

d01b2c4d92af76ce.ContentText: I haven't been able to sit back once over the past ten years — a moment's negligence could have brought Wildfire crashing down... and the Underworld would've been beyond saving.
d01b2c4d92af76ce.Speaker: Natasha

8f2cda357ae619fd.ContentText: Staying vigilant wasn't the issue... it was the not knowing whether I'd ever be able to let my guard down again...
8f2cda357ae619fd.Speaker: Natasha

2048c03e5949a52c.ContentText: No matter what anyone says, I believe your arrival was the reward for my long vigil. Thank you, Trailblazer.
2048c03e5949a52c.Speaker: Natasha

0a55c6f946f587a0.ContentText: If you walk with your head down and your heart full of fear, your steps will grow heavier and your spirit will suffer.
0a55c6f946f587a0.Speaker: Bronya

186bd4c04b459473.ContentText: But if you find something to look up to and move forward with hope, then your steps will grow lighter... and if you should fall, you'll be on your feet before you know it.
186bd4c04b459473.Speaker: Bronya

96e4a2c88ed34a6a.ContentText: ...Thank you for teaching me this, Trailblazers.
96e4a2c88ed34a6a.Speaker: Bronya

3bbdce7b7dfd95d0.ContentText: The inauguration ceremony went very smoothly. I didn't expect so many Underworlders to come and listen to the address.
3bbdce7b7dfd95d0.Speaker: Seele

acc3abfee749ef1b.ContentText: Everyone seemed supportive, too. Seems like Bronya made a pretty good impression on them.
acc3abfee749ef1b.Speaker: Seele

d8e799d7c49818b2.ContentText: If those two approve of Bronya, then everyone following Wildfire won't question her either.
d8e799d7c49818b2.Speaker: Seele

5adb0bcf8165eefb.ContentText: Of course I was! I was just hidden in the crowd. I'm glad you didn't notice me — means I'm doing something right. I want to protect Bronya in my own way.
5adb0bcf8165eefb.Speaker: Seele

85543de6fb1b2004.ContentText: She wanted me to stand next to her, but I'm glad I stuck to my guns. Besides, I'm not sure I could handle that many people staring at me.
85543de6fb1b2004.Speaker: Seele

0aad77debacbbf95.ContentText: No doubt. I figured that out back in the Underworld.
0aad77debacbbf95.Speaker: Seele

89e329f8a87e9426.ContentText: Leave...? So soon? I thought you'd stay for a few more days — at least until everything had calmed down...
89e329f8a87e9426.Speaker: Seele

0ba08bf0651ebf0f.ContentText: Ahh... I get it. People are waiting for you to go back so you can keep traveling, right?
0ba08bf0651ebf0f.Speaker: Seele

4c58be087cba56c8.ContentText: Shame, I thought we'd have more time to discuss all the crazy things you guys like to talk about. Looks like that'll have to wait till next time.
4c58be087cba56c8.Speaker: Seele

fa27580174cad989.ContentText: ...And before you say anything, there will be a next time. I know we'll meet again.
fa27580174cad989.Speaker: Seele

e0bdf3d207cbb869.ContentText: I received Bronya's message before the inauguration ceremony. She told me everything that happened north of Belobog — about the Stellaron, and Cocolia's sacrifice...
e0bdf3d207cbb869.Speaker: Serval

f23727c0f81f9def.ContentText: ...Honestly, I feel that girl is hiding something from me. I knew Cocolia well, and she was never one to suddenly change her mind.
f23727c0f81f9def.Speaker: Serval

c40d59ba04fcca64.ContentText: *sigh* Don't worry, I won't dig too deep. I know Bronya must have thought long and hard before deciding what to make public.
c40d59ba04fcca64.Speaker: Serval

460093b1c1ca40f5.ContentText: I just... feel a bit empty now that we've lost the Stellaron — I spent a long time pursuing it, after all...
460093b1c1ca40f5.Speaker: Serval

bf7d35a857974392.ContentText: As for Cocolia, the best side of her will live on in people's memory. That's not all bad...
bf7d35a857974392.Speaker: Serval

965299b4d40694cb.ContentText: Miss Serval is cool, strong, and... carefree...
965299b4d40694cb.Speaker: Clara

ecdd0bcd892c2c54.ContentText: I want to be like her when I grow up so I can protect everyone... and protect Mr. Svarog!
ecdd0bcd892c2c54.Speaker: Clara

15128a4616a93ab6.ContentText: The thief has stolen parts again? How am I going to track down this crook?
15128a4616a93ab6.Speaker: Clara

03995e5726556298.ContentText: There have been a few unusual thefts in the dwelling over the past few days.
03995e5726556298.Speaker: Clara

bd5eec1bb702ebcb.ContentText: The vagrants say that the parts they worked so hard to obtain have completely vanished. They're worried that there's a thief in the camp...
bd5eec1bb702ebcb.Speaker: Clara

6416fa2532c2bf02.ContentText: Despite our investigations, no one has been able to track down the thief. What's even stranger is that the thief appears to be only interested in stealing parts, and doesn't care about other valuable items...
6416fa2532c2bf02.Speaker: Clara

be88182d6183a325.ContentText: The vagrants had no choice but to ask Mr. Svarog to look into it, but he still hasn't found anything... I investigated the matter myself, but I came up empty-handed...
be88182d6183a325.Speaker: Clara

13e95e346c288354.ContentText: Jeez... I'm baffled. What a strange thief...
13e95e346c288354.Speaker: Clara

0197446021076047.ContentText: Are you also here to look into this case, {F#big sister}{M#big brother}? Perhaps if we work together we can uncover some clues that I missed...
0197446021076047.Speaker: Clara

73da5a87dbc1c35e.ContentText: It's just... I haven't found enough clues yet. The thief is really tricky. They haven't left any traces in the dwelling...
73da5a87dbc1c35e.Speaker: Clara

6b49c700585a2204.ContentText: Are you also here to look into this case, {F#big sister}{M#big brother}? Perhaps if we work together we can uncover some clues that I missed...
6b49c700585a2204.Speaker: Clara

f359b991baba990d.ContentText: ...Th—That look on your face is a bit scary...
f359b991baba990d.Speaker: Clara

426cea625923c426.ContentText: But if you're willing to help look into this case, perhaps we can uncover some clues that I missed.
426cea625923c426.Speaker: Clara

c42a4c5a15c3ef0f.ContentText: Oh! I heard the vagrants on patrol last night ran across the thief again, but I haven't had time to look into it... Should we go ask them?
c42a4c5a15c3ef0f.Speaker: Clara

647e1c634bea2e00.ContentText: You sound so cool, {F#big sister}{M#big brother}... You're like one of the characters from Mr. Svarog's movies. Aren't they called detectives?
647e1c634bea2e00.Speaker: Clara

29ebabf485f4ddf9.ContentText: Seeing you so fired up has me excited, too. Now, let's get started.
29ebabf485f4ddf9.Speaker: Clara

841afa8894364b1b.ContentText: But actually... I think it's cool, too! Now, let's get started, {F#big sister}{M#big brother}!
841afa8894364b1b.Speaker: Clara

a25eeeb5c8bec4b0.ContentText: Sir, how are you? I heard you saw the thief who stole the parts last night. Can you tell us what happened?
a25eeeb5c8bec4b0.Speaker: Clara

6ce7a76cd8318ad8.ContentText: Oh! Clara, it's you! I thought it was... You scared the living daylights out of me!

eea5016494d1a859.ContentText: I—I did see the thief last night, but... who is this person next to you?

d0ca433ae7805d42.ContentText: Trailblazer... Oh, I know. You're the outsider who's made a name for themself around town, right?

2a1235316bc0890b.ContentText: Oh, wow. I feel way better knowing that a big shot like you is here to catch the thief... H—Hold on, I'll explain what happened last night. Just let me gather my thoughts first...

7d36a74a1e02f794.ContentText: Oh! W—Wildfire has sent someone... That's fantastic!

2b3c61431642f465.ContentText: H—Hold on... I'll explain what happened last night. Just let me gather my thoughts first...

04ca30970a2e98f5.ContentText: Em... This nickname is a bit embarrassing...
04ca30970a2e98f5.Speaker: Clara

e08ea39d9081139e.ContentText: D—Detective? I see. You're here to help catch the thief, right?

8e5d45968891a4a7.ContentText: It's great that there are more people here to solve this case... H—Hold on, I'll explain what happened last night. Just let me gather my thoughts first...

fde1c126d3c7fdb5.ContentText: O—Okay. So... Last night, I was on patrol when I bumped into the thief stealing the parts! Then... then... I—I just...

7bed872f16f8d424.ContentText: Goodness, I was so scared! It was dreadful!

7ac4631d6c782a52.ContentText: I... you... I—I'm sorry... Last night was just so terrifying... I—I'll continue!

989e214719c7c229.ContentText: I was cold and hungry while on patrol last night, so I decided to return to the dwelling and heat up some leftover canned food for a snack.

42f307509899bde8.ContentText: But when I entered the tent... the thief's silhouette scurried across my vision!

ad7d55360cfed0af.ContentText: I couldn't see the thief's face because the tent was so dark, but I could tell he wasn't a nice guy...

2859f33e4d7b7cc6.ContentText: B—Because when he turned to flee, he swung a knife right across my face! In that moment, I really thought I was going to die...

4999b167fdae3ddd.ContentText: I could feel the blade's chill on my cheeks, and smell its rusty scent... The weapon that fella had was definitely a metal one! That's the only thing I'm certain of!

dab59770dc11c90c.ContentText: Also, I saw the outline of him in the dark... That fella's head was absolutely square! Yes, you heard me, square!

60fad7fae3606310.ContentText: Can you believe that? Someone with a square head! It was truly terrifying...

6439c47bf29f37ed.ContentText: It sounds bizarre, but it could be a clue. I'll jot it down.
6439c47bf29f37ed.Speaker: Clara

f8bbaa84d3e5ec5c.ContentText: I—I'm also terrified! But I still have to jot down the important clues...
f8bbaa84d3e5ec5c.Speaker: Clara

b5c1b5d6cc12ba33.ContentText: Oh, you're right, {F#big sister}{M#big brother}! I see! I'll jot it down...
b5c1b5d6cc12ba33.Speaker: Clara

36472674ffabf86a.ContentText: Sir, please take a deep breath... So, the thief was armed with a metal weapon and had a... um, square head... correct?
36472674ffabf86a.Speaker: Clara

e53515e8e2ac5885.ContentText: Hmm... I'm struggling to make sense of these clues. Do you have any thoughts, {F#big sister}{M#big brother}?
e53515e8e2ac5885.Speaker: Clara

b12963eba9fc37ee.ContentText: I'm sorry... I was too scared! When a shadow leaps out at you, who could possibly pay attention to such tiny details?

a9b84aa5b7ce35a0.ContentText: It seems that's everything... We now know one of the culprit's physical traits and that he is extremely violent. But how can we track him down?
a9b84aa5b7ce35a0.Speaker: Clara

364cc5e3697f8bf7.ContentText: How can you just accuse me like that!? I was terrified, how could I be an accomplice!? *sob* ...

11eb3e34bb981927.ContentText: I'm sorry! {F#She}{M#He} was just joking... Please don't take {F#Her}{M#Him} seriously!
11eb3e34bb981927.Speaker: Clara

f71ed8e29e7659a6.ContentText: Oh! You've figured it out. But how are we going to track down someone with such an unusual appearance?
f71ed8e29e7659a6.Speaker: Clara

afff77d9ff7a39cc.ContentText: Ah, yes, I remember something! While the culprit was hurrying to escape, he knocked something over... He may have left some clues or something.

64c54b082b94d489.ContentText: This is a crucial clue! {F#Big sister}{M#Big brother}, Let's go investigate the crime scene together!
64c54b082b94d489.Speaker: Clara

db62445ecca04781.ContentText: I think he ran that way. No one has touched the crime scene, so any traces he left behind should still be there... P—Please catch the thief for us.

1fd7ecaa0d5f8090.ContentText: Take a look at these marks... These are very suspicious. Could they have been left by the culprit?
1fd7ecaa0d5f8090.Speaker: Clara

274036b2c0e2e02e.ContentText: They point in that direction... Let's go take a look.
274036b2c0e2e02e.Speaker: Clara

a8fd98aa7d830b37.ContentText: And look at these! How unusual... They don't appear to have been left by a human...
a8fd98aa7d830b37.Speaker: Clara

e14e1ad755ebbecc.ContentText: The tracks stop here... I guess we'll have to look around for other clues.
e14e1ad755ebbecc.Speaker: Clara

556a04b9b405b3d1.ContentText: This is where the mechanical waste is disposed of though. Could it be...
556a04b9b405b3d1.Speaker: Clara

874dc1b93de36ca2.ContentText: O—Okay! I'll follow you, {F#big sister}{M#big brother}.
874dc1b93de36ca2.Speaker: Clara

e528f888fe993823.ContentText: Um, I don't think the culprit actually likes waste heaps. He probably uses them as a hiding spot... Oh, maybe he hid the stolen parts here too!
e528f888fe993823.Speaker: Clara

22b04aa1137db90c.ContentText: Hey! You're being too loud... If the culprit is nearby, he'll just run away!
22b04aa1137db90c.Speaker: Clara

91946498351a2ddd.ContentText: Let's split up... Wait, what's that noise?
91946498351a2ddd.Speaker: Clara

7054a66e84e76cc6.ContentText: It's a... tiny robot? Is it searching for something? But... I don't remember Mr. Svarog issuing an order like this recently...
7054a66e84e76cc6.Speaker: Clara

f5780866446ac0af.ContentText: It looks like it's carrying the vagrants' missing parts...
f5780866446ac0af.Speaker: Clara

7fb8a09d93304083.ContentText: And those tracks and metal scratches we noticed earlier...
7fb8a09d93304083.Speaker: Clara

69064f8343b437c2.ContentText: Hmm, it appears we're thinking the same thing...
69064f8343b437c2.Speaker: Clara

80e28caf3db23ebd.ContentText: Hmm... That would be quite strange, yet such a scenario can't be ruled out.
80e28caf3db23ebd.Speaker: Clara

156472b81ef8f3ec.ContentText: Yes... This robot model probably doesn't have any kind of metal weapon.
156472b81ef8f3ec.Speaker: Clara

438d40bf121a1397.ContentText: This small robot... doesn't appear to be a Belobog creation. It looks like it's been welded together from random scrap metal materials... Huh, it appears to have a small mechanical arm...
438d40bf121a1397.Speaker: Clara

481d2cd0bf7f3ab1.ContentText: I—I don't understand what it's saying... but it doesn't appear to be trying to flee or attack us...
481d2cd0bf7f3ab1.Speaker: Clara

71ead31eab289fec.ContentText: Ah, wait, {F#big sister}{M#big brother}! Look! It doesn't appear to be trying to flee or attack us...
71ead31eab289fec.Speaker: Clara

cce82ca20d21669b.ContentText: Don't be scared! Look! It doesn't seem like it wants to hurt us...
cce82ca20d21669b.Speaker: Clara

b20c3e64ac7a7832.ContentText: It appears to be trying to say something: I, human, please, don't hurt...
b20c3e64ac7a7832.Speaker: Clara

19568ea80b231bdc.ContentText: ...Is it trying to say: "Please don't hurt me, humans"?
19568ea80b231bdc.Speaker: Clara

73471adf21f14e69.ContentText: █ Parts███ need██? █ █Need █ ███ need! ██ need██! Hurt██ don't.

84d4a89f29dc676d.ContentText: It appears to have a malfunction, but I think I can understand it...
84d4a89f29dc676d.Speaker: Clara

56e20a9836e927ea.ContentText: It seems that it needs these parts, and it's begging us not to hurt it...
56e20a9836e927ea.Speaker: Clara

d8693c8ff35b71f3.ContentText: I—I've never seen a robot with this kind of malfunction before... What happened to it...?
d8693c8ff35b71f3.Speaker: Clara

ca532ec8ef0b6520.ContentText: Although this small robot appears to want to communicate, its speech is all scrambled...
ca532ec8ef0b6520.Speaker: Clara

74bb88c1e43852a1.ContentText: Perhaps there's an issue with its language module. This little guy probably can't understand what we're saying either...
74bb88c1e43852a1.Speaker: Clara

73929cb039b80787.ContentText: No! We can't let it escape! It still has the vagrants' parts!
73929cb039b80787.Speaker: Clara

68a51ec3864a9c10.ContentText: What should we do? We gotta stop it! But, please don't be too rough on it! I'll figure out a way to repair it later...
68a51ec3864a9c10.Speaker: Clara

d889babedbefd6f5.ContentText: █Sorry█hurt███suffer█pain█no█pain█sorry██so█████rry███pain█████████hurt█sorry suffer sorry sorry pain sorry ouch pain sorry████████████!

08143ce7e9010f19.ContentText: Initiating assessment of the robot's condition. Please wait, Clara.

582b2ab33df34b5a.ContentText: While Mr. Svarog is assessing this little fella, let's give it a quick checkup ourselves.
582b2ab33df34b5a.Speaker: Clara

0133b89a8870e1a9.ContentText: Huh? This paint job and these custom parts. And the way the parts are attached... It's all quite strange.
0133b89a8870e1a9.Speaker: Clara

ab889ea40742dd68.ContentText: But one thing is for certain... This little fella is not under remote control. He's operating entirely of his own accord...
ab889ea40742dd68.Speaker: Clara

0e101a07b7b8d912.ContentText: Its design is, well, unique. I've never seen a robot with a design like this before.
0e101a07b7b8d912.Speaker: Clara

90048bff7488625b.ContentText: It really seems like something that was thrown together rather quickly. Its creator most likely didn't consider whether the system would function properly or not...
90048bff7488625b.Speaker: Clara

12a03e19651e5fe4.ContentText: Is it a failed robot pet creation that has been abandoned...?
12a03e19651e5fe4.Speaker: Clara

9493781121ebd675.ContentText: But if it's a pet... then why would it gather parts itself?
9493781121ebd675.Speaker: Clara

bf0caa289ba10786.ContentText: I've heard that some vagrants in the dwelling keep the little robots they find as pets.
bf0caa289ba10786.Speaker: Clara

40ca0c205841336f.ContentText: Some vagrants also make modifications to their pets, which they call... pet upgrades.
40ca0c205841336f.Speaker: Clara

d63ebe3ae3da6ca8.ContentText: Pets like that are pretty rare, but some of the folks who have them have formed a small community to share ideas. Some are interested in nurturing robots. Others... force them into battle.
d63ebe3ae3da6ca8.Speaker: Clara

2f50d83167ed4de9.ContentText: If my memory serves me right, the parts this little fella stole were originally designed for that kind of pet upgrade.
2f50d83167ed4de9.Speaker: Clara

82e14a4a1a8ada9a.ContentText: The vagrants... or, to be more accurate, the majority of people in the Underworld regard robots as nothing more than tools.
82e14a4a1a8ada9a.Speaker: Clara

3079fc43126df7e3.ContentText: But I disagree. Robots have their own thoughts and feelings...
3079fc43126df7e3.Speaker: Clara

a385a267ad6e5027.ContentText: It's great that you understand what I'm saying...
a385a267ad6e5027.Speaker: Clara

88b93d15904c90a6.ContentText: That's not the word I'd use.
88b93d15904c90a6.Speaker: Clara

76cf7a1bd4828f85.ContentText: I guess most people only see robots as tools. I'll try not to hold it against you.
76cf7a1bd4828f85.Speaker: Clara

eaee12ec264894a0.ContentText: *sigh*... This robot pet phenomenon really gets to me.
eaee12ec264894a0.Speaker: Clara

f90420b32a98a173.ContentText: Erm... I'm sorry, I just suddenly felt some strong emotions. Let's get back to work on repairing the small robot.
f90420b32a98a173.Speaker: Clara

777ceebb6e26576a.ContentText: This jack's placement is... odd. The chip is buried deep inside. If you don't look closely enough, you won't even find it...
777ceebb6e26576a.Speaker: Clara

97d00edf1cb4c9b6.ContentText: Assessment of the robot's condition is complete. The shell damage is estimated to be <unbreak>98.2%</unbreak>.

f0e1f0d5a0c74b1f.ContentText: The assessment concludes that a total recovery is impossible. It is recommended that the robot's external shell be removed and replaced while keeping the outer circuitry and related transmission devices.

a56f8cc2611996ed.ContentText: You can always rely on Mr. Svarog to come up with a brilliant idea! So, I guess we'll have to go find a new robot shell to fix it, right?
a56f8cc2611996ed.Speaker: Clara

39f172cb42604b5c.ContentText: Hmm... I'm not sure if anyone sells this kind of thing, however...
39f172cb42604b5c.Speaker: Clara

35657091abdc423f.ContentText: Please don't use violent methods to solve this issue. There are other options...
35657091abdc423f.Speaker: Clara

87960e98b3ca6b56.ContentText: There must be some robot shells lying around the machine graveyard. Everyone calls it a graveyard, but there are actually lots of useful parts buried there.
87960e98b3ca6b56.Speaker: Clara

72e87f0a47c1f5cc.ContentText: I'm gonna return the parts to the vagrants first, then I'll check on the little fella. Can I trust you to find a shell in the machine graveyard, {NICKNAME}?
72e87f0a47c1f5cc.Speaker: Clara

f825416fa4dbb155.ContentText: Really? You could have what it takes to be a prospector, {F#big sister}{M#big brother}.
f825416fa4dbb155.Speaker: Clara

6875fef92f5d3f2e.ContentText: Please, please don't say things like that. You'll upset me...
6875fef92f5d3f2e.Speaker: Clara

cd6a147cd612acb7.ContentText: Then I'll entrust this task to you, {NICKNAME}.
cd6a147cd612acb7.Speaker: Clara

3e1a1576c582b808.ContentText: Look for Toby at the front entrance. His appearance is... crude, but he's the robot most familiar with the machine graveyard. Just follow Toby.
3e1a1576c582b808.Speaker: Clara

fded0b4e64640ee6.ContentText: Hello, my name is Toby. It is my honor to serve you.

6e31395730b05449.ContentText: Hello, guest of Miss Clara. Please do as you wish! It's my honor to serve you.

c0619f5e389e1d88.ContentText: Allow me to share a fun fact: Toby is not a primitive robot.

d24aed25402e91bb.ContentText: Miss Clara has assigned me the task of planning your sightseeing route in the machine graveyard. I will guide you down the path.

4cf17b2d807d9372.ContentText: Would you like to engage in Super Speed mode? If so, please confirm by spinning counterclockwise <unbreak>10</unbreak> times, then clockwise by <unbreak>270</unbreak> degrees.

7eb7593476b13a55.ContentText: We have arrived at our second destination. This module is called the Beetle, which is the same as mine.

fcc31f3cb9e210c4.ContentText: This machine was scrapped because it accelerated erratically for <unbreak>7.1</unbreak> kilometers after it incorrectly interpreted a command, causing the engine to catch fire and the core module to melt down.

2ae1d41ba5ce30c6.ContentText: (That is such an odd reason to be scrapped...)
2ae1d41ba5ce30c6.Speaker: playerboy

6db491245e01d225.ContentText: (However, the shell appears to be in good condition, so I'll bring it with me.)
6db491245e01d225.Speaker: playerboy

e1d87d87e90057d7.ContentText: We are on our way to the second destination. Please take a seat, buckle up, and hold tight.

601b1b902c602cce.ContentText: CAUTION: You have exceeded the speed limit. Please obey Belobog traffic laws. On the road, safety is the top priority.

f0663b4f603acbf8.ContentText: We have arrived at our first destination. This model is known as the Direwolf, and was scrapped after it sustained piercing damage during a battle with another robot pet, which caused the chainsaw's fuel tank to burst.

3e9a32c6dd57c49c.ContentText: (Robot pet battles sound a little frightening...)
3e9a32c6dd57c49c.Speaker: playerboy

e984b10fd36a9153.ContentText: (The inside of the armor is a total mess due to being melted by the heat. Unfortunately, it appears to be useless.)
e984b10fd36a9153.Speaker: playerboy

722395471cdae979.ContentText: Your trip has concluded. Please keep an eye out for vehicles approaching from the back or sides, as well as enemies and automatons.

01df673e508ea316.ContentText: Your trip has concluded. I appreciate you putting your trust in Toby.

afaec93748a07aff.ContentText: A five-star review for this trip has been automatically generated for you. You're welcome!

96a6e2cd72341254.ContentText: Clara, it's time for a break. You shouldn't repair machines when you have negative emotions. It's bad for your physical and mental health.

d2ca2cdea3948cdd.ContentText: Don't worry, Mr. Svarog. I'm fine.
d2ca2cdea3948cdd.Speaker: Clara

18e825ec2fb9a3a2.ContentText: Oh, {NICKNAME}, you're back already? How did it go? Did Toby help you find a shell?
18e825ec2fb9a3a2.Speaker: Clara

265ec0cf6d139723.ContentText: This shell... Hmm... It doesn't appear to be the same design as this little fella's...
265ec0cf6d139723.Speaker: Clara

64a9ba468c764464.ContentText: But it shouldn't matter. The structures of these small robots are nearly identical. Thank you for bringing this to me, {NICKNAME}.
64a9ba468c764464.Speaker: Clara

21ce9cbdbfae1129.ContentText: I've finished extracting that chip from the small robot. Now all that's left to do is move all of this circuitry into the new shell...
21ce9cbdbfae1129.Speaker: Clara

5756a280b7716130.ContentText: Although its appearance has changed a lot, I think we did a good job.
5756a280b7716130.Speaker: Clara

dc79fc7876f4a7b1.ContentText: Hmm, but what I just did... Is it any different from those pet upgrades that the vagrants perform...?
dc79fc7876f4a7b1.Speaker: Clara

562cae6f0cef558e.ContentText: Huh? It's making a strange sound.
562cae6f0cef558e.Speaker: Clara

d7ea1066c98f8097.ContentText: Wh-What's going on? Is it malfunctioning?
d7ea1066c98f8097.Speaker: Clara

41459cc6678f3225.ContentText: Risk level: high. Clara, get away, now!

52499f2bff37e328.ContentText: {NICKNAME}, watch out! It's out of control!
52499f2bff37e328.Speaker: Clara

d940c086968109e1.ContentText: Phew... that was close. Fortunately, Mr. Svarog and {NICKNAME} acted fast...
d940c086968109e1.Speaker: Clara

bb3a3e4ec6c1e6ba.ContentText: Why did the little fella... Was there a compatibility issue?
bb3a3e4ec6c1e6ba.Speaker: Clara

401c70b4bd0e7acb.ContentText: Assessment: The system on the chip and the new hardware are incompatible, causing the robot to behave erratically.

fb2813328f32f300.ContentText: The current issue has been resolved. Risk level: low. Alert lifted.

141570454aa5ad83.ContentText: It appears to have adjusted to its new shell after the battle. That's great...
141570454aa5ad83.Speaker: Clara

b9da323d1c122348.ContentText: But... I'd like to keep a closer eye on it for a while. Compatibility tests should take a few days. Hopefully, it will be all back to normal by then.
b9da323d1c122348.Speaker: Clara

fae3541f8f1b298d.ContentText: I'm also curious about where this little fella came from. Could you please come back later, {NICKNAME}?
fae3541f8f1b298d.Speaker: Clara

c1cd1e344365a404.ContentText: I need to look into something... I may require your assistance.
c1cd1e344365a404.Speaker: Clara

0920deedf567f0c7.ContentText: Thank you, {NICKNAME}! I'll text you when this little fella is fixed.
0920deedf567f0c7.Speaker: Clara

28d20e52ca745fde.ContentText: Mr. Svarog, I'd like to give this little fella a name. Any ideas for a good name?
28d20e52ca745fde.Speaker: Clara

5439ed2913456701.ContentText: Accessing name database. Search results: Abby, Abigail, Ada, Addison...

8ed5b7b677c0ea32.ContentText: (I should come back to Clara later.)
8ed5b7b677c0ea32.Speaker: playerboy

c21efd8b80eabbdb.ContentText: (Looks like it hasn't gone back to normal yet... I should come back later.)
c21efd8b80eabbdb.Speaker: playerboy

c38790b95e4cc26f.ContentText: Based on the information gathered, it is recommended that Pascal's data be formatted and integrated into the base network so that he doesn't threaten the property or safety of the camp's residents.

2d62426477da0080.ContentText: I know this is the most sensible option, but Pascal...
2d62426477da0080.Speaker: Clara

41ca2ec1a1ac9686.ContentText: Welcome, outsider. Thanks to Clara's hard work, the repairs were completed successfully.

e6bad029082ab7d3.ContentText: Yes, the little fella is alive and well again. It's just that... some parts aren't completely back to normal yet.
e6bad029082ab7d3.Speaker: Clara

65339e314bb86dca.ContentText: Yes! Mr. Svarog and I spent a long time coming up with a suitable name...
65339e314bb86dca.Speaker: Clara

eb4abc3ab58fdecd.ContentText: Well... How should I put it...
eb4abc3ab58fdecd.Speaker: Clara

7c66a24393f36a3c.ContentText: Absolutely not! I'm not going to give up...
7c66a24393f36a3c.Speaker: Clara

a37084eb92670dff.ContentText: Oh look, {F#big sister}{M#big brother}! Pascal is greeting you. It's just... his speech is still a little confusing.
a37084eb92670dff.Speaker: Clara

b20e5cca6df8dce9.ContentText: The examination conducted earlier revealed that the information stored in this robot's core module is incompatible with the new hardware.

58fc42d3e9e5fba8.ContentText: Furthermore, many defective networks were detected in the core module. A significant amount of muddled information with unknown content was discovered during a deep scan.

ca0a3e11055bd736.ContentText: Simply put, Pascal's brain is filled with junk information of unknown origin. This junk, along with hardware that's incompatible with his core, caused him to lose his ability to communicate.
ca0a3e11055bd736.Speaker: Clara

260e19b4109a3816.ContentText: Fortunately, apart from the language module, Pascal is still functioning properly...
260e19b4109a3816.Speaker: Clara

12c210987a93f15b.ContentText: However, the robot still has a <unbreak>44.7%</unbreak> chance of malfunctioning. It's recommended that Pascal's data be formatted and integrated into the base network.

d3dd7bad08ac0fff.ContentText: Mr. Svarog, I understand, but I think Pascal is different. He possesses a quality that other small robots don't have...
d3dd7bad08ac0fff.Speaker: Clara

1494edc5204660f8.ContentText: In some ways, I believe he is similar to Mr. Svarog. I can't overlook this unique quality...
1494edc5204660f8.Speaker: Clara

ae3c7ab1d3fc831d.ContentText: Mr. Svarog, could you give me a little more time? I want to investigate this further. If we don't find anything, you can integrate Pascal into the network.
ae3c7ab1d3fc831d.Speaker: Clara

90cd9ea0bdc46812.ContentText: Understood, Clara. I respect your wish. In the meantime, I'll make sure that this robot doesn't endanger other people or property.

787889932f96e662.ContentText: I'd like to recap what I discussed with Mr. Svarog earlier.
787889932f96e662.Speaker: Clara

63473321582880ab.ContentText: I know this is asking a lot...
63473321582880ab.Speaker: Clara

c4890844ba935150.ContentText: But... it's very important to me! Please... help me one more time.
c4890844ba935150.Speaker: Clara

b859912028330849.ContentText: Oh, th—thanks then... I'm so sorry to trouble you again, {NICKNAME}!
b859912028330849.Speaker: Clara

dcfa69f84c96f23e.ContentText: Phew... As long as you're not really annoyed with me.
dcfa69f84c96f23e.Speaker: Clara

32a58beecdc504c7.ContentText: Let's begin by doing exactly what we did before. Find a new shell, put Pascal's core in it, and see if the hardware is compatible.
32a58beecdc504c7.Speaker: Clara

1750fcaa27f76575.ContentText: According to the analysis, Pascal's original hardware was a Direwolf or Grizzly model. If we can put its core into the appropriate shell, there's an <unbreak>87.3%</unbreak> chance that its language module will return to normal.

a2e60baa36bccf55.ContentText: There are all kinds of abandoned robots in the machine graveyard. Let's go take a look.
a2e60baa36bccf55.Speaker: Clara

20f1d1b279eda5c4.ContentText: It's the same old place. Everywhere you look, there are robots that have lost the ability to function...
20f1d1b279eda5c4.Speaker: Clara

2e200dcd0bad8adb.ContentText: Hey, {NICKNAME}, take a look over there!
2e200dcd0bad8adb.Speaker: Clara

71202da340892872.ContentText: This is an Automaton Direwolf, but it appears to have been modified. It's most likely another abandoned robot pet...
71202da340892872.Speaker: Clara

4a53ffa9ba3bf5cd.ContentText: Although it doesn't seem to be functioning, you should still be cautious when approaching it...
4a53ffa9ba3bf5cd.Speaker: Clara

c2430d1857d9cbc4.ContentText: Oh no, it's still active. Watch out!
c2430d1857d9cbc4.Speaker: Clara

22189a34b06df18f.ContentText: This big fella is completely out of control... Let's quiet him down!
22189a34b06df18f.Speaker: Clara

435b7bedd4a264fd.ContentText: Here it is! This is the core. I'll pack it up and take it with us...
435b7bedd4a264fd.Speaker: Clara

a1ba4ab62a58af68.ContentText: Hmm, then all that's left is to drag the shell back.
a1ba4ab62a58af68.Speaker: Clara

418cb5d5b12ad544.ContentText: It's okay, I'm strong too! I'll tuck the core in a little tighter so it doesn't fall out...
418cb5d5b12ad544.Speaker: Clara

c380efcd6df9fed5.ContentText: Judging from how active the robot was, its core isn't just scrap metal. It should be repairable.
c380efcd6df9fed5.Speaker: Clara

91bb11c677c657f2.ContentText: I can't let any robot go to waste if it can be repaired. So... I'm going to try to fix them all.
91bb11c677c657f2.Speaker: Clara

052b35f72fe6e208.ContentText: Let's start with Pascal. We found him first, after all. Also, like Mr. Svarog warned, if he's not supervised, he might cause trouble...
052b35f72fe6e208.Speaker: Clara

b2facff027f918c9.ContentText: You know, I have a large safe full of core modules that I've gathered around the Underworld.
b2facff027f918c9.Speaker: Clara

42b6a1e75bacd366.ContentText: Every day, I try to figure out how to repair some of them and return the robots to normal. Except... there are a lot more than Mr. Svarog and I can handle on our own.
42b6a1e75bacd366.Speaker: Clara

c47403df184cfe4f.ContentText: But I'm sure I can fix them all one day... We can't relax yet. We must work harder!
c47403df184cfe4f.Speaker: Clara

ea877ccfa343cae8.ContentText: Thank you, {F#big sister}{M#big brother}. It makes me happy to hear that.
ea877ccfa343cae8.Speaker: Clara

c4886b56b28120a1.ContentText: I know. You and Mr. Svarog have helped me so much, someone needs to do the same for those poor robots... I've got to do my best.
c4886b56b28120a1.Speaker: Clara

67c5b1aa382d4442.ContentText: Ah, I was talking so much that I totally lost track of time.
67c5b1aa382d4442.Speaker: Clara

c237cfb266efdb65.ContentText: Let's head back, otherwise Mr. Svarog and Pascal will get worried.
c237cfb266efdb65.Speaker: Clara

b0e8cf398bd974a0.ContentText: Welcome back, Clara. I've completed my further analysis of this robot.

7a7320fd9a4835f7.ContentText: Although no abnormal behavior was detected during the analysis, the muddled information in the robot's core module is still rapidly increasing. The risk of abnormal behavior is expected to rise to <unbreak>76.1%</unbreak> in three hours.

6e6d23c19d43185f.ContentText: It appears we don't have much time left. Mr. Svarog, have you discovered anything else?
6e6d23c19d43185f.Speaker: Clara

18c241cb1c1572f6.ContentText: Okay... Then you can tell me first, Mr. Svarog.
18c241cb1c1572f6.Speaker: Clara

f54fbf05dac4e1ee.ContentText: Conclusion: It is impossible to determine the time of manufacture, purpose, and ownership of this robot.

7ca31b2f8473797e.ContentText: During my analysis, I extracted the robot's serial number and searched for it in the Underworld's automaton database...

d5b53d2608866707.ContentText: According to my search, there are <unbreak>32</unbreak> automatons with the same serial number as this one. Even after eliminating the scrapped ones, three automatons still match the keyword description.

2c75cf3ebdd9c4a0.ContentText: Assessing... Assessment complete. Conclusion: Search results cannot be narrowed down any further.

d6de2937b306b221.ContentText: The three automatons that match the keyword descriptions are located in Moltammerville, Rivet Town, and Forge Town. All three of these mining towns have been abandoned, and no automatons have been discovered in these three sites recently.

85a06fd3e57e8f59.ContentText: It appears that the trail has gone cold yet again.
85a06fd3e57e8f59.Speaker: Clara

03e315dc28de71d8.ContentText: It appears so. I'm not sure what he's trying to say though.
03e315dc28de71d8.Speaker: Clara

b904ab0e05b7876a.ContentText: While we were talking, the robot's failure rate increased. We should activate Alert mode.

3571d3e31ee29f93.ContentText: I'm not sure, but if we can narrow it down to the three automatons, then...
3571d3e31ee29f93.Speaker: Clara

37d8fe15093d771a.ContentText: Pascal is becoming increasingly unstable... We should change his shell.
37d8fe15093d771a.Speaker: Clara

e571b00e01209463.ContentText: Pascal, I'm going to change your shell. Don't worry, it won't hurt...
e571b00e01209463.Speaker: Clara

2660022618e9f14c.ContentText: Still not functioning properly? What's wrong, Pascal?
2660022618e9f14c.Speaker: Clara

419f5d0a9ba9f776.ContentText: Pascal... Did he run off towards Rivet Town? Let's follow him!
419f5d0a9ba9f776.Speaker: Clara

e6f74914f8aac6ed.ContentText: No, Clara, just leave it to me. I'll order the robots to pursue this one...

532b6cb19cb74432.ContentText: So that's what happened, Mr. Svarog. But there's one thing I don't understand... Why is Pascal being treated as a Fragmentum creature?
532b6cb19cb74432.Speaker: Clara

e1db411361fea003.ContentText: This robot has been repairing itself using Fragmentum-contaminated components for an extended period of time. Therefore, automatons connected to the base network recognize it as a Fragmentum creature. This is a minor issue that can be resolved by replacing components, do not worry.

d51edea959851a7b.ContentText: I see... Has Mr. Svarog ever witnessed a similar incident anywhere in the network?
d51edea959851a7b.Speaker: Clara

89000f1cde1ad93a.ContentText: No. Network-connected automatons regularly clear out muddled information in their core modules.

aa3fcd468e4d9a31.ContentText: The likelihood of a robot gaining sentience beyond control is approximately <unbreak>0.12%</unbreak>. For those that aren't connected to the network, the chance climbs to <unbreak>3.23%</unbreak>.

251c734ececa53b0.ContentText: Please keep in mind that these probabilities are only estimates. Over the past <unbreak>700</unbreak> years, this has never happened in the Underworld.

a5afe134e0e87317.ContentText: Actually, I do. Contrary to popular belief, improbable events that are easily disregarded frequently result in catastrophes.

23f27f3d2448480e.ContentText: Given that automatons can still develop emotion modules using their own processing power, I have a backup plan in place.

45f4bce1717c7e95.ContentText: To make life easier for users, all of Belobog's automatons contain language simulation abilities. They generate appropriate responses by reading preset parameters and mimicking natural human conversations.

c09b82e9b1cbdf04.ContentText: This, however, is only a simulation, and it does not mean that the automatons have actual emotional intelligence.

9821f751250482ec.ContentText: Given that automatons can still develop emotion modules using their own processing power, I have a backup plan in place.

03a0114843bdcdbd.ContentText: Improbable events that are easily disregarded frequently result in catastrophes.

84f14ab892eaeb15.ContentText: Mr. Svarog always takes all factors into account and handles problems logically... I can't do that myself yet.
84f14ab892eaeb15.Speaker: Clara

62ef0d1445b6b48e.ContentText: So, what should we do with Pascal?
62ef0d1445b6b48e.Speaker: Clara

02762536993bcf83.ContentText: It is recommended that Pascal's data be formatted and integrated into the base network.

45b7577206078330.ContentText: I will maintain the robot's core module and repair its hardware once it has been integrated into the base network.

cadab169c58ac9b1.ContentText: There is a greater than <unbreak>97.2%</unbreak> chance that this robot will return to normal after the bad sectors and muddled information are removed. However...

448d63605b85778e.ContentText: Once the formatting is complete, the robot's emotional intelligence will vanish.

e4ac6f0c0256df97.ContentText: But, once the formatting is complete, Pascal's emotional intelligence will vanish...
e4ac6f0c0256df97.Speaker: Clara

668fa104a8b9ae15.ContentText: This option minimizes both internal and external losses. Although Clara's account indicates that the robot is relatively stable, the assessment based on the computations shows that...

d51b851a56c0d9d3.ContentText: Both the risk of Pascal crashing and the amount of muddled information are increasing. When it approaches <unbreak>100%</unbreak>...

c77def1c5d506323.ContentText: But I don't think I'm ready to give up on Pascal just yet.
c77def1c5d506323.Speaker: Clara

19e53d23656d46da.ContentText: We've helped Pascal find compatible hardware. If we can eliminate the muddled information without damaging the sectors linked to his emotional intelligence...
19e53d23656d46da.Speaker: Clara

539453229a4e8fca.ContentText: You know the chances of that are incredibly low, Clara.

73e95b2b93d158dd.ContentText: No, I can't just give up. There has to be another way!
73e95b2b93d158dd.Speaker: Clara

d9ab712c042600cd.ContentText: There's only one way to completely remove muddled information — overwriting.

6ac75734e2898c3c.ContentText: When the muddled information is removed, the base network will create a comprehensive backup and overwrite the data stored in the corresponding sector.

d7ccfef9a321ebaf.ContentText: It's okay, Mr. Svarog and I can come up with a solution.
d7ccfef9a321ebaf.Speaker: Clara

376f74aa07a43eff.ContentText: (Svarog thinks that formatting Pascal's data and integrating him into the base's network is necessary, but doing so will deprive Pascal of his special emotional intelligence.)
376f74aa07a43eff.Speaker: playerboy

c4a62b517bdb45ec.ContentText: (Although it may sound cruel, this approach best prevents Pascal from posing a threat...)
c4a62b517bdb45ec.Speaker: playerboy

87e40a8f7ce2e256.ContentText: (Clara thinks she can use programming to control Pascal's behavior and prevent him from causing harm while keeping his emotional intelligence intact. However, this doesn't address the root of the issue, and it also requires Clara to devote much time and effort to Pascal.)
87e40a8f7ce2e256.Speaker: playerboy

e6488eea74751428.ContentText: (Although Clara will use Pascal's emotional intelligence to help guide him in the right direction, Pascal could still go out of control in the future.)
e6488eea74751428.Speaker: playerboy

bbc1a7b61466ddc2.ContentText: (In addition, Pascal has a history of stealing, even though he never caused any harm to anyone. This is also a major concern.)
bbc1a7b61466ddc2.Speaker: playerboy

06d2514ca1f7e384.ContentText: (What is most important here? I need to think carefully and choose one solution, then persuade the other person.)
06d2514ca1f7e384.Speaker: playerboy

c14b5c8cacef9e85.ContentText: Clara proposed that you should choose, outsider. I respect her wish.

146ecea55f305a16.ContentText: Have you made a decision about how to handle Pascal?

c23e309e574231ff.ContentText: I understand. You can make a decision after you've thought about it more.

02f5a2b66edc82f8.ContentText: I had anticipated this possibility. Tell me what you think.

84b2fcae2b7ca079.ContentText: I understand. Over the past <unbreak>700</unbreak> years, there has never been an automaton that has developed emotional intelligence through its own computational power. Pascal is an intriguing subject worth researching.

0455aec8198c462a.ContentText: However, in my opinion, protecting humanity's safety and property is more important than research.

8942e0bfd8e1b933.ContentText: I understand. You believe that Pascal's emotional intelligence, derived from his own computational power, is no different from mine.

f7790d5aea43e1a1.ContentText: I am currently still unable to conduct a thorough analysis of human empathy. However, I recognize the importance of respecting such emotions.

4d10b361f516f420.ContentText: I understand. I also do not detect any hostility from him.

f65021493fc39687.ContentText: However, the risk remains, and there is no guarantee that the robot will not lose control again and cause harm to humans in the future.

9d3dff52bbb0a8fe.ContentText: The prior assessment remains valid. The risk of error and the amount of muddled information in this robot is increasing, and has the potential to cause future security concerns.

07922d382fe7f66d.ContentText: Clara believes in you as a variable. Either way, your input will be taken into account.

9c141341112eaadc.ContentText: I'll keep gathering information and calculating new possibilities. Do you have any other insights, outsider?

5b26c128f96700f3.ContentText: "Clara's determination." This entry contains information that is difficult to quantify and may cause computational difficulties.

d99f8f313cf4b6ea.ContentText: Nonetheless, real experience has demonstrated that Clara's determination can often overcome all challenges.

59fcdd174ee51039.ContentText: I understand. You and Clara both agree on this point.

d4d9831f8f61c9b8.ContentText: Protecting a consciousness created by artificial intelligence. I shall give this more consideration.

6dab97852c5423a0.ContentText: People Clara's age do not usually take on overwhelming social responsibilities.

1813f17e21811121.ContentText: To ensure that Clara grows up well, I've always avoided overburdening her.

bdd8e375f2edd87e.ContentText: But if Clara insists on taking on such responsibilities, then I have no right to object.

16eb056c7700c607.ContentText: There is no need to discuss this any further. If you insist on using Clara's solution, the Svarog base network will completely support you.

bcaef764486bda5c.ContentText: It's all up to you. I'll be waiting for you right here.

18f4ab282af4c359.ContentText: What should we do with Pascal?
18f4ab282af4c359.Speaker: Clara

447e77461dfa38c1.ContentText: Okay. I'll think about it some more too.
447e77461dfa38c1.Speaker: Clara

237c1ca7f36c1c07.ContentText: But I'd like to know why you went with Mr. Svarog's solution.
237c1ca7f36c1c07.Speaker: Clara

6a87c7cb81fed7d1.ContentText: Do you truly believe that, {F#big sister}{M#big brother}?
6a87c7cb81fed7d1.Speaker: Clara

3dd6fd2eb8e4577c.ContentText: I understand that crimes should be punished, but I think Pascal deserves another chance.
3dd6fd2eb8e4577c.Speaker: Clara

a82b2b142d1ba413.ContentText: He only wants everyone to return safely to Rivet Town and live their peaceful lives like before.
a82b2b142d1ba413.Speaker: Clara

233ef91c6dc7e40a.ContentText: I think that anyone with emotion should be treated with dignity, regardless of whether they are a human or robot.
233ef91c6dc7e40a.Speaker: Clara

f859c704f3b793d9.ContentText: I'm confident that I can prevent Pascal from stealing and harming others.
f859c704f3b793d9.Speaker: Clara

de130ac918198134.ContentText: However, I respect your point of view. I admit I might not be as rational as Mr. Svarog, and don't think things through as much...
de130ac918198134.Speaker: Clara

28dc2b6c6c64ee6a.ContentText: So, could you please talk more about your point of view? I'd like to hear some different perspectives.
28dc2b6c6c64ee6a.Speaker: Clara

5e7e1a68a73fb7cb.ContentText: I said I will stay with Pascal until the end, but I'm actually scared too.
5e7e1a68a73fb7cb.Speaker: Clara

b5088c815c654f54.ContentText: I can't imagine it... How will I feel when I have to face Pascal after being forgotten so many times?
b5088c815c654f54.Speaker: Clara

5fa7467a51c06f25.ContentText: What if I feel like giving up? What happens then?
5fa7467a51c06f25.Speaker: Clara

b631b89306e606b6.ContentText: Perhaps it's best to let go now, while my feelings for Pascal aren't as strong?
b631b89306e606b6.Speaker: Clara

0f439a898af8881f.ContentText: Mr. Svarog's warnings about the potential risks do make me nervous.
0f439a898af8881f.Speaker: Clara

2675e69bd3324c19.ContentText: Did Mr. Svarog consider that for me? Maybe I shouldn't disappoint him...
2675e69bd3324c19.Speaker: Clara

515b18b34d429d4a.ContentText: Mr. Svarog believes Pascal will harm someone else eventually... which is why he keeps telling me to let go.
515b18b34d429d4a.Speaker: Clara

d2e24aab09b4e753.ContentText: No, I don't think so. Humans and machines should coexist as equals. Isn't Mr. Svarog also a machine?
d2e24aab09b4e753.Speaker: Clara

a23fc5c85d7d3212.ContentText: Are you trying to say... equality means you have to consider others' interests first?
a23fc5c85d7d3212.Speaker: Clara

3e8476d6f7cd23f3.ContentText: I see. Maybe Mr. Svarog believes Pascal will harm someone else eventually, which is why he keeps telling me to let go.
3e8476d6f7cd23f3.Speaker: Clara

7f71c8ef0f94cddc.ContentText: True. Mr. Svarog is always there for me.
7f71c8ef0f94cddc.Speaker: Clara

eaefe2e62e4e196d.ContentText: Maybe Mr. Svarog believes Pascal will harm someone else eventually, which is why he keeps telling me to let go.
eaefe2e62e4e196d.Speaker: Clara

966f6230026cf726.ContentText: I appreciate you taking the time to speak with me. This decision is much harder than I expected, but I've finally made my mind up.
966f6230026cf726.Speaker: Clara

d9add6f73e29b987.ContentText: If you feel it's necessary, we'll do what Mr. Svarog suggested... But until you're sure, I'll keep trying to find a way to save Pascal's emotions and memories...
d9add6f73e29b987.Speaker: Clara

52b62b9c92415a7c.ContentText: Tell me when you're ready to make a decision.
52b62b9c92415a7c.Speaker: Clara

dad6c308e8aa04a1.ContentText: Okay... I need some time to emotionally prepare myself anyway.
dad6c308e8aa04a1.Speaker: Clara

360d8f60fe7b0801.ContentText: Already, arrive, target! Waiting, further, instructions!

fa3a73547431e66a.ContentText: Accessing. Preparing to back up all core module data.

239dd0f98ce23786.ContentText: Pascal, good, waiting! Waiting, further, instructions!

49ed56b2a71fd115.ContentText: Now... please be a good boy and don't move.
49ed56b2a71fd115.Speaker: Clara

c4941cbae76f3184.ContentText: Pascal, we've got Mr. Svarog to help treat your illness. He'll help you recover.
c4941cbae76f3184.Speaker: Clara

f5746742c69ef938.ContentText: Understood. The protective programs are ready for installation...

182778abb0ec2a32.ContentText: I hope I made the right decision...
182778abb0ec2a32.Speaker: Clara

7a97c13a86223fb9.ContentText: The programs were successfully installed. The robot will require offline maintenance and will be unable to communicate for some time. We can return to it later.

c86e2a52963421ec.ContentText: ...I see. In that case, let's go back to the base.
c86e2a52963421ec.Speaker: Clara

a2811f66389cebc0.ContentText: (I think it's over... I'll check in with Clara later to see what's up.)
a2811f66389cebc0.Speaker: playerboy

ac2066e6a30f8930.ContentText: Oh, it's you! I wanted to show you something... These little fellas.
ac2066e6a30f8930.Speaker: Clara

9a79428279650748.ContentText: Hello, hello, hello! Long time no see!

508e9632524e97a3.ContentText: Long time no see! Today, weather, great!

79150af1a2a42262.ContentText: Thank, you! Long time, no see! {NICKNAME} friend, Clara friend!

eacd188f6e71a082.ContentText: Yes, that's what I was talking about... Something strange has happened.
eacd188f6e71a082.Speaker: Clara

44150a85f2b1cd4b.ContentText: Mr. Svarog helped to format Pascal and integrate him into the base network, but after that...
44150a85f2b1cd4b.Speaker: Clara

60d2b37873eed1f4.ContentText: ...I discovered that whenever I mentioned your name to Mr. Svarog, these guys at the base would get really happy.
60d2b37873eed1f4.Speaker: Clara

0c0cd6b91ea46199.ContentText: Look how excited they are about you! I've never met anyone for the first time that was so happy to see me...
0c0cd6b91ea46199.Speaker: Clara

9bc8a8b052581c36.ContentText: I was wondering... is it because they share Pascal's emotions?
9bc8a8b052581c36.Speaker: Clara

f4da8aa6d66a9d9f.ContentText: Yeah, it's like Pascal is always with us.
f4da8aa6d66a9d9f.Speaker: Clara

4e250ce2e0efaf3c.ContentText: It's a nice feeling... just like the one I had before.
4e250ce2e0efaf3c.Speaker: Clara

bd0926da028c23cd.ContentText: That's what Mr. Svarog said. He said Pascal's emotional intelligence was like a virus that infected the entire base network at some point.
bd0926da028c23cd.Speaker: Clara

c8975b4e33e6603b.ContentText: Don't worry, {F#big sister}{M#big brother}. I don't think it's a bad thing, because...
c8975b4e33e6603b.Speaker: Clara

94c63871f367ba92.ContentText: ...Mr. Svarog chose not to get rid of it. Isn't that the most convincing proof?
94c63871f367ba92.Speaker: Clara

021f5f919a292b20.ContentText: ...Oh, it's you! I'm just doing a checkup on Pascal.
021f5f919a292b20.Speaker: Clara

c7802a8a93f014ef.ContentText: He's been doing great — Mr. Svarog's programs are extremely effective... It's just hard to know if it will last...
c7802a8a93f014ef.Speaker: Clara

df667d4e04d98b8e.ContentText: Would you like to speak with Pascal?
df667d4e04d98b8e.Speaker: Clara

86f4d54cff5eae10.ContentText: Protect, Rivet Town! Waiting, everybody, come back, live, together!

49d6c4ce13e49934.ContentText: No, Pascal! Clara, say, wrong, stealing!

a31efec498253f85.ContentText: Pascal, not, again, steal! Carry out, Clara, mission!

af625ef6079bea8a.ContentText: Thank you, {NICKNAME}! Your, life, happy! Pascal, happy!

b606f69ba39c2f69.ContentText: Oh, I tried to fix Pascal's language module by installing a new chip.
b606f69ba39c2f69.Speaker: Clara

5cf4dca51f894e28.ContentText: ...It didn't seem to make much difference though. Still, at least we can understand what he's saying... I'll leave him alone for now.
5cf4dca51f894e28.Speaker: Clara

f34c52b55ebf01ab.ContentText: Not, not quite, running, smoothly! Very, apologies!

b7301aad4e1cd963.ContentText: Hehe, you're in good health, Pascal. Today's checkup is over — shall we head back now?
b7301aad4e1cd963.Speaker: Clara

66869ee616b24179.ContentText: Flower, flower, flower, for you — don't forget.

f64270dd4a65fb16.ContentText: Pascal, make, make myself! Scraps, parts, materials! Not stolen, very clean.

e8a04370607f76f8.ContentText: Thank you, thank you! Thank you, Clara, {NICKNAME}!

1c4eb3a6d1b65bcf.ContentText: Umm... {F#big sister}{M#big brother}, would you like a flower?
1c4eb3a6d1b65bcf.Speaker: Clara

fc7a55fa46b0a13a.ContentText: (My choice will have a direct impact on the outcome... I should mull it over.)
fc7a55fa46b0a13a.Speaker: playerboy

a312c3b5e8258b69.ContentText: Look, Pascal's over there! Who's standing next to it?
a312c3b5e8258b69.Speaker: Clara

32ce95ad1bd94506.ContentText: Huh? Isn't that a Grizzly robot? Let's go take a look!
32ce95ad1bd94506.Speaker: Clara

b48bf7a4d87970ef.ContentText: Pascal! Who did this to you?
b48bf7a4d87970ef.Speaker: Clara

b73c1b17fe15d2c9.ContentText: Clara, get away. This is a Fragmentum creature. It's extremely dangerous.

8662299de5569d64.ContentText: A Fragmentum creature!? What are you talking about?
8662299de5569d64.Speaker: Clara

c8b54f06ee69b84f.ContentText: Reanalysis complete. The original assessment stands. This is a Fragmentum creature, and is thus extremely dangerous.

08556395a22413f5.ContentText: How is that possible? Pascal is obviously a robot, just like you!
08556395a22413f5.Speaker: Clara

45ce00fd87478f44.ContentText: I am on a standard patrol mission. I have not received any other orders from the network hub.

81d2058c37f11692.ContentText: It's telling the truth... Mr. Svarog made a promise to me, and he never betrays his promises.
81d2058c37f11692.Speaker: Clara

03c67783f4c09fdb.ContentText: Could it have malfunctioned? It appears to be normal...
03c67783f4c09fdb.Speaker: Clara

c7c23af54416b8d5.ContentText: Please step back. I shall eliminate this Fragmentum creature...

96259a008e55bb90.ContentText: No, it's going to attack Pascal! We have to stop it!
96259a008e55bb90.Speaker: Clara

17e2f3f84af5d911.ContentText: Oh no! It seems to think we're its enemies as well...
17e2f3f84af5d911.Speaker: Clara

b9b60d6d1000299f.ContentText: Phew... Luckily, the patrol robot and Pascal's cores are still intact. The big fella's shell is only slightly dented... Thank you for your help.
b9b60d6d1000299f.Speaker: Clara

05733590d95d0896.ContentText: The only thing that puzzles me is why the big fella mistook Pascal for a Fragmentum creature.
05733590d95d0896.Speaker: Clara

75b76399a5a94ef9.ContentText: Hmm, I can't figure it out... Well, let's not worry about that now.
75b76399a5a94ef9.Speaker: Clara

f3fa09a1e9093178.ContentText: Anyway, I'll take this core back and examine it. Now, let's insert Pascal's core into the big fella's shell.
f3fa09a1e9093178.Speaker: Clara

1b359b2c02dd81b9.ContentText: Testing, verifying, all modules, working, connected.

8783836ccc1e1417.ContentText: Welcome, back, everyone, finally. Pascal, has been, waiting!

57dda56ff859b6e2.ContentText: Um... No, there's one more thing... We still need to find out why Pascal was stealing parts in the first place.
57dda56ff859b6e2.Speaker: Clara

6f8c5f06af47ecc9.ContentText: Oh, I almost forgot. Thank you for reminding me!
6f8c5f06af47ecc9.Speaker: Clara

59078981a2dba6b4.ContentText: Hmm... We still need to ask Pascal why he was stealing parts in the first place.
59078981a2dba6b4.Speaker: Clara

120aa7cb9687d547.ContentText: Pascal... Could you please, uh... explain why you were stealing parts...?
120aa7cb9687d547.Speaker: Clara

bc5f85d51559c2be.ContentText: Workshop? Oh, do you mean the Tempering Workshop in Rivet Town?
bc5f85d51559c2be.Speaker: Clara

8c136f7e79833b31.ContentText: Been, waiting, repair. Follow, please, Pascal!

e73775058c16b1c8.ContentText: He went in that direction... I think he wants us to follow him!
e73775058c16b1c8.Speaker: Clara

a67f42ed747b1a0f.ContentText: Up ahead... Is that an abandoned restaurant?
a67f42ed747b1a0f.Speaker: Clara

24c1e0f5b7daef26.ContentText: I think this place used to be a restaurant. One time, I found a bunch of canned food here... The vagrants in the camp were so happy.
24c1e0f5b7daef26.Speaker: Clara

2032f4e40a777b04.ContentText: The light here... Why is it still on? This place has clearly been abandoned for a long time...
2032f4e40a777b04.Speaker: Clara

83a3e28d80ad2e1b.ContentText: Also, there's dust all over the place, but none of the equipment appears to be deteriorating.
83a3e28d80ad2e1b.Speaker: Clara

73c650d4d3f473b2.ContentText: I don't think so... No one should be living here. I never saw anyone when I came here to hunt for supplies.
73c650d4d3f473b2.Speaker: Clara

09d73f40e6f93631.ContentText: Ah!? Are you saying we're... not alone...?
09d73f40e6f93631.Speaker: Clara

84b3e5492775efb0.ContentText: No, no, no... Ghosts don't exist...
84b3e5492775efb0.Speaker: Clara

189c1d085e63236a.ContentText: Anyway, someone must be looking after this place. But who?
189c1d085e63236a.Speaker: Clara

db10a118329d175c.ContentText: Pascal's trail leads in that direction. Let's follow it.
db10a118329d175c.Speaker: Clara

468ebb0f515662ed.ContentText: Hey, this is the Tempering Workshop. And look, Pascal is here.
468ebb0f515662ed.Speaker: Clara

c3aee34b4d344103.ContentText: Look, isn't it, shiny? Job, Pascal, done, nice!

dc3a8d29dd1f157e.ContentText: Huh? Could it be... Pascal has been repairing this abandoned town?
dc3a8d29dd1f157e.Speaker: Clara

6ad3b154c9507a3a.ContentText: Pascal, repair, indeed! Waiting, been, everyone.

c4d8cf5cf7b63f3d.ContentText: Parts, Pascal, collect, non-stop. Rivet Town, repair, non-stop!

354caf2061320307.ContentText: It seems that Pascal was stealing parts because he wants to repair the town.
354caf2061320307.Speaker: Clara

595ab565d8fcf46c.ContentText: Waiting, everyone, Pascal, non-stop! Leave, everyone, come back, one day!

8c0d4139168560a0.ContentText: Has Pascal been waiting for Rivet Town's evacuated residents to return?
8c0d4139168560a0.Speaker: Clara

28bb732b07051f0f.ContentText: Repair, been, every day, Pascal! Use, can, everyone, return!

36759b320bb24e21.ContentText: Pascal has been looking after the town so that everyone can go back to their previous lives when they return...
36759b320bb24e21.Speaker: Clara

a6fe11334a64f426.ContentText: Workshop, Tempering, here. Base, Pascal, secret!

14cd11374e47014a.ContentText: Parts, store! Enemies, not here. Place, safe. Scared, no need, everybody!

77b9acc4c020bba2.ContentText: Ahh. This appears to be the secret base where Pascal keeps the parts.
77b9acc4c020bba2.Speaker: Clara

25bf1ebdb8603deb.ContentText: Although we now know why he took them, there are still many unanswered questions. For example...
25bf1ebdb8603deb.Speaker: Clara

72598292d33f8d5b.ContentText: Right. But I don't think Pascal will give us a straightforward answer on this one...
72598292d33f8d5b.Speaker: Clara

f065109b16700412.ContentText: Hmm... I wonder if we can find any clues here?
f065109b16700412.Speaker: Clara

261200b055da6919.ContentText: ...Right. That bigger robot said that, how strange...
261200b055da6919.Speaker: Clara

1b169397651f4def.ContentText: ...Right. Pascal is doing this out of good will, but still...
1b169397651f4def.Speaker: Clara

a161a0bbfa583286.ContentText: Stealing is always wrong, and Pascal needs to learn that.
a161a0bbfa583286.Speaker: Clara

4350f90c6eeb9e2d.ContentText: Let's take a look around again, {F#big sister}{M#big brother}. I'm still not finished here.
4350f90c6eeb9e2d.Speaker: Clara

9654432f0ab94b53.ContentText: Rivet Town, live, Clara, {NICKNAME}! Tour, feel free, please!

b893b4ce429197a8.ContentText: This must be the result of Pascal's meticulous repairs... but the little fella doesn't really need the monitor, does he?
b893b4ce429197a8.Speaker: Clara
