12cef2d6712522e3.ContentText: Hmm... Hey! Those look like handprints on the side of the cabinet — human handprints. Could this monitor have been recently used by someone?
12cef2d6712522e3.Speaker: Clara

653640dd7942059a.ContentText: These pages are so neatly cut out... Oh, and they smell like Geomarrow Fuel.
653640dd7942059a.Speaker: Clara

f63e54c7cadfae54.ContentText: Is there someone here in Rivet Town doing this...? Or could Pascal have collected the pages and put them together?
f63e54c7cadfae54.Speaker: Clara

466bf0b89179ea02.ContentText: Wow. Such neat handwriting... no, wait a minute, I think this was printed onto the cover...
466bf0b89179ea02.Speaker: Clara

f04f7419b43d3ad8.ContentText: Let me think... How about we go over Pascal's whole story again, from the start?
f04f7419b43d3ad8.Speaker: Clara

d5a370a493a27ed4.ContentText: So Pascal used to be a robot guardian of Rivet Town...
d5a370a493a27ed4.Speaker: Clara

7f18fe8bde7ce74b.ContentText: Pascal's backup power was activated for some reason shortly after the residents were evacuated...
7f18fe8bde7ce74b.Speaker: Clara

25d10c955a3cba82.ContentText: It woke up to discover that the whole place had been abandoned. So, it decided to collect parts, repair the town, and wait for everyone to return...
25d10c955a3cba82.Speaker: Clara

4710cabf0a6f7b99.ContentText: However, for some reason, Pascal keeps getting attacked by his fellow robots, because the automatons think he's a Fragmentum creature.
4710cabf0a6f7b99.Speaker: Clara

c55370c74dcf5e18.ContentText: I'm not sure, but I suspect Pascal's tormented sense of self stems from him being constantly attacked by his fellow robots.
c55370c74dcf5e18.Speaker: Clara

2fde7eacc235b79f.ContentText: The module used to detect emotions was frequently damaged, eventually turning him into a small robot that did nothing but collect parts.
2fde7eacc235b79f.Speaker: Clara

d6cc9cb63e233636.ContentText: At least, that's my theory. Still, that doesn't explain why Pascal is being treated as a Fragmentum creature...
d6cc9cb63e233636.Speaker: Clara

f80d1adfee573dcd.ContentText: I don't know... I can't find the answer in Pascal's diary.
f80d1adfee573dcd.Speaker: Clara

892900e8ccbac93c.ContentText: Pascal, why do your peers keep rejecting you...
892900e8ccbac93c.Speaker: Clara

9ae42f40b81e724d.ContentText: Pascal, collect parts, ready, continue! Or, wait, instruction, next!

0426fcd2809dbfa6.ContentText: Pascal's consciousness does not appear to have returned to the level shown in the diary...
0426fcd2809dbfa6.Speaker: Clara

85e45eca3d3dea8f.ContentText: I see. Thank you so much, Pascal.
85e45eca3d3dea8f.Speaker: Clara

c69c90e254d98248.ContentText: You can stop gathering parts for the time being. Just stay here and wait for us to return and give you your next orders, alright?
c69c90e254d98248.Speaker: Clara

aa156f7d2e46608d.ContentText: {F#Big sister}{M#Big brother}, let's go back to Mr. Svarog and talk about what to do next.
aa156f7d2e46608d.Speaker: Clara

0dccd687d91a124d.ContentText: This is Madam Herta, or better known as member <unbreak>83</unbreak> of the Genius Society. In her childhood, she solved the solitary waves theory and the Spark model hypothesis. In her adolescence, she found the Sigma Baryons conversion method. In middle-age, she proposed the Herta sequence and published a paper on de-aging.
0dccd687d91a124d.Speaker: Herta

87b5b87e6f42a14a.ContentText: In her senior years, she managed to reverse her own age via de-aging, and went on to solve the mystery of the imaginary leakage phenomenon, and even captured and sealed a stellaron. Madam Herta has saved the planet she was on from destruction <unbreak>19</unbreak> times and has met the Aeons twice.
87b5b87e6f42a14a.Speaker: Herta

093cea762bb4eb53.ContentText: This space station is her property.
093cea762bb4eb53.Speaker: Herta

4fe45cb19b643400.ContentText: Oh, Elias Salas, such a lovely old fellow. He is Member <unbreak>56</unbreak> of the Genius Society, one of the only two publicly elected Ministers in the Society's history. Be grateful to him! He created the Synesthesia Beacons and over-range remote sensing, the cornerstones of modern cosmic communication.
4fe45cb19b643400.Speaker: Herta

a8f636a81f76a801.ContentText: However, he did not disclose his inventions to the public, so I hereby certify that the rights of these two technologies belong to the Intelligentsia Guild. To be honest, I am not a big fan of the Guild, but it is impressive that they managed to reproduce Elias Salas' inventions.
a8f636a81f76a801.Speaker: Herta

4b54289fedfe935e.ContentText: Polka Kakamond, member 4 of the Genius Society. A woman full of mystery. Many people in the Society died by her hand. I haven't heard anything about her for many years, but I firmly believe she is still alive.
4b54289fedfe935e.Speaker: Herta

f923ca98e610d767.ContentText: Hey, Lord of Silence, if you're here, if you're listening... I'm member <unbreak>83</unbreak>, Herta, and I want to meet you. I believe you and I will have a lot to talk about.
f923ca98e610d767.Speaker: Herta

eb632c4c7e655354.ContentText: Zandar One Kuwabara, Genius Society member 1. I hung up his portrait purely out of respect. Without him, there would be no Genius Society today.
eb632c4c7e655354.Speaker: Herta

9601e64573c07325.ContentText: Frankly, I don't know what he has achieved. None of his books and inventions have survived, but there's gotta be a place for the founder of the Society, right?
9601e64573c07325.Speaker: Herta

07f3ca5b24aac7e3.ContentText: This is Aiden, member <unbreak>22</unbreak> of the Genius Society. The most selfless and the strangest one. He spent his whole life helping others. Personally, I don't see the point.
07f3ca5b24aac7e3.Speaker: Herta

5a5b18622cc7aa9a.ContentText: But the Society is famous thanks to him. The Interastral Peace Corporation has been trying to find a replacement ever since his death. They searched for many Amber Eras, but no genius was willing to lower their head to the IPC... Until they found me.
5a5b18622cc7aa9a.Speaker: Herta

b7c6366a5e10989d.ContentText: Member <unbreak>76</unbreak> of the Genius Society, Screwllum. I have known him for a long time. He is a really good man, a gentleman with an exceptional mechanical mind. I have learned a lot from him.
b7c6366a5e10989d.Speaker: Herta

48e21c733c7424cc.ContentText: Recently, I have been working with him and Ruan Mei on a project! I hope this project can help us get closer to the greatest mystery of the universe...
48e21c733c7424cc.Speaker: Herta

222462bb09c2a124.ContentText: She looks so young. She was already famous in the last Amber Era, no? She has to be at least a hundred years old.
222462bb09c2a124.Speaker: Kafka

07fce77e98ac7401.ContentText: She's a member of the Genius Society and an Emanator of Nous the Erudition. She can probably age backwards if she wanted.
07fce77e98ac7401.Speaker: Silver Wolf

09ca373c0d408a5b.ContentText: She's a member of the Genius Society and an Emanator of Nous the Erudition. She can probably age backwards if she wanted.
09ca373c0d408a5b.Speaker: Silver Wolf

a4189cb2c691cab5.ContentText: Hah. I seem to recall that over half of the Genius Society's eighty-odd members had a normal death. Wasn't there someone who only lived for a dozen days or so? What was their name...
a4189cb2c691cab5.Speaker: Kafka

7fe5c493d581f938.ContentText: That's pretty normal. Aren't the immortal bosses in games always waiting for the protagonist to come kill them? Immortality is not always a good thing.
7fe5c493d581f938.Speaker: Silver Wolf

87d5c54450710112.ContentText: That's pretty normal. Aren't the immortal bosses in games always waiting for the protagonist to come kill them? Immortality is not always a good thing.
87d5c54450710112.Speaker: Silver Wolf

53b430c1ffc89daf.ContentText: Herta... Have you ever met her? I'm curious about the tastes of someone who used their own name for a space station.
53b430c1ffc89daf.Speaker: Kafka

a916836e00a575e9.ContentText: Never seen the real one. Saw plenty of her portraits, though.
a916836e00a575e9.Speaker: Silver Wolf

3ed4fcd30c918f29.ContentText: Who's this old guy with a white beard?
3ed4fcd30c918f29.Speaker: Kafka

95cc6eebc213f8da.ContentText: ...I know this person. She's the Lord of Silence, Polka Kakamond. See? Her face is all blank. She had destroyed all of her own portraits and sculptures in the entire universe...
95cc6eebc213f8da.Speaker: Kafka

ae53e0cf174e026d.ContentText: I'm not interested. Hurry up with our real business.
ae53e0cf174e026d.Speaker: Silver Wolf

ba8fb75cf0f95b6f.ContentText: I'm not interested. Hurry up with our real business.
ba8fb75cf0f95b6f.Speaker: Silver Wolf

436520e4b9f71523.ContentText: This is Zandar. Zandar One Kuwabara. The first genius in history.
436520e4b9f71523.Speaker: Kafka

d368d0b7dc5caf94.ContentText: The one who supposedly created Nous?
d368d0b7dc5caf94.Speaker: Silver Wolf

38d2556534592f86.ContentText: The one who supposedly created Nous?
38d2556534592f86.Speaker: Silver Wolf

88ef0d7e92ca4d91.ContentText: That's him... If the legends are true, then he was a man who created an Aeon.
88ef0d7e92ca4d91.Speaker: Kafka

2f401b10e30ab93b.ContentText: Well they better be false. I don't want to be a Zandar hunter.
2f401b10e30ab93b.Speaker: Silver Wolf

5a12138ee48bf09d.ContentText: Well they better be false. I don't want to be a Zandar hunter.
5a12138ee48bf09d.Speaker: Silver Wolf

dc83a16f5c4958f7.ContentText: Hey! Silver Wolf! Look! It's Screwllum, your good old opponent.
dc83a16f5c4958f7.Speaker: Kafka

fed181c23f02b104.ContentText: Hahhhh... I told you already. I didn't know it was him...
fed181c23f02b104.Speaker: Silver Wolf

8ed83582af6162b6.ContentText: Hahhhh... I told you already. I didn't know it was him...
8ed83582af6162b6.Speaker: Silver Wolf

57603f779cc604ee.ContentText: Ah, that battle was how Elio got his eyes on you. Imagine, someone actually able to crack Screwllum's code! First Screwllum, then Herta... there's probably no one else in the universe who offended two genii in such quick succession. It must be destiny.
57603f779cc604ee.Speaker: Kafka

047de0a3ea1d9fdd.ContentText: Urgh... Seems like I'm the real Destiny's Slave here.
047de0a3ea1d9fdd.Speaker: Silver Wolf

e7ea17793373e41f.ContentText: Urgh... Seems like I'm the real Destiny's Slave here.
e7ea17793373e41f.Speaker: Silver Wolf

7d5f0993bf0d8a98.ContentText: Who knows what's in the brains of those following the Erudition?
7d5f0993bf0d8a98.Speaker: Silver Wolf

cf2f6a7ca67976f7.ContentText: Of course, I'll still be here waiting for you, eh... and the space station will be waiting for you. Returning... it's not impossible.
cf2f6a7ca67976f7.Speaker: Herta

4a0c0884e6f622ee.ContentText: If you wanna be a researcher here, you can just ask Asta. If she's fine with it, I have no complaints.
4a0c0884e6f622ee.Speaker: Herta

7b9ad68bdcfa6b91.ContentText: No, hold on — you have a Stellaron within you. I think it's better if you left and came back occasionally. It might be dangerous if you stay for too long...
7b9ad68bdcfa6b91.Speaker: Herta

f9dd7c94205a4e10.ContentText: No. You're way too dangerous. I don't mind personally, but I don't want Asta and others to take the risk.
f9dd7c94205a4e10.Speaker: Herta

677e5a1786c5325b.ContentText: You wouldn't want the Stellaron in you to hurt all the people in the space station either, right?
677e5a1786c5325b.Speaker: Herta

e589e81fc9f5a912.ContentText: Just come back once in a while. You will always be welcome at the space station — just don't stay for too long.
e589e81fc9f5a912.Speaker: Herta

93a247f064135bf2.ContentText: ...You really are weird. What's so good about this place? Even I don't like staying here...
93a247f064135bf2.Speaker: Herta

18fbb9e823c45a3b.ContentText: Ugh. Fine. To be honest with you, I have plenty of ways to seal a mere Stellaron — You just might end up not having a lot of personal freedom.
18fbb9e823c45a3b.Speaker: Herta

4373ebff9d77d944.ContentText: If you're so keen to stay... Fine. I'm okay with it. Go speak to Asta. She's the lead researcher. She's in charge.
4373ebff9d77d944.Speaker: Herta

c56825f75a4702d5.ContentText: As I've said, talk to Asta! She's the lead researcher. She's in charge. Go, go, go.
c56825f75a4702d5.Speaker: Herta

bcdd9cc1cc62883d.ContentText: In that case... I have nothing against it either. Mind you, if Madam Herta was to do something to you, {NICKNAME}...
bcdd9cc1cc62883d.Speaker: Asta

e75dee4827a6f6d8.ContentText: She's not going to care a lot about what you think.
e75dee4827a6f6d8.Speaker: Asta

9be626103c943d79.ContentText: Is that so... Well, I respect your choice.
9be626103c943d79.Speaker: Himeko

074032a214586194.ContentText: Take care, {NICKNAME}. We'll come back now and then to see you.
074032a214586194.Speaker: Himeko

5c4f98369f8ea0b2.ContentText: After careful deliberation, you decide to decline Himeko's invitation. With a long whistle, the Astral Express prepares to go ahead on its journey. The friends you just made wave goodbye to you, and your farewell is as sudden and final as your meeting.

8e15763d95c24795.ContentText: After the departure of the Express, the station begins to eagerly rebuild. Meanwhile, Herta and you get busy while researching the Stellaron. However, it doesn't take long before Herta loses interest in you and the Stellaron, and Asta arranges for you to become a researcher at the space station.

08bc3c45d611a804.ContentText: You spend a peaceful life on the space station. The Express visits a few times before disappearing for good. From the occasional visitors on the station, you hear stories about how the final end of the Express and the Stellaron Hunters shakes the universe to its very core. Sometimes you wonder whether their destiny would have changed, had you stepped onto that train.

8f088a4f4015470f.ContentText: But those stories are no longer for you.

50c5b44218adf8f3.ContentText: When did the Antimatter Legion become so weak?
50c5b44218adf8f3.Speaker: Kafka

ad3565b24def1c7c.ContentText: I could only attract this much. Did you really want the entire Legion to come here?
ad3565b24def1c7c.Speaker: Silver Wolf

c261e0dd2cf34a61.ContentText: This lot won't be able to slow down the Astral Express crew.
c261e0dd2cf34a61.Speaker: Kafka

24ce619bfef09ce6.ContentText: Relax. A Doomsday Beast is also here.
24ce619bfef09ce6.Speaker: Silver Wolf

303544638b556eff.ContentText: You came at a good time, {NICKNAME}, there is something you can help me with.
303544638b556eff.Speaker: Natasha

4e0dff4556187818.ContentText: According to my patient records, there are a few that haven't come for their follow-up visits. It happens from time to time, but never as regularly as this. I'm a bit concerned...
4e0dff4556187818.Speaker: Natasha

cfcb593d12b89599.ContentText: Have you heard of the Complex Illness Mutual Aid Society?
cfcb593d12b89599.Speaker: Natasha

07d38d09e6c6014b.ContentText: Generally speaking, mutual aid societies like these allow patients to share their experiences and support each other. It's a way of countering all the negative emotional effects of being ill... But there might be more to this society than that.
07d38d09e6c6014b.Speaker: Natasha

5e5dff229beb98d4.ContentText: I've got a few patients who've started refusing treatment since joining the society... It certainly makes you wonder.
5e5dff229beb98d4.Speaker: Natasha

08fcb91b9146b8a5.ContentText: The most suspicious part is that no matter how much I ask, no one's ever willing to tell me anything about it... and that's where you might be able to help.
08fcb91b9146b8a5.Speaker: Natasha

be4efb760b84d8de.ContentText: ...It sounds dangerous, but what I want you to do is actually very simple. Investigate this so-called "Mutual Aid Society" and find out what exactly they're up to.
be4efb760b84d8de.Speaker: Natasha

6c1e9d6f03971ce7.ContentText: ...That won't be necessary, but it will help if you pretend to be a patient. Help me investigate this so-called "Mutual Aid Society" and find out exactly what they're up to.
6c1e9d6f03971ce7.Speaker: Natasha

df0818ff51aeebf5.ContentText: Hmm... Pretend to be a patient. Help me investigate this so-called "Mutual Aid Society" and find out exactly what they're up to.
df0818ff51aeebf5.Speaker: Natasha

5d14df0794e17564.ContentText: If I find out they're preventing me from doing my job... or if they're bringing harm to my patients... I won't just sit on the sidelines.
5d14df0794e17564.Speaker: Natasha

bd952c069d3eb43b.ContentText: Can I entrust you with this task, {NICKNAME}?
bd952c069d3eb43b.Speaker: Natasha

79c5791f97b06369.ContentText: This little clinic has huge numbers of patients to deal with every day... If I didn't have you here to help me out, I wouldn't be able to focus on giving them quality care.
79c5791f97b06369.Speaker: Natasha

fc348dbd091609a4.ContentText: Good luck, {NICKNAME}. I'll be sure to thank you properly when you're back.
fc348dbd091609a4.Speaker: Natasha

a155585187d999fd.ContentText: You... I've seen you at the clinic. You run errands for Natasha, right?

47503a495973d4fa.ContentText: ...Your cover? What are you talking about?

9cc56c3fda7472c3.ContentText: ...Don't play dumb. I might be sick but my eyes still work.

e36d9e7b4a250270.ContentText: *sigh* Let me guess, Natasha wants you to persuade me to go back for a follow-up visit, right?

652af87306c51ff1.ContentText: *sigh* ...What's the use? I'm terminal. Life'll be over before I know it.

e243aa699fa2f6ce.ContentText: Of course not, I read it in a book.

64010c615c4321d7.ContentText: Every book I read has descriptions that match my symptoms exactly... I can diagnose myself with a dozen incurable diseases before I get halfway through.

7eebae162d24dac4.ContentText: For people in my situation, a follow-up visit is just a waste of time and money... not to mention medicine.

00dfe80de9f40455.ContentText: Mutual aid what now? What are you talking about?

72d0cc239adca513.ContentText: ...What else is there to say. Natasha was seeing me free of charge. She said I could keep a tab running for as long as I liked, then pay it back when I had the opportunity... I guess I'm too proud.

ede49a2bdb88e50a.ContentText: You think I need you to tell me? Don't try and persuade me, I've already thought this through...

73fab835455ea30d.ContentText: ...Are you making fun of me? Have at it, you won't change my mind.

087c9e3e26a5587c.ContentText: *sigh* ...Dr. Vache never charged me anything either. Natasha's great, but Vache was always my number one...

62b7ac4655389127.ContentText: Natasha's brother? They both used to practice medicine back in Rivet Town.

b4e90a4d5d28001e.ContentText: I heard he was a top student from the Overworld medical academy — Belobog's main hospital wanted him. I've no idea what convinced him to set up down here... a kind heart, maybe.

0f2418558bbb39c1.ContentText: What do you mean? Dr. Vache was a people's doctor — he handed out free medicine. He even followed up with detailed questions on how we felt.

b6123e5f07a8c5c0.ContentText: The Underworld is always short on medical resources — they say that Dr. Vache made all his own medicine himself.

fe6c9be13867758b.ContentText: You think I don't want to? I heard that he... passed away.

a524a9eab42749c2.ContentText: Uh... I should keep my voice down. Don't go telling anyone else about this next bit...

0129858dbf675da2.ContentText: I heard that Natasha had something to do with Dr. Vache's death. They say she was jealous that her brother had stolen her patients, so she...

af2ef786b7a6dfeb.ContentText: Agh, it's just something people were saying... I don't think Dr. Natasha could do something like that.

0252699f69e79b74.ContentText: ...Hey, it's just a rumor. Don't take my word for it.

5b9aa395ee2841c5.ContentText: *sigh* Forget I said anything. Since Dr. Natasha sent you over specially, I'll do her a favor.

b22515aea34dd956.ContentText: I'll go to the clinic for my follow-up a little later. Bye for now...

be09e9d152bf2342.ContentText: (Avoiding a follow-up visit due to money issues...)
be09e9d152bf2342.Speaker: playerboy

6f87f2604a168061.ContentText: (I should find another patient to talk to...)
6f87f2604a168061.Speaker: playerboy

491488420653c54e.ContentText: ...What was that? You'll have to be louder! My ears aren't what they used to be — everything's muffled.

cbfbd64b6d75ee71.ContentText: Hah? Follow-up visit? Is that what you're asking about?

03964a1841254143.ContentText: *sigh* Natasha's a wonderful girl. She always gives me a thorough checkup...

ae211821c024a37a.ContentText: But at this age, it's rather a lot to bear. Even if they could cure me, I'm sure I wouldn't be around for long. I don't want to waste anyone's time...

08263629ee8a687d.ContentText: Not for youngsters like yourself. When you get to my time of life, good health is a bit of a luxury I'm afraid.

99421c32ccedf3ac.ContentText: That girl's always trying to get me to take my medicine on time. *sigh* I know her heart's in the right place...

68a3d9f7faf7d24f.ContentText: My husband had the same illness as me, but he never touched the medicine. He wanted to make sure I had enough.

e6e678003e57a766.ContentText: Then one day, he said he needed to take care of some things at the mine. He never came back...

4e30d8439d0065e0.ContentText: He was forever saying he wanted to go before I did. Hehe... Selfish old fool...

fc00323c95122f61.ContentText: I miss him. Now that he's gone, who cares how long I stick around?

a1c52434667ef5be.ContentText: ...Do you think so? Wouldn't he want me to hurry up and join him...?

f770462ae7ad0847.ContentText: Hmph... Kids today don't give up easily.

9d353822b919ce9c.ContentText: ...You're not wrong, I suppose. That girl certainly spares me no effort, but I always feel like I'm a burden to her...

0c195219dab6432d.ContentText: You don't give up easily, do you? Still... you're full of kind words.

dabfb412e4de27aa.ContentText: Okay, you win. It's off for another follow-up visit with Dr. Natasha, I suppose...

5face60aa4339ab3.ContentText: Mm? Did you want to say something else? My ears are terrible...

5b1d01f8f6ce81f9.ContentText: Alright, I heard you! Do you have to shout? ...No, I've never heard of any mutual aid society...

e890d105b2cd59a8.ContentText: (Avoiding a follow-up visit due to her husband...)
e890d105b2cd59a8.Speaker: playerboy

7540ed9e2ccfbb57.ContentText: (I should find another patient to talk to...)
7540ed9e2ccfbb57.Speaker: playerboy

aaa0086f1d895db7.ContentText: Why haven't I gone for my follow-up visit... Are you a patient too, or did Dr. Natasha send you over?

d54f1a86976be8d0.ContentText: Who else would care about people like me?

570c747e540c0651.ContentText: Hah, you should head on back then. Thank Dr. Natasha for her concern.

3932b654a6bc6e5a.ContentText: I don't need Dr. Natasha's help now. Tell her to save her worries and medicine for other people.

e6cb684d9e9f8aa3.ContentText: A dispute? No, no, she's the only kindhearted doctor in the Underworld.

2452ba65b3840b8c.ContentText: I just don't really approve of her methods, that's all. Too idealistic, and no real efficacy...

9336d45cd520805d.ContentText: Huh? So you had a dispute with her?

71f7163324edbf46.ContentText: ...She's the only kindhearted doctor in the Underworld. I just don't really approve of her methods, that's all. Too idealistic, and no real efficacy...

f71a782ae471132f.ContentText: She tries to save everyone, which means she can't save anyone... In the end, it's the patients who suffer, and she just tires herself out.

65dc344092a58a6d.ContentText: Miners like me don't have time for lengthy treatments... If I can't take something and get right back to work, I may as well lie down and wait for death to come knocking...

fa5e1a4973ec3edc.ContentText: Did you know Dr. Vache? His wonder medicine is cheap and the results are immediate. You just need to be willing to... take a little risk.

b970c8315c2494f3.ContentText: Dr. Vache's medicine is... different. Lots of people make a full recovery after taking it... but some get worse, and the unlucky ones check out early.

37e996399fb24aea.ContentText: Even knowing the risk, most people fought tooth and nail to get a hold of the medicine. You know why?

55c314634d0175a1.ContentText: Hmph, you're smarter than you look.

ab5aba6a57d48820.ContentText: Hmph... you've clearly never been in really dire straits.

549a2851a2812a87.ContentText: When life forces you to the edge, you'll throw yourself at any opportunity... even if it means risking it all.

fb88065b1e6e3cfe.ContentText: For people like us, a slow and tortuous treatment is the same as a death sentence. If it's between that and a quick result, we'll take the latter.

f17843fe3030c745.ContentText: Ahem, forget it. Why am I telling you all this? Dr. Vache is dead, anyway...

98300a07abf020f4.ContentText: Hah, what, now you're interested in the wonder medicine?

0684ee36cd65d948.ContentText: Listen up... the Complex Illness Mutual Aid Society is still selling that medicine... I can tell you where they trade, but there's a rule...

b453882fc5765c09.ContentText: ...You must not tell any of this to Dr. Natasha, you hear? If you break the rule, you'll face the consequences!

440f5a26f92a16a6.ContentText: Here, take this, it's the address. A final warning — do not reveal this information to Natasha!

8a2c4caabb3b27d6.ContentText: (I know where to find the wonder medicine. What should I do next...?)
8a2c4caabb3b27d6.Speaker: playerboy

a29afcfe92249ff5.ContentText: (That patient didn't want me to tell Natasha about this... Should I listen to him?)
a29afcfe92249ff5.Speaker: playerboy

09814b16cb641d06.ContentText: So the mutual aid society found my bro— ...Vache's research results... and now they're selling this so-called "wonder medicine" to patients...?
09814b16cb641d06.Speaker: Natasha

2ac109407b96de1d.ContentText: Any organization doing something like that is interested in more than just "mutual aid..."
2ac109407b96de1d.Speaker: Natasha

bbdcef4959fa6a4c.ContentText: I'm not surprised. They'll know that I'm completely against them using this "wonder medicine..."
bbdcef4959fa6a4c.Speaker: Natasha

3ebc2fd35e65db50.ContentText: ...As a doctor, I don't accept that — I'm responsible for their well-being. My attitude towards this "wonder medicine" won't change.
3ebc2fd35e65db50.Speaker: Natasha

c07989cb1b05f8d1.ContentText: What Vache left behind is nothing more than reagents and experimental by-products... The word "medicine" doesn't apply here.
c07989cb1b05f8d1.Speaker: Natasha

924fbbc427e3252e.ContentText: I warned the patients countless times, but it seems like they had their heads in the sand all along... No wonder they kept the mutual aid society a secret from me.
924fbbc427e3252e.Speaker: Natasha

18eb3c692a7682b7.ContentText: Thank you, {NICKNAME}. Those patients weren't exactly singing my praises — thank you for having faith in me.
18eb3c692a7682b7.Speaker: Natasha

8dbfcfb27a7dfe0c.ContentText: If you're curious about Vache's wonder medicine, you should ask some of the patients in the clinic... see what they have to say about the effects.
8dbfcfb27a7dfe0c.Speaker: Natasha

8523c8ce0dbea559.ContentText: Hey, where do you think you're going?

18459ac5445588f6.ContentText: Medicine? Oh... you mean Dr. Vache's wonder medicine, right?

6df07cbbc5832e5f.ContentText: In the Fragmentum? Hmph, gimme a break.

13b56eb396eff494.ContentText: You're the same as everyone else that comes through here. If you want medicine, you don't need to go any further — you talk to me.

c1bb28ac8f2ff165.ContentText: And we only take cash, this ain't a charity...

67490aa4606d5a42.ContentText: The mutual aid society sets the price. It might be different from Dr. Vache and his handouts, but it's a darn sight cheaper than that clinic woman's medicine.

c090fc9ae4ad860b.ContentText: ...Well, are you buying or not? Spit it out. I don't have time for chit-chat.

78369f18b3eed640.ContentText: No money? Then you don't get any. You go home and wait for death.

d148790f38014a41.ContentText: ...Say, what are you trying to pull here? If you can't afford it, then get outta my sight. I've got medicine to sell.

43fc1c9f85ebcdaf.ContentText: Hmph, cut the small talk next time... my time is valuable.

bed8baa7c66879c6.ContentText: Huh? What are you gonna do about it? Either buy something or clear out.

2f1ce8b092b4bf29.ContentText: You sound like Vache. That isn't how the mutual aid society works.

d971ceba1186bae8.ContentText: Wait a minute, your clothes... Are you friends with that doctor woman? I've seen you at the clinic before — I know it!

93369c7ea232fc9b.ContentText: Get lost — now! If you're a friend of that woman then you're not welcome here! Shop's closed today, no customers!

5330de1d835e9b88.ContentText: ...W—Wait! What about our medicine? We've been waiting for ages...

11432a86e5652752.ContentText: Get lost! All of ya! Save your breath and come back some other time!

1279ac056bc4b7cf.ContentText: ...Th—This is all your fault! How are we supposed to get our wonder medicine now!?

90bc4a0daf248ce6.ContentText: You should leave — if you stay here that guy might not ever sell to us again...

c6ee6d6cba338b6c.ContentText: (That medicine seller sure shut up shop in a hurry...)
c6ee6d6cba338b6c.Speaker: playerboy

21ebc6f01c2c521b.ContentText: (I should head back and report to Natasha.)
21ebc6f01c2c521b.Speaker: playerboy

a29fcba16db660da.ContentText: So the mutual aid society found my bro— ...Vache's research results... and now they're selling this so-called "wonder medicine" to patients...?
a29fcba16db660da.Speaker: Natasha

50387d9a65997d23.ContentText: Any organization doing something like that is interested in more than just "mutual aid..."
50387d9a65997d23.Speaker: Natasha

f5fd3f923705f2e8.ContentText: I'm not surprised. They'll know that I'm completely against them using this "wonder medicine..."
f5fd3f923705f2e8.Speaker: Natasha

4ba85988b833f729.ContentText: ...As a doctor, I don't accept that — I'm responsible for their well-being. My attitude towards this "wonder medicine" won't change.
4ba85988b833f729.Speaker: Natasha

be073d9e697b1d07.ContentText: What Vache left behind is nothing more than reagents and experimental by-products... The word "medicine" doesn't apply here.
be073d9e697b1d07.Speaker: Natasha

64f51ba7e5682f7e.ContentText: I warned the patients countless times, but it seems like they had their heads in the sand all along... No wonder they kept the mutual aid society a secret from me.
64f51ba7e5682f7e.Speaker: Natasha

bf3029b013fb6821.ContentText: I'm guessing the patients you met weren't exactly singing my praises, which is why you tracked the dealer down and made inquiries first.
bf3029b013fb6821.Speaker: Natasha

90812e6e7484c9fc.ContentText: I don't blame you, {NICKNAME}. After everything you heard, I'm grateful you came back to find me. Your trust is important to me.
90812e6e7484c9fc.Speaker: Natasha

22dddd7e231e8773.ContentText: If you're curious about Vache's wonder medicine, you should ask some of the patients in the clinic... see what they have to say about the effects.
22dddd7e231e8773.Speaker: Natasha

c5d54104dec56b09.ContentText: The medicine Vache left behind? That stuff... Can you even call it medicine?

559112fc127925a6.ContentText: I know Dr. Natasha's here, but I have to tell it like it is... Vache had zero medical ethics — he didn't deserve the title "doctor."

d74e74f3cf19508f.ContentText: He may have had the capability, but he didn't use it to help anyone... Whenever I went to see him, he never even asked about my illness! He just prescribed me his so-called "wonder medicine..."

510226ea6515b184.ContentText: If it were you, would you have taken that medicine?

f3172b6368238fda.ContentText: Some people say that Dr. Vache was a saint who came from the Overworld to help those in need... I don't buy it.

4d1b496b9687a1dd.ContentText: "People's doctor..." That's just what people who've bought into the myth like to say. Vache used to distribute free medicine all the time, but, uh... he couldn't have cared less about the people taking the medicine...

de372f7474eb2d0c.ContentText: The hard truth is that we were just his test subjects. It didn't matter if the medicine worked or not. What mattered was having a constant stream of willing lab rats...

64847d7ddef07f37.ContentText: ...Of course, I can't control what anyone else thinks. That's just how I see it.

a156ab8666ac3d6a.ContentText: ...I still haven't worked out how to convey it to you, the issues surrounding Vache. My relationship with him... the things he's done in the Underworld... it's a long story.
a156ab8666ac3d6a.Speaker: Natasha

36137577906694f1.ContentText: I'm guessing you've heard a lot of different opinions on Vache. What do you make of him, {NICKNAME}?
36137577906694f1.Speaker: Natasha

63cb2f963ae6315c.ContentText: I see... I can understand that.
63cb2f963ae6315c.Speaker: Natasha

88a4858dcfa3f65f.ContentText: {NICKNAME}, I want you to go and visit another patient — a victim of the wonder medicine... I want you to see the real consequences of abusing that medicine.
88a4858dcfa3f65f.Speaker: Natasha

b16fcb63ac505156.ContentText: Once you've understood her situation, come back and tell me what you think. After that... I want to ask for your help again.
b16fcb63ac505156.Speaker: Natasha

9dd9fa48f26662ee.ContentText: ...Where's my husband... and where's my child...?

22fd5c40b1e9b6f7.ContentText: ...Wh—Where are they? You... you know where they are, right?

4dab6e582bca8e10.ContentText: ...You don't know... they don't know... nobody knows...

a51934395f09f29b.ContentText: That poor, poor lady... Both her husband and child became ill and passed away.

2325c241a23c1d52.ContentText: *sigh* ...Not terribly serious. But they needed to get treatment every now and then, which did impact their livelihood.

40ff806b4f8bb529.ContentText: Yes... Before her family passed away, she was a carefree young woman.

eb546674ce5db0e8.ContentText: Her husband and child caught a mysterious illness. The symptoms weren't grave, but their livelihood was certainly impacted.

55deb45a42c2c3af.ContentText: In order to try and rid themselves of the ailment once and for all, they bought some kind of "wonder medicine..." Who would've thought their condition would deteriorate so rapidly after they began using it.

d0bb5262833f6fc6.ContentText: The two began to suffer terribly, such that death became a blessing... It wasn't long before they departed this world, one after the other.

f1fb108c337230dd.ContentText: From that moment on, oh she became as you see her now. If Dr. Natasha hadn't taken her under her wing... *sigh* Well it doesn't bear thinking about.

8316f69511d5bc0c.ContentText: And yet what more could've been done? They were warned about the medicine. They were told about the risks... They chose to roll the dice.

2a283280012c7ef6.ContentText: Just unlucky? As far as I'm concerned, those medicine dealers are making money for murder in broad daylight... Who would sell such a thing to the sick?

7fd31476825a245f.ContentText: *sigh* Talking about it tires me out. At least my husband and I are able to help her where we can. I just hope that one day she can lead a normal life again...

244ee6534cbcc724.ContentText: Come over here, child. It's best to leave that poor lady in peace. Let me explain...

f8d72a61e270a655.ContentText: What's wrong with her? Isn't it obvious? Her family were the victims of improper medical treatment, then she had a nervous breakdown...

c7114c5aec3cff72.ContentText: *sigh* Oh sister, sometimes there just isn't a cure...

4c6abe52abedfdbb.ContentText: That Dr. Vache wasn't human... he was a devil in a doctor's coat!

3a81708ba45d8988.ContentText: I told her so many times not to believe in that medicine, but she...

e8510a849c6fc049.ContentText: Yeah... But don't think for a second he was any better than those medicine dealers at the mutual aid society. He was worse than they could ever aspire to be!

780cdc7bd0237ae6.ContentText: At least the mutual aid society doesn't hide the risk from the buyers. Vache gave that poison away to everyone for free... even the elderly and the children...

f9ca3e738cc3a5cf.ContentText: Argh, I hate them! I hate them all! How could they do this to my sister...

ca2d418bc2f35603.ContentText: By the look on your face... I'm assuming you've come to understand the wonder medicine all too well.
ca2d418bc2f35603.Speaker: Natasha

cb572d9d6d75543d.ContentText: Be it Vache or the mutual aid society — forces like that can take full advantage of the... the typical Underworld state of mind.
cb572d9d6d75543d.Speaker: Natasha

c9770c62797f2dd6.ContentText: Let me tell you a story, {NICKNAME}.
c9770c62797f2dd6.Speaker: Natasha

8e01e1ad41dd2917.ContentText: There was once a brilliant Overworld doctor with unmatched pharmaceutical skill.
8e01e1ad41dd2917.Speaker: Natasha

0d6e73c72fbf09b0.ContentText: The doctor was set on developing a medicine that would steel the human body against the cold. He named his research project "Blizzard Immunity."
0d6e73c72fbf09b0.Speaker: Natasha

9291cdbeef425031.ContentText: But his research met with obstruction time and time again, the biggest factor being a lack of test subjects. Tampering with the human immune system carries huge risk, and nobody in the Overworld was willing to submit themselves to such experiments.
9291cdbeef425031.Speaker: Natasha

fc80df52dc3d8db2.ContentText: As such, the doctor got in touch with his sister in the Underworld... claiming that he wanted to support the medical effort below ground.
fc80df52dc3d8db2.Speaker: Natasha

7e74514a990b63fb.ContentText: ...Naturally, his sister was overjoyed. After all, as far as medicine was concerned, her brother had always been the standard she'd strived to attain.
7e74514a990b63fb.Speaker: Natasha

f0663d6049f5c519.ContentText: She brought her brother underground and entrusted him with her clinic and laboratory...
f0663d6049f5c519.Speaker: Natasha

6ea8e3688d55a798.ContentText: ...I think you know what comes next.
6ea8e3688d55a798.Speaker: Natasha

d933f14e01bc011f.ContentText: Issuing free medicine to the needy was just Vache's way of conducting experiments on his test subjects.
d933f14e01bc011f.Speaker: Natasha

80220f577da97fb6.ContentText: On some level, his reagents were able to alleviate the patients' suffering... but nothing more. They would forget their pain for a while, and neglect their regular treatment plans...
80220f577da97fb6.Speaker: Natasha

29979d3ec883e825.ContentText: The result... patients with mild illness would attribute their recovery to the so-called wonder medicine, while patients with serious illness would quickly deteriorate... and sometimes die.
29979d3ec883e825.Speaker: Natasha

e9eb69b88552f8b0.ContentText: I cannot accept that their fate was simply the result of misfortune or risk, {NICKNAME}. No true doctor would accept that.
e9eb69b88552f8b0.Speaker: Natasha

286e712d1e0330cb.ContentText: That's why I want you to help me recover all the wonder medicine. Are you willing to take on this assignment?
286e712d1e0330cb.Speaker: Natasha

cf267f3699c30402.ContentText: ...But it's impossible to sit on the sidelines, right?
cf267f3699c30402.Speaker: Natasha

e37a13aaf027a900.ContentText: This will be hard for the people that have come to rely on the wonder medicine... but it's up to us to remove this false hope.
e37a13aaf027a900.Speaker: Natasha

7dafc32acc1ea4e4.ContentText: You mustn't hesitate — recover every last reagent that Vache left behind. I'll take responsibility for the consequences — don't worry about that.
7dafc32acc1ea4e4.Speaker: Natasha

03a4a4caaf9d9319.ContentText: Go, {NICKNAME}. I'll be waiting for the good news.
03a4a4caaf9d9319.Speaker: Natasha

946088904cb4fab5.ContentText: Stop right there! No one's allowed up ahead!

126c4e988fe5d124.ContentText: Oh-ho! Playing the hero, are we? Is this a stick-up?

f781ace3bf041837.ContentText: You're that clinic woman's lackey, aren't you. Did you think the mutual aid society didn't have its own intel?

75c44aec0263ed2e.ContentText: Who are you trying to kid? You're that clinic woman's lackey. Did you think the mutual aid society didn't have its own intel?

fd18a715ac1437be.ContentText: In the Fragmentum? Gimme a break!

a9845b24e295a7e0.ContentText: She's after our medicine and sent you here to smash the place, right?

5753b51ddaa77161.ContentText: Men, look lively and send this idiot packing already!

0c86313b4513a726.ContentText: ...Well, look who we have here. Your reputation precedes you, outsider... I didn't take you for a bandit and a thief!

7cca5f44115fec89.ContentText: Oh, just passing through... And our guards decided to just beat themselves into submission, I suppose?

cefbc54b194f69c8.ContentText: You listen here — I'm the president of the Complex Illness Mutual Aid Society. The medicine we hold here is lifeblood for many of our members. Are you sure you want to deprive them of that?

dd7e13121dfb01fb.ContentText: Those poor patients... Along comes a life-saving wonder medicine, only to be snatched away by a shameless bandit like you...

5b8aa11a612d2bb2.ContentText: The Underworld is full of sickness... What would happen if we left it all to that clinic to treat?

8d507f215760d295.ContentText: My mutual aid society has relieved that doctor of patients at the end of the road. Shouldn't she be thanking me?

07f7452997b03304.ContentText: Hmm. Seems like you are quite bent on dismantling our operations, aren't you?

ed0ba374c6ccc717.ContentText: Fine, seeing as you came all this way, it'd be rude not to give you the opportunity!

fb9a613c3e08ee38.ContentText: Blast it... What did we ever do to you? Why are you taking away our money-maker!?

fb141110db88a75b.ContentText: So you admit it, then? You're not in this to save lives. You're in it to get rich.
fb141110db88a75b.Speaker: Natasha

80bdbb33fd8c34b9.ContentText: Wh—What are you doing here? Ugh, as if we didn't have enough trouble already...

414e434c4adab1a8.ContentText: ...Selling fake medicine with false kindness. You should have expected trouble to find you sooner or later.
414e434c4adab1a8.Speaker: Natasha

9a605d42ceed92e9.ContentText: I have a responsibility to protect the well-being of my patients... or to put it another way: I must eradicate any and all threats to them.
9a605d42ceed92e9.Speaker: Natasha

10798d2b313fef56.ContentText: You... You can't save everyone! The Underworld is teeming with sickness... how could you possibly pull it off!

2a1c2f3a02a14c86.ContentText: You're right, I can't save everyone alone... but if I must, I would sacrifice food and sleep to treat them.
2a1c2f3a02a14c86.Speaker: Natasha

abd99131bf41786f.ContentText: The debt that Vache owes to the Underworld rests with me. All I can do is help everyone to the best of my ability... to the very end.
abd99131bf41786f.Speaker: Natasha

60a6e11bf7d9b174.ContentText: Ugh... So stubborn... In that sense, you're no different from your crazy brother.

ff41098dd014a781.ContentText: Thank you, {NICKNAME}. Your actions today have saved many Underworld families.
ff41098dd014a781.Speaker: Natasha

f9cab0f5d47e16ab.ContentText: I'll find a way to dispose of Vache's leftover reagents. Next time the "Mutual Aid Society" wants to whip up a quack cure? They'll be out of luck.
f9cab0f5d47e16ab.Speaker: Natasha

4f2b3efcdf21be62.ContentText: Let's go back to town. I still owe those patients an explanation...
4f2b3efcdf21be62.Speaker: Natasha

ac652feb230199b6.ContentText: I want to thank you again for recovering the wonder medicine. It meant a lot to me.
ac652feb230199b6.Speaker: Natasha

55dabdd26ddc0225.ContentText: But disposing of Vache's reagents isn't enough to solve the medical supply shortage. Many of my patients can't be seen promptly, and my stock of medicine is running low.
55dabdd26ddc0225.Speaker: Natasha

ab3c03d97880e254.ContentText: Thanks to you, the route to the Overworld through the Furnace Core has reopened. I'd like to use it to return to the surface and see if I can get some help.
ab3c03d97880e254.Speaker: Natasha

68cf0e3519923701.ContentText: Remember my adoptive parents I mentioned to you a while ago?
68cf0e3519923701.Speaker: Natasha

0fbd343e957fc300.ContentText: After the reopening of the Furnace Core passage, I had an idea. I wrote a letter and asked Sampo to deliver it to my parents' old address.
0fbd343e957fc300.Speaker: Natasha

9d953028e467a93a.ContentText: I didn't have high hopes, but amazingly, Sampo brought me my mother's reply.
9d953028e467a93a.Speaker: Natasha

f670621f684b7003.ContentText: Hehe, that's exactly what I thought when I got her letter.
f670621f684b7003.Speaker: Natasha

8c1c3439f414236c.ContentText: No, I recognize my family's handwriting. We are all doctors after all.
8c1c3439f414236c.Speaker: Natasha

f79a4e3112cd6e3d.ContentText: Mom said they still live at the old house, but they're not working on the front lines anymore. They should still have some connections in the medical school and the hospital, though.
f79a4e3112cd6e3d.Speaker: Natasha

3887a0492a95180e.ContentText: If I'm lucky, maybe I can convince them to send extra medical supplies to the Underworld.
3887a0492a95180e.Speaker: Natasha

ba450240e7354317.ContentText: Of course, that's not the only reason for me to go back to the surface... I can't wait to visit my parents again, and I can tell from my mom's letter that they feel the same.
ba450240e7354317.Speaker: Natasha

4c5f9b1746a1bb6c.ContentText: If possible, I would like you to go with me, {NICKNAME}.
4c5f9b1746a1bb6c.Speaker: Natasha

28c3ffe68195a7b2.ContentText: I've sent another letter to my mom telling her to find us near Fountain Plaza. Don't worry, I know my way around the Administrative District.
28c3ffe68195a7b2.Speaker: Natasha

aab771de3e637dfb.ContentText: ...this place doesn't seem to have changed much from what I remember.
aab771de3e637dfb.Speaker: Natasha

260dd18979d630ab.ContentText: ...Oh, there you are. Sorry, I got distracted watching the crowds.
260dd18979d630ab.Speaker: Natasha

2b37f9224aff718a.ContentText: {NICKNAME}, look at the busy flow of people — life in the Overworld carries on as usual, as if nothing has happened.
2b37f9224aff718a.Speaker: Natasha

d5e07d98b33c6e85.ContentText: We're a little early. I've got an idea...
d5e07d98b33c6e85.Speaker: Natasha

290e99e273821350.ContentText: I want to buy my mom a gift. {NICKNAME}, you're more of an Overworld local than I am now. Any suggestions?
290e99e273821350.Speaker: Natasha

2903efb1657d2a16.ContentText: That's a great idea. I've been underground for so long, I almost forgot what flowers smell like.
2903efb1657d2a16.Speaker: Natasha

12c20c4f8ceb451d.ContentText: Flowers it is then, {NICKNAME}. Can you lead the way?
12c20c4f8ceb451d.Speaker: Natasha

9dd801cbdf2e8933.ContentText: Sounds fun, but there's a chance it won't suit my mom's taste. Let me think...
9dd801cbdf2e8933.Speaker: Natasha

18eacfd41fd9162a.ContentText: Oh, yes! I remember there was a florist in the Overworld. How about we head over that way?
18eacfd41fd9162a.Speaker: Natasha

a9f2e3be7176bee4.ContentText: I've been underground for so long, I already forgot what flowers smell like.
a9f2e3be7176bee4.Speaker: Natasha

2be61db62e443575.ContentText: Workshop? I'm not too sure about that... Let's see if we have other options.
2be61db62e443575.Speaker: Natasha

6d9163dff032cba8.ContentText: Eversummer... Was that always the name? Seems I was too young to get the irony back then.
6d9163dff032cba8.Speaker: Natasha

c6a37dd67445ace9.ContentText: ...Sorry, don't mean to sound cynical. Maybe it simply represents the people's hopes up here.
c6a37dd67445ace9.Speaker: Natasha

565f4fcda7f96686.ContentText: Now that I think about it, sending flowers is quite the tradition in my family. Mom, dad, Vache, and I... whenever something good happened, we sent each other flowers to celebrate.
565f4fcda7f96686.Speaker: Natasha

3ecfa5a48d0ca1ef.ContentText: Do you want to hear a flower story, {NICKNAME}?
3ecfa5a48d0ca1ef.Speaker: Natasha

08baf400368fb3cc.ContentText: Each year for their anniversary, my dad would send my mom a bouquet of Ball Peonies wrapped in red paper.
08baf400368fb3cc.Speaker: Natasha

779f0df7582c279d.ContentText: I heard that Ball Peonies represent "love that knows no end..." It does fit their marriage.
779f0df7582c279d.Speaker: Natasha

0b4b3992f70705f5.ContentText: My father is a famous surgeon in Belobog. Because of his fame, people in medical circles paid great attention to his surgeries... He always had a lot of stress to deal with.
0b4b3992f70705f5.Speaker: Natasha

8957ff9b3a398f64.ContentText: Each time he finished a tricky operation, my mom and I would buy a single stem of Sunshine, then pin it on the chest pocket of his apron.
8957ff9b3a398f64.Speaker: Natasha

06bc4d8149a391db.ContentText: Sunshines represent "warmth and love of light..." For patients on the verge of death, my dad might have been the only light to penetrate the darkness around them.
06bc4d8149a391db.Speaker: Natasha

84c7db898cd40892.ContentText: Vache... Out of everyone in my family, I think he probably appreciated flowers the least.
84c7db898cd40892.Speaker: Natasha

a60899b33d087d69.ContentText: Still, I remember the day he received his offer from the medical academy. My parents took me to the florist and we bought him the most expensive Marquise stem in the shop.
a60899b33d087d69.Speaker: Natasha

4cf67fbcb8f59c28.ContentText: When we gave him the flower, he failed to hide his smile. You can't imagine how hard it was to get him to smile.
4cf67fbcb8f59c28.Speaker: Natasha

b781cda22d5c62ef.ContentText: As an orphan, I never knew my birthday. My adoptive parents took me to the Overworld and made the day I joined the family my birthday.
b781cda22d5c62ef.Speaker: Natasha

35c46baa70bc3706.ContentText: Each year on that day, my parents would give me a bouquet of First Snow. The number of stems represented how many years had passed since I joined the family.
35c46baa70bc3706.Speaker: Natasha

570429d420eef81d.ContentText: I only found out later that First Snow represents "beautiful memories." My parents gave me a beautiful childhood, and I still haven't had the chance to thank them for that...
570429d420eef81d.Speaker: Natasha

e8200fdcff52844c.ContentText: ...You're right, not the best moment for distant memories, I don't want to waste your time.
e8200fdcff52844c.Speaker: Natasha

47776bf8d903431e.ContentText: {NICKNAME}, will you choose some flowers for my mom?
47776bf8d903431e.Speaker: Natasha

e4dc2dbe6fd6eb9f.ContentText: To me, every flower carries a different meaning — it would take me ages to decide.
e4dc2dbe6fd6eb9f.Speaker: Natasha

7a511fd8fb709218.ContentText: Don't worry. I don't think my parents will be picky about the flowers they get. Quick, that florist is looking at us.
7a511fd8fb709218.Speaker: Natasha

fc0e79d0b810af99.ContentText: Oh, hey {NICKNAME}. I thought you went to choose some flowers?
fc0e79d0b810af99.Speaker: Natasha

dacebba707ddee82.ContentText: Or... did you want to hear some family flower stories?
dacebba707ddee82.Speaker: Natasha

65aad1d88cf994ce.ContentText: Nice to see you again! Vaska at your service. If you need some help picking the right flowers, feel free to let me know.

e8921fe1f41bbdf1.ContentText: Aww... Ball Peonies, is it? One second, I'll get it ready for you...

66d4c5ea377ba070.ContentText: Hm? Sunshines, is it? One second, I'll get it ready for you...

202c93aec7cb10c3.ContentText: Aww... Marquises, is it? One second, I'll get it ready for you...

cab761b846ca72fa.ContentText: Aww... First Snow, is it? One second, I'll get it ready for you...

24bc7fc0753037fd.ContentText: There you go, sorry for the wait. Hope to see again you soon!

592db098d3743e63.ContentText: Nat... Nat! Is that you? Oh come here, my darling...

8b824df049ba423f.ContentText: It's been too long, mom... too long.
8b824df049ba423f.Speaker: Natasha

ddb2ebf751a86b56.ContentText: Sorry, I don't usually get this emotional... How have you been, Mr. Oswell? Thank you so much for taking care of my parents these last ten years.
ddb2ebf751a86b56.Speaker: Natasha

f0d61c4cb61474df.ContentText: I'm doing fine, Miss Natasha, just fine... Look at you! You've blossomed into a fine young woman. Such a pity that your father...

6aff506703bdf550.ContentText: ...Dad? I was wondering where he is. Is he...
6aff506703bdf550.Speaker: Natasha

9a1c02b0eb3d9b4c.ContentText: ...It was three years ago, Nat. No need to be sad... he passed away very peacefully.

40503e4f89db6a37.ContentText: I'm so sorry mom... I'm so sorry. For ten years, I left you both in the Overworld. Mr. Oswell, I'm sorry you had to bear all this weight.
40503e4f89db6a37.Speaker: Natasha

864c0e6741afce58.ContentText: Don't be, my dear... It is my honor to look after your parents.

09001ca80cda0f1d.ContentText: It's not your fault that they sealed off the passage between the surface and the underground. Don't be so harsh on yourself, daughter.

28e70a3d41728cdd.ContentText: Mom... I have so much to say to you, but there's an urgent matter that needs your help.
28e70a3d41728cdd.Speaker: Natasha

cee2ec35130e7ada.ContentText: I apologize. I wish this were a happier reunion... but there are too many suffering with sickness in the Underworld. You're the only person I can go to for help.
cee2ec35130e7ada.Speaker: Natasha

9b45eec295bf996e.ContentText: There's no need to apologize, my child... I've heard of your deeds down there and I know you've saved many lives. Your father... he would be proud of you.

206950ba5542ed77.ContentText: We have many connections in the medical academy. No matter what you need, be it medicine or data, I should be able to get it for you.

4b1762d1cf23c490.ContentText: Be the doctor you always were, Nat. We have all the time in the world to catch up later...

22406025dc5e0ce8.ContentText: She's always been there for me.
22406025dc5e0ce8.Speaker: Natasha

7daf57f342376e6d.ContentText: It's alright, {NICKNAME}. I was prepared... Although it still hurts to hear it from mom.
7daf57f342376e6d.Speaker: Natasha

cc21c63b8920e351.ContentText: With her help, we'll be able to ease the Underworld's medical supply shortage. That's good news for patients who'd lost hope.
cc21c63b8920e351.Speaker: Natasha

4a646c43cc80c5d0.ContentText: I really wish I could spend the whole day talking to her about the old days. But sadly now is not the time.
4a646c43cc80c5d0.Speaker: Natasha

164478427fb59137.ContentText: Let's head back to the Underworld, {NICKNAME}. We need to spread the good news.
164478427fb59137.Speaker: Natasha

9df7f83495fe0fae.ContentText: Mr. Oswell? I thought you headed back home with mom. How come...?
9df7f83495fe0fae.Speaker: Natasha

ea2eaa3550fea0c2.ContentText: I apologize, Miss Natasha! As a matter of fact... there's something I have to tell you in person.

084c261a0a355d5d.ContentText: Something that mom isn't supposed to know?
084c261a0a355d5d.Speaker: Natasha

43769c2bd53ecc8b.ContentText: You haven't changed a bit — smart and sensitive. The fact of the matter is... in the first two years after the passage was closed off, I received many letters from Master Vache.

99680c22e898e88c.ContentText: ...What? Letters from Vache? Are you certain, Mr. Oswell?
99680c22e898e88c.Speaker: Natasha

969b0e4487813b14.ContentText: Of course, Miss. I recognized his handwriting. You'll see what I mean when you read the letters yourself.

44a0c83d7fc137e5.ContentText: Actually... those letters were intended for your eyes only. The delivery address was the Underworld, but because of the sealing off of the passageway, the letters were sent back to your old house, to me.

5be0ba0ad3b467a3.ContentText: I don't understand — did you not show them to my parents?
5be0ba0ad3b467a3.Speaker: Natasha

f9f30a97f9ff571e.ContentText: I... I'm sorry, Miss. I opened one of them out of curiosity. Master Vache stressed in the letter that your parents must not know what happened to him...

a7c1ac90f20fe827.ContentText: That's why I put the letters in a secure place, waiting to hand them to you when we could meet again.

174628213d464135.ContentText: I... I'm not sure if I did the right thing, Miss Natasha. I just didn't want your parents to feel that their son was so close and yet so far away...

575095f9264ee1a9.ContentText: ...Do you have the letters on you, Mr. Oswell? Let me take a look.
575095f9264ee1a9.Speaker: Natasha

9551ee29807717a4.ContentText: Of course, of course — here... You can tell it's the young master's handwriting.

642cf7665596d912.ContentText: "The cold has revealed to me my arrogance. How can a child who grew up in warmth ever begin to comprehend a cure to bitter cold."
642cf7665596d912.Speaker: Natasha

e621695e1266625b.ContentText: He... Vache didn't give up on his research into Blizzard Immunity... even after he left the city.
e621695e1266625b.Speaker: Natasha

68bd1b7802fc5fe4.ContentText: "I live in abandoned houses under broken roofs and continue my experiments. One step after another, I've made breakthroughs. I'm trembling, not because of the cold... but because I can feel I'm getting closer to the answer I seek..."
68bd1b7802fc5fe4.Speaker: Natasha

eab0556fbfc9d675.ContentText: If what's in here is true, then Vache must have built a lab somewhere in the Snow Plains... and even made progress in his research. But how can that be...
eab0556fbfc9d675.Speaker: Natasha

15298787397f0786.ContentText: There'd be no point in him lying to me in the letters. Still, it's possible he may have gone completely insane before he started writing them...
15298787397f0786.Speaker: Natasha

96e6e97ef61f336f.ContentText: It's possible. But what if he was still sane when he wrote this down...
96e6e97ef61f336f.Speaker: Natasha

f98dc9965e551824.ContentText: {NICKNAME}, I need to leave the city to recover my brother's research data. Are you willing to come with me?
f98dc9965e551824.Speaker: Natasha

161c3c0f92c4431b.ContentText: Leave the city? You are taking too much risk, Miss Natasha...

6a5b46b669a5fe5a.ContentText: This {F#young lady}{M#young gentleman} is right. Danger is everywhere beyond the walls of Belobog...

d56fa6e6a502bb2d.ContentText: I know, Mr. Oswell. But I have a hero with me — {F#she}{M#he} saved the Underworld. I'm sure {F#she'll}{M#he'll} protect me, right?
d56fa6e6a502bb2d.Speaker: Natasha

d8fe27a8b868da9a.ContentText: Vache... It's been so many years. Are you still alone in the blizzard...?
d8fe27a8b868da9a.Speaker: Natasha

5b45776467fe64c3.ContentText: ...Ignore me... I'm just talking to myself. Let's go, {NICKNAME}. It's time to face my past head-on.
5b45776467fe64c3.Speaker: Natasha

fa32a6b61255f86e.ContentText: Such harsh cold... It's hard to imagine anyone surviving in these conditions.
fa32a6b61255f86e.Speaker: Natasha

a1debd1106e9cb0c.ContentText: Let's hurry up, {NICKNAME}. We need to find any clues that Vache may have left behind before both of us become ice sculptures.
a1debd1106e9cb0c.Speaker: Natasha

2bc174bd085a4111.ContentText: Here, this looks like lab equipment. Maybe Vache left it behind.
2bc174bd085a4111.Speaker: Natasha

0a81b6935827801a.ContentText: Still, it's all just used test tubes, beakers, and other vessels. No sign of any sample reagents, or lab notes for that matter...
0a81b6935827801a.Speaker: Natasha

b81a688c500a9d63.ContentText: I know my brother he's — meticulous when it comes to medical experiments. There's no way he wouldn't document his results.
b81a688c500a9d63.Speaker: Natasha

f908baa467d3fa4c.ContentText: I know my brother he's — meticulous when it comes to medical experiments. There's no way he wouldn't document his results.
f908baa467d3fa4c.Speaker: Natasha

4ddf420499b19c01.ContentText: {NICKNAME}, I want to go deeper into the Snow Plains. Can you press on any further?
4ddf420499b19c01.Speaker: Natasha

46ad1671d93dad06.ContentText: *shivering* Gosh... The temperature keeps getting lower... but we can't give up halfway.
46ad1671d93dad06.Speaker: Natasha

c86a786995ddd8ef.ContentText: Hehe, no need. Don't you underestimate the leader of Wildfire.
c86a786995ddd8ef.Speaker: Natasha

3a92347f46f5782d.ContentText: Hehe, that's very kind of you. Don't you underestimate the leader of Wildfire.
3a92347f46f5782d.Speaker: Natasha

8e25c8701072cfb3.ContentText: This may not sound like me, but... I hope that deity the Architects worship can grant us some luck.
8e25c8701072cfb3.Speaker: Natasha

28d749ddddf81ede.ContentText: ...Citizens? Outside the walls? Hey, you two, stop right there!

09389678511d5caa.ContentText: That's a Silvermane Guard. Is he yelling at us?
09389678511d5caa.Speaker: Natasha

ab19afcc5dedd4c5.ContentText: Ah, I'd almost forgotten... No one can leave Belobog without authorization. Looks like we need to talk our way out of this, {NICKNAME}.
ab19afcc5dedd4c5.Speaker: Natasha

867957e60f703381.ContentText: I can't say you sound suspicious, but... I can't just take your word for it either...

b313e1b15f254887.ContentText: Captain, look at her necklace... Maybe she's telling the truth.

e6c00bb41bae76d3.ContentText: It's... the same as Dr. Vache's.

7ca9baa9093f9ae0.ContentText: My brother does wear an identical necklace... Do you know him?
7ca9baa9093f9ae0.Speaker: Natasha

6538d9bc5f3c2cca.ContentText: Are you really his sister? Dr. Vache saved a lot of my soldiers!

eb4ff7c5c9139dcd.ContentText: Yes. Take a look at the guards patrolling outside the city. All of them are risking their lives.

7c6bddcea777293c.ContentText: Aside from the monster-related casualties, we lose men to frostbite every year.

23215b929cf2179f.ContentText: But thanks to the medicine the doctor leaves us, my soldiers are able to withstand the cold. They can make camps in the Snow Plains as footholds for our patrols... If it weren't for the doctor, we would have long since frozen to death.

575bde0bcaf52030.ContentText: Doctor Vache is... elusive. My squad only met him once, and he didn't seem like the talkative type. He leaves the medicine at specific locations and our patrols go there to collect it.

dc7f38038a7866b1.ContentText: The medicine is extremely potent — a small vial can keep someone warm for a week.

5631e9fa2073148e.ContentText: The medicine is extremely potent — a small vial can keep someone warm for a week. We have over half our stock left.

a9c67deae9f21fec.ContentText: Speaking of the doctor, it's been a long time since we last saw him... at least two or three years. I hope he's alive and well...

c62e443ce480b505.ContentText: So he really did have a breakthrough in the Snow Plains...
c62e443ce480b505.Speaker: Natasha

6ce60a4660400eb4.ContentText: Did the medicine have any side effects for you?
6ce60a4660400eb4.Speaker: Natasha

154497e208ab6abd.ContentText: ...Side effects? Not that I know of. If there were a problem, it'd be that we couldn't go back to the city until the effect had worn off...

09d473ca1478a620.ContentText: ...because the city would be too hot for us. We'd break a sweat just sitting idle, haha.

85a3886e76e321c9.ContentText: Thanks for the information. We're planning to head deeper into the Snow Plains to find my brother.
85a3886e76e321c9.Speaker: Natasha

bb3f79d9da45a5ba.ContentText: ...Seems like you've made up your mind. I'd really like to send some of my men with you, but we can't leave our posts.

141aabd05e296c83.ContentText: Here, take this medicine. If what you two told me is true, I'm sure you're more than capable of handling yourselves out there.

155f5a65aa96dc66.ContentText: Thank you, captain. We'll take it with us.
155f5a65aa96dc66.Speaker: Natasha

971cbc5d6737074f.ContentText: Hold on! That's a big guy over there.
971cbc5d6737074f.Speaker: Natasha

14356e540014de44.ContentText: Did you see that? There's something on the monster's back.
14356e540014de44.Speaker: Natasha

f33745d8041b3539.ContentText: I'm ready, {NICKNAME}. The doctor's got your back.
f33745d8041b3539.Speaker: Natasha

6463ca44c6b060f2.ContentText: Oh, the Blizzard Immunity. Shall we drink it? It's your call.
6463ca44c6b060f2.Speaker: Natasha

9b1d69eec00f175b.ContentText: Can you feel it, {NICKNAME}? It seems like Vache's medicine is working.
9b1d69eec00f175b.Speaker: Natasha

4115dc3fec2d215f.ContentText: That was my first time seeing you in battle... you've got some moves, don't you? No wonder you were able to save the Underworld.
4115dc3fec2d215f.Speaker: Natasha

eb6afa496aff7bf6.ContentText: Let's have a look over there. My gut tells me we should find something connected to Vache...
eb6afa496aff7bf6.Speaker: Natasha

06d26c4666c43823.ContentText: ...That should do. Hope it can withstand the snow.
06d26c4666c43823.Speaker: Natasha

ca9efee882f75310.ContentText: I don't know. It's just something that suddenly occurred to me.
ca9efee882f75310.Speaker: Natasha

9ff0ecd109167bf7.ContentText: People write things on headstones, right? Let me think...
9ff0ecd109167bf7.Speaker: Natasha

96ac741e129cb781.ContentText: That'll do. Thank you for helping me, {NICKNAME}. I feel like a great weight has been lifted.
96ac741e129cb781.Speaker: Natasha

19a39ec79f1129cc.ContentText: So long, brother. Hope you don't forget dad's teaching.
19a39ec79f1129cc.Speaker: Natasha

d8b54caf8747cce3.ContentText: "A doctor does not get to choose his or her patient, my children. Remember, never say no to those who come to you for help. Never."
d8b54caf8747cce3.Speaker: Natasha

8aa11fb64143b2d4.ContentText: All done? May I have a look?
8aa11fb64143b2d4.Speaker: Natasha

69ce11c7f7a98ac6.ContentText: Nice pick, {NICKNAME}. I wonder if dad still sends mom flowers on their anniversary...
69ce11c7f7a98ac6.Speaker: Natasha

cd99cc1a0c04576a.ContentText: I knew you'd pick the right flowers. Mom and dad will be so happy.
cd99cc1a0c04576a.Speaker: Natasha

fb8c6a20fef796ed.ContentText: Let's go, my mom will be there soon. Best not to leave old folks waiting!
fb8c6a20fef796ed.Speaker: Natasha

352d3846cffc5027.ContentText: Nice pick, {NICKNAME}. Dad's not young anymore, he probably doesn't have to do operations solo these days. I hope he's looking after himself...
352d3846cffc5027.Speaker: Natasha

08770ffaf7108f85.ContentText: Thank you, {NICKNAME}. To be honest with you, it reminds me of Vache... Don't worry, good memories only.
08770ffaf7108f85.Speaker: Natasha

d903afe8e076f133.ContentText: Thank you, {NICKNAME}. It reminds me of carefree childhood days... Those times were pure and innocent, just like these petals.
d903afe8e076f133.Speaker: Natasha

e4c4243d245c6b74.ContentText: {NICKNAME}, can I talk to you for a moment? I have a favor to ask. Something... rather personal.
e4c4243d245c6b74.Speaker: Natasha

057711e1a7141b1f.ContentText: It's okay, I understand. You must have some important things on your plate? Don't let them get ahead of you.
057711e1a7141b1f.Speaker: Natasha

ad5a90ffab5332b4.ContentText: *sigh* I can't remember the last time I got such a polite response.
ad5a90ffab5332b4.Speaker: Himeko

06a2caf62f93d905.ContentText: Well hang onto it, it's cute.
06a2caf62f93d905.Speaker: Himeko

59c63d0ee1d49496.ContentText: Ah, no need to worry, Dan Heng's rarely late. I'm sure he must have a good reason...
59c63d0ee1d49496.Speaker: Himeko

07959f07d9e66c7f.ContentText: Dan Heng's situation is special — we hope to protect him to the best of our ability.
07959f07d9e66c7f.Speaker: Himeko

484d111ff180bd78.ContentText: The trailblazing of Jarilo-VI has drawn to a close, and the Astral Express must depart for the next planet.
484d111ff180bd78.Speaker: Himeko

ca0a6b17ae20daf9.ContentText: Not telling yet... We'll make an official announcement in the meeting, but I'm keeping you in suspense for now~
ca0a6b17ae20daf9.Speaker: Himeko

49ad1d319c3080aa.ContentText: The universe is boundless, and trailblazing never ends... Even a lifetime isn't enough to explore every world. That's the beauty of the unknown.
49ad1d319c3080aa.Speaker: Himeko

8cae9ca23ee84a73.ContentText: That hardly sounds like you, {NICKNAME}. What about that Stellaron inside you? Don't you wanna get rid of it?
8cae9ca23ee84a73.Speaker: Himeko

3760aa8fc9457592.ContentText: {NICKNAME}, what do you think about all this?
3760aa8fc9457592.Speaker: Himeko

1a30f18912060438.ContentText: Haha, I see you're already a full-fledged Trailblazer. You're right, we can't remain indifferent to those in crisis.
1a30f18912060438.Speaker: Himeko

48f77fb1c662083d.ContentText: We can't trust everything Kafka says. It's credible that the leader of the Stellaron Hunters can predict the future, but Kafka might not be telling the truth.
48f77fb1c662083d.Speaker: Himeko

eef261a997fc433a.ContentText: ...This is a difficult matter. If she is telling the truth and we turn a deaf ear, then those on the Luofu will be in great danger.
eef261a997fc433a.Speaker: Himeko

8b0ec5db88abbdb0.ContentText: You're right. It's credible that the leader of the Stellaron Hunters can predict the future, but Kafka might not be telling the truth.
8b0ec5db88abbdb0.Speaker: Himeko

89e4d1c9de29b20e.ContentText: It wouldn't be surprising. I've seen the IPC's file on Blade. If the details are accurate, he's incredibly dangerous.
89e4d1c9de29b20e.Speaker: Himeko

0ba233c19ac9dd17.ContentText: It's hard to believe that someone like him could be captured by the Cloud Knights and that the Stellaron Hunters would look to us for help.
0ba233c19ac9dd17.Speaker: Himeko

268dd5766bad4904.ContentText: Yes, however... if she is telling the truth and we turn a deaf ear, then those on the Luofu will be in great danger.
268dd5766bad4904.Speaker: Himeko

abe70f6e2b5de895.ContentText: I like the way you think.
abe70f6e2b5de895.Speaker: Himeko

826d94d8598bb0d3.ContentText: {NICKNAME}, did you notice that Kafka didn't mention anything to do with you...?
826d94d8598bb0d3.Speaker: Himeko

1f02df9586ca3b4d.ContentText: A Stellaron Hunter implanted you with a Stellaron — a move like that hints at a far-off purpose. Everyone says that Elio can foresee the future, and that every step of his schemes is a foreshadowing.
1f02df9586ca3b4d.Speaker: Himeko

2537fa29978538d8.ContentText: You must be extra vigilant, {NICKNAME}. Kafka won't always turn a blind eye.
2537fa29978538d8.Speaker: Himeko

0a59d3a693c10067.ContentText: The Xianzhou Alliance... I've heard of them, but never had any contact with them.
0a59d3a693c10067.Speaker: Himeko

f5cbd36ec5976596.ContentText: How could the mighty Xianzhou Alliance be breached by a Stellaron...
f5cbd36ec5976596.Speaker: Welt

867e37de7a901890.ContentText: Something's not right. The Xianzhou Alliance is a small faction, but one that derives its power directly from an Aeon. They have immense strength — much more than a train under the protection of the fallen Akivili.
867e37de7a901890.Speaker: Welt

083b91d637303611.ContentText: Stellarons can lead to the collapse of stars scattered throughout the universe, but the Xianzhou has Lan, The Hunt on their side. I struggle to believe that Stellarons pose a threat in the eyes of the Aeons.
083b91d637303611.Speaker: Welt

d6acc3cf412bed6e.ContentText: Either the Stellaron Hunters are lying, or... there's an even bigger threat lurking on the Xianzhou Luofu...
d6acc3cf412bed6e.Speaker: Welt

d582d7bd96a9ef4c.ContentText: It's fair to say that it ranks highly among the known forces in the universe.
d582d7bd96a9ef4c.Speaker: Welt

4466f1b4b846631d.ContentText: The Path of The Hunt is narrow and doesn't stand out among the other Paths, but the Alliance enjoys the direct blessing of the Aeon. The six great ships of the Xianzhou are like brothers in arms.
4466f1b4b846631d.Speaker: Welt

e6fbd3ac86fd751a.ContentText: Its power is much greater than those factions that simply draw their strength from the Paths themselves.
e6fbd3ac86fd751a.Speaker: Welt

3a59479d504d0728.ContentText: This is big. I'm coming with you this time.
3a59479d504d0728.Speaker: Welt

936b6193d45fe869.ContentText: This is big. I'm coming with you this time.
936b6193d45fe869.Speaker: Welt

2365210a6af7b335.ContentText: Something's not right — the Xianzhou has Lan The Hunt's blessing. I struggle to believe that Stellarons pose a threat in the eyes of the Aeons...
2365210a6af7b335.Speaker: Welt

a170e712ae2889a4.ContentText: ...Which means either the Stellaron Hunters are lying, or... there's an even bigger threat lurking on the Xianzhou Luofu.
a170e712ae2889a4.Speaker: Welt

223b34f8c075b51b.ContentText: The Alliance is made up of six great ships, all following Lan, The Hunt. Its mission is to eliminate the Aeon of Abundance.
223b34f8c075b51b.Speaker: Welt

a047c30103a7dfd2.ContentText: Lan doesn't rank among the more powerful Aeons — the concept of the Path of The Hunt is narrow... but in contrast with the other Aeons, they pay close attention to mortals. Lan grants strength to the Xianzhou Alliance without reservation.
a047c30103a7dfd2.Speaker: Welt

be21812ab0f777a9.ContentText: It follows that the Alliance's marshal and six generals are in no way inferior to Lord Ravagers.
be21812ab0f777a9.Speaker: Welt

e0f52fa2b45f8aac.ContentText: Kafka... *sigh* Pom-Pom doesn't like her. She smells of danger.

4fd94999d5fbff7d.ContentText: Still, a Trailblazer should choose their goal and the road they take to get there themselves. That's the creed of the great Akivili.

9f790924fc14fce5.ContentText: I'm forbidden from setting foot on the Luofu. "Total interception of any attempt to enter the dominion." *sigh* Let's head back to the main carriage.
9f790924fc14fce5.Speaker: Dan Heng

b734da66ead99dca.ContentText: It's waaaay too much of a coincidence. A Stellaron Hunter shows up at the site of a Stellaron burst that just happens to be occurring nearby. Does anyone really believe that?
b734da66ead99dca.Speaker: March 7th

d1a73044a80e1053.ContentText: I'm so mad! She just hijacks our communications and then hangs up? So rude! {NICKNAME}, you used to know her, right? Was she always like this?
d1a73044a80e1053.Speaker: March 7th

ce67de7933149a3c.ContentText: ...We don't need another amnesiac on this train...
ce67de7933149a3c.Speaker: March 7th

3d4bf87054b10ecd.ContentText: Oh yeah? Huh, maybe she really liked you...
3d4bf87054b10ecd.Speaker: March 7th

130453507a71afc6.ContentText: Pfft, taking things seriously all of a sudden...?
130453507a71afc6.Speaker: March 7th

28a2ec8161a7d3e7.ContentText: Oh yeah, I just spoke to Dan Heng, here's the deal: we've all gotta vote against!
28a2ec8161a7d3e7.Speaker: March 7th

7f637e9a16fb3080.ContentText: Trust me, she'll hold a democratic vote. One for you, one for me, one for Dan Heng — three altogether. We never go anywhere without a consensus.
7f637e9a16fb3080.Speaker: March 7th

d87558909b0da481.ContentText: Hmph, I should've known you'd listen to that Stellaron Hunter. Whatever — but you should think before you do that.
d87558909b0da481.Speaker: March 7th

903c0962bd1e3a49.ContentText: ...Seems like the longer I spend in my room, the stranger things are when I emerge.
903c0962bd1e3a49.Speaker: Dan Heng

6efc4b390ceb7972.ContentText: Mm, March told me... *sigh* If it were one of the other ships it might've been okay, but I can't go to the Luofu.
6efc4b390ceb7972.Speaker: Dan Heng

f455bd30cc9c77bb.ContentText: I'm forbidden from setting foot on that ship. "Total interception of any attempt to enter the dominion" is how they chose to put it. *sigh*
f455bd30cc9c77bb.Speaker: Dan Heng

1ecdef48464ff6c4.ContentText: ...So if you're planning on going, I can't go with you.
1ecdef48464ff6c4.Speaker: Dan Heng

a0c22940031f2055.ContentText: The Alliance is made up of six ships — the Luofu is only one of them.
a0c22940031f2055.Speaker: Dan Heng

8225eb9bb8ce12ce.ContentText: There are also the Yaoqing, the Fanghu, the Zhuming, the Xuling, and the Yuque.
8225eb9bb8ce12ce.Speaker: Dan Heng

03e34d93756e3dd7.ContentText: I remember the Xianzhou was a sight to behold. Good luck.
03e34d93756e3dd7.Speaker: Dan Heng

1fb9dbf3a7c08d82.ContentText: Have a safe trip you guys!

4b495d882896d843.ContentText: Pom-Pom's too busy — looking after the Express is a full-time job.

9eddb978f21583c9.ContentText: ...Don't worry about me — I'm just happy you're enjoying the journey.

ce577d8660bf13ba.ContentText: This time you'll get the chance to witness Welt in action, haha. I'm glad he's going with you.
ce577d8660bf13ba.Speaker: Himeko

ef973bb010f1d4b1.ContentText: He doesn't talk much about his past. If you ask him, he'll just tell you about how he worked in animation...
ef973bb010f1d4b1.Speaker: Himeko

6a73e1b8516e8e30.ContentText: ...But that's only a small part of his story. Believe me when I say he has more experience than I do.
6a73e1b8516e8e30.Speaker: Himeko

eb074f9e638cad97.ContentText: You could say he keeps his cards close to his chest. If you ask him, he'll just tell you about how he worked in animation...
eb074f9e638cad97.Speaker: Himeko

ab19f87458916811.ContentText: Allll this universe, and we just happen to bump into a Xianzhou ship that Dan Heng spent time on? That's gotta be fate! I wonder what Dan Heng stories await us.
ab19f87458916811.Speaker: March 7th

295c9e7c9bf14a90.ContentText: That guy sure has a mysterious past. We gotta take this opportunity on the Luofu to dig into it!
295c9e7c9bf14a90.Speaker: March 7th

b0b13aa645a20220.ContentText: I knew you'd be excited! Check out the master of gossip over here.
b0b13aa645a20220.Speaker: March 7th

6575d435030f246f.ContentText: (I wonder if she even remembers we've got a job to do down there...)
6575d435030f246f.Speaker: playerboy

5b19949f3aceefa1.ContentText: *sigh* Fine, you're right... In that case, we'll just have to take loads of selfies till he gets super jealous.
5b19949f3aceefa1.Speaker: March 7th

00de86970c3bb6fe.ContentText: Huh? Is his past really that dark?
00de86970c3bb6fe.Speaker: March 7th

59f0a88d904ea487.ContentText: *sigh* Fine, I'll leave him alone then. We'll just have to take loads of selfies till he gets super jealous.
59f0a88d904ea487.Speaker: March 7th

13dcf9675e89bf0d.ContentText: You need to take extra care on this expedition. I've compiled some intel on the Xianzhou for you, I hope it comes in useful.
13dcf9675e89bf0d.Speaker: Dan Heng

98aa3a0ce6f89796.ContentText: See, it's like I said: If you wake up and Dan Heng's not around, then you probably won't see him the rest of the day either.
98aa3a0ce6f89796.Speaker: March 7th

46799c05df0a6f7f.ContentText: I guess. To be honest, warp navigation meetings are basically just like that "teambuilding" you're always going on about. You don't have to show up, but Himeko might be upset if you don't.
46799c05df0a6f7f.Speaker: March 7th

4b069e3f75902a9c.ContentText: Think about it, Dan Heng's the one managing the archives — he'll already be clued in to our next destination. Himeko and Welt know already, of course... so it's just me and you in the dark!
4b069e3f75902a9c.Speaker: March 7th

b9eab836972c9f2d.ContentText: Yeah... I heard he did something incredible once, and now some powerful force has his name on a wanted list. My guess is the Xianzhou Alliance or the Garden of Recollection. In any case, it can't be the IPC — I've seen their wanted list.
b9eab836972c9f2d.Speaker: March 7th

6915bff3d698863b.ContentText: Hmm... I bet it is the Garden of Recollection. Didn't it seem like Dan Heng was super keen on talking to Herta? Everyone knows that Herta and the Garden of Recollection don't get along. They say the enemy of your enemy is your friend...
6915bff3d698863b.Speaker: March 7th

e3bc4dfc16e787f2.ContentText: Ha! Shocking? I guess you're still new — you'll find out how strange everyone is around here sooner or later...
e3bc4dfc16e787f2.Speaker: March 7th

15822c030d1b2ed5.ContentText: What's with the funny look? Am I not strange enough for you? Name me an amnesiac that didn't have some crazy backstory. I already made up a few dozen for myself.
