15822c030d1b2ed5.Speaker: March 7th

06f331bb30275961.ContentText: Haha, you better believe it. You guys really put on a show for Jarilo-VI — I'm eager to join in myself.
06f331bb30275961.Speaker: Welt

5923d7c238158fe0.ContentText: I gotta say, there were more than a few times where I wanted to lend a hand... but Himeko said I should let you youngsters rise to the trailblazing challenges...
5923d7c238158fe0.Speaker: Welt

6a9fe5893f48c4b3.ContentText: I know alright, but I can't tell you yet. Himeko wants to create a sense of mystery for you and March.
6a9fe5893f48c4b3.Speaker: Welt

e5b2b3917ff351aa.ContentText: That I want to go to? ...My home world, I suppose. Sadly, its location doesn't appear on the Express's astral chart records, at least the ones that are undamaged.
e5b2b3917ff351aa.Speaker: Welt

170c519875cb6d2d.ContentText: In any case, I do want to see some other civilizations before I go home. It'd be a crime to waste this opportunity on the Express.
170c519875cb6d2d.Speaker: Welt

e8b0d585b6e41586.ContentText: Ahem... {NICKNAME}, did you receive the destination overview? Excited?

2154bd6be8ff0a93.ContentText: After all that cold and exhaustion on Jarilo-VI, you must be looking forward to the next planet!

9c688b7429ab4a8a.ContentText: Pom-Pom's thrilled that you're enjoying your journey!

227ea97d9381088d.ContentText: A long, long time ago, this train would ferry the Nameless from planet to planet... Now it's able to do the same again.

b7008f8674c7bdfc.ContentText: Pegana? That's the final stop — Akivili's home world... Pom-Pom wants to visit again too. Unfortunately, the journey's a lot like life — you don't always get where you're going right away.

5a500d4a675f835f.ContentText: ...There are some planets that haven't been affected by Stellarons.

04a52b53e631ddf6.ContentText: The Express moves at an incredible speed, but change is always faster...

79ba3511bfc8dfac.ContentText: {NICKNAME}, if you're ready, head over to the front of the train. The meeting is about to start!

7bace366ba99f512.ContentText: Beep, beep, beep... Findie the Home-Use Object Finder at your service. Please say the target object you want to search for.

43db8799e6bb88a8.ContentText: Beep, beep, beep... Potential target object detected, search mode activated. Please commence search according to my instructions.

ae66d57f5b224f6f.ContentText: Beep, beep, beep... Distance between the finder probes is too close for precise location detection. Please reselect position.

2ca973879e822386.ContentText: Beep, beep, beep... About to play: Home-Use Object Finder Safety Manual. Please follow along and recite the entire document...

4de931b14eb4e49d.ContentText: Beep, beep, beep... Obstacle detected ahead, unable to commence precise location detection. Please reselect position.

df0517ba2d1870cc.ContentText: Beep, beep, beep... Keep reading the Home-Use Object Finder Safety Manual. You'll learn something new every time.

82af53a5198a56b6.ContentText: Beep, beep, beep! Potential target object detected. The current search has concluded, entering sleep mode...

dbc1359b9d9cd81f.ContentText: Beep, beep, beep... Interastral Peace Appliances, your most trustworthy companion.

713627b629367e98.ContentText: Beep, beep, beep... Based on your search history, I recommend the Humanoid Tactical Microwave. Press Skip to cancel personalized ads.

f2f381ade5d69c19.ContentText: Beep, beep, beep... As stated in the Terms of Service, my search result accuracy and reliability are not guaranteed. For more information, please call Interastral Peace Appliances.

d1b3c38435a3db02.ContentText: Beep, beep, beep... Findie will create a calendar reminder for when you want to visit an Interastral Peace Appliances store.

5b85a6c1d5a6ff59.ContentText: Pom-Pom doesn't know, but it's in the Express! No one knows Akivili's Express better than Pom-Pom. There is something strange in here, Pom-Pom can feel it!

d9c84cca1906e1d8.ContentText: Help Pom-Pom look for it. We have to find it.

9594f4d71771c9a6.ContentText: Did they send for you as well? Looks like Pom-Pom is quite serious this time...
9594f4d71771c9a6.Speaker: Welt

05d922dfe3be0f09.ContentText: No. I have a heightened sense of hostility and danger, but I don't sense anything on the Express.
05d922dfe3be0f09.Speaker: Welt

580a88e6ebad8c48.ContentText: The galaxy is huge. Maybe there's some kind of organism that can become invisible visiting us...
580a88e6ebad8c48.Speaker: Welt

668cd6adf059247b.ContentText: Not sure, Pom-Pom couldn't put it into words. It's like a gut feeling.
668cd6adf059247b.Speaker: Welt

e49964b6338b4e32.ContentText: I lean towards trusting Pom-Pom's instinct when it has to do with the Express.
e49964b6338b4e32.Speaker: Welt

165f42bd29bef515.ContentText: Himeko had them go to a different coach. We can take care of what's going on here.
165f42bd29bef515.Speaker: Welt

e2fba6dbe3d5307c.ContentText: Nope, but there must be something on the Express if Pom-Pom is getting so worked up.
e2fba6dbe3d5307c.Speaker: Himeko

4e79c0d3028e7b0d.ContentText: Don't worry, I have another way to deal with this if no one can find anything... It's just a little wasteful to use it on something like this. But we can't let it continue to stress the conductor either.
4e79c0d3028e7b0d.Speaker: Himeko

8f6812eb1a57d81e.ContentText: Yep, Pom-Pom has a deep connection with the Astral Express. Anything that could harm the Express always stresses out the conductor.
8f6812eb1a57d81e.Speaker: Himeko

3d36b4e412686927.ContentText: So... help me educate March about not messing with the equipment on the Express.
3d36b4e412686927.Speaker: Himeko

909146fcc4d89dc0.ContentText: Check the coach and see if there is anything out of the ordinary.
909146fcc4d89dc0.Speaker: Himeko

ea02ea5b058df8e6.ContentText: (Looks like Mr. Yang really can't see it...)
ea02ea5b058df8e6.Speaker: playerboy

84a924d8106710b8.ContentText: An invisible mirror? I think I've heard something about that...
84a924d8106710b8.Speaker: Welt

7fa3b288715721c2.ContentText: What are you talking about? What mirror?
7fa3b288715721c2.Speaker: Himeko

b3b27a2a721a1b67.ContentText: (Seems like I'm the only one who can see it...)
b3b27a2a721a1b67.Speaker: playerboy

981d06a057184b65.ContentText: Wahh! P-P-Pom-Pom knew something strange was going on!

ea174ca75ed84e94.ContentText: Wahh! Even you didn't find anything...?

3a3017713ab6a313.ContentText: Wow, so this is the Astral Express?

3b5a0382e538a10d.ContentText: Oh, I haven't introduced myself yet...

7c48559afd01fe1e.ContentText: Wait a minute! I'm not one of the bad guys!

2a16f793f5128f27.ContentText: I'm a messenger from the Garden of Recollection. I will be staying on the Express from now on. It's very nice to meet you!

7d7189aca782c3c0.ContentText: Thank you! You're a friendly one! However, I should still explain—

d68363a32b9537c1.ContentText: Erm, that's why I'm here. Let me explain—

c5cbe72ed841738b.ContentText: Garden of Recollection is an organization that worships the Aeon Fuli. As a messenger for the Remembrance, we surrendered our worldly bodies and traverse the universe in the form of memes to search the stars on behalf of Fuli for the most precious memories.

3457d3448648aca9.ContentText: Seeing that I'm able to be here, you must have already come to understand the concept of Remembrance and the Garden of Recollection. The memories that you possess have activated a pathway for the Garden of Recollection to make copies and implant me into your thoughts...

deacb94e051aa868.ContentText: We can actually just follow you without being noticed. However, the Garden of Recollection believes that you're special: The memories that you possess are extremely rare and precious, and it's very likely there'll be even more in the future...

49370733797fbb2f.ContentText: That's why I thought it'd be best if I introduced myself to you! I noticed that you've also received the concept of Memosnatchers... The Garden of Recollection wouldn't want you to mistake us for thieves or crooks! Everything we do is for a higher purpose.

c413a53bb9fc6746.ContentText: I believe we've become acquainted now.

999b73244048e835.ContentText: Some keywords and hints to your question: Herta and Light Cone — when you came in contact with them, the concept of Remembrance, Garden of Recollection, and Memosnatcher were implanted in you.

17a7392c8379bea4.ContentText: Madam Herta has a slight prejudice against us, so the Garden of Recollection believes that it'll be best if I provide you with a proper understanding of these concepts.

9871871295c6ea1b.ContentText: We want to prevent the universe from being forgotten because of the Destruction.

167e151ad8f914d2.ContentText: Even if all matter is annihilated, it can continue to live on in the form of memories.

a9290386e91aae51.ContentText: There's a big difference, of course. I don't have a material body, so it doesn't count as smuggling.

276ba98f2c7a90d0.ContentText: Yup, just imagine me as someone from the posters. It would be strange if you were to scold someone from the cartoons for smuggling, right?

ea4c991040fec8f4.ContentText: Why would I want to steal a material body? I gave up my own willingly!

73357a213b107309.ContentText: There is actually something that I need. So I'll get right to it. {NICKNAME}, the Garden of Recollection wants to preserve your memories.

e923b4fe967e8b22.ContentText: But don't worry, we won't take it from you. We just want to make a copy of the precious moments. You can see it as a trade between us...

972926f78ebe0d6b.ContentText: This is the Forgotten Hall created specially to store your memories. We hope that you can visit this place regularly to rekindle your lost memories. The Garden of Recollection will extract the memories they want and give you something in return — in the form of matter and Light Cones.

85401930872e05b8.ContentText: Come, I swear on the memories of my past self that you won't be at a loss for anything.

0a63732846b14c39.ContentText: What is it? Are you not feeling well?

9a1f451f7a6506d6.ContentText: That's how it is the first time.

47eea7187276ddbf.ContentText: Ah, that's good. I was afraid you'd be angry.

4c7aa95208fae6dc.ContentText: A strong stimulus will lower your guard against your subconscious. Only then will we be able to copy your memories.

b7f8c34927b4326d.ContentText: From now on, all you have to do is enter the Forgotten Hall periodically, and we'll give you an abundant amount of rewards.

6723cb066720197b.ContentText: Erm, about me being on the Astral Express... It'd be best if you kept it between the two of us. I won't reveal myself to your companions, so make sure you don't tell them about me, okay?

e530590eaa524332.ContentText: If that's the case, the Garden of Recollection will have to block out their memories... I really don't have a choice, please don't make me do that!

385bdb0d95707c79.ContentText: Perfect! Thank you, {NICKNAME}. I'm glad you're so pleasant to work with.

919cfd1de0d54a84.ContentText: Erm, you can say that it's just a Phase Flame or an Inquisition Spirit. They often suddenly appear and then vanish. You should be able to get past them with that...

17e94b274ad8e98f.ContentText: Alrighty then, just step close to the mirror if you ever want to find me.

f1cc769e22708268.ContentText: Someone from the Garden of Recollection is here? On the Express...?
f1cc769e22708268.Speaker: Himeko

998850c7039e11d6.ContentText: Seems like the rumors are true. The Emanators of the Remembrance don't have a physical body and only those they allow can see them.
998850c7039e11d6.Speaker: Welt

db106ce5200f5208.ContentText: The Express is not a place they can just come and go as they wish! We have to kick them out!

4757b2bffbafe8bf.ContentText: Yes, I agree. Dealing with the Garden of Recollection is dangerous, and the trade of memories is... a shady business.
4757b2bffbafe8bf.Speaker: Welt

5c56c48396d5952f.ContentText: We'll come up with something. Don't worry, conductor.
5c56c48396d5952f.Speaker: Himeko

d733628bd7524146.ContentText: An Inquisition Spirit...? On the Express?
d733628bd7524146.Speaker: Himeko

2e219ab7c1bee210.ContentText: Yeah, these creatures do suddenly pop up sometimes and start questioning the first person they see... {NICKNAME}, what did it ask you?
2e219ab7c1bee210.Speaker: Welt

42fddeae4e787a45.ContentText: This actually confirms a theory that I've always had: It seems like Inquisition Spirits are a creation of the Erudition.
42fddeae4e787a45.Speaker: Welt

e88cc0a61fb79622.ContentText: This actually confirms a theory that I've always had: It seems like Inquisition Spirits are a creation of the Enigmata.
e88cc0a61fb79622.Speaker: Welt

9692329f17f7186b.ContentText: This actually confirms a theory that I've always had: It seems like Inquisition Spirits are a creation of the Elation.
9692329f17f7186b.Speaker: Welt

189bd8d54bd54366.ContentText: Pom-Pom doesn't care whose creation it is! It has to go!

acbb30745d9ec235.ContentText: Indeed. Welt, do you know what to do?
acbb30745d9ec235.Speaker: Himeko

fce0551a761c3b20.ContentText: Don't worry, it should be gone by now — Inquisition Spirits only ask one question at a time. It will go elsewhere once it gets an answer.
fce0551a761c3b20.Speaker: Welt

067017385a850409.ContentText: I asked you so candidly yet you still told them.

58a17d3f62748148.ContentText: Hmph, then I'll have to seal this portion of their memories — I'm sorry, but I don't have a choice.

b2dcbb4791080b83.ContentText: You and only you can know about me. If a keyword related to me shows up in their memories, then we'll have no choice but to get rid of it... Why don't you trust me? I won't hurt them.

5a0189510d2444ba.ContentText: *sigh* We have our rules at the Garden of Recollection.

6b8e1bb2cc08f74e.ContentText: Thank you, {NICKNAME}. I'm sorry you had to lie, but please do understand... We have our own rules at the Garden of Recollection.

289c231042428baf.ContentText: Do you want to enter the Forgotten Hall?

13bcef214f0b7d29.ContentText: I'll try to answer to the best of my abilities!

f5e330f7a1bbe552.ContentText: I can give you the memories related to the Aeon, Fuli...

77d6a2ef5e89ba9b.ContentText: That's all I have. I don't have the honor of keeping the experience of seeing the Aeon, Fuli with my own eyes.

f70c55094c3c8f24.ContentText: Huh? I thought I already told you about that. You really are forgetful.

dc21b3547b5ad637.ContentText: "The disappearance of those with form will inevitably bring about the obliteration of those without."

22f9eee38e023fc5.ContentText: Look at the galaxy. After the incident with the Antimatter Legion, civilizations are like dying embers in the wind. Many worlds wither and crumble even without Nanook's influence. It is unacceptable to allow the memories of civilizations to simply vanish.

c9b1b4ed09c19974.ContentText: That is why Garden of Recollection has decided to collect and safe keep their memories. Once the crisis ends, the fragments of these memories will shape a blueprint of rebirth for everything that has disappeared.

e9c88f050f741cb9.ContentText: I don't have to worry about the cold, heat, pain, hunger, flesh wounds, or solar storms — I'm not human anymore.

64a5350d4ff0d638.ContentText: Without a material body, I don't have adrenaline, oxytocin, dopamine, or anything that causes different emotions in people. This allows me to judge human thought and desire with an even more neutral position. You can say that I'm another step closer to having free will.

2753c2f53b39ae3f.ContentText: Of course, there is a price for the convenience — the price is that I rely on the memories of others to move around. Erm... And would you consider this kind of existence to be free?

798460fc4327d756.ContentText: Yes. I'm only able to move around due to the memories of others. Every time I appear, move, or disappear, it means I'm reading someone's memories.

975ddf25f07702ed.ContentText: But you don't have to worry about me peeping, stealing, or controlling your memories. Memokeepers have undergone rigorous training. Anything we do that goes against the rules will result in the immediate termination of our existence.

2bdfc52ed1bdb75c.ContentText: Although some Memosnatchers can bypass the restrictions... Um, I'm not one of them!

aebf45b8d6299560.ContentText: Are you curious about what I look like under this mask? Hmph... Then bring me enough memories to exchange for it!

57feb3a020d637c7.ContentText: No, that's forbidden. I'm a rule-abiding Memokeeper. I refuse!

fdc3a597f242fe1c.ContentText: You're a receptacle for a {RUBY_B#Cancer of All Worlds}Stellaron{RUBY_E#}! You're able to survive and even wield its power...

6ca7bf8f13df72ad.ContentText: The Garden of Recollection is very interested in what kind of a past, future, and influence on the universe someone like this will have.

3b4e21881e07572a.ContentText: I'm sorry, but I've restricted others from having memories of me.

c03b537fdd5cca33.ContentText: Everyone has a unique memory of themselves and everything around them. In order to keep that uniqueness and pureness unspoiled, let's keep our dealings a secret.

53c1f8af79afef63.ContentText: Do you have to ask every other minute, missy? Two more steps, just two more steps and you're there.
53c1f8af79afef63.Speaker: Sampo

ad658bb24b84b2a9.ContentText: Hey, where are you going? We have more important things to do. Stop dilly-dallying!
ad658bb24b84b2a9.Speaker: March 7th

f6e0c0b47a6ffa1f.ContentText: Himeko, Mr. Yang! Team Trailblaze, back from duty! Mission one: Accomplished!
f6e0c0b47a6ffa1f.Speaker: March 7th

721f30ec0721a3fc.ContentText: *chuckles* Although Welt and I didn't get the chance to go with you, I can tell you worked hard to bring things back to normal. Well done, everybody. And especially you, {NICKNAME}. I heard a lot of good things about you.
721f30ec0721a3fc.Speaker: Himeko

b5724fa232b6b221.ContentText: I'd say it's a solid five stars.
b5724fa232b6b221.Speaker: Himeko

1920037041d9d173.ContentText: *chuckles* And miss out on a great adventure? I don't think you'd like that.
1920037041d9d173.Speaker: Himeko

9ff228695052d662.ContentText: Get some rest on the Express. Jarilo-VI was not an easy ride.
9ff228695052d662.Speaker: Welt

fa6446717f156c85.ContentText: Pom-Pom is of the opinion that we should leave as soon as possible to avoid potential resurgences of the anomalies we experienced earlier. Himeko and I agree.
fa6446717f156c85.Speaker: Welt

e0dbe4555d7aa46d.ContentText: ...Which means we need to decide where our next destination is, soon.
e0dbe4555d7aa46d.Speaker: Dan Heng

9ca5b2ac4bdcc154.ContentText: That's the path of the Nameless, I presume? Always on the road, always trailblazing...
9ca5b2ac4bdcc154.Speaker: March 7th

47446ca54137e125.ContentText: I—I'm not complaining by the way! One adventure after another, that's exactly what I signed up for!
47446ca54137e125.Speaker: March 7th

5a0d558859a17b5c.ContentText: Looks like March has fallen in love with the way of the Nameless. That's good to hear.
5a0d558859a17b5c.Speaker: Himeko

c58b6f7f785ac6ed.ContentText: You can head back to your rooms for some rest, or stay here and make yourselves a cup of coffee, whichever you like.
c58b6f7f785ac6ed.Speaker: Himeko

b2e9464e6a8764ea.ContentText: I'll head back to my room then.
b2e9464e6a8764ea.Speaker: Dan Heng

ecd34e9d1276fd02.ContentText: *sighs* There I was thinking this guy would gradually open up...
ecd34e9d1276fd02.Speaker: March 7th

a7b1f155cb0b9b56.ContentText: *chuckles* We need to give him some time, March. I think he treasures the time spent with you guys.
a7b1f155cb0b9b56.Speaker: Himeko

6a42880b6240d05f.ContentText: {NICKNAME}, about your battle against the Supreme Guardian and the whole Stellaron situation, you must have a lot of unanswered questions, I suppose?
6a42880b6240d05f.Speaker: Himeko

c199538f8c309e3d.ContentText: While you were away, Welt and I did some research and came to some interesting conclusions. Let me know if you want to ask about anything.
c199538f8c309e3d.Speaker: Himeko

d6c762672a2b8f0a.ContentText: (...So strange. Seems like Asta and Arlan are in trouble...)
d6c762672a2b8f0a.Speaker: playerboy

c86e8c02c04de7c9.ContentText: (Still, it all sounds like hearsay to me. Better keep them in the dark for now.)
c86e8c02c04de7c9.Speaker: playerboy

d49e032752ae30d0.ContentText: (Himeko seems to be on good terms with the folks on the space station. Maybe I should tell her first.)
d49e032752ae30d0.Speaker: playerboy

0e7a90febd0ccde3.ContentText: It must be difficult for Asta. Being the lead researcher isn't easy.
0e7a90febd0ccde3.Speaker: Himeko

60e1df05c529b09a.ContentText: As soon as the Legion exits stage right, in comes the gossip... How does that saying go again? "Greet enemies outside with a smile, greet enemies inside with a sword..."
60e1df05c529b09a.Speaker: Himeko

82219d2f755c7191.ContentText: Such is the Herta company culture...
82219d2f755c7191.Speaker: Himeko

00644337b8bc5410.ContentText: What do you mean? This is such an inter— Uh... inconvenient situation.
00644337b8bc5410.Speaker: Himeko

d5b631203edb7cf7.ContentText: Haha, Herta doesn't really have anything to do with it. I'm afraid wherever you find people, you find gossip of some variety.
d5b631203edb7cf7.Speaker: Himeko

40cb52139e7bacf6.ContentText: {NICKNAME}, are you thinking of getting involved?
40cb52139e7bacf6.Speaker: Himeko

72940ccccc8aac75.ContentText: Well, while these rumors have nothing to do with us, they do concern the reputation of young Asta. And turning a blind eye is not the way of the Nameless.
72940ccccc8aac75.Speaker: Himeko

f0a0d2d50fbd35e4.ContentText: Solving a matter like this won't be difficult. Predictably, the crowd cares more about the drama than the facts. Stopping the rumors from brewing is more important right now than laying out the truth... and it's better to unearth the source of the rumors directly than to painstakingly try to refute them one by one.
f0a0d2d50fbd35e4.Speaker: Himeko

ffaa913c7e72dd67.ContentText: No, no... that's not what I meant...
ffaa913c7e72dd67.Speaker: Himeko

566b235533c63a00.ContentText: I have a friend — they say there isn't a single piece of station gossip she doesn't know about.
566b235533c63a00.Speaker: Himeko

af7cfd4bb7d8ae01.ContentText: First of all, it's not me. Secondly, I don't make friends JUST for the sake of gossip.
af7cfd4bb7d8ae01.Speaker: Himeko

8e3c7f2207a4a74a.ContentText: It's just that my friend is pretty amazing, and I think you might be able to extract some information from her. Let's see... Right now she's probably slacking off somewhere outside the department.
8e3c7f2207a4a74a.Speaker: Himeko

0fc3b119c416f153.ContentText: I don't know her real name, but she calls herself <color=#dbc291ff>Gossipmonger</color>....
0fc3b119c416f153.Speaker: Himeko

12983a692106249f.ContentText: (I can't see anyone slacking off... Maybe Gossipmonger isn't around?)
12983a692106249f.Speaker: playerboy

e0ffdecf6cd3f3be.ContentText: (The rumors are already circulating. Let's gather some intel first.)
e0ffdecf6cd3f3be.Speaker: playerboy

b851bb01bf210db5.ContentText: Have you heard anything from Gossipmonger? Is the lead researcher really that corrupt? Who exactly is this whistleblower?

dc8b1f7f9d134784.ContentText: Hey, aren't you off work today?

35345cf857d13a52.ContentText: I couldn't not come in after checking my phone! Days off aren't as juicy as gossip.

b211ed68235e167b.ContentText: Well, too bad, I haven't seen Gossipmonger this morning. You should rest up and wait for more news.

0ae1162802456ff3.ContentText: Why are you still here? Didn't your department call you to prepare for the emergency operation?

77f5a2d8ff57a5ea.ContentText: Uh... no? I just sneaked out for a little while. What are the odds...

4bce68401a0d19dc.ContentText: I got a group message two minutes ago saying that <color=#dbc291ff>something's happened in the Special Purpose Lab — somebody's trapped</color>. The Security Department's blocked off the area around the entrance.

a5e840dff24ae56d.ContentText: The Special Purpose Lab? Then wouldn't <color=#dbc291ff>Pamela — I mean, Gossipmonger be...</color>

b74c823738c6656d.ContentText: Most likely. No wonder she's not here right now...

1ea278793a891b19.ContentText: Gossipmonger only concerns herself with gossip, not the secrets within.

ae5e4a706e3cd5b6.ContentText: There aren't many members in the Heritor group, but news is still traveling so fast. This must be the work of something bigger...

07702c66f24f571f.ContentText: ...Hmm... Given the number of people in the group and its content... could this all stem from a few alt accounts? But why kick up a storm like this...

8b30b054e206f302.ContentText: The walkways around the Special Purpose Lab have been temporarily closed off. Please keep your distance.

e5a1ce5d10c7d725.ContentText: I'm afraid this is a live situation. It's too dangerous.

3b0314641b6cb754.ContentText: Wait... Brother Arlan told me about you. If you insist on going... then I wish you the best of luck. Be safe.

98ecc60d05602f9f.ContentText: The Security Department received information about sightings of Legion remnants in the vicinity.

3fdae416814dae36.ContentText: However, we just confirmed that there are monsters here that have never been seen before.

e95071fdcc2816a5.ContentText: The Security Department sectioned off the area immediately, but we lost contact with some people.

3eb1b804d6ccf6d4.ContentText: Pamela...? Let me check, I remember her name was on the rescuer list.

e82745ec21a75f4b.ContentText: Did Arlan ask you to investigate? Great! I've made some new discoveries.

8edf53f59d673282.ContentText: Did you see it? Look... It seems like the rumors about the station are true — there are Stellaron traces here.

2dad2276b441ad47.ContentText: Good luck figuring that out. All I know is that monsters have destroyed the power supply installations here.

846db48f69950ae0.ContentText: The elevator is out of commission, so the people stuck on the floor below can't make it up.

fc44c26077de4b81.ContentText: It happened so suddenly. The support from the Security Department is still on the way.

a332e869f3cbd780.ContentText: We're low on staff right now — all we can do is make sure the monsters don't make it up here.

310ae45442b3bdba.ContentText: Maybe you can help us restart the central elevator?

323d0e8861a6d461.ContentText: There are plenty of backup power sources in the storage zone — right opposite, if I remember right.

89e6164ac6978483.ContentText: As soon as we can restart the power supply, we can get this elevator working and rescue everyone.

1f91e865526037ec.ContentText: Well, did you find the backup power source?

8b10025c711982bd.ContentText: Phew, thank goodness you're here. Give me a moment — I'll give the elevator a little shake-up.

cbfd547488e12c8e.ContentText: Alright, you can use it now. Be safe.

f95314f509cc399e.ContentText: Help! Somebody help! ...Wait, the elevator is here!

fea8827017cfc5cd.ContentText: W—We lost sight of Pamela... There's a terrifying monster over there — we didn't dare to go over on our own.

78916466adf854ca.ContentText: Please save her! W—We'll take the elevator up.

1c0dcaea7c6dc8bc.ContentText: Holy mackerel, you scared the stars out of me... Y—You took your time!

8661f8cff0a51653.ContentText: That's right, I'm the one you're looking for.

04dac6d83432cc4a.ContentText: Of course. Not only did I know you were coming, but I also know why.

261b4501e466d301.ContentText: Heh, you want to know who Richard_Knowitall from that Heritor group is, don't you?

cd096b0b60545f00.ContentText: Fans of Madam Herta. They call themselves the Heritors.

7648d8f2ab010267.ContentText: If I didn't even know that, could I really call myself Gossipmonger?

c87936f9b2eebe5e.ContentText: I'm a businesswoman, and we play by our own rules. If you want the scoop, you have to pay the price.

1326f49f38b09e25.ContentText: Certainly not. I have a very clear notion of how much different favors cost.

68883aa643557e54.ContentText: Don't worry, the price is a fair one. Why would I make it difficult for you?

f5d3d715f569b40e.ContentText: I don't have any particular hobbies. I do indulge in a little tittle-tattling here and there, not to mention, admiring... of a certain scientist...

7791390db209df17.ContentText: A—And now here you are, vanquishing monsters left, right, and center! I heard you're with the Astral Express...?

f6fdcb279febbfb0.ContentText: How fortunate! As it happens, I'm a huge fan of Himeko... An amalgamation of beauty and brains — the epitome of a graceful and gentle... scientist.

7c21251f5f6f0631.ContentText: Can you help me take a hi-def portrait photo of Himeko smiling? Pleeeaase~

5ae166f5af3c453a.ContentText: Make sure you capture her electrifying smile — the one that stuns people into a trance — that million-volt smile~

49686b06bee8bf6c.ContentText: What's the matter? You know Himeko well, right? If you ask her, I'm sure she'll say yes~

b4e684fddda20a3d.ContentText: I appreciate young, brave, talented people like yourself!

970bc6d43050bf26.ContentText: A superbly beautiful, dazzling, electrifying portrait shot of Himeko in exchange for the secret behind Richard_Knowitall.

18c928cbecf0ea0f.ContentText: Send the picture over when you have it. I'm always fair when it comes to haggling.

a56f83344fdfa3bc.ContentText: Did you find Gossipmonger? What did she say?
a56f83344fdfa3bc.Speaker: Himeko

14539d2b717c184d.ContentText: Ha, I knew she was weird...
14539d2b717c184d.Speaker: Himeko

f3131f01c14810b6.ContentText: *sigh* There are many types of friend... She's the type you can only stay friends with if you never meet her.
f3131f01c14810b6.Speaker: Himeko

a29c79f49538c37f.ContentText: It's okay. It's just a picture. I don't mind. Go ahead, {NICKNAME}.
a29c79f49538c37f.Speaker: Himeko

6a11c1572c2ac28f.ContentText: Let me see... Hey, you're pretty good, {NICKNAME}.
6a11c1572c2ac28f.Speaker: Himeko

752534fd3b91beb0.ContentText: Huh? What are you taking pictures of?
752534fd3b91beb0.Speaker: Asta

f5b8a2e34dafde17.ContentText: Why do you sound so nervous all of a sudden? Suspicious...
f5b8a2e34dafde17.Speaker: Asta

6bbf82d817990ce6.ContentText: I didn't expect to see you here. Didn't you say you were really busy?
6bbf82d817990ce6.Speaker: Himeko

73fb40eb910fb30e.ContentText: *sigh* I am. The Legion has only just retreated — the station is in absolute shambles.
73fb40eb910fb30e.Speaker: Asta

330deed37948093d.ContentText: And now any progress in rebuilding things has been ruined by the reappearance of the Fragmentum...
330deed37948093d.Speaker: Asta

dc03b0e0e3e55249.ContentText: Oh, an active Stellaron is rarely a cause for celebration... What did Herta say about the Fragmentum's appearance?
dc03b0e0e3e55249.Speaker: Himeko

c78fd4dc5a8ebe6c.ContentText: You know what she's like. It's like nothing's happened — she's just sitting back and giving orders.
c78fd4dc5a8ebe6c.Speaker: Asta

31e402c1cec60b03.ContentText: If there's time later, I want to talk to you both in more detail about this. You're the Fragmentum experts after all.
31e402c1cec60b03.Speaker: Asta

d908d0cb4ae2443a.ContentText: *sigh* I need to go — someone's taken my family encryption key. You know, the one I use to withdraw my allowance? I need to get to the bottom of it.
d908d0cb4ae2443a.Speaker: Asta

761934ef876a5bdb.ContentText: That might be the whistleblower's so-called "evidence." Looks like you don't have much time to lose, {NICKNAME}.
761934ef876a5bdb.Speaker: Himeko

cf36e64a6731d1f9.ContentText: (A young man <color=#dbc291ff>with black-rimmed glasses and a slanted fringe</color>. Which one is Richard_Knowitall?)
cf36e64a6731d1f9.Speaker: Unknown

4b7e1daa08859751.TitleText: Researcher of the Department of Implement Arts

1d544fa31562c3ae.TitleText: Researcher of the Department of Implement Arts
1d544fa31562c3ae.ContentText: Richard knows what now...? What are you talking about?

9f11b19ad202eeb7.TitleText: Researcher of the Department of Implement Arts
9f11b19ad202eeb7.ContentText: What are you talking about? When did I start rumors about the lead researcher? What nonsense.

18c4639167fd9c8c.TitleText: Researcher of the Department of Implement Arts
18c4639167fd9c8c.ContentText: I don't even know you. I'm gonna call security if you keep this up.

f5286c77a0ee6894.ContentText: Oho! Well done — you found me.

a32e2670992e6565.ContentText: Rumors? More like a formal complaint!

f9b898894e53fcf6.ContentText: So you're here about the lead researcher's corruption? Anything for a good story, huh?

4f637a7fcf81a25f.ContentText: I don't get it — you people live your lives for gossip.

e4d96c9a5b1cfbd8.ContentText: Wouldn't it be better to apply that drive to your research? Madam Herta would be delighted to see everyone working so hard.

6696c69217bd1959.ContentText: Haha, who do you think you are? The space station's next lead researcher?

917bf8a991cd698a.ContentText: Please. Only upstanding and intelligent people like myself are worthy of such a position. You gossipers need to figure out your place in the hierarchy.

8805573c65682e01.ContentText: Have you been reading too many novels? You think there's some hidden heir on this space station with keys to the family coffers? Less fantasizing, more researching, got it?

2ef37d45e155ba00.ContentText: You want the scoop? Fine. I've backed it all up anyway. Here, take it. And let it be known that I, Richard_Knowitall, do not spread rumors.

d832eb2d2c025d67.ContentText: This is the receipt. See the title on this purchase order...?

2a63493433f0195e.ContentText: That's what I call substantive evidence! Hmph...

ecdbf71c1f0b984d.ContentText: Of course it is! If I had any doubt, I'd have kept it quiet.

7df7dd24fd6f23bc.ContentText: ...I picked it up a few days ago when I was collecting a package. I saw a few receipts requiring the lead researcher's signature.

e84c0b0a71a67153.ContentText: The Security Department's head honcho, Arlan — he left pretty quickly when he saw them. We all know he's on her side anyway.

66c4d912b534274a.ContentText: So I had a peek, and woah! She's buying equipment for the space station under her own name! I've got her now!

3bdfa6fb3b23d619.ContentText: Geez, do I really have to break it down for you?

ba224d037e83b898.ContentText: The space station has its own financial procedures. As long as the purchase is for the space station, no matter how big or small, it has to go through the organizational account using the station's allocated funds.

27f13d078265aacc.ContentText: The payer here is her private account. She's totally embezzling station funds for herself!

96d556fea4021e9d.ContentText: I'm so disappointed — so hurt! She looks like a sweet enough girl, but not only did she fail to repay Madam Herta for promoting her, she even stooped to this.

396a38f672b9309a.ContentText: I was so angry that I was shaking. I broke out in a cold sweat!

e702eaef6a9c4de3.ContentText: That amount of money? Herself!? Who do you think she is, Fleming's daughter?

d8ec9d28664bd410.ContentText: Anyway, now you know everything, so leave me alone. I still need to write a report about this for Madam Herta.

e0c1e4f7cb42aa14.ContentText: (Seems like it's all just a scare...)
e0c1e4f7cb42aa14.Speaker: playerboy

6fdbc3fddba4d973.ContentText: (But it's easy to make rumors and hard to dispel them. I better let Asta know.)
6fdbc3fddba4d973.Speaker: playerboy

7ebabca1fc1146bb.ContentText: Uh, hi, how can I help you?

a932eeb975c4c5c4.ContentText: Oh, you mean the guy from the group chat — the one with the scoop?

2b2728b13293ef55.ContentText: I found out about the whole thing recently — drama for drama's sake, y'know? Don't take it too seriously...

aa5cdacb2046c3e6.ContentText: Started it? What do you mean? I think you have the wrong person.

2c1a3cc2dce6eecf.ContentText: I've been on overtime for the past two days — I haven't left my office...

6cd16edaf480d288.ContentText: *sigh* Sounds like a lot's happened since I last poked my head out the door...

31a0399b29c2e220.ContentText: (She said... a young man with <color=#dbc291ff>black-rimmed glasses and a slanted fringe</color>.)
31a0399b29c2e220.Speaker: playerboy

456c778dd8977385.ContentText: You can't waste money like this...
456c778dd8977385.Speaker: Arlan

85775eb298430389.ContentText: This isn't wasting money! The IPC's budget is so stringent, and the process takes so long! By the time my application would've gone through too much time would've been wasted!
85775eb298430389.Speaker: Asta

d7a8c4b9a03280c8.ContentText: Do you know how much hardware was destroyed when the Legion attacked? And how many cables are currently out of order on the station?
d7a8c4b9a03280c8.Speaker: Asta

8eeec01fc4a985f2.ContentText: How is it my fault when I'm spending my own money to solve everyone else's problems? Give my encryption key back!
8eeec01fc4a985f2.Speaker: Asta

14483217845a843b.ContentText: You — who gave you the right to tell me what to do with my money?
14483217845a843b.Speaker: Asta

3ec0642efe0e0344.ContentText: I... I might have done that, but this doesn't count as wasting money!
3ec0642efe0e0344.Speaker: Asta

8716bdb79a8457f8.ContentText: How is it not wasting money? We lost that Findie device you bought during the Legion's invasion.
8716bdb79a8457f8.Speaker: Arlan

08d417af57247579.ContentText: All you had to do was check the inventory, and we could've replaced it — why did you make a new order?
08d417af57247579.Speaker: Arlan

988fe9a68ad82f16.ContentText: And that starnought fleet from the last time...
988fe9a68ad82f16.Speaker: Arlan

c0b49e26badd2cd5.ContentText: I did make an order, but it didn't go through... I was just trying to improve security measures to make sure attacks like this don't happen again.
c0b49e26badd2cd5.Speaker: Asta

ac729f8020573f2e.ContentText: I—If the money wasn't spent, then it doesn't count! Anyway, {NICKNAME}, are you here for something?
ac729f8020573f2e.Speaker: Asta

c1a7b23865302c4f.ContentText: Ugh, please, tell me why you're here.
c1a7b23865302c4f.Speaker: Asta

025ee4507cca1008.ContentText: So, you think Richard was the one who stole my encryption key?
025ee4507cca1008.Speaker: Asta

b02e7e4974dc46c9.ContentText: So he was the one who started the rumors... Hmm, that fits.
b02e7e4974dc46c9.Speaker: Asta

465f4b9f82ea06ff.ContentText: I'll deal with that immediately. Please, don't worry, Miss Asta.
465f4b9f82ea06ff.Speaker: Arlan

0724f0622a5cfd7a.ContentText: Go, go... Wait! Leave the encryption key here.
0724f0622a5cfd7a.Speaker: Asta

4aec4dd9196fc21c.ContentText: That's a separate issue. We'll talk about the encryption key later.
4aec4dd9196fc21c.Speaker: Arlan

bb18754a1d1544f6.ContentText: I haven't moved. What you're seeing is one of my remote-controlled puppets. They're all over the station. I just connect to one wherever I am needed.
bb18754a1d1544f6.Speaker: Herta

10c357409e42ea5f.ContentText: Who's waiting for you? I've been busy. What you're seeing is one of my remote-controlled puppets. They're all over the station. I just connect to one wherever I am needed.
10c357409e42ea5f.Speaker: Herta

37d60a870c49a2f0.ContentText: Enough chit-chat, {NICKNAME}. I am working on a big project with a few colleagues. If we succeed, it will answer the ultimate question that's been puzzling us for thousands of Amber Eras: the truth about Aeons.
37d60a870c49a2f0.Speaker: Herta

648e033167efad65.ContentText: Aeons... think about it. What mystical existences! Some Aeons used to be ordinary humans like you and me, but somehow they managed to obtain power beyond our imagination! They are mysterious, powerful, silent and terrifying! It's hard to explain all the mysteries surrounding them.
648e033167efad65.Speaker: Herta

916fff058b7a7faa.ContentText: How were they created? Why were they created? What were they created for? {NICKNAME}, have ever you thought about these questions?
916fff058b7a7faa.Speaker: Herta

6363d71fbd6d420b.ContentText: Great. Curiosity is the foundation of science. Now, we can't just think about it. We should also act. I want to give you the chance to participate in this project. Let's work together.
6363d71fbd6d420b.Speaker: Herta

d36acd122b2c765c.ContentText: Well indeed, it's got nothing to do with you, but we need you. Give me some time, {NICKNAME}, I'll make this worthwhile for you too.
d36acd122b2c765c.Speaker: Herta

741b539410c10641.ContentText: <unbreak>42</unbreak> what? Are you even listening to me? We want to solve the mystery behind the Aeons! Right now I want you to participate in this project!
741b539410c10641.Speaker: Herta

e6cef7245eab89af.ContentText: The four geniuses of the society wrote a program together. You see the big machine in the office? That machine contains a universe, just like the universe we live in, but it's more streamlined and customized.
e6cef7245eab89af.Speaker: Herta

d1efc3356b747b29.ContentText: Oh really? That's what my partners said as well. Fine, I am a team player. Then let's call it the "Simulated Universe."
d1efc3356b747b29.Speaker: Herta

7c44a93eea4676e8.ContentText: Now go and experience it for yourself. I will guide you in the Simulated Universe to make sure nothing happens to you! I'll even give you a substantial reward.
7c44a93eea4676e8.Speaker: Herta

360977037af2b89b.ContentText: What's up? I'll only answer questions about the Simulated Universe.
360977037af2b89b.Speaker: Herta

373363152574b6b5.ContentText: Oh, in layman's terms, it will simulate the Aeons themselves. Then we can ask them questions.
373363152574b6b5.Speaker: Herta

b53f291d68a58d24.ContentText: The society has pulled a lot of strings and diverted a lot of resources to make this project happen... The false Aeons we have simulated are connected with real ones, so you can say we have basically created a bunch of powerless mini Aeons.
b53f291d68a58d24.Speaker: Herta

9a54876897c3d437.ContentText: Of course, if you want to get to the nitty-gritty, it's not that simple... This project has encountered plenty of hiccups along the way. It wasn't all smooth sailing.
9a54876897c3d437.Speaker: Herta

18972570db23a92e.ContentText: Well, the project was jointly launched by four members of our society. There's Ruan Mei, a master in the field of creation. She cultivated the protoplasm simulating the Aeons. There's Screwllum, the famous mechanical aristocrat, who is responsible for writing the underlying logic of the program and the algorithm for the galaxy.
18972570db23a92e.Speaker: Herta

9feb819a84d3f3be.ContentText: There's me, Herta, who is responsible for providing the venue, personnel, resources, and adding some interesting systems to the project. There's also Stephen— oh, um, he wants to keep it a secret, so... forget about him.
9feb819a84d3f3be.Speaker: Herta

f596a39106020647.ContentText: Well, because you're special... You have a Stellaron in your body. You're living the life of a trailblazer, and even Nanook took a glance at you. So the Aeons may be more willing to accept you.
f596a39106020647.Speaker: Herta

4c5735a9bb5563e0.ContentText: You know, the Aeons have no concept of free will at all. They think about nothing but the destined Path. So, when we asked them questions, they simply ignored us, even when Screwllum gave them each a simulated personality and maxed out their social tendency stat.
4c5735a9bb5563e0.Speaker: Herta

fa268fa2b3672d61.ContentText: So we decided a different approach... with you.
fa268fa2b3672d61.Speaker: Herta

5dd34370c28898b3.ContentText: It is a simulation of the entire universe according to Screwllum's design. But right now, only limited locations are open for access in this terminal. It's enough for us. Screwllum likes to design big useless things. He has a whole planet to himself, so he doesn't care about spatial limitations...
5dd34370c28898b3.Speaker: Herta

9b5b9588d76ecc9c.ContentText: Because combat is the best way to connect with one's Path. Only then can we summon those simulated Aeons. Those guys don't have any special talents, but they are as much a real pain in the butt as the actual gods...
9b5b9588d76ecc9c.Speaker: Herta

0a3faf7ff90b412d.ContentText: Of course! For your safety, I want to ensure that everything you see is manageable. I don't want you to lose your mind in the simulation!
0a3faf7ff90b412d.Speaker: Herta

e8ff315648d73996.ContentText: I knew you'd ask about this. Go on.
e8ff315648d73996.Speaker: Herta

96ce934f40e9117f.ContentText: You can keep all the information you get from the simulated Aeons. Isn't that enough? Some people would sell their firstborn just to see an Aeon! And you will get to speak with them face to face!
96ce934f40e9117f.Speaker: Herta

064c93900cdf667d.ContentText: Oh, well... If you want, I am sure I can arrange something. I have more credits than I know what to do with. But honestly, it's just a bunch of numbers the IPC typed up.
064c93900cdf667d.Speaker: Herta

97687998eb42f1ac.ContentText: I want to give you something more practical and realistic, something that can really help you. So, it may be different from how you imagined...
97687998eb42f1ac.Speaker: Herta

01bca77e5f7a3f43.ContentText: Don't forget to test my Simulated Universe!
01bca77e5f7a3f43.Speaker: Herta

8a0473ece7f5d758.ContentText: Shh... Listen, each song has its own story. Maybe you can listen to some when you have the time?

de954048ff920c1a.ContentText: Ehhhh! Don't bring the dirt in here! Pom-Pom just swept!

8c2df241f7752963.ContentText: Pom-Pom can't go outside, yet even from here, the stars are still so pretty to look at.

7e17a47af324af90.ContentText: So... the outside world. What do you think it's like?

ffd4fe72afc4cd11.ContentText: Looks like the inventory won't need be restocked anytime soon.

ce46306bb9c0846e.ContentText: Hmm? Here to buy something? You'll have to get in line first.

536992637943d877.ContentText: More water for you to grow taller, taller, taller!

6e5434184a259164.ContentText: Do you need to be watered too? It looks like you've grown tall enough already.

f0476e1006f307f5.ContentText: ...Zzzzz... What's going on? Did something happen?

62395225b7dd5bb3.ContentText: Pom-Pom isn't a robot! Train conductor needs breaks too!

dd4c202df887e8aa.ContentText: Journeys... dreams... few make it to the end. Most people are just bystanders, witnessing birth and brokenness in the world...

0ea5be34ee60042d.ContentText: It's nothing. Stay on the train long enough and one day you'll understand.

9fc1a43dccc38f9c.ContentText: Hmmm... how can a button be so stubborn...

f9fcb245fb56c947.ContentText: Do—don't get the wrong idea! Pom-Pom only eats three donuts a day...

a451904f7a28b6be.ContentText: Ugh... Every day Pom-Pom has to clean it over again. What a nuisance!

fe8c9e57a8bbf061.ContentText: Move along, passenger! Your conductor has to get to work!

50bd445eb0aa26e0.ContentText: Eh, there doesn't seem to be anything special going on.

ea6f21e35285032b.ContentText: Hm... the coach is quiet. Maybe a little too quiet?

3fcfafea5d28aae2.ContentText: Ah... Standing for such a long time makes Pom-Pom want to take a nap.

ede70fbaf744a9c2.ContentText: Not to brag or anything, but the lighting and temperature here are carefully calibrated by Pom-Pom, so it's normal to get sleepy.

472f01b17b84d58b.ContentText: La la la la la~ huh? You're back! It's natural for the conductor to feel relieved when their passengers return safely!

9a5373ca2dc74414.ContentText: You finally got some leisure time. Don't forget to grab some sleep when you're done wandering about, {NICKNAME}.

48592dc3260740e5.ContentText: Sounds nice. If only Pom-Pom could go out on expeditions with you...

9ee39fdbdb2cd876.ContentText: Back already? Did you get into some trouble?

f48e81d25c5a7ddf.ContentText: Quit being a nuisance! Pom-Pom is working!

0110aacf643af4ce.ContentText: That's our Bronya — quick as a flash!
0110aacf643af4ce.Speaker: March 7th

711c0bcae851c28e.ContentText: She certainly moves a lot faster than some people I know...
711c0bcae851c28e.Speaker: Dan Heng

c02258b74c7197fd.ContentText: ...If you haven't got anything nice to say right now, zip it!
c02258b74c7197fd.Speaker: March 7th

2395a03c2e1600f9.ContentText: ...I understand your circumstances, Serval. I respect your choice.
2395a03c2e1600f9.Speaker: Bronya

b351723361c9ba96.ContentText: It was my mistake to make an unwarranted request without considering your own wishes.
b351723361c9ba96.Speaker: Bronya

6120d42c59db927f.ContentText: Allow me to offer you my apologies... I hope you don't take this matter to heart.
6120d42c59db927f.Speaker: Bronya

d0381c99198ad239.ContentText: N—No need, Bronya! You're a supreme guardian now. Don't let a little thing like this...
d0381c99198ad239.Speaker: Serval

4fdaceb3079a78ea.ContentText: Besides, I'm the one who should be apologizing — I've put my own personal reasons ahead of Belobog's reconstruction...
4fdaceb3079a78ea.Speaker: Serval

06e5c6242b4858b4.ContentText: I get it, Serval. After all, you and mother...
06e5c6242b4858b4.Speaker: Bronya

602e001aaf88ff05.ContentText: ...Sorry, I don't mean to open up old wounds...
602e001aaf88ff05.Speaker: Bronya

05bbe21280c668e2.ContentText: ...but there's something I need to ask you.
05bbe21280c668e2.Speaker: Bronya

b05b540b7622c12b.ContentText: This guitar... I found it after going through mother's old things.
b05b540b7622c12b.Speaker: Bronya

16a97686d447e4e0.ContentText: She was never a music lover, so... I thought this might be connected to you...
16a97686d447e4e0.Speaker: Bronya

952ed34ce0404ae0.ContentText: ...I—It's nothing. You're right, it does belong to me.
952ed34ce0404ae0.Speaker: Serval

3e6e41342aeced47.ContentText: ...In fact, it once belonged to me and Cocolia. It was our shared treasure. If you don't mind, Bronya... could I take it back to the workshop?
3e6e41342aeced47.Speaker: Serval

311c783b323f514f.ContentText: ...Of course. I—I'm sure there's a story behind it, but that's between you and mother — I won't pry.
311c783b323f514f.Speaker: Bronya

af5f1643759f2666.ContentText: I hope you have an amazing journey, Serval. Do remember to visit home when you get the chance.
af5f1643759f2666.Speaker: Bronya

c2c29aa121d9d321.ContentText: You... You just won't stop haunting me.
c2c29aa121d9d321.Speaker: Serval

185a40a82cace5a0.ContentText: I try everything to put the past behind me... and yet you always manage to creep up again...
185a40a82cace5a0.Speaker: Serval

c199ae8f77598807.ContentText: Cocolia, you... you witch! You terminated my research and ruined my life... What else do you want to take away from me!?
c199ae8f77598807.Speaker: Serval

939631a597b1d05a.ContentText: Calm down, Serval! It's just a Fragmentum illusion!
939631a597b1d05a.Speaker: Gepard

68878c98f3469a7e.ContentText: All that time we spent together... was any of it real?
68878c98f3469a7e.Speaker: Serval

d2dbba7e677de7ed.ContentText: It was so easy for you to just leave this world behind... Don't you at least owe me an explanation!?
d2dbba7e677de7ed.Speaker: Serval

966723eaa5b54b52.ContentText: █There is no place for you█ ██the promised new world!

7eb635b6a4796d8c.ContentText: Sister! I know you want Madam Cocolia to respond...
7eb635b6a4796d8c.Speaker: Gepard

ed9a4fadc615e25d.ContentText: But this... thing in front of us is our enemy! It was born out of the evil gathered in the Fragmentum! You won't get answers from it!
ed9a4fadc615e25d.Speaker: Gepard

cc5a918415e32146.ContentText: Fight with us, sister. Let's dispel the shadow of the past once and for all!
cc5a918415e32146.Speaker: Gepard

517df37bd566752f.ContentText: Of course, if you're not yet able to confront the past...
517df37bd566752f.Speaker: Gepard

d5e3d2589063e5ff.ContentText: Then {NICKNAME} and I will fight for you... until your heart is ready.
d5e3d2589063e5ff.Speaker: Gepard

a4e91c77748aa86a.ContentText: I'm sorry, brother. I always make you worry when things get serious.
a4e91c77748aa86a.Speaker: Serval

25466a5d867b01b9.ContentText: But I see what you're doing... Reverse psychology, huh?
25466a5d867b01b9.Speaker: Serval

a0231065c6f7bb38.ContentText: Well, seeing as we've come this far...
a0231065c6f7bb38.Speaker: Serval

3222cbcab5c2f9e2.ContentText: Cocolia... let's settle this bad blood right here, right now!
3222cbcab5c2f9e2.Speaker: Serval

4e84cf217d176065.ContentText: Is this... the Stellaron Imprisonment Device? They had such advanced technology back in the day.... impressive.
4e84cf217d176065.Speaker: Serval

03d7117bf7557f9e.ContentText: ...Mm. She gave something back, in death.
03d7117bf7557f9e.Speaker: Serval

b1a5b374ef6610a7.ContentText: I think I'm mostly here for myself. Still...
b1a5b374ef6610a7.Speaker: Serval

212a2f053a9c69b5.ContentText: I wanted to come here to perform for Cocolia. To say goodbye...
212a2f053a9c69b5.Speaker: Serval

9f35f50d7dcd4024.ContentText: ...I'm glad you guys are here to witness it.
9f35f50d7dcd4024.Speaker: Serval

200042f3901a6b9b.ContentText: Not the nicest spot for a show, and the equipment could be better... sorry about that.
200042f3901a6b9b.Speaker: Serval

bbe68f25809c2e29.ContentText: Look at me, Cocolia! Don't you dare look away...
bbe68f25809c2e29.Speaker: Serval

409b2716c7579b1b.ContentText: ...Happy. I just wish I could've seen the look on her face.
409b2716c7579b1b.Speaker: Serval

39fa48badc6e2eed.ContentText: Well, that's all from me... {NICKNAME}, Gepard, thanks for sticking by my side me throughout all of this.
39fa48badc6e2eed.Speaker: Serval

6c3d453feb8d1846.ContentText: As for tonight... let's go to Old Goethe's place and have a big feast to celebrate!
6c3d453feb8d1846.Speaker: Serval

dac52b9c0fd67f4b.ContentText: The city is drowning in tears... The power of the Preservation is fading.

314f9db4c4fc16d4.ContentText: We could not defy the will of the Stellaron after all...

dbee57adba5736a5.ContentText: Yes... But we have no right to judge.

8b8aabbcf38f4f9f.ContentText: The Fragmentum had been expanding for the past <unbreak>700</unbreak> years. There is no faith nor wealth left for our successors... only despair.

20ff9dd77f28f618.ContentText: To see the home we vowed to preserve wither away... That in itself is torture. Not to mention the haunting whisper of temptation...

a2bcf7cf3bc91399.ContentText: The day will come when even the strongest of wills cannot help but give in to such influence. It is only a matter of time before the Amber Lord forsakes us.

4f295bde724baed3.ContentText: You are but a stranger to us. And yet you seek to bond your destiny to ours...

c0c5887986910041.ContentText: So be it. What is there to lose when so much has already been lost...

67b3ae83027e8c40.ContentText: Touch the light of the Amber, trailblazer. See if your will can attract their gaze.

3e44c823e69ea26c.ContentText: It's been more than a decade... I'm so glad to see you in the hotel lobby again, Mr. Goethe.

94ad9ef2e90f8f8f.ContentText: Unbelievable... feels like it was just yesterday that I was showing you around the hotel all those years ago. I'm too old to remember a lot of things... but that day I remember clearly as ever.

a898f6095ad5ef03.ContentText: Since the passage between the Overworld and Underworld has opened up again, it's about time we shared some tips with each other, hotel manager to hotel manager.

d565d10b00ab2748.ContentText: Of course, of course! I was worried before that after losing customers from the Overworld you would go out of business... but your establishment is still alive and well, all thanks to your superb management!

4fbdc412d6f2283a.ContentText: You flatter me, Goethe! My hotel is getting refurbished. I'll be sure to invite you to visit again when the work is all done.

0e130cc6c2a9be19.ContentText: Home, sweet home! Mr. Yang and Himeko must be bored given how long our train had to stay here.
0e130cc6c2a9be19.Speaker: March 7th

9dcedebdf65d78b6.ContentText: Where's our next stop? I can't wait!
9dcedebdf65d78b6.Speaker: March 7th

561b39986d77536c.ContentText: The Express crew tread upon the Trailblaze. We travel between worlds, like a thread weaved into the life stories of others.
561b39986d77536c.Speaker: Himeko

c06f677de1aea003.ContentText: The universe is vast beyond our imagination. It's a miracle that our paths converge. The fact that we get to know and travel with each other can only be seen as the design of destiny.
c06f677de1aea003.Speaker: Himeko

def2ac06a3a00342.ContentText: Thank you for becoming our companion, {NICKNAME}. I'll do my best to answer any questions you may have.
def2ac06a3a00342.Speaker: Himeko

88d3f3b10dfd9a31.ContentText: Sure. Oftentimes those who are involved in historic events don't have the opportunity to see things from a wider perspective. I hope as an onlooker I may provide some help.
88d3f3b10dfd9a31.Speaker: Himeko

03b099b94e7a53b0.ContentText: Qlipoth the Preservation is known for their... indifference. Unless you become a zealot like those with the Corporation, it's hard to share in the Aeon's power.
03b099b94e7a53b0.Speaker: Himeko

8444079f60987317.ContentText: Determined to preserve the world they love, the Architects held on for hundreds of years. But as the Fragmentum continued to advance, their already wavering faith started to show some cracks.
8444079f60987317.Speaker: Himeko

0286a5a7a3f8480e.ContentText: And one particular guardian, Cocolia, abandoned the Path of Preservation altogether. In contrast, you stood your ground and proved your faith in the Amber Lord.
0286a5a7a3f8480e.Speaker: Himeko

2488e34bf12c7e95.ContentText: Judging by how the battle turned out, Qlipoth responded to your wish. Their gaze infused you with the power to wield the weapon of a supreme guardian and to take control of the Colossus.
2488e34bf12c7e95.Speaker: Himeko

9f2fa954317bdf04.ContentText: *chuckles* Don't mention it. Welt and I may have stayed on the Express this whole time, but we've been watching over you the moment you set foot on Jarilo-VI.
9f2fa954317bdf04.Speaker: Himeko

64eb095aac10f198.ContentText: Friends look after each other, the same goes for us Nameless. Please remember, no matter where you are in the universe, the Express will always be behind you.
64eb095aac10f198.Speaker: Himeko

e6a8635268b10f19.ContentText: ...is a Stellaron, there's no doubt about that.
e6a8635268b10f19.Speaker: Himeko

766435499c64c9b6.ContentText: What I've gathered so far suggests it's likely that the supreme guardian was corrupted by the Stellaron at a very young age. All the tragedies that came after can be traced to that point...
766435499c64c9b6.Speaker: Himeko

cf76174020774b1f.ContentText: On the flip side, we can't judge Cocolia too harshly. Imagine if it were you or me who had to sit on the throne and watch the city slowly being brought to its knees... Would we not question what we believed in?
cf76174020774b1f.Speaker: Himeko

753b0937f1e41254.ContentText: Sure, ask away. We've got plenty of time.
753b0937f1e41254.Speaker: Himeko

1fd9c330e73f3225.ContentText: Welt may be better equipped to answer that. But if you want my two cents...
1fd9c330e73f3225.Speaker: Himeko

c568a528b87e4e02.ContentText: I'd say it's unlikely. I guess it's possible, but it would take a long time.
c568a528b87e4e02.Speaker: Himeko

1eb0971f3cbe7acb.ContentText: I can tell from your report that the new Supreme Guardian of Belobog is a smart young lady with leadership qualities. What's more important is that she now understands her people after the journey with you.
1eb0971f3cbe7acb.Speaker: Himeko

d9bc399d0ee2f300.ContentText: The firm and honest support she gets from people around her will also prove immensely useful. But fate likes to play tricks on people. Even if during their lifetime they managed to make Jarilo-VI prosper again to a certain degree...
d9bc399d0ee2f300.Speaker: Himeko

32ce139392f56701.ContentText: They will remain vulnerable and helpless to countless threats lurking in the recesses of the universe. We can only give them our best wishes from afar.
32ce139392f56701.Speaker: Himeko

a21bb723ddfcc26f.ContentText: It's virtually impossible to destroy a Stellaron. No one, not even Herta, has found a way to break its structure. The best we can do at this stage is to prevent its energy from overflowing.
a21bb723ddfcc26f.Speaker: Himeko

205e552c215c9686.ContentText: When the supreme guardian was defeated, the Stellaron that had been transmitting energy to her exposed its weakness to us for a brief period of time, allowing Welt and I to contain its power.
205e552c215c9686.Speaker: Himeko

90a28334eda8dce9.ContentText: That's about all we can do about a Stellaron. It may be suppressed for now, but it's only a matter of time before it regains power.
90a28334eda8dce9.Speaker: Himeko

3790693e6995fba8.ContentText: But this brief window should allow the people on this planet to heal and rebuild.
3790693e6995fba8.Speaker: Himeko

e800609da8c6a9bb.ContentText: You're most welcome, {NICKNAME}. Have some rest, you've earned it.
e800609da8c6a9bb.Speaker: Himeko

1c21d0504cd4b51f.ContentText: So, your first trailblazing expedition has concluded. How do you feel, {NICKNAME}?
1c21d0504cd4b51f.Speaker: Welt

4d87b88a31562816.ContentText: Be it joy or pain, success or regret, it's all part of the journey. Those feelings will accompany you as long as you tread on the Trailblaze, and one day you'll grow used to them.
4d87b88a31562816.Speaker: Welt

bdcbe692fda26e79.ContentText: It seems you have something on your mind. Let's hear it. I'd like to hear a fresh perspective myself... Hehe, as talkative as Himeko is, we've pretty much run out of topics.
bdcbe692fda26e79.Speaker: Welt

c25bcaa4ab078733.ContentText: As I've mentioned before, the Stellaron's influence on Jarilo-VI is more profound than we might think. I don't think Belobog's fight against the lingering effects of the Stellaron will end any time soon.
c25bcaa4ab078733.Speaker: Welt

3d6e98acebb2142a.ContentText: But, the balance of power is tilting ever so slightly towards humanity, the crucial factor being the hope you brought about.
3d6e98acebb2142a.Speaker: Welt

ce76ac973d4fbce4.ContentText: As intangible as it may sound, don't underestimate hope because the power it inspires has no limit. Like the Stellaron, it's a seed that may grow into something much bigger. But in my opinion, the fruit that hope bears will have a much bigger impact than that of the Stellaron.
ce76ac973d4fbce4.Speaker: Welt

5069e68efa1d3375.ContentText: Is that so? Well, I think you did the right thing. It's better to move forward with the burden of knowledge than to tread a perilous road with blind optimism.
5069e68efa1d3375.Speaker: Welt

c9e688858fea3612.ContentText: I remember a distant world where the people were faced with unimaginable danger every single day. But they saved their planet time after time with wisdom and courage.
c9e688858fea3612.Speaker: Welt

4bdafa7d4cb9bf5b.ContentText: This goes to show how much of a difference ordinary people can make. I hope Jarilo-VI sees that too.
4bdafa7d4cb9bf5b.Speaker: Welt

92152cb8bc0bc9a8.ContentText: Hehe... I, too, wished to go with you. But Himeko insisted on letting you and your friends rise to the challenge.
92152cb8bc0bc9a8.Speaker: Welt

eb2746af401eaae9.ContentText: I'd been observing what's happening on the ground from the Express, and I have to admit that I got sweaty palms a couple of times. I was glad to see you three meet friends you could trust and overcome hardships. Well done.
eb2746af401eaae9.Speaker: Welt

7ae318a673d26486.ContentText: Himeko was calm from the very beginning. She kept telling me to trust you youngsters' decisions.
7ae318a673d26486.Speaker: Welt

fca07a9e3072906f.ContentText: Hehe... And she was right. I really need to stop worrying so much.
fca07a9e3072906f.Speaker: Welt

2d3ebcd90268b1cc.ContentText: Likewise. Get some sleep, we'll be heading off again soon.
2d3ebcd90268b1cc.Speaker: Welt

743d6e0cbaba3a6a.ContentText: ...Shhh! Checking star rail stability, Pom-Pom needs to focus!

a2300c13adad79ed.ContentText: Spatial readout... back to the normal bracket!

90ee0024bd891a07.ContentText: The numbers have stabilized! Dispatch the Express!

48875129bc44eba6.ContentText: ...Oh, welcome back to the Express. You've accomplished your Trailblaze Mission, the Express appreciates your help!

9216ec3668096521.ContentText: Thanks to you, the Space Fissure is healing up, and the star rail has become stable enough for us to dispatch the Express...

e7ae923d72dc77a0.ContentText: As for the coaches, Pom-Pom's checked every nook and cranny and made sure everything is in good order!

81606fc214b754eb.ContentText: ...Don't worry about it! Jarilo-VI probably doesn't have anything worth buying anyway. Plus, it's your first time on a Trailblaze Mission, so Pom-Pom will let it slide this time!

60a69238ce8bfb0c.ContentText: The destination will be announced at the navigation meeting.

cf8aac2ff0286fdd.ContentText: For now, get some rest and stay tuned!

231f4020b9a77a23.ContentText: There you go, careful not to spill it!

93604c516f13f5d1.ContentText: To avoid encountering the anomalies again, the Express will dispatch shortly and head to a more stable area.

65367e4a7bf1222e.ContentText: For your safety, please don't leave your seat until the Express has reached cruising speed!

01de81f709730624.ContentText: It's about time we hit the road, passengers! Thanks to the three trailblazers, the activity of the Fragmentum has reached the lowest level, and the readings regarding the status of the star rail have returned to normal!

83d2bbeec6422fb5.ContentText: Pom-Pom will dispatch the Express shortly and we'll be leaving Jarilo-VI. Please be seated and say your goodbyes to this planet!

f84d128bb50ef2a2.ContentText: Finally, you're here. This is urgent, so I'll cut to the chase — Arlan's disappeared.
f84d128bb50ef2a2.Speaker: Asta

52be3093e3cfd6c5.ContentText: Yes, I can't find him. He's not answering his messages or calls.
52be3093e3cfd6c5.Speaker: Asta

f975f69d5f8f3074.ContentText: In all the time since I took him in, this has never happened.
f975f69d5f8f3074.Speaker: Asta

571804a59107453f.ContentText: Of course! I didn't see him...
571804a59107453f.Speaker: Asta

a948a2ac98f56e56.ContentText: Parts of the surveillance system were destroyed when the Legion invaded — it still hasn't been fully repaired. Maybe he took advantage of a blind spot.
a948a2ac98f56e56.Speaker: Asta

198cd0b56541b3b9.ContentText: It's been thirteen hours since he last contacted me. He usually takes less than <unbreak>13</unbreak> seconds to reply to my messages!
198cd0b56541b3b9.Speaker: Asta

946976bda5be6d38.ContentText: I looked everywhere and couldn't find him, so I checked the Security Department's work plan records. This is what I found!
946976bda5be6d38.Speaker: Asta

1ab6b4c70fc3a473.ContentText: Look, at his last work objectives entry: "Of the heart. Of the mirror. Of the self." It's so strange...
1ab6b4c70fc3a473.Speaker: Asta

18fbb561e6b04ce0.ContentText: I knew it. {NICKNAME}, you think so too, right?
18fbb561e6b04ce0.Speaker: Asta

25a772a7f7897c52.ContentText: *sigh* I asked people in the Security Department, but none of them thought it was concerning. They said stuff like:
25a772a7f7897c52.Speaker: Asta

a79ae49fb457519b.ContentText: "Brother Arlan is a grown man with his own plans!"
a79ae49fb457519b.Speaker: Asta

edd616db23ab0fe8.ContentText: I couldn't get them to listen at all, so I'm asking you for help.
edd616db23ab0fe8.Speaker: Asta

438130d1a4d91429.ContentText: I have a secret weapon! Say hello to...
438130d1a4d91429.Speaker: Asta

d33d02c8d88ccec6.ContentText: Why are you acting like those Security Department idiots!? Stop fooling around and help me!
d33d02c8d88ccec6.Speaker: Asta

586064c0981022af.ContentText: I have a secret weapon! Say hello to...
586064c0981022af.Speaker: Asta

f47cc0f288bf8fdd.ContentText: Mm-hmm, Peppy's my dog — Arlan's looked after him since he was a puppy. They're great friends.
f47cc0f288bf8fdd.Speaker: Asta

998810ef1fe2fa59.ContentText: Peppy knows Arlan's scent — maybe he can track him down.
998810ef1fe2fa59.Speaker: Asta

17cab6f76342dcd8.ContentText: Y—Yes! Think about it — if people see me, the acting lead researcher, searching for Arlan...
17cab6f76342dcd8.Speaker: Asta

8254c4dcd7a7835f.ContentText: Peppy can't go alone. What if he gets lost too? And I can't go with him — if people see me, the acting lead researcher, searching for Arlan...
8254c4dcd7a7835f.Speaker: Asta

2ca9e2e65679ddf6.ContentText: Wouldn't that... Wouldn't that make Arlan look incompetent as head of the Security Department?
2ca9e2e65679ddf6.Speaker: Asta

d61f70cda1544665.ContentText: ...Let's go together! Relax — Peppy doesn't bite.
d61f70cda1544665.Speaker: Asta

2819b6d4a9144994.ContentText: That's... Professor Capote? Are you sure Arlan was here, Peppy?
2819b6d4a9144994.Speaker: Asta

d4f544bbf6d1db0b.ContentText: Weird. Why would he visit this Casanova?
d4f544bbf6d1db0b.Speaker: Asta

7bad52c57291af42.ContentText: Look at all his fans! Need I say more?
7bad52c57291af42.Speaker: Asta

e5acc1304a259f41.ContentText: Behold, the winner of the "Most Awesome Researcher" contest.
e5acc1304a259f41.Speaker: Asta

8c9ae739c6132b40.ContentText: Haha, he probably should've been named Casanova... I've gotten used to saying it, anyway.
8c9ae739c6132b40.Speaker: Asta

1dd8e32417de3a7a.ContentText: Behold, the winner of the "Most Awesome Researcher" contest.
1dd8e32417de3a7a.Speaker: Asta

e0a5cb9853a71b63.ContentText: Hmm, it's better if I don't show my face... {NICKNAME}, see if you can get some intel out of him.
e0a5cb9853a71b63.Speaker: Asta

9e11e2e9315a1b3d.ContentText: I must confess that I, too, was terrified. Petrified, even! But there remained a light in my heart. A light that led me onward!

440cc4e102f4563a.ContentText: That light... was the happy smiles on all your faces!

8a73bacffcfd7c62.ContentText: Ah! Master Capote thinks about me!

9ce7f6d786d81d03.ContentText: Oh, it's you! Long time no see. How are you?

e0292912f3a3d0b0.ContentText: I'm a bit busy here. If it's not urgent, come back later.

654c830ab3271731.ContentText: Oh, it's you! Long time no see. Are you okay? You look troubled — that's quite a wrinkled brow.

deff35014921c50e.ContentText: Come! Join the others and listen to me recount the tale of the Legion's invasion. I'm sure your memory of the events will dispel your worries.

60bc96f905c1f017.ContentText: The Antimatter Legion barely missed me, and that's when I saw your faces... It was all I could see. If it weren't for you, I wouldn't be standing here today.

7ba838add6a55c04.ContentText: Aha, I see you no longer look troubled. There is only one word to describe your expression: Enlightenment!

010172a59655fb95.ContentText: Such is the power of my rhetoric! It creates an energy that uplifts the soul.

6f8d56bb445d2753.ContentText: Oh, still troubled? You must be ill! You look pale and your pupils are gray... That's fine! I, Capote, never waver in my support! I shall double my efforts to heal your heart.

ee0624c387eadd4a.ContentText: Arlan? Uh, yes... I know him. After all, my calling is to light up the heart of every person on the space station. As to his current location...

741d42ccf1c24e4d.ContentText: Forgive me, but I cannot tell!

c6409e85f03bd510.ContentText: (Insert dramatic pause and sudden drama here...)
c6409e85f03bd510.Speaker: playerboy

053928d5d025d9bc.ContentText: Everyone knows the most important word in my life is "principle." Without principle, what difference would there be between a person and a mechanical arm?

8b9d9ee1a77f6c34.ContentText: Wait a minute... last time he said the most important word in his life was "illumination..."

a654a1c68c318345.ContentText: We need to update Master Capote's Life Wiki! This will be version <unbreak>12.0</unbreak> of his life keywords!

5f7436ddfeb91367.ContentText: Ahem, uh... Anyway, I do not lie. I can tell you that I did indeed meet Arlan recently, and I know where he went.

b1a494e506a6cf5e.ContentText: Regrettably, I already swore on my life that I, Capote, would never tell anyone Captain Arlan's secret!

0f46a2ed381ee401.ContentText: You don't understand what I'm trying to say at all!

b634c8f6b40c7000.ContentText: Crises, disasters... these are just mirages of the material plane! A person's character and the vows of humankind are most precious — they must be protected at all costs!

fb292678e1e7f7cb.ContentText: All you see are the minuscule risks of the immediate situation... but did you ever consider that if I, Capote, abandoned my principles, then the hopes and dreams of hundreds of fair ladies would be dashed?

a1e134825da7cb02.ContentText: I am their lighthouse, and I will NEVER allow myself to be tainted!

e5d8ace9d612a5ff.ContentText: *sniff* Oh, Master Capote is so considerate...

64ffc9628dd2b86b.ContentText: (Wow, the cringe is strong... I need to remember what I came here for!)
64ffc9628dd2b86b.Speaker: playerboy

014b10256bc955e2.ContentText: Seems like you already know what kind of person I am.

abea821e6125ae2b.ContentText: Captain Arlan had a similar expression to yours when he found me. He was anxious and desired an answer.

0274f437164b45b4.ContentText: But answers are not easy to give. Besides, he wanted to master a trial of the heart that would thoroughly change him, and that would be even more difficult...

5bbd2e2d9a8bec05.ContentText: You can't even imagine the difficulty of the trial. I was tired merely from the act of imitating that way of talking with him! Thankfully he... Ah! Ahem, no more. No more!

c316061bfd75c54a.ContentText: (His words match Arlan's work plan records. Seems like he does have key information.)
c316061bfd75c54a.Speaker: playerboy

aee0a0464ccca796.ContentText: Seems like you already know what kind of person I am. I'm telling you, quit while you can and don't waste your time and effort here. You can see that I, too, am quite busy.

5cb0023f44de7f7f.ContentText: *sigh* I didn't take you to be so stubborn. The light in your heart has been clouded for too long!

9d6774575c78d078.ContentText: But I, Capote, will never give up on anyone. Even if I have to talk through the day and into the night, I will make you understand!

a73a19493c7e6fdd.ContentText: (Wow, the cringe is strong... I need to remember what I came here for!)
a73a19493c7e6fdd.Speaker: playerboy

1f24ce4f1918edf9.ContentText: Seems like you already know what kind of person I am.

9ec78069072893aa.ContentText: Captain Arlan had a similar expression to yours when he found me. He was anxious and desired an answer.

23b4b260c67e06b3.ContentText: But answers are not easy to give. Besides, he wanted to master a trial of the heart that would thoroughly change him, and that would be even more difficult...

91eadefbd7e02f21.ContentText: You can't even imagine the difficulty of the trial. I was tired merely from the act of imitating that way of talking with him! Thankfully he... Ah! Ahem, no more. No more!

1e2e5e2f4f243054.ContentText: (His words match Arlan's work plans. Seems like he does have key information.)
1e2e5e2f4f243054.Speaker: playerboy

e7828502e2b341a0.ContentText: I-I didn't say that! Did you mishear it?

90c1f2ea2d5fe407.ContentText: Ahem... What I said was "Life is a trial, and you need to be true to yourself."

37afd0f3a94cf67e.ContentText: So, I know nothing about anything you said about Captain Arlan. Ahem, I need to head to a meeting now. Can we talk later?

51f1ab4a6c463ddf.ContentText: (I can't let him get away like this. If he doesn't want to tell me, then...)
51f1ab4a6c463ddf.Speaker: playerboy

a203fed91d8443ed.ContentText: Y—You dare to utter such a threat!

3685e4e1fecaf85c.ContentText: Listen here, leaving aside the fact that you don't have the right to dismiss me, I wouldn't yield even if Lead Researcher Asta — no, if Madam Herta herself commanded me!

f59892c9e7034e73.ContentText: Why not threaten to KILL me while you're at it? I've said it once and I'll say it again — I will not yield!

38094af0de00ce16.ContentText: *sigh* Master Capote is so courageous... We're so lucky to be his fans...

fcdf13df41571ad6.ContentText: He said the exact same thing when he promised Captain Arlan.

a84d78f9aa4d1479.ContentText: Yes, the part about not yielding... It's making me tear up! *sob*

aaae75d83968f1bf.ContentText: I'm gonna print out the <color=#dbc291ff>transcript of the conversation</color> as soon as I get back today! The fan club needs to recite and memorize it!

20594fb0b8140cfe.ContentText: (Transcript? They've recorded Arlan's conversation with Capote...?)
20594fb0b8140cfe.Speaker: playerboy

ff609b342d08dc71.ContentText: (I didn't think a clue like that would suddenly pop up...)
ff609b342d08dc71.Speaker: playerboy

741160d22a91046a.ContentText: D-Don't joke about that! Promotions have a strict assessment process!

f46eaeb83c815db9.ContentText: I did hear that the space station gives special benefits to morally upstanding researchers... but those are just rumors — even the oldest staff have never witnessed it!

26901f01edacf6f8.ContentText: Stop looking down on Master Capote! He's not the kind of person you think he is!

e7ffe7f04e2019b8.ContentText: Master Capote's Life Wiki, version <unbreak>4.0</unbreak>: Master Capote doesn't care about rank. Everyone knows that!

acdd5d0b57b22d33.ContentText: Even if you promoted Master Capote to acting lead researcher, he wouldn't tell you about the trial!

6f4b54c07cfe1738.ContentText: ...I—Indeed! I won't forsake my precious morality for something so base!

20c8b49119fd3f18.ContentText: How could you think up something so terrible? You're not just lost, my friend — you've completely strayed from the narrow path!

a2860e88d69d5c99.ContentText: I need to give you a thorough education on human ethics — we'll need to sit down and go over it slowly...

27f02b13985cba2a.ContentText: No need to bother Master Capote! We'll fix this injustice for you ourselves!

fe42e2401dbb49b8.ContentText: (Wow, the cringe is strong... I need to remember what I came here for!)
fe42e2401dbb49b8.Speaker: playerboy

3241e0800a511736.ContentText: They went through everything with you? I'm sure you reflected deeply on your actions.

8b53c2768e63989f.ContentText: I'll pretend I never heard the things you said. Think before you act in future, please.

3118b46e5fd05fd4.ContentText: Of course, if you haven't reflected enough, we can always talk more in private... Right now, I need to hurry to a meeting!

4c53d08f1854c8ce.ContentText: (I can't let him get away like this. If he doesn't want to tell me, then...)
4c53d08f1854c8ce.Speaker: playerboy

dbb76e67552b7fa5.ContentText: Y—You dare to utter such a threat!

8146505f266a9b82.ContentText: Listen here, leaving aside the fact that you don't have the right to dismiss me, I wouldn't yield even if Lead Researcher Asta — no, if Madam Herta herself commanded me!

da8e4255aaaac84b.ContentText: Why not threaten to KILL me while you're at it? I've said it once and I'll say it again — I will not yield!

b8f83efde9fa62e4.ContentText: *sigh* Master Capote is so courageous... We're so lucky to be his fans...

6d2341e80da36039.ContentText: He said the exact same thing when he promised Captain Arlan.

3aeb78f5a6c7d975.ContentText: Yes, the part about not yielding... It's making me tear up! *sob*

ecc5f401fbb306ea.ContentText: I'm gonna print out the <color=#dbc291ff>transcript of the conversation</color> as soon as I get back today! The fan club needs to recite and memorize it!

d6adb29e3f82f4af.ContentText: (Transcript? They've recorded Arlan's conversation with Capote...?)
d6adb29e3f82f4af.Speaker: playerboy

797807ef7d7c61e4.ContentText: (I didn't think a clue like that would suddenly pop up...)
797807ef7d7c61e4.Speaker: playerboy

9599e4d37ccf4080.ContentText: You really know nothing about repentance! You're totally corrupt!
