eeabbeca00e1b481.ContentText: Now, let me tell you exactly what—

b4681aec3c94dc12.ContentText: Wait, Master Capote! Don't impart your wisdom to this person. They don't deserve it!

6e4d25f9b82550f3.ContentText: That's right! Even we don't get to receive personal instruction from Master Capote!

365c8ce3f964655b.ContentText: Leave it to us, Master Capote!

00d60fbd10af8bed.ContentText: (Wow, the cringe is strong... I need to remember what I came here for!)
00d60fbd10af8bed.Speaker: playerboy

1d107ea56088735a.ContentText: (This is the one who mentioned the transcript just now...)
1d107ea56088735a.Speaker: playerboy

7c96bf1f68b66fa8.ContentText: Hey, you've been talking Master Capote's ear off this whole time. Do you... want to join the fan club?

dfe95294cc6aa261.TitleText: Ruminative Researcher after a Long Period of Thinking
dfe95294cc6aa261.ContentText: I bet you do... You wouldn't have known about Captain Arlan's meeting with Master Capote unless you had an interest.

d5a8d915ecc950e9.ContentText: You even memorized the internal testing content for version <unbreak>12.0</unbreak> of Master Capote's Life Wiki!

3219f89bd458d8e0.TitleText: Ruminative Researcher after a Long Period of Thinking
3219f89bd458d8e0.ContentText: You must be one of those super fans that stayed under the radar. *sigh* We've been careless.

6564ab0d207d0a86.ContentText: We're on the same side after all! Here, this is our latest welcome bundle for new members of the fan club, and I'll toss in an updated version of Master Capote's Life Wiki!

db5966831f057b47.ContentText: Aww... He looks really cool in the new limited-edition snapshots~

08f9e73524a78aac.ContentText: *sigh* What happened to you Arlan? Why did you have to get that sleazy Capote to help you with a trial?
08f9e73524a78aac.Speaker: Asta

77de012c4643ff7d.ContentText: Yeah, I guess that's our starting point.
77de012c4643ff7d.Speaker: Asta

b8cc53445e0d5c4e.ContentText: I heard he's good at rallying people to his cause... Ugh, never mind, let's stay on track and find some clues.
b8cc53445e0d5c4e.Speaker: Asta

3a89b53c1aad8757.ContentText: This handwriting looks familiar... Is it Arlan's...?
3a89b53c1aad8757.Speaker: Asta

b9f64756088f67f0.ContentText: "Against the scorching sun, a beautiful flower will never endure. Within my fair embrace, my love for you is tender and pure."
b9f64756088f67f0.Speaker: Asta

3bb3a14dc52f8571.ContentText: Yuck, so slimy... it does sound like Capote.
3bb3a14dc52f8571.Speaker: Asta

a5a2b2e1b22ac2f2.ContentText: Looks like a candid shot... but surely he knew it was being taken — it's autographed.
a5a2b2e1b22ac2f2.Speaker: Asta

2afc24d971dbc13b.ContentText: There's a figure that's not quite in the shot. Is that... Arlan!?
2afc24d971dbc13b.Speaker: Asta

6728112d3f669f47.ContentText: So Arlan did go to see Professor Capote. This is the evidence.
6728112d3f669f47.Speaker: Asta

117cef36be388cbe.ContentText: ...Even the space station handbook doesn't get updated this frequently.
117cef36be388cbe.Speaker: Asta

bde8a345f4b9fce0.ContentText: So... the trial of the heart means knowing how to deal with an overbearing boss.
bde8a345f4b9fce0.Speaker: Asta

cf64b10cfbed31b3.ContentText: So that's... how Arlan sees me...
cf64b10cfbed31b3.Speaker: Asta

4a777f153c97beaa.ContentText: I need to talk to him — let's hurry up and find him.
4a777f153c97beaa.Speaker: Asta

0ced032510d3659c.ContentText: That's... Dan Heng and the Security Department staff!
0ced032510d3659c.Speaker: Asta

086000eb7a4daa7f.ContentText: There are still remnants of the Antimatter Legion in the space station. Let's go help them!
086000eb7a4daa7f.Speaker: Asta

63306adccda4a7a3.ContentText: ...Then be careful. There are still Legion remnants in the area.
63306adccda4a7a3.Speaker: Dan Heng

b597b8e3d5c18b5a.ContentText: Arlan isn't here right now, so we need to step up the space station's security. Spare no effort and stay focused.
b597b8e3d5c18b5a.Speaker: Dan Heng

51b41d15c67105d0.ContentText: *sigh* I'm only helping Arlan. You're here to look for him, right? He's with March.
51b41d15c67105d0.Speaker: Dan Heng

27050afe4c8e7ab7.ContentText: But I suggest you don't bother him. He's given himself a personal trial.
27050afe4c8e7ab7.Speaker: Dan Heng

d37e9c90ca62fae2.TitleText: Thrilled Member of the Security Department
d37e9c90ca62fae2.ContentText: Brother Arlan's special trial? He's a man among men, a lion among tigers! He's already reached great heights, but still he wants to improve!

dd4444b89459a3b9.TitleText: Excited Member of the Security Department
dd4444b89459a3b9.ContentText: That trial... I bet it's even more intense than physical training! And brother Arlan already challenges himself to the limit in that department — he runs <unbreak>21,358</unbreak> meters around the space station every day! An eagle among wolves! Always so hard on himself!

7e1e0e89bfbf532b.TitleText: Thrilled Member of the Security Department
7e1e0e89bfbf532b.ContentText: I think it must have something to do with the mind. He probably found a waterfall and asked Ms. March to lower the temperature to freezing point!

5820eac0d4d65d38.TitleText: Excited Member of the Security Department
5820eac0d4d65d38.ContentText: No way! Brother Arlan's trial wouldn't be as simple as just standing under a waterfall! I think he wants to learn fighting skills from Ms. March.

a547a9068fee4fae.ContentText: ...They're not correct, but not wrong either.
a547a9068fee4fae.Speaker: Dan Heng

c3e3e6aada3f5d35.ContentText: Arlan came to me to learn how to manage pressure from his boss.
c3e3e6aada3f5d35.Speaker: Dan Heng

41efacb31d7033a4.ContentText: ...So I sent him to March. If he can manage her, then he has nothing to fear.
41efacb31d7033a4.Speaker: Dan Heng

6f9b00c2bb127578.TitleText: Thrilled Member of the Security Department
6f9b00c2bb127578.ContentText: That might be a metaphor too far.

6a09f887dc6664eb.TitleText: Excited Member of the Security Department
6a09f887dc6664eb.ContentText: Brother Arlan runs like a horse and fights like a bear. I think that's a great metaphor!

f1585aba77b292f9.TitleText: Thrilled Member of the Security Department
f1585aba77b292f9.ContentText: I think brother Dan Heng is pretty smart.

bc04868ee426e2a2.TitleText: Excited Member of the Security Department
bc04868ee426e2a2.ContentText: Brother Arlan only has that one weakness in his armor, but he won't ignore it! He's too awesome for that!

a690c92196f8731e.ContentText: ...Arlan and I decided to switch our assignments. He went with March to investigate a suspicious crystal, and I've taken up his patrol.
a690c92196f8731e.Speaker: Dan Heng

a7b9fd33417938c0.ContentText: He said he read an anonymous handwritten journal in the space station — it contained <unbreak>36</unbreak> different strategies to do with managing pressure from one's boss.
a7b9fd33417938c0.Speaker: Dan Heng

00cbd729c58bacc1.ContentText: It also contained some information on trials.
00cbd729c58bacc1.Speaker: Dan Heng

df8c59001559580a.ContentText: Firstly, the trial of the heart. One needs to acknowledge the pressure in one's heart, and only then can one face it.
df8c59001559580a.Speaker: Dan Heng

64788af7d4ad1813.ContentText: Secondly, trial of the mirror. Like a mirror's reflection, one needs to personally experience the pressure others feel in a job in order to understand it.
64788af7d4ad1813.Speaker: Dan Heng

fa245d126075cb7c.ContentText: Lastly, trial of the self. One places oneself within that pressure to complete a transformation.
fa245d126075cb7c.Speaker: Dan Heng

65a277097f2f160d.ContentText: I believe he came to me to complete the trial of the mirror.
65a277097f2f160d.Speaker: Dan Heng

47c8f8dfd1dfeb76.ContentText: He gave me a pass for access across the space station while on patrol.
47c8f8dfd1dfeb76.Speaker: Dan Heng

81142cb1ab664c96.TitleText: Thrilled Member of the Security Department
81142cb1ab664c96.ContentText: I found a broken ceiling tile. This mark... it must be from where Brother Arlan smashed it down!

1675a49712e7c6c5.TitleText: Excited Member of the Security Department
1675a49712e7c6c5.ContentText: Move aside. What kind of clue is that? This floor tile I found is way better! Look at the footprint — it's the right size, not to mention the angle of motion... This is proof of brother Arlan in combat!

9d73dad6530d90df.ContentText: No. He didn't say, and I didn't ask.
9d73dad6530d90df.Speaker: Dan Heng

2ee38eaaa378247f.TitleText: Thrilled Member of the Security Department
2ee38eaaa378247f.ContentText: Brother Arlan doesn't need a reason to improve himself! You don't understand him at all!

bd2d6aa08ea72074.TitleText: Excited Member of the Security Department
bd2d6aa08ea72074.ContentText: Brother Arlan is a fierce fighter with an eye for detail. If you don't understand his reason for doing things, maybe that's because you're too zoomed in.

337090e439fddf9c.TitleText: Thrilled Member of the Security Department
337090e439fddf9c.ContentText: He's just staying ahead of the game is all! He's the space station's coldhearted hawk, the Security Department's alpha wolf!

4231beade4cf5e8f.ContentText: If you want to find Arlan, just contact March.
4231beade4cf5e8f.Speaker: Dan Heng

5a909ef2823bd296.ContentText: Job pressure... how to manage your boss...
5a909ef2823bd296.Speaker: Asta

eb43036237348590.ContentText: Arlan... I'm sorry. I never knew I was giving you so much pressure...
eb43036237348590.Speaker: Asta

6d005d59f3d4a311.ContentText: Mm... I need to feel the pressure he's feeling so I can understand what it's all about.
6d005d59f3d4a311.Speaker: Asta

3b718f52fdd05a6e.ContentText: Ah, there's a photo of Peppy on the pass...
3b718f52fdd05a6e.Speaker: Asta

c094f14abd53ae77.ContentText: I got Arlan to look after Peppy because I thought they got along... but was that was giving him too much extra pressure?
c094f14abd53ae77.Speaker: Asta

3a47a341534e5c4c.ContentText: Maybe he printed out Peppy's picture as a way of forcing himself to remember his responsibility...
3a47a341534e5c4c.Speaker: Asta

a92bbd3874ead01d.ContentText: Look how smashed up this ceiling tile is... Arlan must have bottled up his frustration and had no way of releasing it — so he took it out on the monsters!
a92bbd3874ead01d.Speaker: Asta

4bc09f3043a1e21a.ContentText: It's Arlan's shoe size alright —.and this actually came from a pair of shoes I bought for him.
4bc09f3043a1e21a.Speaker: Asta

f95951293b84ff63.ContentText: Maybe even these shoes are painful shackles for him...
f95951293b84ff63.Speaker: Asta

9f1e13210cf17428.ContentText: Yeah... We need to find Arlan quickly. I need to apologize to him in person!
9f1e13210cf17428.Speaker: Asta

3771a6390ec0307b.ContentText: (So Peppy can locate March just by looking at a photo of her...)
3771a6390ec0307b.Speaker: playerboy

1a88dd4ffa29ef60.ContentText: (...Is he really using scent to track?)
1a88dd4ffa29ef60.Speaker: playerboy

1efa2a15a5f22c90.ContentText: *gasp* What a cute doggy! ...Oh, you're here too.
1efa2a15a5f22c90.Speaker: March 7th

6f28b6066c8e016e.ContentText: He wanted to go investigating on his own, so I let him~
6f28b6066c8e016e.Speaker: March 7th

dce2e3ebe3a8771d.ContentText: Hey! He's a new face, and you're not.
dce2e3ebe3a8771d.Speaker: March 7th

6dfec9f4c20c034c.ContentText: Huh, this little guy looks familiar... Ah! Are you Arlan's Peppy? Awwww I'm sowwie, your master isn't here. He's gone off to investigate~
6dfec9f4c20c034c.Speaker: March 7th

2d1077dcaa42a663.ContentText: He kept harping on about Dan Heng being a "true warrior" or something...
2d1077dcaa42a663.Speaker: March 7th

7f77c5e3b25f891a.ContentText: Oh, he did say that completing an assignment with me would help him "complete the final trial."
7f77c5e3b25f891a.Speaker: March 7th

2be753caffc1fc69.ContentText: Hehe, it felt like he learned a lot from me. Then again, everyone has a lot to learn from me, hee-hee~
2be753caffc1fc69.Speaker: March 7th

d2d539d47baf1b28.ContentText: We were investigating suspicious crystals together, but he said it was all pointless if he couldn't "transform" himself...
d2d539d47baf1b28.Speaker: March 7th

38c3b5382f09f3d2.ContentText: I could tell he was giving himself a lot of pressure, so I gave him a suggestion~
38c3b5382f09f3d2.Speaker: March 7th

bab7272febd7c91b.ContentText: I told him actions speak louder than words when you wanna prove yourself... I was just thinking out loud really, I had no idea what kind of trial he was doing.
bab7272febd7c91b.Speaker: March 7th

39ecd949d98a9da4.ContentText: But when he heard that, he said "Mr. Dan Heng was right."
39ecd949d98a9da4.Speaker: March 7th

bbe113419659c735.ContentText: And then he just left. I took a photo of him — he was doing one of those tough guy walks!
bbe113419659c735.Speaker: March 7th

e6594559100d4646.ContentText: Come to think of it, maybe I shouldn't have left him alone. Take me with you if you're going after him!
e6594559100d4646.Speaker: March 7th

8829ec8e279c2035.ContentText: I read that a Stellaron's internal fluctuations will cause a Fragmentum to appear.
8829ec8e279c2035.Speaker: Asta

6b7ca750cf909a2f.ContentText: Hey, relax! I've seen plenty of Stellarons — it'll be fine.
6b7ca750cf909a2f.Speaker: March 7th

8700007c7d1a221b.ContentText: The extent of the corrosion here is a lot worse than I imagined. Mrs. Hinkel did say the clean-up had been slow in places...
8700007c7d1a221b.Speaker: Asta

00f2596b5b2b8768.ContentText: The Fragmentum has a big influence on the space around it. All this electronic equipment on the station must short-circuit pretty regularly, huh?
00f2596b5b2b8768.Speaker: March 7th

050c8e84c04c4cd2.ContentText: The report did mention abnormalities in the surveillance system and module errors... We'll have to start prioritizing those issues.
050c8e84c04c4cd2.Speaker: Asta

22e64cae6d9be4a9.ContentText: The Fragmentum corrosion is weaker here... I wonder what's controlling it?
22e64cae6d9be4a9.Speaker: Asta

569d7361dc598ba9.ContentText: No clue, but I know one thing...
569d7361dc598ba9.Speaker: March 7th

ad94e57a91dbf55a.ContentText: The less Fragmentum corrosion there is, the safer it gets!
ad94e57a91dbf55a.Speaker: March 7th

b6782074615333a2.ContentText: Lady Asta? Why are you crying? Are you hurt?
b6782074615333a2.Speaker: Arlan

d3e1dccf5182605d.ContentText: It's all my fault — I've been putting too much on your plate. That's why you looked up ways to manage the pressure...
d3e1dccf5182605d.Speaker: Asta

64fdc2d82fe5eb8c.ContentText: I—I honestly didn't realize that... these things would bring you s—so much... stress.
64fdc2d82fe5eb8c.Speaker: Asta

0c0efec31f3cae76.ContentText: I just want to say... I... I'm sorry! *sob*
0c0efec31f3cae76.Speaker: Asta

10e93e7c901417c5.ContentText: You didn't give me any pressure!
10e93e7c901417c5.Speaker: Arlan

12018f0bc2c16b3f.ContentText: Arlan, you don't need to hide this from me any longer. {NICKNAME} and I know all about the trials you're putting yourself through!
12018f0bc2c16b3f.Speaker: Asta

f72fd2d42c05ad58.ContentText: If you can't forgive me right now, then... I—I'll reflect further and... find a way to prove that I'm willing to change.
f72fd2d42c05ad58.Speaker: Asta

78ed2ccbe8a5cad9.ContentText: Firstly, your trial of the heart! You went to Professor Capote and asked him to simulate conversations with you so you could better understand your boss.
78ed2ccbe8a5cad9.Speaker: Asta

b5848caa6a1716e5.ContentText: No need to explain! This is Professor Capote's autograph alright, but you can't hide your handwriting. The way you join your letters is no different to your childhood diary entries.
b5848caa6a1716e5.Speaker: Asta

e44aa28b6b5a9295.ContentText: ...I—I did write this for professor Capote.
e44aa28b6b5a9295.Speaker: Arlan

6ad6cf04e455361e.ContentText: You're head of the Security Department — you don't have anything to do with Professor Capote. Why did you suddenly start writing his reply cards for him, huh?
6ad6cf04e455361e.Speaker: Asta

18a570fddc65c727.ContentText: Hmph, d—don't go spilling the beans just yet!
18a570fddc65c727.Speaker: Asta

97d8997edabbffe3.ContentText: {NICKNAME}, this evidence is a bit of a stretch... Do we have anything better?
97d8997edabbffe3.Speaker: Asta

57431d090f06cffd.ContentText: This was taken by a member of the Master Capote Fan Club less than <unbreak>24</unbreak> hours ago. In other words, you went to find Professor Capote today...
57431d090f06cffd.Speaker: Asta

e85f0311ed6a5b2c.ContentText: ...and stopped responding to messages in the same time window!
e85f0311ed6a5b2c.Speaker: Asta

19eed118e37057d7.ContentText: N—No need to launch your defense, we haven't got to the core yet!
19eed118e37057d7.Speaker: Asta

aad802ca1b6d6096.ContentText: {NICKNAME}, this evidence is a bit of a stretch... Do we have anything better?
aad802ca1b6d6096.Speaker: Asta

995b6332d1523870.ContentText: This transcript records what you asked Capote to help you with. Here we can see a bossy manager and you being asked to do things outside of your job description.
995b6332d1523870.Speaker: Asta

0a6140b63a9e91bb.ContentText: Clearly, Professor Capote is unlikely to master my speech or mannerisms any time soon... But the content is the key here!
0a6140b63a9e91bb.Speaker: Asta

8507cebe7aed9372.ContentText: I am the source of your pressure!
8507cebe7aed9372.Speaker: Asta

1543128e3d4b863f.ContentText: Lady Asta, you... Why are you all here?
1543128e3d4b863f.Speaker: Arlan

529484a65202ae38.ContentText: I've never seen anything like this before. It looks like some kind of new entity — it must have mutated after being corroded.
529484a65202ae38.Speaker: Arlan

3478367c31f4c1fb.ContentText: My lady, I did speak to Professor Capote, and I did ask him some things.
3478367c31f4c1fb.Speaker: Arlan

b284c4847526ebb2.ContentText: But they had nothing to do with you! I've never experienced any pressure with you...
b284c4847526ebb2.Speaker: Arlan

ec521f01d996361c.ContentText: Oh Arlan, won't you accept my apology?
ec521f01d996361c.Speaker: Asta

5b3638f8fb32aaad.ContentText: *sigh* I'll just have to show you more evidence.
5b3638f8fb32aaad.Speaker: Asta

29dc9af2055a8f2a.ContentText: We know the essence of your trial of the heart, and we also know that you asked Dan Heng to help you complete the trial of the mirror.
29dc9af2055a8f2a.Speaker: Asta

aec9cce9c4b00233.ContentText: I'm so sorry, Arlan. Until I spoke with Dan Heng, I never realized how much pressure was on your shoulders.
aec9cce9c4b00233.Speaker: Asta

f0e20b1386fb5d3e.ContentText: This... um... ceiling tile! You... you broke it!
f0e20b1386fb5d3e.Speaker: Asta

25f5e8b52d4929c8.ContentText: Sorry... I'll get it fixed later.
25f5e8b52d4929c8.Speaker: Arlan

468d2d0a08296fc7.ContentText: I know you can be tough, but you're not violent by nature, Arlan — quite the opposite! Breaking a ceiling tile like this shows how much pressure and anger you were carrying around!
468d2d0a08296fc7.Speaker: Asta

5b2d977389bf11a3.ContentText: Uh, eh-he... This interpretation is sounding a little odd... Do we have any other evidence?
5b2d977389bf11a3.Speaker: March 7th

e6d248b698bde785.ContentText: I bought these shoes for you — I remember the size and the design. This is undoubtedly your footprint.
e6d248b698bde785.Speaker: Asta

a2deacee2035d8ac.ContentText: But I can tell a lot from the details, such as... umm... y—you used a lot of force! You had a lot of pressure, so you stomped really hard!
a2deacee2035d8ac.Speaker: Asta

a7053bce079c7f43.ContentText: She can't even make things up anymore. You have more evidence, right?
a7053bce079c7f43.Speaker: March 7th

b7bda8dd136c887a.ContentText: This isn't just any old station pass, is it? There's a very important photo on it!
b7bda8dd136c887a.Speaker: Asta

e53db69d15ad920f.ContentText: Lady Asta, I like Peppy a lot, so I...
e53db69d15ad920f.Speaker: Arlan

53db0d0f041db5f0.ContentText: No, no, Arlan. You don't need to find excuses for your actions. *sigh* Maybe you've actually convinced yourself...
53db0d0f041db5f0.Speaker: Asta

d5986706c0bdd371.ContentText: The combination of your simulated conversations with Capote and the entry in your work log about playing holodisc with Peppy...
d5986706c0bdd371.Speaker: Asta

52b118fd599baa4e.ContentText: It points to one thing: Me getting you to look after Peppy is the greatest source of your stress!
52b118fd599baa4e.Speaker: Asta

d46e7af5163bd557.ContentText: Y—You even printed out a photo of Peppy to constantly remind yourself to look after him! *sniff*
d46e7af5163bd557.Speaker: Asta

ef591ca9e71d8e44.ContentText: I know exactly what message you're trying to drill into yourself by sticking this photo onto your pass: "Arlan, taking Peppy out to play is an assignment from Lead Researcher Asta — you better throw that holodisc like it's a full-on discus! If you spare any effort... Lady Asta will find out and punish you terribly for all eternity!." *sniff*
ef591ca9e71d8e44.Speaker: Asta

638054a5590d6726.ContentText: M—My lady, don't you think that's a long thought to think...?
638054a5590d6726.Speaker: Arlan

815b12cf065eb23d.ContentText: Lady Asta, please, I didn't do any of these trials because of you.
815b12cf065eb23d.Speaker: Arlan

15dcf8d7e7a5676c.ContentText: I always try to complete every assignment you give me, regardless of whether it's within my job description.
15dcf8d7e7a5676c.Speaker: Arlan

98bc3961ec10d870.ContentText: I... really like taking Peppy out to play.
98bc3961ec10d870.Speaker: Arlan

519009d7869be17a.ContentText: Asta, I don't think Arlan is upset with you.
519009d7869be17a.Speaker: March 7th

714d56a1a3ecb7d5.ContentText: But Arlan doesn't have any other bosses — who else would it be? March, he asked to accompany you so he could learn how to manage his stress, right?
714d56a1a3ecb7d5.Speaker: Asta

ab9527dfb501a67d.ContentText: Huh? Arlan wanted to go on assignments just to experience stress!?
ab9527dfb501a67d.Speaker: March 7th

3cb10de8936531ac.ContentText: Phew... Good thing I let him go alone — my calming influence would've ruined his training.
3cb10de8936531ac.Speaker: March 7th

6e40dbef896b2e57.ContentText: Hehe, guess I made the right decision after all.
6e40dbef896b2e57.Speaker: March 7th

ec8379f7cccb034e.ContentText: What did he say? That I'm good at solving people's problems?
ec8379f7cccb034e.Speaker: March 7th

e33e3ab754d55893.ContentText: Ugh, Arlan, all I want you to understand is how sincerely I'm reflecting on my actions. Please accept my apology!
e33e3ab754d55893.Speaker: Asta

e46826c8ff57568d.ContentText: Arlan, I understood the level of stress you're dealing with as soon as I saw this photo.
e46826c8ff57568d.Speaker: Asta

78ea0cd1e09e0bfc.ContentText: I'm always giving you tasks and assignments, but I never actually see how you take to the battlefield...
78ea0cd1e09e0bfc.Speaker: Asta

d3251ada0f3144a7.ContentText: ...when I saw this photo, when I saw you fighting alone just now...
d3251ada0f3144a7.Speaker: Asta

255678e11720b39e.ContentText: I'm just sorry that I gave you the stress of all my private affairs on top of an already stressful job.
255678e11720b39e.Speaker: Asta

194fa747fe2ef7d7.ContentText: My Lady, I... I'm very touched, but...
194fa747fe2ef7d7.Speaker: Arlan

e7bfd9410828fb2c.ContentText: I started this trial because of Madam Herta.
e7bfd9410828fb2c.Speaker: Arlan

56a3f33829c56ffd.ContentText: Whenever she's back on the space station, Madam Herta assigns me things outside the Security Department remit.
56a3f33829c56ffd.Speaker: Arlan

fc9ed52ffb5faafa.ContentText: Even if I dared to refuse, I wouldn't know how. She's just... too overbearing.
fc9ed52ffb5faafa.Speaker: Arlan

521407267c6048c3.ContentText: Whether it's helping her test some new specimen, or looking for ancient documents I've never even heard of...
521407267c6048c3.Speaker: Arlan

f7d8c91e4dccbd88.ContentText: ...Assignments like those were okay before the invasion, but now I need to focus on clearing out any last traces of the Legion.
f7d8c91e4dccbd88.Speaker: Arlan

5eb34b8ce099683b.ContentText: Aha! So, you're trying to learn how to reject Herta, and then put it into practice!
5eb34b8ce099683b.Speaker: March 7th

a5a8631745def449.ContentText: Yes. I found an anonymous handwritten journal while I was cleaning up — it mentioned <unbreak>36</unbreak> different strategies for relieving pressure. That's where I read about the trials.
a5a8631745def449.Speaker: Arlan

1806472cf7246727.ContentText: Yes. There were detailed notes, so... I wanted to give them a try.
1806472cf7246727.Speaker: Arlan

6a37a533ff13d61e.ContentText: I'm sorry, my lady... I didn't want to bother anyone, so I didn't mention it.
6a37a533ff13d61e.Speaker: Arlan

6eda0a74f260290b.ContentText: So... you don't feel pressured around me?
6eda0a74f260290b.Speaker: Asta

c472b33c2da70fc1.ContentText: I've never felt pressured around you, my lady.
c472b33c2da70fc1.Speaker: Arlan

d959d99520e869f2.ContentText: Alright, alright — it's all a misunderstanding. You two should reflect on your actions!
d959d99520e869f2.Speaker: March 7th

af8843cfa12d812d.ContentText: Yeah! See, the two of us would never have misunderstandings like this.
af8843cfa12d812d.Speaker: March 7th

7e2ea5c8ab5565aa.ContentText: Yup! I always say what I'm thinking.
7e2ea5c8ab5565aa.Speaker: March 7th

031bd7c06aaad8b3.ContentText: That's righ— Hey! This is supposed to be a happy moment!
031bd7c06aaad8b3.Speaker: March 7th

f19fc9f96377a3e0.ContentText: You keep saying that — what did Dan Heng even say...
f19fc9f96377a3e0.Speaker: March 7th

6b60d945a9949bc0.ContentText: ...Thank you for helping Lady Asta... and for coming to find me.
6b60d945a9949bc0.Speaker: Arlan

9f6f23f25b896d61.ContentText: You're welcome! Although if you really wanna thank me... let me play holodisc with Peppy — pleaaaase~?
9f6f23f25b896d61.Speaker: March 7th

7493ef29a9031b60.ContentText: Ah, speak of the devil! I was just wondering when you might show up, hehe.
7493ef29a9031b60.Speaker: Serval

22634922a114e4e1.ContentText: Don't worry, there's enough to go around! On the house — order whatever you like.
22634922a114e4e1.Speaker: Serval

0122caf8f0e0dd2a.ContentText: Ready? My stomach's always ready for food and drink!
0122caf8f0e0dd2a.Speaker: Serval

c3984f08c51c841c.ContentText: Oops, forgot to check my messages...
c3984f08c51c841c.Speaker: Serval

327c68ffe6b8f8ad.ContentText: Sorry, my bad... but it's not too late! You can order anything you want!
327c68ffe6b8f8ad.Speaker: Serval

113bead63684f116.ContentText: There's something I need your help with — I had to make it up to you somehow.
113bead63684f116.Speaker: Serval

bf0b4ccf2e96c8ff.ContentText: ...Looks like we're not the only ones who wanted afternoon tea today though. We'll have to stand up for the time being.
bf0b4ccf2e96c8ff.Speaker: Serval

2e894d0ffa8d1dfd.ContentText: Haha, don't drink too much, or you won't be able to sleep tonight.
2e894d0ffa8d1dfd.Speaker: Serval

bfa53318d8f0a92c.ContentText: Anyway... about the something I needed your help with.
bfa53318d8f0a92c.Speaker: Serval

29f960fe4d27f6c3.ContentText: Well, you're clearly better traveled than I am, and I know how generous you are... I feel embarrassed to ask now...
29f960fe4d27f6c3.Speaker: Serval

d4842f07cc2758fa.ContentText: Ha, don't get ahead of yourself, this might be more complicated than you think...
d4842f07cc2758fa.Speaker: Serval

f25eed317978a3f1.ContentText: Wait, don't go! Take it easy, I just wanted to ask you a question...
f25eed317978a3f1.Speaker: Serval

70a19339bcd88670.ContentText: *sigh* Was it that obvious? I'm out of practice...
70a19339bcd88670.Speaker: Serval

f135011fcef6a5d7.ContentText: Well, you're clearly better traveled than I am, and I know how generous you are... I feel embarrassed to ask now...
f135011fcef6a5d7.Speaker: Serval

6f779f2812567ace.ContentText: Ha, don't get ahead of yourself, this might be more complicated than you think...
6f779f2812567ace.Speaker: Serval

0c1fa2d49fd85ec4.ContentText: Uh, how can I put this...
0c1fa2d49fd85ec4.Speaker: Serval

ce7602db178bfb58.ContentText: If I remember correctly, you, March, and Dan Heng came here on that train — the "Astral Express" — right?
ce7602db178bfb58.Speaker: Serval

50335cd2d42c18d9.ContentText: I was wondering... is the train accepting new passengers?
50335cd2d42c18d9.Speaker: Serval

e3552eca0ac2fc76.ContentText: Well, i—it's just... the dust has settled now. The Stellaron problem has been resolved, and Cocolia...
e3552eca0ac2fc76.Speaker: Serval

390010c08bf0a1df.ContentText: ...Forget it, it's nothing! Forget I said anything.
390010c08bf0a1df.Speaker: Serval

dec502b85d5d6814.ContentText: Boarding Exam? Like a test? I can do that! That sounds like the admission system that schools in Belobog use!
dec502b85d5d6814.Speaker: Serval

8ccabcb1559d64e5.ContentText: I'm wondering though, are there any restrictions against, uh... "aliens" like me from boarding the train?
8ccabcb1559d64e5.Speaker: Serval

8ba0909fab1af98b.ContentText: You see, there's not much left for me here except to carry on repairing equipment in the workshop... I like practicing the guitar, and performances are fun, but the crowds are pretty small.
8ba0909fab1af98b.Speaker: Serval

4346331d7a5c49c0.ContentText: Besides, I'm a researcher... how could I not get excited about the chance to explore new worlds up close? Everyone gets tired of living in small places like Belobog after a few years, right?
4346331d7a5c49c0.Speaker: Serval

9c580d13fe6ebdc1.ContentText: Really? You're gonna say yes just like that?
9c580d13fe6ebdc1.Speaker: Serval

0f0bb0a44c59412f.ContentText: I understand. I'm counting on you!
0f0bb0a44c59412f.Speaker: Serval

89e84eac8cd5ed46.ContentText: Okay, okay, I—I'm counting on you!
89e84eac8cd5ed46.Speaker: Serval

fa2c7cb5592232a9.ContentText: I know this is a lot to ask out of the blue, so apologies in advance.
fa2c7cb5592232a9.Speaker: Serval

a48162bed7f42e68.ContentText: Haha, I knew I could count on you!
a48162bed7f42e68.Speaker: Serval

5e46308368a0701b.ContentText: Hehe, this is a pretty big ask⁓
5e46308368a0701b.Speaker: Serval

dc52be8babd29ad2.ContentText: ...Actions? Ohhhh, I get you! Another plate of delicious snacks, coming right up!
dc52be8babd29ad2.Speaker: Serval

3bd747f8306daeab.ContentText: (There goes Serval... I better send Himeko a text and ask about the request...)
3bd747f8306daeab.Speaker: playerboy

9d191d1b92d87f50.ContentText: (...or I guess I could ask Mr. Yang — or Pom-Pom?)
9d191d1b92d87f50.Speaker: playerboy

90e9a5f700783649.ContentText: (Hmm, who's the best one to ask...?)
90e9a5f700783649.Speaker: playerboy

db13545d6130731f.ContentText: (Let's send a message to Mr. Yang...)
db13545d6130731f.Speaker: playerboy

9f761a677ca8332f.ContentText: You should go and talk to Lady Bronya, Serval. It was her personal invite, after all...
9f761a677ca8332f.Speaker: Gepard

dd7be29d565344a4.ContentText: Ugh... I know, I know. Let me think about it...
dd7be29d565344a4.Speaker: Serval

1bd3b31ea6608a37.ContentText: Huh? {NICKNAME}, you're just in time! Any news yet?
1bd3b31ea6608a37.Speaker: Serval

40d3def0c8d160ae.ContentText: Oh! No, not at all! I could do with a hand, actually...
40d3def0c8d160ae.Speaker: Serval

4dd8bd9efdfee3e4.ContentText: Perfect timing, {NICKNAME} — please talk some sense into her.
4dd8bd9efdfee3e4.Speaker: Gepard

b021428113d84ef4.ContentText: Y'know what, you're right — we should work these things out on our own...
b021428113d84ef4.Speaker: Serval

09697c779818f545.ContentText: That's just it — there is no deal...
09697c779818f545.Speaker: Serval

8a96e678897124a9.ContentText: ...Serval, I understand your reluctance to rejoin the Silvermane Guards.
8a96e678897124a9.Speaker: Gepard

6cbd284edc218cd2.ContentText: But Lady Bronya values your talent, and she sees how much you could contribute to the rejuvenation of Belobog... so I came to talk to you about it.
6cbd284edc218cd2.Speaker: Gepard

eeb09a4698ef621b.ContentText: In any case, you should at least pay her a visit.
eeb09a4698ef621b.Speaker: Gepard

0dc35089455063bf.ContentText: Okay... I get it. I'll make a trip to Qlipoth Fort and tell Bronya what I really think.
0dc35089455063bf.Speaker: Serval

57c9af282e6bf054.ContentText: Sorry, {NICKNAME} — I need to get this over with. Let me know what they said when I get back.
57c9af282e6bf054.Speaker: Serval

efda865843716035.ContentText: Ah, sorry, my head's still in the argument. It's like this.
efda865843716035.Speaker: Gepard

d13e48b3f92052ae.ContentText: Is she creating trouble for you too?
d13e48b3f92052ae.Speaker: Gepard

52fbaaabb5c07db7.ContentText: Ah, sorry, my head's still in the argument. It's like this.
52fbaaabb5c07db7.Speaker: Gepard

408bac44442740f4.ContentText: I see... no wonder she seemed so flustered. So that's what's on her mind...
408bac44442740f4.Speaker: Gepard

ed683a2b91e6856b.ContentText: Ah, sorry, my head's still in the argument. It's like this.
ed683a2b91e6856b.Speaker: Gepard

3f62c83299a70322.ContentText: As you know, my sister used to be one of the research team leads in the Silvermane Guards Technology Division. Stellarons were her main area of research.
3f62c83299a70322.Speaker: Gepard

60a2865c49d9c439.ContentText: But her expertise went far beyond Stellarons. She was and still is well versed in mechanical engineering and other fields.
60a2865c49d9c439.Speaker: Gepard

db7f2c648a567db8.ContentText: Immediately after her succession, Lady Bronya set her sights on Serval's talents. The supreme guardian wants her to resume her technological research and be a shining light for the revitalization of Belobog.
db7f2c648a567db8.Speaker: Gepard

9e2dba4c759f55bf.ContentText: However... you saw her attitude just now. I doubt her meeting with Lady Bronya will change anything — it'll probably just leave them both feeling dejected.
9e2dba4c759f55bf.Speaker: Gepard

f05e58537d8d7ed6.ContentText: Mm... I think there's more than one element to it.
f05e58537d8d7ed6.Speaker: Gepard

0e37d67d2adcaa6d.ContentText: My intuition tells me this is mostly linked to Madam Cocolia's passing.
0e37d67d2adcaa6d.Speaker: Gepard

25993d10108f3ce0.ContentText: *sigh* Never mind, it's just a personal hunch. I've never been good at reading my sister's mind.
25993d10108f3ce0.Speaker: Gepard

d368970908a10661.ContentText: I can tell the two of you have a close bond. If you get the chance, see if you can persuade her to open up about it.
d368970908a10661.Speaker: Gepard

792d8900da0dccbe.ContentText: ...Hand on heart, I wouldn't want to see her sitting behind a desk in Qlipoth Fort and sighing all day either...
792d8900da0dccbe.Speaker: Gepard

ced8aaf75b3bdf47.ContentText: Belobog is too small a place for a mind as inquisitive as Serval's... Maybe it would be better for her to join you on your journey.
ced8aaf75b3bdf47.Speaker: Gepard

749d9cef2ca8a59c.ContentText: *sigh* ...I'll admit, I'm a little worried about how she plans on getting all this across to Lady Bronya.
749d9cef2ca8a59c.Speaker: Gepard

3699cfd6d4b81e31.ContentText: {NICKNAME}, are you busy? Let's go and wait for her in front of Qlipoth Fort.
3699cfd6d4b81e31.Speaker: Gepard

b22818df586cfeaa.ContentText: Doesn't seem like they've finished talking yet. I hope it's not turning into a shouting match... Let's go in.
b22818df586cfeaa.Speaker: Gepard

e433332bfc59b39c.ContentText: I assume you heard our conversation just now?
e433332bfc59b39c.Speaker: Serval

a6aae113e7737fb3.ContentText: I didn't expect her to be so open-minded... and she didn't even try to persuade me to stay. She didn't summon me just to return the guitar, did she?
a6aae113e7737fb3.Speaker: Serval

37154ad717c271b3.ContentText: I wouldn't rule it out — she's good at reading people's minds... she would've known that you'd never set foot in Qlipoth Fort voluntarily.
37154ad717c271b3.Speaker: Gepard

21bdaf1c281e0caa.ContentText: ...After all these years, I never thought I'd set eyes on this guitar again. *sigh* Guess we're stuck with each other...
21bdaf1c281e0caa.Speaker: Serval

a21afd023a0e66f9.ContentText: ...Well, it'll take a while to tell.
a21afd023a0e66f9.Speaker: Serval

b0c80ccdadbd3b78.ContentText: If she did, I never knew about it.
b0c80ccdadbd3b78.Speaker: Gepard

205da30a7d6e4978.ContentText: The story behind this guitar... huh, it'll take a while to tell.
205da30a7d6e4978.Speaker: Serval

e040173c102dd8ac.ContentText: When we were in cadet school, Cocolia and I were notoriously disruptive — we were always coming up with the next crazy invention... We called it "exploring the infinite possibilities of new technologies."
e040173c102dd8ac.Speaker: Serval

4f24313331ca4d7d.ContentText: This guitar was one of those inventions. Cocolia came up with a name...
4f24313331ca4d7d.Speaker: Serval

f51f132b0364887a.ContentText: ...the "super electromagnetic flux player," or "electric guitar" for short.
f51f132b0364887a.Speaker: Serval

4a94452184652643.ContentText: Not really, no. She was a military history major — very different from what I was doing.
4a94452184652643.Speaker: Serval

913c775cf415b5f0.ContentText: Still, we hung out every day, it's only natural that my love for inventing would rub off on her.
913c775cf415b5f0.Speaker: Serval

12f9d154b0b5d371.ContentText: Don't believe me? Let me tell you, Cocolia and I shared a similar way of thinking back in the day.
12f9d154b0b5d371.Speaker: Serval

9012834b4993aa4e.ContentText: It's a bit of a mouthful, but I liked it at the time... it was a rock 'n' roll name.
9012834b4993aa4e.Speaker: Serval

11cfe5430633d557.ContentText: ...*sigh*, I told you it'd take a while to tell the story — let's get back to the workshop first. By the way... wanna help me pack my bags?
11cfe5430633d557.Speaker: Serval

209fa50544cd5893.ContentText: I didn't think many people liked that one... Seems the city might have a few nice memories of me after I'm gone.
209fa50544cd5893.Speaker: Serval

9bb3730d8579988a.ContentText: Well, it's getting late, let's head back.
9bb3730d8579988a.Speaker: Serval

21c99116ef4f568d.ContentText: Ah... There's no place like home. I never feel completely free out there.
21c99116ef4f568d.Speaker: Serval

b64b771fd0960bfc.ContentText: Gepard, can you lend your dear sister a hand? Help me pack my bags~
b64b771fd0960bfc.Speaker: Serval

207ced0e79e29c4e.ContentText: Am I allowed to refuse? This place... Just looking around gives me a headache.
207ced0e79e29c4e.Speaker: Gepard

10868527ff2944a7.ContentText: Okay, okay, I promise this is the last time.
10868527ff2944a7.Speaker: Serval

2353a119f6189386.ContentText: I'm about to go traveling with {NICKNAME} — who knows how long it'll be before I can visit home again. You should help me pack while you still have the chance.
2353a119f6189386.Speaker: Serval

1509889ffdb698e5.ContentText: {NICKNAME}, you just need to make yourself at home. You've done plenty of work already!
1509889ffdb698e5.Speaker: Serval

63e11740b1997940.ContentText: Oh, that~ It's a botanical specimen — little Lynxy sent it during one of her research trips.
63e11740b1997940.Speaker: Serval

ac3b74c2e258290b.ContentText: As for the name... I can't quite recall...
ac3b74c2e258290b.Speaker: Serval

85897cee33b37a7a.ContentText: And "little Lynxy" is the youngest sister of the Landau family, by the way...
85897cee33b37a7a.Speaker: Gepard

52f382cc5e17fd42.ContentText: Ah! Yes, yes, — snowman's palm! Ugh, my memory is the worst.
52f382cc5e17fd42.Speaker: Serval

df8e9af662193f7d.ContentText: It's the only plant here that looks like it's still alive...
df8e9af662193f7d.Speaker: Gepard

591635b097b5d02f.ContentText: ...Anyway, this specimen means a lot to me, so I'm bringing it with me. Thanks for the reminder, {NICKNAME}.
591635b097b5d02f.Speaker: Serval

c51c46e20f315de8.ContentText: Oh, that's a letter I was gonna send to my mom. I haven't even finished writing it.
c51c46e20f315de8.Speaker: Serval

1ac760d8905f6229.ContentText: There's nothing personal in it — have a read if you like.
1ac760d8905f6229.Speaker: Serval

70aa80ff407ccaac.ContentText: You're still writing to Mom and Dad...?
70aa80ff407ccaac.Speaker: Gepard

fceda2aee30fca52.ContentText: Only to Mom. You know I still don't get along with Dad.
fceda2aee30fca52.Speaker: Serval

400c3ec46e86a94f.ContentText: Y'know Serval, if you're really leaving Belobog for a while... you should pay them a visit first.
400c3ec46e86a94f.Speaker: Gepard

fe16c6c08d907424.ContentText: Since you're so curious, I'll give you the whole story.
fe16c6c08d907424.Speaker: Serval

800b00b84a5f9db5.ContentText: This guitar... was actually given to me as a birthday present by Cocolia a long time ago.
800b00b84a5f9db5.Speaker: Serval

616ec314000e902e.ContentText: I came up with the design, but I was never able to build it — some of the raw materials were either too expensive or too hard to get a hold of. She helped me turn the concept into reality.
616ec314000e902e.Speaker: Serval

e32c250bbcaebb37.ContentText: Quick as lightning, always keeping her word — that was her way of doing things. Back then... I thought we'd be friends for life.
e32c250bbcaebb37.Speaker: Serval

be4edcccb1e67e66.ContentText: If it was a gift... why was it in Madam Cocolia's office?
be4edcccb1e67e66.Speaker: Gepard

2a04609acf5624c5.ContentText: I don't think anyone realized, but back then we were so close we didn't even differentiate between each other's possessions. We shared pretty much everything.
2a04609acf5624c5.Speaker: Serval

d0bc26a44b157e74.ContentText: We lived in the same dormitory, went to the same school together every day, ate together, whiled away the time together... and occasionally talked about music together — though it wasn't something she was overly familiar with.
d0bc26a44b157e74.Speaker: Serval

7d98b48b98d4c2eb.ContentText: That's how things were until the day we fell out. A lot of our shared possessions never left her office again...
7d98b48b98d4c2eb.Speaker: Serval

cf934292a09540a2.ContentText: I was always looking forward to the day she'd return this guitar... I thought that would be the day we could bury the hatchet.
cf934292a09540a2.Speaker: Serval

f0d300bc50c801b9.ContentText: Now that I think about it... perhaps I was too naive. She'd probably forgotten it even existed.
f0d300bc50c801b9.Speaker: Serval

9e6850dd31cae7ed.ContentText: *sigh* I know... but that's what makes it harder.
9e6850dd31cae7ed.Speaker: Serval

32ea36e613119c5c.ContentText: How did the conversation get so heavy again!? No good — let's talk about something interesting.
32ea36e613119c5c.Speaker: Serval

be8db25714092d69.ContentText: You know something, Gepard? That guitar case in your hand, and my guitar... They're both from the same prototype — the "super electromagnetic flux player."
be8db25714092d69.Speaker: Serval

b10a0ec8751c4a93.ContentText: I never knew your guitar had a connection to me too.... Quite the story.
b10a0ec8751c4a93.Speaker: Gepard

657b98608ff64c28.ContentText: Well... let's see. Ah, yes — a Silvermane Guard standard issue portable heater. I—It's broken, though.
657b98608ff64c28.Speaker: Serval

46b5e0e300e4fdfc.ContentText: It's a family heirloom — it belonged to Rhonda once... You should take care of it.
46b5e0e300e4fdfc.Speaker: Gepard

d006e646045d12ef.ContentText: *sigh* I wanted to keep it with me... but that's the problem with old things — the less you use them, the easier they break. Besides, no one's paying me to fix it, right?
d006e646045d12ef.Speaker: Serval

941ca3dda788398e.ContentText: Hey, wait a minute! {NICKNAME}, didn't I teach you a few machine-overhaul skills? Wanna practice on this old antique?
941ca3dda788398e.Speaker: Serval

be1905d097535586.ContentText: {NICKNAME}, you don't have to do everything she tells you...
be1905d097535586.Speaker: Gepard

a0f0eeeb2f7836a7.ContentText: *sigh* ...Like I said, let bygones be bygones.
a0f0eeeb2f7836a7.Speaker: Gepard

23d05236ce07b5f5.ContentText: ...The principle behind this machine and the one you fixed when you first came to the workshop is the same. You'll understand when you see it.
23d05236ce07b5f5.Speaker: Serval

b6d586213cd7d920.ContentText: So, I'll leave this one to you, {NICKNAME}. In return... how about I tell you the backstory behind it?
b6d586213cd7d920.Speaker: Serval

7d4d81ddd6950e3b.ContentText: I knew you were a reliable apprentice, {NICKNAME}!
7d4d81ddd6950e3b.Speaker: Serval

9d4cf42d63d4b892.ContentText: Hehe, come on, it isn't that difficult.
9d4cf42d63d4b892.Speaker: Serval

335de29976d97b11.ContentText: What!? No! No, no, no — can't you see I'm just short of hands here?
335de29976d97b11.Speaker: Serval

b1a088a1ba395d90.ContentText: Think about it — you helped me fix my machine the first time you came here, and now you're helping me the last time too... That's called having a beginning and an end, right?
b1a088a1ba395d90.Speaker: Serval

d1d0647bcedb375c.ContentText: ...Well done for putting up with her for this long, {NICKNAME}.
d1d0647bcedb375c.Speaker: Gepard

4753dd4734c87432.ContentText: Wow, great job, {NICKNAME}! Like I said — a reliable apprentice!
4753dd4734c87432.Speaker: Serval

c0fff683c593fad3.ContentText: As promised, let me tell you the story behind this little heater.
c0fff683c593fad3.Speaker: Serval

56abc89e515cad3c.ContentText: Its original owner was an ancestor of the Landau family — Rhonda Landau. She was one of our great heroes who participated in the Defense of Belobog <unbreak>700</unbreak> years ago.
56abc89e515cad3c.Speaker: Serval

c58fe29572f921cd.ContentText: The records tell that during the decisive battle, she led two Silvermane Guard brigades. She engaged the enemy for four full days and nights in the fight for the city... I still have the newspaper clippings from that time — I'll show you when I get the chance.
c58fe29572f921cd.Speaker: Serval

031734ad87dda2de.ContentText: Of course, after all, she was a Landau!
031734ad87dda2de.Speaker: Serval

4d5d5afa65fadf41.ContentText: <unbreak>700</unbreak>-year-old newspaper clippings? That... seems a little unlikely.
4d5d5afa65fadf41.Speaker: Gepard

e35dec8f8e66ef42.ContentText: I'd take that with a grain of salt. Even if they do exist, odds are she lost them.
e35dec8f8e66ef42.Speaker: Gepard

559df43d27acabc7.ContentText: Ugh, the clippings aren't the point — what I'm trying to say to {NICKNAME} is that we have a lot of talent in the Landau family!
559df43d27acabc7.Speaker: Serval

3ca5de8612a71b0b.ContentText: Mm — "take responsibility for your choices and the people of Belobog..." Every Landau is driven by that ethos.
3ca5de8612a71b0b.Speaker: Gepard

60b942b5b955b781.ContentText: Phew... finally. I think I must have left cadet school with about the same amount...
60b942b5b955b781.Speaker: Serval

ab31ca9bc0ae5429.ContentText: No easy job. Serval, I want to ask you again...
ab31ca9bc0ae5429.Speaker: Gepard

5586b0a53f804fe8.ContentText: Do you... really want to leave Belobog and go with the Trailblazers?
5586b0a53f804fe8.Speaker: Gepard

f353d44adede9e82.ContentText: ...Of course! This is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity — I can't miss it.
f353d44adede9e82.Speaker: Serval

4c9bc641631ecb4b.ContentText: What's wrong, Gepard? Ahh, I see... Can't let go of your dear ol' sister, eh?
4c9bc641631ecb4b.Speaker: Serval

c010fe8ab3e562af.ContentText: I... Forget it. I don't want to complicate things for you.
c010fe8ab3e562af.Speaker: Gepard

3aed9c92f4620ec6.ContentText: But before you leave, I have one last request to make. The Garrison is heading down to the Underworld soon to survey the situation around Boulder Town. Why don't you come with me?
3aed9c92f4620ec6.Speaker: Gepard

f159aa18f4e0993b.ContentText: ...Huh? You just said you didn't wanna complicate things for me, and now you're sending me on a mission...
f159aa18f4e0993b.Speaker: Serval

6c003821352f9af2.ContentText: Ahaa~ You just wanna spend as much time as possible with me before I go, right?
6c003821352f9af2.Speaker: Serval

8e813083bddf6624.ContentText: N—No, it's not that... I've heard there are a lot of old energy hubs in the Underworld, and you're probably the only person in Belobog who knows how to inspect them.
8e813083bddf6624.Speaker: Gepard

0f4b7e69d02c919b.ContentText: Since you're leaving one way or the other, why don't you do the people of the city one last favor before you go?
0f4b7e69d02c919b.Speaker: Gepard

9dc616282b6341d5.ContentText: Even at a time like this, you're still thinking about the people... *sigh* I don't know what to say.
9dc616282b6341d5.Speaker: Serval

1bd1dc306e941844.ContentText: Alright, I'll help you out — the first and last time the Landau siblings will work together!
1bd1dc306e941844.Speaker: Serval

3a3e666e59f610da.ContentText: Thanks, sis. {NICKNAME}, if you have the time, could you accompany the Garrison?
3a3e666e59f610da.Speaker: Gepard

2002fade238055d1.ContentText: You're Belobog's hero — I'm sure you must be popular in the Underworld. The Silvermane Guards will face less resistance if you come with us.
2002fade238055d1.Speaker: Gepard

9e45a0e666e03850.ContentText: Thanks. I'll contact you when the Guards have finished their preparations.
9e45a0e666e03850.Speaker: Gepard

9eb92a39d5b6414f.ContentText: *sigh* ...I'm tired of packing. Let's leave it here for today. Thanks for your help.
9eb92a39d5b6414f.Speaker: Serval

1cfbc84219161666.ContentText: *yawn* I drank all that tea. Why am I getting sleepy?
1cfbc84219161666.Speaker: Serval

e36e864ee9a97290.ContentText: I'm heading back to the military zone later. {NICKNAME}, do you want to go with me?
e36e864ee9a97290.Speaker: Gepard

ba6eca5dffa516c5.ContentText: Huh? Hmm. If you want my opinion...
ba6eca5dffa516c5.Speaker: Gepard

5ffdac55d0e432a2.ContentText: All I can say is that it's in character for her to say something and then do it without thinking. She's always been impulsive, and she doesn't mind creating a headache or two along the way...
5ffdac55d0e432a2.Speaker: Gepard

0e031e4ec923b4eb.ContentText: ...If she can remedy that habit during her trip with you, then I guess it will have been worth it.
0e031e4ec923b4eb.Speaker: Gepard

fc1a1087c193ad38.ContentText: Turns out I'm no good at hiding it...
fc1a1087c193ad38.Speaker: Gepard

813d6a7f8116f3b9.ContentText: *sigh* She's my sister — we grew up together. I'd be lying if I said I'm not going to miss her.
813d6a7f8116f3b9.Speaker: Gepard

10f93c76b4caae56.ContentText: I'm not afraid of being alone. After all, there's that, uh... communication device you gave me. If I really miss her, I can send her a message whenever I want.
10f93c76b4caae56.Speaker: Gepard

bec89e6facdc853f.ContentText: It's more that I'm worried she won't look after herself properly... Then again, with capable people like you as travel companions, I'm probably overthinking things.
bec89e6facdc853f.Speaker: Gepard

1b70ca091728e738.ContentText: You're... a very reliable person, {NICKNAME}. Even I feel lucky to have you as her travel companion.
1b70ca091728e738.Speaker: Gepard

2ed2baa06219d9ed.ContentText: Still, don't underestimate her ability to drive people crazy... If at some point your crew can't take it anymore, just send her back.
2ed2baa06219d9ed.Speaker: Gepard

ddfdc25da185c0fb.ContentText: Pela and I are probably the only ones in the world who know how to handle her... oh, and that assistant of hers too — Molly.
ddfdc25da185c0fb.Speaker: Gepard

5c0a5065e4b7eab2.ContentText: It's getting late, let's get ready to move. Is there something else you wanted to talk about?
5c0a5065e4b7eab2.Speaker: Gepard

8dd02e6cdaeb9195.ContentText: Agreed — as soon as you're packed.
8dd02e6cdaeb9195.Speaker: Gepard

8d3ff64ae5625bc9.ContentText: Yes, I've been preparing myself mentally for a long time. If I back out now, it'll be a huge loss.
8d3ff64ae5625bc9.Speaker: Serval

df705c51ed502508.ContentText: Well... would you believe me if I said yes?
df705c51ed502508.Speaker: Serval

39ab9a5a1be3b043.ContentText: Haha, he's my little brother, of course I don't want to leave him alone. But... I don't have any other choice.
39ab9a5a1be3b043.Speaker: Serval

e43668639ae3127a.ContentText: Also, i—it's not like I'm never coming back. And if I really miss him... I can just pester the heck outta him over the phone, right?
e43668639ae3127a.Speaker: Serval

74827822cebf48b4.ContentText: There's always a way for me to contact him if I need to, so don't worry!
74827822cebf48b4.Speaker: Serval

cdcab21952ffef05.ContentText: Hm... you can see right through me.
cdcab21952ffef05.Speaker: Serval

73589411243d58e2.ContentText: I'm sorry, I'm not ready to talk to anyone about the reasons behind my decision... I hope you can understand.
73589411243d58e2.Speaker: Serval

1df8060a1999b12b.ContentText: Haha, thank you. Make sure you look after me now~
1df8060a1999b12b.Speaker: Serval

6bafa6c49144bb38.ContentText: And that's the only Cocolia you guys ever got to know, huh... Always ahead of everyone else, never looking back, even for a second...
6bafa6c49144bb38.Speaker: Serval

2e5e34ac7c8d933f.ContentText: ...She put it all out of her mind. Me, and every memory to do with me...
2e5e34ac7c8d933f.Speaker: Serval

86cc8f88ac41b11d.ContentText: (Looks like Gepard's got his work cut out for him...)
86cc8f88ac41b11d.Speaker: playerboy

2814b60828342000.ContentText: {NICKNAME}, you're here. Thanks again for agreeing to this.
2814b60828342000.Speaker: Gepard

8ec3427e853e910f.ContentText: Don't be, I only just arrived myself.
8ec3427e853e910f.Speaker: Gepard

0d05e086c89e6626.ContentText: You're not wrong, it's only been a few minutes.
0d05e086c89e6626.Speaker: Gepard

7d4a0e8f94eaab89.ContentText: They're behind us. If negotiations go well, then Dunn will lead them down into the Underworld.
7d4a0e8f94eaab89.Speaker: Gepard

cf7b74969cda28c8.ContentText: He's a very capable sergeant — upright, plainspoken — a model Silvermane Guard.
cf7b74969cda28c8.Speaker: Gepard

29b6b29ecb6db303.ContentText: ...I assume you remember him? You and Serval ambushed — uh... subdued him in the Silvermane Guard Restricted Zone. I think he was out cold for most of the action.
29b6b29ecb6db303.Speaker: Gepard

d0db80a84789ec3a.ContentText: The conflict was a product of the situation, I understand.
d0db80a84789ec3a.Speaker: Gepard

37f7c0ba6b936dbe.ContentText: Not to mention... he wasn't in bad shape when we found him. Thank you for holding back.
37f7c0ba6b936dbe.Speaker: Gepard

8da2e2b0ecc18047.ContentText: The conflict was a product of the situation, I understand.
8da2e2b0ecc18047.Speaker: Gepard

e46374c9a214dde0.ContentText: Not to mention... he wasn't in bad shape when we found him. Thank you for holding back.
e46374c9a214dde0.Speaker: Gepard

9232cec29a26a761.ContentText: He wasn't in bad shape when we found him. Thank you for holding back.
9232cec29a26a761.Speaker: Gepard

70f25098e9f29faa.ContentText: Don't worry, the hard work is already behind us.
70f25098e9f29faa.Speaker: Gepard

f5df8290a94812b3.ContentText: The highest priority for today is establishing good negotiations with the chief of Wildfire — I'm about to get that process underway. Serval was a little delayed on the way over, but that doesn't affect our schedule. Let's set off.
f5df8290a94812b3.Speaker: Gepard

0f74f84314ecd378.ContentText: Hold up, I wasn't that late...
0f74f84314ecd378.Speaker: Serval

9132523ad18cf0f9.ContentText: Huh? Hold up, I wasn't that late...
9132523ad18cf0f9.Speaker: Serval

3367d4a8be2e469c.ContentText: You weren't that early, either... Still, I don't blame you — you hadn't seen Mom and Dad in a long time... I'm glad you managed to speak to them.
3367d4a8be2e469c.Speaker: Gepard

20ee24320540aa96.ContentText: We didn't speak all that much... You know how it is, I can only talk to Dad for so long before I start losing it.
20ee24320540aa96.Speaker: Serval

a24bee9fdfcabb2d.ContentText: I know how it is alright. Put that to one side for now... We need to get going.
a24bee9fdfcabb2d.Speaker: Gepard

c0a52876a3ab5bbe.ContentText: Negotiations will be held in the Boulder Town clinic. Serval and I are newcomers, so you'll have to lead the way, {NICKNAME}.
c0a52876a3ab5bbe.Speaker: Gepard

2edad26f27a88b7f.ContentText: The Underworld... isn't exactly how I remember it.
2edad26f27a88b7f.Speaker: Gepard

cebd862afd52827f.ContentText: ...Feels like we're not getting many friendly looks, huh.
cebd862afd52827f.Speaker: Serval

cf6bc1d06acd5be1.ContentText: Well, well, well! I don't think our little clinic has ever played host to an occasion like this!

48b5078ec05cda66.ContentText: Hahaha, Oleg will do, son. Oh, {NICKNAME}, you probably won't know... Our young Silvermane friend here and I had the pleasure of speaking to each other at a certain guardian's succession ceremony — we're not complete strangers. But as for this young lady...

d34a886493d83d9c.ContentText: The name's Serval. I'm, uh... an ex-engineer from the Technology Division and... Gepard's sister. Pleasure to meet you, chief!
d34a886493d83d9c.Speaker: Serval

cadbd5bebd6834c7.ContentText: Likewise, miss! The more the merrier!

acd55f105fa6ebf8.ContentText: And it's good to have you here again, {NICKNAME} — it bothered me and Natasha that we never arranged a formal welcome for you. Once we're done talking, you must all join us for a meal.

2f74b8b8d2026bac.ContentText: We'd be honored. But to your point, Oleg — let's finish our discussions first.
2f74b8b8d2026bac.Speaker: Gepard

df84e1adb0716fad.ContentText: Quite right. Let's head inside — too much commotion out here.

99be770c0d57c460.ContentText: ...So she's your sister. The Landau family is full of talented young people I see.
99be770c0d57c460.Speaker: Natasha

ae2b43a6ba99542a.ContentText: You're worried that Underworlders might still hold a grudge against the Silvermane Guards, so you want to show your solidarity with the Trailblazers to build some trust. Seems like a sound strategy to me.

99c8e69e4639b943.ContentText: Rebuilding trust between the two worlds has always been a priority for Lady Bronya.
99c8e69e4639b943.Speaker: Gepard

4453b4a7c5391b7a.ContentText: People here must have felt abandoned by the Guards after the passage was sealed off. If we were to simply "take over" the Underworld in the name of the supreme guardian... I can only imagine how people would react.
4453b4a7c5391b7a.Speaker: Gepard

3318759e79eec733.ContentText: Seems like you have a good handle on the situation. I see now why you made captain at such a young age, haha!

42fde4f3580466c7.ContentText: So... you're also saying the Guards want to work with Wildfire and use our reputation to win back people's support, correct?
42fde4f3580466c7.Speaker: Natasha

622e72d1728a6671.ContentText: ...I wouldn't use those exact words, but that is more or less what we want to achieve.
622e72d1728a6671.Speaker: Gepard

ed52c2fcd6d6543e.ContentText: If that's the case, I've got a question for you:
ed52c2fcd6d6543e.Speaker: Natasha

57a6f0e24b0da1ad.ContentText: Since this offer comes from those who left us to our fate for more than a decade... how would you react if Wildfire refused? Hmm? Would you use force?
57a6f0e24b0da1ad.Speaker: Natasha

422ea25bb574b22d.ContentText: Uh... she's not trying to be diplomatic about it, is she?
422ea25bb574b22d.Speaker: Serval

53e793ff97821934.ContentText: Hmm... Choose your words wisely, Geppie...
53e793ff97821934.Speaker: Serval

610486bfc8086857.ContentText: The barrier between the surface and the underground was the product of the former supreme guardian's misjudgment and the policies that resulted from it. The people of Belobog should have stood together, but instead we were made to blame and hate one another...
610486bfc8086857.Speaker: Gepard

df4724c80b683d4e.ContentText: Lady Bronya wants Belobog to heal, so the Silvermane Guards need to regain the people's trust. But we won't achieve that by kicking doors open and policing everyone around.
df4724c80b683d4e.Speaker: Gepard

fde3626c55b94ad5.ContentText: As a grassroots organization, Wildfire did an extraordinary job maintaining order for over a decade in the absence of the Guards. I can only imagine how much work you put in to protect the Underworld.
fde3626c55b94ad5.Speaker: Gepard

7bef287498ea2144.ContentText: I can assure you that the Guards are not here to seize power. If it takes time for the people to trust us, so be it. We're willing to take small measures and serve as an auxiliary force to Wildfire to help maintain peace.
7bef287498ea2144.Speaker: Gepard

d20ad3f27c3e97d1.ContentText: I hope you can see that everything we do, we do to rebuild trust and make Belobog work for all.
d20ad3f27c3e97d1.Speaker: Gepard

52bdafeded002962.ContentText: I swear he never used to be this emotionally intelligent...
52bdafeded002962.Speaker: Serval

70976e179a4fc179.ContentText: I've never really seen this side of him before... the more you learn.
70976e179a4fc179.Speaker: Serval

e8c2d6eb29712d1c.ContentText: ...That's an answer I can accept. Oleg, what do you think?
e8c2d6eb29712d1c.Speaker: Natasha

accb37950fe990f8.ContentText: Haha, I think there's no need for the guessing game to continue. It's obvious we share the same goal.

2e88918ccc89ae79.ContentText: With the help of Bronya, Serval, and Gepard, we're one step closer to rebuilding a united Belobog.

ab3a84d3148af933.ContentText: I agree. Tell Bronya that Wildfire will work with the Silvermane Guards on security matters. However, things aren't simple down here — please also tell her to draw up plans in case the situation demands—
ab3a84d3148af933.Speaker: Natasha

9e3d79cd98af1cd7.ContentText: Not good... Stay here, Natasha — the patients need you. The soldiers and I will handle this.

32799769d14d1f52.ContentText: (Everyone rushed outside... I should probably see what's happening.)
32799769d14d1f52.Speaker: playerboy

0de83f71f92fda07.ContentText: I—I'm sorry! I didn't mean to scare you all...

b4d61d7b751cec7e.ContentText: Th—The monsters invaded the mine! Please, you have to save my friends!

0f112b83a3b02521.ContentText: Otherwise, those things will t—tear them apart!

259e67e345bbef37.ContentText: Don't worry, the Silvermane Guards are trained for these situations. Where do we find them?
259e67e345bbef37.Speaker: Gepard

64a8d18aae8337a0.ContentText: The Great Mine! The one with the b—big ore vein...!

a3e105eb891bc42e.ContentText: Understood. I'll send my men to set up a perimeter and start the rescue operation right away.
a3e105eb891bc42e.Speaker: Gepard

0e3533d0fd5311dd.ContentText: Mr. Oleg, please entrust the Silvermane Guards with the rescue.
0e3533d0fd5311dd.Speaker: Gepard

9f5119d9dbb69d0c.ContentText: The defense of Boulder Town will need Wildfire's expertise. Watch out for ambushes and be ready to receive wounded soldiers.
9f5119d9dbb69d0c.Speaker: Gepard

1c8017d5dc0ef1ce.ContentText: Ha, you're a natural-born commander. Understood, leave it to me, son.

9f6765df43311af1.ContentText: Your troops will be unfamiliar with the layout of the mine — I'll send some of my men to be your guides.

61c9c7c1c6d21c23.ContentText: ...Thank you. In the name of the Preservation, I promise we'll do everything we can to save lives.
61c9c7c1c6d21c23.Speaker: Gepard

0a17dbcd892bf0a2.ContentText: I'll go on ahead and lead the troops to the mine. {NICKNAME}, Serval, catch up to us when you can.
0a17dbcd892bf0a2.Speaker: Gepard

eeda141fddafa3f8.ContentText: ...I couldn't get a word in while they were talking.
eeda141fddafa3f8.Speaker: Serval

ae22a207c61552ff.ContentText: A duty-bound soldier and a resistance leader... It's hard to be rock 'n' roll in front of people like that.
ae22a207c61552ff.Speaker: Serval

0053400ece037b16.ContentText: Y'know... maybe I need to put my "inner struggles" in a broader context, hehe...
0053400ece037b16.Speaker: Serval

2193be387e3782ad.ContentText: ...You're right. I've probably been idle for too long — it's easy to get stuck in your own head.
2193be387e3782ad.Speaker: Serval

b2afa4415c9b0e1c.ContentText: My "own" way... Ha, I don't even remember what kind of life I want.
b2afa4415c9b0e1c.Speaker: Serval

2daea02b107fb786.ContentText: ...I know. Anyway, don't worry, I'm doing fine.
2daea02b107fb786.Speaker: Serval

af6c0222cd1fe36f.ContentText: It's just... I see people fighting for their lives and here I am thinking about how to escape... I feel guilty about that.
af6c0222cd1fe36f.Speaker: Serval

44e0b43d58b91ca8.ContentText: Wait a minute, was that Gepard's plan all along? Use guilt to make me stay!?
44e0b43d58b91ca8.Speaker: Serval

9df2ce33dccbfde9.ContentText: Hmm, that's true. Anyway, since he asked for help, it's time to give those monsters a shock!
9df2ce33dccbfde9.Speaker: Serval

7cb2100a2c978912.ContentText: You know the way to the Great Mine, right? Let's catch up with Gepard when you're ready!
7cb2100a2c978912.Speaker: Serval

fea68201e967125b.ContentText: That's all you needed to say! Let's go.
fea68201e967125b.Speaker: Serval

8142341bd9fd0fe4.ContentText: Need to take stock? Just say the word — we'll head over together.
8142341bd9fd0fe4.Speaker: Serval

a6aaa0c16725e079.ContentText: I see... Thanks for bringing me up to speed. The clinic has been busy while you were gone. We've treated many people — soldiers and civilians alike.
a6aaa0c16725e079.Speaker: Natasha

24ed46c9aa85c2f8.ContentText: All in all, I owe everyone a big thank you. It would've been much harder if Wildfire had operated alone.
24ed46c9aa85c2f8.Speaker: Natasha

b388022e966f8aa2.ContentText: Thanks to Captain Gepard, we managed to keep our losses to a minimum. I'm sure people will begin to appreciate the Silvermane Guards after this battle.
b388022e966f8aa2.Speaker: Natasha

618d74278eaf0ceb.ContentText: Haha, how could I forget about you two? We couldn't have done it without your help.
618d74278eaf0ceb.Speaker: Natasha

d471d1ca10d0a3ee.ContentText: You're too kind, they deserve the real credit. I doubt I'd have come back in one piece without them.
d471d1ca10d0a3ee.Speaker: Serval

b4b0e64040efc874.ContentText: Sounds like you went through a lot of danger... Are you hurt, Miss Serval? I can have a look if you like.
b4b0e64040efc874.Speaker: Natasha

599533c1d053f7f7.ContentText: I'm alright, don't worry! Everything worked out eventually. Let's wait for the rest of them to get back...
599533c1d053f7f7.Speaker: Serval

2030376fa6bfa38f.ContentText: ...Mr. Oleg has a pretty good handle on what's needed in the mine.
2030376fa6bfa38f.Speaker: Gepard

99e3e9663cbc0484.ContentText: He's arranging for rescue teams and supplies to be sent over. He won't be back for a while.
99e3e9663cbc0484.Speaker: Gepard

0df92036c5306ec5.ContentText: Looks like you guys have the situation under control. Thank you.
0df92036c5306ec5.Speaker: Natasha

6483924f7a560656.ContentText: *sigh* I'd love to sit down and chat with all of you, but I still have a backlog of patients to see.
6483924f7a560656.Speaker: Natasha

1252f4487267dd3f.ContentText: Oh, there was a girl and her brother who said you saved their lives. You might want to check on them and see how they're doing.
1252f4487267dd3f.Speaker: Natasha

1f3d235dfc6ca415.ContentText: Natasha's right, we should make sure those children are alright.
1f3d235dfc6ca415.Speaker: Gepard

2e99199edbe54106.ContentText: C'mon, drink it up and you'll feel better.

9f5d4f82db702781.ContentText: But... there's smoke coming out of it...

b0567b9698856cef.ContentText: Ah, it's you! You saved us from the monsters in the mine. You guys are... Silvermane Guards from the Overworld, right?

45cb2db1241ea628.ContentText: If you hadn't been there, we would've...

9edd47a7a8318769.ContentText: I—I'll think of a way to repay you! I'll get a job, and—

f26db9c05acf141a.ContentText: Th—That's very kind of you... If Mom and Dad were still here, they'd want us to return the favor...

a0066bb952b23163.ContentText: Thanks! We can manage our daily expenses...

464b758c575db380.ContentText: Mom and Dad went somewhere far away a long time ago — haven't come back yet!

e59158532b871cd1.ContentText: ...Mm. They'll come back one day, Zino.

422bffaf87eb199d.ContentText: ...So you're looking after your brother on your own? That must be hard.
422bffaf87eb199d.Speaker: Serval

63d3fe5b6ee6ff50.ContentText: Mm, not really — it's my responsibility as a sister. I'm just worried that with all these monster invasions, maybe one day I won't...

3924ec43f5047437.ContentText: My brother is too young to survive in the Underworld. To think he might have to live on his own ...

ed7745570638fd32.ContentText: The misjudgment of the former supreme guardian isolated the Underworld for more than a decade. With that isolation, came tragedy...
ed7745570638fd32.Speaker: Gepard

6f6ab74ec306d37b.ContentText: But under Lady Bronya's leadership, the Silvermane Guards will atone for past mistakes and bring relief to the people. From now on, you don't need to worry about the safety of your family.
6f6ab74ec306d37b.Speaker: Gepard

fe64d9cb59ba7930.ContentText: Taking care of yourself is hard enough under these circumstances, let alone if you have a brother to look after. I know it can't have been easy.
fe64d9cb59ba7930.Speaker: Gepard

22926baae26b9399.ContentText: You're still young, so you need to stay under your sister's wing. But when you grow up, remember to use what you've learned to protect her.
22926baae26b9399.Speaker: Gepard

a0d511b325cb7618.ContentText: Be there when she needs you, and listen to her when she feels vulnerable. She'll do the same for you.
a0d511b325cb7618.Speaker: Gepard

41bb417aa9f812de.ContentText: O—Okay sir! I'll protect my sister when I grow up!

21bbb831ac9b96dd.ContentText: Thank you, Captain Gepard. Zino and I will remember your words.

925993a04e8548e3.ContentText: Y'know... we're pretty good at turning a happy reunion into a tear fest. Let's call it a day and give them some room.
925993a04e8548e3.Speaker: Serval

381e55981ff1bda8.ContentText: If you're not too tired, Gepard, can I talk to you for a moment?
381e55981ff1bda8.Speaker: Serval

91306f8ea4049ee9.ContentText: What you said back there... did you really mean it?
91306f8ea4049ee9.Speaker: Serval

0b601f989a31cf9f.ContentText: Of course I did. And it wasn't some last-minute speech I cobbled together. It's how I've always felt.
0b601f989a31cf9f.Speaker: Gepard

b24e3da2161f4e36.ContentText: We can't always face problems alone and build walls to keep people out... We need to learn to rely on others — especially those we care about the most.
b24e3da2161f4e36.Speaker: Gepard

002853a45266e8c7.ContentText: I know what you're up to, Geppie...
002853a45266e8c7.Speaker: Serval

aa7d31add138d63e.ContentText: You made it sound like you were talking to those kids... but you were talking to me.
aa7d31add138d63e.Speaker: Serval

5a9a9f77b678ff4b.ContentText: Well, a Landau just called out a Landau.
5a9a9f77b678ff4b.Speaker: Gepard

6864f3840eed7b33.ContentText: Change of plan. I've decided to stay in Belobog.
6864f3840eed7b33.Speaker: Serval

0152ad813238d282.ContentText: Serval, I... I just want you to know that I would've supported your decision no matter what you chose. I wasn't trying to force you to stay.
0152ad813238d282.Speaker: Gepard

e377c18c4f98082a.ContentText: I know that, Gepard. Don't worry, I've thought this one through for a change.
e377c18c4f98082a.Speaker: Serval

14d15f93457023ad.ContentText: What you said was the last piece of the puzzle for me. I suddenly realized that my decision to leave was just me trying to run away from my problems... Wasn't a mature decision.
14d15f93457023ad.Speaker: Serval

a5ed459c23d3af1c.ContentText: I've always found it hard to handle complex relationships... be it Cocolia or my family.
a5ed459c23d3af1c.Speaker: Serval

a16043628d4df3ff.ContentText: The first thought I have when things don't work out is to run away. Starting from today, that's no longer the case.
a16043628d4df3ff.Speaker: Serval

f390e169953c1c16.ContentText: After all... I'm not doing this on my own, right?
f390e169953c1c16.Speaker: Serval

a50f413a323cf7f6.ContentText: If it weren't for you, I wouldn't have had any idea about the hardships people were going through in the Underworld. It made me feel like... maybe I could help a little, and make Belobog a better place.
a50f413a323cf7f6.Speaker: Serval

4cb2eff7a1f9b0bf.ContentText: Gepard, {NICKNAME}, I have one last thing that I might need your help with.
4cb2eff7a1f9b0bf.Speaker: Serval

9030154b3f05f6d8.ContentText: I'm so sorry! This is the last one, I promise!
9030154b3f05f6d8.Speaker: Serval

11ed6f42fba61459.ContentText: I... want to see the Stellaron. I want to see the place where Cocolia sacrificed herself.
11ed6f42fba61459.Speaker: Serval

15a641f5889d7780.ContentText: ...Say no more. We'll go with you.
15a641f5889d7780.Speaker: Gepard

62feb58a888f2aaa.ContentText: Oh, but before that, I need to go back to the workshop and get something. {NICKNAME}, why don't you head north first and we'll catch up with you.
62feb58a888f2aaa.Speaker: Serval

4d5aa30fd294f50b.ContentText: It's alright, I've got Gepard with me — we'll be safe. See you in a bit!
4d5aa30fd294f50b.Speaker: Serval

5d39a3b0196c9629.ContentText: Put all artillery units on standby. Wait for my command to bombard enemy positions and cover our infantry advance.
5d39a3b0196c9629.Speaker: Gepard

078e89b9983e91e8.ContentText: We have a choke point here. Tell all infantry units to switch to double-line formation — close-quarters in front, gunners behind. Remember, get the wounded out as soon as possible, and always secure your flanks before advancing.
078e89b9983e91e8.Speaker: Gepard

6a16051d48b48d92.ContentText: Ah, you're here. Get ready, we need to help the infantry lines drive deep into the mine.
6a16051d48b48d92.Speaker: Gepard

ec0a7715058416db.ContentText: The back of the mine has been secured, which gives us a forward base to send in supplies. The Silvermane-Wildfire combined regiment is conducting rescue missions as they advance.
ec0a7715058416db.Speaker: Gepard

6ea6292ef61a1464.ContentText: The battle is fierce, I need to get to the front line. I'll leave the command post to my officers.
6ea6292ef61a1464.Speaker: Gepard

f0996326b2e78af5.ContentText: The battle is reaching a pivotal point. I have to get to the front line. I'll leave the command post to my officers.
f0996326b2e78af5.Speaker: Gepard

1b12953e2c9cbc06.ContentText: We have clear objectives and the terrain is relatively easy to read. My officers are well-trained — the command system will be in good hands.
1b12953e2c9cbc06.Speaker: Gepard

03356e1396ca8675.ContentText: I... I don't know much about warfare, but I don't see why a commander needs to lead the charge. The situation here is totally different from the Restricted Zone.
03356e1396ca8675.Speaker: Serval

454f4040550396f6.ContentText: Gepard, let me and {NICKNAME} clear the way for you. You should stay in your command post.
454f4040550396f6.Speaker: Serval

9ccff735e93ce7ef.ContentText: Thanks, Serval, but please trust my judgment on this.
9ccff735e93ce7ef.Speaker: Gepard

3244a95074d62128.ContentText: I made a promise to Mr. Oleg to save as many people as possible. I have to see to it myself.
3244a95074d62128.Speaker: Gepard

66579267091b56f7.ContentText: ...There's no stopping you once you've made up your mind. Fine, we'll do it your way.
66579267091b56f7.Speaker: Serval

8b56c346f8e90269.ContentText: Let's move out. We need to clear a way for Wildfire and the Guards.
8b56c346f8e90269.Speaker: Gepard

dee7355fab868f1a.ContentText: All civilians please go to the bridge immediately! The Silvermane Guards have set up a defensive perimeter — you'll be safe there!
dee7355fab868f1a.Speaker: Gepard

b22f36c186f8c397.ContentText: There's a monster heading this way... What should we do, Gepard?
b22f36c186f8c397.Speaker: Serval

8c7fe758a369ac63.ContentText: Bring it down. We need to cover the retreat.
8c7fe758a369ac63.Speaker: Gepard

dbbe8bb3242bf503.ContentText: It made it easy for us... but we can't let our guards down.
dbbe8bb3242bf503.Speaker: Gepard

82e359bca0482e3a.ContentText: It's safe here. Let's move on.
82e359bca0482e3a.Speaker: Gepard

3071d4c9ca58988e.ContentText: Gepard, look! The miners have put up a makeshift defensive line!
3071d4c9ca58988e.Speaker: Serval

dce877c4ceadf33d.ContentText: That's right. We're evacuating the miners together with Wildfire. Are there any other civilians up ahead?
dce877c4ceadf33d.Speaker: Gepard

ccd02d7e2f68c7c1.ContentText: Silvermane G—Guard and Wildfire are working together now...?

73be5387ab5653c0.ContentText: Oh, Civilians... Ah! I saw a girl run out from our defensive position just now!

307ce14c3e8a3313.ContentText: My brother went after her, but they haven't come back...

716a5dcdaff4a86c.ContentText: Understood, I'll bring them back. The Guards and Wildfire have set up defenses on the bridge. You should head over.
716a5dcdaff4a86c.Speaker: Gepard

ab90af547f36730a.ContentText: Thank you! Please bring them back to safety!

77ea8cf10ed91a4d.ContentText: Oh no! Monsters are coming this way!

9f932bd4a315c817.ContentText: Leave the battle to us, you need to fall back!
9f932bd4a315c817.Speaker: Gepard

31a6cd5de90c310d.ContentText: O—Okay! Thank you for saving us!

1dd5c9dce6759d0e.ContentText: Let's keep searching for the missing girl and the miner.
1dd5c9dce6759d0e.Speaker: Gepard

b6bf22d3345deab1.ContentText: Is it me or is it... cold here?
b6bf22d3345deab1.Speaker: Serval

1effbdee90f7a8b0.ContentText: They need our help. We have to deal with these monsters first before advancing further.
1effbdee90f7a8b0.Speaker: Gepard

90059b71fa4402fb.ContentText: You two! It's too dangerous here. Find the Silvermane Guards and Wildfire at the bridge — they'll protect you.
90059b71fa4402fb.Speaker: Gepard

041fe78762300ff5.ContentText: Zino, take my hand! Let's get out of here!

7e1cd1592b3c20ca.ContentText: *sob* It's so cold here... I'm scared...

0e12297a3d762cb2.ContentText: ...The monsters have gotten stronger somehow. I don't remember them being this difficult...
0e12297a3d762cb2.Speaker: Gepard

319bc8db74daa430.ContentText: Thank goodness we got here in time. If we'd arrived any later...
319bc8db74daa430.Speaker: Serval

755c79bd9c1ed05c.ContentText: That's one brave little girl... You were like that at her age too.
755c79bd9c1ed05c.Speaker: Gepard

ee5a96a0080ef083.ContentText: Huh? I wouldn't go that far — I only had Dad to deal with. He could be fierce, but nothing like the monsters here.
ee5a96a0080ef083.Speaker: Serval

957f64a9842b29ba.ContentText: Besides, my problem with him wasn't that he was a strict father...
957f64a9842b29ba.Speaker: Serval

ef8482b1b290eebd.ContentText: I just couldn't believe that he never lifted a finger to oppose Cocolia's order to seal the passageway...
ef8482b1b290eebd.Speaker: Serval

840668ba93d7a3ec.ContentText: Vowing to protect the Underworlders in one breath, and then deciding they deserved to be abandoned in the next... "Family code of conduct" — what a joke.
840668ba93d7a3ec.Speaker: Serval

e0da93b4bad81bed.ContentText: Father was a soldier. He wasn't supposed to question the orders from his superiors...
e0da93b4bad81bed.Speaker: Gepard

b2e7f5adc7e4dc6a.ContentText: ...Never mind. I know I sound like I'm defending him, and I don't want to make you angry. At least now we've got the chance to right the wrongs.
b2e7f5adc7e4dc6a.Speaker: Gepard

5367267fc1dfce8f.ContentText: Hmph, I'm angry just thinking about it. Looking back, I'm glad I left home early.
5367267fc1dfce8f.Speaker: Serval

346f27a584572673.ContentText: Running away doesn't solve the problem. It's been ages since you two had those fights, but you still can't let it go... You need to walk out of his shadow.
346f27a584572673.Speaker: Gepard

265919de800719a0.ContentText: I'm not trying to change your mind. I just want to know that your choice to leave this planet is a result of having thought things through, not because you're trying to run away from something.
