265919de800719a0.Speaker: Gepard

e35d7ec4591702a1.ContentText: *sigh* Don't worry about it. I get what you're trying to say, I do! It's just... I need some time.
e35d7ec4591702a1.Speaker: Serval

892270bc2a83c9fe.ContentText: Let's focus on the business at hand. That miner we met said his brother came this way — we should look around.
892270bc2a83c9fe.Speaker: Serval

768665cf46a0ce7e.ContentText: Okay. Be careful though, I sense a drop in temperature. Something's not right.
768665cf46a0ce7e.Speaker: Gepard

cf9887c5cab3bc07.ContentText: It could mean something we haven't encountered before is waiting for us. Stay on your toes.
cf9887c5cab3bc07.Speaker: Gepard

0f1923240b0deb12.ContentText: Phew... These monsters are tough. I need to find those kids...

e23492b2ae96b787.ContentText: Hey... Did you just scare off a Fragmentum monster?
e23492b2ae96b787.Speaker: Serval

959c812d7540e875.ContentText: Uhh, kind of... There was one on its own — I managed to chase it away.

13a94735b87371e4.ContentText: Speaking of which, you came from that direction, right? Did you see two little kids? A girl and her brother...?

41d3153cab96456f.ContentText: Ah, thank goodness... I chased the monster too far and lost them.

c015b344eef61986.ContentText: What!? Quick! I knew I shouldn't have—

132e697bd422b274.ContentText: Easy, they went back to safety.
132e697bd422b274.Speaker: Gepard

6c76a372586358c5.ContentText: They'll be okay now. You should head back to the bridge too — the Guards and Wildfire have set up a safe zone there.
6c76a372586358c5.Speaker: Gepard

3059e14dbb425fe9.ContentText: Thank you — all of you. I'm just glad they're okay... I can finally retreat as well.

d747c757372f7ea8.ContentText: I heard there's a powerful monster down the road — some kind of leader of the pack... I'd take caution!

c03faf91839aec6d.ContentText: Thanks for the intel. We'll be careful.
c03faf91839aec6d.Speaker: Gepard

91d7185f0d3c5db8.ContentText: I think he was right about the monster... Serval, {NICKNAME}, no sudden moves.
91d7185f0d3c5db8.Speaker: Gepard

13d443824d19f6f3.ContentText: I've seen this type of monster a few times near the restricted zone.
13d443824d19f6f3.Speaker: Gepard

b0268fb43df6d7a1.ContentText: Wait, don't get too close! Something's not right...
b0268fb43df6d7a1.Speaker: Gepard

05be35bb48c9ea20.ContentText: These monsters are usually eager to fight — you're guaranteed a fierce battle if you see one in the Fragmentum...
05be35bb48c9ea20.Speaker: Gepard

aefda3a293768c87.ContentText: But this one doesn't seem concerned about us... This could be a trap.
aefda3a293768c87.Speaker: Gepard

55eb81ac0f639efe.ContentText: ...I'm not sure either. I just have a feeling that something's different.
55eb81ac0f639efe.Speaker: Gepard

9ec23302fdf23d09.ContentText: Careful, {NICKNAME}. Special circumstances require a special approach.
9ec23302fdf23d09.Speaker: Gepard

f29385589ce582f4.ContentText: ...Steady, get ready to counter its attack...
f29385589ce582f4.Speaker: Gepard

c584009aabc7d7ea.ContentText: ...Ugh, that noise! Do Fragmentum monsters usually sound like this?
c584009aabc7d7ea.Speaker: Serval

2fb295d788614ad0.ContentText: I heard rumors about this kind of monster... "Shadows in the Fragmentum that assume human forms are echoes of the will of past guardians."
2fb295d788614ad0.Speaker: Gepard

b16fefcf45016851.ContentText: If the rumors are true... could it be...
b16fefcf45016851.Speaker: Gepard

dcc23dc3ab1f522b.ContentText: Hmph, since when did you forget how to let go, Cocolia?
dcc23dc3ab1f522b.Speaker: Serval

e15ca36473f13499.ContentText: The temperature is returning to normal... the monsters are retreating.
e15ca36473f13499.Speaker: Gepard

5f9f496cb7511718.ContentText: ...I think it's safe to say that the shadow of Madam Cocolia was the reason for this invasion. The other anomalies we experienced were probably also a direct result...
5f9f496cb7511718.Speaker: Gepard

9433706e3def570b.ContentText: Whatever the case, we've managed to avert a crisis. Are you okay, {NICKNAME}?
9433706e3def570b.Speaker: Gepard

c01ce53ac3be7382.ContentText: Indeed it was. We're lucky to have an experienced fighter like you who can adapt to different enemies.
c01ce53ac3be7382.Speaker: Gepard

1a8e0342f27f57a5.ContentText: Sounds like something the Hero of Belobog would say alright.
1a8e0342f27f57a5.Speaker: Gepard

6fef4949fd2437d4.ContentText: It would've taken us much longer to fight off the shadow without you. Serval... how are you feeling?
6fef4949fd2437d4.Speaker: Gepard

8c94e9d2e4859005.ContentText: I feel like something heavy has finally been lifted.
8c94e9d2e4859005.Speaker: Serval

d49ac7228e12b3be.ContentText: All that noise before it perished... {NICKNAME}, did you catch what it said?
d49ac7228e12b3be.Speaker: Serval

8d87bde48ed8237f.ContentText: I see... You really made no effort to correct your mistakes, Cocolia...
8d87bde48ed8237f.Speaker: Serval

ce3f2ffca6727478.ContentText: Anyway, it doesn't matter anymore... From here on out, I'm over that woman.
ce3f2ffca6727478.Speaker: Serval

cf9f3c0e512237aa.ContentText: *sigh* I guess it doesn't matter. From here on out, I'm over that woman.
cf9f3c0e512237aa.Speaker: Serval

844345d94a34cf10.ContentText: *sigh* I guess it doesn't matter. From here on out, I'm over that woman.
844345d94a34cf10.Speaker: Serval

7dafe79664cfbbe7.ContentText: ...I can tell you mean it this time.
7dafe79664cfbbe7.Speaker: Gepard

cfe0459d6cbd77de.ContentText: I'm happy for you, Serval... It's not easy to truly put the past behind you.
cfe0459d6cbd77de.Speaker: Gepard

60e86987be5b3b48.ContentText: Looks like we accomplished our mission. I need to get back to the Guards and Wildfire to wrap things up.
60e86987be5b3b48.Speaker: Gepard

0eb70380b66bbe09.ContentText: You two should head over to Natasha's place and check in on the wounded.
0eb70380b66bbe09.Speaker: Gepard

b13fea72c077b315.ContentText: Sure, come find us later at the clinic. {NICKNAME}, let's leave Gepard to his business and head back to town.
b13fea72c077b315.Speaker: Serval

ea8d04663bbc1730.ContentText: ...I may live in relative seclusion, but I can recognize my own territory.

6b20724c4dda3697.ContentText: Why did you bring us here!? Does this look like the Divination Commission to you!?

a6bf6143c757b2da.ContentText: ...No need to yell, Master Diviner! The Meridian Pin is malfunctioning and I couldn't find the entrance to the delve. I wanted to get us straight to our destination but this is the only place I could dock the starskiff.
a6bf6143c757b2da.Speaker: Tingyun

5458133cbf3acf23.ContentText: Look — "Exalting Sanctum" — this is a safe place. Let's just walk the rest of the way from here.
5458133cbf3acf23.Speaker: Tingyun

a875be3c797261bd.ContentText: Our hexagrammatic position is fluctuating between the marsh and water trigrams. The vessel is stranded and the way is blocked...

3005c6a477323808.ContentText: I heard the Xianzhou can tell your fortune — is that how they do it? Anyone can count on their fingers...
3005c6a477323808.Speaker: March 7th

ef4e948c5f98544f.ContentText: Yeah, yeah, yeah — so I'm a layman. Why don't you enlighten me, oh connoisseur?
ef4e948c5f98544f.Speaker: March 7th

6d913294a2f82966.ContentText: That's been out of fashion for hundreds of Amber Eras!
6d913294a2f82966.Speaker: March 7th

ee5b807ab54554d5.ContentText: What's wrong with that? We've got ten fingers, may as well use them!
ee5b807ab54554d5.Speaker: March 7th

3cf7a4455ab916ec.ContentText: I just performed some quick divination and the hexagram is consistent with our current predicament. The starskiff cannot take us to the Divination Commission today. Alas, without me in charge to handle the Stellaron crisis, I dare not even imagine the kind of mess the commission must be in.

42dbc575b8072d50.ContentText: It's true — the Divination Commission really can't go a single day without Lady Fu.
42dbc575b8072d50.Speaker: Tingyun

6c674682f8762b44.ContentText: That's why you have to develop your talent pool — otherwise everything falls apart when you go on vacation...
6c674682f8762b44.Speaker: March 7th

a74bd22acef06383.ContentText: Hmph, since you are clearly ignorant of the commission's internal affairs, I shall absolve you of your ridiculous remarks. I'm going ahead to make some inquiries. Goodbye.

4e70a0344b0c9cba.ContentText: You... really are enthusiastic. No wonder Jing Yuan told me to give you errands...

fadf2e1b986d5c09.ContentText: The prisoner must follow me every step of the way. This is Jing Yuan's order.

41ef146b7ec2ac3b.ContentText: Um, you might not wanna hear this, but your general gave us his word. We have to be present when you question Kafka.
41ef146b7ec2ac3b.Speaker: March 7th

04568f88c4d3de72.ContentText: You think too little of me — my word is my bond! I will stick to my promise even if this delve collapses. That's... very unlikely, by the way.

89b001808484dcbb.ContentText: To have this prisoner speak, the commission must resort to unconventional means... the nature of which is confidential and cannot be disclosed — forgive me. But I can assure you that the questioning will not begin until you arrive, even if that means wasting precious time.

b4283397fe385bc4.ContentText: I have appointed someone to wait for you in front of Exalting Sanctum Plaza. Once we've consolidated our internal affairs, you will be brought into the Divination Commission. Please be patient.

d0e936e8157652f0.ContentText: Hey, are you on her side? I just wanted to remind her not to break her promise, that's all.
d0e936e8157652f0.Speaker: March 7th

616a6ea7497ea9aa.ContentText: Hmph, you do it next time — I'm tired of being the villain.
616a6ea7497ea9aa.Speaker: March 7th

9ea42b0ac8602edb.ContentText: Don't take it to heart, March. Miss Fu Xuan seems like a reasonable lady — I'm sure she's not angry with you.
9ea42b0ac8602edb.Speaker: Welt

23dff2b71dba509c.ContentText: Really? I thought she was pretty icy...
23dff2b71dba509c.Speaker: March 7th

92c40cae3f56c52d.ContentText: Hmm... I don't know how to deal with people like that.
92c40cae3f56c52d.Speaker: March 7th

286fdec8cb1f77be.ContentText: Like how you're always pretending to be quiet?
286fdec8cb1f77be.Speaker: March 7th

7e1b00bf4c4d8a47.ContentText: Haha, Dan Heng's not icy. He's nerdy.
7e1b00bf4c4d8a47.Speaker: March 7th

213fdd24b8f62c64.ContentText: Okay, enough chit-chat. I reckon the Divination Commission could be a while — let's take a look around.
213fdd24b8f62c64.Speaker: Welt

d4db92d801a0e7e0.ContentText: Yeah! That starskiff was pretty cool, there must be loads of interesting things in Exalting Sanctum.
d4db92d801a0e7e0.Speaker: March 7th

966f51668184772e.ContentText: *sigh* You never asked what the Sky-Faring Commission does. I suppose not all commissions are created equal...
966f51668184772e.Speaker: Tingyun

182cb35e3e24a237.ContentText: Anyway, if you must know, the Divination Commission is responsible for gathering intelligence, devising strategies, and performing divination.
182cb35e3e24a237.Speaker: Tingyun

331755130f065b24.ContentText: Maybe there's more to it? It's not like I would know, I'm a mere amicassador.
331755130f065b24.Speaker: Tingyun

b50b8f0acbd584b5.ContentText: Don't worry, Diviner Fu seems confident about getting Kafka to talk. If I were you I'd just sit back and watch her do her thing.
b50b8f0acbd584b5.Speaker: Tingyun

26fd73207cbfd973.ContentText: Oh no, Xianzhou divination is nothing like the superstitious scams you see elsewhere. It's based on a technology called the jade abacus.
26fd73207cbfd973.Speaker: Tingyun

a5764128c04d8f6a.ContentText: From navigation to governance, military issues to civil affairs, every decision on the Xianzhou must be reviewed by the Divination Commission to ensure that it can be executed without a hiccup.
a5764128c04d8f6a.Speaker: Tingyun

d368df2fb340ceed.ContentText: Who knows? She tends to make decisions based on the results of her divinations as opposed to what others might be thinking.
d368df2fb340ceed.Speaker: Tingyun

67eac5389487835c.ContentText: If she doesn't want to reveal the commission's secrets, then you have no choice but to wait.
67eac5389487835c.Speaker: Tingyun

c226d340c31c6f07.ContentText: The general entrusted the master diviner with the interrogation of the fugitive because he has faith in her ability to manage the situation. As one of the Six Charioteers, she is certainly capable.
c226d340c31c6f07.Speaker: Tingyun

6914b14a3f09817e.ContentText: Why do you think Kafka surrendered at the mere sight of her back in Stargazer Navalia?
6914b14a3f09817e.Speaker: Tingyun

c34fbf526d9cba21.ContentText: Oh? Did you want a tour of Exalting Sanctum? Hee-hee...
c34fbf526d9cba21.Speaker: Tingyun

18e76559786fcca0.ContentText: The last time I came here on a Starskiff was... let me think... about <unbreak>20</unbreak> years ago now. I've been on the road for so long that I've started to forget the sights and sounds of the Xianzhou...
18e76559786fcca0.Speaker: Tingyun

b29942de1a4aa9eb.ContentText: All I remember is that this is a good place to while away the days~ Still, many delves have changed beyond recognition since the arrival of the Stellaron.
b29942de1a4aa9eb.Speaker: Tingyun

0493d0e5220b27a2.ContentText: If you're bored, you could go and find the messenger from the Divination Commission.
0493d0e5220b27a2.Speaker: Tingyun

b2ab30b5bc272682.ContentText: If you're bored, you could go and find the messenger from the Divination Commission.
b2ab30b5bc272682.Speaker: Tingyun

82aaecd0f9b2b161.ContentText: "...the nature of which is confidential and cannot be disclosed..." Is that a Xianzhou motto or something? First the Sky-Faring Commission, now the Divination Commission — they're all so secretive! The general's the only friendly face here.
82aaecd0f9b2b161.Speaker: March 7th

c3edfe63ae1f6be2.ContentText: I hate to admit it, but I'm even starting to miss Sampo... Hold up! I must be losing my mind. Nope — I'll take the Xianzhou over that blue-haired bore any day...
c3edfe63ae1f6be2.Speaker: March 7th

6e8d705ca37bc42b.ContentText: *sigh* We've gone from being chased through every street in Belobog, to waiting on every corner in the Xianzhou.
6e8d705ca37bc42b.Speaker: March 7th

be8dd431c13e3c9b.ContentText: Chasing and waiting — maybe that's what life's all about...
be8dd431c13e3c9b.Speaker: March 7th

3c9a623a04706752.ContentText: Hmph, I'm not just a pretty face, y'know! I've got poetry on standby <unbreak>24</unbreak>/7.
3c9a623a04706752.Speaker: March 7th

bfb7c0436bc03ab5.ContentText: ...Are you wondering if the Xianzhou is my homeworld?
bfb7c0436bc03ab5.Speaker: March 7th

3dc3864baef11124.ContentText: No, I'm not getting any flashbacks. Please — do I look Xianzhouish to you? You must be thinking of Dan Heng.
3dc3864baef11124.Speaker: March 7th

ea2ff25ae573b9c6.ContentText: Wait a minute — clear my head of what!?
ea2ff25ae573b9c6.Speaker: March 7th

5a742063b1bfff29.ContentText: Should we wait here, or go find the messenger from the Divination Commission?
5a742063b1bfff29.Speaker: March 7th

a333171c75c3a2f5.ContentText: When we confronted Kafka, she seemed certain that Fu Xuan would show up...
a333171c75c3a2f5.Speaker: Welt

cdac4933ef78d406.ContentText: That's a romantic way of putting it, but I suspect the reality could be more sinister...
cdac4933ef78d406.Speaker: Welt

4f69ab2bac18ffef.ContentText: The leader of the Stellaron Hunters is called Elio. No one knows who he is or what he looks like — only that the Interastral Peace Corporation calls him "Destiny's Slave."
4f69ab2bac18ffef.Speaker: Welt

e4de5d4637b23928.ContentText: It's said that he has the power to foresee "possibilities." According to Herta, the corporation believes Elio can see the temporal branching of infinite possibilities — which is very much like being able to predict the future...
e4de5d4637b23928.Speaker: Welt

3df0773cbbc51a69.ContentText: ...in fact, it may even be superior. If the rumors are true, every seemingly meaningless action taken by the Stellaron Hunters may actually be a choice based on those "possibilities."
3df0773cbbc51a69.Speaker: Welt

f150a0b7f3687ee2.ContentText: ...which would include what they did to you, {NICKNAME}...
f150a0b7f3687ee2.Speaker: Welt

3f199b4e6645c463.ContentText: I think that may be why the Stellaron Hunters won't leave you alone.
3f199b4e6645c463.Speaker: Welt

30013b2e8cd5d655.ContentText: Be careful, {NICKNAME}. Every time a Stellaron Hunter appears, their objective may be to steer the direction of the future.
30013b2e8cd5d655.Speaker: Welt

aac478c92fbc1acc.ContentText: For the sake of this discussion? Yes, I think so. But, {NICKNAME}... who isn't?
aac478c92fbc1acc.Speaker: Welt

d8381bd908980737.ContentText: All of us are future variables, our choices solidifying reality. The future is nothing incredible either — just a fog waiting for us to make a decision.
d8381bd908980737.Speaker: Welt

14dd759e8234cf36.ContentText: That's good, {NICKNAME}, but be careful — maybe the Stellaron Hunters showing up is a sign that they're trying to change the future...
14dd759e8234cf36.Speaker: Welt

c0cee7c6c02f29dd.ContentText: Back to the matter at hand — Kafka...
c0cee7c6c02f29dd.Speaker: Welt

51eacdcf9e92b50c.ContentText: Yes. It's strange for a fugitive to give themselves up, but a fugitive who can see the future? For her, perhaps that was the way it was always going to be...
51eacdcf9e92b50c.Speaker: Welt

14637bb789ae3423.ContentText: ...but is she really as calm as she seems? The future holds almost infinite possibilities, after all. I suspect she has proof that she has nothing to do with the Stellaron crisis.
14637bb789ae3423.Speaker: Welt

66cac9be91cb17da.ContentText: Or perhaps something is supposed to transpire during the Divination Commission's interrogation — something that would allow her a window of escape...
66cac9be91cb17da.Speaker: Welt

0fd357a5dc48ae29.ContentText: *sigh* Why did the Stellaron Hunters go to such lengths to bring us here? What is the future that Destiny's Slave sees behind this course of action?
0fd357a5dc48ae29.Speaker: Welt

ba283daf5b1aa9e8.ContentText: Sorry, I'm getting a little fixated. If you want to head out, we should go this way.
ba283daf5b1aa9e8.Speaker: Welt

1c45af4f54586d7c.ContentText: Hurry, find beds for the patients from the other delves and stabilize them.

8699dd34c88fba13.ContentText: Remember to minimize contact — we don't want your people to succumb to the same evil...

1911258988127bc2.ContentText: Yeah, yeah, yeah, the Realm-Keeping Commission is out in full strength — what about the Alchemy Commission? Why are there so few of you here?

01adab3d093bfa0a.ContentText: Do you mean "out in full force"?

73834391b6d512e5.ContentText: Hey, missy, does this look like a classroom to you? Concentrate on treating the patients!

22ed2966b96e4ec1.ContentText: There must be alternate medical practitioners somewhere — the Alchemy Commission can't help us right now...

8edc7ba7207d75bb.ContentText: That's... the best I can do...

0e9a72890b316b83.ContentText: Tsk, what's that supposed to mean? Doctors don't give up that easily!

b954adbe9a30f4c4.ContentText: What else am I supposed to do? The route back to the Alchemy Commission has disappeared, and we're in the field without the right medicine or supplies.

3b48e7b657001e55.ContentText: Besides, we have no record of this disease at all. These symptoms are consistent with someone about to be stricken with mara.

a44644a396fa1eec.ContentText: According to his medical record, this man is barely over <unbreak>200</unbreak> years old — he only just joined the Cloud Knights. How can he possibly be mara-struck? Why don't you... take another look.

0fc45e9ab5b369bd.ContentText: If it goes on like this, the judges of the Ten-Lords Commission will have to come out and clean up this mess.

ba7e99d044b2f2e6.ContentText: My first time seeing these symptoms up close... Being stricken with mara is more terrible than I imagined.

50b1b0b2cd7b138e.ContentText: I heard the Vidyadhara dragon lady is here. Maybe she can help stem the tide...

a69b0fcf226685a0.ContentText: Tsk, when it rains, it pours. The Artisanship Commission has its own issues — sounds serious too! Go and inform the Cloud Knights — see if you can...

4fda7db66d132807.ContentText: Oh, my apologies. I'm an orderly from the Realm-Keeping Commission. Judging by your dress, you must be visitors to the Luofu?

f6c85bbfe9003a7e.ContentText: Sorry, the Xianzhou is currently caught in... unusual circumstances. But the Cloud Knights will resolve the issues as soon as possible.

611c89a55d3787ed.ContentText: For safety reasons, please stay in your residence and refrain from going out for the time being.

f59e6fae3e7e3c5c.ContentText: And I'm a civil servant — the general hired me.

b4b11d9626b69273.ContentText: Technically speaking, every traveler aboard the Luofu is a guest of the general.

3329eb9e6a44486a.ContentText: If the port is still open, I would suggest you take a boat to Starskiff Haven right away, though I heard the route may have been temporarily suspended...

b38739847c34a1b9.ContentText: Oh, that reminds me... I have a friend with a starskiff and a travel permit — he could help you and your friends get over quickly. The price is fair and negotiable. What do you think?

2e63df8cbcb15b38.ContentText: Well now, you must be quite special! Don't spread this around, but this isn't some small-scale maintenance drill. The general has sent the Cloud Knights to check for hidden dangers.

c0639af1ab7c99e2.ContentText: You may not need it right now, but if there's any help I can give you, come to me any time.

6b030ceaa0d8f22b.ContentText: Hmph, very well. I still have business to attend to. If you change your mind, come to me any time.

c18d7f0355fe89b4.ContentText: Ugh, they pay us next to nothing then order us straight to the front line when things go south... I must be crazy.

262d481876891404.ContentText: Everyone, please remain calm. This is an announcement from the Realm-Keeping Commission General Bureau. Exalting Sanctum is temporarily closing its borders and navigation routes. The details will be outlined in the official bulletin sent to your jade abacus soon.

fbb41600fcd3e2fb.ContentText: If you feel unwell, please report to the Realm-Keeping Commission as soon as possible. We have doctors from the Alchemy Commission here who will see you free of charge.

79c0a40940060cb2.ContentText: Oh, we will also be distributing a bag of protein rice and emergency medicine to each of you. You can collect the supplies from me in person, or the commission can deliver them to your door.

9b006232f038cd89.ContentText: Please register with your jade abacus bracelet... Oh, you must be an outsider.

ac799621e08cb30f.ContentText: I heard there's a problem with the meridian pin.

2abc342a23ec8826.ContentText: Some diviners and stargazers managed to escape the delve. Many of them were terrified — they were muttering about "plants" and "roots..." Something terrible must have happened there.

4896f253d13dd33d.ContentText: Do you have friends trapped in the delve? If you're worried about them, find a diviner and see if they can tell you what happened.

dd18d85cb284886c.ContentText: I want to say it's all in a day's work, but I've been here for twelve hours already... When will this end?

2eaf901a1018d056.ContentText: This is an announcement from the Realm-Keeping Commission General Bureau. Exalting Sanctum is temporarily closing its borders...

0c4f88cf915d4d5f.ContentText: Can I help you with anything?

9ef3be22dc6515b9.ContentText: Wait a minute, I already issued you with supplies... You won't fool the Realm-Keeping Commission that easily.

7db3fff92c3254a2.ContentText: All in a day's work, although I've been standing here for twelve hours now... I just want this to be over.

2bb971f22471d6eb.ContentText: Huh, now I'm getting déjà vu...

7edce40ad6b29274.ContentText: ...I think I need to take a break.

5f0444755f258523.ContentText: ...but I can't see anyone waiting for us. Should we look around?
5f0444755f258523.Speaker: March 7th

9947b46ee48e6e5f.ContentText: What does that mean? It's just a picture. Are we supposed to meet someone there?
9947b46ee48e6e5f.Speaker: March 7th

f5f836aaf1f6a8fc.ContentText: It's like one of those messages a kidnapper sends in a horror movie...
f5f836aaf1f6a8fc.Speaker: March 7th

6581a9a38ac0f46a.ContentText: That's enough of that. Come on, let's go.
6581a9a38ac0f46a.Speaker: Welt

bcf2c47ff804189f.ContentText: Hurry up, Qingque! We'll be fossils by the time you're finished.

2b43f42c76421585.ContentText: I heard there was a disaster in the Divination Commission's delve? I'm surprised you're in the mood to play right now, Qingque.

6d060749f0bdfde5.ContentText: Even if the sky was gonna collapse on the Divination Commission, the master diviner would be there to hold it up. What she lacks in height, she more than makes up for in stamina.
6d060749f0bdfde5.Speaker: Qingque

c3907962a5e39576.ContentText: Anyway, I didn't come here just to play — she ordered me to wait here for our guests. Time is precious! I'm simply multitasking.
c3907962a5e39576.Speaker: Qingque

617650a210aff38d.ContentText: It's the place in the photo alright. Is this... a games parlor!? What kind of problem can they possibly be facing?
617650a210aff38d.Speaker: March 7th

193b5b5927113adf.ContentText: Ha! Isn't this hand a problem? I have the worst luck...
193b5b5927113adf.Speaker: Qingque

aeb14d73b2ac9458.ContentText: Hi there! I can tell just by looking at you that you're the Divination Commission's guests.
aeb14d73b2ac9458.Speaker: Qingque

306ea76b6f4cb1d9.ContentText: I know, I know, I'm sorry — I was going to wait for you by the statue, but— Ah— Triplet!
306ea76b6f4cb1d9.Speaker: Qingque

5b53d982e95d020a.ContentText: ...but folks from the Realm-Keeping Commission descended on the area. It's too loud over there now... Pass! Pass!
5b53d982e95d020a.Speaker: Qingque

e0400b7aa8b0c213.ContentText: ...So I thought to myself, wouldn't it be better to meet somewhere quieter? FOUR OF A KIND!
e0400b7aa8b0c213.Speaker: Qingque

51dd3815bcf7c681.ContentText: ...And wouldn't that be more fun, too? Better to show you the real Exalting Sanctum and introduce you to a true Xianzhou pastime: celestial jade. Aha...
51dd3815bcf7c681.Speaker: Qingque

a20acc068391f5e7.ContentText: *sigh* Now that my wish has been fulfilled, there's nothing holding us back. Follow me, honored guests.
a20acc068391f5e7.Speaker: Qingque

f43b2a0d8b7fb1de.ContentText: I must apologize for your long wait, honored guests.
f43b2a0d8b7fb1de.Speaker: Qingque

e708db9b47333e73.ContentText: It wasn't too long. Seeing your enthusiasm for this "celestial jade" game has stoked my curiosity.
e708db9b47333e73.Speaker: Welt

b6b3d7f5769b30cd.ContentText: Haha, I'm glad to hear it — you clearly have excellent taste! If you're interested I can show you how to play — it's great fun.
b6b3d7f5769b30cd.Speaker: Qingque

1e71c2437ebe0514.ContentText: Mr. Yang! Is this really the best time?
1e71c2437ebe0514.Speaker: March 7th

0bf322ac4067534b.ContentText: It's an ancient tree — we call it the Ambrosial Arbor. It was once the Xianzhou Luofu's prized treasure.
0bf322ac4067534b.Speaker: Tingyun

47cfbdfe54febc3c.ContentText: I didn't know the Sky-Faring Commission were history buffs! Not bad, younger generations usually don't know much about it. It's said that the Ambrosial Arbor is an ancient remnant from when the Xianzhou roamed the ether.
47cfbdfe54febc3c.Speaker: Qingque

b223ebe3c93609d3.ContentText: From a distance it looks like half a tree stump, but according to Records of the Early Nation, in its prime, "it wound into the heavens, and from it celestial bodies hung!"
b223ebe3c93609d3.Speaker: Qingque

835b27cd38101f21.ContentText: It means the tree was as tall as the sky and stars hung from its branches.
835b27cd38101f21.Speaker: Welt

8fe01c5df58cb5d9.ContentText: So how big was it? Bigger than the Express? Bigger than Herta space station? No, that can't be right.
8fe01c5df58cb5d9.Speaker: March 7th

0e22c26638ec9858.ContentText: "Stars hung from its branches..." Then how did it fit in the Xianzhou!?
0e22c26638ec9858.Speaker: March 7th

309cb9ec0cc3bfca.ContentText: Those are metaphors! You shouldn't take poetry so literally.
309cb9ec0cc3bfca.Speaker: Qingque

05b787d492b36e99.ContentText: Exactly, let's just say it was bigger than your imagination.
05b787d492b36e99.Speaker: Qingque

83fa2ddcd6135118.ContentText: Anyway, it's just a legend. I see this view every day on my way to work — I'm kinda bored of it.
83fa2ddcd6135118.Speaker: Qingque

9cd84278df75f3ca.ContentText: On the eastern horizon, the arbor stands tall, the candle dragon down below... One day, I'll see that view for myself.

22ef6082494d64cd.ContentText: Hello, are you here for a bit of Exalting Sanctum scenery too?

0e465493564429e7.ContentText: I've heard there are serious incidents unfolding on the Luofu. Communication with the Divination Commission's delve has been severed. For your own safety, I'd suggest you remain here.

6076b29a5e31e5de.ContentText: If you do have an important reason to go, then please be extra careful.

be18c0a28fa9fa81.ContentText: I'm just a doctor — there's not much I can do to assist you. These are medicinal pellets that the Alchemy Commission hands out to field doctors — you might find them useful in an emergency. Take them.

6506e6ac0b978680.ContentText: In that case, would you mind describing it to me?

a9fb442e39730e4b.ContentText: Precisely. I've been without sight since the day I was born.

50b35237b532e182.ContentText: My other senses make up for that fact to some extent — they're as strong as anyone else's.

e165e6a76a2be6ec.ContentText: I can hear the sounds of people on the wind, smell the moisture from the rain clouds of the Artisanship Commission, feel the delicate texture of the yule flower's petals. All I lack is a window on the world...

4ce4009e88e531bd.ContentText: I've been here many times in my life, but the scenery can never fully reveal itself to me.

f2dee2965a7f6cba.ContentText: That's why I'd love you to describe it to me.

60ad37d7fb91b71d.ContentText: We're almost there everyone, stay close.
60ad37d7fb91b71d.Speaker: Qingque

f73c2f4ad2cca5eb.ContentText: That was terrifying, thank goodness the Vidyadhara dragon lady was saved...

044fa4febb161ab0.ContentText: Yes, that child's usually hidden away. What's she doing out here?

9ad7404dc114e131.ContentText: I heard the Knights affected by the evil are going berserk!

6a5350434529e2d6.ContentText: Don't scare yourself — the Alchemy Commission's dragon lady can cure anything.

2ce45db3e3076470.ContentText: Excuse me, {M#fella}{F#miss} — hold on a moment.

1fb897a0ed284fdf.ContentText: It was only thanks to your help earlier that the dragon lady and those Exalting Sanctum residents got away unscathed.

ca0db5aa6bfaaa76.ContentText: The dragon lady of the Alchemy Commission — Lady Bailu.

439cd2786360c8f6.ContentText: You mean the child? She's starting to sound like a big shot.
439cd2786360c8f6.Speaker: March 7th

36ebe3b33563c6d9.ContentText: You don't remember? You dealt with those mara-struck knights in the nick of time — I saw it all.

b52e89bb78c3a958.ContentText: A friend in the Sky-Faring Commission told me the general commissioned guests to deal with the troubles on the Luofu. You must be the guests.

e6bd47c26ec7d713.ContentText: If you don't mind, I hope you can take the time to come to the Realm-Keeping Commission. I'd like to talk to you about the issues Exalting Sanctum is currently facing.

61d115caaf74170a.ContentText: This isn't a good place to talk — too much activity. If you don't mind, I hope you can come to the Realm-Keeping Commission.

4ec174dc7dab8344.ContentText: ...That'll teach you a lesson. Ready to lie down now?
4ec174dc7dab8344.Speaker: Bailu

27247854bb7e845b.ContentText: Thanks for helping to stabilize the patients — your "assertive sedation" techniques are quite effective.
27247854bb7e845b.Speaker: Bailu

b16b927c674268da.ContentText: "Assertive sedation techniques..." Does she mean beating people up?
b16b927c674268da.Speaker: March 7th

9eefd0cd444705f2.ContentText: However, these Cloud Knights were already sick, and now they're injured too. I've gotta bandage up their wounds, realign their bones... Ugh, as if I didn't have enough on my plate!
9eefd0cd444705f2.Speaker: Bailu

d1a8c2e5e4cdac4f.ContentText: I get it — you think because I'm small I must be a runaway child.
d1a8c2e5e4cdac4f.Speaker: Bailu

90c322ad3910bf2e.ContentText: Hmph, welcome to the Xianzhou my short-lived outsider friends — appearances can be deceiving here! The Vidyadhara race is self-reincarnating — no mum or dad required!
90c322ad3910bf2e.Speaker: Bailu

712b1f17d860427d.ContentText: I've been studying the art of healing ever since I cast off my old shell! You're looking at a recognized, practicing, dedicated doctor.
712b1f17d860427d.Speaker: Bailu

ebe8344e03b8c60b.ContentText: Belobog kids are making snowmen while children here are writing prescriptions...
ebe8344e03b8c60b.Speaker: March 7th

02470520b6c3cdac.ContentText: Things haven't been very peaceful on the Luofu recently. Make sure you don't—
02470520b6c3cdac.Speaker: Bailu

2ebda6897029c7d8.ContentText: Go running around, right? Well, your general gave us an errand, so I'm afraid we have to.
2ebda6897029c7d8.Speaker: March 7th

c9ef4e74848a0dbe.ContentText: Hm, well, seeing as you saved me just now, if you're unlucky enough to acquire any breaks or sprains... I'll treat you for free! As for medicine, I'll give you a twenty percent discount.
c9ef4e74848a0dbe.Speaker: Bailu

01ad1ed70c69ed7f.ContentText: Ha, do you have any idea how many people on the Luofu are waiting for an appointment with me? You should count this as a blessing!
01ad1ed70c69ed7f.Speaker: Bailu

426490ef24043e78.ContentText: If I hadn't left my purse at home, I wouldn't have to...
426490ef24043e78.Speaker: Bailu

c421eae6e0a45bf9.ContentText: Ahem, enough of that. I have patients to see.
c421eae6e0a45bf9.Speaker: Bailu

3f0ca666b5fb3494.ContentText: Where did you come from little one? Is your Dad around?
3f0ca666b5fb3494.Speaker: March 7th

125ff4fdfc679008.ContentText: I don't have a mom either.
125ff4fdfc679008.Speaker: Bailu

b07b00812cc9e559.ContentText: Our little miracle worker here seems very different from everyone else around — don't you think Mr. Yang?
b07b00812cc9e559.Speaker: March 7th

27f62db35efae85c.ContentText: So this is the Vidyadhara, I've only ever read about them. They're known as the dragon race... not hard to see why.
27f62db35efae85c.Speaker: Welt

034219cfca48c91a.ContentText: Just a heads up — please don't go running off once we're inside.
034219cfca48c91a.Speaker: Qingque

b0dacbc8c22be663.ContentText: You may be the master diviner's guests, but she hates people who don't abide by rules and regulations, oh — and people who ask too many questions, not to mention... *sigh* Please don't push her buttons.
b0dacbc8c22be663.Speaker: Qingque

292019c5097ce67e.ContentText: We're just here for the questioning. We'll leave as soon as it's over.
292019c5097ce67e.Speaker: Welt

78acd04bad513edf.ContentText: Let me guess, the gate isn't working?
78acd04bad513edf.Speaker: March 7th

2481d7f97a7b8a11.ContentText: I don't understand, it's never been locked before... And no one told me to take a key.
2481d7f97a7b8a11.Speaker: Qingque

f2f309f28477416e.ContentText: Hey! I know the food here sucks but that's no reason to shut the gate on our guests!
f2f309f28477416e.Speaker: Qingque

2301ee552c239976.ContentText: Are you really from the Divination Commission?
2301ee552c239976.Speaker: March 7th

78166bea43fa9577.ContentText: No way — she's already demoted me to managing the repository. What else does she want from me?
78166bea43fa9577.Speaker: Qingque

14f44796d1a9c4f5.ContentText: There's no need to panic, okay? This isn't the only entrance into the Divination Commission. I know an emergency access.
14f44796d1a9c4f5.Speaker: Qingque

93010d9f14dc4e64.ContentText: Don't scare me! Master diviner wouldn't let anything bad happen on her watch.
93010d9f14dc4e64.Speaker: Qingque

40db6c7ed972c40d.ContentText: You seem familiar — is this where you come to avoid doing work?
40db6c7ed972c40d.Speaker: March 7th

01f8f9b4c33ea5aa.ContentText: You're pretty sharp. Divination Commission staff call this the "loafing gate."
01f8f9b4c33ea5aa.Speaker: Qingque

335297bbb916c12d.ContentText: When there's nothing to do, we often sneak out from here and spend a few hours lazing around outside.
335297bbb916c12d.Speaker: Qingque

d55d5287bab9797c.ContentText: ...A few hours? *sigh* Do you have any vacancies?
d55d5287bab9797c.Speaker: March 7th

c46e7dc4977a4c9c.ContentText: Ugh, this Stellaron corrosion... what's going on?
c46e7dc4977a4c9c.Speaker: Qingque

1ea98bccc60d8647.ContentText: Great, this gate won't open either. We've kept the master diviner waiting — no doubt she'll blame "unreliable Qingque" for messing up once again...
1ea98bccc60d8647.Speaker: Qingque

4cf64e716bbaf9e6.ContentText: I knew I'd offended that diviner — that's why she sent this girl to help us!
4cf64e716bbaf9e6.Speaker: March 7th

82323bbb8d8fd407.ContentText: Miss Qingque, if you don't mind, may I take a look?
82323bbb8d8fd407.Speaker: Welt

c8fe69d644df73be.ContentText: Huh? Oh, uh... no need. Actually I was just being polite, I don't see why not.
c8fe69d644df73be.Speaker: Qingque

233977de7372ad61.ContentText: Let me show you — this thing is pretty fun.
233977de7372ad61.Speaker: Qingque

756a1de57b60e3e0.ContentText: Wow, you're amazing Mr. Yang! You handled that well for an outsider. I officially hand over the title of "keeper of the loafing gate" to you!
756a1de57b60e3e0.Speaker: Qingque

105825ae8c84b8a8.ContentText: No, I meant Qingque. I didn't expect to see her here during work hours.

647c897127df67e2.ContentText: That's unfair — I'm working hard! Look, these are the guests the master diviner wants to meet.
647c897127df67e2.Speaker: Qingque

4bcc625fc138fbc4.ContentText: Are you talking about us this time?
4bcc625fc138fbc4.Speaker: March 7th

4829817b60632512.ContentText: Yes! The master diviner rarely allows outsiders — she likes her peace and quiet.

ca1df3731d32ae5b.ContentText: If you want to see the master diviner, head straight to the Matrix of Prescience.

4cb9a58d0dc8abe4.ContentText: They're short of hands — the master diviner is run off her feet and the Cloud Knights stationed there are driving away evil spirits. I don't know when they'll be done.

4a43b964535b55f9.ContentText: Hmm. Meta algorithm reading complete, inputting jade abacus for simulation.

d9ff8b5b870f0f96.ContentText: Divination inference complete, hexagrammatic position established. Fluctuation range is between the marsh and water trigrams. Error margin of <unbreak>0.2%</unbreak>.

87ceed547f20e77f.ContentText: The algorithm is correct. So what's interfering with the instruments...?

4424e34fb57caeec.ContentText: I'm sorry, the Cloud Knights have orders from the master diviner to secure the commission's safety. The area up ahead is temporarily closed.

bd3a7c7a38073f49.ContentText: Ugh, can't we run around to them for a change!?
bd3a7c7a38073f49.Speaker: March 7th

9bfabe5087d47e72.ContentText: Hey, Miss Qingque, care to get involved!?
9bfabe5087d47e72.Speaker: March 7th

0f1bfb6a1d3bc02b.ContentText: I—I'm just a diviner, wouldn't I slow you down!? Ugh, okay, here I come...
0f1bfb6a1d3bc02b.Speaker: Qingque

d3a045ea5442825e.ContentText: This is the Matrix of Prescience — a large-scale jade abacus calculation terminal. It's the pride and joy of the Divination Commission.
d3a045ea5442825e.Speaker: Qingque

8e583fa8e7080d03.ContentText: We've heard the term "jade abacus" a few times now. Would you mind explaining what it is, Miss Qingque?
8e583fa8e7080d03.Speaker: Welt

816fe7e34c54c667.ContentText: A jade abacus is just... a jade abacus!
816fe7e34c54c667.Speaker: Qingque

d83079fc01a82300.ContentText: Eh-he, that's a good question, Mr. Yang — it might take me a minute to give you an answer. Let me think...
d83079fc01a82300.Speaker: Qingque

314253f285ba9701.ContentText: The book Glimpses Into the Beyond describes it as "living jade engraved with symbols for divination into the unknown."
314253f285ba9701.Speaker: Qingque

1001d5c8d586904a.ContentText: Just like engraving a seal, the craftsmen of the Xianzhou Artisanship Commission carve faint symbols into pieces of jade, and then insert them into machines to get them to operate according to a certain intention.
1001d5c8d586904a.Speaker: Qingque

918907c091f8da53.ContentText: Some jade abacuses are small enough to fit inside bracelets and jewelry. We put the bigger ones into instruments of calculation so we can simulate the future and learn from the past.
918907c091f8da53.Speaker: Qingque

2734d9db1dc18cbc.ContentText: Take the Matrix of Prescience here as an example. As long as sufficient information is provided, it can answer questions on anything — from the evolution of natural phenomena to the metabolism of living things.
2734d9db1dc18cbc.Speaker: Qingque

9618f3d23f5e014d.ContentText: They say the theory behind the symbols was handed down by Nous, the Wisdomwalker. The principles are so profound that in the Divination Commission only the master diviner truly understands them.
9618f3d23f5e014d.Speaker: Qingque

cdc09c577e082555.ContentText: Seems like it, but "jade abacus" does sound a lot better.
cdc09c577e082555.Speaker: March 7th

af245eb333b717ce.ContentText: Besides, ordinary computers don't have cool backstories. Technology handed down from Nous, huh...
af245eb333b717ce.Speaker: March 7th

30e1c0aaf05742d7.ContentText: Even in Madam Herta's space station, I never saw anything related to Nous.
30e1c0aaf05742d7.Speaker: March 7th

357d0db26324463a.ContentText: It sounds like similar technology. Maybe we'll get a better understanding if we see the manufacturing process with our own eyes.
357d0db26324463a.Speaker: Welt

74d875a88f29f9b6.ContentText: I'm afraid that's impossible — the Artisanship Commission's Hall of Jadeology keeps a close watch over the jade carving process.
74d875a88f29f9b6.Speaker: Qingque

cdea579f133c7b1f.ContentText: But if you're interested, there's a shop selling jade abacus jewelry in Starskiff Haven — I can show you around when I'm free.
cdea579f133c7b1f.Speaker: Qingque

b3d480b40b3f22f7.ContentText: Did you hear that, {NICKNAME}? She said she's taking Mr. Yang jewelry shopping. Hehe, that'll be interesting.
b3d480b40b3f22f7.Speaker: March 7th

401253b4c454879d.ContentText: Anyway, don't dwell on names. As long as the machine works, what does it matter whether it's a "jade abacus" or a "computer"?
401253b4c454879d.Speaker: Qingque

d12e39bda2b813cc.ContentText: Just like today — would it have mattered if "Baique" had brought you here instead of Qingque? It makes no difference at all.
d12e39bda2b813cc.Speaker: Qingque

903fe7a58aeeb6e3.ContentText: We're almost at the Matrix of Prescience core. The master diviner should be waiting.
903fe7a58aeeb6e3.Speaker: Qingque

9fc512d9e65c7982.ContentText: Diviner Fu, how are things progressing?
9fc512d9e65c7982.Speaker: Jing Yuan

361c6d8fbb078555.ContentText: We're fluctuating between the heaven and thunder trigrams. A step forward bridges no distance hence.

fa3630e2151d5da5.ContentText: ...And for those who don't speak Fu Xuan?
fa3630e2151d5da5.Speaker: Jing Yuan

b5521fa9a8ba59e6.ContentText: Ahem... it's an {RUBY_B#Great Woe}utter disaster{RUBY_E#}. How's that for a Divination Commission fortune?

370f81a1655a84cf.ContentText: The Matrix of Prescience has stopped operating and the symbols have dimmed. There are Stellaron spirits wreaking havoc inside the commission and the Cloud Knights are struggling to protect civilians. I want to restore the Matrix of Prescience but I have no forces available.

77c6b3b97cf46888.ContentText: And on top of all that, General, we still have to deal with the Stellaron Hunter you handed to us. If that's not an utter disaster, then I don't know what is.

4f9776e91fc23dd4.ContentText: Haha, but you're Fu Xuan the seer — the boundless omniscient! Bringing luck and avoiding misfortune is your strong suit, isn't it?
4f9776e91fc23dd4.Speaker: Jing Yuan

25964db275069f49.ContentText: You don't need to flatter me, General. It's natural for fortune to fluctuate — there's no escaping it.

7c8cbfcb2a8755fa.ContentText: The Divination Commission simply does its best to uncover the good and the bad and then make the right decisions. We have no magical means to turn the tide.

a9d284f14e55769f.ContentText: And that is precisely why we need you in charge. When it comes to handling clairvoyant Stellaron Hunters, who better than Fu Xuan the seer? As for reinforcements, you didn't think I'd be unprepared, did you?
a9d284f14e55769f.Speaker: Jing Yuan

e2a735ac930b999a.ContentText: Master Diviner, I've brought you the guests, though... it wasn't your order I received.
e2a735ac930b999a.Speaker: Qingque

d201f1c1ab87f3c3.ContentText: *sigh* So, general... even guests are on the payroll these days?

c104d103968f3a99.ContentText: Well, since they're here already, I may as well make use of them.
c104d103968f3a99.Speaker: Jing Yuan

78a811f3856b4a63.ContentText: Entering the Matrix of Prescience without my permission is a breach of protocol...

cb0f5ffa8d882d1a.ContentText: *sigh* ...would be an ungracious thing to say in the present circumstances. I admit, I'm pleasantly surprised to see you here.

287a7e02bed11b1d.ContentText: Qingque is often unreliable, but she comes through for us when the need arises.

b996640b9d34a74c.ContentText: It's nice to have people I can entrust with difficult matters. I'm not like the general, and you don't even belong to my commission — I certainly won't be bossing you around.

3fe3b2150739f977.ContentText: I was waiting for the Matrix of Prescience to resume operations so that you might gain insight into my divination techniques... *sigh* It was rude of me to keep you waiting so long.

52647ee50ab7456e.ContentText: No need for the formalities, we heard what the general said... If you need something from us, just say the word.
52647ee50ab7456e.Speaker: March 7th

bac0501d47b6a56e.ContentText: Very well, then I'll keep this brief. The Divination Commission is currently understaffed. I need your help to restart the Matrix of Prescience's base terminals... and eliminate the Stellaron spirits along the way.

ec4f1e243dbaee11.ContentText: Yes, but you needn't worry. You have my permission.

6a91c42c811ad090.ContentText: Qingque will accompany you. She'll be in charge of restarting the terminal. As for eliminating the spirits...

2fab83298a9c1095.ContentText: Psst, {NICKNAME}... I hath divined our future — we're destined to be errand runners forever...
2fab83298a9c1095.Speaker: March 7th

7e811e2039da94cd.ContentText: Qingque, restarting the base terminals will be your responsibility.

f86a0016d00323ca.ContentText: Oh, and forget everything you saw and heard just now.

03e6f3d6433e5a91.ContentText: Is this what I get? No reward and a bunch of extra work...
03e6f3d6433e5a91.Speaker: Qingque

822999de869e3d10.ContentText: *sigh* The master diviner wants me to restart the Matrix of Prescience's base terminals... and bring you along for the ride.
822999de869e3d10.Speaker: Qingque

577b87c70cbd65f7.ContentText: Ugh, I worked so hard on getting transferred to the repository — it's the best place to slack off and be invisible.
577b87c70cbd65f7.Speaker: Qingque

d25825cf4d3a11ee.ContentText: Now I actually have career prospects... this is terrible.
d25825cf4d3a11ee.Speaker: Qingque

f45963739a6c9575.ContentText: If I screw it up, they might fire me... but if I get it done right, they'll send me more work!
f45963739a6c9575.Speaker: Qingque

7266297bdd9f1ee4.ContentText: I'm gonna ask more questions next time... I could be playing celestial jade right now.
7266297bdd9f1ee4.Speaker: Qingque

dffe097fe151b2f8.ContentText: I'm gonna ask more questions next time... I could be playing celestial jade right now.
dffe097fe151b2f8.Speaker: Qingque

3f47770bd9ef1d18.ContentText: It's been a while, my astral guests.
3f47770bd9ef1d18.Speaker: Jing Yuan

6d713512cd11d5d3.ContentText: Thanks to you, the Luofu has successfully brought Kafka to justice... I am truly grateful — there hadn't been a single Stellaron Hunter arrest since the Interastral Peace Corporation issued their bounty. Hehe, this is a victory for the Xianzhou.
6d713512cd11d5d3.Speaker: Jing Yuan

ebea031b109f8bca.ContentText: How can we compete when our paths diverge? The Alliance has taken an oath to hunt down undying abominations, while the IPC is dedicated to their "preservation." The Alliance and the Corporation occasionally work together, but ultimately, our ways are different.
ebea031b109f8bca.Speaker: Jing Yuan

798c17055f5a0a84.ContentText: Still, it's a pleasure for me to be able to say that the Xianzhou has captured a criminal wanted by the IPC, haha.
798c17055f5a0a84.Speaker: Jing Yuan

cd1f72f628d70332.ContentText: Once this is over and the Stellaron curse has been lifted, the Xianzhou will have no more use for Kafka. If you wish to claim the bounty, feel free to take her to the IPC — the Alliance has no interest in the IPC's reward.
cd1f72f628d70332.Speaker: Jing Yuan

4f12e4ede5a4d97b.ContentText: Blade, on the other hand, is a wanted criminal for the Xianzhou — he must remain with us.
4f12e4ede5a4d97b.Speaker: Jing Yuan

40909726e0f94148.ContentText: Fu Xuan's Matrix of Prescience was able to go one step further than Kafka. To maintain the upper hand, I had to keep it a surprise. I hope this hasn't made you doubt my sincerity?
40909726e0f94148.Speaker: Jing Yuan

62b38ec25088cd1a.ContentText: Next time, maybe ease off on the surprises?
62b38ec25088cd1a.Speaker: March 7th

ee5f311fd909c409.ContentText: I promise to be more transparent next time.
ee5f311fd909c409.Speaker: Jing Yuan

7e1b03170cbd7ea6.ContentText: At present, Kafka has no intention of speaking and the Stellaron Hunters' motives remain unknown. We must rely on the power of the Divination Commission to unearth the truth.
7e1b03170cbd7ea6.Speaker: Jing Yuan

8f822bba918a0b3d.ContentText: "Unearth the truth..." You mean interrogate Kafka with the Matrix of Prescience?
8f822bba918a0b3d.Speaker: Welt

ffd8650ec95da98f.ContentText: Precisely, the Matrix of Prescience is the Divination Commission's ultimate weapon. It was originally used to calculate navigation routes and predict future events...
ffd8650ec95da98f.Speaker: Jing Yuan

3077a7499b557eec.ContentText: ...but the secrets of the Stellaron Hunters cannot remain hidden any longer. I have no choice but to move beyond conventional protocol — we must use divination to ascertain Kafka's intent.
3077a7499b557eec.Speaker: Jing Yuan

9bf5c140ba0ec9bd.ContentText: Everything hinges on restoring the Matrix of Prescience, which is why I would like you to help Diviner Fu complete the setup. I am eternally grateful for your assistance.
9bf5c140ba0ec9bd.Speaker: Jing Yuan

79f1320e8c756dd3.ContentText: I will guard the Matrix core. Once we've restarted the three terminals, Kafka's interrogation can commence.

c098a449fc24b680.ContentText: When we're finished, I'll give you enough time to talk to her.

19aa7e4080372a81.ContentText: Once activated, the Matrix of Prescience analyzes all the information contained in the target — Kafka in this case — and transfers anything pertaining to the Xianzhou into the diviner's consciousness.

bc0870384ebf15de.ContentText: Every one of us walks a Path, moving ceaselessly through time and space, creating all manner of karma in our wake...

69d8123146d159e7.ContentText: How are things progressing? I have yet to sense the connection between the three base terminals.

5c1773e4df25d5d4.ContentText: Divination is no mere conjecture. If the parameters are insufficient and uncertainty surrounds the target, then it is like looking for a needle in a galaxy. Do you understand?

06b62dddd480f5a5.ContentText: Furthermore, interference caused by the Stellaron spirits that infiltrated the Commission has greatly reduced the accuracy of our divination. The margin of error could be as high as <unbreak>0.2%</unbreak>! I cannot tolerate such inaccuracies in our interpretations.

5de639fd029d654d.ContentText: So, have you activated the terminals yet? Why is the Matrix of Prescience still unresponsive?

ef022005e100f0bc.ContentText: There is no "what if"! ...Because nothing remains unforeseen.

59564deb55383e53.ContentText: The Matrix's algorithm is known as "the way of all change" — it accounts for every unpredictability on the Path of all things with uncountable enumerations. When your objects of measure are eras of time and oceans of stars, there are no true variables in the world.

d7cf1bf398c5f44a.ContentText: ...No more questions! Have you activated the three terminals!?

450b895f9b242834.ContentText: Let me see, this is the Temporal Terminal.
450b895f9b242834.Speaker: Qingque

9e53c3561f64ce85.ContentText: "Observes the potential of the temporal plane." They say this terminal is designed to retrieve information related to time.
9e53c3561f64ce85.Speaker: Qingque

209c50988e3f25ef.ContentText: What? You just matched up those symbols. Is that it?
209c50988e3f25ef.Speaker: March 7th

ee811746e5fe90ab.ContentText: The more complex something is, the more important it is to keep it simple. Don't you think?
ee811746e5fe90ab.Speaker: Qingque

9edeeea0d19efa06.ContentText: If it's so simple, why didn't your master diviner come and do it herself?
9edeeea0d19efa06.Speaker: March 7th

54cf39c24423b460.ContentText: Hehe, maybe deep down she just wants to be lazy once in a while — like me!
54cf39c24423b460.Speaker: Qingque

029e93bb3c357de1.ContentText: This must be the Spatial Terminal. They say this terminal is designed to retrieve information related to space. You probably could've guessed that...
029e93bb3c357de1.Speaker: Qingque

583cd311bf255680.ContentText: Let me guess — time, karma... I bet the next terminal is energy-related!
583cd311bf255680.Speaker: March 7th

6f423b76a21b20cf.ContentText: Darn, the Spatial Terminal. They say this terminal is designed to retrieve information related to space. You probably could've guessed that...
6f423b76a21b20cf.Speaker: Qingque

5dc90787b1c73b49.ContentText: This must be the Karma Terminal. They say this terminal is designed to establish the causal relationships between objects.
5dc90787b1c73b49.Speaker: Qingque

b14ead084337ca81.ContentText: Let me guess — time, space... I bet the next terminal is energy-related!
b14ead084337ca81.Speaker: March 7th

aff96d8eb9b50488.ContentText: Darn, the Karma Terminal. They say this terminal is designed to establish causal relationships.
aff96d8eb9b50488.Speaker: Qingque

c1e2bb55c14578bb.ContentText: Phew, we did it. All three terminals activated.
c1e2bb55c14578bb.Speaker: Qingque

3c89495e01947a72.ContentText: Let's go back to the core and report to the master diviner.
3c89495e01947a72.Speaker: Qingque

f90f9a1d48f9fb01.ContentText: Well done, all of you. I can sense the Matrix of Prescience symbols re-illuminating.

9ffdc026c4e78700.ContentText: Now, to interrogate Kafka. Those of you in the core may feel a few... impacts.

f53c8e7196032ee7.ContentText: Is this really necessary? I said I'd cooperate with you.
f53c8e7196032ee7.Speaker: Kafka

9b6d8c151781e65e.ContentText: I have no interest in the words of wanted criminals — especially those skilled in the art of manipulation...

e61b49ba9d43c625.ContentText: ...so say what you will — I'm here to witness the divination of the Matrix of Prescience.

3b7c8fc1a7e8a654.ContentText: The Divination Commission has ways of extracting the truth, and they're far more effective than a conversation.

4bfd208a4b568b80.ContentText: Then please, Master Diviner, witness my destiny.
4bfd208a4b568b80.Speaker: Kafka

4a858e29169d0717.ContentText: ...But, the Matrix of Prescience cannot be wrong.

c9f22043047ee7b0.ContentText: Kafka has nothing to do with the Stellaron, but you... It's you...

4f157a3ac4022e31.ContentText: Ha! Absurd! I'd never have thought it...

2dd5bc1113cf6d3a.ContentText: Ask her yourself — take as long as you wish.

86b0ee0797b33403.ContentText: I must report this to the general immediately. Please excuse me!

522cdfca65f1e017.ContentText: I know you still have many questions for Kafka yourself.
522cdfca65f1e017.Speaker: Welt

13b7718ba7e0e6c2.ContentText: If there are questions you want Kafka to answer, now's the time.
13b7718ba7e0e6c2.Speaker: Welt

c023d59ade638114.ContentText: You don't want to know about her motives and your past?
c023d59ade638114.Speaker: Welt

1a5ee3a30cf6badf.ContentText: There are many things I want to know — but they can wait.
1a5ee3a30cf6badf.Speaker: Welt

c4b401ac8bc91576.ContentText: What will Kafka have to say to you? I'm curious to find out myself.
c4b401ac8bc91576.Speaker: Welt

a88e6c1391b158d5.ContentText: You go, {NICKNAME}. I don't wanna talk to that woman.
a88e6c1391b158d5.Speaker: March 7th

8fcb3faefbee1aae.ContentText: Be careful though. Don't get fooled by her again.
8fcb3faefbee1aae.Speaker: March 7th

1188a1a6b88e45b7.ContentText: Huh, I wouldn't go that far.
1188a1a6b88e45b7.Speaker: March 7th

8b3b539d4e88f38c.ContentText: ...Fool you what now? Ugh, stop it, I'm getting Fu Xuan vibes.
8b3b539d4e88f38c.Speaker: March 7th

fa1f6d947025685d.ContentText: Ha, I'm the queen of vigilance, thank you very much. I don't trust anyone except Dan Heng, Mr. Yang, Himeko, and you.
fa1f6d947025685d.Speaker: March 7th

a01b4f8c41c1565a.ContentText: Be careful. Don't get fooled by her again.
a01b4f8c41c1565a.Speaker: March 7th

66dee70d52372636.ContentText: I'm sorry you have to see me in such a sorry state.
66dee70d52372636.Speaker: Kafka

105474f49d118ea5.ContentText: Fine, if you prefer. Not friends.
105474f49d118ea5.Speaker: Kafka

65b5bafba7b66ed4.ContentText: Concerned about me? I'm fine, the Xianzhou is always courteous with its captives.
65b5bafba7b66ed4.Speaker: Kafka

0f2b48e2f290d74b.ContentText: Really? That's good. I wouldn't want to affect your image of me.
0f2b48e2f290d74b.Speaker: Kafka

b5e356ec6e50aa82.ContentText: I didn't talk to you on the train because I knew you and I would get to talk alone here. Worth waiting for, don't you think? You seem to have a lot to ask me.
b5e356ec6e50aa82.Speaker: Kafka

2348c55748c7c381.ContentText: ...Elio said he foresaw three questions, but they would be the same in essence. If I were to hear one of them, I would then tell you the objective of this trip in all its detail.
2348c55748c7c381.Speaker: Kafka

ca36eb60c4b54f80.ContentText: Since you asked one of the three questions, it means everything is going smoothly. Are you ready to hear my answer?
ca36eb60c4b54f80.Speaker: Kafka

580ee74b139d35ba.ContentText: Xianzhou's Stellaron problem is not directly linked to us. But if you look at it from Elio's perspective, you can't say the Stellaron Hunters are completely innocent. We foresaw all this long ago, but chose to remain indifferent until the time was right for us to get involved.
580ee74b139d35ba.Speaker: Kafka

b0ea19419780fc83.ContentText: Diviner Fu was surprised because she discovered three truths: One, the Stellaron Hunters are not enemies of the Xianzhou. You know this now, though you refused to believe it.
b0ea19419780fc83.Speaker: Kafka

4695eb5c2349afec.ContentText: Two, someone else brought the Stellaron into the Xianzhou and activated it — a result of internal unrest and external aggression. Traitors on the Luofu and enemies from outside want to overthrow the Xianzhou. The master diviner is in a hurry to find the general, presumably to inform him of this fact.
4695eb5c2349afec.Speaker: Kafka

b21405534202fabd.ContentText: However, that's all the master diviner knows, because Elio withheld key pieces of information from me. He foresaw the Divination Commission using the Matrix of Prescience against me. To guard against setbacks, he ensured that I knew only what he wanted the Xianzhou Alliance to know in this moment.
b21405534202fabd.Speaker: Kafka

f301576b59caa48e.ContentText: As for number three, even in their wildest dreams, the Xianzhou Alliance could never have guessed it, haha... If the Stellaron Hunters aren't the cause of all this, then why are Bladie and I even here?
f301576b59caa48e.Speaker: Kafka

f42b4b7d044cb030.ContentText: Sounds ridiculous, doesn't it? It's no wonder Fu Xuan doesn't believe it either. But the Matrix of Prescience doesn't lie. The answer is just that bizarre: The Stellaron Hunters appearing here, Bladie getting arrested, me being lured to the Matrix of Prescience... it was all to bring you, the Astral Express crew, to the Xianzhou.
f42b4b7d044cb030.Speaker: Kafka

794ea574c3cff6b1.ContentText: In the future that Elio chose, the power of The Hunt is indispensable. That's why the Astral Express crew had to come to the Luofu and achieve something important for the Xianzhou. You had to establish a connection with the Alliance...
794ea574c3cff6b1.Speaker: Kafka

e33db708b0cb3432.ContentText: ...and that's why I had to trick you into coming here. I needed you to meet the Luofu's general in person and help him resolve the Stellaron crisis. I needed the Alliance to owe you a favor. That way, in the future, at the most critical moment, the Xianzhou will offer you their help.
e33db708b0cb3432.Speaker: Kafka

653129006d990a7b.ContentText: What do you think? Surprised? The notorious Stellaron Hunters did all that just to make you a hero of the Xianzhou... Quite the plot twist, don't you think?
653129006d990a7b.Speaker: Kafka

e08788aba90bbd2b.ContentText: Like I said: Elio withheld key pieces of information from me. The future holds endless possibilities. Knowing the right thing at the wrong time could spoil all our hard work.
e08788aba90bbd2b.Speaker: Kafka

35e816b2b3af64e2.ContentText: There is only one thing I can tell you about the future: In the best and the worst cases, you will eventually have to face Nanook the Destruction. When that time comes, you will need all the help you can get. It will be a brutal struggle of Aeonic proportions...
35e816b2b3af64e2.Speaker: Kafka

905a34bae271fb05.ContentText: ...proportions that neither you, nor I, nor the Astral Express will ever be able to reach. In the vast majority of futures, that's when destiny ends. But if we follow Elio's plan, there may be a glimmer of hope on the horizon.
905a34bae271fb05.Speaker: Kafka

5daf9ca397ab13d0.ContentText: ...You know, {NICKNAME}, even Aeons can be killed.
5daf9ca397ab13d0.Speaker: Kafka

c01eacca81d1bb1d.ContentText: What the heck is this? It looks like a walking gate...
c01eacca81d1bb1d.Speaker: March 7th

61bb63779df1d079.ContentText: Take it easy, there's nothing supernatural on the Xianzhou. It's an aurumaton — it's guarding the Matrix of Prescience. They're stationed at various strategic places.
61bb63779df1d079.Speaker: Qingque

513a92d36035474c.ContentText: I feel like it needs a sign saying "mortals forbidden" or something... Are you sure it won't fly into a rage if we walk past it?
513a92d36035474c.Speaker: March 7th

f177356ed1a58a16.ContentText: We're here by order of the master diviner to restart the Matrix of Prescience — friends not foes.
f177356ed1a58a16.Speaker: Qingque

9f469767c9b761ff.ContentText: Ah...! March, you should join the Divination Commission! Q—Quick, do something!
9f469767c9b761ff.Speaker: Qingque

914d08cc8cc48e7f.ContentText: Ha, are you kidding? That's not what we want.
914d08cc8cc48e7f.Speaker: Kafka

e37da6d394b2b696.ContentText: I just want to tell stories from the past: stories about Aeons that have fallen.
e37da6d394b2b696.Speaker: Kafka

53c1d4dc60fefcf9.ContentText: That's right, it would be impossible for a human...
53c1d4dc60fefcf9.Speaker: Kafka

d2047ae4a45edf78.ContentText: ...but then I didn't bring humans into the picture, did I?
d2047ae4a45edf78.Speaker: Kafka

5851b8ee0e6415b3.ContentText: Is it so unthinkable? There are many stories about fallen Aeons.
5851b8ee0e6415b3.Speaker: Kafka

d36486f64f0ea2aa.ContentText: Long the Permanence, Idrila the Beauty, Ena the Order, Tayzzyronth the Propagation... Akivili the Trailblaze.
d36486f64f0ea2aa.Speaker: Kafka

646c9ae0a0ac4b64.ContentText: These names were once known all over the universe. Now, they've all but disappeared, leaving behind only masterless Paths.
646c9ae0a0ac4b64.Speaker: Kafka

e65fd4d85d79c1f5.ContentText: Currently, there are three ways an Aeon can perish known to humanity.
e65fd4d85d79c1f5.Speaker: Kafka

5fdc76cef346c492.ContentText: One: Paths with overlapping concepts will eventually collide, and the broader Path will engulf the narrower one. That's how Ena the Order was assimilated by Xipe the Harmony.
5fdc76cef346c492.Speaker: Kafka

e1d0e8c6b0164ddb.ContentText: Two: In a war between Aeons, the stronger side will annihilate the weaker one — that's how Tayzzyronth the Propagation fell. Under the guidance of The Hunt, the Xianzhou Alliance travels the universe exterminating "abominations" cultivated by the Abundance...
e1d0e8c6b0164ddb.Speaker: Kafka

280b1b021f685828.ContentText: ...so the Xianzhou too are engaged in this process.
280b1b021f685828.Speaker: Kafka

811d34f8a37b3969.ContentText: As far as I know, the predecessors of the Alliance were the Elixir Seekers. They searched for Yaoshi and longed for the blessing of immortality. When they eventually found the Aeon, they received a blessing that did indeed prevent death — the Ambrosial Arbor.
811d34f8a37b3969.Speaker: Kafka

10d906efd72ef306.ContentText: ...But immortality turned out to be a curse for the Xianzhou. That's when The Hunt appeared — firing an arrow and felling the Ambrosial Arbor. Ever since, the Alliance has followed The Hunt in pursuit of Yaoshi, erasing the curse of immortality from the universe along the way.
10d906efd72ef306.Speaker: Kafka

929668e793cf1eef.ContentText: After the disappearance of Long the Permanence, Tayzzyronth divided the Aeon's Path. In the process, Tayzzyronth became a new Aeon known as the Propagation. My understanding is that Tayzzyronth, or "Imperator Insectorum" to some, didn't last long...
929668e793cf1eef.Speaker: Kafka

c334ab2265c5404c.ContentText: ...When the Swarm Disaster began to take hold, Tayzzyronth was attacked and killed by multiple Aeons.
c334ab2265c5404c.Speaker: Kafka

3218c5198761b41d.ContentText: I don't know. Akivili's disappearance was very mysterious. {RUBY_B#Aeon of Erudition}Nous{RUBY_E#} is probably the only one that can answer that question. After all, {RUBY_B#Title of Nous}Droidhead{RUBY_E#} knows everything.
3218c5198761b41d.Speaker: Kafka

359ee3652905a219.ContentText: What do you think, {NICKNAME}? Fascinating stories, no?
359ee3652905a219.Speaker: Kafka

43d1b6bd696f1be4.ContentText: They're the kind of stories that folks on the straight and narrow would never tell you.
43d1b6bd696f1be4.Speaker: Kafka

4db4018539a472a3.ContentText: Did Kafka escape? Argh, how are we gonna explain this to the master diviner!?
4db4018539a472a3.Speaker: March 7th

0f088b7b435d3031.ContentText: If what she said is true, we won't have to explain anything...
0f088b7b435d3031.Speaker: playerboy

4923dd738c3eeca9.ContentText: Wasn't this the dead tree Qingque showed us earlier? How did it grow all of a sudden?
4923dd738c3eeca9.Speaker: March 7th

81cd9f6bf46b1a92.ContentText: Amazing, absolutely amazing! Even the long-lived might not witness something like this in their lifetime! I'm so lucky!
81cd9f6bf46b1a92.Speaker: Tingyun

31922fb5553231d9.ContentText: Such extraordinary energy... It's the Stellaron.
31922fb5553231d9.Speaker: Welt

bb82c1893d861287.ContentText: Mr. Yang, do you mean... the Stellaron is making the Ambrosial Arbor grow?
bb82c1893d861287.Speaker: March 7th

afd4d5bd98921458.ContentText: Yes, the Stellaron the Cloud Knights are searching for must be causing this anomaly!
afd4d5bd98921458.Speaker: Welt

40a440451beefd29.ContentText: Unless Kafka deceived the Matrix of Prescience...

9ca64a37eeaa1043.ContentText: Stay calm, Diviner Fu, the Matrix of Prescience does not lie. The logic you have laid out concerning Kafka makes sense — it has helped me to fill in another piece of the puzzle.
9ca64a37eeaa1043.Speaker: Jing Yuan

32521c527a72c2ac.ContentText: I agree there is a hostile external force at work on the Luofu. The Stellaron didn't appear out of thin air — someone managed to sneak it onto the ship. As for the culprits behind the Luofu's internal strife, I believe we are dealing with the so-called Disciples of Sanctus Medicus — that shadowy organization of the Denizens of Abundance.
32521c527a72c2ac.Speaker: Jing Yuan

d060123c4fa2b7c6.ContentText: You... General, when did you have these suspicions?

e2248861b3d8944e.ContentText: The moment the planter of the Stellaron revealed themself. The Xianzhou has the blessing of the Reignbow Arbiter — only another Aeon's Emanator would be capable of sneaking onto this ship without my knowing. We are dealing with an external threat.
e2248861b3d8944e.Speaker: Jing Yuan

63e1ea597078bf57.ContentText: The Stellaron corrosion continues to flood into the ship, and yet it bypassed both the Seat of Divine Foresight and The Shackling Prison... there is forethought here — our enemy must have had access to Luofu intelligence for things to unfold in this way. It is evident now...
63e1ea597078bf57.Speaker: Jing Yuan

e34e7c735e5a9ff0.ContentText: The Stellaron Hunters aren't the ones behind the curtain... No, as soon as I set eyes on Blade, it was clear to me. But why is he here, and why did he draw the Astral Express? ...That piece of the puzzle still eludes me.
e34e7c735e5a9ff0.Speaker: Jing Yuan

650bd66b1afabd71.ContentText: Nevertheless, Lady Fu, your intel means the puzzle is more complete than it was before, haha. These Stellaron Hunters are a captivating group — such lengths to get the Xianzhou and the Express onto the same track. Who would've believed it?
650bd66b1afabd71.Speaker: Jing Yuan

cefae7ff07f5faf2.ContentText: We were in need of extra hands, and extra hands I have provided — no need to thank me.
cefae7ff07f5faf2.Speaker: Jing Yuan

558374340f260baf.ContentText: General, we must retain all urgency! The Ambrosial Arbor...

545459f6c7a6f93b.ContentText: It's the Stellaron. No need to search high and low — the traitors have planted it in the Ambrosial Arbor's delve, thereby causing the tree to grow once again. The Disciples of Sanctus Medicus couldn't hold off any longer.
545459f6c7a6f93b.Speaker: Jing Yuan

23f3a62d19200f24.ContentText: Every crisis is a turning point. A problem is easier to resolve when you know where it lies.

a5e7e024d5ef38b5.ContentText: ...Am I coming up with the plan again?

c2e0460c75ae3259.ContentText: Of course, I'm sure you have a countermeasure at the ready, Master Diviner.
c2e0460c75ae3259.Speaker: Jing Yuan

22ca821b6e9f6552.ContentText: From my perspective, convening the Cloud Knights is our immediate priority. We must head into the roots of the Ambrosial Arbor, expel the Stellaron spirits, and prevent the Arbor's resurrection.

4122ec14b90e14d8.ContentText: Mhmm, as ever the master diviner's omniscia provides the fastest solution. However, sometimes speed is not everything. I have known the Stellaron's location for a while now, so why have I held back our forces?
4122ec14b90e14d8.Speaker: Jing Yuan

56021803ac4515f6.ContentText: Haha, pulling up the grass requires removing the roots. The Disciples of Sanctus Medicus have chosen to make their move now, which means the Cloud Knights have the situation under control and the traitors have run out of patience. Now is the time to capture them all in one fell swoop.
56021803ac4515f6.Speaker: Jing Yuan

b57570877ec0fed1.ContentText: You've been sitting on that this whole time? How will you justify the losses if something goes wrong, General!?

ff77a5eaf71f7e65.ContentText: Please, Lady Fu, I still have forces to deploy.
ff77a5eaf71f7e65.Speaker: Jing Yuan

5171ebf1fedf8194.ContentText: We were in need of extra hands, and the Stellaron Hunters were kind enough to bring us together with the Astral Express — how could I look the other way.
5171ebf1fedf8194.Speaker: Jing Yuan

62709f92b97324fe.ContentText: That massive tree has suddenly sprung to life!
62709f92b97324fe.Speaker: March 7th

bcabad9ae8065da1.ContentText: The general's smiling again — definitely errands...
bcabad9ae8065da1.Speaker: March 7th

543b1419081d2e3f.ContentText: It's my fault. I had higher expectations of the general...

a66bb220100b5756.ContentText: Please! We can't keep getting them to do everything for us! Since when did we run out of people on the Luofu?

16afe028dc579cb9.ContentText: You... Why are you staring at me?

918c86311cd45638.ContentText: Do I need to remind you, general, that the Ambrosial Arbor's access point is a closley guarded secret? Allowing outworlders would be—

fe4d79d94c9d130b.ContentText: A violation of the rules and regulations. I would like to remind you, Lady Fu, that the Xianzhou comes before its rules and regulations — all the more so in times of crisis.
fe4d79d94c9d130b.Speaker: Jing Yuan

a50587e2c85ce742.ContentText: As such, I am about to make a decision that runs counter to those rules and regulations. Oh, uh — decisions, plural. Haha, what a rare pleasure.
a50587e2c85ce742.Speaker: Jing Yuan

0f04f64d9ff0d741.ContentText: Lady Fu, I hereby issue you with the military tally — the Cloud Knights will be under your control. You will act in concert with the other forces in the approach to the Ambrosial Arbor through the Alchemy Commission delve.
0f04f64d9ff0d741.Speaker: Jing Yuan

b5f31c571bde6340.ContentText: You've been eager to discover for yourself what it is to be a general, have you not?
b5f31c571bde6340.Speaker: Jing Yuan

f57021ff2c24dba2.ContentText: You've never given me the opportunity, and now suddenly... Understood, as you wish.

5028cbd6f7d55e24.ContentText: As for our Astral friends... I hereby formally welcome you all to join our operation to seal the Stellaron.
5028cbd6f7d55e24.Speaker: Jing Yuan

d21d05ceb4a487b5.ContentText: Lady Fu will deploy the Cloud Knights, but I would like you to set off in advance. Take a shortcut through the Artisanship Commission and convene with Lady Fu further down the line.
d21d05ceb4a487b5.Speaker: Jing Yuan

4effa7c54d54b452.ContentText: This is no order, honored guests. I am merely stating what needs to be done, should you wish to help us.
4effa7c54d54b452.Speaker: Jing Yuan

124353a1f2d97020.ContentText: You've never really seen us as outsiders, huh.
124353a1f2d97020.Speaker: March 7th

d0f319bd0a22899b.ContentText: This is no errand, honored guests. I am merely stating what needs to be done, should you wish to help us.
d0f319bd0a22899b.Speaker: Jing Yuan

20596168f7297cf3.ContentText: You've never really seen us as outsiders, huh.
20596168f7297cf3.Speaker: March 7th

172e4bf8797647e8.ContentText: Understood, understood, worry not — I know how to repay a favor.
172e4bf8797647e8.Speaker: Jing Yuan

6cd965eefaa44c29.ContentText: The Xianzhou has met with a dramatic chain of events, and each of you has chosen to stand by us. Your fearlessness moves me.
6cd965eefaa44c29.Speaker: Jing Yuan

fc9537e62e5806c6.ContentText: Nevertheless, the enemy is upon us and time is of the essence — let us not allow monetary affairs to cast a shadow over more pressing matters.
fc9537e62e5806c6.Speaker: Jing Yuan

81b899ddeddb5aaf.ContentText: Once catastrophe has been averted, we shall discuss this in greater detail.
81b899ddeddb5aaf.Speaker: Jing Yuan

aef0dc18bcee530c.ContentText: Miss Tingyun, I would like you to continue to serve as a guide for our Astral friends.
aef0dc18bcee530c.Speaker: Jing Yuan

1dd4f60fde8ac7dd.ContentText: I have requested that the master diviner prepare a starskiff and open a way through the shortcut.
1dd4f60fde8ac7dd.Speaker: Jing Yuan

cfaab9a20319aceb.ContentText: The Alchemy Commission and Scalegorge Waterscape delves are adjacent to the Ambrosial Arbor's seal. I'd like you to investigate these places.
cfaab9a20319aceb.Speaker: Jing Yuan

21a547a90ada2aa2.ContentText: It is an ancient artifact that was planted on the Xianzhou Luofu by Yaoshi, the Aeon of Abundance. It has the power to shape life and subdue death at will.
21a547a90ada2aa2.Speaker: Jing Yuan

7c1665b1399b0ec5.ContentText: The ancestors of the Luofu people consumed the fruits of the Ambrosial Arbor and gained endless lifespans — thus becoming long-life species.
7c1665b1399b0ec5.Speaker: Jing Yuan

22ce2bbab55a6874.ContentText: Yes... it was also the bane of everything to come.
22ce2bbab55a6874.Speaker: Jing Yuan

807039c2e6d27d3f.ContentText: As outsiders, you are unfamiliar with the history of the Xianzhou. I cannot blame you for asking a question like this. Let me tell you a story.
807039c2e6d27d3f.Speaker: Jing Yuan

d2a0d7c9eec0a656.ContentText: Long ago, before the Xianzhou took to the skies, our ancestors lived on the surface of a planet. Like all of you, the Xianzhou people at that time were a mortal species with a lifespan of fewer than <unbreak>100</unbreak> years.
d2a0d7c9eec0a656.Speaker: Jing Yuan

42e505d2bb0cebb9.ContentText: There was a time when the ruling emperor could not bear his temporary existence, or the thought of his life's achievements being lost to another after his death. He became fixated on acquiring an elixir of immortality, and focused his power on constructing a fleet of nine ships. These ships would voyage into deep space, where traces of gods were rumored to exist...
42e505d2bb0cebb9.Speaker: Jing Yuan

bdc1abdafb89a538.ContentText: Yes, and no. He succeeded because, after an arduous journey, the nine ships eventually witnessed the manifestation of a god — Yaoshi's appearance provided for all manner of unfathomable celestial blessings... However, he failed because the fleet has been lost ever since, and has never been able to return to its home planet.
bdc1abdafb89a538.Speaker: Jing Yuan

5cbab147786d1dbf.ContentText: That doesn't sound so bad. The Xianzhou people went on a great adventure and got what they wanted in the end, right?
5cbab147786d1dbf.Speaker: March 7th

440ee9e4658edc73.ContentText: Oh...? Our ancestors once thought so too, but the miracle of longevity was nothing more than a vain dream.
440ee9e4658edc73.Speaker: Jing Yuan

c287b7eca91c926a.ContentText: Take the Luofu, for example — immortality seemed like a beautiful thing. But what followed was population expansion and diminishing resources. In the struggle for survival, the immortals lost their humanity and degenerated into mere beasts.
c287b7eca91c926a.Speaker: Jing Yuan

356733e07507e676.ContentText: After paying the price with blood and tears, the Luofu people finally understood that immortality was not a free blessing, but the beginning of a cruel ordeal.
356733e07507e676.Speaker: Jing Yuan

8b1215d6f6358bdf.ContentText: In the eras that followed, other beings that had likewise received Yaoshi's blessings repeatedly attacked the Xianzhou in an attempt to take the sacred artifact as their own. Countless atrocities were committed as a result.
8b1215d6f6358bdf.Speaker: Jing Yuan

208807f181d0e558.ContentText: Many Xianzhou comrades who were lucky enough to survive the wars became stricken with mara — a condition that immortals are susceptible to.
208807f181d0e558.Speaker: Jing Yuan

a24561e93e7102d9.ContentText: Had it not been for the enlightenment and protection of the {RUBY_B#Lan}Reignbow Arbiter{RUBY_E#}, the Xianzhou Alliance you see today would never have existed.
a24561e93e7102d9.Speaker: Jing Yuan
