846aa3bf911fb7c2.ContentText: At this point in the story, I assume you understand the disasters that the resurrection of the Ambrosial Arbor might bring about?
846aa3bf911fb7c2.Speaker: Jing Yuan

ddb295b6155fe38b.ContentText: Thousands of years have passed since the Reignbow Arbiter felled the Ambrosial Arbor.
ddb295b6155fe38b.Speaker: Jing Yuan

30d707cec7a25214.ContentText: Most in the Xianzhou regard the Arbor as nothing more than the stump of a dead tree... Only those familiar with our history and the ancient texts know of its origin.
30d707cec7a25214.Speaker: Jing Yuan

dedcc1c7bfe24ee5.ContentText: Our ancestors placed the stump in full view of the people precisely to make it seem unimportant, but in fact, they sealed it behind layers upon layers of delve enchantment. Even if one travels toward the Ambrosial Arbor, one will never reach it.
dedcc1c7bfe24ee5.Speaker: Jing Yuan

942f04223a206e1e.ContentText: Someone brought a Stellaron into the Xianzhou and planted it among the roots of the Ambrosial Arbor. They wish to resurrect it and achieve their hidden goal through external aggression.
942f04223a206e1e.Speaker: Jing Yuan

41fda61b3230ff27.ContentText: In my opinion, the force that provided the Stellaron and the force that activated it have different objectives.
41fda61b3230ff27.Speaker: Jing Yuan

b18221ab7d675835.ContentText: I have asked Fu Xuan to open a shortcut to the Divination Commission for you.
b18221ab7d675835.Speaker: Jing Yuan

4fe140075ae5bfc5.ContentText: A step forward bridges no distance hence... Ugh, the hexagram was right.

f6990610d6a51974.ContentText: The {RUBY_B#Relic of the Abundance}Ambrosial Arbor{RUBY_E#} was felled thousands of years ago... now it returns to life. The future of Xianzhou is difficult to divine.

9ed22f713ab732ea.ContentText: Huh? She's not angry? *sigh* Is there anyone that isn't two steps ahead of us around here?
9ed22f713ab732ea.Speaker: March 7th

59f102644923357e.ContentText: Pursuing Kafka is a waste of time and effort — The Matrix of Prescience informed me of her innocence. Our priority is the Ambrosial Arbor.

b5ef62b7d523454e.ContentText: From the time the Stellaron corrosion began to spread until now, the only reports we've received on the Alchemy Commission have come from alchemists and doctors stationed in other delves.

37acc4af91c37057.ContentText: The Alchemy Commission is where the Xianzhou's medical research and production take place. However, due to its proximity to the Ambrosial Arbor's seal, I'm afraid the Stellaron spirits may have plunged it into a deeper crisis than we first feared.

b71956c97fa550f0.ContentText: To make matters worse, the general suspects there are traitors in the Alchemy Commission. The self-proclaimed Disciples of Sanctus Medicus have been plotting this for a long time — now they're using the location to their advantage. I must take action as soon as possible.

38d6b0c13c456e71.ContentText: He really is a delegator at heart, isn't he... There isn't much distance between the Artisanship and Alchemy Commissions — I'm afraid the former is likely also facing imminent catastrophe.

1afbf2978ef4237a.ContentText: The starskiff is ready — I will lead the way.

865dc37da1d0a164.ContentText: *sigh* I thought I might be relieved of my guiding duties once the Divination Commission affair was over...
865dc37da1d0a164.Speaker: Tingyun

b487918494f374ef.ContentText: Who would've thought the general would take such a liking to you? I suppose I must accompany you further... Fate can be so unpredictable.
b487918494f374ef.Speaker: Tingyun

32ca2f8cd8534906.ContentText: You have quite the sense of humor, benefactors... I've encountered more trouble with you than I have with the merchant fleet in ten years.
32ca2f8cd8534906.Speaker: Tingyun

a30e5d95a49f8f69.ContentText: I just hope everything is smooth-sailing from now on — please look after me.
a30e5d95a49f8f69.Speaker: Tingyun

49fc439f208cae28.ContentText: I understand. The Luofu is in danger, and members of the six commissions should stand united.
49fc439f208cae28.Speaker: Tingyun

a43781a74f203963.ContentText: *sigh* You did save my life at Cloudford... Consider this my returning the favor.
a43781a74f203963.Speaker: Tingyun

f69ecfae573d1c1a.ContentText: The general said there are traitors aboard the ship.
f69ecfae573d1c1a.Speaker: Tingyun

87a6e398a8dac4d4.ContentText: But only someone from the six commissions could bring the Stellaron into the Xianzhou undetected, let alone plant it within the Ambrosial Arbor...
87a6e398a8dac4d4.Speaker: Tingyun

32459d919e35e4a5.ContentText: I am saying nothing of the sort, just raising a doubt, that's all. Please be careful, benefactors...
32459d919e35e4a5.Speaker: Tingyun

d7d47f896f750082.ContentText: Y—You want to leave straight away? Let me pack some things. I'll be right there.
d7d47f896f750082.Speaker: Tingyun

4082c7a8f01806bc.ContentText: Phew, that was scary. I was having a snack in the repository when the Ambrosial Arbor started to grow — the trunk suddenly shot right up into the sky. So the legends were right all along...
4082c7a8f01806bc.Speaker: Qingque

aad6f58e644f5453.ContentText: Such is life, full of surprises. That's why you gotta seize any opportunity to take a break — who knows when trouble will come knocking at your door.
aad6f58e644f5453.Speaker: Qingque

294fc396a7dd0a4a.ContentText: It'll be fine. Even if the sky collapses, we have the master diviner with us to hold it up. Oh, and now we have the general here too.
294fc396a7dd0a4a.Speaker: Qingque

4a9041c058111101.ContentText: What do subordinates like us have to panic about? Let the big shots worry about the big events. That's the secret to happiness.
4a9041c058111101.Speaker: Qingque

f17e67c9d3fe9d00.ContentText: She did — she saw me on her way over. She told me to go to the repository and read up on anything related to the Ambrosial Arbor.
f17e67c9d3fe9d00.Speaker: Qingque

9abdd5b11eab4067.ContentText: A simple task like that is only fifteen minutes' work for me.
9abdd5b11eab4067.Speaker: Qingque

ecee33b82698fc5e.ContentText: I heard people say even the general has to watch his manners when asking you for help — pretty impressive! I don't have much to offer you... Uh, here! Take this book. It's the thought that counts!
ecee33b82698fc5e.Speaker: Qingque

379bf15dac5adc25.ContentText: I was gonna wait for the master diviner to get off work so I could show you around and teach Mr. Yang how to play celestial jade.
379bf15dac5adc25.Speaker: Qingque

e16393c48e964213.ContentText: Your kindness is much appreciated, Miss Qingque. As for celestial jade, we'll have to leave it for next time.
e16393c48e964213.Speaker: Welt

8cfd3764b6ffbc54.ContentText: I know, I know, you've got an important task ahead... sorry to keep you. Priorities are priorities.
8cfd3764b6ffbc54.Speaker: Qingque

1a48d3d46913f20e.ContentText: Well then, get back safely. Remember to come find me in Exalting Sanctum!
1a48d3d46913f20e.Speaker: Qingque

061cf6a89bbd73ac.ContentText: I still have important tasks from the general to attend to. Go carefully, all of you.

aeeb4f4e805b46d6.ContentText: Wait, wait! Master Diviner, can you divine our fortunes for us? Is there anything we need to watch out for?
aeeb4f4e805b46d6.Speaker: March 7th

53c152760d272766.ContentText: My omniscia has seen that your journey will be auspicious — everything will proceed smoothly.

5d02af1f1a7745b6.ContentText: A—Are you sure? You don't need to use a crazy device or do more finger-counting?
5d02af1f1a7745b6.Speaker: March 7th

708d262a1588fe72.ContentText: Well said, {NICKNAME}. Thank you for your assurance, Master Diviner. Onward.
708d262a1588fe72.Speaker: Welt

16b395daa5c46c63.ContentText: {NICKNAME}, where are you going? The starskiff is ahead of us — follow my lead.

d57eb46dc9c7524f.ContentText: What's the delay? If you're worried about the road ahead, I've already told you — the hexagram indicates an auspicious result.

47a670837adef18d.ContentText: Don't believe me? Fine. Fate is fickle — better to believe in yourself than look to the sky.

4aec98745e792aa3.ContentText: Huh? Look at all the people gathered here... Not a good day for commuting on the Luofu.
4aec98745e792aa3.Speaker: Tingyun

8873ea8c735dab8c.ContentText: The Artisanship Commission delve should have suspended operations after the Stellaron corrosion began. Why haven't these people taken starskiffs to safety?
8873ea8c735dab8c.Speaker: Tingyun

89cb24266b430e7e.ContentText: Maybe the Artisanship Commission are just more dedicated to their work? The Divination Commission's diviners aren't exactly a hard act to follow...
89cb24266b430e7e.Speaker: March 7th

4efb64520ec5aabd.ContentText: *sigh* At the end of the day, work is work — you need it to live. Y'know March, adults forget what "relaxation" means after a certain age, hehe...
4efb64520ec5aabd.Speaker: Welt

e406322e99d64721.ContentText: Sounds like you're speaking from experience...
e406322e99d64721.Speaker: March 7th

f4f64649e05fe5ba.ContentText: Just speaking from the heart, that's all.
f4f64649e05fe5ba.Speaker: Welt

399dd835a4a959a0.ContentText: I think they call that "complaining from the heart."
399dd835a4a959a0.Speaker: March 7th

f758048394fa205d.ContentText: Are any of the Paths in this world easy to tread?
f758048394fa205d.Speaker: Tingyun

8d03d69e20c2d2ae.ContentText: That's it~! First you arrive out of the blue, then the general recruits you to the cause — it's like the stories where imperial heroes bring salvation to the world.
8d03d69e20c2d2ae.Speaker: Tingyun

0ec13895dd62fdb7.ContentText: Still, it doesn't look like they're rolling out the red carpet... We might be getting ahead of ourselves.
0ec13895dd62fdb7.Speaker: Tingyun

39704aad574588d0.ContentText: The Artisanship Commission is full of workshops, buildings, state-of-the-art mechanisms, and craftsmen designing brand-new concepts.
39704aad574588d0.Speaker: Tingyun

bb2da4a513e5a651.ContentText: Periodically stirring up trouble is part of their tradition... entire buildings vanishing into thin air, puppet riots — you get the picture.
bb2da4a513e5a651.Speaker: Tingyun

2882b63903c40cd2.ContentText: It seems like the craftsmen are too afraid to go in, but they have nowhere to run to either. We should take care, benefactors — something terrible must have happened.
2882b63903c40cd2.Speaker: Tingyun

4dd178406443ac83.ContentText: Either way, we'll have to go in. Let's ask around first.
4dd178406443ac83.Speaker: Welt

cd6abe383d09d8b4.ContentText: *gasp* Are you guys Cloud Knights? Are you here to save us?

26b2f82ec14a7f05.ContentText: ...Your clothes. *sigh* I knew I was getting ahead of myself — you're just tourists.

79d66a47738b3a96.ContentText: Sorry this crisis came during your trip. *sigh* I'm sorry it came at all...

47b3e5fca8f96673.ContentText: Yeah, you just need to tell us what the trouble is, hehe~ General Jing Yuan pulled out all the stops to get us here — you can trust us.
47b3e5fca8f96673.Speaker: March 7th

27a5cc406b9d127f.ContentText: ...You mean the general invited you? Is that a joke? The Luofu has the Cloud Knights — why would he send outsiders?

685d3e5883376378.ContentText: There's been a serious incident in the Artisanship Commission — nobody's in the mood for jokes, miss.

9112aa7bd10f6030.ContentText: You misunderstand, young sir — we genuinely want to help. Can you tell us what happened here?
9112aa7bd10f6030.Speaker: Welt

ea1a98503fd780f9.ContentText: Waiting around, that's what. We ran away, it was way too dangerous in there.

69bd4a6a2de726aa.ContentText: Please, if you plan on living a little longer, don't go in there.

eeaa7c61ed3c99b3.ContentText: There's been some kind of botanical disaster — it was like an ornamental tree somewhere suddenly started to grow. There were branches so thick you couldn't put your arms around them! It spread everywhere — the whole Commission is being destroyed.

5ce0a8fcfe9ec221.ContentText: I don't get it, the Artisanship Commission focuses on the mechanical — we've got nothing to do with hydroponics or accelerated growth... Where did that thing come from?

b2784f040971d4a0.ContentText: The worst thing is... my master is still inside!

5bb7bceb541e7707.ContentText: Master Gongshu is the most experienced craftsman in the Artisanship Commission's smelting works — he's in charge of our research project.

02a59af4d00b897e.ContentText: When the incident happened, he dragged me, Ziming, and Yunche to safety... But then he turned around and ran back in.

6cf9c8da4442d6ed.ContentText: I need to wait here for the Cloud Knights so I can tell them to rescue him.

017baee325898b5c.ContentText: Is research data more important than life?

c08e5ccb0dc1e173.ContentText: That's not how it works — the research comes first here.

3f072ad3514f976a.ContentText: We didn't have time — we were scrambling for our lives! If I had an extra pair of arms, maybe I could've tried.

bf6478b9633ff0b9.ContentText: I just heard him shout "It's gone! We lost the furnace!" By the time we realized, he'd already vanished.

3a411ec1a3bcaa38.ContentText: Anyway... you said you're here to help us, right?

f41f520bdf7a5bed.ContentText: You don't have to believe us — the Astral Express doesn't shout about its achievements! We'll look for your master.
f41f520bdf7a5bed.Speaker: March 7th

fd8992f3395f636c.ContentText: In that case, take this jade seal with you.

6907acea5818ae3d.ContentText: If you find my master, please bring him out safe and sound! If anything happens to him...

8fe8b66a268d548e.ContentText: Don't worry, young sir. Your master's safety is our—
8fe8b66a268d548e.Speaker: Welt

0f028ee229b2e93a.ContentText: None of us will be able to graduate this year...

88a13814c0c1105c.ContentText: Let's go, I think this conversation's run its course...
88a13814c0c1105c.Speaker: March 7th

841535db2a3d073f.ContentText: "Botanical disaster"? It must be the Ambrosial Arbor...
841535db2a3d073f.Speaker: March 7th

d645d3e2322b3056.ContentText: ...but what about the "furnace" his master mentioned?
d645d3e2322b3056.Speaker: March 7th

691f9a34e2a0d091.ContentText: It's no ordinary tree — the branches felt tough as metal...

3790cc2dec9c87ee.ContentText: Yunche, have you ever seen material like that before?

7bfd4b27686ecc77.ContentText: What if I have — you gonna go get a sample for me?

bcb42e25ac1fdbf7.ContentText: I was thinking about it, yeah. Isn't it just an ornamental tree?

a6ab5d3ee24fa390.ContentText: Have you ever seen an ornamental tree move? Have you ever seen one bore through the ground like that?

3666e01c421a89cc.ContentText: So what if it moves? I just need to run over and saw off a sample. It can't grow faster than I can run, right?

2868b7369eefc111.ContentText: Sure, go ahead. Here's a crowbar and a saw! Don't say I didn't warn you when the Cloud Knights have to scrape you off the walls.

a54afa1363b6fd9d.ContentText: Well, I... I—I've been feeling a bit under the weather lately. *cough* Yunche, you're the most agile person on the materials team! When it comes to operational efficiency—

0728f90ceebd001a.ContentText: Under the weather!? How convenient. As for me — I'd rather stay alive, thanks!

e166c72841f4a89c.ContentText: As expected, the divination was correct.

a3de75102d0e74b3.ContentText: If I hadn't repaired the Shifting Screen today we'd all have been trapped — we'd be fertilizer by now.

1ef143186db901aa.ContentText: Still, the teleportation range wasn't enough...

63923851e440ba50.ContentText: *sigh* Another locked gate. Time for the old dilemma — break in or climb over?
63923851e440ba50.Speaker: March 7th

aa762830c091e21b.ContentText: A warm reminder, benefactors, that the Artisanship Commission is as important to the Xianzhou as the Divination Commission.
aa762830c091e21b.Speaker: Tingyun

1c681446717c4439.ContentText: Our law states that trespassing into the Artisanship Commission can result in a prison sentence of between <unbreak>300</unbreak> to <unbreak>500</unbreak> years... Serious violations may result in exile on a barren planet, thousands of light-years away...
1c681446717c4439.Speaker: Tingyun

9744ba4eb1f8fdb8.ContentText: Yes, we do. Still, the Artisanship Commission is filled with security mechanisms. Even the general won't be able to save us in time if we get trapped.
9744ba4eb1f8fdb8.Speaker: Tingyun

e54f9249a0e0d7d1.ContentText: ...You gonna be this enthusiastic when it's jail-sentencing time?
e54f9249a0e0d7d1.Speaker: March 7th

59f348369d41d5bf.ContentText: I'm not trying to scare you — I'm simply suggesting you ask the craftsmen to see if they can provide an insider like Qingque to guide you.
59f348369d41d5bf.Speaker: Tingyun

ac23e63da52ffed6.ContentText: It seems more than a little reckless to charge in when we don't know what's ahead of us.
ac23e63da52ffed6.Speaker: Tingyun

2c91ba16b410eb84.ContentText: The Stellaron facilitated the resurrection of the Ambrosial Arbor...
2c91ba16b410eb84.Speaker: Welt

b1eaf40e73c18b15.ContentText: The severity of the corrosion becomes worse as it grows.
b1eaf40e73c18b15.Speaker: Welt

55997424f00a6745.ContentText: *sigh* Look, the roots are coming up through the ground. I'm afraid we've got some gardening work to do.
55997424f00a6745.Speaker: Tingyun

bdd16b2a54134148.ContentText: Upon Commission grounds your feet do tread! Leave from whence you came or soon be dead! Deaaaad!!!

7d1939123c77a98f.ContentText: Stay away! If you come any further, I'll not spare you!

b725c442adbe042e.ContentText: Hold on, let us explain! We're not—
b725c442adbe042e.Speaker: March 7th

fb5bd71a7fd77ea6.ContentText: What excuses do you have? Surprise me! Just passing by? Stumbled in? Door wide open? HMM?

7c2625009224aa15.ContentText: Within Commission grounds today was sewn, an evil spun by hands unseen, unknown! No longer!

f6cceb08d2740a84.ContentText: If the security mechanisms didn't teach you a lesson, these robots will!

cc53b8f158bed97b.ContentText: Golden Cloud Toad! Illumination Dragonfish! ...Are you alright? Wake up! I raised you like my own flesh and blood...

4a6046f99bf10332.ContentText: Did you really have to destroy my little friends? I want compensation!

38e3263a6a5e2f37.ContentText: You didn't want to listen to us! We were here to rescue you and you started a fight for no reason!
38e3263a6a5e2f37.Speaker: March 7th

e0713565aef5c5b1.ContentText: How do you know my name, child?

5b4ddb6def727f30.ContentText: Does the reputation of Gongshu Liang, "the smelter extraordinaire," precede one?

b295d8310058dd0c.ContentText: This guy is pretty deluded for a "master..."
b295d8310058dd0c.Speaker: March 7th

ef36132d265fb2ea.ContentText: Hmph! Did those hopeless brats send you here? It won't work! They abandoned the Commission's precious assets and ran off to save their own little skins!

70bd4524e2d1fcf3.ContentText: Even if you rescue me, it won't change anything — all of them will fail their internships!

2179f22821f551dd.ContentText: ...It's not like that. You're making this too complicated...
2179f22821f551dd.Speaker: March 7th

2076d82421c8b6d3.ContentText: We're passing through on our way to the Alchemy Commission at the behest of General Jing Yuan and Diviner Fu. We'd like you to show us the way, Master Gongshu.
2076d82421c8b6d3.Speaker: Welt

b1aa973cfa99a6dc.ContentText: R—Really? The general sent you? Then this must be a mere misunderstanding! Ah — don't worry about those things, easy to fix!

1d28b1341952f26d.ContentText: But there's not much I can do to help! The Artisanship Commission was suddenly taken over by some evil tree demon. It seized our most precious possession — the Creation Furnace!

b2d4834ea51ba4fe.ContentText: It's a dark and powerful entity. The robots... it was like they gained consciousness — they were moving in a circle around it. I fear approaching it is tantamount to suicide!

0be6a545292e9287.ContentText: But then, I couldn't just run away... knowing what lies sealed in the furnace...

62a7375dde81f020.ContentText: Haha, I'm sure General Jing Yuan must have believed wholeheartedly that you could save the Artisanship Commission from this crisis.

0d0f9156d3aedda1.ContentText: Means I know of may yet serve your fight, pray you in repayment aid my plight. Come! Come on, through here~

4e53a2e9881d4b22.ContentText: Look, this is one of the Artisanship Commission's prototypes: the Shifting Screen.

fc5914e2805ccd6b.ContentText: Good thing I got the students to take it out and make a few adjustments — otherwise they'd never have managed to get out in time.

48f378b79b3c1cdb.ContentText: You all saw the Jade Gate on your way in, I assume? The Shifting Screen works in the same way. It connects two spatial coordinates in ways that laymen, ahem, wouldn't understand.

c6ff06bfde6c9392.ContentText: Indeed. With limited range and energy costs aside, to every starskiff soon shall woe betide~!

c775d41ff3913fda.ContentText: You sure about that? Even our trailblazing Space Anchors sound better.
c775d41ff3913fda.Speaker: March 7th

fc513a2e6bc9c0f4.ContentText: Thank goodness you take the time to perfect these inventions, master! If not, the Sky-Faring Commission would've become quite redundant by now.
fc513a2e6bc9c0f4.Speaker: Tingyun

4d8264c9489f90f5.ContentText: Ordinarily I could've used this beauty to teleport you thither, but... Through earth and air the wretched branches boiled, the Shifting Screen entangled thence... encoiled!

cb8f2ad18bd21a64.ContentText: How observant — you would make an excellent student.

f9b8f8d87ef4edef.ContentText: H—Hold on! Have some faith in me!

77fb96e0c254c206.ContentText: H—Hold on! My young friends, don't underestimate the Artisanship Commission. The general is too far off to help us now, but I can!

e83fc4e98ea10869.ContentText: The Commission is more than a match for mother nature. Hmph! O piteous tree, who think thyself so strong, your match and more in strength to meet ere long...

8f2daaf30a8e2728.ContentText: This is the first thing that came to mind when the tree demon attacked.

e968e8fb3921b263.ContentText: It's a mechanical device code-named the Luminflux Pyxis.

3bd03702413e951a.ContentText: I invented this weapon for the Cloud Knights. It's incredibly powerful, but...

9eefa62c65566cca.ContentText: Let me guess... Limited range? Energy costs?
9eefa62c65566cca.Speaker: Welt

ccd84aec92dc3dd4.ContentText: *sigh* Every light has its shadow. But this is more than enough to deal with the tree demon.

777704e588375da5.ContentText: And then, ignite. Fire beats wood — there's no way we can lose!

1d05e6dd59767982.ContentText: Agh, we were so close... What went wrong?

764dd8d3ddb6a64b.ContentText: Very good! The master reveals the door, but the apprentice must walk through it. You're much better than my useless students.

bc884b0f4d091d18.ContentText: Wh—What's happening? Is the delve collapsing?

3e45a50709a93a99.ContentText: Phew, seems like it worked! That tree demon must be writhing in pain, hahaha.

ce0176fe3d5cf536.ContentText: Alright, there's no time to lose. Hurry through the Shifting Screen to the opposite side before the branches grow back.

271358f4c16f769f.ContentText: They've encoiled the Artisanship Commission's most precious invention: the Creation Furnace!

805ddb30cbf4883c.ContentText: Help me, young friends! Let's hack them away together! We can't let the roots punch through the furnace!

a92dc815b989056b.ContentText: ...Miraculous, it creates life at will. Such incredible power...
a92dc815b989056b.Speaker: Tingyun

2506c435cf2dddcd.ContentText: It's guarding the Ambrosial Arbor's roots and the furnace.
2506c435cf2dddcd.Speaker: Welt

1ad34810bce0d1e8.ContentText: Look at the deer's feet — there are more roots coming up!
1ad34810bce0d1e8.Speaker: March 7th

b622aa3ead91693c.ContentText: They're flowering? Watch out — all of you.
b622aa3ead91693c.Speaker: Welt

707e62073e0ed629.ContentText: Huh? Peaches? I am kinda hungry...
707e62073e0ed629.Speaker: March 7th

03de217dd789caf5.ContentText: I'm just saying! It'll be a shame if they get smashed to pieces.
03de217dd789caf5.Speaker: March 7th

81eae7861abc5464.ContentText: No matter how much damage we do, it just heals itself... not fair!
81eae7861abc5464.Speaker: March 7th

628e164de4125ede.ContentText: We'll have to retreat for now. Follow me!
628e164de4125ede.Speaker: Welt

ff4f356c2a2656db.ContentText: Ugh, no wonder the Xianzhou is so scared of the Abominations of Abundance — they're unstoppable!
ff4f356c2a2656db.Speaker: March 7th

7d5ac3746d56cd92.ContentText: Miss Tingyun, are the long-life species on the Xianzhou... all like this?
7d5ac3746d56cd92.Speaker: March 7th

fb28561cc1498322.ContentText: I'm afraid this Ebon Deer was likely birthed by the Ambrosial Arbor as its guardian — it shares a close connection with the Arbor's roots. Most living creatures on the Xianzhou don't have abilities like this.
fb28561cc1498322.Speaker: Tingyun

9e9b819e1d8b4269.ContentText: *sigh* As long as it's there, we can't get any closer.
9e9b819e1d8b4269.Speaker: March 7th

c0302456158a7381.ContentText: I wonder... The Ebon Deer seems to heal itself instantly, but perhaps it's drawing that power from elsewhere...
c0302456158a7381.Speaker: Welt

8edb26674ae0c0a4.ContentText: {NICKNAME}, are you listening to Mr. Yang!?
8edb26674ae0c0a4.Speaker: March 7th

b014b58d0ddf27ef.ContentText: Yeah! It can't heal if we take out the source, right?
b014b58d0ddf27ef.Speaker: March 7th

671e4a5f9177ff80.ContentText: The monster only seems to be active in the vicinity of the Arbor. Let's look around and see if we can find anything.
671e4a5f9177ff80.Speaker: Welt

ac12a7e1bf53874b.ContentText: I don't think we're in a position to take down this deer until we've dealt with its regenerative abilities...
ac12a7e1bf53874b.Speaker: Welt

1daac0e3d26c0b19.ContentText: ...Young friends, I have a suggestion. Why don't we head that way?

9bed66ec15cbed98.ContentText: Hmm... When the deer revives, the surrounding roots glow brightly...

4f9711bf0171bd1d.ContentText: Great observation Mr. Gongshu. It's amazing what you notice when you're not fighting...
4f9711bf0171bd1d.Speaker: March 7th

067874d18a32471f.ContentText: Hehe, I'm only an artisan, after all. My skills in clash of swords shall find no sake, yet that which clasheth needeth hands to make!

ad6692db061fc5b6.ContentText: As Mr. Yang said, the deer monster is likely drawing power from somewhere in order to replenish itself. I'm certain that when the Arbor glows, we are witnessing that very process.

cea71104b653cd4d.ContentText: Precisely! You remember how we untangled the Shifting Screen with fire?

e0b2f7c7dfd5494c.ContentText: You're right! Those roots never grew back!
e0b2f7c7dfd5494c.Speaker: March 7th

b234918e4934e562.ContentText: Not only that — its reaction suggested we'd hurt it... perhaps that's our starting point.
b234918e4934e562.Speaker: Welt

5fc2f70d94b758bc.ContentText: Take hold of your weapons, young comrades! Let's raze these roots to the ground!

dac0f2f7489a4f26.ContentText: See!? My theory was correct! Keep going!

5c7e54ef053a7a0f.ContentText: Take care where you walk, friends...

9d3687071cd611c8.ContentText: If you hear the ring of a bell, keep away...

845d33b2cc472f36.ContentText: Quick, there's more roots over here!
845d33b2cc472f36.Speaker: March 7th

4b05210014e69489.ContentText: Give me a moment — I'll set up the device.

29c562d664b3d3b2.ContentText: I suspect the Ambrosial Arbor's root system must have spread far underground. The only thing we can say with confidence is that we removed the majority of those within the bounds of the Artisanship Commission.

abb8d4ce2181a9fb.ContentText: Let's hurry, before they've had a chance to grow back.

f4a161bb98937499.ContentText: I feel like I'm gonna be sick...
f4a161bb98937499.Speaker: March 7th

d63206e59b36db04.ContentText: Look — the roots coiled around the Creation Furnace! They've withered!

5b8b40dd5ae77a95.ContentText: Excellent! Nothing can stop you now!

2ca995886ca0e04b.ContentText: It's getting weak! Quick, finish it off!
2ca995886ca0e04b.Speaker: March 7th

398903390db3440e.ContentText: Thank heavens! The Creation Furnace is intact.

b35e759ff3b6d534.ContentText: General Jing Yuan said the Ambrosial Arbor was an unfathomable celestial blessing...
b35e759ff3b6d534.Speaker: Welt

0ca6af9677f77b85.ContentText: At first glance, that deer could have been an ordinary life form, but the ability to heal such grave wounds in an instant... I think I finally understand why the Xianzhou decided to follow The Hunt in eradicating the Abundance.
0ca6af9677f77b85.Speaker: Welt

5fca21af2a383716.ContentText: If immortal creations were left to spread their branches and roots throughout the universe, entire ecosystems would collapse...
5fca21af2a383716.Speaker: Welt

0d9983a8224a0eff.ContentText: No wonder the people of the Xianzhou wander the universe, never settling on a planet...
0d9983a8224a0eff.Speaker: Welt

bb466530ca536f17.ContentText: You are a man of vision, Mr. Yang. It's a shame our ancestors, the Elixir Seekers, were unable to see that hidden curse <unbreak>8000</unbreak> years ago...

61ec8562a436c5b7.ContentText: Perhaps some of them did reject the {RUBY_B#Yaoshi}Plagues Author{RUBY_E#}'s "gift." But how could an entire civilization resist the temptation of immortality?

e02f236ae7969aae.ContentText: Ironic, isn't it? The wise are buried while the fools remain immortal...

0e58f171dab96e51.ContentText: The Xianzhou regrets being led astray by the Abundance... That's why they have decided to embark on the Path of The Hunt. Maybe it's not too late for redemption.

8c9b977a1e1950d0.ContentText: Thank you for your help. I realize you must continue on to the Alchemy Commission, to the Ambrosial Arbor. After witnessing what happened here, I know there will only be more danger ahead.

9e17e541254cf2a3.ContentText: Go, friends, and stay vigilant. I wish you a safe journey.

f07f33482d69d65a.ContentText: Thank you for your help. Those useless students and I will take care of the rest here... If worst comes to worst, we still have the Cloud Knights.

4a8351505bcde85d.ContentText: It's only a legend... though what with the Ambrosial Arbor having come back to life, I suppose it's no longer absurd...

db9f37593a31738c.ContentText: They say that a long time ago, when the Xianzhou Alliance was adrift in deep space, it encountered many unimaginable life forms.

ae66f51e6b1e7b2f.ContentText: Among them were abominations known as heliobi. They existed in the form of pure energy, but craved the sensations and desires of mortal flesh and blood. Sometimes they managed to infiltrate the delves of the Xianzhou in order to bewitch humans and become parasites in their bodies.

29439326ab9b2746.ContentText: It's said that mortals parasitized by heliobi would lose their free will imperceptibly, before gradually going berserk.

e2a17797992183c0.ContentText: After a prolonged struggle, the people of the Xianzhou finally managed to trap and seal the heliobi in a vessel.

3bb3518e1d33f7c1.ContentText: That vessel is the Creation Furnace. Our predecessors hoped that by burning the heliobi in the furnace, their energy would gradually be exhausted until they were completely destroyed.

e1784385eea0be1e.ContentText: I don't know if there are demons in the furnace — perhaps it's all just superstition. However, from the day I started learning from my master, I've looked after the operation of the furnace.

8f46e57ee6b14f27.ContentText: Indeed, the flame inside has never been extinguished...

350bd776b81e167c.ContentText: Everything happened so quickly. My students and I were caught by surprise.

a089f16dd6d7610d.ContentText: I'm not overly surprised. The Alchemy Commission's alchemists were once closer to the Arbor than anyone else on the Luofu.

1a73d3646d01a30a.ContentText: The Disciples of Sanctus Medicus? Now there's an old name.

9f60055c2c556313.ContentText: They say that when the Xianzhou Luofu was first granted the Ambrosial Arbor, the alchemists in the Alchemy Commission wielded tremendous influence. Using the power of the Arbor, they transformed mortal bodies, manipulated the weather, and even brought never-before-seen creatures into being.

6dd1475536513558.ContentText: They called themselves "Saints." Unfortunately, they didn't possess any saintly powers. As soon as the Ambrosial Arbor withered, the alchemists lost their status and were reduced to medical researchers and practitioners.

ef8ea14cf2f152d9.ContentText: I'm sorry I'm not able to accompany you further.

1b186d6ae5f6c841.ContentText: Agh, I've always hated owing a favor. Take these with you — rewards for your tireless efforts.

2e575395513efc06.ContentText: It's a whole row of those gate robots! We saw one in the Divination Commission...
2e575395513efc06.Speaker: March 7th

56dc20c250fa2e25.ContentText: Gate robots...? Those are aurumatons — the Artisanship Commission created them to stand guard in various locations.

b9e4448a0cdb15a1.ContentText: Master, are these creations truly able to protect the Artisanship Commission? There's already been so much destruction — why haven't we seen any in action?
b9e4448a0cdb15a1.Speaker: Tingyun

ac3d66c95b9f0e54.ContentText: I... Ahem! We haven't quite finished the paintwork on this batch. How can we deploy them if they're not looking their best?

55b2f4b0a67976cb.ContentText: So the general asked you to head to the Alchemy Commission?

fc6b02ba22394a02.ContentText: *sigh* The Artisanship Commission had no choice but to halt operations once the tree demon appeared.

ef6802f89782c4f1.ContentText: Hey, Luocha, you didn't finish telling us about the {RUBY_B#Aeon}Propagation{RUBY_E#}! Keep going — it's interesting. So Aeons can die, huh? Weird, I thought they were invincible...
ef6802f89782c4f1.Speaker: Sushang

e38a378b3c2d6de4.ContentText: There is no true invincibility or immortality in the world — such exaggerations are born of the perspectives of ordinary beings. Nonetheless, ordinary beings could not have orchestrated the fall of the Propagation... That Aeon was slain at the hands of another Aeon.
e38a378b3c2d6de4.Speaker: Luocha

6c80b4ef30609bce.ContentText: ...I don't understand. They're all Aeons, why do they want to fight?
6c80b4ef30609bce.Speaker: Sushang

60ee85714b97705b.ContentText: You... Are you really from the Xianzhou!? Other Aeons aside, surely you must know the story of Lan and Yaoshi? Isn't destroying the Aeon Yaoshi the Alliance's cherished aim?
60ee85714b97705b.Speaker: Luocha

ee3e16e6ed00c6d7.ContentText: Of course, I know! Well, I know a little. My mum made me practice with swords all day — I didn't really go to school...
ee3e16e6ed00c6d7.Speaker: Sushang

defa13798ec7e712.ContentText: In that case... let's just change the subject. If you don't know about the feud between The Hunt and the Abundance, I'm afraid there's just too much to explain.
defa13798ec7e712.Speaker: Luocha

bcae48dff6faca2c.ContentText: Fine, how's this for a subject — what's in the box?
bcae48dff6faca2c.Speaker: Sushang

003ad1a33efc5be9.ContentText: Oh... this one? It's a casket, more commonly known as a coffin. It's for containing the remains of the deceased.
003ad1a33efc5be9.Speaker: Luocha

2b9262d718973efd.ContentText: The deceased... A—Aren't you a merchant?
2b9262d718973efd.Speaker: Sushang

a728b7acbae97aa8.ContentText: Yes indeed, this is just part of my job. I was asked to deliver this coffin to the Xianzhou. Ah, I'd quite forgotten — for long-life species, death is probably a distant concept?
a728b7acbae97aa8.Speaker: Luocha

d18d44ceea3179fa.ContentText: Nope. The Cloud Knights spend a lot of time on the battlefield — death is a common occurrence. It's just, we don't put bodies in boxes — uh — coffins... In Xianzhou, people go to the Hall of Karma in the {RUBY_B#Long-Life Supervisory Authority}Ten-Lords Commission{RUBY_E#} and consecrate the names and jade abacuses of the dead. It's our way of saying goodbye.
d18d44ceea3179fa.Speaker: Sushang

270276c56b3217c3.ContentText: The Foxians and the Vidyadhara have their own ceremonies. Foxian soldiers place their dead in Starskiffs and then let them drift out into the stars. They call it "the Returning."
270276c56b3217c3.Speaker: Sushang

ccc738bd3c9e8c88.ContentText: As for the Vidyadhara, they're... more mysterious. They say that when a Vidyadhara is very old or has a fatal injury, they turn into an egg that looks like a pearl. When the shell breaks, they come out looking young again...
ccc738bd3c9e8c88.Speaker: Sushang

7a96d2b634b0c349.ContentText: My mum calls the Vidyadhara "Long's Scions." When I was young, she told me stories of how the Vidyadhara could turn into dragons. I don't know if that's true...
7a96d2b634b0c349.Speaker: Sushang

ecf4b6cbe5f63627.ContentText: What do you know? Silent but deadly speaks.
ecf4b6cbe5f63627.Speaker: Sushang

f579b711cf57a723.ContentText: ...Your mother is right. The Vidyadhara are Long's Scions. They are descendants of the Aeon of {RUBY_B#Long}Permanence{RUBY_E#}. That was why some, but not all, could turn into dragons.
f579b711cf57a723.Speaker: Dan Heng

33010929e43c280c.ContentText: The power was a rare inheritance, passed down only to those who could successfully complete numerous rites and challenges. For the inheritor, it was hard to say whether it was a blessing or a curse.
33010929e43c280c.Speaker: Dan Heng

11b405922f50416f.ContentText: ...I've heard the story of Long the Permanence and their descendants. Many myths and legends praise the Aeon for a rich and immortal life.
11b405922f50416f.Speaker: Luocha

8ff6a39a72b01586.ContentText: But for some reason, the Aeon disappeared among the stars without a trace — almost as if they had never existed... leaving only their descendants.
8ff6a39a72b01586.Speaker: Luocha

b13661c422e2d69d.ContentText: Every life has its limit. Even the Aeons are not truly immortal and will eventually reach the end of their lives.
b13661c422e2d69d.Speaker: Luocha

3f2614d2ede5a51e.ContentText: Uh, let me ask you one more question... Do you know the person in the coffin?
3f2614d2ede5a51e.Speaker: Sushang

3f0e65ae71caca1f.ContentText: Haha, miss, whatever gave you that impression? The individual in the coffin is neither friend nor relative — we met only once. By chance, I made someone a promise, and so I have to run this errand.
3f0e65ae71caca1f.Speaker: Luocha

d48357c8fd647098.ContentText: Let's leave it at that, shall we? I think we've all had enough rest.
d48357c8fd647098.Speaker: Luocha

b94e57334e417a37.ContentText: Wait! Let's think before we act.
b94e57334e417a37.Speaker: Dan Heng

7821a4b16c468a0a.ContentText: Silent but deadly, Luocha, let's charge in together. If we take them out quickly, we can rescue the girl!
7821a4b16c468a0a.Speaker: Sushang

5640b1c0ba048e19.ContentText: What happened to "us letting you handle it"?
5640b1c0ba048e19.Speaker: Luocha

fe37c2bad61c480d.ContentText: I—I've only got two hands! Please — I'll wangle you a prize for your bravery or something when it's all over!
fe37c2bad61c480d.Speaker: Sushang

36092687a9fac2df.ContentText: Ah... Sorry, I didn't see any blood, so I thought you were okay... You're a {RUBY_B#cyborg}puppet{RUBY_E#}.
36092687a9fac2df.Speaker: Sushang

893c985f511762f8.ContentText: My motor is broken — I can't move.

97bfa62655c440ab.ContentText: Are you a Cloud Knight? ...Good. Take me to the Realm-Keeping Commission.

3c622034340b7e56.ContentText: Luocha, silent but deadly, I'm afraid we have to delay things again... This lady is one of the judges of the {RUBY_B#Long-Life Supervisory Authority}Ten-Lords Commission{RUBY_E#}. As a Cloud Knight, I must prioritize her orders.
3c622034340b7e56.Speaker: Sushang

ea31822d2c1d553f.ContentText: I'm sorry... If I'd known I wouldn't have got you to come with me. You'd probably be there by now if you'd gone by yourself...
ea31822d2c1d553f.Speaker: Sushang

3500f39709d1cd02.ContentText: I happen to have some medical knowledge — perhaps I can treat the young lady's injuries.
3500f39709d1cd02.Speaker: Luocha

2782f44540d47d38.ContentText: Well, it's just... she's a {RUBY_B#cyborg}puppet{RUBY_E#}. I think we should just take her to the Realm-Keeping Commission?
2782f44540d47d38.Speaker: Sushang

8e48e58d8e11f9cb.ContentText: Don't worry, Miss Sushang — leave it to me.
8e48e58d8e11f9cb.Speaker: Luocha

e4d357a643379154.ContentText: You might get an aching or numbing sensation, but it shouldn't be too painful... Do you think you can hold still?
e4d357a643379154.Speaker: Luocha

ed20342d6067e862.ContentText: It won't work... My body is mechanical, not flesh and blood—

8f72119f3892b125.ContentText: Be it mechanical or organic, we're still dealing with composite substances. I just hope you'll tolerate my methods...
8f72119f3892b125.Speaker: Luocha

aca64e3d0057c3b9.ContentText: H—How... What kind of "medical knowledge" is this!?
aca64e3d0057c3b9.Speaker: Sushang

ee4a183f0ae9d834.ContentText: Very good — we no longer need to return to the Realm-Keeping Commission. The mission continues.

a74d3688fe9606c7.ContentText: As a judge in the employ of the Ten-Lords Commission, I am forbidden from interfering in the affairs of outsiders. However, seeing as you came to my aid, a word of advice: Leave as soon as possible.

51a214927d67f43e.ContentText: I came to address the root of our crisis by arresting a fugitive — a Stellaron Hunter. This villain possesses exceptional swordsmanship and wields a divine weapon — they are extremely dangerous.

df43387ccc20dba8.ContentText: If it hadn't been for a strange accident, my wakespan might have been cut short.

c811246a83e77686.ContentText: I've never seen anything like it.

9bee738ee818655a.ContentText: I—It's bigger than I thought... Hey you, I was just joking! Leave us alone, shoo!
9bee738ee818655a.Speaker: March 7th

e0ba53a1abc719dd.ContentText: This energy flow... it's up to something.
e0ba53a1abc719dd.Speaker: Dan Heng

d4703c15e521b567.ContentText: There's something on its right hand, stay alert!
d4703c15e521b567.Speaker: Himeko

49872587dffb81a3.ContentText: Gotcha! See, that's what you get for annoying me!
49872587dffb81a3.Speaker: March 7th

2b30ce2e9a751200.ContentText: No, the Legion's weapon shouldn't go down so easily.
2b30ce2e9a751200.Speaker: Himeko

766625bc378fcc2e.ContentText: Let's worry about that later. We need to focus fire — fast.
766625bc378fcc2e.Speaker: Dan Heng

ef4be77fb167f768.ContentText: I'm out, I'm out! It's gone bananas!
ef4be77fb167f768.Speaker: March 7th

f82387b3f42ff737.ContentText: Not good... It's ready to throw everything at us.
f82387b3f42ff737.Speaker: Dan Heng

44f701763295fba9.ContentText: Hey! Is it trying to pull a charged attack?
44f701763295fba9.Speaker: March 7th

22d299cb6e128250.ContentText: I don't see any other possibilities. Here we go, brace yourselves!
22d299cb6e128250.Speaker: Dan Heng

5e43c3955fca33fe.ContentText: Not bad. It would've been even better if you didn't faint. But thanks to you, the Doomsday Beast was as tame as a kitten. It had no temper at all.
5e43c3955fca33fe.Speaker: March 7th

b87ed19d8e5d6ca1.ContentText: Yes, and you are the hero.
b87ed19d8e5d6ca1.Speaker: March 7th

0e1677a499307f20.ContentText: Alright, alright. I just gave you a compliment, don't let it go to your head. However, you are indeed the hero this time.
0e1677a499307f20.Speaker: March 7th

9aa55373e10e41ea.ContentText: Get up when you feel better. Himeko wants you to go find her. I have something to do, so I won't go with you, alright?
9aa55373e10e41ea.Speaker: March 7th

c897f17ad401816d.ContentText: By the way, we should exchange beacons. If you get lost or something, feel free to text me.
c897f17ad401816d.Speaker: March 7th

11e505571a910652.ContentText: It's good that you've made it through in one piece. You can rest easy now that the threat from the Legion has been neutralized.
11e505571a910652.Speaker: Dan Heng

93d8774ed75edb9b.ContentText: Well, this invasion seems to be nothing more than a random provocation. As soon as the Doomsday Beast fell, the Legion retreated.
93d8774ed75edb9b.Speaker: Dan Heng

05ca636488493db9.ContentText: You're not wrong, but be careful about blurting things out loud — it could attract unwanted attention.
05ca636488493db9.Speaker: Dan Heng

80a7096cc8c5f738.ContentText: Well, this is the Herta Space Station.
80a7096cc8c5f738.Speaker: Dan Heng

43559754b40ecf3f.ContentText: I guess I'll leave you to rest up a bit for the time being. By the way, what's your beacon address? That way if anything happens, I can contact you.
43559754b40ecf3f.Speaker: Dan Heng

9586355bbbfcf856.ContentText: Go see Himeko when you have the time. She said she had something to discuss with you.
9586355bbbfcf856.Speaker: Dan Heng

5e514e17d8365821.ContentText: Darn it! He's got extra hands!
5e514e17d8365821.Speaker: March 7th

b3e8f41ee3096aa0.ContentText: So it's literally a helping hand?
b3e8f41ee3096aa0.Speaker: March 7th

c1ff01e5e7597773.ContentText: That hand of his! It's gonna explode!
c1ff01e5e7597773.Speaker: March 7th

4077cfee2ae72d6a.ContentText: Defense or offense, we need to pick one and go all in.
4077cfee2ae72d6a.Speaker: March 7th

0416400fa9a31f7e.ContentText: Ugh — can't find a way to break their formation!
0416400fa9a31f7e.Speaker: March 7th

8924027df65d9c11.ContentText: Hey, you over there looking dumbfounded. Yes, Pom-Pom's talking to you.

579534770059536e.ContentText: Himeko told Pom-Pom about your situation. Now listen up, Pom-Pom will only say this once.

dcb8966ebfdca777.ContentText: Pom-Pom's sure there have been lots of people telling you how special you are lately, but this is the Astral Express, and everyone on here has their secrets.

566b486555d7554c.ContentText: Since you chose to board, you can abide by the rules. You're not the only special one here. You'd best remember that.

c54f625c7773c91d.ContentText: I'm Pom-Pom, the conductor. Just come find me if you have any trouble.

66a8a91777325989.ContentText: Oh, it's you. How do you feel?
66a8a91777325989.Speaker: Welt

f6647b0eaae61426.ContentText: Great. Looks like your stamina is really quite special.
f6647b0eaae61426.Speaker: Welt

7821dd0667863f0f.ContentText: ...I'll check you out in a minute.
7821dd0667863f0f.Speaker: Welt

f1d58efcfd82a004.ContentText: Your body has been tampered with by the Stellaron Hunters. Perhaps that left behind some aftereffects.
f1d58efcfd82a004.Speaker: Welt

772ec8f4bd333f95.ContentText: Tasteful... Oh, you mean the train? I was asking how you felt physically.
772ec8f4bd333f95.Speaker: Welt

4568eaedc6ff98b2.ContentText: You are right, though. Looking at the interior decoration, you can tell that trailblazers have quite good taste.
4568eaedc6ff98b2.Speaker: Welt

c75c5ce583cd6efb.ContentText: In any case, I have to thank you for saving March.
c75c5ce583cd6efb.Speaker: Welt

56567f621a8114b0.ContentText: Heh, all I did was calm that thing inside you down temporarily...
56567f621a8114b0.Speaker: Welt

db79d959da045b31.ContentText: ...I don't want to frighten you, but the truth is you won't ever be in the clear while it is still inside your body.
db79d959da045b31.Speaker: Welt

221bfce8ec7e0c1f.ContentText: It's good that you think so. Someone with that mindset and the actions to back it up — that is the true meaning of the word "hero."
221bfce8ec7e0c1f.Speaker: Welt

c90a1af2686b8ab6.ContentText: Helping others without a second thought — that is the most important quality of a hero.
c90a1af2686b8ab6.Speaker: Welt

394e48fb34b7d019.ContentText: However, as long as the Stellaron is still in your body, you should be careful what you do. I don't know if Himeko and I can suppress it again.
394e48fb34b7d019.Speaker: Welt

b790ef037817b298.ContentText: But I won't bore you any longer. So much happened at the space station, you must be tired.
b790ef037817b298.Speaker: Welt

71567cc808c53bcb.ContentText: There should be some time until the next warp jump, so feel free to walk around and familiarize yourself with the environment.
71567cc808c53bcb.Speaker: Welt

662494a88e6d34ec.ContentText: What do you think? Does the Astral Express look the same as you imagined?
662494a88e6d34ec.Speaker: Himeko

d078c28e02a48183.ContentText: Everyone on the Express is a passenger.
d078c28e02a48183.Speaker: Himeko

779d90977ec0baba.ContentText: We're all heading towards an unknown destination, like we are traveling together.
779d90977ec0baba.Speaker: Himeko

98dd4ec12ef37bb1.ContentText: Maybe that's why the Trailblaze chose such a look.
98dd4ec12ef37bb1.Speaker: Himeko

13b9f4c96f703530.ContentText: March said something like that at first, too.
13b9f4c96f703530.Speaker: Himeko

944d62af818e5497.ContentText: Seems like you young people have similar tastes.
944d62af818e5497.Speaker: Himeko

129000b7c4ee298e.ContentText: Oh right — March and Dan Heng should both be in their rooms right now.
129000b7c4ee298e.Speaker: Himeko

34923e5c12226015.ContentText: You can go look for them. You youngsters should get along well.
34923e5c12226015.Speaker: Himeko

af3904645271c084.ContentText: Ah, you know, young people! Their rooms always reflect their personality.
af3904645271c084.Speaker: Himeko

6b409caa25195afe.ContentText: You can go and... have a look around?
6b409caa25195afe.Speaker: Himeko

c452bea0a92c4887.ContentText: We usually meet up here, but our personal cabins are in the next carriage.
c452bea0a92c4887.Speaker: Himeko

1b1350b95e7fa620.ContentText: Also, don't mind Pom-Pom's antics. They're actually pretty interested in you. It's just that we haven't had new passengers on the Express for a long while.
1b1350b95e7fa620.Speaker: Himeko

c57baab253ac93a1.ContentText: I won't steal Pom-Pom's thunder. If you have any questions, just go ask our conductor.
c57baab253ac93a1.Speaker: Himeko

67e44454462adb1a.ContentText: Here already? I was just engaging in pleasantries. How can I help?

157cf64d3e0df863.ContentText: Oh? Why are you interested in her room?

bb41b8450f7a6d28.ContentText: Ah, Pom-Pom remembers Himeko saying that you saved her...

1453d23b938d4e69.ContentText: Mmm, very brave! Very foolhardy! But that is what a Trailblazer should be like.

225957ba6d55efa4.ContentText: March 7th's room is in the Express Sleeper Compartment. She's always running around, so she might not be there.

2da0945ac0c185be.ContentText: Dan Heng's room? Oh, you mean the archives.

87dba262ef54bf61.ContentText: He's just... sort of living in there, I guess. I can't be bothered getting him out.

da0c4869f742f5e0.ContentText: March 7th's room is right next to the Archives. You can visit him on the way.

669b24393f20b7aa.ContentText: Himeko always likes to bring back weird junk and try to fix it.

97f4c24034f8d32d.ContentText: That also got modified a bit.

2910a849135c5e9c.ContentText: Shouldn't be a surprise to see the IPC's vending machine anywhere...

2483a60f7cd6a37f.ContentText: Pom-Pom doesn't wanna admit it, but they really do have everything you may need on sale.

76b4441684c4cb96.ContentText: This thing might add some nice flavor to the trip.

2832a3e721c5a776.ContentText: Pom-Pom still needs to prepare for the Express' warp jump. You can look around the place yourself.

7ddd85dda2f34cdf.ContentText: No matter where you go on this train, Pom-Pom will always have my eyes on you.

135377f82e8ea658.ContentText: Himeko likes using the Phonograph a lot. She says it can play melodies from the past.

9510d1efeb2ec3d9.ContentText: Welt likes collecting these jet-black discs. It seems like they could be antiques. He'd be very happy if you could bring a few back.

773613c63ddd78c2.ContentText: The Interastral Peace Corporation's after-sales service is very comprehensive. The vending machine has a wide range of products that are regularly refreshed.

d07e05bcc21da48b.ContentText: Hyper-distant delivery costs an arm and a leg, but we got this machine from Madam Herta, all the products inside come free of shipping charges.

23a277d574601314.ContentText: Hey! Y-You don't have any questions to ask Pom-Pom!?

d1a831ce6ca00fe5.ContentText: Is it because you think Pom-Pom talks too much? Or is it Pom-Pom's age? You youngsters gotta learn to bridge that generation gap.

c3be89c3b6e04a9b.ContentText: You just left. Why are you back again!?

09f9bbff263408e8.ContentText: Go, go. I'm busy here and I don't have time for you.

f5be45e455c88fea.ContentText: (There seems to be the sound of electronic equipment...)
f5be45e455c88fea.Speaker: playerboy

0a23a342c19ae431.ContentText: ...Oh, it's you. The door's not locked. Come in.
0a23a342c19ae431.Speaker: Dan Heng

8500494b02179db0.ContentText: I learned to sense incoming visitors after people kept barging in so frequently.
8500494b02179db0.Speaker: Dan Heng

e8e3e5191168233a.ContentText: Feel free. This is open to everyone on the Express.
e8e3e5191168233a.Speaker: Dan Heng

42e903213fcde83d.ContentText: This is not my pad, it's just where I sleep.
42e903213fcde83d.Speaker: Dan Heng

d76ae92a21149d6c.ContentText: These are the Archives. It has the records of all the Astral Express's trips since its first journey.
d76ae92a21149d6c.Speaker: Dan Heng

a6cba6ef4f1cc80f.ContentText: A lot of the data is corrupted, but even the residual pieces contain huge amounts of information that we're struggling to process. I'm trying to sort them out.
a6cba6ef4f1cc80f.Speaker: Dan Heng

8c59a53af1270ea0.ContentText: Aside from the existing data, I also recorded this trip to the archives.
8c59a53af1270ea0.Speaker: Dan Heng

36c1ff33e653fc21.ContentText: Go look them up yourself. I don't know your definition of "fun."
36c1ff33e653fc21.Speaker: Dan Heng

dc86f12bb7c0c37e.ContentText: If you see your own name, don't be surprised, I also recorded this trip to the archives.
dc86f12bb7c0c37e.Speaker: Dan Heng

359913223bd3b107.ContentText: While many of the roads that Akivili traveled along no longer exist, I think it's still meaningful to record our adventures as current passengers of the Express.
359913223bd3b107.Speaker: Dan Heng

db5d051a0d3ec55c.ContentText: I enter the collected data into the archives' data bank. I try to catalog the people and places the Express encounters, and compare and contrast them with the existing records.
db5d051a0d3ec55c.Speaker: Dan Heng

46db1f112bf810ed.ContentText: Do you see the terminal over there? It can be used to view information already stored in the data bank. Do give it a go.
46db1f112bf810ed.Speaker: Dan Heng

18e8810a3904d16a.ContentText: I'll be entering any new information we encounter on future journeys, so drop by anytime to check it out. We also have a shortcut on the terminal device.
18e8810a3904d16a.Speaker: Dan Heng

9a6fb301f5771b73.ContentText: Seems like you have some deep misunderstandings about me. *sigh* Ah, well, I think I know who caused that.
9a6fb301f5771b73.Speaker: Dan Heng

9945cef04af52ab9.ContentText: I have matters to attend to, feel free.
9945cef04af52ab9.Speaker: Dan Heng

00944e65a8ffb905.ContentText: So, if you're headed next door...
00944e65a8ffb905.Speaker: Dan Heng

50c1a2566f997b2b.ContentText: ...Is it time to warp jump? You go ahead.
50c1a2566f997b2b.Speaker: Dan Heng

8f41ef7d75086929.ContentText: (But... can he really sleep on such a hard bed?)
8f41ef7d75086929.Speaker: playerboy

a622305d7a3d22e2.ContentText: A hard bed is good for your spine. A bed that's too soft will end up hurting you.
a622305d7a3d22e2.Speaker: Dan Heng

47a07be3231d3930.ContentText: (How did he know... Did my gaze betray me!?)
47a07be3231d3930.Speaker: playerboy

d6b788a7a20acaff.ContentText: (I wonder if this is the only style of clothes he owns...)
d6b788a7a20acaff.Speaker: playerboy

a7d3424a218e751e.ContentText: (The door is unlocked. Should I go in?)
a7d3424a218e751e.Speaker: playerboy

d48e6167ca8dcb7d.ContentText: (Just one look should be fine, right?)
d48e6167ca8dcb7d.Speaker: playerboy

fc52c874f3fc81f4.ContentText: (Better to wait till the room's owner comes back.)
fc52c874f3fc81f4.Speaker: playerboy

a61a654a3c5e6f84.ContentText: (There are even pictures of the space station...)
a61a654a3c5e6f84.Speaker: playerboy

2e2a57db9ebee68d.ContentText: Make a choice I won't regret... reach the future...
2e2a57db9ebee68d.Speaker: playerboy

2a793ad4bd2ecd6e.ContentText: (So much has happened in such a short time...)
2a793ad4bd2ecd6e.Speaker: playerboy

5fa4d5f5a7620d29.ContentText: Ahem, hi, hello~ Attention all passengers. Attention all passengers.

ef60a7ecdb15c7c6.ContentText: The Express is about to conduct a warp jump. All passengers, please gather at the main hall.

748409e49a991baf.ContentText: I repeat. The Express is about to conduct a warp jump. All passengers, please gather at the main hall.

2e1dcbb412277632.ContentText: (I can't tell what plant this is. Maybe I'll ask March 7th next time.)
2e1dcbb412277632.Speaker: playerboy

9f4ebaad2fee7b80.ContentText: (With such a huge doll on the bed, wouldn't it feel really cramped at night?)
9f4ebaad2fee7b80.Speaker: playerboy

4a63c6c3ee961bfa.ContentText: (This looks like a souvenir from the journeys... right? Probably.)
4a63c6c3ee961bfa.Speaker: playerboy

b04d00dbf62f5575.ContentText: Wait, this is your first trip! So that should be double the excitement, right?
b04d00dbf62f5575.Speaker: March 7th

5c8394eb2c84b26f.ContentText: Hehe, I was excited the first time I experienced a warp jump, too. But I'm used to it now.
5c8394eb2c84b26f.Speaker: March 7th

dac632f36fe48686.ContentText: Don't worry, you'll get used to it too, and before you know it you'll be a mature and dependable passenger just like me.
dac632f36fe48686.Speaker: March 7th

4b0a60fc3c30cce9.ContentText: Ah! You're just like Mr. Yang, always worrying about things that haven't even happened yet.
4b0a60fc3c30cce9.Speaker: March 7th

f1f84705b81deba8.ContentText: Young people should be energetic! Here, let's do some relaxation exercises.
f1f84705b81deba8.Speaker: March 7th

4c33850de6b176e3.ContentText: The first step is to grab a hold of the root cause of your anxiety.
4c33850de6b176e3.Speaker: March 7th

9e9ad314eece599a.ContentText: Well, it is a little abstract, but basically you just need to pinpoint what's bothering you.
9e9ad314eece599a.Speaker: March 7th

da41a0f835c72225.ContentText: The second step is to focus all your anxiety on that point.
da41a0f835c72225.Speaker: March 7th

7fd082f007063e02.ContentText: This is science! Don't get distracted! *deep breath* Focus.
7fd082f007063e02.Speaker: March 7th

d91874e68b466acb.ContentText: Seems like you're a natural. It's not easy to reach this level of enlightenment.
d91874e68b466acb.Speaker: March 7th

1f52e721fa98e198.ContentText: Now for step three: Yank out that anxiety and cast it away with all your might!
1f52e721fa98e198.Speaker: March 7th

a1104119b738ff19.ContentText: That doesn't mean it won't work! The best method for relieving anxiety is the one that works, right?
a1104119b738ff19.Speaker: March 7th

30cc1310eaecb9b6.ContentText: Really? I've never been able to do it successfully myself!
30cc1310eaecb9b6.Speaker: March 7th

89ddf5076eff3b1f.ContentText: What does it feel like? Like all your worries have been swept away?
89ddf5076eff3b1f.Speaker: March 7th

a1bc4c1f69ac140c.ContentText: You took long enough! But at least everyone's here now.

10a066168b4888dd.ContentText: He won't be here, so just leave him be.

1470b7afb797eba2.ContentText: Just a little gift from the conductor to the passenger. Think of it as an investment in your future growth.

6ee1d5b7e658cfc5.ContentText: Okay everyone, hurry up and find a place to sit down. Try not to be like March, always running around the Express like a headless chicken.

15999bc162182974.ContentText: Pom-Pom's going to start the final preparations for the jump.

6a16b0987a975cdc.ContentText: What's wrong? You look like you were about to say something.
6a16b0987a975cdc.Speaker: Himeko

d594ca8f9950a86d.ContentText: Oh, I think I know what you were going to ask. You've come to the right person.
d594ca8f9950a86d.Speaker: Himeko

b7bb4c65ec017cd6.ContentText: Ohh, you want to know more about the Express? I'm glad. After all, it's an important companion of ours.
b7bb4c65ec017cd6.Speaker: Himeko

658aae5ee41353bf.ContentText: The Astral Express was a tool created by Akivili the Trailblaze, who used it to transport themself and the Nameless across the galaxy. It is rumored that there are other vehicles like it, but the Express has no such records.
658aae5ee41353bf.Speaker: Himeko

b2251233fef2a3ef.ContentText: When I found the Express, its memory had been severely damaged, with much of its valuable information lost. All I know is that the Express is an Aspect of Creation built by Akivili themself, and used to travel the cosmos.
b2251233fef2a3ef.Speaker: Himeko

3067b03c42527806.ContentText: As for how it was built and how it was damaged, I do not have an answer.
3067b03c42527806.Speaker: Himeko

a0abde450e9ebe69.ContentText: The Express is traveling on a route that the Trailblazer once embarked on. The names of some destinations have been lost, but the first and final stops were both at Pegana — Akivili's home world.
a0abde450e9ebe69.Speaker: Himeko

4799c44e8a8bdd28.ContentText: We speculate the Astral Express started its journey from Pegana, stopping at each destination along the way before returning there for its next journey. However, the appearance of the Stellarons has caused a delay at each stop.
4799c44e8a8bdd28.Speaker: Himeko

015f92131b39d2db.ContentText: There is a legend in the galaxy: the heart of Akivili themself lies in the core of the Astral Express, providing it with the power to travel between worlds. But I found no evidence of that aboard the Express.
015f92131b39d2db.Speaker: Himeko

7f6b201b5e6a4992.ContentText: Besides, the Express existed before the Trailblaze fell. There's no way they could have had two hearts, right? However, it is likely that the Express possesses some sort of mechanism to transfer power from the Trailblaze.
7f6b201b5e6a4992.Speaker: Himeko

05ee7e24c89d46f5.ContentText: It wouldn't be possible with a normal Pathstrider.
05ee7e24c89d46f5.Speaker: Himeko

83fb442d0bcfd064.ContentText: The fallen Aeon, deceased Trailblaze — their passing is still a mystery, but of all the known Aeons, Akivili was the closest to mankind.
83fb442d0bcfd064.Speaker: Himeko

6910a2783aee1777.ContentText: In the databank aboard the Express, it is recorded that they walked among the mortals — adventuring, fighting, and celebrating with them. Although they were an Aeon restrained by the "Primum Mobile," Akivili enjoyed a freedom similar to us mortals.
6910a2783aee1777.Speaker: Himeko

e3ed40807b6ac36e.ContentText: They were different from most... But their passing came so suddenly that it was thought they were killed by another Aeon. I don't believe that to be the case.
e3ed40807b6ac36e.Speaker: Himeko

74f4646acd06d318.ContentText: The galaxy is endlessly vast. I wouldn't know where to begin, especially if you ask me that so suddenly...
74f4646acd06d318.Speaker: Himeko

f6b1be6289a6f099.ContentText: I've been to many different worlds, yet I still know very little about the galaxy, simply because it's too vast. As for its nature, there are a few theories that I can share with you.
f6b1be6289a6f099.Speaker: Himeko

866d9059bd5aab36.ContentText: The most popular is probably the Cosmos Tree theory, proposed by Zandar, Emanator of Erudition and the first member of the Genius Society. He compared the galaxy to an enormous imaginary tree, with its leaves being individual star systems.
866d9059bd5aab36.Speaker: Himeko

df7f7250416d2c9f.ContentText: Therefore, only Aeons, who draw their energy from the imaginary, and Emanators, who are blessed by Aeons, can travel through the spaces filled with imaginary energy. That's why planets where civilizations exist are so similar.
df7f7250416d2c9f.Speaker: Himeko

8544644812d9f3d4.ContentText: However, the theory has its flaws. Elias Salas, the <unbreak>56</unbreak>th member of the Genius Society, invented remote detection, disproving that the imaginary is unique. This shook the foundation of the "Cosmos Tree" theory.
8544644812d9f3d4.Speaker: Himeko

2fe31e41083513a5.ContentText: There are other theories as well: the "Stretching" theory, the "Heat Torch" theory, and the "Parallel Imaging" theory... The Riddlers claim the galaxy is just a dream and IX's followers seem to like that claim.
2fe31e41083513a5.Speaker: Himeko

d5720038d9742f82.ContentText: Aeons are the most mysterious beings in the galaxy. All we know is that they ascended from the form of intelligent beings. As for the how and why, even the heavyweights over at the Genius Society haven't the slightest clue.
d5720038d9742f82.Speaker: Himeko

2eb9f22f5db45c4b.ContentText: Upon ascending to Aeon-hood, that being gains power over the Paths, free to choose the allocation of imaginary energy however they wish, while suffering the restrictions of the "Primum Mobile."
2eb9f22f5db45c4b.Speaker: Himeko

e9c594ad2fd8d480.ContentText: The Aeon of Destruction seeks only to destroy the universe, while the Aeon of Erudition wants to find the answer for all that exists. Meanwhile, the Aeon of Preservation continues to forge walls, and the Aeon of Enigmata devotes themself to obscuring all that is known...
e9c594ad2fd8d480.Speaker: Himeko

42d76ea3b3eb4881.ContentText: A cloud of mystery shrouds the Aeons. I heard Madam Herta recruited a team to try and solve the mysteries about them.
42d76ea3b3eb4881.Speaker: Himeko

e6168ed58ae9c321.ContentText: Compared to the Aeons, the factions are much easier to understand. Mortals with the same objective gather together to practice their understanding of Aeons and the Paths.
e6168ed58ae9c321.Speaker: Himeko

3bae34dc95bcd5a0.ContentText: Many Aeons are unreachable, but the factions are close to us. After Akivili trailblazed across the galaxy, people became aware of the existence of other worlds. Gradually, more people started trying to use the power of the Aeons to travel between worlds.
3bae34dc95bcd5a0.Speaker: Himeko

e4eda2c3e0697807.ContentText: The Interastral Peace Corporation is a good example: They worship Qlipoth, the Aeon of Preservation, but somehow became the largest economic entity in the galaxy.
e4eda2c3e0697807.Speaker: Himeko

8bdb80cd5c568a7e.ContentText: Another example is the Genius Society: There is no shortage of eccentrics like Madam Herta who dedicate themselves to scientific research under the protection of the Erudition.
8bdb80cd5c568a7e.Speaker: Himeko

f62faeb2d08dd7ed.ContentText: These factions possess the same power as us to voyage between worlds. It would be hard to travel through the galaxy without them.
f62faeb2d08dd7ed.Speaker: Himeko

8ab194bbb1d48c5c.ContentText: The birth of an Aeon gives rise to a Path. The nature of the Paths remains a mystery, leaving us to draw an analogy in a way that mortals can understand: It's a philosophical concept of sorts.
8ab194bbb1d48c5c.Speaker: Himeko

49c442a39a0ce273.ContentText: A person is considered to be on a Path when their will overlaps with that Path. If the person has a strong enough will, they can draw power from that Path. Those who can do so are called Pathstriders.
49c442a39a0ce273.Speaker: Himeko

c83d10abdd9a986a.ContentText: Pathstriders possess extraordinary power, but are still insignificant compared to the Aeons, like a drop of water in a vast ocean. Sometimes, Aeons will bestow a mortal with their power, making them an "Emanator" of that Aeon.
c83d10abdd9a986a.Speaker: Himeko

c377049a3007ab38.ContentText: I should mention that once a Path is open, it cannot be closed, even with the fall of its Aeon. That is how we are still able to travel across the stars, despite Akivili's passing.
c377049a3007ab38.Speaker: Himeko

5576bfff1ed2e9e2.ContentText: "Trailblaze" is our mission and the source of strength that powers the Express to travel across the galaxy.
5576bfff1ed2e9e2.Speaker: Himeko

001631f8142f422b.ContentText: Explore the unknown world to continue our journey ahead.
001631f8142f422b.Speaker: Himeko

56a0a410c954d9b4.ContentText: Understand the local culture and immerse ourselves within it.
56a0a410c954d9b4.Speaker: Himeko

afe8de074d958005.ContentText: Establish a connection with the new world — rejoice with it and share in its fears.
afe8de074d958005.Speaker: Himeko

030c501fffd63b96.ContentText: Connect worlds together, carving an endless path.
030c501fffd63b96.Speaker: Himeko

c7e0eee0bdead354.ContentText: This is your first time experiencing the warp jump, so a little discomfort is unavoidable.
c7e0eee0bdead354.Speaker: Welt

d5a18d2d25965767.ContentText: If you're really anxious about it, I can stay here and have a chat with you.
d5a18d2d25965767.Speaker: Welt

27d1eb342d84135e.ContentText: About everyone on the Express? Who would you like to know about?
27d1eb342d84135e.Speaker: Welt

db37c75f12a5302e.ContentText: Haha, she's the owner of the Express. We joke around calling Pom-Pom the conductor, but everyone knows Himeko is the boss.
db37c75f12a5302e.Speaker: Welt

5cf52956cf455b37.ContentText: It all started with her encounter with the Astral Express, and they haven't been apart since then.
5cf52956cf455b37.Speaker: Welt

87a43b6e4927e650.ContentText: She's... extremely passionate, like a burning sun. However, she remains mysterious most of the time. Once in a while, you feel that she's burning herself out trying to accomplish her dream.
87a43b6e4927e650.Speaker: Welt

0961956605c803d1.ContentText: Only someone like her is worthy of the Astral Express. I think Himeko's vision of her whole life revolves around... a very important dream.
0961956605c803d1.Speaker: Welt

eb87d73c58786bda.ContentText: To be honest, I don't know when Pom-Pom appeared... I think it was before I came to the Express? No wait, maybe it was after...
eb87d73c58786bda.Speaker: Welt

99208935505b8823.ContentText: Pom-Pom is like the spirit of the Astral Express. Whenever anyone on the Express needs help, they will appear immediately. It would be ill-advised to underestimate them.
99208935505b8823.Speaker: Welt

d6a7db4d6540090c.ContentText: Pom-Pom is terrifying when they get angry... Yes, terrifying...
d6a7db4d6540090c.Speaker: Welt

458bf54486dc7ddd.ContentText: Dan Heng is a lonely child. He may appear distant and cold, but his heart is kind. Perhaps, he's the way he is today because he spent so much time on the run. Sometimes, he reminds me of myself when I was young...
458bf54486dc7ddd.Speaker: Welt

244c371ad6a9bcc6.ContentText: He used to work at the Xianzhou. We don't know what he's running from. He once told me that he didn't know either. All he knew was that something was chasing him and that he had to run.
244c371ad6a9bcc6.Speaker: Welt

a96f9912962d10af.ContentText: So he boarded the ship of a troupe called the "Mourning Actors" and escaped the IPC. After a while he made his way to the Express, and he's stayed here longer than anywhere else.
a96f9912962d10af.Speaker: Welt

18315528446187ed.ContentText: Don't worry, no matter who or what wants to hurt Dan Heng, we won't let them. Those who dare attack members of the Astral Express should be prepared to suffer the wrath of me and Himeko.
18315528446187ed.Speaker: Welt

acb33b3125a83c5c.ContentText: Did Himeko tell you about March 7th? She was trapped in ice, floating through space. We happened upon her and rescued her.
acb33b3125a83c5c.Speaker: Welt

6bc5e9190de09273.ContentText: It was a unique type of ice known as Six-Phased Ice — a substance that adheres to Imaginary Law, meaning that external forces cannot change its form.
6bc5e9190de09273.Speaker: Welt

ea3eb721516e486a.ContentText: Whoever sealed her inside the Six-Phased Ice... No matter who it is... did so either to protect or banish her. I believe she had been floating through space for some time.
ea3eb721516e486a.Speaker: Welt

0818354afebd7321.ContentText: It's impossible to trace the origin of this phenomenon. When it's observed by humans — or I should say once it begins to affect the physical world — it's already too late to reverse.
0818354afebd7321.Speaker: Welt

5dafdb52099085a0.ContentText: It's like a sudden storm that appears on a calm ocean. This phenomenon causes the smooth journey through the expanse to be filled with dangers.
5dafdb52099085a0.Speaker: Welt

06ef4939543d2807.ContentText: The mechanism whereby this mutation and corrosion spreads is the Stellarons.
06ef4939543d2807.Speaker: Welt

addd2742d02a3a7e.ContentText: It promulgated rapidly like cancer cells, so the Interastral Peace Corporation named it the Cancer of All Worlds.
addd2742d02a3a7e.Speaker: Welt

a3cd64e5e1ecc4c5.ContentText: They are an army ruled by the Aeon of Destruction, Nanook.
a3cd64e5e1ecc4c5.Speaker: Welt

4a852aef5dac1e74.ContentText: As Nanook's followers, they stand against all life and civilization and execute the will of Destruction, disseminating chaos and calamity.
4a852aef5dac1e74.Speaker: Welt

cd4e1f545ce56bdc.ContentText: Their actions cannot be explained by reason, because their only motivation and purpose is to destroy.
cd4e1f545ce56bdc.Speaker: Welt

38cc394b7b9eb76d.ContentText: The Fragmentums are a phenomenon of corrosion.
38cc394b7b9eb76d.Speaker: Welt

0ad99b4488ab77ea.ContentText: The mainstream school of thought is that Stellarons catalyzed the appearance of Fragmentums.
0ad99b4488ab77ea.Speaker: Welt

8c60cd3c451dc1f3.ContentText: All matter and space that comes into contact with the Fragmentum will be turned into Fragmentum creations.
8c60cd3c451dc1f3.Speaker: Welt

7e4abf7540cdb520.ContentText: However, you don't have to feel too burdened. At the very least, the current state of the Stellaron in your body is very stable and will not cause distortion to the outside.
7e4abf7540cdb520.Speaker: Welt

b4b9a8a7f75b6fb2.ContentText: I'm still young. I don't wanna die!

e67f86aeed8f1695.ContentText: Tsk, time to make another loan repayment...

955d36388b4b0ec1.ContentText: If something should happen to me...

ee9611ce116b42b7.ContentText: Hello, and welcome to the space station.

8d0a91a0fa35aa4e.ContentText: Are you still in the mood to read a book?

729b3ea09b071f3b.ContentText: I've always wanted to be a scientist ever since I was little.

9d1370b814ba9e44.ContentText: When I first came here, I took a photo together with it.

798d48a7520cfc01.ContentText: Is this second-hand radiometer for sale?

021ee3d29720cae6.ContentText: It's so easy to get tired these days.

1f07aaafd189c7d5.ContentText: Why is there never any time for nonsense in your briefings?

3b2228305cb7d51e.ContentText: Have you figured out how to express yourself?

0250744026cedc55.ContentText: How does an innovative new coffee end up making money?

1d4d98eaa1ad13e4.ContentText: The notice said that we have to confirm receipt.

4450674b0b321a15.ContentText: Gimme your thoughts about my latest love poem.

128a894414fe7332.ContentText: You mean "Your Voice is Like an Alarm"?

1e66d96cd09b2928.ContentText: The strange voice is saying something over and over. You trace it back to the source and listen carefully...

88f227524501efef.ContentText: The meaning of the strange voice became clear inside your head: "And you shall be crowned Emperor of the Tottonids..."

dc72259dd5ca361a.Speaker: March 7th
dc72259dd5ca361a.ContentText: Ahem! Hello, {NICKNAME}. Welcome aboard the Astral Express. My name is March 7th, I'm one of the passengers. We'll be working together. First, we need to take your induction photo... Did that scare you! Just a joke~

39dd43a60713241d.Speaker: March 7th
39dd43a60713241d.ContentText: Ah! You're just in time — we haven't taken our selfie today.

caf929aee576b04c.Speaker: March 7th
caf929aee576b04c.ContentText: I'm gonna get some rest after I've sorted these photos. Don't stay up all night playing video games again!

fdb1e3c785fcf711.Speaker: March 7th
fdb1e3c785fcf711.ContentText: I came up with my name myself, but some people just call me March... Which do you prefer?

7bf489cfc95cd990.Speaker: March 7th
7bf489cfc95cd990.ContentText: Maybe my past isn't behind me, but in front of me. That's why I'm gonna keep going forward, one stop at a time... train or no train.

514677b84f7c0277.Speaker: March 7th
514677b84f7c0277.ContentText: Ahh, juice... If I say the word, I get a craving. If I get a craving, I wanna drink some. And if I drink some... Ahh... I can't stop!

cc2315c08ff8ae6e.Speaker: March 7th
cc2315c08ff8ae6e.ContentText: Of course photos aren't reality, but if you have enough of them, doesn't reality come a little closer?

e99567532fc7bddb.Speaker: March 7th
e99567532fc7bddb.ContentText: Taking pictures. Writing in my diary. What else is there to say~?

67a0f55b72f83492.Speaker: March 7th
67a0f55b72f83492.ContentText: I get really bored when no one's talking to me. When we're on the Express, Himeko and Mr. Yang are pretty busy, but Dan Heng's usually free. He doesn't like chatting though...

264d3e011e4de9e0.Speaker: March 7th
264d3e011e4de9e0.ContentText: Every time I'm done sorting my album and look out the window, I always want to take another picture... Even though I've seen the view a thousand times, I still feel happy looking at the stars like this.

d41c97fa165fb361.Speaker: March 7th
d41c97fa165fb361.ContentText: No matter how disgusting the dish, you gotta summon your trailblazing spirit and face it! Not gonna lie though, jellied eels and Himeko's coffee are pretty tough to stomach...

75519de03a67529c.Speaker: March 7th
75519de03a67529c.ContentText: ...Dan Heng got on the train before me. He never mentioned his past... If you get the chance, why don't you ask him about it?

e435b7d75c03c72d.Speaker: March 7th
e435b7d75c03c72d.ContentText: Ahh, beautiful Himeko. She's sensible, reliable, and elegant. It's great to have her as the navigator... When I'm grown up, I'm gonna be just like her! I like the now me too though~

b2dc19d0662babaa.Speaker: March 7th
b2dc19d0662babaa.ContentText: I heard Mr. Yang was once the leader of a secret organization and saved a whole planet! Not to mention he's been a teacher, and even a storyboard artist! *sigh* He must be an alien or something...

cbf635f986ea483c.Speaker: Dan Heng
cbf635f986ea483c.ContentText: I should reintroduce myself. My name is Dan Heng — I'm the guard on the Express. I also administer the train's data bank.

364a63defb2195d3.Speaker: Dan Heng
364a63defb2195d3.ContentText: I updated the data bank entries today if you wanted to look anything up.

b4c331e73eaf4bca.Speaker: Dan Heng
b4c331e73eaf4bca.ContentText: Time to turn in already...? Thanks for the reminder. It's easy to lose track of time in the archives — before you know it, a whole day's gone by... See you tomorrow.

7cf1d61a6ad0de80.Speaker: Dan Heng
7cf1d61a6ad0de80.ContentText: I come from an alliance, and was born on a grand and beautiful ship that I barely had the chance to see... I can never return.

26314401b57d81e7.Speaker: Dan Heng
26314401b57d81e7.TitleText: About Self: Reason for Boarding the Express
26314401b57d81e7.ContentText: At that time, I had nowhere to go but the Express.

d603b010eee35281.Speaker: Dan Heng
d603b010eee35281.ContentText: Cloud-Piercer is always with me. For my safety, and the safety of everyone else.

7861a208bd6b3dde.Speaker: Dan Heng
7861a208bd6b3dde.ContentText: It's not really a hobby, but I used to read a lot...

c30f5fae432d1da5.Speaker: Dan Heng
c30f5fae432d1da5.ContentText: If you're not there to look something up, then please don't enter the archives. It's not a place for chitchat.

26b5b90f7dcde125.Speaker: Dan Heng
26b5b90f7dcde125.ContentText: As vast as the universe is, it cannot change its past.

7d402b2832f378b6.Speaker: Dan Heng
7d402b2832f378b6.ContentText: Once there are sufficient records in the data bank, the flow of individuals will link together seemingly independent events.

1870a5b54dd1fdd4.Speaker: Dan Heng
