1870a5b54dd1fdd4.ContentText: March's weakness is that she likes to get involved in other people's business. ...Perhaps that's also her strength.

cc449b074f0cfd02.Speaker: Dan Heng
cc449b074f0cfd02.ContentText: If you have questions about the Express, Himeko can give you the best answer.

258c8cfdd34d29cb.Speaker: Dan Heng
258c8cfdd34d29cb.ContentText: Mr. Yang is a very compassionate person, but thankfully he doesn't pry.

7c16ff168872c154.Speaker: Dan Heng
7c16ff168872c154.ContentText: My intuition tells me that it would be unwise to provoke the conductor.

157a08f34726ecb8.Speaker: Himeko
157a08f34726ecb8.ContentText: Welcome aboard, {NICKNAME}. I'm Himeko, navigator of the Astral Express. I'm sure we're about to embark on a fascinating journey together.

d82896db326fc4bf.Speaker: Himeko
d82896db326fc4bf.ContentText: Hey there. Tired? How about a coffee?

2a5934e23a5dedd6.Speaker: Himeko
2a5934e23a5dedd6.ContentText: Relax, Pom-Pom and I are here to take care of the train.

7a8688d300f7aff4.Speaker: Himeko
7a8688d300f7aff4.TitleText: About Self: Relationship With the Astral Express
7a8688d300f7aff4.ContentText: The Express and I are like old friends — we've helped each other a lot. I fixed it so that it could get back to its original route, and in return it takes me to unknown frontiers.

276316ba4eb6f46b.Speaker: Himeko
276316ba4eb6f46b.ContentText: As far as malfunctions on the train are concerned, I've usually dealt with them before you guys even realize anything's amiss.

d3cec2c985385645.Speaker: Himeko
d3cec2c985385645.ContentText: I'm speculating, but I think the Express departs from Akivili's home world and returns there before starting the journey anew. So the Express doesn't have a "final stop" per se — it's up to you where you disembark.

795da4c156777222.Speaker: Himeko
795da4c156777222.ContentText: I have a knack for blending different coffee beans. Can I make you a cup? I recommend not adding milk — black coffee is proper coffee.

3819932ea20904a1.Speaker: Himeko
3819932ea20904a1.ContentText: Seems like only Dan Heng has a kind word for my coffee. What do you think? ...Well, I've always thought that bitter is better...

63c424bf3b2630a9.Speaker: Himeko
63c424bf3b2630a9.ContentText: When people live together it seems like nobody ever changes. Only when they're away from each other for a long time do surprising transformations occur...

45ea66958dd698d2.Speaker: Himeko
45ea66958dd698d2.ContentText: When we scour the universe for the things we seek, most of the time it's less of a "Eureka, I found it!" moment and more of a "Is this it? What if I'm wrong?" moment.

8db13935acdc1720.Speaker: Himeko
8db13935acdc1720.ContentText: If I woke up on the Express without any memories, there's no way I'd recover as quickly as March has. I admire her for that, but I also worry about her... If I'm ever too busy, please do take the time to chat with her.

f37ff6b66ed9eb46.Speaker: Himeko
f37ff6b66ed9eb46.ContentText: Dan Heng is the cautious type — I think he's gotten used to doing things by himself. He doesn't like to bother or inconvenience others. That's why I asked him to be the train's guard and maintain the data bank. I don't think he'd have joined us if there wasn't anything for him to do.

78a358ae2e5d3f2f.Speaker: Himeko
78a358ae2e5d3f2f.ContentText: I think Welt's anxious that he can't keep up with you youngsters, but he sure seems young at heart to me...

0e190ac8b9f82c68.Speaker: Himeko
0e190ac8b9f82c68.ContentText: To Pom-Pom, I'll always be the train's mechanic, haha.

b81aba76bdba2511.Speaker: Welt
b81aba76bdba2511.ContentText: Hi, I'm Welt Yang. If there's something you need help with, you can come find me anytime.

868bec6fc7b5dc6e.Speaker: Welt
868bec6fc7b5dc6e.ContentText: Hm? Still half asleep? Don't force yourself. You should get some more rest.

0baf4e6787393077.Speaker: Welt
0baf4e6787393077.ContentText: Can't sleep? I understand — inspiration always comes knocking in the small hours. It's hard to ignore, right?

f4461a553ed0521d.Speaker: Welt
f4461a553ed0521d.ContentText: I was an animator for eight years — my life was pretty routine. I guess it was a little dull compared with adventuring, but work is a very worthwhile thing. It brings dreams to life.

96dafc4d0d87641a.Speaker: Welt
96dafc4d0d87641a.TitleText: About Self: Reason for Boarding the Express
96dafc4d0d87641a.ContentText: *sigh* It's a long story, and it involves a lot of people and incidents that everyone would like to forget about, haha. Best not to talk about it. In essence, I got lost in the universe, but was fortunate enough to come across Himeko driving the Express.

8562005e1d33de4c.Speaker: Welt
8562005e1d33de4c.ContentText: Oh, there's a lot to say there. They only aired that series on my home world — I don't know if there's anywhere else in the universe that'd have it... I can use my mimicry power to show you a few episodes, but I can't guarantee the resolution.

4473ae46056a8163.Speaker: Welt
4473ae46056a8163.ContentText: Researching history and producing animations... I'd say they go hand in hand.

ea38703dd6d6f628.Speaker: Welt
ea38703dd6d6f628.ContentText: Y'know {NICKNAME}, you remind me of the main character in a cartoon or something — you seem to attract companions out of thin air... *sigh* I hope you don't mind me saying that. It's just... it seems like my own chances of going on an adventure have plummeted again...

0f940168e563a62a.Speaker: Welt
0f940168e563a62a.ContentText: My home was corroded by a force known as Honkai, but that hasn't stopped it from being a warm and beautiful world.

30d47f929597ade1.Speaker: Welt
30d47f929597ade1.ContentText: Do you know how the followers of Qlipoth the Preservation became the Interastral Peace Corporation? The Aeon wanted to build a wall, and humanity started searching for building materials so they could follow in Qlipoth's footsteps... it's pretty funny when you think about it.

434a8a345ae9d769.Speaker: Welt
434a8a345ae9d769.ContentText: March is curious about everything, and she's always getting me to do combat poses. She thinks I pull them off pretty well, apparently. You think so too? Hmm...

40ed9f6fdb3bc1ad.Speaker: Welt
40ed9f6fdb3bc1ad.ContentText: He's safe. I know he has his doubts... but he's one of the crew now. Himeko and I won't let anyone harm him.

d2098578b99f4d1c.Speaker: Welt
d2098578b99f4d1c.ContentText: Himeko's the kind of person that... gives off her own light. Even though we're traveling across the train's old route, you can see Himeko's dreams flashing before her eyes when you look at her. It's almost as if she's been on the train from the very beginning — always moving starward.

94813360a4b91933.Speaker: Welt
94813360a4b91933.ContentText: Pom-Pom's always there to lend a helping hand, but I'd refrain from teasing them if I were you. The last person that did that...

6f14bdd37a1e92d7.Speaker: Arlan
6f14bdd37a1e92d7.ContentText: Hello, {NICKNAME}. I'm Arlan, I head up the Security Department on Herta Space Station. I'll be in charge of your safety during your time here.

ee814fed68007370.Speaker: Arlan
ee814fed68007370.ContentText: Seed Isle's latest flavors of dried earthworm hit the shelves today — we should head over before the queue starts. The early bird catches the... anyway.

703ea9e524a090f1.Speaker: Arlan
703ea9e524a090f1.ContentText: You should have some mixed vegetable juice before bed — it helps you sleep. Well, I'm on night duty tonight. See you tomorrow.

a7d91db1f84fe3c3.Speaker: Arlan
a7d91db1f84fe3c3.ContentText: We've held the Space Station Peppy-Finding Contest nine times so far, and I've... I've won it nine times in a row.

5263ebbb774f45fa.Speaker: Arlan
5263ebbb774f45fa.ContentText: I try to be inconspicuous when I'm on patrol. That way, I can avoid disturbing the researchers while they work and observe their utmost concentration.

3d84efcc8418962c.Speaker: Arlan
3d84efcc8418962c.ContentText: You should keep your sword sharp at all times.

ac6909c3a5b50afd.Speaker: Arlan
ac6909c3a5b50afd.ContentText: Oh, man! The phone case shipping location is too far from the space station — you have to buy <unbreak>5000</unbreak> units for them to deliver... Wait, please don't tell Lady Asta that.

6a547ba0b31dc53f.Speaker: Arlan
6a547ba0b31dc53f.ContentText: There are some sword fragments housed here on the space station, but I can't find them in the pictographic index... They must be pretty special.

bc8519a7bb0bee56.Speaker: Arlan
bc8519a7bb0bee56.ContentText: I heard the researchers say that there are some curios that actively requested to come to the space station.

8b294b99f58249e6.Speaker: Arlan
8b294b99f58249e6.ContentText: *sigh* ...I don't know why, but it seems like I manage to annoy Lady Asta fairly regularly.

0ce6ad91b22274cf.Speaker: Arlan
0ce6ad91b22274cf.ContentText: I'm different from the researchers — I'm not what you'd call a "follower" of Madam Herta — but she still lets me work here.

09bd2ae292027874.Speaker: Asta
09bd2ae292027874.ContentText: Hi, {NICKNAME}! The name's Asta, I'm the lead researcher on Herta Space Station. I'll be sure to let you know if I need your help... Don't worry, I think you'll be hearing from me.

b699b8c9dfc1bceb.Speaker: Asta
b699b8c9dfc1bceb.ContentText: *yawn* You're here! The observation matrix we adjusted should have some results for us now. Free to take a look?

089446d0e7823aa2.Speaker: Asta
089446d0e7823aa2.ContentText: Is that the time? Time flies when you're working hard.

675f38eac37a8d3f.Speaker: Asta
675f38eac37a8d3f.ContentText: *sigh* Even if I never kept in touch with any of my relatives, they would find their way over here.

b98fd6f1cb68b656.Speaker: Asta
b98fd6f1cb68b656.ContentText: You heard right! If I don't work hard, I'll have to go back and inherit the family fortune... *sigh*

29d404fa97b4fbb9.Speaker: Asta
29d404fa97b4fbb9.ContentText: ...I haven't written a single word yet... But it won't take long once I get started!

a4b0ab02d831b538.Speaker: Asta
a4b0ab02d831b538.ContentText: "The space station is merely Herta's toy box." That's by no means an inaccurate statement. But this is Herta we're talking about — her toys are pretty dangerous~

d769551b78b7e1ed.Speaker: Asta
d769551b78b7e1ed.ContentText: Continuously channeling funds into constructing the space station, improving employee benefits, creating a positive feedback loop... Ahem, as well as satisfying the lead researcher's — that is to say my — indispensable shopping needs.

6beb3b2459fe965c.Speaker: Asta
6beb3b2459fe965c.ContentText: If only Madam Herta could pay a visit to the space station more often — the researchers are clearly her followers.

8480ff9d27ecbb7c.Speaker: Asta
8480ff9d27ecbb7c.ContentText: When I first got to the space station, the researchers had prepared a room for me. I—I was really grateful, but it was far away from everyone else. That was a bit disheartening.

efff199446a6060d.Speaker: Asta
efff199446a6060d.ContentText: Even the monitoring room is being monitored.

69e8fb8adcd0480a.Speaker: Asta
69e8fb8adcd0480a.ContentText: Arlan's always saying stuff like, "all of you must heed Lead Researcher Asta's judgment!" Then when I remind him that that includes him, he says, "don't worry, I have my own judgment."

eed52d829c240813.Speaker: Asta
eed52d829c240813.ContentText: If there's anyone who thinks they can be as headstrong as Madam Herta, I'd recommend they consider whether or not they possess her intelligence first.

4830367e2f3fc0e5.Speaker: Herta
4830367e2f3fc0e5.ContentText: This is Herta. I'm busy right now. This is my ranged puppet's automated-response mode: Hello everyone. Hope you have a wonderful day. Goodbye.

edbe1876007d29c2.Speaker: Herta
edbe1876007d29c2.ContentText: Why not come around today and help me with my research? You'll be the subject, by the way.

47060a6c84bd558b.Speaker: Herta
47060a6c84bd558b.ContentText: *sigh* I've lost interest in your research potential for today. See you tomorrow.

9ebaa896e4655876.Speaker: Herta
9ebaa896e4655876.ContentText: What do you make of it? It's about seventy percent similar to how I looked as a child.

f4658a8d6592fddf.Speaker: Herta
f4658a8d6592fddf.ContentText: Best not to ponder, you'll be scratching your chin all day.

89db7ca7f12e5758.Speaker: Herta
89db7ca7f12e5758.ContentText: The good thing about this club is that it doesn't ask me for anything. In fact, it doesn't even care if I'm a member.

0b98d69fadce74d9.Speaker: Herta
0b98d69fadce74d9.ContentText: Why do I get to visit an Aeon? I'm Herta, that's why.

51160cc972fb387c.Speaker: Herta
51160cc972fb387c.ContentText: If you're not solving problems or writing up contributions, then don't blame me if your life is boring.

bc9426c091b4830d.Speaker: Herta
bc9426c091b4830d.ContentText: I'm perfect enough already. What else do I need to prove? Of course, I could write a few more books... but what would I get out of that? Why should I bother?

dd1d16d690b148e6.Speaker: Herta
dd1d16d690b148e6.ContentText: The Intelligentsia Guild is always able to find a way to support their case, writing enough "scholarship" in one night to fill a library... This is a problem.

5de764bca2fe7455.Speaker: Herta
5de764bca2fe7455.ContentText: The Lord of Silence erased the eyes from the portrait, but drew everyone's attention in the process.

4d6144df5cfd8e49.Speaker: Herta
4d6144df5cfd8e49.ContentText: Asta provided financial assistance to a few exceptional children — I assume Arlan was one of them.

9f91aae664eb5788.Speaker: Herta
9f91aae664eb5788.ContentText: If my other collections had people like Asta watching over them, I could take a hands-off approach.

5eda78ce4d5173cf.Speaker: Herta
5eda78ce4d5173cf.ContentText: I give her the most boring things, and then she gives them back to me and they're suddenly interesting.

6fc0e8436c218358.Speaker: Bronya
6fc0e8436c218358.ContentText: My name is Bronya Rand, heir to Belobog's supreme guardian and acting commander of the Silvermane... Apologies, I'm used to introducing myself like that — you can call me Bronya.

da4af628e08629df.Speaker: Bronya
da4af628e08629df.ContentText: I had a nightmare last night... S—Sorry, I'm not fully awake yet.

84a014325f588476.Speaker: Bronya
84a014325f588476.ContentText: I'd like to walk around a bit more... Don't worry, I won't go far. See you tomorrow.

800fe820b1f2f014.Speaker: Bronya
800fe820b1f2f014.ContentText: Sometimes I feel like I don't represent myself... that I'm a symbol in human form, and anyone could have been given the title of "heir to the supreme guardian." I don't know where the feeling comes from, but I hope it doesn't become the truth.

2e15a219aa32ece5.Speaker: Bronya
2e15a219aa32ece5.ContentText: The Architects built us a fortress to keep the blizzards at bay, but we must never forget that those blizzards are still on the horizon.

2ceb7607ffb0818b.Speaker: Bronya
2ceb7607ffb0818b.ContentText: The faint singing that emanates from Golden Theater, the sound of hurried footsteps in the early morning, the night-time tranquility of Qlipoth Fort... I know they might seem contradictory, but I like all of them.

d3a384117b7055c2.Speaker: Bronya
d3a384117b7055c2.ContentText: You have to suppress your anger during an interrogation, or you might find yourself using... indelicate vocabulary.

c4c839ee10f422c9.Speaker: Bronya
c4c839ee10f422c9.ContentText: When you've been on the front line for a while, you start to get an overwhelming urge to return to the guardian's residence and rest. But then as soon as you're lying in bed, all your worries about the front line come to the fore... Perhaps that's the "responsibility" that mother used to talk about.

a3887bc460c161f2.Speaker: Bronya
a3887bc460c161f2.ContentText: I heard the Solwarm Festival was first established to celebrate the arrival of spring, but Belobog citizens these days just see it as a few days off... I want to bring the original meaning back again.

3da2f27c530445c1.Speaker: Bronya
3da2f27c530445c1.ContentText: Captain Gepard...? I think he could accurately be described as Belobog's iron wall. In this city, it's more difficult to defend than go on the offensive.

e4911885cef1d1c0.Speaker: Bronya
e4911885cef1d1c0.ContentText: I remember I'd be there when mother and the rest of them would convene, and Serval would always patiently answer any questions I had... *sigh* I'm starting to feel like that was a long, long time ago.

54840be544a7dd66.Speaker: Bronya
54840be544a7dd66.ContentText: Whenever I praise her, she does her utmost to keep a straight face and hide any trace of happiness she might be feeling... I can tell, because I've practiced the same thing.

d6416ddd0148084f.Speaker: Bronya
d6416ddd0148084f.ContentText: I have deep respect for my mother, but she's no longer how I remember her. Perhaps I never realized who she truly was...

16f89ff518e1ec08.Speaker: Bronya
16f89ff518e1ec08.ContentText: Our first encounter may have been a bit of a disaster, but it was also the start of a new future... Haha, if Seele heard this she'd probably say I was giving one of my Overworld princess speeches.

dc304a19078f74e6.Speaker: Gepard
dc304a19078f74e6.ContentText: My name is Gepard Landau, I'm a captain of the Silvermane Guards. If you discover anything suspicious in the city, you can always report it to me.

4c747821d3dbba49.Speaker: Gepard
4c747821d3dbba49.ContentText: You're here. I just finished training.

9ea4de28dbc98388.Speaker: Gepard
9ea4de28dbc98388.ContentText: My apologies, I still have an assignment to attend to. I'll have to see you off from here.

2b34b9f823a8f972.Speaker: Gepard
2b34b9f823a8f972.ContentText: As a Silvermane Guard, I observe the oath not because I fear to go against it, but because I am obliged to uphold it.

b08e2befe359f7bb.Speaker: Gepard
b08e2befe359f7bb.ContentText: Belobog is far from buried in the snow curtain. This city is the planet's last bastion against the ferocity of the Eternal Freeze.

5cfa97ff19dca055.Speaker: Gepard
5cfa97ff19dca055.ContentText: I grow flowers, *sigh* ...It's just that I'm not very good at it.

db065e075d0d76c4.Speaker: Gepard
db065e075d0d76c4.ContentText: My sister's songs are very popular among the Guards — there's always someone singing one when we're off duty. Recently I've found myself humming them without realizing, even when I'm on duty... *sigh*

4b096669579e7757.Speaker: Gepard
4b096669579e7757.ContentText: The Landau family has had the honor and responsibility of serving the supreme guardians for generations. Only by becoming a shield for the people is one worthy of the title "Architect."

1979986261987aac.Speaker: Gepard
1979986261987aac.ContentText: Lately, many children have come to ask me how to become a captain... *sigh* To be honest, the best advice I can give is to keep training and have a balanced diet.

c01bbc528c2bbdd7.Speaker: Gepard
c01bbc528c2bbdd7.ContentText: Lady Bronya has ventured deep into the most dangerous regions of the front line with us — many times for that matter.

3e5e5a5acf8b92ce.Speaker: Gepard
3e5e5a5acf8b92ce.ContentText: Many people seem to like talking about how my sister changed since she left the Guards, but in reality... she's exactly the same person.

ca75f883458057f0.Speaker: Gepard
ca75f883458057f0.ContentText: I heard my sister started asking Pela to look after my flowers when I'm away... I hope it's not too much trouble for her.

4c33527b02207571.Speaker: Gepard
4c33527b02207571.ContentText: I've always firmly believed that no one knows this city better or loves it more than the supreme guardian.

c94c04719afe4c4e.Speaker: Gepard
c94c04719afe4c4e.ContentText: He's very... cunning. According to leads provided by citizens, he's got his hands on a number of ancient relics. He sold off most of them, but it seems he's using others to commit various frauds.

8ae7b96767465f2e.Speaker: Serval
8ae7b96767465f2e.ContentText: Hi {NICKNAME}, the name's Serval Landau, I'm a Belobog mechanic. Of course, that's really just what I do on the side — rock 'n' roll is my main occupation.

b911876e5a6932d1.Speaker: Serval
b911876e5a6932d1.ContentText: Huh? You start work this early?

37542d769dc91550.Speaker: Serval
37542d769dc91550.ContentText: Signing off now! Time to get some songwriting going~

f53be74cdb7dacdd.Speaker: Serval
f53be74cdb7dacdd.ContentText: If we Landaus have one thing in common, it's that we're all stubborn in our own way.

48d07b3da4fcb723.Speaker: Serval
48d07b3da4fcb723.ContentText: If you wanna make sure you don't burn yourself out or stifle your creativity, then don't push yourself too hard at work~

9b37c944ad199ada.Speaker: Serval
9b37c944ad199ada.ContentText: Pela's got a lot on her plate — plus she also does volunteer work on the weekends sometimes. That's why we usually schedule Mechanical Fever's rehearsals at night.

8657cd55b9e1380c.Speaker: Serval
8657cd55b9e1380c.ContentText: Since I do rock 'n' roll full-time, I'd say my hobby is... work? What's wrong with that?

591f8b1aeace3faf.Speaker: Serval
591f8b1aeace3faf.ContentText: I always get people asking me how my workshop makes money when it's not trading. Use your brain! It doesn't!

be54620642ebb104.Speaker: Serval
be54620642ebb104.ContentText: Mechanics, research, and music are all things I'm pretty good at, wouldn't you say? But I guess making money's not on the list...

43ad9bfe029c5095.Speaker: Serval
43ad9bfe029c5095.ContentText: When Bronya becomes the supreme guardian, do you reckon she'll let me perform at Golden Theater? I'll re-arrange that "Supreme Guardian" stage show and make it a rock 'n' roll musical!

d3fc29232b4aebc6.Speaker: Serval
d3fc29232b4aebc6.ContentText: If he paid more attention to his affairs, it'd save me a lot of headaches... I guess I do create a few headaches for him too... Maybe we're even.

8558e227c48ae7c8.Speaker: Serval
8558e227c48ae7c8.ContentText: She's a flower-growing drummer and a great report writer. Name a more reliable girl. I'll wait.

33277c20bc9b6a89.Speaker: Serval
33277c20bc9b6a89.ContentText: Bronya's a good kid — you can tell she learned a lot from Cocolia. *sigh* It's been a while since we saw each other. I miss her.

c2e34e17f04f2526.Speaker: Serval
c2e34e17f04f2526.ContentText: The Cocolia I knew would sit on the roof and listen to my songs, but... not the supreme guardian.

44a0b00facef500f.Speaker: Serval
44a0b00facef500f.ContentText: Hah, that guy. One of these days he's gonna get busted by my brother.

e419262639489f05.Speaker: Pela
e419262639489f05.ContentText: Pelageya Sergeyevna, Silvermane Guards Intelligence Officer, at your service. You can call me Pela.

89a7081e0a8608e2.Speaker: Pela
89a7081e0a8608e2.ContentText: You ready? Let's start the records for the day.

34467a16ffe2612b.Speaker: Pela
34467a16ffe2612b.ContentText: The reports look pretty normal today. You can go have some rest.

a780c647b7d5a0f9.Speaker: Pela
a780c647b7d5a0f9.ContentText: I'm good at documenting information and coming up with my analysis. Acting on that analysis is the captain's job.

25c36c4ffb358378.Speaker: Pela
25c36c4ffb358378.ContentText: People don't usually notice the drummer, but if you miss a beat, everyone feels it. I like the challenge.

373c983eeb895a96.Speaker: Pela
373c983eeb895a96.ContentText: I like to go to the library on the weekend and take out some... literature. Then when we're finished reading, me and my friends meet up to discuss it.

e50bfa37e39b327f.Speaker: Pela
e50bfa37e39b327f.ContentText: *sigh* Sometimes I practice over a dozen times before reporting to my superiors, but I still can't get it right...

9540056f71fe7b28.Speaker: Pela
9540056f71fe7b28.ContentText: There are <unbreak>32</unbreak> versions of my full name circulating among the troops. How do I know? I'm an intelligence officer after all.

ffcb5354e66541ef.Speaker: Pela
ffcb5354e66541ef.ContentText: *gasp* A new edition of the fanbook "Tale of the Winterlands?" That's one of the most sought-after series out there... H—How many copies should I get... Ten? Is ten enough...?

e998fc717a20ed9c.Speaker: Pela
e998fc717a20ed9c.ContentText: In all of Belobog, you won't find anyone who speaks more elegantly or acts more like a leader than Lady Bronya.

ee521f65f6115c69.Speaker: Pela
ee521f65f6115c69.ContentText: Captain Gepard is an honorable man and very reliable. But when it comes to his horticultural skills... all I can say is I respect his effort and wish him the best of luck.

d408fe288f3c56dd.Speaker: Seele
d408fe288f3c56dd.ContentText: Hey, I'm Seele. I'm a member of Wildfire down here in the Underworld. Wanna help me forge a future for the people?

7a04e02060d844da.Speaker: Seele
7a04e02060d844da.ContentText: Right on time — let's start the patrol.

279d921958bb6123.Speaker: Seele
279d921958bb6123.ContentText: Hey, you're about to fall asleep on your feet. Don't push yourself — I got this. Go get some rest.

97de9e4a0e27dcd1.Speaker: Seele
97de9e4a0e27dcd1.ContentText: Me as a child? Hook times ten.

162144525187bf50.Speaker: Seele
162144525187bf50.ContentText: We may live underground, but we won't be buried by this city.

69b4d0431b05092e.Speaker: Seele
69b4d0431b05092e.ContentText: I like to keep my scythe sharp so I can get a good night's sleep on it.

eb72323ad7a53437.Speaker: Seele
eb72323ad7a53437.ContentText: I'm over it now, but... when I was young, I used to keep my favorite comic books in the clinic. Then the other kids started borrowing them... permanently.

18e969cc4ee1278c.Speaker: Seele
18e969cc4ee1278c.ContentText: The chief's right — sometimes a sharp blade is the only way to get people to come to their senses.

db6217b439fca6a3.Speaker: Seele
db6217b439fca6a3.ContentText: Hmm... Can I see this Pom-Pom? Sounds like a talking teddy bear to me.

065cd3efa886ed24.Speaker: Seele
065cd3efa886ed24.ContentText: I learned when I was a kid I that temper tantrums won't get you anywhere with Nat... Let's just say she knew how to give you a taste of your own medicine.

88510de7655616b5.Speaker: Seele
88510de7655616b5.ContentText: That girl doesn't talk much, but... I know she doesn't see us as her enemy.

4ba323e4ef692251.Speaker: Seele
4ba323e4ef692251.ContentText: Heh, Svarog's always going on about "humanity's endless conflicts," but you don't get peace by offering everything up on a silver platter.

c9e5c9ed32c904d0.Speaker: Seele
c9e5c9ed32c904d0.ContentText: If you need something doing, he might be your man. But if you feel like befriending him, do yourself a favor: don't.

9f36b7d5b8e679b7.Speaker: Seele
9f36b7d5b8e679b7.ContentText: Don't let her appetite for chaos fool you — I think that kid's going places.

1d7955ddfc464eae.Speaker: Seele
1d7955ddfc464eae.ContentText: I probably owe my life to the chief.

87cd83c3707d9c5d.Speaker: Seele
87cd83c3707d9c5d.ContentText: It was the first time both of us had seen Belobog's real sky... the same sky.

f0a13c5f46899414.Speaker: Clara
f0a13c5f46899414.ContentText: Clara: Hello... I'm Clara. Wanna be in my family? ...Like Mr. Svarog?\nSvarog: As long as I'm here, {NICKNAME} is your family.

50350444eade3d7f.Speaker: Clara
50350444eade3d7f.ContentText: Let's keep up the good work today!

a265a24bf2cc6596.Speaker: Clara
a265a24bf2cc6596.ContentText: I'm getting sleepy — time for a nap on Mr. Svarog's arm. Are you coming?

f5f9f63cbc4b03b4.Speaker: Clara
f5f9f63cbc4b03b4.ContentText: Memories are important. Even Mr. Svarog's calculations need to take them into account... I won't forget about you.

4f423033408baa05.Speaker: Clara
4f423033408baa05.ContentText: One time when I was playing house, I asked Perkins to get the door, and someone actually came to visit!

9f6f842407256c2b.Speaker: Clara
9f6f842407256c2b.ContentText: There are lots of interesting things stored in Mr. Svarog's memory bank, like... movies! It's like watching lots of people playing house together!

f4d0122b11c913e2.Speaker: Clara
f4d0122b11c913e2.ContentText: It's hard to get Mr. Svarog to act out a movie with me — he only wants to play trees or rocks... I wanted him to be the dad...

ce6c356f91acfca8.Speaker: Clara
ce6c356f91acfca8.ContentText: My robot friends can be rude sometimes, but deep down, they're kind and honest.

277e4f6615bfdde9.Speaker: Clara
277e4f6615bfdde9.ContentText: When Mr. Svarog's sleeping, his body makes a noise. It sounds like... snoring~

b38d00985d5c5961.Speaker: Clara
b38d00985d5c5961.ContentText: Natasha said I'm also a doctor — for my robot friends.

05bda69f654a8fe0.Speaker: Clara
05bda69f654a8fe0.ContentText: I remember one time Miss Seele saw me trying to pull a component out of a crack in the rocks. She smashed the rocks with one hand and walked away before I had time to say thank you...

b73a215d49739786.Speaker: Clara
b73a215d49739786.ContentText: Did you know Mr. Svarog's hands can turn into machines that dry my hair? Also, they can cut big stones and turn them into little tables and chairs...

38f783550613c36f.Speaker: Clara
38f783550613c36f.ContentText: Hook invited me to join The Moles. I want to, but I think Mr. Svarog's too big to play hide and seek with us...

4c4f26c42ffd2689.Speaker: Natasha
4c4f26c42ffd2689.ContentText: Nice to meet you, I'm Natasha — an Underworld doctor. Feeling sick? Take a seat, let me take a look.

dc0af8bb63b0e126.Speaker: Natasha
dc0af8bb63b0e126.ContentText: I'm in today. But that is not an excuse for misbehavior.

2b0f689a7fca65b2.Speaker: Natasha
2b0f689a7fca65b2.ContentText: I see all kinds of patients. Some require a gentle touch, others need a stern talking to before they take things seriously... Haha, a doctor should always use the right cure for the right person.

d77c0ca9b64d6d04.Speaker: Natasha
d77c0ca9b64d6d04.ContentText: A patient's medicine doesn't just reveal their illness. It also offers a window into their desires and needs.

5cd546a175fe0c95.Speaker: Natasha
5cd546a175fe0c95.ContentText: People join Wildfire for themselves, for the newborn next door without a mother, for the elderly with no home to return to.

ad02da923c983bfb.Speaker: Natasha
ad02da923c983bfb.ContentText: I still occasionally practice suturing on my old teddy bear, just like in the old days.

3bfcfd0ed34be1b0.Speaker: Natasha
3bfcfd0ed34be1b0.ContentText: People in the Underworld have gotten used to making the best of a bad situation. That's why I have to keep reminding myself that we're nowhere near where we need to be.

e4f525b69f844408.Speaker: Natasha
e4f525b69f844408.ContentText: Humans long for freedom. If they go for too long without seeing the sky, they get ill... Both in body and mind.

a43df39e87ea604f.Speaker: Natasha
a43df39e87ea604f.ContentText: When the childrens' parents are away in the mines, the clinic becomes a kind of nursery... Haha, to be fair, it's me who invites them. Perhaps I need them more than they need me.

c120570692cf2831.Speaker: Natasha
c120570692cf2831.ContentText: Seele's already become a capable adult — I can't treat her like a child anymore.

a34adf8cdd9760d5.Speaker: Natasha
a34adf8cdd9760d5.ContentText: I heard she's been looking after the wounded vagrants. What a girl... When I first met Clara, she was replacing parts for her robots like a mechanic, but leaving her own wounds unattended. It was heartbreaking to watch.

2156a59520c83744.Speaker: Natasha
2156a59520c83744.ContentText: Svarog wants to preserve humanity, but he's not concerned about what humans truly think.

f6de737da714b83b.Speaker: Natasha
f6de737da714b83b.ContentText: If I know Sampo, the last thing he wants is to owe you a favor — he'll think of any way possible to pay you back... The longer you leave a favor, the harder it is to calculate its value.

71850185e763b9f2.Speaker: Natasha
71850185e763b9f2.ContentText: Sometimes I stand at the door of the clinic and watch her running and jumping around... and my tiredness simply goes away.

92c4bfaf97967ac9.Speaker: Natasha
92c4bfaf97967ac9.ContentText: We both came from the Overworld. Maybe that's why we're so eager to turn back the clock — to return to when life below ground was no harder than life on the surface.

bad9cbd11541df9c.Speaker: Hook
bad9cbd11541df9c.ContentText: Haha, the grown-ups in the Underworld listen to Wildfire and the kids listen to us Moles. I'm the leader of The Moles, by the way. You may call me Pitch-Dark Hook the Great!

7d5179b9005babb3.Speaker: Hook
7d5179b9005babb3.ContentText: Moles, Moles, leaving our holes, brave Moles, charge as a whole!

f86447c1410638aa.Speaker: Hook
f86447c1410638aa.ContentText: Moles dismissed! Sleep well and see you tomorrow!

6bd56bf1f92876e0.Speaker: Hook
6bd56bf1f92876e0.ContentText: Diggertron used to be a hard-working mining machine. After it retired, it heard my call and became the ruthless villain-smashing iron fist!

19a4c5eaf13a4061.Speaker: Hook
19a4c5eaf13a4061.ContentText: Haha! Under my leadership, we recruited Julian of a Thousand Faces, Luka Strongarm, and Cunning Child! Everyone joins the cause!

1514d9d943d51947.Speaker: Hook
1514d9d943d51947.ContentText: Expeditions in the mines, expeditions in the clinic, expeditions on the surface... e—expeditions in the unknown!

bf69b7e2c2a706be.Speaker: Hook
bf69b7e2c2a706be.ContentText: People say if you worry too much, your head gets super heavy. Wouldn't that make it harder for me to get taller? Waaaah...

c18f286f11c9b096.Speaker: Hook
c18f286f11c9b096.ContentText: Grown-ups always say things like "you'll understand when you're older," but Hook heard you forget things when you're older! Don't believe me? Let's see who knows more stuff!

6f5e8a6809db887f.Speaker: Hook
6f5e8a6809db887f.ContentText: Hook's interested in loads of things, like... lizards that carry Geomarrow on their backs, o—or olms that survive without eating food... Natasha told me that there are flowers on the surface that only bloom once a year. I really really wanna go see them...

b559f585d4699105.Speaker: Hook
b559f585d4699105.ContentText: Old witch... Ahem. Natasha is beautiful and nice, but when she gets angry she, uhh... isn't so nice. B—But still beautiful...

5c11bb8f5028eab4.Speaker: Hook
5c11bb8f5028eab4.ContentText: Waaaah... Clara... when can you join The Moles...?

13f9984e30c65ee2.Speaker: Hook
13f9984e30c65ee2.ContentText: Hook's Diggertron is mightier than Svarog's fist! Hmph!

be990a472622b72b.Speaker: Hook
be990a472622b72b.ContentText: I run into Mr. Sampo almost everywhere. Does he like expeditions too?

15237c5fdb484eb4.Speaker: Hook
15237c5fdb484eb4.ContentText: Miss Seele talks loud, but sometimes Hook still beats her in an argument, hehe~

6e6bb6565f88f505.Speaker: Hook
6e6bb6565f88f505.ContentText: Hook loves daddy! One day, Hook's gonna dig up a big treasure and build daddy a huge huge house!

8715e60588195957.Speaker: Sampo
8715e60588195957.ContentText: Hey, {NICKNAME}! Y'know, with Sampo Koski by your side, you've got a businessman, chaperon, and problem-solving conversationalist, all rolled into one! Pretty sweet deal, huh?

0682781f75fb39f0.Speaker: Sampo
0682781f75fb39f0.ContentText: So, what's the job this time around? If you've got the cash, I've got the... No cash? N—Not a problem! Haha, just say the word, pal...

883fd217329b5771.Speaker: Sampo
883fd217329b5771.ContentText: Come on, get some rest already! What's the matter? I'm not going anywhere.

bfda45e4064aaa43.Speaker: Sampo
bfda45e4064aaa43.ContentText: Me? I'm just an easygoing fella that looks out for the little guy — free of charge I might add — who somehow gets pulled into everyone else's business with nothing to show for it! Tsk, like I say, I'm an easygoing fella.

6a6513ed854a0c7a.Speaker: Sampo
6a6513ed854a0c7a.ContentText: If you package it right, you can sell the same piece of intel to different people! That, my friend, is called "maximizing your profit."

558617fe92135cac.Speaker: Sampo
558617fe92135cac.ContentText: I'm a firm believer in "small talk brings big clients."

c46a31f5b3afd17d.Speaker: Sampo
c46a31f5b3afd17d.ContentText: I sell things that buyers want to buy — and they call me a con man! It's outrageous!

d04756949844be22.Speaker: Sampo
d04756949844be22.ContentText: You'd think in a place as isolated as Belobog, people would be more willing to share what they have. Well, it's the exact opposite. And I'm more than happy to make up the shortfall.

2ab8749cc705a245.Speaker: Sampo
2ab8749cc705a245.ContentText: Come on, how did you guys end up in the middle of the Snow Plains? UFO? Let me guess, you took a train, haha. Seriously though.

a32a73cc037d1066.Speaker: Sampo
a32a73cc037d1066.ContentText: Back when I first arrived in the Underworld, I used to bring Natasha the medicines she needed. I did that for a while, and before long it was medicines and intel. You know how these things work.

24e7d5c3c01d3b4f.Speaker: Sampo
24e7d5c3c01d3b4f.ContentText: If anyone out there ever managed to strike a deal with Svarog, they'd earn my heartfelt admiration!

2f1248ae743d10bf.Speaker: Sampo
2f1248ae743d10bf.ContentText: Our little girl in red is truly impressive. How did she get that giant tinhead to listen to her?

8142e6b57c2b39d6.Speaker: Sampo
8142e6b57c2b39d6.ContentText: If she had it her way, Miss Seele would spend less time yelling at me and more time actively trying to hit me. Can someone explain what I did to deserve her?

f18714be48777f39.Speaker: Sampo
f18714be48777f39.ContentText: Ah, we see each other pretty often — usually it's me running away and him running after me. Gotta say, I'm gradually beginning to enjoy the attention, hehe.

6c63bac688f438b8.Speaker: Sampo
6c63bac688f438b8.ContentText: We used to be good pals, but now... Let's just say her brother put in a bad word for me.

7e4cc88d9084406b.Speaker: Sampo
7e4cc88d9084406b.ContentText: My only wish is to get acquainted with the supreme guardian-to-be. Any introduction will do — even a painful one!

801d164224c80aa3.Speaker: Qingque
801d164224c80aa3.ContentText: I'm Qingque, a diviner from the Divination Commission. You wanna play Celestial Jade? Okay, come back during my work hours.

bda4685a39ac8b8c.Speaker: Qingque
bda4685a39ac8b8c.ContentText: You're here this early again? So diligent...

2c8882515b49005d.Speaker: Qingque
2c8882515b49005d.ContentText: Let's go, let's go, time to play. Are you... thinking of working overtime!?

c234546be711b2ae.Speaker: Qingque
c234546be711b2ae.ContentText: Work is not about increasing value. It just pays your bills. The trick is to increase value for yourself at your employer's expense.

43f1b663a3b1ddb7.Speaker: Qingque
43f1b663a3b1ddb7.ContentText: My Mom said I could relax in a secure job once I passed the Divination Commission entrance exam. Now that I'm in, I feel like I should be doing more...

6ea0c87b1d9468d0.Speaker: Qingque
6ea0c87b1d9468d0.ContentText: Told off by my manager? Go play some Celestial Jade. Too much work? Go play some Celestial Jade. Ahhhh, Celestial Jade is my savior!

f05e2272da348651.Speaker: Qingque
f05e2272da348651.ContentText: I can't play Celestial Jade on my own. How come Celestial Jade isn't omnipotent...

5db33406ca12ecd2.Speaker: Qingque
5db33406ca12ecd2.ContentText: There are three basic principles for happiness at work – do not be proactive, do not say no, and do not be responsible. You should give it a try~

dfa6a5fe86e0c21b.Speaker: Qingque
dfa6a5fe86e0c21b.ContentText: Fun number one, knowing there are books for leisure on the Xianzhou. Fun number two, browsing these books in the Spare Time Bookshop. Fun number three — the greatest fun — reading those books at work.

c2adecf850da8403.Speaker: Qingque
c2adecf850da8403.ContentText: I heard the general often listens to music with his eyes closed. Can we promote that in the Divination Commission? Thank you, general.

69d2bb01ccf6bd3a.Speaker: Qingque
69d2bb01ccf6bd3a.ContentText: I've heard his name. A genius boy, and working every day at such a young age? Sounds exhausting.

c3d7d909fb5c823d.Speaker: Qingque
c3d7d909fb5c823d.ContentText: As soon as I have free time, the master diviner immediately appears and gives me mundane jobs to do... It looks like I need to work on time management more...

5859bf12dca3376c.Speaker: Qingque
5859bf12dca3376c.ContentText: She's a big shot from the Sky-Faring Commission who can't rest even after retiring from the front lines. It's hard being a powerful official.

86828d19cfc45717.Speaker: Qingque
86828d19cfc45717.ContentText: I saw Tingyun stopping in front of the games parlor once, so I invited her to play a round. Tingyun is pretty and her play is entertaining. People crowded around the game table that day and the mood was on fire. The owner lost all his money — it was great to watch.

04c52b2213242c0e.Speaker: Qingque
04c52b2213242c0e.ContentText: Who? That sounds like an outsider... We've got a lot of outsiders. You'll come across them a lot in The Looking Bronze. He's probably here to seek success in "Seeking Immortality" for himself... Yes, I did say "seek" twice.

8b12792b7d297e31.Speaker: Qingque
8b12792b7d297e31.ContentText: A newcomer with the Cloud Knights? *sigh* Just go back to where she's from. Everything is so competitive here in the Luofu. You can't get promoted.

05ef1f33bda637b0.Speaker: Qingque
05ef1f33bda637b0.ContentText: I got a bit too excited playing Celestial Jade once and sprained my wrist — a friend recommended her to me. I had my doubts at first, but as soon as she'd written out my prescription, she took out a Celestial Jade set. She told me to practice stacking the tiles to improve wrist flexibility. Naturally, I instantly respected her.

d5a5ded09fd6b6c5.Speaker: Tingyun
d5a5ded09fd6b6c5.ContentText: My name is Tingyun, the Amicassador for the Luofu Sky-Faring Commission merchant guild. Please look after me from now on, benefactor.

7b34c0c87115d2a2.Speaker: Tingyun
7b34c0c87115d2a2.ContentText: Where are you going? Please take me with you~

293a32c1695554eb.Speaker: Tingyun
293a32c1695554eb.ContentText: Ahh, the time is late, and even my tail is falling down. My apologies, I will be excusing myself...

175124fa61c54d38.Speaker: Tingyun
175124fa61c54d38.ContentText: Bedtime tail care is a must. First, you need a comb that's made of boxwood, then apply some sweet ointment to the root of the tail, and wrap it in Pale Cloud Silk and go to sleep. That way my tail will be all so soft and fluffy tomorrow. See?

9c747ef2214893b9.Speaker: Tingyun
9c747ef2214893b9.ContentText: This bracelet isn't anything old, but the jade was so green and pure that I commissioned a craftsman to make it. If you ask me, it's harder to find something for myself than for my shop. Not only does it have to be good, but it also has to strike my fancy.

2c3050e954fc4e56.Speaker: Tingyun
2c3050e954fc4e56.ContentText: Peace is the best for business. It's best to work with persuadable people. For those who are less persuadable, cooling them down with a fan works wonders.

d9ffb2e24d0e253f.Speaker: Tingyun
d9ffb2e24d0e253f.ContentText: Every time I head out, I leave a letter behind and lock it in the drawers of my shop. If I come back, then I'll burn it later. If I don't... then it'll be something for others to remember me by.

de8bb51be3922e5c.Speaker: Tingyun
de8bb51be3922e5c.ContentText: If I have time, I head over to the Sleepless Earl when it's late. If I want company, then I chat with the patrons there. If I want leisure, then I watch people drink tea and toss dice in order to practice reading people. It is quite fun.

4a09cf13024b79ed.Speaker: Tingyun
4a09cf13024b79ed.ContentText: The Sky-Faring Commission are all very gallant. Though I admire them, I really can't imitate them... I'm a lot better at embellishing words and talking up a storm...

434428f4ad8159a9.Speaker: Tingyun
434428f4ad8159a9.ContentText: The purchase price of Sky-Amber doubled to support the Lord of the Preservation. However, it is up to the Corporation's fancy whether this becomes good or bad fortune for worlds rich in ores...

ed990efe2c535568.Speaker: Tingyun
ed990efe2c535568.ContentText: Most of the lifeforms I have seen with the Whistling Flames have an origin and a reason. The creatures that cannot be communicated with are the most terrifying, as it means they do not conquer using language...

58235ce3a0b8682f.Speaker: Tingyun
58235ce3a0b8682f.ContentText: The general is a true master of maximizing returns for minimal effort. I cannot match him on that front.

d2fffaebe1351446.Speaker: Tingyun
d2fffaebe1351446.ContentText: I once gifted him some items I deemed rare, and that child respectfully thanked me and accepted them. Then I saw him excitedly selecting swords in the Artisanship Commission... Hehe, children are clever little creatures.

a887c8d467819535.Speaker: Tingyun
a887c8d467819535.ContentText: Whether it's driving starskiffs or leading the Sky-Faring Commission, Madam Yukong is always present in the Xianzhou's course. I'm still lacking in my skills as a helmswoman.

26938edcaab26ba4.Speaker: Tingyun
26938edcaab26ba4.ContentText: A businessman from beyond the sky? And he's not on the Whistling Flames' records... Weird, why can't I remember him?

a75ddcc2bcff971b.Speaker: Tingyun
a75ddcc2bcff971b.ContentText: Sushang is very kind and comes to my shop everday to ask: "Is business difficult? I'll help you!" "Did anyone smash your shop? I'll help you!"...

256a6acb0031c1d2.Speaker: Tingyun
256a6acb0031c1d2.ContentText: Lady Bailu has small hands but is very skilled... I have to go lie down and have a massage with her every time I return to the Luofu.

b815593710535b51.Speaker: Tingyun
b815593710535b51.ContentText: I just thought she was a frequent customer of the games parlor, but recently I heard she is a diviner from the Divination Commission... Aren't they always busy over there? How can she have the time for a games parlor?

3657ff3f53b33dd0.Speaker: Tingyun
3657ff3f53b33dd0.ContentText: The master diviner has a harsh tone, but she speaks sense. To be completely honest, her lectures are quite memorable...

f938eec0683775f4.Speaker: Tingyun
f938eec0683775f4.ContentText: Nowadays Mengming manages everything in and out of the tea house. People say "Foxians are born to do business," but things are always easier said than done.

789bb97ebc7784ac.Speaker: Jing Yuan
789bb97ebc7784ac.ContentText: I am Jing Yuan, the general of the Luofu Cloud Knights. There's no need for formality. "General" is a temporary title, and you can simply call me Jing Yuan.

e2efe76430aed243.Speaker: Jing Yuan
e2efe76430aed243.ContentText: Ah, you're here. If you have any interesting stories from your travels, do share them with me.

8d7ab56dafae347a.Speaker: Jing Yuan
8d7ab56dafae347a.ContentText: Mmm, rest well... My apologies. There is still some work to be done and I can't see you out personally.

ab5573975cff7f71.Speaker: Jing Yuan
ab5573975cff7f71.ContentText: My past enemies are either dead or captured, and my past friends are scattered to the winds. Now that I think about it, I am indeed an old man...

2998199fa05f61f0.Speaker: Jing Yuan
2998199fa05f61f0.ContentText: A master of the chessboard does not always make flashy moves. People take delight from one flashy move that saves the day, but never worry when the entire situation teeters towards a loss.

aa2b8785b27d8157.Speaker: Jing Yuan
aa2b8785b27d8157.ContentText: Outsiders perhaps like to abbreviate the Xianzhou Luofu as just Xianzhou, but... the Luofu is not the Xianzhou. The Luofu is the Luofu, no more, no less.

286e258df5dd564e.Speaker: Jing Yuan
286e258df5dd564e.ContentText: Meditating with my eyes closed. That gets more difficult as time goes on.

470a6332402e63d5.Speaker: Jing Yuan
470a6332402e63d5.ContentText: For all of my life, I've been scared of trouble. There are major troubles and minor ones, distant ones and close ones. They need plans, preparations, and all things that need effort...

c516293a835f3a44.Speaker: Jing Yuan
c516293a835f3a44.ContentText: This spirit is called Lightning-Wielding Thunder-Clapping Spirit-Squashing Lord. It's a name I read from an ancient text, but it's too long to remember, so I just abbreviate it to the Lightning... Lord.

ce3d676cb4486e32.Speaker: Jing Yuan
ce3d676cb4486e32.ContentText: I have been bound by mundane duties for years. Not only do I find no fun in my surroundings, but I'm also becoming a rather boring person. If I must talk about something interesting, then it'd be meeting space travelers like yourself.

5030d9647116447b.Speaker: Jing Yuan
5030d9647116447b.ContentText: If you treat him as a child, he'll put on the airs of an adult. If you treat him as an adult, he'll show the temperament of a child.

7aaa0b7beacb7584.Speaker: Jing Yuan
7aaa0b7beacb7584.ContentText: I know what Fu Xuan is thinking of, so I must make her wait. If she is patient enough to wait, then that would be the time.

00034573aa7c1515.Speaker: Jing Yuan
00034573aa7c1515.ContentText: Everyone believes Helm Master Yukong had retired... They don't know that she chose an even harder path after she left her beloved skies behind.

7f38f78d982ee9a6.Speaker: Jing Yuan
7f38f78d982ee9a6.ContentText: Xianzhou is capable of such bustling trade because of how Amicassadors such as Tingyun socialize so much with the outsiders.

00f6598554cf148f.Speaker: Jing Yuan
00f6598554cf148f.ContentText: I have seen many merchants in my life, but don't you think there aren't many like him, who are in no hurry to do business?

41ae8b9d6c6aac48.Speaker: Jing Yuan
41ae8b9d6c6aac48.ContentText: A careless Cloud Knight new recruit, huh... I was like that once upon a time, but it was a long while ago.

ef7d2596647b2f09.Speaker: Jing Yuan
ef7d2596647b2f09.ContentText: It's hard being the High Elder of the Vidyadhara... I hope she remains well in this lifetime.

430e97af171a6fba.Speaker: Jing Yuan
430e97af171a6fba.ContentText: She taught me the skills with a blade, but we never became close... *sigh* In an endless night, there is nothing closer than the bright moon, always hanging in the sky.

cc0d7de58b2fce3e.Speaker: Sushang
cc0d7de58b2fce3e.ContentText: I'm Sushang, and I recently joined the Cloud Knights. Talk to me if you have any issues... but I don't know the Luofu very well either, hehe.

26488bedb9c307e1.Speaker: Sushang
26488bedb9c307e1.ContentText: No need to be polite, I can help any— Huh? You're just here to say hello? You don't need my help?

787931f4c1b13e60.Speaker: Sushang
787931f4c1b13e60.ContentText: Today was another day of being eager to help! I am very happy with myself. Time to rest!

89f53fbbc8e47333.Speaker: Sushang
89f53fbbc8e47333.ContentText: "Be eager to help those in need. Do one good deed a day and reflect on oneself three times a day." — Those words will definitely appear in my biography one day and be remembered!

05080dc4098f002a.Speaker: Sushang
05080dc4098f002a.ContentText: It's a family heirloom, and probably has a history? My Ma can swing it with just one hand, but I struggle even with two. Ah...

3661abcaff671bad.Speaker: Sushang
3661abcaff671bad.ContentText: When I was a kid, I was mesmerized by the Foxian gents on the streets telling the stories of the Cloud Knight martyrs. If my Ma didn't drag me away, I would have listened to them all day!

c77d91d3ddcaa71c.Speaker: Sushang
c77d91d3ddcaa71c.ContentText: All the Outworlders arriving at Xianzhou these days start their sentences with "There's an old saying in Xianzhou..." but a local like me can't think up any. How can this be...

c2f08f9a4744ebff.Speaker: Sushang
c2f08f9a4744ebff.ContentText: *sigh* It's not easy being born in a military family. My Ma trained me in martial arts since I was a kid and I had to get up to spar with her before the crack of dawn. I'd get so exhausted in the morning that I always fell asleep in class. The teachers all called me Sleepy Sushang...

15212da14f331416.Speaker: Sushang
15212da14f331416.ContentText: To hear a story on the Luofu is like a wish come true! After all, this is where High-Cloud Quintet became famous. All the expertise of Mr. Xiyan, the storyteller at the Sleepless Earl, is in this place.

368833749f654698.Speaker: Sushang
368833749f654698.ContentText: The "Dozing General" of the Xianzhou Luofu... I've heard a lot about him, but I feel he doesn't do anything... He's not as good as the lady general from our Xianzhou Yaoqing.

b8458d6c5c056419.Speaker: Sushang
b8458d6c5c056419.ContentText: He's so young, but a Cloud Knight Lieutenant already!? Could he have a Ma more strict than mine urging him on with swordplay?

48015f638fb91eb6.Speaker: Sushang
48015f638fb91eb6.ContentText: I think about this every time I listen to Diviner Fu talk. We are both from Xianzhou, but are we really speaking the same language?

a113415a13cba01f.Speaker: Sushang
a113415a13cba01f.ContentText: I've heard Cloud Knight veterans talk about the legend of the "Starfire Fox". As the best ace pilot in the Luofu, Madam Yukong's starskiff records remain unbeaten! I didn't expect her to talk in such a polite way when I met her~

46d83351e5386754.Speaker: Sushang
46d83351e5386754.ContentText: I saw Tingyun in so many shops and just thought she was a customer who's always buying stuff... Then I heard all those shops are hers!

f176ed4ada938725.Speaker: Sushang
f176ed4ada938725.ContentText: She's the girl playing in the games parlor, right? She must have played for years to be that good... With how good her skills are, it's almost a martial art for her.

9705cf42abd2a302.Speaker: Sushang
9705cf42abd2a302.ContentText: That outsider looks weak, but is pretty brave. If he weren't on the Xianzhou and hadn't met me, he'd totally get robbed just for lugging such a huge case around.

f04dc1393012cfcb.Speaker: Sushang
f04dc1393012cfcb.ContentText: Bailu... I—it's that Healer Lady. I heard that her crying can cure patients... that sounds impossible! But she is a Vidyadhara after all... for them, the more outrageous something is, the more possible it becomes.

ab5963b702374800.Speaker: Sushang
ab5963b702374800.ContentText: "One sliver of moonlight, nine hundred lives" — in Mr. Xiyan's stories about Jingliu, I love this sentence the most. How come the Cloud Knights' records didn't say anything about such a swordmaster...?

ecfa315e12fd17b6.Speaker: Yanqing
ecfa315e12fd17b6.ContentText: Yanqing, lieutenant of the Luofu Cloud Knights, reporting in! If you have some free time, {NICKNAME}, would you mind sparring with me? Don't worry, I won't go easy on you.

5d3e5f66df495d19.Speaker: Yanqing
5d3e5f66df495d19.ContentText: What kind of sword training will you do today? Do you wish for me to accompany you?

db81056f22a93f98.Speaker: Yanqing
db81056f22a93f98.ContentText: The sword needs to return to its scabbard... See you tomorrow, Teacher!

95469333b356c8cb.Speaker: Yanqing
95469333b356c8cb.ContentText: There are no more fitting opponents for me on the Luofu, but out there among the stars... there may be someone yet.

3bfea13d2f169c02.Speaker: Yanqing
3bfea13d2f169c02.TitleText: Chat: Swords from the Artisanship Commission
3bfea13d2f169c02.ContentText: I can talk all day about swords made by the Artisanship Commission. I always buy two swords per model: one for the battlefield and one for my collection... Buuut my allowances might run a bit short by the end of the month. I'm sure the general will buy me food and things if I nag him a bit...

966fbf455dd78025.Speaker: Yanqing
966fbf455dd78025.ContentText: Not having the title of Sword Champion just means my skill still needs sharpening, but the general said I don't need more skills, just more time... *sigh* How exactly am I worse than that Sword Champion...

ebd1054c687c6054.Speaker: Yanqing
ebd1054c687c6054.ContentText: After buying a new sword, I would spend even more effort on the scabbard. Should the body be made of black pear wood, or silk? Should the locket and the carrying ring be dragon- or tiger-shaped? And the chape, the decorative plaque... It's great fun deciding on each piece!

f991a398d027e467.Speaker: Yanqing
f991a398d027e467.ContentText: Sometimes I find multiple good sheaths for a new sword, and I end up buying them all. And yet, one sword can only use one sheath...

4bc2019fd815a05e.Speaker: Yanqing
4bc2019fd815a05e.ContentText: "What can one do after one has made history?" I once asked the general this question, but he said he can't answer it because he never wanted to be a general, and that I should try to answer it myself. Um...

aa3ae1ca4cb7c5c0.Speaker: Yanqing
aa3ae1ca4cb7c5c0.ContentText: Like the other Xianzhou ships, the Luofu also holds the Stellar Martial Competition to test the strength of the Cloud Knights, and whoever wins the sword competition receives the title of Sword Champion!

034cbbc0d0ca39c1.Speaker: Yanqing
034cbbc0d0ca39c1.ContentText: The general has no need to show his martial prowess with me around. Since he acknowledges my strength, I need to help shouder his burdens that much more!

a911adb8a237001e.Speaker: Yanqing
a911adb8a237001e.ContentText: Tingyun would ask me to write introductory pieces for blades when her Codex on Goods contains a section on them.

56e04fb19a479127.Speaker: Yanqing
56e04fb19a479127.ContentText: Sushang has a good sword, but a good sword is not always an easy-to-use sword. One needs to apply ten times more power to make it perform just one-tenth better.

fca541a96bb4587c.Speaker: Yanqing
fca541a96bb4587c.ContentText: I visited the Sky-Faring Commission once and saw Madam Yukong staring alone at the leather target for a long time. She didn't fire a single arrow that day, but perhaps she did shoot thousands in her mind.

68235ba08a6da30d.Speaker: Yanqing
68235ba08a6da30d.ContentText: So, Diviner Fu wants to be the general... Well, firstly, she needs to fix the issue where everyone just wants to nap as soon as she starts to talk.

e20d3d972097e50a.Speaker: Yanqing
e20d3d972097e50a.ContentText: At first, I thought he always fights using that sword casket. That thing looks really strange... I need to figure out a way to fight him and get him to use his skills for real...

a36dbd3e72c36860.Speaker: Bailu
a36dbd3e72c36860.ContentText: I'm Bailu, a doctor from the Alchemy Commission. Come here and let me have a look at you. Hmm... What's wrong? Where does it hurt?

4cad2b25bd700ac7.Speaker: Bailu
4cad2b25bd700ac7.ContentText: Do you want candy? No? Then I'll have it.

f702092f3c41f83e.Speaker: Bailu
f702092f3c41f83e.ContentText: Huh? I have to go back now...? Please, just a little a bit longer!

61563714b07945ad.Speaker: Bailu
61563714b07945ad.ContentText: Do I even count as a dragon? ...What kind of a dragon can't step out of her own house, and has to obey the rules of the clan? I'd say I'm more like a fish in a fishbowl!

f2721d1d8edcd11c.Speaker: Bailu
f2721d1d8edcd11c.ContentText: Lunch is like medicine — it has to have the right balance of ingredients. Two smoked patties and a cup of milk tea is a great way to heal your heart and lift your spirits!

b4e9cb0579f69d33.Speaker: Bailu
b4e9cb0579f69d33.ContentText: Study medicine, find herbs, and broaden my horizons. Everything can be used as a medicine. The rarer a disease is, the bolder the prescription must be~

2ffc990dbaa12a2a.Speaker: Bailu
2ffc990dbaa12a2a.ContentText: There's only one ailment that I can't cure, and that. Is. Being. Short... Hmph!

b059e6f3cc918479.Speaker: Bailu
b059e6f3cc918479.ContentText: Putting my head in the water, and though it is a small area, I feel I can breathe freer than before, far beyond the boundaries of the water...

2e9c8cfc0ff166f8.Speaker: Bailu
2e9c8cfc0ff166f8.ContentText: A patient told me that the Garden of Gourmet released a new dessert called Fallen From the Skies. The sugar threads are suuuper looong... But I can't get my hands on it.

3c8719ebd9552c7e.Speaker: Bailu
3c8719ebd9552c7e.ContentText: The general comes to me with ailments such as "too tired to stay awake," and then he just asks how I've been and leaves after sitting around for a while. Sometimes he doesn't even take any medicine from me...

95993be25d681a07.Speaker: Bailu
95993be25d681a07.ContentText: Whenever Diviner Fu does overtime, we start running out of sugar powder for the medicinal eye-soothing tea...

ec59cdfb12bb77a0.Speaker: Bailu
ec59cdfb12bb77a0.ContentText: Helm Master Yukong... She says she lets everything go everytime she sees me, but I don't think she has.

96c227f407e86521.Speaker: Bailu
96c227f407e86521.ContentText: Tingyun can endure more intense massages than other people, so I never show her mercy~

78e8a9ca5a993a6a.Speaker: Bailu
78e8a9ca5a993a6a.ContentText: Ah, even if I don't step outside, I can still hear her. "Be eager to help those in need" — that's her, right?

fa6fdbc2170b8473.Speaker: Bailu
fa6fdbc2170b8473.ContentText: I just wish I met the inventor of Celestial Jade earlier... This activity is great for both physical and mental health! It needs to get popularized!

5d0cb38e7b523dea.ContentText: These days, it's really hard to find work...

4231af73fb4f5199.ContentText: Mom, why is the sky blue?

03b9892eb683b319.ContentText: The price of Moo-Moo Milk has gone up again...

1378c8dd0cf46e18.ContentText: Tamila seems to be taking some time off...

12c4332c303c4547.ContentText: It's time to switch posts, buddy.

4776056a98129f14.ContentText: I want to see The Adventurous Moles!

e3bf932593ca5dcd.ContentText: Turns out there are creatures like that underground...

5da8751c29f2ecca.ContentText: I never knew flowers could symbolize so many things...

0124db9ff86860bc.ContentText: That project seems to be quite promising...

f00698ba70362073.ContentText: Ma'am, we are closed for a little while...

01334d7cea5e793c.ContentText: Go ahead and fess up, why did you only get <unbreak>35</unbreak> points on the test?

6b7909856c9fae53.ContentText: You get some whipped cream and lemon juice...

6b877b625e95c6d3.ContentText: Mom, why aren't they here yet?

6280238bc0d31df6.ContentText: Children will always need a few hobbies...

20c793b9729b2c25.ContentText: The Ball Peonies in my garden are blooming...

7e03d6c2815ac79f.ContentText: I think the Supreme Guardian is going to issue a new policy.

6984c544e58fa2e0.ContentText: This Rightful Rights Society you mentioned...

03c7fb0ba879cb99.ContentText: Ah... that no-good kid never wrote me back...

17541f3ddda16c61.ContentText: Top-shelf Olm meat from the Underworld!

12d2a50922325dc7.ContentText: When will coffee be back on the menu...

df9359bc30479740.ContentText: I think there's a novel written about this hotel...

183c7707e818dbab.ContentText: I heard there's a legend of horror about the Ding-Ding Tram...

cf5e51948a3c3a59.ContentText: Have a taste of this Honey and Oats Mousse...

6d55466ae380a63f.ContentText: When was the last time you came home!?

8aff51956e457d6d.ContentText: I'd like to transfer one ticket for tonight...

c65675b143da4802.ContentText: Quality purified water. Second glass half-price!

7e12489f7350e01f.ContentText: Have you heard? The mining team is hiring...

24f1f4cbfd484636.ContentText: The building blocks for the Miner's Lamp look pretty interesting...

f4519351e5d0308b.ContentText: Grandma, when can we go home?

39c4e6ed2f82bd1f.ContentText: Follow Hook for some yummy meats!

f613a1142d6d64aa.ContentText: Work time's over... Where should I go, then?

9383cd02dc2d8636.ContentText: I've got a headache... Could it be the Geomarrow radiation?

e9f1d78db02d644a.ContentText: I'm here with the latest in today's news...

ea00496aa2237cca.ContentText: Where's that cheeky kid gone off to now?

d1ed816b2f030c36.ContentText: Sorry, kid — they're all sold out.

1f81379e4f8c31dc.ContentText: Move aside and quit causing trouble.

250066a8ef3e5eb6.ContentText: Why hasn't he come and apologized...?

924c2f143fb6b654.ContentText: My monthly allowance's nearly run out again...

7b00d30becc2d7b3.ContentText: Are you sure this is the way?

79bd45a67e211d87.ContentText: I don't know what flowers she likes...

aaa6b882f837ce38.ContentText: What should I buy for my mom?

3ceae90d3511d625.ContentText: Hey, hurry up and give me some ideas.

23c8c8ba52c78ed4.ContentText: Drinking tea in this weather should be done outdoors...

7ae631b828a168a1.ContentText: I think I'll order another sausage platter...

0b40c79452578381.ContentText: This new one isn't very yum...

598c035c3de52a13.ContentText: Looking down from here, is this the Starskiff Haven...?

8b4223fd88ae54b0.ContentText: Every piece of machinery assigned to cooperate with the patrols went out of order...

14b129cb605f7ab2.ContentText: Hey, I just got to the Luofu...

0d2c2a885ce878c0.ContentText: How long have we been together?

7a9d3092a0f35a2f.ContentText: How are things going at the moment?

60e933d604cbe18a.ContentText: Is the old space bandit hiding here?

21c9bf4c8ead1b31.ContentText: Things really are getting weird these days.

3296708b64420f55.ContentText: My mom used to work here.

46457764c6e51026.ContentText: Travelers with nowhere else to go!

f145cf4212c21cd6.ContentText: What did you register this one as?

00d092846e0e6872.ContentText: There're lots of visitors at the Palace of Astrum these days...

43e5437ec59c529f.ContentText: My head hurts. I want to knock off work...

467707d256932195.ContentText: Abide by the curfew, and overcome tough times together.

97dde477b0b81d99.ContentText: This crosstalk has four lessons in it...

1012e2ad2c8e4768.ContentText: From inside the pilothouse came the General's battle cry~

7be2bbc28998f25e.ContentText: Master, the streets are all empty...

ccf2ce587c51bd91.ContentText: Everyone's gone home. It's time to pack up...

d152206252a59b74.ContentText: Wei told me that we need to go through a back door...

65bdfca3adbc4ba9.ContentText: Ma'am, won't you buy some of this fruit?

519661fc2e2c3494.ContentText: Minstrelsy, now that's a dated art form...

b236732b43da4f85.ContentText: It'll always have its fans. Who are you to mock it?

6189fd4adf0e6239.ContentText: Good tea. This is good tea!

687dfc8ea2bc888a.ContentText: Should I buy it, or not?

ef37d576c9addd7c.ContentText: What should we call the new starskiff models?

341f68200e8dd3bf.ContentText: What does one do for fun on the Luofu?

9549e743e2fe94b2.ContentText: Take care and stay safe along the way.

fe71efe37be9c60b.ContentText: Business hasn't been well these days...

39d7d1675da35582.ContentText: I'm here to license your starskiff...

7440b6b5262ef288.ContentText: Its capacity will take a hit.

29b25dbb81ab3667.ContentText: There are still some people held up...

cb14a45e9a9e560d.ContentText: Stay calm and let's wait for the news...

c8cd27d80a706792.ContentText: My dad is the best pilot ever!

8124cc718c0bd956.ContentText: That's not my area of education!

2ef42e6a841db03f.ContentText: It's been a long time since I ran into something this serious...

492addd3c6649f3d.ContentText: I came specifically to see Ambrosial Arbor.

c11dcdda96e28204.ContentText: I can't play. Please everybody, hands up.

476a1be400e6210f.ContentText: Hurry up, finish up this game and evacuate!

c5acb9ec4445f626.ContentText: Have you heard? The Ambrosial Arbor...

a529fdecf7a99a42.ContentText: How come I don't recognize this character?

30aba0c1cedc6940.ContentText: This is the stuff of true literature!

0263c71c0a7411ab.ContentText: Thanks for helping out on patrol...

c304bc16a4fae559.ContentText: Clean the cooker hood~ Repair the starskiff~

5f968a677be50b7c.ContentText: Can I have it for twenty?

f3e0b95505c733f8.ContentText: Everybody, please don't wander around outside!

ef110533ee26d46c.ContentText: This tree has been withered for thousands of years...

221050ae1e412949.ContentText: I heard your fur baby got lost?

619f478f767c2cc6.ContentText: But I, an officer, am different...

ddacc3dca7ab546c.ContentText: Why are you calling me this late...

5a8f1f2b0ce01f3d.ContentText: This moment right now... I ought to write a poem!

759e134cc2675179.ContentText: The literati all love coming here...

9a6bf4eb036765c0.ContentText: The crime rate is down again this year...

95c01206294874f7.ContentText: Tell the truth! You're here every time!

4800f1c21be2a103.ContentText: I've got one word for you: "Zero."

41b68b5319819c04.ContentText: I'm thinking of a number, over and over again.

008a0122de7a5a3a.ContentText: If only you could divine crime statistics...

b1cc22a551f4e3e6.ContentText: I heard the Artisanship Commission is on vacation due to martial law...

27eda3f7866afc9e.ContentText: The answer is three and three-quarters...

9448ef6f8c6439a5.ContentText: The Ambrosial Arbor sprouts, and evil runs rampant...

2f826cb0245ba39e.ContentText: Repairing household machinery daily, without fail...

a209f8629f12237d.ContentText: It is the Void. It is the Truth.

4804da5a70ac5e7a.ContentText: Error error error error error error...

ac655edf1d6b79ae.ContentText: That means we're more important than them!

0559e543f61b0b16.ContentText: I've never seen the Ambrosial Arbor behaving like this before...

5f9f55ef9edb8d0d.ContentText: The air seems to heat up suddenly, and a sticky wind grips onto your ankles, leaving you feeling intuitively uncomfortable. "Equilibrium..." Mutters a low, emotionless voice. Another whisper echoed, as if in symphony: "The universe should be... in equilibrium..."

5e7569ddf4598f13.ContentText: "The Arbitrators of the Equilibrium are giving you a trial." And the echoes continued, "For the equilibrium of all worlds, you must demonstrate your strength. The strong will be given greater opportunities, the weak a chance to breathe."

a1b6dc196125afc0.ContentText: "Passing the trial will prove that your strength has shaken the scales of power." The voice said, "Worlds will change, and thus... equilibrium. You will encounter stronger enemies, harder puzzles, and... greater rewards."

fac8b60fe53823c1.ContentText: "After equilibrium..." The voice keeps repeating, "You will go on to face yet more trials..."

a08da807b6a4ea1e.ContentText: The voice does not answer, then after a while: "It is your choice to make..." And it continued, "But in the end, equilibrium will be upheld..."

4e5c4a00aeb57b27.ContentText: "You will obtain more..." The voice said, "More of the material, more of the spiritual... more of the countable, more of the immeasurable. What is obtained will be in proportion to your strength, and thus... in equilibrium."

3d35abb44426ce14.ContentText: "Equilibrium." The voice repeated. You detect a hint of approval from that emotionless tone, "It is for this that all worlds change."

eb3b65ad3c66cae5.ContentText: The air turns hot again without warning, and that soft breeze itches at your ankles. "Equilibrium." An unknown voice whispers into your ear, "The worlds are already changing, for equilibrium reigns supreme. Rest assured, the Trial of the Equilibrium will find you." As its voice falls, everything returns to normal.

b8cd185c391d06a2.ContentText: If the shipping passages in Cloudford changed even a little, the entire route would be drastically altered.
b8cd185c391d06a2.Speaker: Dan Heng

133e366467ddeac5.ContentText: Do you two know the way?
133e366467ddeac5.Speaker: Dan Heng

c26586d8a945abb8.ContentText: Haha, I came this way, I know it like the back of my hand. Just follow me.
c26586d8a945abb8.Speaker: Sushang

851414c0948e83bf.ContentText: Um... So, silent but deadly, let me know when you're ready and we can set off.
851414c0948e83bf.Speaker: Sushang

d744b2c79c7cacd6.ContentText: ...Seriously? I just got to the Luofu myself...
d744b2c79c7cacd6.Speaker: Sushang

b34dade447419404.ContentText: Do you hail from the Luofu, young master Dan Heng?
b34dade447419404.Speaker: Luocha

38a6e7dc06f23395.ContentText: I see... It's fine if you'd prefer not to discuss further.
38a6e7dc06f23395.Speaker: Luocha

b7dc99f5f4a50826.ContentText: Ah. For some reason, you seem to fit right in here... Perhaps I read it wrong.
b7dc99f5f4a50826.Speaker: Luocha

7a522e05c8e0cac8.ContentText: I do often struggle to judge the boundaries of small talk — I hope I haven't offended you.
7a522e05c8e0cac8.Speaker: Luocha

7bb23a1773908e3a.ContentText: Almost nothing. I was scheduled to leave the Luofu when I heard there was a disturbance.
7bb23a1773908e3a.Speaker: Luocha

d48d6c0df7745503.ContentText: Miss Sushang here is a member of the Cloud Knights. You can try asking her.
d48d6c0df7745503.Speaker: Luocha

6ed5d8aa444896f1.ContentText: Her name is Sushang. She apparently just transferred here from the Yaoqing.
6ed5d8aa444896f1.Speaker: Luocha

ed187eb287a87970.ContentText: I know that though every Xianzhou ship operates individually, the Cloud Knights are all commanded by the marshal. Therefore, it's normal for the Knights to transfer between different ships.
ed187eb287a87970.Speaker: Luocha

ebee8aa0dd266dce.ContentText: Merchants do not belong anywhere. We wander and make the stars our home. But if you're curious... I am registered at the Xianzhou Yuque within the Alliance. With the IPC, I'm registered at the Star Unity Mall branch at the North Valley Star.
ebee8aa0dd266dce.Speaker: Luocha

ab003888c55d10fd.ContentText: ...Therefore, Luocha is just the name I use at Xianzhou. Outside of Xianzhou, I use something more difficult to pronounce. I'm guessing you want to know that name, too?
ab003888c55d10fd.Speaker: Luocha

3c1c1e91a3c09c2c.ContentText: The universe is a dangerous place. The IPC and the Alliance can only ensure that we travel in safety. Our personal security is dependent on our own capacities.
3c1c1e91a3c09c2c.Speaker: Luocha

a6704c7717f7e9c3.ContentText: That's how I trained my swordplay and healing skills. You are also a wanderer. Surely you understand.
a6704c7717f7e9c3.Speaker: Luocha

50fb1a8096f74bfa.ContentText: Ahh, that was some ill luck. I got involved in a conflict by accident and ended up owing a favor, so now I have to help send a deceased body back to Xianzhou.
50fb1a8096f74bfa.Speaker: Luocha

fa04a867e1769549.ContentText: Perhaps I simply attract problems... I thought I would be safe at the Luofu, but now...
fa04a867e1769549.Speaker: Luocha

12277e756428cf7c.ContentText: Are we heading off? It's not safe to linger here.
12277e756428cf7c.Speaker: Luocha

277206b863166ef4.ContentText: Silent but deadly... are you sure that nickname isn't annoying you?
277206b863166ef4.Speaker: Sushang

d44e949fb0d5b36b.ContentText: Huh, I should learn to be this easygoing...
d44e949fb0d5b36b.Speaker: Sushang

264922a6b8963122.ContentText: It's good to have a sense of humor!
264922a6b8963122.Speaker: Sushang

e50511140427c3a1.ContentText: *sigh* ...I mean, you're kinda living up to the first bit right now.
e50511140427c3a1.Speaker: Sushang

3a9cb71b0efad620.ContentText: We can move out any time. Let me know when you're ready.
3a9cb71b0efad620.Speaker: Sushang

c874b3055de2bc5a.ContentText: Hmm? Go ahead. I'll tell you everything I know~
c874b3055de2bc5a.Speaker: Sushang

760d64fe55c5d8a3.ContentText: I heard that they found an Antimatter Legion bomb, and the entire Luofu needs to be locked down for safety's sake. They'll only re-open after they've removed the bomb... I don't know if that's true.
760d64fe55c5d8a3.Speaker: Sushang

b394b7166aaa598c.ContentText: Anyways, the higher-ups didn't say anything. They just got me to come evacuate the civilians in Cloudford.
b394b7166aaa598c.Speaker: Sushang

2278d10d8c46ce5d.ContentText: Nope. I met him and you at the same time.
2278d10d8c46ce5d.Speaker: Sushang

b824a328180f80ae.ContentText: But now that you've asked... maybe I did see him somewhere? He seems a bit familiar...
b824a328180f80ae.Speaker: Sushang

649117374e9236d0.ContentText: Me? There's not much to talk about...
649117374e9236d0.Speaker: Sushang

e64e712f0b325451.ContentText: Not that long ago... but I've been receiving strict Cloud Knight military training since I was a child!
e64e712f0b325451.Speaker: Sushang

53a382c2fb10bad2.ContentText: My parents are both famous on the Yaoqing! ...I wouldn't be here otherwise. They've been training me ever since I was born!
53a382c2fb10bad2.Speaker: Sushang

d596f4bab7de901b.ContentText: Don't look down on me just because I'm a new recruit~
d596f4bab7de901b.Speaker: Sushang

4e4358910e2f8c4b.ContentText: Yep. Have you been there before?
4e4358910e2f8c4b.Speaker: Sushang

f4fb669a89ef5f82.ContentText: I feel the Yaoqing and the Luofu have different characteristics. I might be a Luofu Cloud Knight now, but I still think the Yaoqing is better... For example, when it comes to leadership, I don't feel General Jing Yuan is as reliable as our madam general back on the Yaoqing...
f4fb669a89ef5f82.Speaker: Sushang

4f6c84a2b8b043a5.ContentText: Um, actually, forget about that last sentence. Just pretend I never said it.
4f6c84a2b8b043a5.Speaker: Sushang

a5f6f6bb6dd5db36.ContentText: I'll lead the way. You two keep an eye on our surroundings.
a5f6f6bb6dd5db36.Speaker: Sushang

7da5986c82e21a0d.ContentText: Not exactly my expertise. I'm just a traveling merchant...
7da5986c82e21a0d.Speaker: Luocha

163b24c43a222099.ContentText: This is life and death, okay!? You look like you can handle yourself, how come you're so lazy?
163b24c43a222099.Speaker: Sushang

f78f7a63190c5c0a.ContentText: Bold of you to assume my appearance betrays my nature.
f78f7a63190c5c0a.Speaker: Luocha

947dcacc7d820318.ContentText: Hey, silent but deadly, shout if you see any danger, okay? Don't think just because you know a move or two you can charge off by yourself!
947dcacc7d820318.Speaker: Sushang

98a9f5b8b8c7f27c.ContentText: Huh? Sushang? What are you doing here...?

c2a788d370a4bbd3.ContentText: I have orders to evacuate civilians. See these two behind me? I need to get them out of here quickly. It's too dangerous.
c2a788d370a4bbd3.Speaker: Sushang

02fe239e2cff3f13.ContentText: You can say that again — some comrades were injured by monsters in the vicinity. They only just made it out.

7e11f1a66dab7f0a.ContentText: I'm taking up the rear — I should be out of here soon. You guys should hurry.

b9f5fc6de39d4474.ContentText: Excuse me, have you seen three outworlders? One of them's older — wears glasses — calm demeanor?
b9f5fc6de39d4474.Speaker: Dan Heng

9f516fd01dddd3c1.ContentText: Sorry, that could be anyone around here...

17980a761515593f.ContentText: Then... how about an excitable girl with pink hair...?
17980a761515593f.Speaker: Dan Heng

463f95d999cb5fc0.ContentText: Oh, I know who you're talking about. I saw them leave — they were going this way.

412056dbb43271ca.ContentText: There's supposed to be a passage... Why can't I see it?
412056dbb43271ca.Speaker: Sushang

7c7bac5ad8601c13.ContentText: Somebody used the Cloudford control panel to block the road with containers.
7c7bac5ad8601c13.Speaker: Luocha

cec26ac602ecf084.ContentText: Ughh, who did this? I'm terrible with machines and stuff... Hold on, how do you know!?
cec26ac602ecf084.Speaker: Sushang

bfbd1e96452c3cc0.ContentText: I'm a traveling merchant, I've been here many times. Now, for a Cloud Knight to be unfamiliar with the local topography...
bfbd1e96452c3cc0.Speaker: Luocha

541ba4bdc29d9015.ContentText: ...I told you, I was only just transferred here from the Yaoqing. I don't come here very often.
541ba4bdc29d9015.Speaker: Sushang

2255c6b6cc69e932.ContentText: Control panel... Where is the control panel?
2255c6b6cc69e932.Speaker: Sushang

a44938ae8937bf7b.ContentText: Let me see... Whoa, Luocha! You've got sharp eyes!
a44938ae8937bf7b.Speaker: Sushang

95c6eae7848c2748.ContentText: Luocha already saw the control panel — why is it taking this long to find it...
95c6eae7848c2748.Speaker: Sushang

be93ea849aab771e.ContentText: Do you need me to point the way for you again?
be93ea849aab771e.Speaker: Luocha

d35156d7b05064a6.ContentText: Phew, thank goodness, there's one starskiff left.
d35156d7b05064a6.Speaker: Sushang

550eb8cf6cf08f8f.ContentText: Judging by where it's docked, it must be heading for Central Starskiff Haven. Nice, we'll be safe there.
550eb8cf6cf08f8f.Speaker: Sushang

7b338c3fd157aba3.ContentText: Not really, I've just seen them before, that's all.
7b338c3fd157aba3.Speaker: Luocha
