cd9ada46d9748f5a.ContentText: Oh? What makes you ask that, young master? I'm happy as long as I get to leave this place.
cd9ada46d9748f5a.Speaker: Luocha

279ef84f07d8a15d.ContentText: I'm not a very interesting person...
279ef84f07d8a15d.Speaker: Luocha

b8bade57e63c2c8c.ContentText: At this stage, I'm just taking it one step at a time.
b8bade57e63c2c8c.Speaker: Luocha

3f082c6150417eb7.ContentText: Thankfully, as a registered merchant on the Xianzhou, I get a discount on all my expenses. In that regard, it makes sense for me to stay a little longer, haha.
3f082c6150417eb7.Speaker: Luocha

bd4aca6993a153ae.ContentText: Miss Sushang said she could show me around if I find myself unable to leave.
bd4aca6993a153ae.Speaker: Luocha

eb74987086c42751.ContentText: I had some more trading to do on the other Xianzhou ships, but my main appointment was with Miss Tingyun of the Whistling Flames merchant guild. We had a business deal to discuss, but I fear it will no longer go ahead.
eb74987086c42751.Speaker: Luocha

69b73e78ca2409d0.ContentText: Most of the deals won't be particularly profitable — the IPC takes the majority. There's only one that might be worth the journey — a direct trade with the Fanghu...
69b73e78ca2409d0.Speaker: Luocha

f12c15015da1afbd.ContentText: Let's hurry and get on the starskiff!
f12c15015da1afbd.Speaker: Sushang

ae2786a2cbafc104.ContentText: I dunno... I think we should be okay. Let's get out of here first and talk about it when we're in the clear.
ae2786a2cbafc104.Speaker: Sushang

83ae548b51fa8ffb.ContentText: There should be a dedicated evacuation team waiting for us. You can go with them.
83ae548b51fa8ffb.Speaker: Sushang

22faa0bd455f7a89.ContentText: No need to thank me, just a Cloud Knight doing her job!
22faa0bd455f7a89.Speaker: Sushang

752c06c44d4ef7c8.ContentText: Umm, that depends on the higher-ups. If there are still civilians to evacuate, then I'll need to come back.
752c06c44d4ef7c8.Speaker: Sushang

b2b672b479133526.ContentText: So this is the Luofu's Ambrosial Arbor? It's my first time seeing it.
b2b672b479133526.Speaker: Sushang

d09130de2664803d.ContentText: Clouds Knights don't visit the Ambrosial Arbor without a reason, plus I'm new here...
d09130de2664803d.Speaker: Sushang

651316e707ab356c.ContentText: The Luofu's plaguemark is a tree, while the Yaoqing's is a moon. Ha, I think we got the better one.
651316e707ab356c.Speaker: Sushang

58c9aa0476a28dd2.ContentText: ...I heard that the Ambrosial Arbor shriveled and died a long time ago... How could it suddenly spring back to life and start growing again?
58c9aa0476a28dd2.Speaker: Luocha

86672f6a14ea77a7.ContentText: The influence of the Stellaron... There's no time for explanations — we must return to the Ten-Lords Commission! I'm wounded — I need your assistance in getting there. Once we get to Starskiff Jetty, you can go your separate ways.

b6a9cea4653f7d56.ContentText: ...Well, there's nothing else for it, we're duty-bound to help the Ten-Lords Commission...
b6a9cea4653f7d56.Speaker: Sushang

4d11087562896957.ContentText: Hehe, I did not expect such a short journey to be filled with so many twists and turns.
4d11087562896957.Speaker: Luocha

cc7d9a8f506b49f0.ContentText: How does it feel, Master Dan Heng, to be a subject of the Ten-Lords Commission?
cc7d9a8f506b49f0.Speaker: Luocha

4e3af4870d0b6771.ContentText: A good answer, short and to the point. It would seem I've been unsuccessful in de-tangling myself of matters thus far...
4e3af4870d0b6771.Speaker: Luocha

3060365d5fba1c7a.ContentText: I suggest we hasten to Starskiff Jetty and send this Judge of the Ten-Lords Commission on her way — we must continue our own journeys as soon as possible.
3060365d5fba1c7a.Speaker: Luocha

4bd4f33f1b6578fa.ContentText: Uh, sorry... All Cloud Knights answer to the Ten-Lords Commission. Duty calls...
4bd4f33f1b6578fa.Speaker: Sushang

a14a25359c6616c3.ContentText: Apologies for asking you to stick with me a bit longer. I'll treat you guys when I get you back to safety.
a14a25359c6616c3.Speaker: Sushang

470ee72d6dd28b88.ContentText: Um... I guess you could slip away and find a safe spot to hide. I'll come back and get you once I've sent her on her way.
470ee72d6dd28b88.Speaker: Sushang

f4de812665e4c249.ContentText: Not a smart way to operate. The Luofu is more dangerous than ever — I can't let you put yourself in harm's way.
f4de812665e4c249.Speaker: Sushang

11941d4f9b3acb8a.ContentText: I ran your facial profile against the records in The Shackling Prison just now. Indeed, there were no matches to be found.

96804f475a8e8b93.ContentText: Don't be nervous. I ran your facial profile against the records in The Shackling Prison just now. Indeed, there were no matches to be found.

b3b3b07c799883eb.ContentText: You're the first Ten-Lords Commission judge I've met. What do you guys do, exactly?
b3b3b07c799883eb.Speaker: Sushang

97aa3b590510898d.ContentText: Our work concerns the mara-struck and the lifespans of long-life species.

c757734dd4d976f0.ContentText: Oh, hehe... Hopefully you'll be the last one I meet for a while then...
c757734dd4d976f0.Speaker: Sushang

601f5c8bb019e5c5.ContentText: So are judges all loners? You don't seem to have any backup.
601f5c8bb019e5c5.Speaker: Sushang

cf7b9f25d8ef045f.ContentText: Judges of the Ten-Lords Commission have always acted independently, each carrying out their duty in solitude. However...

41a39b3b8a0710dd.ContentText: I have a younger sister. You remind me of her.

c34140df226a4907.ContentText: Why are you two always so quiet?
c34140df226a4907.Speaker: Sushang

1b813a6e6c836cac.ContentText: You asked all the questions for us.
1b813a6e6c836cac.Speaker: Luocha

7b5a56dca703dfb6.ContentText: I fear not death, for the fate of the Artisanship Commission now rests entirely on my shoulders.

24cfe4c3f1de4825.ContentText: Not a chance! Acai, escape while you still can — there's no hope of the Cloud Knights arriving now. As darkness falleth think not what is just, to this old man entrust your hopes... you must!

13a8d14b4dacddc1.ContentText: Don't try to be a hero!
13a8d14b4dacddc1.Speaker: Sushang

7a312acafc832854.ContentText: Acai!? S—Since when were you able to speak?

ba96f754c99a69c0.ContentText: Hey! Do I sound like a dog to you?
ba96f754c99a69c0.Speaker: Sushang

23a6b8b2475d90cb.ContentText: Oh! M—My apologies, miss. No wonder I was confused, I never installed a human speech module in the little guy... No.

ca5ec6bbc31d6402.ContentText: But what is the meaning of this? I'm the only one left here — the apprentices all fled... You should probably do the same!

775585195cce4913.ContentText: You just said "there's no hope of the Cloud Knights arriving." I happen to be a Cloud Knight — wouldn't you call this a timely arrival?
775585195cce4913.Speaker: Sushang

f26953219d7a890a.ContentText: Come with us for now. I'll take care of things here later.
f26953219d7a890a.Speaker: Sushang

37c435269d947d01.ContentText: That won't do! As a senior artisan, I can't just abandon my post.

787f712b0750470d.ContentText: *sigh* Looks like we're gonna to have to resort to unconventional methods. Are you gonna come with us willingly, or do I have to ask the guy behind me to carry you in his white death-box?
787f712b0750470d.Speaker: Sushang

deb25b3019820900.ContentText: I—I... can you give me a moment to consider those options?

b96dc3431f19a41e.ContentText: Huh? Why is there still a civilian out here?
b96dc3431f19a41e.Speaker: Sushang

69e12aedb6b00798.ContentText: The Creation Furnace is utterly entangled...

c68f752296cfb43d.ContentText: Miss Cloud Knight, why did the general send you out here all alone?

b050d4f7db2ec1df.ContentText: The extent of the disaster means the Cloud Knights are short on manpower...
b050d4f7db2ec1df.Speaker: Sushang

5aa5f3015a011c76.ContentText: But don't worry! I'll keep you safe!
5aa5f3015a011c76.Speaker: Sushang

077cc73aae975e0e.ContentText: You misunderstand, it's not my safety I'm concerned about...

893a29326b378917.ContentText: A few more steps and we're at the main gate. Thank you for escorting me — we must go our separate ways.

e7f257710c16a670.ContentText: It's just a few steps away — you're not leaving with us?
e7f257710c16a670.Speaker: Sushang

08a6bb4c591969b0.ContentText: Everyone has their own duties and obligations. From the day I joined the Artisanship Commission, I've been taking care of the ins and outs of its operations without a day's rest. And today is no exception.

8dca1544189cb031.ContentText: The apprentices fled, as they should have... but I cannot let them see their master flee from peril. This is as far as I go with you — I must see what more I can do for the Artisanship Commission.

f7b926d80597edb2.ContentText: No use in trying to talk me out of it, young miss. This old man cherishes his life — he won't do anything rash. On your way, now.

d2bf8144686a9c0c.ContentText: Everyone has their duties. Let's go.

f1b93ee3b967ae0c.ContentText: You saw it, right? What happened to the Artisanship Commission?

b431eccba4832d23.ContentText: Did someone overfeed their houseplant or something?

06993ad2aca010da.ContentText: How could I desert the Artisanship Commission in its time of need?

27766c7a99a130bb.ContentText: Master Gongshu! How could you stay inside?

51ee9e921354afc4.ContentText: I—I'm afraid that if I leave, I won't be able to graduate.

1d76adbc9604dda1.ContentText: Hey, Yunche... If we switched the material for the aurumatons with whatever that crazy plant's made of, would that eliminate maintenance?

ede3c8678647ca67.ContentText: Y'know, Ziming, I say we focus on surviving today for now.

c33b9fb46771a4fe.ContentText: How could I leave? This is a novel engineering material... If I leave now I may never get another chance to conduct research on it.

44a45a803b9b2700.ContentText: Don't pay attention to my silly fellow apprentice... I—If he's set on staying here, I can't exactly leave him here alone, can I?

95382f2c53861b23.ContentText: The rebirth of the Ambrosial Arbor was bound to bring calamity... The Cloud Knights must be at the Alchemy Commission next to the Arbor. You should head the same way.

e79f7d335ba2feda.ContentText: Thank you for ensuring my safety on this journey. I will report this good deed to the Ten Lords, and if the opportunity arises, I will return the favor.

6885c5571e34c5d7.ContentText: She mentioned the Cloud Knights are at the Alchemy Commission — I should find a ship and regroup with my unit. What about you?
6885c5571e34c5d7.Speaker: Sushang

36f5f750282ec92c.ContentText: Aww, you just can't bear to see me go, huh? Come on then, let's get going.
36f5f750282ec92c.Speaker: Sushang

a5da114749cb3dfd.ContentText: You want to stay here? No, no, the Artisanship Commission isn't safe enough. How about this — I'll escort you and Mr. Luocha a little further.
a5da114749cb3dfd.Speaker: Sushang

8a6554658e1fe17d.ContentText: We are most grateful, Miss Sushang.
8a6554658e1fe17d.Speaker: Luocha

2b3a0f1be428497a.ContentText: ...Doesn't look like it wants to let us through. Do you think if I yell at it I could scare it off?
2b3a0f1be428497a.Speaker: Sushang

5be0c837a122ec93.ContentText: ...I doubt that. I think Acai is the only one here still taking orders from people.
5be0c837a122ec93.Speaker: Luocha

e7509c8a26183a24.ContentText: I've got one. Bring it down.
e7509c8a26183a24.Speaker: Dan Heng

2674030a36955c08.ContentText: Y'know, you're getting less silent and more deadly by the minute! Sounds good, let's get it!
2674030a36955c08.Speaker: Sushang

6925963bdded2066.ContentText: Hm, interesting practice... Do people on the Xianzhou have no problem leaving blueprints out in the open?
6925963bdded2066.Speaker: Luocha

47eae133e6f79657.ContentText: It makes things easier for the craftsmen. It's not like outsiders can just walk in here.
47eae133e6f79657.Speaker: Sushang

eae2f8339a8d4b4f.ContentText: ...Are we not outsiders here, Miss Sushang?
eae2f8339a8d4b4f.Speaker: Luocha

c62d7f3c2a576b4e.ContentText: "Authorized personnel only. This chamber is sac..." How do you pronounce it?
c62d7f3c2a576b4e.Speaker: Sushang

5d0ab4494ba4ea8d.ContentText: Sacrosanct. It means this place is important.
5d0ab4494ba4ea8d.Speaker: Luocha

853f2d24128e0e7d.ContentText: You sure know a lot, Mr. Luocha.
853f2d24128e0e7d.Speaker: Sushang

f18c9a522ceb9ffc.ContentText: You are too kind, miss. For one, I don't recognize that thing in the painting.
f18c9a522ceb9ffc.Speaker: Luocha

165b132cf0f199ac.ContentText: Ha, that's something I do know. It's an aurumaton — they're service robots on the Xianzhou.
165b132cf0f199ac.Speaker: Sushang

80af41126528e743.ContentText: This man on the wanted list... he's a Stellaron Hunter, right? Is that...?
80af41126528e743.Speaker: Sushang

83bbe1654c527950.ContentText: Hmph... You guessed right. If you see him, don't engage.

590ccf4dd26fee37.ContentText: I don't think this is the way.

f502f87afdd876ab.ContentText: This is as far as I go...

4a638682087c1e62.ContentText: Hmm? You still have more to do, no? Onward!

a4d5a48a373eb485.ContentText: I can't just abandon the Commission. I must think of a way to solve all this...

ca05089230314342.ContentText: Welcome to the Interastral Peace Broadcast. Good evening everyone.

2477269a5ef3da65.ContentText: As Qlipoth the Preservation's giant hammer slowly descends, its strike echoes among the stars with a deafening clamor.

eb830357a7d34c1b.ContentText: The Intelligentsia Guild's Astral Ecology School has declared the official end of <unbreak>2157</unbreak> AE and the start of <unbreak>2158</unbreak> AE.

76716ca166b3dd94.ContentText: In this new Era, the Interastral Peace Corporation will continue to wholeheartedly support the peaceful co-existence and commercial prosperity of all residents in the galaxy.

698f915feb0576d2.ContentText: The IPC will remain true to its sole creed upon which it was founded — To dedicate everything to the Amber Lord.

d0ac7aa99547175f.ContentText: Let's take a moment to look back at some of the biggest happenings in <unbreak>2157</unbreak> AE.

87694f8998550ea9.ContentText: The mysterious phenomenon known as Stellaron corrosion continues to propagate. Stellarons have blocked travel between civilizations since <unbreak>2147</unbreak> AE, and they shattered the union of the worlds that were once united under the Path of the Amber Lord.

7b0198b3141971f6.ContentText: For the entirety of the past ten Amber Eras, the Interastral Peace Corporation has never given up on our hope of reconnecting the worlds.

31be359317270a68.ContentText: With the Intelligentsia Guild's ardent support, we have begun developing technologies to bypass Stellaron corrosion. Experiments conducted across <unbreak>113</unbreak> galaxies have shown promising results.

9c4883788b8c1d2f.ContentText: The galaxy is vast, yet we are not alone. The Astral Express, once piloted by the fallen Aeon Akivili the Trailblaze, has embarked on its journey once again.

e7dfc6bbdd828e59.ContentText: These young Nameless claim to have inherited the will of Akivili and will re-establish the access routes between the stars, recreating the First Prosperity from <unbreak>990</unbreak> Amber Eras ago.

17252180cc08c946.ContentText: On behalf of the Interastral Peace Corporation, we wish the best of luck to the Trailblazers of the Astral Express.

66226cc420e270d8.ContentText: While the residents of the galaxy are plagued by the Stellarons, a new evil organization called the Stellaron Hunters has been stirring up trouble.

3864dfaa7c3b8a5d.ContentText: As we previously discussed on our program, the Stellaron Hunters illegally gained access to Planet Screwllum, which is under the purview of the Genius Society, and clashed with the head of the planet, Screwllum.

97b12acb16e69e93.ContentText: Our latest reports suggest that the criminal group has recently been spotted on the Xianzhou Luofu. The IPC's Special Commissioner to the Alliance has contacted General Jing Yuan of the Luofu to verify this information. We have yet to receive a response.

c980c5b35a9f158c.ContentText: The Stellaron Hunters have committed many significant crimes. Any one of their members has the power to destroy a planet, and it remains uncertain which Aeon the group is loyal to. They are classified as extremely dangerous terrorists.

12c4f8d35792de8a.ContentText: If you encounter anyone suspected of being a Stellaron Hunter, please contact the IPC immediately and do not act on your own. Anyone who provides useful information will be subtantially rewarded.

7092019e49f5d876.ContentText: Meanwhile, many factions have received an invitation to Penacony, the Planet of Festivities. This is the first time that the Family in Penacony has openly sent formal invitations to all galactic factions.

a3cc0cbda92ed444.ContentText: The Interastral Peace Corporation is among the factions invited. The head of the Strategic Investment Department, Diamond, has stated that we will carefully examine the purpose behind this gesture, and respond to it in a positive and friendly manner.

c63ce394cb237ddf.ContentText: We look forward to having all galactic factions join together to protect our homelands and defend against the invasion of evil forces.

25c046b565fdfdd5.ContentText: The Lord Ravager, Zephyro, had appeared at the Tia'nua galaxy. According to the Mourning Actors, that galaxy had been completely destroyed.

5bb2d5af56bed758.ContentText: The Antimatter Legion is ravaging through the Galaxy and has caused countless calamities. The IPC would like to remind everyone to remember the significance of the Preservation.

f3fa68ae6fca56f2.ContentText: Any planet with a telepathy beacon can obtain from the IPC free copies of the Interastral Peace Guide written by the Architects.

7953daa62f7b553b.ContentText: At the beginning of <unbreak>2158</unbreak> AE, the Interastral Peace Corporation would like to proudly announce that the famous scientist, Madam Herta of the Genius Society, has officially committed to a long-term alliance and cooperative relationship with the IPC.

dd702fa7135ef4d9.ContentText: Madam Herta is the third genius of the Erudition to partner with the IPC, after Member #22 Aiden and Member #56 Elias Salas. The Corporation stands united with Madam Herta to protect the Amber Lord's universe.

676a8cdf27eae108.ContentText: And this is the end of our broadcast. Please tune in for our next episode. Thank you for listening.

c055a8032aff5bf3.ContentText: If a space telescope were deployed at this location on the Express, it would almost certainly be possible to observe shorter wavelengths...
c055a8032aff5bf3.Speaker: Asta

0142fa1b42c705dc.ContentText: Mm, feels like a good angle.
0142fa1b42c705dc.Speaker: Asta

6cc114126180516d.ContentText: Sure do! Y'know, I was racking my brains before I boarded the Express, but now I've got more ideas than I know what to do with. Inspiration is a fickle mistress.
6cc114126180516d.Speaker: Asta

026ce62ced4903fe.ContentText: My thesis might just be related to the Express... I hope you'll agree to be interviewed later — I need first-hand information.
026ce62ced4903fe.Speaker: Asta

06ff3f604a41aea7.ContentText: Of course not — I'm here on your invitation. Isn't that right?
06ff3f604a41aea7.Speaker: Asta

b23f9a3c26af4f20.ContentText: That's why I went into vacation mode the second I boarded the Express — thesis topics don't unearth themselves y'know.
b23f9a3c26af4f20.Speaker: Asta

5ca7f4351bdc3ca1.ContentText: ...Of course, there are other things in life too.
5ca7f4351bdc3ca1.Speaker: Asta

b3ab18b2399ff96b.ContentText: I've been on the Express before, but this is my first visit with {NICKNAME} on board.
b3ab18b2399ff96b.Speaker: Asta

0d69ce089c40a048.ContentText: If shorter wavelengths could be observed, it'd make for a good thesis... But that's not the focus of today.
0d69ce089c40a048.Speaker: Asta

e4bc9db667d4156e.ContentText: I've been on the Express before, but this is my first visit with {NICKNAME} on board.
e4bc9db667d4156e.Speaker: Asta

46654de71aa16984.ContentText: There are quite a few curios on the Express that I've only seen in the catalogs, though I'll need to see them up close before I believe them...
46654de71aa16984.Speaker: Asta

1bec1bcfa0ec387b.ContentText: I'm guessing that's one of the prototype synthesizers. There may be a curio code on its base.
1bec1bcfa0ec387b.Speaker: Asta

99f8a9d7e41e6232.ContentText: "Omni" makes it sound pretty capable, but the Corporation released other models onto the market first. Know why?
99f8a9d7e41e6232.Speaker: Asta

30099843f72324b1.ContentText: Well, why make "omni" money when you can make ordinary money first~?
30099843f72324b1.Speaker: Asta

aae63e4c379fde30.ContentText: Oh, I don't think that's a curio.
aae63e4c379fde30.Speaker: Asta

1c70adcadb099cd4.ContentText: It's amazing how many songs are stored in its library. Someone must have paid big money to get all the copyright issues sorted.
1c70adcadb099cd4.Speaker: Asta

c70f67c3d064bca5.ContentText: Hmm... there's something weird about that sofa over there...
c70f67c3d064bca5.Speaker: Asta

b001a8c6006dd7ea.ContentText: {NICKNAME}, how come it lets you sit on it, but not me?
b001a8c6006dd7ea.Speaker: Asta

c5e63bb225e4054b.ContentText: Perhaps it has its own set of authorization mechanisms, and only those it recognizes are permitted to sit on it.
c5e63bb225e4054b.Speaker: Asta

0c20aded95367c18.ContentText: Interesting... I'll have to have a closer look some time.
0c20aded95367c18.Speaker: Asta

8dde07e551d69999.ContentText: Huh... there's something strange about that sofa.
8dde07e551d69999.Speaker: Asta

6216a52bcc33bd1e.ContentText: {NICKNAME}, how come it lets you sit on it, but not me?
6216a52bcc33bd1e.Speaker: Asta

76abbbd3099cd59f.ContentText: Perhaps it has its own set of authorization mechanisms, and only those it recognizes are permitted to sit on it.
76abbbd3099cd59f.Speaker: Asta

cff63e0f1421e73c.ContentText: Interesting... I'll have to have a closer look some time.
cff63e0f1421e73c.Speaker: Asta

3eda580635be5bcd.ContentText: This must be ancient... Is the Express crew still using it?
3eda580635be5bcd.Speaker: Asta

1697699e2699f292.ContentText: Oh, nothing. It's just you don't see things like this every day.
1697699e2699f292.Speaker: Asta

9d1ac7a790cceff5.ContentText: Phonographs...They use vinyl records, right? There's only a handful of folks on the space station who collect those things.
9d1ac7a790cceff5.Speaker: Asta

1b278dafd3ff7964.ContentText: I think they're more popular with the older crowd — I bet Gunn would know how to use them. Still, if I remember correctly, Gunn only listens to audio tapes...
1b278dafd3ff7964.Speaker: Asta

49515bb6c7224cef.ContentText: Same as you guys — on terminals.
49515bb6c7224cef.Speaker: Asta

c793f9bf0a822106.ContentText: About music? I'd say I'm more of a casual listener than a hardcore enthusiast.
c793f9bf0a822106.Speaker: Asta

37d827c7d6ce6769.ContentText: Huh... What with them being so big and heavy, I used to wonder why anyone would ever buy a Phonograph. Think I'm starting to get it now.
37d827c7d6ce6769.Speaker: Asta

dec60dd152bb8628.ContentText: It's hard to find the music you want on the streaming platforms managed by the IPC. I, for one, had to subscribe to at least a dozen of them.
dec60dd152bb8628.Speaker: Asta

39014bd9814f1163.ContentText: It's not like they're expensive or anything. It's just a hassle to switch between them to find the song you like. With a Phonograph, it's essentially just plug-and-play. It also scratches the itch to collect things I guess.
39014bd9814f1163.Speaker: Asta

8b6899e0896bf41a.ContentText: That thing is ancient... It's amazing you guys are still using it.
8b6899e0896bf41a.Speaker: Asta

2a5955d590c7ae26.ContentText: Huh... What with them being so big and heavy, I used to wonder why anyone would ever buy a Phonograph. Think I'm starting to get it now.
2a5955d590c7ae26.Speaker: Asta

ac16b7cd4d67d90f.ContentText: It's hard to find the music you want on the streaming platforms managed by the IPC. I, for one, had to subscribe to at least a dozen of them.
ac16b7cd4d67d90f.Speaker: Asta

eccee9e5650370c8.ContentText: It's not like they're expensive or anything. It's just a hassle to switch between them to find the song you like. With a Phonograph, it's essentially just plug-and-play. It also scratches the itch to collect things I guess.
eccee9e5650370c8.Speaker: Asta

795dc5b4ace132b2.ContentText: I finally managed to get some time off work and thought I'd hop on the Express for a chat with Himeko. I had no idea I'd bump into you...
795dc5b4ace132b2.Speaker: Asta

fb5137ac69af08fb.ContentText: That's not what I'm saying! I just thought you'd be on an adventure somewhere, that's all.
fb5137ac69af08fb.Speaker: Asta

25ca69c3e3643a04.ContentText: Sadly, I can't. Too much work on the space station.
25ca69c3e3643a04.Speaker: Asta

ab23a3bba314d995.ContentText: Y'know, whenever the Express stops at the station platform, I make a point of getting a few visits in.
ab23a3bba314d995.Speaker: Asta

8921661755e0a30e.ContentText: I will say, the train feels a little different now...
8921661755e0a30e.Speaker: Asta

0adec80f1280ce17.ContentText: It's almost as if you joining the crew has given everyone an extra boost of energy...
0adec80f1280ce17.Speaker: Asta

eb85c9ca5df94c98.ContentText: ...And this might sound a little strange, but that's how I felt when I first met you, hehe. Anyway, whichever way you slice it, it's always nice to bump into a friend.
eb85c9ca5df94c98.Speaker: Asta

fbd5c9a7a3cc6d54.ContentText: I didn't expect to bump into you...
fbd5c9a7a3cc6d54.Speaker: Asta

a54b578eeea6d5cb.ContentText: Y'know, whenever the Express stops at the station platform, I make a point of getting a few visits in.
a54b578eeea6d5cb.Speaker: Asta

4c0365986a66a902.ContentText: I will say, the train feels a little different now...
4c0365986a66a902.Speaker: Asta

6d4323c21a996a19.ContentText: It's almost as if you joining the crew has given everyone an extra boost of energy...
6d4323c21a996a19.Speaker: Asta

5610d7afd25fa61f.ContentText: If I get the chance, I'd love to bring my telescope onto the Express.
5610d7afd25fa61f.Speaker: Asta

fcfef5b94e4d24b6.ContentText: Not an observatory-sized one, haha. I've got a portable one — it can be disassembled and reassembled super easily.
fcfef5b94e4d24b6.Speaker: Asta

1e3f73e2fe812c4d.ContentText: It's got a small base, but it's stable enough to get the job done. I used to love stargazing with it when I was a child.
1e3f73e2fe812c4d.Speaker: Asta

3239da75e14ee2c0.ContentText: There are all kinds of wonders in the universe — you never know what you might find with a telescope.
3239da75e14ee2c0.Speaker: Asta

8b4bb46c656156c1.ContentText: The lighting on the Express is perfect for observations. Great views at the windows too.
8b4bb46c656156c1.Speaker: Asta

ef966d5749b2f906.ContentText: When you find a moment, sit here and turn off the lights. You'll be amazed by what you can see.
ef966d5749b2f906.Speaker: Asta

dedf485d2edeae27.ContentText: And if you're feeling a little tired, lie down on the seats instead. The universe is fascinating from every angle.
dedf485d2edeae27.Speaker: Asta

84a43a55004b757c.ContentText: There's no better place for looking out into the stars than the Express. I envy you guys.
84a43a55004b757c.Speaker: Asta

a8e0130b9d1ca5d1.ContentText: {NICKNAME}, if you get any time, you can sit here in the window seat, turn off the lights, and have a nice long gaze out the window.
a8e0130b9d1ca5d1.Speaker: Asta

6a0c3642b52f020a.ContentText: And if you're feeling a little tired, lie down on the seats instead. The universe is fascinating from every angle.
6a0c3642b52f020a.Speaker: Asta

eef8683a7482c213.ContentText: There's no better place for looking out into the stars than the Express. I envy you guys.
eef8683a7482c213.Speaker: Asta

1c6b560933374f34.ContentText: Hey, {NICKNAME}! I was looking for you.
1c6b560933374f34.Speaker: Asta

3f27042b3b1eb1d9.ContentText: Don't look so worried! I'm not throwing you another mission.
3f27042b3b1eb1d9.Speaker: Asta

b184e840ec6424b7.ContentText: You were a great help to folks on the space station — my job was so much easier with you around.
b184e840ec6424b7.Speaker: Asta

2fc786492fc3f9ae.ContentText: I was due a visit, so I thought I'd bring you a gift. Nothing too precious, just my way of saying thank you!
2fc786492fc3f9ae.Speaker: Asta

5df1545022e6cd51.ContentText: If you're ever free to visit the space station, please come check in on us. We all miss you.
5df1545022e6cd51.Speaker: Asta

dc33fa586646afd0.ContentText: You were a great help to folks on the space station — my job was so much easier with you around.
dc33fa586646afd0.Speaker: Asta

edb0481f6d7a51a3.ContentText: Now that things have settled down, I finally have time to pay the Express a visit.
edb0481f6d7a51a3.Speaker: Asta

401796267597355a.ContentText: If you're ever free to visit the space station, please come check in on us. We all miss you.
401796267597355a.Speaker: Asta

dbb874388790116f.ContentText: Not so long ago, I was still wondering whether I'd ever see Belobog's sky again. Now, I'm on a train coasting through the universe...
dbb874388790116f.Speaker: Natasha

712d265313294aa8.ContentText: ...Sorry, it's so beautiful outside... I got a little lost in thought.
712d265313294aa8.Speaker: Natasha

ca3f4049973c2be9.ContentText: I almost thought I'd slipped into a fairy tale...
ca3f4049973c2be9.Speaker: Natasha

a8fe821fe707b712.ContentText: I'll come and have a seat here more often, if you don't mind.
a8fe821fe707b712.Speaker: Natasha

2af2f417a3d7405b.ContentText: When I stand aboard the Express, I can feel that you and I are really the same — manifesting our own futures in this universe to the best of our abilities.
2af2f417a3d7405b.Speaker: Natasha

ad8ea631946d3de4.ContentText: Mm, everyone's working hard for the bigger picture...
ad8ea631946d3de4.Speaker: Natasha

2f81e029513ab475.ContentText: I believe I'll have lots of happy memories here.
2f81e029513ab475.Speaker: Natasha

47363eed05c4f4f6.ContentText: Thank you for inviting me aboard the Astral Express, {NICKNAME}.
47363eed05c4f4f6.Speaker: Natasha

92a4047cc38b84f7.ContentText: It's just like waiting for Belobog's skies back then... When I stand aboard the Express, I can feel that you and I are really the same — manifesting our own futures in this universe to the best of our abilities.
92a4047cc38b84f7.Speaker: Natasha

d97c400bd632ed85.ContentText: Mm, everyone's working hard for the bigger picture...
d97c400bd632ed85.Speaker: Natasha

8034061551f24734.ContentText: I believe I'll have lots of happy memories here.
8034061551f24734.Speaker: Natasha

b1ab471d3b2e99ab.ContentText: Thank you for inviting me aboard the Astral Express, {NICKNAME}.
b1ab471d3b2e99ab.Speaker: Natasha

7f0a2203a7705762.ContentText: The last time I was out in the field, there was a crying child. I'd seen him before many times at the clinic — he'd heard all my usual stories... But that day, no matter what I said to him, he wouldn't listen.
7f0a2203a7705762.Speaker: Natasha

9ce3e02d54bfef79.ContentText: So I told him about the Express, and eventually he stopped crying and started asking so many questions.
9ce3e02d54bfef79.Speaker: Natasha

1b268635981fd1f8.ContentText: Can you see the Express in Boulder Town? Why does it fly in the sky? Who is the conductor?
1b268635981fd1f8.Speaker: Natasha

da6f141d808580ff.ContentText: Actually, I didn't need any answers — he made them all up himself.
da6f141d808580ff.Speaker: Natasha

2c9fb2248873a916.ContentText: "The stars exploded, and the Express has to go everywhere to pick up all the pieces, and that's why it flies up in the sky."
2c9fb2248873a916.Speaker: Natasha

4de0304e38a7b0ad.ContentText: "The Express has lots of Express friends, and it wants to find them and play together."
4de0304e38a7b0ad.Speaker: Natasha

defc1657170b3c1c.ContentText: ...Imagination is the source of all existence. Children need only their imagination to understand the Express.
defc1657170b3c1c.Speaker: Natasha

654196e11e5a4320.ContentText: Then next time I'm back in Belobog I'll tell them I boarded the Express, and I'm sure they'll give me a hundred different explanations of how it happened...
654196e11e5a4320.Speaker: Natasha

0fa9f0da138730a1.ContentText: "The stars exploded, and the Express has to go everywhere to pick up all the pieces, and that's why it flies up in the sky."
0fa9f0da138730a1.Speaker: Natasha

b56ee2d1e4f3f7fe.ContentText: "The Express has lots of Express friends, and it wants to find them and play together."
b56ee2d1e4f3f7fe.Speaker: Natasha

0e8104c86906e587.ContentText: ...Imagination is the source of all existence. Children need only their imagination to understand the Express.
0e8104c86906e587.Speaker: Natasha

b444f6c03a71f9dc.ContentText: Then next time I'm back in Belobog I'll tell them I boarded the Express, and I'm sure they'll give me a hundred different explanations of how it happened...
b444f6c03a71f9dc.Speaker: Natasha

1fc310b7592b456d.ContentText: The vast universe and Jarilo-VI... How could you ever get tired of such an incredible view.
1fc310b7592b456d.Speaker: Natasha

f1d072b0663805ea.ContentText: If only there was a way for me to preserve this moment and show it to the kids back home.
f1d072b0663805ea.Speaker: Natasha

7357a4a822aa4ff3.ContentText: Haha, kind-hearted as usual. It's just...
7357a4a822aa4ff3.Speaker: Natasha

ed0a669eb8a518b8.ContentText: Haha, that won't be necessary — I can't imagine March reacting well if her camera went missing. Besides...
ed0a669eb8a518b8.Speaker: Natasha

de7ba8d74168f197.ContentText: Phones and cameras capture great beauty, but it never compares to what we see with our own eyes.
de7ba8d74168f197.Speaker: Natasha

5cbe46df84c8c68e.ContentText: For the children in the clinic to truly know the feeling of this view, they'd have to be here to see it themselves.
5cbe46df84c8c68e.Speaker: Natasha

e30b94e8eece18b1.ContentText: Phones and cameras capture great beauty, but it never compares to what we see with our own eyes.
e30b94e8eece18b1.Speaker: Natasha

5de83af12f4ad230.ContentText: For the children in the clinic to truly know the feeling of this view, they'd have to be here to see it themselves.
5de83af12f4ad230.Speaker: Natasha

1aa708b5c27f1e83.ContentText: Vache... if you had the chance to stand here and watch Jarilo-VI from afar...
1aa708b5c27f1e83.Speaker: Natasha

7626cbf3822fc5c2.ContentText: Oh, it's you, {NICKNAME}. Sorry, I was lost in the view — I didn't realize you were here.
7626cbf3822fc5c2.Speaker: Natasha

1bd0f4c76d011cbd.ContentText: Do you remember us walking through the Snow Plains?
1bd0f4c76d011cbd.Speaker: Natasha

b052dad04e47d1ec.ContentText: This view is nothing like the views in Belobog... If my brother were still alive and standing here on the Express, I wonder what he'd make of all this.
b052dad04e47d1ec.Speaker: Natasha

7fb398957c4ffc8f.ContentText: Hehe, I agree... It's hard not to be.
7fb398957c4ffc8f.Speaker: Natasha

6bc536a1c391deca.ContentText: Mm, I don't blame you for that. A disregard for human life doesn't exactly endear you to other humans...
6bc536a1c391deca.Speaker: Natasha

ed4c6899800428d3.ContentText: Vache spent his life looking for ways to push past the limits of the human body... but he met a bitter end.
ed4c6899800428d3.Speaker: Natasha

82f83ab40bccdb3c.ContentText: He never realized that human fragility is also the greatest driver of our accomplishments. Our bodies never conquered the cold, but our minds ensured that we never had to. Now we travel the stars...
82f83ab40bccdb3c.Speaker: Natasha

f1dc54ab2d694fcd.ContentText: Human beings really are conflicted life forms...
f1dc54ab2d694fcd.Speaker: Natasha

2f63a6c3424dd0de.ContentText: Vache spent his life looking for ways to push past the limits of the human body... but he met a bitter end.
2f63a6c3424dd0de.Speaker: Natasha

dd3348bc3a6014e7.ContentText: He never realized that human fragility is also the greatest driver of our accomplishments. Our bodies never conquered the cold, but our minds ensured that we never had to. Now we travel the stars...
dd3348bc3a6014e7.Speaker: Natasha

33f3dad4efb37180.ContentText: Human beings really are conflicted life forms...
33f3dad4efb37180.Speaker: Natasha

2819b561cbcaba25.ContentText: {NICKNAME}, I remember you once said that the Express travels across the universe and visits all kinds of different planets...
2819b561cbcaba25.Speaker: Natasha

1fa04660994ecc82.ContentText: I'm thinking... If I have the chance, I'd love to travel with you and see what lies beyond Jarilo-VI.
1fa04660994ecc82.Speaker: Natasha

eada246cce795b69.ContentText: It's just, people in the Underworld still need a doctor...
eada246cce795b69.Speaker: Natasha

91c80a764a667a28.ContentText: Hehe, you're right. People still rely on me as their doctor.
91c80a764a667a28.Speaker: Natasha

fc53585bbecd40ef.ContentText: Still, I'm looking forward to the day I can join the crew. I'd like to see how other civilizations fight diseases and what Belobog could learn.
fc53585bbecd40ef.Speaker: Natasha

7a95f664022d1506.ContentText: Of course, if there is a day when the Underworld doesn't need a doctor like me anymore and everyone lives happily ever after...
7a95f664022d1506.Speaker: Natasha

501cc44c8877e3f5.ContentText: ... then perhaps there won't be any reason for me to go on the journey with you after all.
501cc44c8877e3f5.Speaker: Natasha

ce298a54cbaa6d64.ContentText: I'm looking forward to the day I can join the crew. I'd like to see how other civilizations fight diseases and what Belobog could learn.
ce298a54cbaa6d64.Speaker: Natasha

4b8dd83adb146fdb.ContentText: Of course, if there is a day when the Underworld doesn't need a doctor like me anymore and everyone lives happily ever after...
4b8dd83adb146fdb.Speaker: Natasha

c99966431e44e692.ContentText: ... then perhaps there won't be any reason for me to go on the journey with you after all.
c99966431e44e692.Speaker: Natasha

ab263696894f6395.ContentText: Hey, {NICKNAME}! I've been looking for you.
ab263696894f6395.Speaker: Natasha

ddecfab774a98b90.ContentText: So, the children in the clinic heard the story of you and the Express, and immediately insisted on sending a gift to the hero of Belobog.
ddecfab774a98b90.Speaker: Natasha

a0ceea38892f76b4.ContentText: I say "gift," but it's more like bits and pieces the kids cobbled together. Still, I hope you like it.
a0ceea38892f76b4.Speaker: Natasha

fa17242f0d701d05.ContentText: Traveling between the stars... Even an adult like me can't help but find it captivating, let alone the children.
fa17242f0d701d05.Speaker: Natasha

9fa50626dead86e2.ContentText: It's a shame they're too young to board the Express. Still, your stories of space adventures always put a smile on their face.
9fa50626dead86e2.Speaker: Natasha

4a44781fd409df2b.ContentText: So, do let me know when you have more stories to share. I'm sure the kids will love them.
4a44781fd409df2b.Speaker: Natasha

3d006fc3d3e4b56c.ContentText: Wowwww, so everything outside the window is the universe?
3d006fc3d3e4b56c.Speaker: Hook

4e796bb2c4383b3a.ContentText: You're pretty stupid for an honorary member! How can you grab stars from so far away?
4e796bb2c4383b3a.Speaker: Hook

6fb929dc746afc31.ContentText: How do you know? Hmph, even if they don't, who's to say there isn't a planet that tastes like honey...
6fb929dc746afc31.Speaker: Hook

ea95cfe4b4e7b5b0.ContentText: All these stars surrounding us... The Express is like a traveling theme park warp-jumping through candy...
ea95cfe4b4e7b5b0.Speaker: Hook

6b293dcac705d517.ContentText: Which means... you live inside a warp-jumping candy theme park! Not fair!
6b293dcac705d517.Speaker: Hook

e96bdbd30a65aa0e.ContentText: Hehe, Hook hereby declares the Astral Express The Moles' newest adventure route!
e96bdbd30a65aa0e.Speaker: Hook

8614df7f97e94104.ContentText: All these stars surrounding us... The Express is like a traveling theme park warp-jumping through candy...
8614df7f97e94104.Speaker: Hook

421c77c56a90db7e.ContentText: Which means... you live inside a warp-jumping candy theme park! Not fair!
421c77c56a90db7e.Speaker: Hook

9b2e99bbeea3c907.ContentText: Hehe, Hook hereby declares the Astral Express The Moles' newest adventure route!
9b2e99bbeea3c907.Speaker: Hook

7e7e07a3ebd4e96a.ContentText: Pom-Pom wouldn't do that. You're not allowed to say that about Pom-Pom.
7e7e07a3ebd4e96a.Speaker: Hook

0005399ba8473373.ContentText: No way! Hook would never do that!
0005399ba8473373.Speaker: Hook

40f28bb3c00edd5c.ContentText: I wanted to invite Pom-Pom to come visit Boulder Town, but I just found out Pom-Pom can't leave the Express...
40f28bb3c00edd5c.Speaker: Hook

ac70a5aadec828ed.ContentText: P—Pom-Pom can't come adventuring with us... *whimper*
ac70a5aadec828ed.Speaker: Hook

8e9727813178fd56.ContentText: *sniff* W—Well, I guess you're right, honorary member. At least Pom-Pom is always on an adventure with you...
8e9727813178fd56.Speaker: Hook

3c66897a298ad43f.ContentText: *sniff* I—I will! When Pitch-Dark Hook the Great's on the Express, Pom-Pom will never get bored!
3c66897a298ad43f.Speaker: Hook

8900ed4f446a246f.ContentText: It's settled then — Hook will make Pom-Pom an honorary member of The Moles.
8900ed4f446a246f.Speaker: Hook

5ff0783ea324870e.ContentText: Promise me, honorary member {NICKNAME}: When Hook isn't here on the train...
5ff0783ea324870e.Speaker: Hook

7787b96054163ee9.ContentText: ...you have to take good care of honorary member Pom-Pom! Otherwise, I'll hold you "accountantable!" Wait... accountable!
7787b96054163ee9.Speaker: Hook

1e759f69d0035da8.ContentText: Hook will make Pom-Pom an honorary member of The Moles.
1e759f69d0035da8.Speaker: Hook

4921563ed2315bbb.ContentText: Promise me, honorary member {NICKNAME}: When Hook isn't here on the train...
4921563ed2315bbb.Speaker: Hook

5646fb36a3e1ca12.ContentText: ...you have to take good care of honorary member Pom-Pom! Otherwise, I'll hold you "accountantable!" Wait... accountable!
5646fb36a3e1ca12.Speaker: Hook

46639ce96ba51f19.ContentText: Well, well, well, if it isn't our honorary member {NICKNAME}!
46639ce96ba51f19.Speaker: Hook

5ad71f48514750e4.ContentText: Pitch-Dark Hook the Great is about to host a hide-and-seek contest! You wanna come?
5ad71f48514750e4.Speaker: Hook

bac91b9bc0e243ee.ContentText: Well... A—At the moment, it's just you and me.
bac91b9bc0e243ee.Speaker: Hook

4bd03f86127e5398.ContentText: Huh!? Even YOU won't play with me? Hook can't hide AND seek y'know!
4bd03f86127e5398.Speaker: Hook

cd8d997dcf1e7119.ContentText: I asked the others if they were interested... Pom-Pom was too busy, but they agreed to let me host the contest on the Express — as long as I don't use the engine room!
cd8d997dcf1e7119.Speaker: Hook

5d496b7502d22bb6.ContentText: Himeko said she's terrible at hide-and-seek. Welt looked excited, but then he said it was a shame he couldn't do it and never explained why...
5d496b7502d22bb6.Speaker: Hook

b65b4d6b86e4ad1f.ContentText: Hmm... Hook needs to find more people! The Express is huge, it's a waste of space to not play!
b65b4d6b86e4ad1f.Speaker: Hook

5c203f6358517454.ContentText: I asked the others if they were interested... Pom-Pom was too busy, but they agreed to let me host the contest on the Express — as long as I don't use the engine room!
5c203f6358517454.Speaker: Hook

06bef95c4dac9425.ContentText: Himeko said she's terrible at hide-and-seek. Welt looked excited, but then he said it was a shame he couldn't do it and never explained why...
06bef95c4dac9425.Speaker: Hook

ac4ddb541eebb002.ContentText: Hmm... Hook needs to find more people! The Express is huge, it's a waste of space to not play!
ac4ddb541eebb002.Speaker: Hook

0595cd4aa32bdccb.ContentText: Honorary member! Come over here! Hook has a question for you!
0595cd4aa32bdccb.Speaker: Hook

c0a16fc875505500.ContentText: Which place looks nicer — the Express or the old witch's clinic?
c0a16fc875505500.Speaker: Hook

19b349bef962c901.ContentText: Hmph! That's because you've never seen what the clinic looks like in the Solwarm Festival! It's fabulous!
19b349bef962c901.Speaker: Hook

bcf269f0d06143a1.ContentText: Hehe, I knew it! Of course it does!
bcf269f0d06143a1.Speaker: Hook

128a0ff7db345620.ContentText: Hmph, only when she's not angry... Wait, honorary member, stop changing the subject!
128a0ff7db345620.Speaker: Hook

bbc97ddf25e0f887.ContentText: I'll tell you my answer: it's the clinic!
bbc97ddf25e0f887.Speaker: Hook

62b75be8a1ce0afe.ContentText: Although... The Express looks almost as good!
62b75be8a1ce0afe.Speaker: Hook

cd0b89ce1605586d.ContentText: Everything is so shiny and sparkly... I can see my face in the floor!
cd0b89ce1605586d.Speaker: Hook

618d6fd6f74c0cdc.ContentText: I've made up my mind. When The Moles find treasure under my leadership, we'll help the old witch make her clinic shiny and sparkly...
618d6fd6f74c0cdc.Speaker: Hook

20a01dbedf8462f3.ContentText: The Moles always repay our debts!
20a01dbedf8462f3.Speaker: Hook

9a52dfb5757f2bb8.ContentText: The Moles always repay our debts!
9a52dfb5757f2bb8.Speaker: Hook

9f18ebc7231218ea.ContentText: Everything is so shiny and sparkly... I can see my face in the floor!
9f18ebc7231218ea.Speaker: Hook

1f7639ad35027239.ContentText: I've made up my mind. When The Moles find treasure under my leadership, we'll help the old witch make her clinic shiny and sparkly...
1f7639ad35027239.Speaker: Hook

2c529b1a644a6a62.ContentText: Look, honorary member! March 7th gave me a doll. It looks just like you!
2c529b1a644a6a62.Speaker: Hook

d6f20d1359a6c2ab.ContentText: Uh, that's not what Hook said...
d6f20d1359a6c2ab.Speaker: Hook

2d7c7f2c0ecc5a34.ContentText: But... it does look cute. And it's soft too! Daddy will love it.
2d7c7f2c0ecc5a34.Speaker: Hook

86c4b922930d0085.ContentText: Well, I've been looking for a souvenir for daddy since I boarded the Express. He's not so well, so he can't pay a visit himself...
86c4b922930d0085.Speaker: Hook

d9e82b3b454dbc16.ContentText: I was asking around to see if I could find anything. Then I bumped into March and she gave me this doll!
d9e82b3b454dbc16.Speaker: Hook

87b78d343d5f93ff.ContentText: It's modeled after you, honorary member! You did a big favor for Hook and daddy, so I think this is a fitting gift!
87b78d343d5f93ff.Speaker: Hook

c86eff4c54f9e4f8.ContentText: I was asking around to see if I could find anything. Then I bumped into March and she gave me this doll!
c86eff4c54f9e4f8.Speaker: Hook

4a2c5944119a0279.ContentText: It's modeled after you, honorary member! You did a big favor for Hook and daddy, so I think this is a fitting gift!
4a2c5944119a0279.Speaker: Hook

bb079e5c9fd41552.ContentText: Hey, honorary member {NICKNAME}! Boss Hook has been looking for you. Where have you been?
bb079e5c9fd41552.Speaker: Hook

4ebc3d55beff1b33.ContentText: Here, this is for you. It's worth a lot according to daddy. I don't know much about it, but daddy is always right.
4ebc3d55beff1b33.Speaker: Hook

9a94e1b03cde3bd3.ContentText: No need for formalities — you deserve it!
9a94e1b03cde3bd3.Speaker: Hook

190dafb8806bf1ca.ContentText: It took Hook and daddy a lot of effort to prepare this gift for you!
190dafb8806bf1ca.Speaker: Hook

9f24cdc1ea4362cd.ContentText: Hook doesn't know either. But it took Hook and daddy a lot of effort to prepare this gift for you!
9f24cdc1ea4362cd.Speaker: Hook

3040b3cac8a6ee3c.ContentText: Hmph! Since when did honorary members get so choosy?
3040b3cac8a6ee3c.Speaker: Hook

8a7bc1d2f73a27e7.ContentText: It took Hook and daddy a lot of effort to prepare this gift for you!
8a7bc1d2f73a27e7.Speaker: Hook

dcac1fd9ff27e3de.ContentText: Anyway, just take it! Enjoy your gift!
dcac1fd9ff27e3de.Speaker: Hook

3a4e2de2309ff881.ContentText: It's worth a lot according to daddy. I don't know much about it, but daddy is always right.
3a4e2de2309ff881.Speaker: Hook

e13c53ebac8d8480.ContentText: Anyway, just take it! Enjoy your gift!
e13c53ebac8d8480.Speaker: Hook

6836f8d00dfa11c5.ContentText: We must be really high up here, right? Much higher than Mr. Svarog's shoulders...
6836f8d00dfa11c5.Speaker: Clara

6c90cce1bb31803f.ContentText: I know... I think I'll be too excited to sleep tonight...
6c90cce1bb31803f.Speaker: Clara

bec16ae8c31fa956.ContentText: Mm-hmm, it's just like a movie... Actually, I've never seen a movie with views like this before...
bec16ae8c31fa956.Speaker: Clara

2f0598f18f6beeb9.ContentText: Next time, I'll have to convince Mr. Svarog to come along.
2f0598f18f6beeb9.Speaker: Clara

f97cff1f4489df33.ContentText: Thank you for bringing me along, {NICKNAME}!
f97cff1f4489df33.Speaker: Clara

aea84b0b7d7b956a.ContentText: The Express really does fly up in the sky... Next time, I'll have to convince Mr. Svarog to come along.
aea84b0b7d7b956a.Speaker: Clara

d20784503dd07759.ContentText: Thank you for bringing me along, {NICKNAME}!
d20784503dd07759.Speaker: Clara

3b203ae421b3b752.ContentText: Himeko just told me that the Express has been stranded before...
3b203ae421b3b752.Speaker: Clara

bd13acdbde818c9b.ContentText: She said it took a lot of hard work to get it back on track. I bet it was difficult.
bd13acdbde818c9b.Speaker: Clara

034edf174dd54ae8.ContentText: Not to mention routine maintenance... If possible, you should let me help fix the Express, too!
034edf174dd54ae8.Speaker: Clara

58f9f90dcf034f29.ContentText: No, it's no trouble at all! I've still got lots to learn, and lots of questions to ask Miss Himeko and Pom-Pom.
58f9f90dcf034f29.Speaker: Clara

e8b5cb0502b709c6.ContentText: Like... How can we get Perkins to fly — how can we get him to fly to super high places like the Express?
e8b5cb0502b709c6.Speaker: Clara

9b116f37914d560c.ContentText: I've still got lots to learn, and lots of questions to ask Miss Himeko and Pom-Pom.
9b116f37914d560c.Speaker: Clara

09f5892eb2e9cadd.ContentText: Like... How can we get Perkins to fly — how can we get him to fly to super high places like the Express?
09f5892eb2e9cadd.Speaker: Clara

2d437f338d6d17d8.ContentText: I asked Mr. Svarog if he'd like to come with me. But he said he couldn't...
2d437f338d6d17d8.Speaker: Clara

97cd8d1901d1be5f.ContentText: He said: "I must continue to monitor the risk factors endangering Belobog. I cannot leave Jarilo-VI." But he also said that I could recount my experience on the Express and he'd store the information in his database.
97cd8d1901d1be5f.Speaker: Clara

4222ab2280a418f6.ContentText: That's why I want to find a way to record the scenery, it's just... there's so much to see. My eyes can't take it all in...
4222ab2280a418f6.Speaker: Clara

0355bcd8685435e9.ContentText: Ah! How come I never thought of that? Thanks {NICKNAME}!
0355bcd8685435e9.Speaker: Clara

ea6e0cf820fc160b.ContentText: ...Oh! I've got an idea. I can take some pictures with my phone and show them to Mr. Svarog!
ea6e0cf820fc160b.Speaker: Clara

91261b019cbbea42.ContentText: Speaking of my phone, where did I put it...
91261b019cbbea42.Speaker: Clara

fb25896c744fda41.ContentText: I'm trying to capture the views but...
fb25896c744fda41.Speaker: Clara

a213af75f03d6640.ContentText: I think I forgot to bring my phone with me...
a213af75f03d6640.Speaker: Clara

3351ab604208757a.ContentText: Pom-Pom looks really cute when they walk...
3351ab604208757a.Speaker: Clara

88c6dd56c3091343.ContentText: Not to mention how fluffy and soft they are...
88c6dd56c3091343.Speaker: Clara

1e72af714ed1c5ac.ContentText: I wish I could take Pom-Pom back to Belobog!
1e72af714ed1c5ac.Speaker: Clara

8d56c968706e3a7d.ContentText: Yeah... they did mention that to me. I wish they could...
8d56c968706e3a7d.Speaker: Clara

ce451b808837974e.ContentText: You're right... I poked my head into the engine room and Pom-Pom acted like an angry puppy...
ce451b808837974e.Speaker: Clara

50027d7844d7c257.ContentText: ...Anyway, it's nice to spend time with such a cute conductor!
50027d7844d7c257.Speaker: Clara

cf6f0f9232b9a2f0.ContentText: Pom-Pom looks really cute when they walk...
cf6f0f9232b9a2f0.Speaker: Clara

512c6989ef59c071.ContentText: Not to mention how fluffy and soft they are...
512c6989ef59c071.Speaker: Clara

bb1b7b1ddc54fdf2.ContentText: I wish I could take Pom-Pom back to Belobog!
bb1b7b1ddc54fdf2.Speaker: Clara

4074ed159c05fc3b.ContentText: I just finished talking to Mr. Yang. He was telling me about movies on other planets that have robots in them!
4074ed159c05fc3b.Speaker: Clara

7ca0d9696990da47.ContentText: They sounded so cool! They're really huge and they have wings!
7ca0d9696990da47.Speaker: Clara

26f5b772e862c7be.ContentText: They launch themselves into the sky and even into outer space!
26f5b772e862c7be.Speaker: Clara

8130c57b16f60161.ContentText: I'm thinking... If I put a pair of wings on Mr. Svarog, would he be able to fly around the universe like in the movies?
8130c57b16f60161.Speaker: Clara

087340c787dea13c.ContentText: Mm... If you think so too, then I'll definitely try. Thanks, {NICKNAME}.
087340c787dea13c.Speaker: Clara

6140217ba07fab73.ContentText: Mm... are you sure, {NICKNAME}? I still want to give it a try...
6140217ba07fab73.Speaker: Clara

5ff0475166c1f9aa.ContentText: Yeah! Sounds like one of those cool movie lines!
5ff0475166c1f9aa.Speaker: Clara

9149e5585c9a152d.ContentText: If I can fly around the universe one day too, I'll come up with my own cool thing to say!
9149e5585c9a152d.Speaker: Clara

2265cb613afda09c.ContentText: Anyway... I'll talk to Mr. Svarog first and see if he likes the idea!
2265cb613afda09c.Speaker: Clara

1dd8c927a477e57f.ContentText: The movie robots sound so cool! They're really huge and they have wings!
1dd8c927a477e57f.Speaker: Clara

7009672eac660d96.ContentText: They launch themselves into the sky and even into outer space!
7009672eac660d96.Speaker: Clara

00bbcb9e615ec090.ContentText: I'm thinking... If I put a pair of wings on Mr. Svarog, would he be able to fly around the universe like in the movies?
00bbcb9e615ec090.Speaker: Clara

156e48e18a53e095.ContentText: Oh, it's you! I wanted to show you something...
156e48e18a53e095.Speaker: Clara

9997466c0af6f2f7.ContentText: Actually... I wanted to ask if you remember Pascal.
9997466c0af6f2f7.Speaker: Clara

4fc06b7d7d78974c.ContentText: I went to the Tempering Workshop in Rivet Town a while ago and found some nice-looking pebbles — there was a note on the side.
4fc06b7d7d78974c.Speaker: Clara

e25b3e434245c101.ContentText: It's Pascal's handwriting — he says he wanted to send the pebbles to you as a gift.
e25b3e434245c101.Speaker: Clara

30dd35b44aee64e2.ContentText: I'm not sure what the pebbles are used for... but please take them! It would make Pascal happy.
30dd35b44aee64e2.Speaker: Clara

89d3a259fddb8b43.ContentText: ...Oh! When you have time, don't forget to come back to Robot Settlement and pay us a visit.
89d3a259fddb8b43.Speaker: Clara

281bf48bf4323ea4.ContentText: I hope you like these pebbles, {F#big sister}{M#big brother} {NICKNAME}...
281bf48bf4323ea4.Speaker: Clara

03fdd1dc3adfe1ad.ContentText: ...Oh! When you have time, don't forget to come back to Robot Settlement and pay us a visit.
03fdd1dc3adfe1ad.Speaker: Clara

e7cda2183d0c64ae.ContentText: Oh wow, the train carriages are so cool. Can we put a little stage there?
e7cda2183d0c64ae.Speaker: Serval

943a1627738f1ad0.ContentText: But if you like, I could give you all a small private show any time.
943a1627738f1ad0.Speaker: Serval

a5b663ee7ac2bca3.ContentText: The sofas here all look tailor-made — perfect for VIP guests!
a5b663ee7ac2bca3.Speaker: Serval

b344ea65fa072522.ContentText: Thanks for inviting me, {NICKNAME}. I've got my hands full right now, but I'm looking forward to the Express tour!
b344ea65fa072522.Speaker: Serval

5221cffdb143b25d.ContentText: If you like, I can give all of you a small private show any time.
5221cffdb143b25d.Speaker: Serval

e33db6068fa73d8c.ContentText: The sofas here all look tailor-made — perfect for VIP guests!
e33db6068fa73d8c.Speaker: Serval

5c3c296f18ca58af.ContentText: Thanks for inviting me, {NICKNAME}. I've got my hands full right now, but I'm looking forward to the Express tour!
5c3c296f18ca58af.Speaker: Serval

d1e2475ff19c2cce.ContentText: {NICKNAME}, can I borrow the Express's phonograph for a few days?
d1e2475ff19c2cce.Speaker: Serval

ea3ff644ee974dc0.ContentText: Who do you take me for...
ea3ff644ee974dc0.Speaker: Serval

4351d03b72a9c1c1.ContentText: Alright, I admit that for a few seconds there, the thought may have crossed my mind.
4351d03b72a9c1c1.Speaker: Serval

e916c2334416881e.ContentText: And not only do you have Belobog music, but music from other planets, too...
e916c2334416881e.Speaker: Serval

96e5642c3c271927.ContentText: I'd love to know where you picked this thing up.
96e5642c3c271927.Speaker: Serval

3caa56240d93e07c.ContentText: *sigh*, I'm not sure you guys will agree, but...
3caa56240d93e07c.Speaker: Serval

a828701b2c4d2b0d.ContentText: ...would you mind if I made a trip to the Astral Express one time, just to listen to music?
a828701b2c4d2b0d.Speaker: Serval

3096ab46cb63a172.ContentText: I should've known you'd be cool with it, {NICKNAME}!
3096ab46cb63a172.Speaker: Serval

a6fe840981cb2d13.ContentText: It's a deal then. Next time you need something done in the workshop, I'll do it for free!
a6fe840981cb2d13.Speaker: Serval

756fc6028bc6ff58.ContentText: Would you mind if I made a trip to the Astral Express, just to listen to music?
756fc6028bc6ff58.Speaker: Serval

dc5b38a44e0d64bd.ContentText: I should've known you'd be cool with it, {NICKNAME}!
dc5b38a44e0d64bd.Speaker: Serval

5e7a9f6fa66ff825.ContentText: It's a deal then. Next time you need something done in the workshop, I'll do it for free!
5e7a9f6fa66ff825.Speaker: Serval

eff9d42c825188b0.ContentText: Right on time, {NICKNAME}! I just finished chatting with Himeko.
eff9d42c825188b0.Speaker: Serval

5d51735dfbef40cb.ContentText: Haha, of course! Himeko and her... collection — more than enough reason to come visit the Express.
5d51735dfbef40cb.Speaker: Serval

0409816777af1402.ContentText: We talked about a lot of things — how she repaired the Express, all about her adventures, a certain resident fluffy conductor, and you guys...
0409816777af1402.Speaker: Serval

25493f9127e1d519.ContentText: Oh, and she showed me her masterpiece too. I gotta say: soooo cool! It was hard to resist the urge to open it up and see what was inside, but I managed to control myself...
25493f9127e1d519.Speaker: Serval

a38be5996b41b798.ContentText: If I'd known there were so many high-tech wonders on the Express, I probably would've insisted on going with you guys.
a38be5996b41b798.Speaker: Serval

0e16f37edfa8111f.ContentText: Haha, only joking — I'm needed in Belobog. Still, if I ever forget how to play the guitar or fix things in my workshop... there'll be a spot for me here, right? It's a deal!
0e16f37edfa8111f.Speaker: Serval

b50511885b958fb6.ContentText: Himeko showed me her masterpiece. I gotta say: soooo cool! It was hard to resist the urge to open it up and see what was inside, but I managed to control myself...
b50511885b958fb6.Speaker: Serval

d6458fb20bc9974d.ContentText: If I'd known there were so many high-tech wonders on the Express, I probably would've insisted on going with you guys.
d6458fb20bc9974d.Speaker: Serval

d3f082a80afef4d8.ContentText: Hey {NICKNAME}, how would you describe Mr. Yang?
d3f082a80afef4d8.Speaker: Serval

e25f71a49e101926.ContentText: Oh? Seems you haven't seen his other side...
e25f71a49e101926.Speaker: Serval

641cd39c5ab0440f.ContentText: He doesn't look like the type, but that sounds about right.
641cd39c5ab0440f.Speaker: Serval

a4d505b4724bdbc8.ContentText: Exactly! You won't believe this, but...
a4d505b4724bdbc8.Speaker: Serval

52a39fad6a5c5e89.ContentText: I was talking to Mr. Yang about my career as a mechanic and my time in the Silvermane Guards. Somehow, we got onto that so-called Engine of Creation...
52a39fad6a5c5e89.Speaker: Serval

3163e183ba299db2.ContentText: As soon as I started talking about it, he jumped out of his seat in excitement — scared me half to death. He wanted to know everything there was to know about its technical specs and whether I'd ever had the chance to ride in it... Sadly, I had to tell him I never saw the robot myself.
3163e183ba299db2.Speaker: Serval

b357537b76f773fb.ContentText: You know what? He's got me excited too... Let's find a time to head into the northern valleys and check it out!
b357537b76f773fb.Speaker: Serval

ddd08592f0aca504.ContentText: The Engine of Creation... Sadly, I never got the chance to see the robot myself.
ddd08592f0aca504.Speaker: Serval

6329bf8ab05d4495.ContentText: You know what? Mr. Yang got me excited about it too... Let's find a time to head into the northern valleys and check it out!
6329bf8ab05d4495.Speaker: Serval

ba9a17c9e8125157.ContentText: Hey {NICKNAME}, if you were to write a song about the Express, what would you name it?
ba9a17c9e8125157.Speaker: Serval

5091f764f0b1e6db.ContentText: Hmm... not bad. Sounds like something one of those old bands would play at the beginning of their sets...
5091f764f0b1e6db.Speaker: Serval

ce9d856d33e25d92.ContentText: Haha, love it, but I bet there's a lot of songs with that name. It sounds like something Randy would play — he's one of my favorite legendary guitarists. May he rest in peace...
ce9d856d33e25d92.Speaker: Serval

5520e3769e155af5.ContentText: Um... not quite my taste. "High speed" doesn't quite do the Express justice.
5520e3769e155af5.Speaker: Serval

d32da97ee147e464.ContentText: Anyway, thanks for the suggestions! They all have something about them. I'll have to think about it...
d32da97ee147e464.Speaker: Serval

7f9a158e17ca8c06.ContentText: That's given me food for thought...
7f9a158e17ca8c06.Speaker: Serval

efde4396e416d269.ContentText: *sigh* I've had a lot of free time recently, so I was thinking about writing some new songs. Sadly, that's about as far as I got...
efde4396e416d269.Speaker: Serval

96cc29a06003f128.ContentText: But at least I have time to come visit you guys! Did you miss me?
96cc29a06003f128.Speaker: Serval

f10767a88e977c63.ContentText: Ha! I knew you'd say that. Here, I've got a gift for you...
f10767a88e977c63.Speaker: Serval

d476c999e85207d4.ContentText: For real? Hmph, never mind the GIFT I got for you then...
d476c999e85207d4.Speaker: Serval

7f158392ddad27a5.ContentText: You can't work your way out of writer's block! A short break is a good way of refreshing the mind.
7f158392ddad27a5.Speaker: Serval

24a4658aaeec4382.ContentText: Hmph! Didn't think you'd accuse me of goofing off... Never mind the GIFT I got for you then...
24a4658aaeec4382.Speaker: Serval

7dec5781332c704b.ContentText: Ha, just kidding — here you goooo~
7dec5781332c704b.Speaker: Serval

c426c9bca27ee718.ContentText: A gift from Belobog's number one rock star — you're not allowed to dislike it! Or at least don't tell me if that's the case...
c426c9bca27ee718.Speaker: Serval

45e423b45f1f0499.ContentText: Hmm, I've been on the Express for a while but I still don't have any new songwriting inspiration. How strange...
45e423b45f1f0499.Speaker: Serval

d59ff5ab92d2bf36.ContentText: Could it be that... I've peaked already?
d59ff5ab92d2bf36.Speaker: Serval

c7de130a7a2a35ff.ContentText: {NICKNAME}, how about you give me some ideas... and I get you some more gifts?
c7de130a7a2a35ff.Speaker: Serval

88309771c494a3d2.ContentText: Apologies, I've been busy lately so I had to put off the Express tour for a while. Here we are, finally.
88309771c494a3d2.Speaker: Gepard

0b4df57b2be47735.ContentText: Sorry — uh... forgive me — I mean... you know what I mean...
0b4df57b2be47735.Speaker: Gepard

8959bb836f154da4.ContentText: It's because we're friends that I feel a little guilty...
8959bb836f154da4.Speaker: Gepard

bae9898a651b4a2f.ContentText: What should we see next? Do we just follow the Express tour route?
bae9898a651b4a2f.Speaker: Gepard

a60a559b71e43ba9.ContentText: I'm honored to be invited aboard the Express.
a60a559b71e43ba9.Speaker: Gepard

505f3ba4f0b63768.ContentText: Truly, I'm not just being polite with you...
505f3ba4f0b63768.Speaker: Gepard

aa9a79ad1f49c1a3.ContentText: It's finally time for the Express tour... What should we see next? Do we just follow the Express tour route?
aa9a79ad1f49c1a3.Speaker: Gepard

8aa2db9e761f7114.ContentText: I'm honored to be invited aboard the Express.
8aa2db9e761f7114.Speaker: Gepard

38a895976e5f6de5.ContentText: Truly, I'm not just being polite with you...
38a895976e5f6de5.Speaker: Gepard

de36778f3f9cd6c2.ContentText: The Landau family is big — there are always people around at home.
de36778f3f9cd6c2.Speaker: Gepard

7a53dbc1304e0458.ContentText: Not at all. It may be empty, but there are traces of life everywhere. I can just imagine how bustling it would be with people here.
7a53dbc1304e0458.Speaker: Gepard

fc1135b8ecee21d9.ContentText: It's like Belobog in the dead of the night: empty, quiet, but always kind.
fc1135b8ecee21d9.Speaker: Gepard

8f3307b023850576.ContentText: It's an amazing feeling for someone who's never left Belobog before.
8f3307b023850576.Speaker: Gepard

e4dde9a6a4b2aadf.ContentText: The Express is pretty empty, but there are traces of life everywhere. I can just imagine how bustling it would be with people here.
e4dde9a6a4b2aadf.Speaker: Gepard

418e6be2b21ae57c.ContentText: It's like Belobog in the dead of the night: empty, quiet, but always kind.
418e6be2b21ae57c.Speaker: Gepard

ad0c85d9d0d4300d.ContentText: It's an amazing feeling for someone who's never left Belobog before.
ad0c85d9d0d4300d.Speaker: Gepard

296b95d52f68ab49.ContentText: Ever since the Express tour, I've been wondering...
296b95d52f68ab49.Speaker: Gepard

7b9bfbdc37567488.ContentText: If the Guards had a train like this, would it make our campaigns easier?
7b9bfbdc37567488.Speaker: Gepard

3ae4c9c41fbc90cf.ContentText: Transfer supplies... huh. That's not a bad idea.
3ae4c9c41fbc90cf.Speaker: Gepard

b92767cc631c65e6.ContentText: Deploy troops... huh. That's not a bad idea.
b92767cc631c65e6.Speaker: Gepard

39f1b5b275699155.ContentText: ...I don't think I've ever seen you that excited.
39f1b5b275699155.Speaker: Gepard

b7fd7bbab89a67c4.ContentText: So... you're thinking of turning the Express into a combat unit? Personally I'd only use it for logistics...
b7fd7bbab89a67c4.Speaker: Gepard

8d8549a33ee6e8bb.ContentText: Hmm... You've given me some food for thought — I should have a chat with the Technology Division about this.
8d8549a33ee6e8bb.Speaker: Gepard

082bd7ab7f35ea72.ContentText: I'll add it to my to-do list.
082bd7ab7f35ea72.Speaker: Gepard

9e3cc617923aacf1.ContentText: It might be worth talking to the Technology Division about incorporating a train into our units.
9e3cc617923aacf1.Speaker: Gepard

1c7f6c1fd59a8f70.ContentText: ...I should add it to my to-do list.
1c7f6c1fd59a8f70.Speaker: Gepard

ad00a3df09a2e62a.ContentText: I just had quite an interesting conversation with Himeko and Mr. Yang.
ad00a3df09a2e62a.Speaker: Gepard

31edd5d6c8f85933.ContentText: But that brown drink that Himeko makes... it's very...
31edd5d6c8f85933.Speaker: Gepard

6f7627eeddde8d1c.ContentText: ...I'm not alone then. I'll be keeping a safe distance.
6f7627eeddde8d1c.Speaker: Gepard

de5a41e5ff7b01ad.ContentText: Anyway, I learned a lot from them. I'm very grateful for that.
de5a41e5ff7b01ad.Speaker: Gepard

740614008b43b43e.ContentText: Well, the part that shocked me the most was about the Aeons.
740614008b43b43e.Speaker: Gepard

c9b135f70c71c6c7.ContentText: Ahem... I'm okay, thanks. Not what I'm used to.
c9b135f70c71c6c7.Speaker: Gepard

2071c80fc1c52460.ContentText: Anyway, I learned a lot from them. I'm very grateful for that.
2071c80fc1c52460.Speaker: Gepard

ce412208b9d6ede1.ContentText: Belobog's Architects talk about the great deeds of Qlipoth all the time. In our minds, Qlipoth represents the single greatest power in the universe.
ce412208b9d6ede1.Speaker: Gepard

0f84339b6e43a862.ContentText: But Himeko and Mr. Yang told me that Qlipoth is far from the only Aeon in the universe. For example, the enemies that invaded Belobog <unbreak>700</unbreak> years ago were Emanators of a different Aeon.
0f84339b6e43a862.Speaker: Gepard

ba23a59463a000ab.ContentText: Things are getting back on track for Belobog, but those Emanators could return one day...
ba23a59463a000ab.Speaker: Gepard

231e16148a5ed5f7.ContentText: ...I need to make sure the Silvermane Guards are always at the ready.
231e16148a5ed5f7.Speaker: Gepard

9dfab41ccadb81ee.ContentText: Himeko and Mr. Yang told me that Qlipoth is far from the only Aeon in the universe. For example, the enemies that invaded Belobog <unbreak>700</unbreak> years ago were Emanators of another Aeon.
9dfab41ccadb81ee.Speaker: Gepard

cf898223c0dfca91.ContentText: Things are getting back on track for Belobog, but those Emanators could return one day...
cf898223c0dfca91.Speaker: Gepard

4dcc282c043fad10.ContentText: ...I need to make sure the Silvermane Guards are always at the ready.
4dcc282c043fad10.Speaker: Gepard

5be275f3089026e3.ContentText: Not long ago, Himeko showed me her collection. There was something called a "satellite" — I was very intrigued.
5be275f3089026e3.Speaker: Gepard

ae49c3fa10ad099a.ContentText: It works in a similar way to our automatons. If we could launch our automatons into space like satellites, it'd definitely give us an edge in combat.
ae49c3fa10ad099a.Speaker: Gepard

0bb4e20241f5f79d.ContentText: That's right — the automatons would be our eyes and ears in space. No matter whether the threats arose on the surface or in outer space, we'd be able to spot them.
0bb4e20241f5f79d.Speaker: Gepard

9cd0c80b205983cc.ContentText: Exactly — the automatons would be our turrets in space. That's also how Himeko uses her satellite.
9cd0c80b205983cc.Speaker: Gepard

6c3285d04e63626f.ContentText: It will be very difficult to bring this concept to reality using Belobog's current technology.
6c3285d04e63626f.Speaker: Gepard

ea7523d891c33686.ContentText: But Himeko told me that if the Silvermane Guards do go ahead with it, she'll be glad to help.
ea7523d891c33686.Speaker: Gepard

a3d308497f499300.ContentText: Only thing though is, I can't make the call. I'll need to write a report and discuss it with Bronya, Pela, and others first.
a3d308497f499300.Speaker: Gepard

fce4e240035c0701.ContentText: If we could launch our automatons into space like satellites, it'd definitely give us an edge in combat.
fce4e240035c0701.Speaker: Gepard

9f42d437d1e3f25e.ContentText: Only thing though is, I can't make the call. I'll need to write a report and discuss it with Bronya, Pela, and others first.
9f42d437d1e3f25e.Speaker: Gepard

4d127630c9f63667.ContentText: Oh, you are here. I've been looking for you up and down the train.
4d127630c9f63667.Speaker: Gepard

f2d768289b62fcbc.ContentText: Actually... I brought you a few things.
f2d768289b62fcbc.Speaker: Gepard

dba464165328004a.ContentText: I brought you all some gifts. Hope I didn't cause too much trouble.
dba464165328004a.Speaker: Gepard

5d2b960e0f9a4a53.ContentText: Is that so? Well, I've got something for you.
5d2b960e0f9a4a53.Speaker: Gepard

2f01d8071c779198.ContentText: This is a gift from the Silvermane Guards, to show our gratitude towards those who saved Belobog.
2f01d8071c779198.Speaker: Gepard

b0bf31fed917af19.ContentText: When you find a moment, do come back to Belobog to have a chat. The Silvermane Guards will always welcome you.
b0bf31fed917af19.Speaker: Gepard

180db17437223e65.ContentText: This is a gift from the Silvermane Guards, to show our gratitude towards those who saved Belobog.
180db17437223e65.Speaker: Gepard

6a07f77b3ee24194.ContentText: When you find a moment, do come back to Belobog to have a chat. The Silvermane Guards will always welcome you.
6a07f77b3ee24194.Speaker: Gepard

9a26bd1d9027dd5c.ContentText: This place could do with some iris scanners... wouldn't want unregistered visitors sneaking aboard.
9a26bd1d9027dd5c.Speaker: Arlan

59396b0578603373.ContentText: I remember Lady Asta commissioned some security equipment a while back. Maybe she still has some spares...
59396b0578603373.Speaker: Arlan

d7b2390dbbede96a.ContentText: Oh, sorry, I was thinking out loud. Don't worry, the Express is perfectly safe — there are no... Come to think of it, I'm an unregistered visitor.
d7b2390dbbede96a.Speaker: Arlan

f58bb737693d1421.ContentText: I'm sure you guys and the Express itself are more than capable of maintaining security... but it's important not to overlook basic prevention methods.
f58bb737693d1421.Speaker: Arlan

4b235d3e741026a0.ContentText: Ah, that's right. Since the Legion's invasion, Lady Asta's been procuring defense products customized to the station's needs. I think she's already got platinum membership cards with some of the suppliers...
4b235d3e741026a0.Speaker: Arlan

f462cb25bebcc907.ContentText: When the unthinkable happens, it usually comes down to the combat effectiveness of the defenders to gain the upper hand. But it's always helpful to have the right equipment by your side.
f462cb25bebcc907.Speaker: Arlan

9b50a92f3aa9db7e.ContentText: In addition to visitor recognition systems, I've made a few notes on third-party signal monitoring and emergency response devices.
9b50a92f3aa9db7e.Speaker: Arlan

9140e6d24c6c65c5.ContentText: Of course, it'd be great if you never had to use any of it, but I hope my analysis is of help to the conductor!
9140e6d24c6c65c5.Speaker: Arlan

37f8acdbc82bbf74.ContentText: I... Th—Those guys aren't serious when they refer to me like that, y'know. Anyway, please don't start using it yourself too...
37f8acdbc82bbf74.Speaker: Arlan

c8ab494b7d24d12e.ContentText: Sorry... I was just trying to help.
c8ab494b7d24d12e.Speaker: Arlan

45aa9232657f0eb7.ContentText: Anyway, thanks for inviting me to see the train, {NICKNAME}. I've seen the Express when it was docked at the platform, but this is my first time on board.
45aa9232657f0eb7.Speaker: Arlan

7517bd5ab3a78750.ContentText: I'm not as knowledgeable as Lady Asta... The only way I can contribute is to help the station improve its defenses, don't you think?
7517bd5ab3a78750.Speaker: Arlan

f6d517527047a4d1.ContentText: H—Huh? *sigh* You're right, I need to learn to unwind.
f6d517527047a4d1.Speaker: Arlan

d8fb5928c2f80cda.ContentText: I've been so focused on the station's defenses recently — it's easy to forget that work-life balance is the best way to stay on top.
d8fb5928c2f80cda.Speaker: Arlan

ed85104774f65503.ContentText: Thanks for your advice, {NICKNAME}. It's nice to have a break every now and then.
ed85104774f65503.Speaker: Arlan

c41b5d39cfbfaa0c.ContentText: Sightseeing on the Express... Where should I begin? It's weird that when I finally have the chance to take a break, I don't know how.
c41b5d39cfbfaa0c.Speaker: Arlan

32ff7730f15c1edd.ContentText: You're right. I won't enjoy myself if I turn it into another safety inspection.
32ff7730f15c1edd.Speaker: Arlan

afc6009bb6bb0d4e.ContentText: Thanks for your advice, {NICKNAME}. It's nice to have a break every now and then.
afc6009bb6bb0d4e.Speaker: Arlan

96e31aff00acb1af.ContentText: I didn't know so much power could fit into such a small body!
96e31aff00acb1af.Speaker: Arlan

a5c1cc463f49167f.ContentText: Uh... Sorry, {NICKNAME}, I was talking about Pom-Pom, the conductor. But hey, you're super good at what you do, too!
a5c1cc463f49167f.Speaker: Arlan

b67d9cded2eb2bb6.ContentText: The Express must have encountered huge dangers on its journey through the universe. Not only does Pom-Pom make sure that no harm comes to the crew, they even manage to find time to clean the carriages and take care of the plants.
b67d9cded2eb2bb6.Speaker: Arlan

26c1cae79f377119.ContentText: Strategically minded with an eye for detail... So impressive.
26c1cae79f377119.Speaker: Arlan

a50470efe2975398.ContentText: The Express must have encountered huge dangers on its journey through the universe. Not only does Pom-Pom make sure that no harm comes to the crew, they even manage to find time to clean the carriages and take care of the plants.
a50470efe2975398.Speaker: Arlan

5ec9feb47344dccb.ContentText: Strategically minded with an eye for detail... So impressive.
5ec9feb47344dccb.Speaker: Arlan

5ff32ac61dc59425.ContentText: I remember the conductor telling me that Himeko's coffee had a special aroma. If caffeine didn't mess with my sleeping pattern so much, I'd ask her for the recipe.
5ff32ac61dc59425.Speaker: Arlan

b55470cd286a7454.ContentText: A lot of the researchers on the station live off the stuff. They said it helps them focus.
b55470cd286a7454.Speaker: Arlan

c3150f199015f867.ContentText: Still, none of the coffee they drink has the same aroma as Himeko's brew. She must have a few secret ingredients up her sleeve.
c3150f199015f867.Speaker: Arlan

15456d209803b45e.ContentText: I wonder if Lady Asta would like it? She drinks a cup or two occasionally, but she has it with milk and sugar. She can't stand bitter flavors...
15456d209803b45e.Speaker: Arlan

7524a8e8d99cbb04.ContentText: Oh, uh, what were we talking about again? Coffee! Sorry, {NICKNAME}.
7524a8e8d99cbb04.Speaker: Arlan

541c2b03e1b1fa89.ContentText: A lot of the researchers on the station live off coffee. They said it helps them focus.
541c2b03e1b1fa89.Speaker: Arlan

e3d7fcfb1565b526.ContentText: Still, none of the coffee they drink has the same aroma as Himeko's brew. She must have a few secret ingredients up her sleeve.
e3d7fcfb1565b526.Speaker: Arlan

65955ef2d205e00f.ContentText: I wonder if Lady Asta would like it? She drinks a cup or two occasionally, but she has it with milk and sugar. She can't stand bitter flavors...
65955ef2d205e00f.Speaker: Arlan

6e58fe4bcd2cc700.ContentText: Oh, uh, what were we talking about again? Coffee! Sorry, {NICKNAME}.
6e58fe4bcd2cc700.Speaker: Arlan

64a24ae127b2e095.ContentText: ...Maybe if I change Peppy's diet, he won't shed so much...
64a24ae127b2e095.Speaker: Arlan

32dc6cda317f39b2.ContentText: No, no, I wouldn't bring Peppy without letting you guys know first. You have a lot on your plate — I wouldn't want you to worry about having to take care of him.
32dc6cda317f39b2.Speaker: Arlan

b4cfded1ee4d0ffb.ContentText: Yeah, the conductor gave me some ideas on how to improve it. It'll probably taste worse, but it'll be more nutritious.
b4cfded1ee4d0ffb.Speaker: Arlan

43ca014e8500b5b0.ContentText: I knew there were no pets on the Express, but I saw signs of shedding. That's when I realized that, uh... maybe the conductor was having the same problem. That's why I wanted to get Pom-Pom's advice.
43ca014e8500b5b0.Speaker: Arlan

c8ed5b464483fc31.ContentText: After I told Pom-Pom about Peppy's shedding, they shared some cooking tips that should help solve the problem.
c8ed5b464483fc31.Speaker: Arlan

176ffb75a784d451.ContentText: I'll start him on the new diet when I get back... Hope he isn't too picky.
176ffb75a784d451.Speaker: Arlan

95b2a17deae4b6d0.ContentText: After I told Pom-Pom about Peppy's shedding, they shared some cooking tips that should help solve the problem.
95b2a17deae4b6d0.Speaker: Arlan

6b038f6671022bb7.ContentText: I'll start Peppy on the new diet when I get back... Hope he isn't too picky.
6b038f6671022bb7.Speaker: Arlan

e9462d6eb46200ae.ContentText: Now this type of cushion looks like it'd help with fatigue. Y'know, from sitting too long?
e9462d6eb46200ae.Speaker: Arlan

539a5b5428994e5d.ContentText: That's fine if you're not on the clock, but you can't just lie down at work!
539a5b5428994e5d.Speaker: Arlan

e4b6415d06fcd98c.ContentText: The material is super soft — whoever made this had relaxation in mind.
e4b6415d06fcd98c.Speaker: Arlan
