a72eef44f21858a3.ContentText: Sadly a lot of our researchers get shoulder and neck pain — they're sat at their desks most of the day.
a72eef44f21858a3.Speaker: Arlan

f9963d4bfa353c5a.ContentText: Lady Asta bought ergonomic benches for everybody, but I feel like there's still room for improvement. Cushions like this one might actually be the missing piece.
f9963d4bfa353c5a.Speaker: Arlan

a29ecb3344b2d2a9.ContentText: Who'd have thought I'd get ideas for office furniture while sightseeing on the Express...
a29ecb3344b2d2a9.Speaker: Arlan

4cf3b13cc384ce68.ContentText: Sadly a lot of our researchers get shoulder and neck pain — they're sat at their desks most of the day.
4cf3b13cc384ce68.Speaker: Arlan

af7b2ca073faca12.ContentText: Lady Asta bought ergonomic benches for everybody, but I feel like there's still room for improvement. Cushions like this one might actually be the missing piece.
af7b2ca073faca12.Speaker: Arlan

316f9e9830ca535b.ContentText: Who'd have thought I'd get ideas for office furniture while sightseeing on the Express...
316f9e9830ca535b.Speaker: Arlan

6ca9b82cb77526a0.ContentText: Thanks for inviting me to the Express, {NICKNAME} — it's been nice to have a break.
6ca9b82cb77526a0.Speaker: Arlan

35fe8aa9de2dc775.ContentText: When I got the invitation I was completely caught up in Security Department affairs — how to prevent another Legion invasion, that kind of thing...
35fe8aa9de2dc775.Speaker: Arlan

6077bcc157e2f886.ContentText: It took me a while to realize I was letting the whole thing stress me out — I couldn't think straight. When I set foot on the Express and saw how vast the universe is, I started to feel calm and relaxed.
6077bcc157e2f886.Speaker: Arlan

e2351eb91483246f.ContentText: Here, take this. It's nothing expensive, but I'm sure it'll be of help.
e2351eb91483246f.Speaker: Arlan

77a9d0d3a01c5da8.ContentText: It's important to slow down and unwind... A change of scenery is sometimes the best medicine.
77a9d0d3a01c5da8.Speaker: Arlan

d0bbeaca242f3ee9.ContentText: I was too caught up in Security Department affairs — I forgot how important it is to get some good rest.
d0bbeaca242f3ee9.Speaker: Arlan

a2c0c2e191132624.ContentText: Oh, that's right! Forgive my forgetfulness — glad you came, {NICKNAME}! It's great to have one of the general's distinguished guests helping us out.

bf312456466c916f.ContentText: My Realm-Keeping Commission colleagues failed to provide adequate care for the Dragon Lady. I'd like to thank you on behalf of all of them for rescuing her back in Exalting Sanctum Plaza.

3d73c25e89cc6586.ContentText: As I'm sure you're aware, symptoms of mara have been spreading ever since the Stellaron incident occurred.

12fa904710173475.ContentText: Thanks to the Ten-Lords Commission, being stricken with mara had long since become a terrifying but avoidable fate for Xianzhou natives... The puzzling thing is that despite the Commission's protection, we're now seeing an increase.

9107564f5349bde4.ContentText: More and more citizens — in particular those dealing with great risks and stress like the Cloud Knights — are becoming stricken with mara.

0e6ba43562b3c05b.ContentText: Moreover, the mara-struck have taken on a horrifying appearance — as if they're turning into some sort of monster... This certainly differs from what I thought I knew about the illness.

8c77323da5e43712.ContentText: We wouldn't have the audacity to trouble you with that — the general has a plan to suppress the illness.

228820a9b8e8f991.ContentText: That appears to be the case — no smoke without fire, as they say... Despite being just a servant of the Realm-Keeping Commission, spending a considerable amount of time on the front lines has sharpened my senses to potential dangers...

a0cac6b1fc48dc10.ContentText: You're a capable person, and since the general entrusted you with locating the Stellaron, it's only a matter of time before you run into mara-struck...

2ea3029c4b312f4a.ContentText: If you come across any clues, remember to inform the Realm-Keeping Commission straight away. My colleagues and I will handle any situation with haste and to the best of our ability.

b02a349407a37953.ContentText: Speaking of which, have you made any discoveries so far?

45d606ae936c2bbc.ContentText: Uh... What's this? Looks pretty ordinary to me.

8c377657d20cc111.ContentText: C'mon now, {NICKNAME}, this is a serious matter — there's no time for jokes.

a01114b6c1ff6567.ContentText: I'll be honest with you, I've got no idea how to handle this problem — it's beyond the Realm-Keeping Commission's jurisdiction. I contacted the Seat of Divine Foresight, which is overseen by the general.

f6d1a6cf7752c200.ContentText: ...Allow me to introduce Madam Qingzu, General Jing Yuan's chief counselor.

4fe380c5fb653601.ContentText: I think it'll be easier if she explains the letter to you.

2bb62932eb88ed55.ContentText: {NICKNAME}, I read the letter you obtained from the mara-struck.

063d0d8873e41b2e.ContentText: While the Cloud Knights were searching for the Stellaron's whereabouts, I was carrying out the general's orders — tracking down clues on the mara-struck. Thanks to your efforts, we now have a lead.

87fa6f8030844637.ContentText: To an outsider, this letter appears to be nothing more than good news detailing a recovery from a chronic illness. However, what is actually being discussed is a violation of the Ten Unpardonable Sins. It's heresy.

01ad2176c67ef40c.ContentText: Correct. The term "Merciful Medicus" is one of respect — one that any law-abiding citizen of the Alliance would never dare utter.

70913b6de81b68dd.ContentText: It refers to none other than the enemy of the people of the Xianzhou — the one we now call the Plagues Author... The Aeon of Abundance — Yaoshi.

168d1d65b9b756da.ContentText: That's right. Since the Alliance was first established, all medical practices aboard the Xianzhou adhere to strict standards that prohibit long-life or mutant modifications under the guise of "curing."

c425cf5eb19a7323.ContentText: I went through all our files to find information on the experiment in question, and found nothing. I started thinking about how the Alchemy Commission's delve was sealed off... There must be an unspeakable secret locked away there.

69ea91568306e8e8.ContentText: The author of this letter was likely the mara-struck you defeated. My guess is he was led astray and poisoned while under the pretext of being cured. You saw how he ended up...

bf95ab4d0434ed29.ContentText: Such actions remind me of an organization that was eradicated from the Xianzhou a thousand years ago... the Disciples of Sanctus Medicus.

31f48f62b57c1307.ContentText: They were disciples of the Abundance that sought to restore the way of immortality by unearthing a forbidden remedial formula.

d8e26d6c3169257e.ContentText: It's hard to believe a group that was wiped out so long ago would suddenly rear its head and create chaos once more. The Seat of Divine Foresight needs to learn all it can about this organization's status before the situation reaches a point of no return.

aa6061df1b2fcb85.ContentText: {NICKNAME}, I have a favor to ask of you.

88b5217b6acf70a0.ContentText: If you come across any similar clues about the Disciples of Sanctus Medicus, come and find me at the Seat of Divine Foresight — these kinds of firsthand accounts are exactly what we require.

96cb2f426f1f7d73.ContentText: Don't worry, the Seat of Divine Foresight always rewards those who contribute to our efforts.

1543fd4ab2ad336a.ContentText: Excellent. Your work will not be in vain. The Seat of Divine Foresight always rewards those who contribute to our efforts.

43369b51a5a072ed.ContentText: I understand, but all I'm asking is for you to keep an eye out when you have time. The Seat of Divine Foresight always rewards those who contribute to our efforts.

d7b8815a86e7275c.ContentText: I recently received some intel. It seems that certain individuals are taking advantage of the current chaos to lure in outworlders around Exalting Sanctum. Maybe you could start there?

d32c7f20f0631e3f.ContentText: We sent an undercover investigator out a few months ago — they provided us with a rough idea of the situation.

255d1d27f8514756.ContentText: Unfortunately, it seems suspicions were aroused... We lost contact with the agent — I suspect he was discovered...

d3747cf8926d4636.ContentText: You are a fresh face on the Luofu and an outworlder. I would feel more at ease if I could leave this matter with you.

2c865eef167fc79f.ContentText: Danger is practically an inevitability when dealing with these devils. If you really don't want to go, I won't force you... but I repeat — if you are able to return with valuable intelligence, the Seat of Divine Foresight will reward you handsomely.

03c862e2f01b9911.ContentText: Excuse me, guest from another world. Please spare me a moment of your time. Do you yearn for immortality?

d23994dbfa17506e.ContentText: Do you not believe in the pursuit of eternal life? Perhaps it's because you've already given up on that aspiration!

575cf6d3b99aa477.ContentText: Who would turn down the opportunity to live forever? The Xianzhou doesn't care one bit about the well-being of short-life species! They stubbornly blockade the glorious path to immortality.

724798888a7c5d64.ContentText: Excellent! Who would turn down the opportunity to live forever?

f43ad2804749d3f5.ContentText: The Xianzhou doesn't care one bit about the well-being of short-life species! They stubbornly blockade the glorious path to immortality.

e13f849e38deb4aa.ContentText: I understand! Eternal life is indeed a kind of power, wouldn't you say?

18913835de54e078.ContentText: I'm at my wit's end with you, {F#Sister}{M#Brother}.

fdf016b63bad9547.ContentText: Haha, what a peculiar person you are. I'll tell it to you straight — to outworlders I offer the chance of immortality... but perhaps someone like you would be better off joining the Antimatter Legion.

a844f4bfba7f82be.ContentText: Regardless of what you choose, let's keep our voices down... eh? This isn't the kind of conversation you can have out in the open.

028002c7e912bc61.ContentText: Before you can grasp absolute power, you must yearn for immortality, don't you think? The problem is that the Xianzhou Alliance doesn't care one bit about the well-being of short-life species! They stubbornly blockade the glorious path to immortality.

54b0a8cef100f2e0.ContentText: My name is Green Hibiscus. I came to Exalting Sanctum in hopes of a fated encounter with one such as yourself — one who is also on the road to immortality.

ee62865392dbcf2b.ContentText: What do you say? How about we find a more suitable spot to talk about all this?

43c3145a9d7f76e2.ContentText: Let's make haste — there are too many people here to linger.

f1da742b379b75c2.ContentText: Bah, how so? We are dutiful and sincere — the only difference between us and other Xianzhou residents is that we are more faithful to our inner desires. I won't harm you.

9e46d83a6e1e1014.ContentText: Good, then let's make haste — there are too many people here to linger.

4c4c9233665e0ce5.ContentText: Here we are. This is the place.

a2d7044c1b83a476.ContentText: Ah, let's not get ahead of ourselves. If it were so easy, we'd be a far larger group, and there'd be no need for secrecy.

f881e6429cb149df.ContentText: Relax. By the mercy of Sanctus Medicus, I will not harm you.

8df7d85d284ca358.ContentText: Allow me to reintroduce myself... I am a member of the Disciples of Sanctus Medicus. I was unable to expose my true identity in Exalting Sanctum, but now I can reveal everything.

0fb53254e4ecc0d9.ContentText: The Disciples of Sanctus Medicus is a devout group, holding firm in their belief that Merciful Medicus is the one, ultimate faith. As followers, we refer to ourselves as disciples, dedicated to our cause.

3a9a646c5efd110a.ContentText: If you wish to gain the means to immortality, then you must become a disciple... but to become a disciple, you must first pass several small trials.

bf8696641e50d113.ContentText: Please excuse me... Our expansion has unfortunately attracted the attention of those Devilish Archer followers. If we are not careful, the consequences could be unthinkable.

3123c2ff3297d581.ContentText: No need to be concerned about him. Much like yourself, he is here to undergo the trials.

d811e908ae856180.ContentText: Haha. Only those led astray by followers of the Devilish Archer could despise Merciful Medicus. Sadly, there are many such people... too many.

815156eff93204e7.ContentText: Every species yearns for the favor and curing of Merciful Medicus, regardless of whether they have heard of the Abundance or not.

d381b4f7011fc0de.ContentText: Foxians yearn to cure themselves of their <unbreak>300</unbreak>-year lifespan. The Vidyadhara yearn to cure themselves of the pain of reincarnation and lack of progeny...

95fa62deec3b3fcd.ContentText: ...As for Xianzhou natives — they long to cure themselves of the torture of becoming mara-struck. Of course, we know that this "torture" is rather a kind of blessed evolution.

271648e7ca9ecb3c.ContentText: To return to your question, Sanctus Medicus can cure the aging that short-life species face, along with disease and death. Sanctus Medicus can do for you what they did for the Xianzhou natives.

916a76cd3ed618d3.ContentText: "What you seek, you will surely find." Merciful Medicus is magnanimous — they do not lightly refuse a prayer. As such, the initiation trials for the Disciples of Sanctus Medicus are nothing arduous.

0fe344d58263ceca.ContentText: All you must do is transcribe this copy of "Thousand-Handed Merciful Medicus' Salvation" <unbreak>500</unbreak> times by hand. This will allow your brothers and sisters to trust your faith... and you to become a disciple.

e4fe12be08537d99.ContentText: This scripture is central to the Disciples — you must maintain a pious heart during the transcription... It would be best if you could memorize the text.

6340b8c64bb36018.ContentText: Of course, this is but the first trial. Once you have become a disciple, you will undergo numerous others.

bf44946956f1c1f8.ContentText: Excessive? The old rules dictated that the text be copied <unbreak>50,000</unbreak> times — I myself undertook such a feat. Nowadays, the master takes greater pity on the common people, hence the number has been reduced to a mere <unbreak>500</unbreak>.

4101ee611391df79.ContentText: Don't worry, a traditional Xianzhou brush and inkstone has been prepared for you — smooth action and an ergonomic design. I myself transcribed <unbreak>50,000</unbreak> copies with such instruments.

d0bdc05847459916.ContentText: Where are you going? The trial isn't over, you can't just leave!

7e8d22513f5770ff.ContentText: Hm? Your mind might've wandered, but that doesn't mean you can. Come back and finish the trial!

bbeaf33d11b2d923.ContentText: Took you long enough... I know you — you're {NICKNAME}, General Jing Yuan's honored guest!

7bb4d548407c596a.ContentText: You're here undercover, right? So am I! You've got to believe me!

fd3c073ffceea373.ContentText: *sigh* Is this really the time for jokes of that quality... You're here undercover, right? Well, so am I!

3e29595814b64d5c.ContentText: W—Wait a second! You're here undercover, right? So am I!

a9a7734f336f98ed.ContentText: I'm a Cloud Knight from the Exalting Sanctum garrison. That Green Hibiscus has been sneaking around spreading heretical lies for a while now. That's why I'm here — to spy on him!

8bcdf52586206d56.ContentText: They were suspicious of me as soon as I arrived... It took a lot of effort to make them believe I wanted to become a disciple...

399d571e7e32443f.ContentText: Hmph, I have my reasoning. Cults like this want to recruit people with influence in law and order — I wanted them to know I was a Cloud Knight! Always know your enemy...

a5b5575f4745703d.ContentText: Shh, keep your voice down — these disciples don't miss much. If they discover us, we won't make it out of here.

3a373d68288c256c.ContentText: Listen carefully — I help you copy the text, you cover for me, and I get word out to the Seat of Divine Foresight...

cac4672223c5e119.ContentText: You can trust me with the transcription. I spent over <unbreak>150</unbreak> years pen-pushing in the Seat of Divine Foresight before I became a Cloud Knight — I could do this in my sleep.

98656760434b3907.ContentText: Psst, hey, stop writing — get over here!

ef25f978f89e96a0.ContentText: Stop writing — you wanna fall under their spell? I'll finish it for you — go keep a lookout!

cd17e9d7cc0ee185.ContentText: Alright, finally... I know you — you're {NICKNAME}, General Jing Yuan's honored guest!

4bb0395718dfab3a.ContentText: You're here undercover, right? So am I! You've got to believe me!

6ceff780c9126c31.ContentText: *sigh* Is this really the time for jokes of that quality... You're here undercover, right? Well, so am I!

e7cc9d89098f25b0.ContentText: W—Wait a second! You're here undercover, right? So am I!

68600b6f1bad4517.ContentText: I'm a Cloud Knight from the Exalting Sanctum garrison. That Green Hibiscus has been sneaking around spreading heretical lies for a while now. That's why I'm here — to spy on him!

e6a2a9775f0d1a0e.ContentText: They were suspicious of me as soon as I arrived... It took a lot of effort to make them believe I wanted to become a disciple...

08a4e71bac415095.ContentText: Hmph, I have my reasoning. Cults like this want to recruit people with influence in law and order — I wanted them to know I was a Cloud Knight! Always know your enemy...

834bad23ec90b104.ContentText: Shh, keep your voice down — these disciples don't miss much. If they discover us, we won't make it out of here.

49070d2a6725c398.ContentText: Listen carefully — I help you copy the text, you cover for me, and I get word out to the Seat of Divine Foresight...

2452144910c43734.ContentText: Take your time, still your mind, and transcribe the text. Allow the beautiful enlightenment of Thousand-Handed Merciful Medicus' Salvation to permeate your being.

7d9a4e3f9504dd85.ContentText: You're finished? So soon? Let me see... Hmm... Hmm... Yes, it would appear you are finished — a fast and accurate transcription. It seems you are destined for immortality.

2328303766424762.ContentText: Calm yourself... The initiation is divided into two steps — you and the Cloud Knight have completed the first. Now... only the second remains.

5a80391957799bb6.ContentText: Sure... but can it wait till tomorrow? I'm supposed to be on duty right now — they'll get suspicious if I don't head back soon.

cdc7a2305b9e9fab.ContentText: No need to worry, the second step is extraordinarily simple. It'll all be over soon enough.

3415c4abb9c3c360.ContentText: The Disciples' initiation is goverened by the following principle — never accept who you suspect, and never suspect who you accept. So...

e1e51ea4b1d58ce1.ContentText: ...it's time for you two to battle it out. Whoever survives will officially become a disciple.

4e88c66017bb2fcf.ContentText: Transcribing scripture allows us to ascertain your devotion, but determining whether or not you'll be loyal to the organization requires a stronger guarantee... Sorry, there's nothing I can do about it, I didn't write the rules.

cccb64685b1b04e6.ContentText: There is nothing that can be done. I didn't write the rules. If you are unwilling to complete the initiation process, then we will have to ask that you keep our secrets hidden... permanently...

3d0f927127674a49.ContentText: Excellent! The Disciples of Sanctus Medicus loves enthusiastic new blood! Well then, show us what you're made of!

b3921b0fdb8c1d1f.ContentText: W—Whoa, whoa — you're kidding, right? We came here to lengthen our lifespans, not shorten them! You can't just make us fight like this!

8f3ff8782f551388.ContentText: We aren't forcing you to fight — by all means refuse if you wish... but we won't possibly be able to let either of you leave.

59570d07acf8e454.ContentText: I... Fine, fine — but at least let me prepare. I've never done anything like this before...

a129463f36e587bb.ContentText: Very well, but you'll need to ask your opponent, too...

1bcfd44777348972.ContentText: Good. Then prepare yourselves. Time is precious — make it quick.

03f5c700a2540425.ContentText: Listen... I have an idea that will let you join the Disciples of Sanctus Medicus, and let me get the heck out of here in one piece.

a984a8f873932002.ContentText: You and I fight, and I lose to you — I pretend that you finished me off. Then, you pretend to help them remove my body by dragging me out of here...

02cc9aeef7d34ccb.ContentText: That way we both accomplish our objectives.

bdd83d6cc9f7c500.ContentText: Oh, uh... I've seen your skills... Please don't mess up and actually kill me...

16ea17634e0a3901.ContentText: Good. I know I could trust you... My life is in your hands!

8637baf39911946f.ContentText: Just... Ugh, whatever, I got myself into this — let fate decide. Just try and hold back a little, okay!?

4d95b24e6d683055.ContentText: So, have you prepared yourselves? Are you ready to fight?

2ef974aa231722ce.ContentText: What magnificent skill! He was fierce, but no match for you.

b2e6d0d3c9e2915e.ContentText: I'm glad you prevailed — that Cloud Knight waltzed straight up to us in uniform and asked if he could join — hardly a convincing spectacle. I doubt I ever could've trusted him.

60b672ccc1f4d567.ContentText: Purple Chrysanthemum, Blue Peach, find somewhere to dispose of the body.

b77704e577483200.ContentText: Oh, you've dealt with this kind of thing before?

1088dedbfb5aa601.ContentText: A long-time associate, eh? You're well-connected, I see...

ef4860b24b269f4a.ContentText: Side... hustle? Ahem, very well — these are hard times, I suppose.

70cf92aa0798e953.ContentText: Not at all! As I said earlier — disciples never suspect who we accept.

067b64c493619bbc.ContentText: Hmm... this does have its advantages. Our brothers and sisters have been proselytizing in Exalting Sanctum over the last few days — we may have attracted the attention of the devils... Having you dispose of the Cloud Knight will be safer.

755f7ebbb4fe104d.ContentText: As such, this can be your first mission as a disciple. You take an active approach to getting things done — I'll be sure to pass that on to my superiors.

541f009204ca08b6.ContentText: In any case... my hearty congratulations on your admission to the Disciples of Sanctus Medicus. From now on, you will be known by the code name... Gray Peony!

ad30e28888dc8a1f.ContentText: Well, Gray Peony, let's depart separately to avoid attracting attention — we'll rendezvous at a different location later. Until then.

1bac6d0e24aacda8.ContentText: Whew. I did a good job playing dead, didn't I?

d5723ad2b558c35b.ContentText: Those people are out of their minds — watch your step next time you're around them...

da0126e462bc3775.ContentText: Gah, enough with the jokes already — it's a miracle either of us is alive.

580dececa5eec0e4.ContentText: With your skills, you've got a better chance than most.

3d234b37d50d07f7.ContentText: With your skills, you've got a better chance than most.

b7ffe9401589b3ee.ContentText: I should report back to the Seat of Divine Foresight. Stay safe, friend!

5e4fb3fdfb050dee.ContentText: (Green Hibiscus agreed to meet me here, but there's no sight of him. What gives?)
5e4fb3fdfb050dee.Speaker: playerboy

6200d104dc95270d.ContentText: (There's a letter here... What's this on the enevlope? "Gray Peony..." This must be from Green Hibiscus.)
6200d104dc95270d.Speaker: playerboy

d9f0de737a34b004.ContentText: (The Disciples sure know how to keep a low profile... Looks like I'll need to help them complete this mission.)
d9f0de737a34b004.Speaker: playerboy

f2c211fbb610d91b.ContentText: (If they're looking to intercept a letter, then I should probably search around the Exalting Sanctum's Cycrane Stand.)
f2c211fbb610d91b.Speaker: playerboy

7e3a3fed2c6c5c7a.ContentText: (It doesn't seem to be on this Cycrane Stand. Let's check out another one.)
7e3a3fed2c6c5c7a.Speaker: playerboy

9892c367a7cf6bf9.ContentText: (What's written on this package? "Seat of Divine Foresight, Urgent..." This is it — the mail the Disciples want to intercept.)
9892c367a7cf6bf9.Speaker: playerboy

d32533d66dc4bc00.ContentText: (Hmm, seems like it's encypted somehow... Makes sense, this is critical intelligence after all... Let's see if I can crack the code.)
d32533d66dc4bc00.Speaker: playerboy

461738a9c6b44257.ContentText: (Code cracked... Huh, it's an internal order from the Disciples of Sanctus Medicus.)
461738a9c6b44257.Speaker: playerboy

5b0297b6551faed6.ContentText: (Judging from these "Urgent Instructions," the Disciples are aware of a Seat of Divine Foresight operation to infiltrate their ranks... No wonder Green Hibiscus was so eager to intercept this.)
5b0297b6551faed6.Speaker: playerboy

e66cc3c68e2269d4.ContentText: (I'll use my phone to make a copy and then hand it over to Green Hibiscus.)
e66cc3c68e2269d4.Speaker: playerboy

6594b3d1b4f79ea4.ContentText: Is that the general's honored guest? I didn't expect to see you around Exalting Sanctum.

0050ae283688aa06.ContentText: The person in charge of the courier cycranes here is a Vidyadhara — just like me. Her day has arrived — she's already headed to Scalegorge Waterscape to self-reincarnate.

d5d77c10bcd378f5.ContentText: I'll be handling her duties until her replacement arrives.

53e4421900060264.ContentText: As a Vidyadhara, one's lifespan typically spans six or seven hundred years. At the end of that span, there comes a day when we journey to Scalegorge Waterscape and embark on a new phase through self-reincarnation. It marks a significant moment in our eternal life cycle.

d1488fff0f7004db.ContentText: Haha, don't be. The lifespan of a Vidyadhara typically spans six or seven hundred years. At the end of that span, there comes a day when we journey to Scalegorge Waterscape and embark on a new phase through self-reincarnation. It marks a significant moment in our eternal life cycle.

4f541e0752a07b92.ContentText: So, what can I help you with?

e5650c7365a53e11.ContentText: When it comes to classified matters concerning the Seat of Divine Foresight, it's best I keep my questions to myself. Here's the package.

63a7b27ba9052090.ContentText: Well, I'll let you get back to your business — I've got things I need to do attend to. See you, and take care.

6f787ee07b7ca95d.ContentText: (It's an internal order from the Disciples of Sanctus Medicus.)
6f787ee07b7ca95d.Speaker: playerboy

e897b547f712467e.ContentText: (Judging from these "Urgent Instructions," the Disciples are aware of a Seat of Divine Foresight operation to infiltrate their ranks... No wonder Green Hibiscus was so eager to intercept this.)
e897b547f712467e.Speaker: playerboy

1a3010e1ab44775f.ContentText: (I'll use my phone to make a copy and then hand it over to Green Hibiscus.)
1a3010e1ab44775f.Speaker: playerboy

1f58de9e39f4969d.ContentText: Gray Peony, did you intercept the secret letter?

b074c4a7185822cc.ContentText: You read the contents? Ugh... this job is proving to be somewhat difficult. Those devils at the Seat of Divine Foresight are too cunning.

6f86728f008ec5e3.ContentText: Good work. Unfortunately, the traitor has already found refuge under their wing... It appears that even our interception couldn't prevent the intel on our mission from slipping through the cracks.

c1edc09608aba89a.ContentText: *sigh* Your work here is done — we'll take it from here... Of course, as a fellow disciple, there will come a time when you too will be tasked with resolving such issues — one among many duties of the Disciples.

e32d7ebfb8de6991.ContentText: You have already proven yourself to be a competent disciple. The head of our operations in Exalting Sanctum is coming to pay you a visit.

617024c7fc3e4c10.ContentText: Just a moment. He will be here shortly.

36c212b0825d74f7.ContentText: Mauve Moon, this is the reliable disciple I mentioned to you — Gray Peony.

b19eb0b8c2da20ee.ContentText: Gray Peony, this is Mauve Moon — the head of our operations in Exalting Sanctum.

b0446dd04952120c.ContentText: It seems you have some impressive skills in your arsenal.

72bd1bb8346d9123.ContentText: No need for modesty. I've studied martial arts for years — I can tell how strong you are with just a glance.

e2fe27e8e9da0cd1.ContentText: Easy, Hibiscus... I like this kid.

6140cdf12d39ef50.ContentText: You seem like you've got it all figured out... What brings you to the Disciples of Sanctus Medicus?

3691bbd9b3576437.ContentText: I can appreciate that. The Devilish Archer Author's so-called salvation is no different from destruction.

b4d459e1f6b7392e.ContentText: They used deceit and power to mislead the people of the Xianzhou, instilling fear in them about the blessings of Merciful Medicus.

d3709786410846b5.ContentText: The mission of the Disciples is to strike down this groundless fear, so that the people of the Xianzhou can return to the warm embrace of Merciful Medicus.

517c5d8e84391d24.ContentText: Good, so do I. I used to think determination and hard work were enough to achieve that... But I've come to realize it's not that simple.

b61d79fcfdc15c9e.ContentText: During my many years as a Cloud Knight, I realized something... An individual's strength is limited.

63ec1bf5f5d1eda7.ContentText: So, I abandoned my mortal body and became a faithful servant of Merciful Medicus.

b746ae0ea8422240.ContentText: Good. Life is a miracle and a blessing. Any futile attempt to forsake it is a disgraceful betrayal.

105888052c549641.ContentText: You have been enlightened to the significance of immortality. You have already surpassed those shameful mortals.

ef1909db7c22418a.ContentText: Don't worry about it. The pursuit of power and immortality is ingrained in the fabric of human nature.

74053bd33b760193.ContentText: Any act that runs counter to that instinct is lamentable, shameful, and futile... You may not have found the path yet, but you've already chosen the right direction. Very good.

09b10dedc73eb4fc.ContentText: Here, take this prescription. Through this medicine, you will become like me. You will be able to break the shackles that the Devilish Archer Author has used to chain your soul. You will gain unbridled power and freedom.

752f27e4e5f7ff8d.ContentText: The disciple responsible for creating medicinal pellets heard of your exploits — they prepared the prescription for you personally.

5755a9bb38a8d4f6.ContentText: Some of the ingredients can be purchased at an apothecary, but others will require you to come up with your own solution... Given your strength, that shouldn't pose a problem.

51be6f894b98480f.ContentText: I don't know. I've heard our members are in the tens of thousands.

d0010d918ef81d26.ContentText: The Disciples of Sanctus Medicus has a flat organizational structure — the head of each area reports directly to the master. I know nothing about what goes on elsewhere.

40453b9a5b446289.ContentText: The benefit is that even if our enemies were to wipe out the Exalting Sanctum branch, it wouldn't affect our brothers and sisters in other areas.

9276a1a16333dfc8.ContentText: That's sensitive information... I know who they are, but for their security, I can't reveal their identities...

a0f8ef6867df77fb.ContentText: It's not that I doubt your loyalty, Gray Peony. It's like I said — security.

1f057d70ab11a1b2.ContentText: The boss? You mean the master... You'll meet them, but for now there's no rush. All in good time.

50cb5b77a1454895.ContentText: Keep fulfilling your duties — as you have been. With your strength, you'll have an audience with the master in no time.

cb72217fe194a904.ContentText: I'm ashamed to admit it, but I once worked alongside those devils... I trained in spear techniques for almost a century — I nearly became a Cloud Knight instructor.

b0867fcb10b13d17.ContentText: But I was trapped in a weak, mortal shell. I was never able to surpass the final barrier that separated me from the martial arts geniuses.

2ec91dd35411120e.ContentText: You understand, right? The more I devoted myself to the spear, the more I lamented my condition. The closer I came to the peak, the clearer my limits became.

bf153d9287ed6438.ContentText: Fortunately, the Draught of Draconic Surge — the prescription you hold in your hand — rescued me. Once I took that medicine, I became more powerful than any mortal could ever dream of.

4438978a4770aab9.ContentText: Now, everything has changed... Zhixin and his pitiful spearmanship are no more... All that remains is a loyal disciple of Merciful Medicus.

d3f469817b246556.ContentText: ...Even the thought of that past fills me with shame. I was once Zhixin, a rat for the Seat of Divine Foresight... But those ignorant devils never realized — I had already been redeemed by the power of Merciful Medicus.

81c3cb7a73363c3f.ContentText: Wait... you recognize me? Where do you know me from? Your face changed when you heard my name...

51acb465533f2de4.ContentText: M—Mauve Moon, sir, we have a problem... I suspect this person may be the agent who's been looking for you...

2421bd7241be2774.ContentText: ...Idiot! What kind of trials are you running? You let an agent infiltrate our ranks!?

df7ca080dc986f14.ContentText: I—I couldn't have known, sir! I witnessed this person slay a Cloud Knight before my very eyes!

7d69f768c5fecdc5.ContentText: Detestable... The Devilish Archer Author allows these pitiful mortals to face death without fear — self-sacrifice is their way of fooling us into opening our doors.

22f8d960973de9a2.ContentText: Merciful Medicus has sharpened my senses — nothing gets past me. A pathetic mortal like you could never understand.

d0fe4b598f7d6beb.ContentText: Merciful Medicus has sharpened my senses — nothing gets past me. A pathetic mortal like you could never understand.

374c6dd4eda28ea0.ContentText: In that case, Divine Foresight devil, it's time for you to meet your demise!

43b8ab015eb98b99.ContentText: I'm glad to see you've returned in one piece.

2278ecd7ae86ca82.ContentText: So, what happened? Did everything go as planned?

7bc0dece32c6f74b.ContentText: Don't worry, your operation was a success — although your identity was ultimately exposed, you gained a wealth of invaluable intelligence. On top of that, you managed to get out without a scratch.

d24b50e6e7ec8ed4.ContentText: *sigh* ...I never imagined that Zhixin would choose the path of evil.

7cea0adfdd47aea5.ContentText: The Cloud Knight you encountered only just finished reporting back to me — he mentioned discovering Zhixin at the scene. I was hoping that maybe — just maybe Zhixin had attempted to join forces with you against the enemy — that he'd fought with all his might...

0bb763ac1bc8c6c6.ContentText: {NICKNAME}, you did the right thing. I'm afraid this is how the Plagues Author operates — using notions of power and life to draw countless people like Zhixin away from bright futures... down a path of no return.

e00bef334f9812e7.ContentText: You've managed to shine a light on the darkness of the enemy. With this intelligence, the Seat of Divine Foresight will be able to improve its strategy...

52f56ac39dafe1f5.ContentText: ...and for all your efforts, please accept this reward.

d10230cbe0e26b64.ContentText: Is there anything else you'd like to know about?

4e667eb1f04c6ddb.ContentText: The current state... I'm afraid we know next to nothing. We dispatched agents, but they were only able to linger on the edges of the organization. Your operation is the furthest anyone's managed to infiltrate.

cc720cba337ce492.ContentText: The Seat of Divine Foresight is still striving to answer one question: Is this but the resurgent shadow of an organization silenced a thousand years ago... or have they been lurking in the darkness all along?

edb2cae3e3b15969.ContentText: Whatever the case, this sudden re-emergence hints at a hidden conspiracy...

94a0b0ed5f9e7828.ContentText: It's troubled me deeply over recent few months... it's hard to tell what all of this is building towards.

ff2bfed2d4053eef.ContentText: Not at all. The Disciples' secret letter makes it sound as if we infiltrated their ranks in great numbers... The reality is that only a handful of agents have successfully slipped into the organization...

7d6e9cdb17651306.ContentText: ...and the majority of them lacked the strength you had to make it back unscathed after their identity was exposed. They didn't have the wisdom and good fortune to gain the organization's trust quickly...

9eae5b04c797d41d.ContentText: An agent can't actually consume those pellets of the Disciples... doing so would mean the end of their life as they knew it.

2fca410da5fb604c.ContentText: The point is, there hasn't been anyone like you who managed to delve into the group's core and obtain so much firsthand information.

f19d14ef181f9ae4.ContentText: Thousand-Handed Merciful Medicus' Salvation is a manuscript transcribed from a sacred text — I don't know where the Disciples obtained it. It likely consists of fragments of banned works from the Befall Era.

73904ee6d4ed1175.ContentText: As I see it, there isn't anything particularly alarming about the text. It recalls the acts of the Plagues Author's warped creatures from an equally warped perspective...

ed0cf0dd6aba1412.ContentText: The scripture doesn't have the power to lead people astray — they do that to themselves... but it does feed lies and false hope.

6f0162d527899d5b.ContentText: The prescription you acquired is... beyond my knowledge.

b53b951096dba7a8.ContentText: There are a few reliable alchemists that reside in Exalting Sanctum. I'd like to ask you to consult with them on the particulars of the prescription. This will allow the Seat of Divine Foresight to have a clear target for creating an antidote...

08f35cfdbaf82e2d.ContentText: {NICKNAME}, given that the Disciples of Sanctus Medicus has become aware of our operation, it's about time the Seat of Divine Foresight reeled in its net.

9e0980fe4ea24286.ContentText: If you turn up any details about the prescription, feel free to come back and find me any time.

1fc6e2f60b426e6f.ContentText: What's on your mind? Did you want to ask about something else?

50652530dd388fcc.ContentText: Ask away, I'll tell you everything I know.

3e1a93500ef44c03.ContentText: Very well, see you soon. Remember to look for those alchemists when you have time — ask them about the prescription. I can't leave my post right now.

0d06473d7d1922b2.ContentText: Uh... C—Can I help you with anything...?

3ecc2544734cc995.ContentText: Right... I see. Let me take a look at the prescription. I'm afraid I'm not the most talented alchemist — I probably won't be able to make much sense of it...

b972eb4cb39c2a04.ContentText: Huh? Th—This calls for... Vidyadhara bone marrow? Whoever wrote this prescription must be out of their mind...

3fbf39561d9fc90f.ContentText: Sorry... I can't make heads or tails of it. The ingredients listed are just too... strange.

be01d75e60ff9e26.ContentText: Based on what little I do know, I doubt the other alchemists will be able to understand it either... I think there's only one person who could grasp this kind of pharmacology...

80776b6e353b60c8.ContentText: Lady Dan Shu is the Luofu's — no, the Xianzhou Alliance's most knowledgeable alchemist... She may be sightless, but she has sharper senses than most...

dab2a97663ceeb03.ContentText: I'll wager she can wrap her head around this prescription.

81d7777fdfeb243a.ContentText: When she's not working, she's usually enjoying the breeze over in Synwood Pavilion. Why don't you go and ask her about it?

abb0efa4e4a1e47b.ContentText: Ah, why hello there. Anything I can help you with?

d62a21bc5e571584.ContentText: So this is official Seat of Divine Foresight business, eh? Then I'll do everything I can to assist you, haha. Let's take a look at this prescription you mentioned.

5c766fc5c85ab48f.ContentText: If this request had come from anywhere else, it would've seemed like a joke... but the Seat of Divine Foresight only deals in the serious...

9d2ea1dddff64c48.ContentText: I can't understand this prescription, and I imagine that other alchemists won't be able to make sense of it either. I recommend you go directly to the chief alchemist, Lady Dan Shu.

4afd3bd6d806cf09.ContentText: Lady Dan Shu is renowned for her unique line of reasoning. She's proposed several prescriptions that would have been incomprehensible to us if she hadn't explained the pharmacology...

9e8eadef8aa60fba.ContentText: ...still, those same prescriptions have always been able to produce miraculous effects. Lady Dan Shu is a truly gifted alchemist.

f769dfe60e89d683.ContentText: All the more amazing given her sightlessness, wouldn't you say?

91b24c825b5e1871.ContentText: Lady Dan Shu likes to pass the time over at Synwood Pavilion — I'm sure you'll run into her if you head that way.

7437d934a6529a5e.ContentText: The Seat of Divine Foresight? Let me see the prescription.

c7cc6d256fd1a4bc.ContentText: It's a horrifying prescription... and I can't make any sense of it.

36b0871c916e194d.ContentText: Go and ask Lady Dan Shu. She's our chief alchemist.

b09969132796a84a.ContentText: She may be sightless, but she's more qualified than all of us.

32209b0ae408f253.ContentText: She's no stranger to helping others, either — always prescribing medicine to those in need — and free of charge.

03f6dd03f0e63998.ContentText: She'll certainly be willing to help the Seat of Divine Foresight.

85b436fbad865719.ContentText: You can find her at Synwood Pavilion.

bc4cd2a579f96104.ContentText: I've been looking forward to meeting you... {NICKNAME}.

ac520eba0328160f.ContentText: You have a very distinct scent. Losing one sense forces the other senses to become sharper.

2a94acc24687eb26.ContentText: Everyone does — you're the hero who rescued the Vidyadhara Healer Lady in Exalting Sanctum.

ab5efaa858d51695.ContentText: I heard from other alchemists you have a prescription you wish me to assess... can you read it to me?

fb8c8e991f6f45fb.ContentText: Don't worry, I've trained myself to remember everything I hear.

79991ca162a16fb2.ContentText: Hmm... A strange and dangerous prescription, but I believe I understand the pharmacology... It involves drawing upon the strength of Long's Scions to attain the power of... ascension.

0faa0b0d75a63231.ContentText: The specifics, however, will require further investigation. This will take some time...

8a86b115b622ebb0.ContentText: ...I could hardly happen upon Vidyadhara bone marrow and test the prescription myself, could I?

1e6ee8d4ed101f6a.ContentText: Leave your contact details with me. When I've completed my assessment of the pharmacology, I'll get in touch with you.

8e7f041d2f3a0e90.ContentText: (So Mauve Moon was the agent that Qingzu lost contact with... he joined the Disciples of Sanctus Medicus.)
8e7f041d2f3a0e90.Speaker: playerboy

d36c627b4d6f6289.ContentText: (I should go to the Seat of Divine Foresight and tell Qingzu... I don't know if this mission was a success or a failure.)
d36c627b4d6f6289.Speaker: playerboy

3ff3c2c17131c61d.ContentText: Would you like to learn the truth about the Arbiter?

e288a4b93fe8d81a.ContentText: Would you like to learn about the true nature of immortality?

902156b237cbf563.ContentText: Is the Reignbow Arbiter truly just?

820b08eb337b7b90.ContentText: Is the Plagues Author truly evil?

e1b4c7cde2cf7c21.ContentText: O, mercy of Sanctus Medicus. Grant me a body impervious to steel, the courage of a thousand armies, a strength that ten thousand foes cannot suppress!

30f36c286391c5c1.ContentText: You think you're a match for me, devil!? Your death is inevitable — surrender and I'll make it quick!

c1fb5109a2196e18.ContentText: Danger is practically an inevitability, take care and try to stay out of harm's way.

e27e125b20ee1d02.ContentText: *sigh* Such a serious matter — I'm sorry I can't be of much help to you. The assistance is appreciated — stay safe.

f637dc67a51d0012.ContentText: The pharmacology of this Draught of Draconic Surge is peculiar. I'll need time to run a thorough analysis. When I have a conclusive answer, I'll contact you immediately.

d7b8f448bff2ed7f.ContentText: (Looks like Dan Shu found something conclusive — let's go and talk to her.)
d7b8f448bff2ed7f.Speaker: playerboy

98fd72cc5b930d15.ContentText: Ah, you're back. From the sound of your stride, I sense you're in good spirits.

673794c5655f6632.ContentText: Many who undertake the far-reaching journey to the Xianzhou are weighed down by a heavy heart and exhaustion... but your steps are bold and steady - a stride worthy of a Nameless.

e92b06bd222d3c7b.ContentText: A persons's footfall reveals a lot about their strength and emotions — much like how a person's breath may serve as an indication of their overall health.

daa8b8f61d81a448.ContentText: I wouldn't be envious. This is not an innate ability — merely compensation for my visual impairment. Ultimately, nothing I hear or smell can match the vividness of the colors that you perceive.

887752ef15922709.ContentText: Let's get down to business... I analyzed the prescription you procured: the Draught of Draconic Surge. Now that I have a preliminary conclusion, it needs to be delivered to the Seat of Divine Foresight.

183324e64945e1a6.ContentText: The conclusion... Put simply, I don't believe that the Draught of Draconic Surge holds the cure to the mara. Even in the foreseeable future, there will likely not be any such cure.

99f086de05e60c8f.ContentText: I've compiled the details into a written analysis. If you're interested, feel free to take a look.

ca8fc918d7dde1ec.ContentText: This is a copy of "Pharmacological Studies on the Draught of Draconic Surge." If the chief counselor wants to see it urgently, I'll have to ask you to deliver it for me.

360de30ff6972cbd.ContentText: Need something else? Isn't the Seat of Divine Foresight anxious to learn about the prescription?

9eeb8421aeb18fe8.ContentText: {NICKNAME}, you're back. Anything you wanted to share?

0be5561fddffaa43.ContentText: Wow, even for those alchemists, that was fast.

b67024295cff0c7a.ContentText: Dan Shu? Wait — why would the Alchemy Commission's chief alchemist be away from her post?

d44ae2530a505771.ContentText: I've heard that the chief alchemist is visually impaired — she rarely leaves the Alchemy Commission delve. She has a vast knowledge and expertise — no wonder she was able to analyze the pharmacology so quickly.

d320f6415fce5957.ContentText: No cure? Tsk, where did these villains get their hands on such a complex prescription? This is infuriating...

8e3cd54964d01e16.ContentText: Still, this is a clue we can follow. Thank you, {NICKNAME}. Please accept these gifts for your efforts.

6fffd1eded7f3bd5.ContentText: Those were rewards from the Seat of Divine Foresight — these are gifts from me, personally. You've done so much for the Luofu... for the Xianzhou. This is the least I could do.

ee0b97f630b01244.ContentText: Please, take them. You've done so much for the Luofu... for the Xianzhou. This is the least I could do.

aa14303c03595ebe.ContentText: Please, take them. You've done so much for the Luofu... for the Xianzhou. This is the least I could do.

ffbf523284877147.ContentText: (A strange prescription and a sudden loss of communication with the Alchemy Commission delve... It seems there's more going on than meets the eye.)

c221c5c75c31280b.ContentText: {NICKNAME}, thank you for coming on such short notice.

39dd34a922e4dc82.ContentText: My stay in Exalting Sanctum was supposed to be focused on treating people and delivering medicine, but the Seat of Divine Foresight tasked me with analyzing the prescription... I've been severely delayed.

944e52b151a5c0a5.ContentText: I've already concocted some of the medicine in question, but there can't be any further delays. Could you assist me in ensuring it arrives on time?

74bb1aed2fb82530.ContentText: Thank you. If she's gotten into any trouble, {NICKNAME}, be sure to let me know when you get back.

43eaa6c08addd99f.ContentText: My colleagues were supposed to handle the deliveries, but now healers are needed everywhere... I can't count on them to do it. I thought long and hard, but I realized I had no choice but to ask you. Perhaps you could see it as repaying a favor?

d4ede1542e29611e.ContentText: The patient in question is a little girl. If she's gotten into any trouble, be sure to let me know when you get back, {NICKNAME}.

5b1cf2d2d3179d99.ContentText: This is the medicine. Her house is near the Court of Tranquility, it shouldn't be hard to find her.

e0a0e366624bbe2e.ContentText: Can't see right, can't see left!

c2312a421e3f5da0.ContentText: Heads to the east, ends up west!

fd54341611e4a474.ContentText: (Is this the one Dan Shu sent me to find? Does she come here to treat other sightless people?)
fd54341611e4a474.Speaker: playerboy

0ecab16d556e91d1.ContentText: She's stuck, hehe! She can't get down!

6b70982968ec0007.ContentText: Hey, what you looking at, outworlder? Mind your own business!

125e7632e4d9127e.ContentText: What's this gotta do with you? You her family or something? Cause you don't look like it. Hmph, you're just trying to be a hero. You sure you wanna mess with the Luofu Trio?

7d44b1c34f16ee47.ContentText: Hahahaha! What a doofus! Who hasn't heard of the Luofu Trio?

8d0d577598ce7450.ContentText: The Luofu Trio is made up of two — uh... th—three super awesome kids that everyone's afraid of! Even the Realm-Keeping Commission!

7cb2a41859105fed.ContentText: Go ahead! You think we're scared of you? They'll just put us in detention — we'll be free again in no time...

9e89a53ca0021623.ContentText: *sigh* Let's leave it, Boss. Detention's detention, but if your dad finds out, you'll get yelled at and start crying again...

11348a213a57145c.ContentText: Hey! Why'd you bring that up... Hmph, you're right, we shouldn't stoop to this short-lifer's level.

2309a3bb2083b49c.ContentText: Did you hear that? The boss is letting you off the hook, so scram!

f0f0f343a81ef9da.ContentText: Yeah, the boss doesn't wanna stoop to your level. Now buzz off, before he yells at you and makes you cry!

d0473809228f6a73.ContentText: You idiot! Enough about yelling and crying!

4af5114bd6830bdd.ContentText: You think you can join the Luofu Trio just because you feel like it?

91edbdb24220292d.ContentText: It's called a trio, which means only two — uh... th—three people are allowed! D—Don't you know how to count?

4ec00611661d206a.ContentText: Haha, look, this short-lifer wants to join us!

dc10f754b4e6970c.ContentText: You don't even know our rules! *clears throat* Section one — no making friends outside the Trio! No boyfriends or girlfriends! All members must devote their youth to the Trio!

60941fab4c480daa.ContentText: Number two — earning pocket money through chores is forbidden — all sources of income must be "voluntary" donations from other kids!

cf1d53f7780d79b9.ContentText: Number three, no making friends with grown-ups — except your mom and dad. You must fight against all grown-up forces to the end!

aed8b519e5d39eaf.ContentText: Number four, the boss never cries. Sure, his dad might yell at him sometimes, and the lyceum abecedaries like to make him stand in the hallway, but those are tears of strength — not weakness!

49f9f9ffb88a3338.ContentText: Hey! Since when did we have a number four!?

dbf9b564a75571e2.ContentText: Ahem, ignore that last one... If you really, truly wanna join the Luofu Trio, we might be able to make an exception... But tell me, what can you bring to the table?

29b5532226504ac6.ContentText: Snacks? Not bad, let's see them.

e58151a30b9d80b3.ContentText: Fickle outworlder, you think you can bribe the Luofu Trio with a couple snacks? Think again!

8699275d9cb1ca2b.ContentText: Shh, let's see if they're tasty, first.

5f341399a1984a78.ContentText: I... guess it couldn't hurt. Good idea, Boss! One pack for you, one for me.

e313379313d6a740.ContentText: Hey, what about me? Where's mine?

e0f16d915e3867f9.ContentText: Eat dirt! There are only two packs — just enough for me and the boss. Why would you get any?

3c25118997e91b41.ContentText: You always steal my snacks when the boss isn't here. Now that he's arrived in Exalting Sanctum, it's payback time.

dd23997651d761b4.ContentText: Quit it, you two. Both packs are mine, that way there's nothing for you to fight over.

50a655d22a5dd657.ContentText: You can't just take both packs for yourself! Isn't the Luofu Trio supposed to share everything evenly?

e1ea03816955e19e.ContentText: Evenly? How was it even when you stole my share, hmm?

366bd36cd6180805.ContentText: Who said anything about sharing? Might makes right!

898f45858858c396.ContentText: A—Antimatter Legion? Stop bluffing! Why would the Antimatter Legion be in Exalting Sanctum?

cee8f3da6dbdab4e.ContentText: Uh, boss... I don't think they're kidding...

8fb8a57a616672a7.ContentText: M—My mom told me the Antimatter Legion eat children who misbehave... It's not true, is it?

781619969804ec78.ContentText: C—C—Calm down! Don't let them scare you!

357d977232d339fc.ContentText: HELP! The Antimatter Legion is going to eat us!

797625a842b4afaa.ContentText: Hmph! The Antimatter Legion wants me to join them? Hah, looks like my reputation has reached the farthest corners of the galaxy! When do I report for duty?

51d041e3d4dfd471.ContentText: Boss, they said "hire a fighter," not "hire you." It might be me they're after!

a0fbb169518c848d.ContentText: What are you guys thinking? It's me they want.

d012e7ec183fb6f0.ContentText: Ha, you think the Antimatter Legion would come all this way for you? You're a goody two shoes.

fe6357a0020a22b3.ContentText: What are you guys talking about!? Obviously, I'm the baddest baddy in the galaxy!

896ab5b0a88f2743.ContentText: Yeah, right! You think the baddest baddy in the galaxy would burst into tears whenever they're yelled at by an abecedary!

4a3bfbfa7fe94353.ContentText: Say that again, I dare you.

1ae5935fe7b6c68a.ContentText: Yeah — fight, fight, fight! The winner gets to join the Legion with me!

c8b4ca02c376f94a.ContentText: If it's a fight you want, you're getting it first!

9fd1c557a70a8693.ContentText: Who do you think you are? Keep your nose out of this — I beat people up all the time.

4ecbe80c2d4e6a4d.ContentText: Yeah, get lost! Stop meddling in our business!

dfe7ce150bb1f5bc.ContentText: Argh, stop yelling and help me up already!

8dfaa1c255f44e7d.ContentText: They used some kind of hidden power — I saw it! You're a cheater!

3a22dc1d3a452f67.ContentText: That's right! If you hadn't cheated, I would've knocked your lights out!

f00061486da67659.ContentText: You sure about that, boss? They didn't even flinch.

1f1687cb3457d9ac.ContentText: Ugh, shut up! Boss, let's get outta here — we shouldn't fight anyone that doesn't respect martial arts!

8c533a244232eb5e.ContentText: Hmph! I'll let you off the hook this time — next time we fight fair and square!

574de0bdcbaf51a5.ContentText: Who do you think you are? Keep your nose out of this — I beat people up all the time.

e9f5482c73ab0001.ContentText: Yeah, get lost! Stop meddling in our business!

90e36e35ef988c00.ContentText: Argh, stop yelling and help me up already!

c8bebf3bb0ffee46.ContentText: They used some kind of hidden power — I saw it! You're a cheater!

d5d7cbb81d7413cb.ContentText: That's right! If you hadn't cheated, I would've knocked your lights out!

5624b4ac212e9a4b.ContentText: You sure about that, boss? They didn't even flinch.

4de221337083422f.ContentText: Ugh, shut up! Boss, let's get outta here — we shouldn't fight anyone that doesn't respect martial arts!

7c8fd9c19933e702.ContentText: Hmph! I'll let you off the hook, but remember — next time we fight fair and square!

32c89d7d6fd51264.ContentText: I'm... okay... it's my fault. I shouldn't have wandered off on my own... then I wouldn't have run into those guys.

b4bbd7752ca288f5.ContentText: They always laugh at me for being blind. They like to trip me up, and steal my things.

d48a05f3bd6d048e.ContentText: Thank goodness you're here, or they wouldn't have let me off so easily.

60f26b8462f7e5ef.ContentText: Oh, Dan Shu asked you to come?

fc5a45aa58512ea4.ContentText: Things are bad on the Luofu recently — Dan Shu must be very busy. Thank you, {F#miss}{M#mister}, remember to thank her for me.

9608925e6d7e5e8b.ContentText: (*sigh* Well, I've delivered the medicine. I should report back to Dan Shu.)
9608925e6d7e5e8b.Speaker: playerboy

d95f98db16778018.ContentText: How was she? Did you deliver the medicine?

860224ea4d27eeca.ContentText: She reminds me of myself when I was a child — I also had to find my way in the dark, face obstacles I couldn't predict, as well as deal with unconscious prejudices people had against me.

0d568113f6d8395a.ContentText: If I was ever injured by bullies or after a fall, I'd run crying to the healers at the Alchemy Commission and ask them to heal me. I suppose that's why I followed in their footsteps — to pay a little kindness forward.

4b956bb2e452f583.ContentText: Thank you for looking after the child. Could I ask you for another favor, {NICKNAME}?

f8768525039fd68c.ContentText: I want to meet the little girl, can you lead me to her?

fd067136b104fdae.ContentText: ...I worry about her wandering around on her own, and I want to know what's been on her mind lately.

7ec3d32e6da528b7.ContentText: Her parents passed away in the Denizens of Abundance Wars... The relatives who took her in aren't close to her, and whenever I treat her, she often confides in me.

a972e545e787b3d0.ContentText: A healer's medicine might remedy one's physical health, but sometimes the loneliness and hurt inside one's heart needs companionship and care to heal.

2b303f3da427d151.ContentText: She told me that whenever she's feeling troubled, she finds a quiet corner in the Artisanship Commission and just sits there, letting the sounds wash over her.

988550d1940637d2.ContentText: Her parents used to be artisans in the Commission, so I think she has some nostalgic connection to the place.

1a78c2c950d40d1b.ContentText: In all likelihood, that's where she'll be. *sigh* There's danger around every corner these days — especially for a sightless child. Let's go.

8c6aaedf01be6f39.ContentText: ...What's happening? Is the girl in trouble?

074754e7423b28b8.ContentText: It's alright, everything's okay now, Xiaoyu...

5e11f37861fa7b43.ContentText: *sniffle* Thank you {F#big sister}{M#big brother}, thank you Dan Shu...

137436c27a0922df.ContentText: You don't need to be scared anymore, {NICKNAME} is here.

43cc2149487aac55.ContentText: But I... When I think about all the trouble I've caused you two... I feel like such a burden... I'm sorry...

1c2680d6357229d6.ContentText: Is that why you're crying? Maybe... you should start getting used to this feeling...

c59c0ebd804c9245.ContentText: ...because in the next few centuries, visually impaired people like us will continue to require help from everyone we meet.

6c53d4c6fc0bebf4.ContentText: So, if a little bit of guilt like this is enough to break your heart, then how will you manage such an arduous path?

193062ae49cb306b.ContentText: I'm not trying to console her. This is... the reality.

6b2af0b5518bae22.ContentText: Walking alone in the darkness, fearing every incoming, invisible obstacle, unable to understand other people's descriptions...

29e6df229d1d40a1.ContentText: Everyone, everything is like a hot coal in the dark — invisible, yet still able to burn you.

7f7e8529a7f05320.ContentText: As a long-life species, she can expect life to continue like this for nearly a thousand years. She must learn to depend upon herself rather than just foolishly waiting around for the next hero to swoop in and save her.

2cd4257fa50c2370.ContentText: One hopes that would be the case...

ae917f7761ac40f1.ContentText: ...but that would require someone to be by her side every waking second of every day. In the meantime, she'll have to learn to withstand the darkness — just as I have.

2baa316dfa8a17ce.ContentText: Yes... by trying my best to change her personal circumstances.

ad679365b72a42d7.ContentText: In the meantime, she'll have to learn to withstand the darkness — just as I have.

146fee4939597850.ContentText: I... You're right, Dan Shu... From now on, I'll do my best to rely on myself...

7bd7c55ec124462c.ContentText: Good, I hope you remember this — forever.

a16485a90eb3cb21.ContentText: This place is too dangerous, {NICKNAME}. Let's head back to Exalting Sanctum.

90b6c14db45af5fa.ContentText: Thank you again, for all you've done.

e62bf344355b93c3.ContentText: It would seem we Incomplete Ones are often bullied from a tender age... I endured innumerous hardships to become chief alchemist, yet there are still things that leave me feeling helpless.

8bf0b53c06c80888.ContentText: That's the reason I said what I said... You might mistake my words for being hurtful — but the truth is, no amount of words can prepare her for what lies ahead.

39c04f34feda3f49.ContentText: For long-life species, these things are permanent. Whether we are beautiful or ugly, tall or short, wise or foolish — all of it is encoded into our flesh from the moment we are born.

ac1e334ab01fb227.ContentText: The impairments of short-life species can be corrected with ingenia or surgery, but that's an impossibility for Xianzhou natives.

fe4f9151b80f211e.ContentText: No matter the method employed, our bodies will eventually return to their original states.

588a9f59e6a25ac1.ContentText: I too was once a non-believer — I fooled myself into acquiring artificial eye implants... Soon thereafter, my sightless eyes began to regenerate, and I was left in pain and despair...

ff78c563628fe6c0.ContentText: That brief window of sight that I regained has turned into a perpetual source of anguish — forever etched into my mind...

bc375327f5c3c613.ContentText: For long-life species, this incompleteness is a permanent, unavoidable penance.

374b21303670060a.ContentText: Hmph, what a joke... Even the Denizens of Abundance — the so-called "abominations" — needn't endure such torture. Perhaps we Incomplete Ones are merely traitors cursed by the Plagues Author.

bd613f39a045c40d.ContentText: It's nothing... Forget I said anything.

6d691e989c63c698.ContentText: Thank you for sticking with me through all of this, {NICKNAME}. I think my aspirations in Exalting Sanctum have been met, for now.

f532a30674243edf.ContentText: Oh, I have a gift for you... though I'll need a little time to prepare it. I'll contact you once it's ready to collect.

fb8b9cb2fe34fa56.ContentText: Your footsteps still linger. Could it be that you still have unanswered questions?

a95afeabf646d13f.ContentText: Ask, and I shall answer to the best of my ability.

e6ac70c40afdf938.ContentText: Not all incompletions are without remedy. Take my ingenium arm, for example — it doesn't require any invasive surgery and operates by detecting bioelectric signals on my skin.

6bcfcabbca813fb9.ContentText: My eyes are another story — the optic nerves never fully developed. Transplants are a temporary solution, but they are soon rejected by the superior healing powers of the Xianzhou natives... The entire process is worse than death.

4a900c921a4e7ea2.ContentText: There are many similar cases... Skeletal deformities, soft tissue defects, congenital heart disease — the list goes on...

f8957e8b128e00eb.ContentText: For short-life species, all these problems can be solved with artificial organs and implants. For long-life species, however, they remain as incompletions.

4bb8f0a3c4cebc74.ContentText: To give a common example... Did you know that to varying degrees, most Xianzhou natives are plagued by oral diseases and jaw-related conditions?

a5012a9a490f62c5.ContentText: For most living creatures, wisdom teeth need to be removed as early possible... but for we long-life species, they are as stubborn as boulders. We must endure them for as long as we live.

af10ecf7374cd87e.ContentText: You see? This is the truth about the Vessel of Celestials... nothing more than a vessel of the Incomplete.

08230eedbb5fc607.ContentText: For beings transformed by the Abundance, there's a difference. Do you know how Abominations of Abundance and Xianzhou people differ?

78628ea92455dd95.ContentText: I've given this question much thought, using all the knowledge I've learned from the Alchemy Commission to answer it. But, deep down, I know there is only one correct answer: There is no difference.

f30954b164a53e04.ContentText: The only difference between us is whether we embrace or reject the long life placed upon us by the Abundance.

c8902299eaf00cfb.ContentText: The borisins, known for their ferocity among the Denizens of Abundance, are similar to the Foxians of the Yaoqing genetically... But the Foxians are not abominations — they're Xianzhou people.

469cb0a22e2236b2.ContentText: From there, we can say that the difference between an abomination and a Xianzhou person is not one of taxonomy, but one of culture.

67dc6ecbde54f789.ContentText: If an abomination aligns with the Xianzhou, then they are a Xianzhou person. If a Xianzhou person aligns with the abominations, they become an abomination themselves. It is that simple.

ba0dd4d2e64474c8.ContentText: Abominations embrace their nature — they change and modify their flesh without care, for the sake of attaining power and strength. However, to the Xianzhou people, these methods are completely taboo.

7955a2bacea8dd0f.ContentText: Now you know why there are no Incomplete Ones among the abominations...

f79840c31208b226.ContentText: I'm just an alchemist — I don't understand them in any detail. I only know that they are a group of Xianzhou people who view themselves as Denizens of Abundance.

1572feecbf59fd3d.ContentText: My guess is that they attribute their suffering to their decision to renounce the Path of the Plagues Author. Thus, they seek to save themselves by becoming Denizens of Abundance again.

a9f4e4f5a0a0b26c.ContentText: I have a gift for you, but I'll need a little time to prepare it... I'll contact you once it's ready to collect.

9cc65b166908948d.ContentText: This is a diary I kept — it records the many attempts I made to overcome my incompletions.

16b03d0cff32d68a.ContentText: No need to apologize — feel free to read it. If you're interested in the Incomplete Ones... you can take it.

9b9c6f04be869693.ContentText: If it can deepen your understanding of our trials and tribulations, it will have fulfilled its purpose.

48a1e78441055bb0.ContentText: (Dan Shu needs more time to prepare my gift. There's nothing pressing right now, why not head over to Spare Time Book Shop for a while?)
48a1e78441055bb0.Speaker: playerboy

f745de90c1c1feda.ContentText: Go right ahead. Mr. Xiyan said that making bookworms feel at home is more important than getting them to buy something.

5149fc98f02610dd.ContentText: All we ask is that you find a quiet spot away from the browsing areas!

e265e2a1ce899c0c.ContentText: Looks like the person you were waiting for has gotten in touch. Safe travels! Oh, uh... maybe buy a book next time?

37efbb36af652b41.ContentText: You've been running so many errands lately — I'd like for you to take some useful items away with you.

ddb4ad2e80d1f19e.ContentText: Examining the exhibits in the Seat of Divine Foresight inspired me to create this. I referenced some historical texts and concocted a medicine that can extend your lifespan and improve your health.

8bde71f6f7947287.ContentText: I call it the Brumedew Concentrate Pellet, and I'd like you to have it, {NICKNAME}.

7a5cb0db0e53d594.ContentText: Consuming it will make your body light, agile, and promote longevity and well-being. As a Nameless, it'll make your journey a much less arduous one.

28626ad40693d265.ContentText: Well then, that's that. I've still got some other business to attend to, so... shall we say goodbye for now?

9a544ee9b77e2623.ContentText: Perhaps the next time we meet, I'll be able to see you in the true sense of the word.

90435b1e92f08ba9.ContentText: (Hmm... Tastes a bit strange, but no adverse reactions so far...)
90435b1e92f08ba9.Speaker: playerboy

cb2b53ba5e1cdf46.ContentText: (Wait a minute... Argh, my head... What's happening?)
cb2b53ba5e1cdf46.Speaker: playerboy

3d694e4b22f3d047.ContentText: (S—Something's wrong — I'm burning up... Feels like I can't breathe...)
3d694e4b22f3d047.Speaker: playerboy

625b22966b4ff619.ContentText: (Whew... Seems to be calming down a little, but still uncomfortable...)
625b22966b4ff619.Speaker: playerboy

9ea0e02f381efda0.ContentText: (This doesn't seem right, I'd better talk to Qingzu at the Seat of Divine Foresight.)
9ea0e02f381efda0.Speaker: playerboy

6518dbebd1dc32bb.ContentText: (It's not that I don't trust Dan Shu... but this doesn't seem like something I should take lightly.)
6518dbebd1dc32bb.Speaker: playerboy

9dc181849b98a59a.ContentText: (Something feels off — I'd better talk to Qingzu at the Seat of Divine Foresight.)
9dc181849b98a59a.Speaker: playerboy

7f9a1af284612b2d.ContentText: (Argh... There goes my head again... Is Dan Shu sure this Brumedew is safe for consumption?)
7f9a1af284612b2d.Speaker: playerboy

a3b83da23db38824.ContentText: (What's happening? Isn't this the Seat of Divine Foresight? Why are there so many mara-struck here...)
a3b83da23db38824.Speaker: playerboy

575fb57d7a94daef.ContentText: (No... I can't let them... get near me...)
575fb57d7a94daef.Speaker: playerboy

042b21d2af41d03c.ContentText: {NICKNAME}! What happened to you? Be careful, don't hurt {F#her}{M#him}...

e30ec01a81b890aa.ContentText: Thank the stars, you're finally awake. I thought we might lose you, I was so worried.

67fbf212410e03b3.ContentText: You came into the Seat of Divine Foresight and started brandishing your weapon.

a584442a55f4379c.ContentText: It looked like you'd lost control, as if you'd been stricken with mara...

14685e217790ac2d.ContentText: There has to be something awry. Tell me what happened to you before arriving at the Seat of Divine Foresight.

f327dff7c75ca496.ContentText: From what you're saying, it seems like the gift she gave to you must be related to the Disciples' prescription we examined earlier...

a0f741f0bf6e7c7f.ContentText: ...but the healer who examined you just now said your body doesn't seem to have been affected... how strange.

f0f7a5c5dd30f4af.ContentText: Could Dan Shu be playing a trick on you? Or is her medicine somehow not working as planned? My advice is to come back later for another examination... It's a Disciples of Sanctus Medicus prescription after all — who knows what "healing" effects it may have.

6bd443ce1dada0c6.ContentText: I'll put out a wanted notice for Dan Shu immediately. If you find any trace of her, get in touch with me.

dc1871d6e9f9e629.ContentText: Take this Diting with you, it might just help you find this... "friend."

866d57e068cbe1e8.ContentText: I understand how you feel... I've also been fooled by someone I regarded as a good friend. It's a dreadful experience.

403225a4f978239b.ContentText: If we can find Dan Shu, we might be able to confront her and get some answers.

b61af71d1d8672da.ContentText: {NICKNAME}, it's been a while. To what does the Seat of Divine Foresight owe the pleasure?

415c11b6a3fa21b5.ContentText: I understand... You say you have suspicions about this pellet she gave you?

bf67d7bee72af824.ContentText: How about this, leave this Brumedew Concentrate Pellet with me, and I'll find someone to run a few tests on it.

a47d360a16493f37.ContentText: I need to find a trustworthy alchemist, so you'll need to wait here a while. It isn't easy to find trustworthy people like yourself in these perilous times.

8ada4200483ec736.ContentText: Thank the stars you were wise enough not take that pellet, {NICKNAME} — my alchemists were able to extract many forbidden components. The result... is identical to the Disciples' mysterious prescription...

b061f7fca863aed8.ContentText: I understand, try not to be too upset.

321f51f46503cc59.ContentText: I had a suspicion that there might be a spy in the Alchemy Commission, but I never expected it to be someone so high up in the organization...

c54123eb9b9aaff6.ContentText: I'll put out a wanted notice for Dan Shu immediately. If you find any trace of her, get in touch with me.

1aec05e21cc8555f.ContentText: Take this Diting with you, it might just help you find this... "friend."

c0b0f7d9ee351b94.ContentText: I had a suspicion that there might be a spy in the Alchemy Commission, but I never expected it to be someone so high up in the organization...

6eb6b1d2e6751865.ContentText: I understand how you feel... I've also been fooled by someone I regarded as a good friend. It's a dreadful experience.

144493cab7b28142.ContentText: You're prudent, and that's a good trait to have. Just try not to let your emotions cloud your judgment.

7be7fdeba2cf5e0e.ContentText: (Dan Shu isn't here... Where could she be?)
7be7fdeba2cf5e0e.Speaker: playerboy

5df787598bc70a81.ContentText: (I've got it. Dan Shu's medicine box has her scent on it — I'll ask the Diting that Qingzu lent me to track her.)
5df787598bc70a81.Speaker: playerboy

65ed56dbd0c34a4c.ContentText: (That's... Dan Shu... with a group of Disciples... I guess that tells me all I need to know...)
65ed56dbd0c34a4c.Speaker: playerboy

5a3b33b45ae895fc.ContentText: Master, stand back. Let me handle this.

b1b77d248f495b13.ContentText: Many of our brethren have fallen by {F#her}{M#his} hands!

cb9dbc7e4b609f08.ContentText: I said, {F#she}{M#he} is my friend. Leave us.

5aedbb845bf093b7.ContentText: {NICKNAME}, I didn't expect you to come looking for me.

dc6b8d1379c7ce2e.ContentText: So they do. I am Master of the Disciples of Sanctus Medicus, scion of Merciful Medicus, and I shall lead the entire Xianzhou Alliance onto the Path of Abundance.

0a955b1a6ceaa1d1.ContentText: The head? What a crude way of putting it. I am Master of the Disciples of Sanctus Medicus, scion of Merciful Medicus, and I shall lead the entire Xianzhou Alliance onto the Path of Abundance.

88d80122b04a8450.ContentText: I lied to you about many things... but I reserve my apology only for deceiving you into taking the medicine. As for the other falsehoods, they were merely in aid of communicating as equals.

f9dddea61996dd9b.ContentText: Did you ingest the Brumedew Concentrate Pellet I gave you?

77ea6cae5cc90852.ContentText: Did you feel the shift? So many Elixir Seekers arrive on the Xianzhou in the hope of obtaining the formula to immortality, but none have succeeded.

51cf239c7de626c3.ContentText: Their aspirations are well-founded. The Xianzhou does indeed harbor the secret to becoming immortal. I admire you, so I thought I'd give you the chance to obtain it.

fc59f1a5fce588fa.ContentText: Upon ingesting the Brumedew Concentrate Pellet, you will feel the limitless freedom of the form bestowed upon you by Merciful Medicus...

565f0fae2b4b4dfd.ContentText: ...and yet — you don't sound any different. Your breaths are not prolonged, and your presence doesn't feel like it's been altered in any way...

e77af5b709aed92c.ContentText: Why is that? Is your constitution somehow different from the average person?

974d61c64314aace.ContentText: Even if what you say is true, to host a Stellaron as a short-life species would only spell an early demise. It looks like you are not fated to live a long life.

1a34afcfaa36d3f1.ContentText: Looks like you have yet to forgive me... I understand.

987755d7ed96b670.ContentText: I admire your vigilance... What a shame. So many Elixir Seekers arrive on the Xianzhou in the hope of obtaining the formula to immortality, but none have succeeded.

097d335b56e30fbb.ContentText: Their aspirations are well-founded. The Xianzhou does indeed harbor the secret to becoming immortal. I admire you, so I thought I'd give you the chance to obtain it.

8423c16397321172.ContentText: The Brumedew Concentrate Pellet will turn you into a long-life species — you will feel the limitless freedom of the form bestowed upon you by Merciful Medicus... By not taking it, you are foregoing its benefits.

eb6e11a6f5dab41c.ContentText: Such a pity... though as your friend, I respect your choice.

5a522b9e177728ad.ContentText: That which the Elixir Seekers that arrive on the Xianzhou dream of — the formula to immortality. To take it is to initiate the transformation from a short-life species into a Xianzhou person or an abomination... depending on your perception.

28f88d97219f0d2a.ContentText: Please believe me when I say that never once have I thought about harming you... I merely wanted to offer you the chance to obtain immortality and freedom.

c6b3ad12bd324af3.ContentText: {NICKNAME}, please, I urge you to leave the Luofu... Abandon this struggle, the truth isn't what it appears to be.

9c69b1c7d9c14b60.ContentText: What did the minions at the Seat of Divine Foresight tell you about this conflict? That the Reignbow Arbiter is the emissary of the righteous? That the Arbiter is chasing the heathen Plagues Author across the stars, while the Disciples of Sanctus Medicus abet their heresy?

4a390bc0d1d314e1.ContentText: Do you really think that is the case? You don't understand Merciful Medicus, nor the Devilish Archer Author, but you understand me — do you see me as such? A heretic?

effdfdb8a33fdb3e.ContentText: I do not ask for you to pick a side... I just wish for you to leave the Luofu — to leave this all behind. This isn't your fight, and I do not wish to make an enemy of you.

45a91faf246dedc7.ContentText: Make your choice. If you put away your weapon, I will take my fellow disciples and leave this place. But if you insist upon defying me... then I will have to put an early end to your journey.

8ca6016530c1bf34.ContentText: Since neither of us is eager to engage in combat, let us respectfully part ways.

e5ee3b5bb5026585.ContentText: I have been thinking... The Devilish Archer Author is not a benevolent god, nor is Merciful Medicus a malevolent one. Your choice to align with Jing Yuan was simply due to meeting him first.

4b816bdbd8dbf191.ContentText: Most unfortunate. Had you known me first, perhaps we could have been good friends.

c9c411e41c3bd410.ContentText: I sincerely wish that this will be our last meeting.

eb2a19412ddd05d5.ContentText: (*sigh* ...I'd better report my findings to Qingzu at the Seat of Divine Foresight.)
eb2a19412ddd05d5.Speaker: playerboy

b47641bc897bcea7.ContentText: Master, you must stay out of harm's way. Let us handle this.

f315a03061aead86.ContentText: Master, please retreat now. Our main mission is impending. We cannot be stalled here by {F#her}{M#him}.

5fbf0ee89c672cf6.ContentText: {NICKNAME}, lay down your weapon. Our fighting will only result in mutual suffering — something I would not wish to see.

87accbba59f21e9d.ContentText: A lie, yes, but also a gift.

18c8b1c33855aacc.ContentText: If it is to happen sooner or later, I would rather it happen later... Now, let us both take a step back — we needn't make this difficult.

d7da5fab208c4de3.ContentText: I have been thinking... The Devilish Archer Author is not a benevolent god, nor is Merciful Medicus a malevolent one. Your choice to align with Jing Yuan was simply due to meeting him first.

2a41adb228a9309a.ContentText: Most unfortunate. Had you known me first, perhaps we could have been good friends.

d6b13b99760ba3e9.ContentText: I sincerely wish that this will be our last meeting.

d00653b1233bfeb6.ContentText: (*sigh* ...I'd better report my findings to Qingzu at the Seat of Divine Foresight.)
d00653b1233bfeb6.Speaker: playerboy
